translated: and five hundred śrāvakas with great miraculous abilities, all of whom had realized the nature of the way of the truths, had directly perceived the limit of reality, had entered the nature of phenomena, had risen above the ocean of existence, had the sphere of activity of the sky of the tathāgatas, had turned away from the latent tendencies of the fetters, had abodes free from attachment, dwelt in the peace of the sky, had cut off doubts, uncertainties, and hesitations about the Buddha, had entered the path of devotion to the ocean of the wisdom of the Buddha, and the lords of the world, who had previously served the victorious ones, had set out for the benefit and happiness of all beings, were unsolicited good friends, had set out to protect other beings, had entered the bliss of the knowledge that abides in the distinction of the world, had minds that did not abandon any beings, had gone forth in the domain of the Buddha's teachings, had set out to protect the Tathāgata's teachings, had been born from the aspiration to uphold the lineage of the buddhas, faced the family and lineage of the Tathāgata, and were desirous of the knowledge of omniscience.

original: evameva te sthavirā mahāśrāvakāstatraiva jetavane sthitāḥ tāni tathāgatavikurvitāni na paśyanti /
analyzed: evam eva te sthavirāḥ mahāśrāvakāḥ tatra eva jetavane sthitāḥ tāni tathāgata vikurvitāni na paśyanti
translated: In just the same way, those elders, the great disciples, remaining right there in Jetavana, did not see those transformations of the Tathāgata.

analyzed: na avataranti  sarvajña tā vipakṣika avidyā paṭala netra paryavanaddha tvāt
translated: They did not enter into them.🔽Because they were covered by the cataract of ignorance, which is adverse to omniscience.

analyzed: sarvajña tā bhūmi kuśala mūla a parigṛhīta tvāt
translated: Because they had not taken hold of the roots of merit belonging to the stage of omniscience.

original: tadyathāpi nāma puruṣo mahatyahni vartamāne mahato janakāyasya madhye styānamiddhamavakrāmet /🔽sa suptaḥ svapnāntaragatastatraiva pradeśe devanagaraṃ paśyet /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma puruṣaḥ mahati ahni vartamāne mahataḥ jana kāyasya madhye styānam iddham avakrāmet  sa suptaḥ svapna antara gataḥ tatra eva pradeśe deva nagaram paśyet
translated: It is just as if a man, in the midst of a great crowd of people, would fall asleep and enter into a dream.

original: sudarśanacakranilayaṃ sarvaṃ ca sumerutalaṃ savṛkṣaṃ sodyānamaṇḍalamapsaraḥkoṭīniyutaśatasahasrākīrṇaṃ devaputrakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrādhyuṣitaṃ vicitradivyapuṣpābhikīrṇam /🔽vividhadivyavastramuktāhāraratnābharaṇasrakpramuktakośāṃśca kalpavṛkṣān paśyet /
analyzed: sudarśana cakra nilayam sarvam ca sumeru talam sa vṛkṣam sa udyāna maṇḍalam apsaraḥ koṭī niyuta śata sahasra ākīrṇam devaputra koṭī niyuta śata sahasra adhyuṣitam vicitra divya puṣpa abhikīrṇam  vividha divya vastra muktā hāra ratna ābharaṇa sraj pramukta kośān ca kalpavṛkṣān paśyet
translated: While asleep and dreaming, he would see a divine city right there in that place, with the abode of the Sudarśana Wheel, the entire base of Mount Sumeru with its trees, gardens, and parks, filled with many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of apsarases, inhabited by many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of devas, strewn with various divine flowers,🔽and he would see the wish-fulfilling trees with their hanging baskets of various divine garments, pearl necklaces, jewels, ornaments, and garlands.

analyzed: nānāvidha divya vādya samīrita manojña madhura nirghoṣān ca vādya vṛkṣān paśyet
translated: He would see the trees of music with their delightful and sweet sounds of various divine musical instruments being played.

analyzed: anekavidhān ca rati krīḍā vyūhān paśyet
translated: He would see the various arrays of amusements and sports.

analyzed: madhurān ca divya apsaraḥ gaṇa saṃgīti vādya śabdān śṛṇuyāt
translated: And he would hear the sweet sounds of the songs and music of the divine apsarases.

analyzed: tatrastham ca ātmānam saṃjānīyāt
translated: He would perceive himself to be right there in that place.

analyzed: sarvāvantam ca tad pradeśam divya vyūha vibhūṣitam paśyet
translated: And he would see the entire area adorned with the arrays of the divine abodes.

original: sa ca sarvo janakāyo na paśyet /
analyzed: sa ca sarvaḥ jana kāyaḥ na paśyet
translated: But that entire crowd of people would not see it.

analyzed: na jānīyāt
translated: One should not know.

analyzed: na vilokayet
translated: One should not look.

analyzed: tatra eva pradeśe sthitaḥ san
translated: While remaining in that very place.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

analyzed: tasya eva hi puruṣasya svapna antara gatasya tat darśanam
translated: For that very man who has gone into another dream, that is the vision.

original: tatraiva ca pradeśe sthitasya tasya mahājanakāyasyādarśanam /
analyzed: tatra eva ca pradeśe sthitasya tasya mahā jana kāyasya adarśanam
translated: And for that great multitude remaining in that very place, that is the non-vision.

original: evameva te bodhisattvāste ca lokendrā bodhyabhimukhā vipulena buddhādhiṣṭhānena svakuśalamūlasusamārjitatayā ca sarvajñatāpraṇidhānasvabhinirhṛtatayā ca sarvatathāgataguṇasupratipannatayā ca mahāvyūhabodhisattvamārgasupratiṣṭhitatayā ca sarvajñatājñānasarvākāradharmodgatasupariniṣpannatayā ca samantabhadrabodhisattvacaryā viśeṣapraṇidhānaparipūriviśuddhyā ca sarvabodhisattvabhūmijñānamaṇḍalākramaṇatayā ca sarvabodhisattvasamādhivihāravikrīḍanatayā ca sarvabodhisattvajñānagocarāsaṅgavicāraṇatayā ca tāmacintyāṃ buddhavṛṣabhitāṃ buddhavikrīḍitaṃ paśyanti /
analyzed: evam eva te bodhisattvāḥ te ca loka indrāḥ bodhi abhimukhāḥ vipulena buddha adhiṣṭhānena sva kuśala mūla su samārjita tayā ca sarvajña tā praṇidhāna su abhinirhṛta tayā ca sarva tathāgata guṇa su pratipanna tayā ca mahāvyūha bodhisattva mārga su pratiṣṭhita tayā ca sarvajña tā jñāna sarva ākāra dharma udgata su pariniṣpanna tayā ca samantabhadra bodhisattva caryā viśeṣa praṇidhāna paripūri viśuddhyā ca sarva bodhisattva bhūmi jñāna maṇḍala āk
translated: In the same way, those bodhisattvas and those lords of the worlds, facing enlightenment, with the vast empowerment of the Buddha, with their own roots of goodness well-purified, with their aspiration for omniscience well-manifested, with their practice of the qualities of all tathagatas well-established, with their establishment in the path of the bodhisattva's great array, with their perfect accomplishment of the knowledge of omniscience and the Dharma that arises in all aspects, with the purity of fulfilling the special aspiration for the conduct of the bodhisattva Samantabhadra, with their knowledge of all the stages of the bodhisattva, with their play in the abode of all the bodhisattva's samadhis, with their unattached consideration of the domain of the bodhisattva's knowledge, see that inconceivable bull-like state of the Buddha, that play of the Buddha.

analyzed: avataranti
translated: They enter into it.

analyzed: anubhavanti
translated: They experience it.

original: te ca mahāśrāvakā agrayugabhadrayugapramukhā na paśyanti na jānanti bodhisattvacakṣurvirahitatvāt //
analyzed: te ca mahāśrāvakāḥ agrayuga bhadrayuga pramukhāḥ na paśyanti na jānanti bodhisattva cakṣuḥ virahita tvāt
translated: And those great disciples, headed by the foremost pair and the excellent pair, do not see it, do not know it, because they are devoid of the bodhisattva's eye.

original: tadyathāpi nāma himavati parvatarāje auṣadhyākarākīrṇe mantravidyauṣadhijñānagrahaṇasiddhavidyaḥ puruṣaḥ sarvauṣadhividhīn prajānan auṣadhigrahaṇakarma kuryāt /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma himavati parvata rāje auṣadhi ākara ākīrṇe mantra vidyā auṣadhi jñāna grahaṇa siddha vidyaḥ puruṣaḥ sarva oṣadhi vidhīn prajānan auṣadhi grahaṇa karma kuryāt
translated: It is just as on the king of mountains, the Himalayas, which is filled with mines of medicines, a man who has mastered the knowledge of mantras, spells, and medicines, who knows the methods of all medicines, would perform the work of collecting medicines.

original: tatraiva ca śailendrābhirūḍhāḥ paśugaveḍakaṛkṣamṛgalubdhakāstadanye vā punarauṣadhyavidhijñāḥ puruṣāstamauṣadhirasavīryavipākaprabhāvopāyayogaṃ na prajānanti /
analyzed: tatra eva ca śailendra abhirūḍhāḥ paśu gaveḍaka ṛkṣa mṛga lubdhakāḥ tad anye vā punar auṣadhya vidhi jñāḥ puruṣāḥ tam auṣadhi rasa vīrya vipāka prabhāva upāya yogam na prajānanti
translated: And there, on that very king of mountains, the animals, cattle, goats, bears, deer, hunters, and other men who do not know the methods of medicines do not know that method of the potency, strength, and ripening of the medicines.

original: evemeva te bodhisattvāstathāgatajñānaviṣayamavatīrṇā bodhisattvavikurvitaviṣayananiryātāstaṃ tathāgatasamādhivikurvitaviṣayaṃ prajānanti /
analyzed: eva īm iva te bodhisattvāḥ tathāgata jñāna viṣayam avatīrṇāḥ bodhisattva vikurvita viṣayana niryātāḥ tam tathāgata samādhi vikurvita viṣayam prajānanti
translated: In the same way, those bodhisattvas who have entered the domain of the Tathāgata's knowledge, who have emerged from the domain of the bodhisattvas' miracles, they know that domain of the miracles of the Tathāgata's samādhis.

original: te ca mahāśrāvakāagrayugabhadrayugapramukhāstatraiva jetavane viharantaḥ svakāryasaṃtuṣṭāḥ parakāryanirutsukā upekṣakā dṛṣṭadharmasukhavihāreṇa sukhasparśaṃ viharanti /
analyzed: te ca mahāśrāvakāḥ agrayuga bhadrayuga pramukhāḥ tatra eva jetavane viharantaḥ sva kārya saṃtuṣṭāḥ para kārya nirutsukāḥ upekṣakāḥ dṛṣṭadharma sukha vihāreṇa sukha sparśam viharanti
translated: And those great disciples, headed by the foremost pair and the excellent pair, while dwelling right there in Jetavana, content with their own goals, indifferent to the goals of others, indifferent, they dwell happily, touching the happiness of the present life.

analyzed: tam ca tathāgata samādhi viṣaya vikurvita viṣayam na prajānanti
translated: And they do not know that domain of the miracles of the Tathāgata's samādhis.

original: tadyathāpi nāma iyaṃ mahāpṛthivī sarvaratnākarasamṛddhā nidhiśatasahasranicitā nānāvidhānantaratnaparipūrṇā /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma iyam mahā pṛthivī sarva ratna ākara samṛddhā nidhi śata sahasra nicitā nānāvidha ananta ratna paripūrṇā
translated: It is just as if this great earth were fully endowed with all the treasures, filled with hundreds of thousands of treasures, and replete with various infinite jewels.

original: tatra ratnagotravidhijñānakṛtavidyaḥ puruṣo rantaparīkṣastatra paryavadātamatirvidhānatantrajñānaśilpasuśikṣito vipulapuṇyabalopastabdhaḥ tato yatheṣṭaṃ ratnānyādāaya ātmānaṃ samyak prīṇayet /
analyzed: tatra ratna gotra vidhi jñāna kṛta vidyaḥ puruṣaḥ ranta parīkṣaḥ tatra paryavadāta matiḥ vidhāna tantra jñāna śilpa su śikṣitaḥ vipula puṇya bala upastabdhaḥ tatas yatheṣṭam ratnāni ādāaye ātmānam samyak prīṇayet
translated: There, a person who knows the method of the jewel family, who has mastered the knowledge of jewels, who is skilled in examining jewels, who has a well-trained mind in that regard, who is well-educated in the knowledge and craft of methods, who is supported by the power of vast merit, would then take jewels as he wishes and properly satisfy himself.

analyzed: mātā pitaram samyak paricaret
translated: He would properly serve his mother and father.

analyzed: putra dāram ca poṣayet
translated: He would support his wife and children.

original: tadanyeṣāmapi sattvānāṃ vṛddhānāmāturāṇāṃ daridrāṇāṃ vinipatitānāmaśanavasanaviprahīṇānāṃ saṃvibhāgaṃ kuryāt /
analyzed: tad anyeṣām api sattvānām vṛddhānām āturāṇām daridrāṇām vinipatitānām aśana vasana viprahīṇānām saṃvibhāgam kuryāt
translated: He would also share with other beings, the elderly, the sick, the poor, the fallen, those lacking food and clothing.

analyzed: vividhām ca artha ratim anubhavet
translated: And he would experience various kinds of wealth and joy.

analyzed: ye tu punar te ratna ākara nidhānā vidhi jñāḥ sattvāḥ
translated: But those beings who do not know the method of the treasure-source, the treasure-store,

analyzed: a kṛta puṇyāḥ a pariśuddha ratna jñāna cakṣuṣaḥ teṣām ratna ākarān ratna nidhīn na prajānanti
translated: who have not accumulated merit, whose eye of knowledge of jewels is impure, they do not know the treasure-source, the treasure-store.

analyzed: tatra eva ca vicaranti
translated: And they wander right there.

analyzed: na ca ratnāni gṛhṇanti
translated: And they do not take the jewels.

analyzed: na ratna kāryāṇi kurvanti
translated: They do not make ornaments out of jewels.

original: evaṃ te bodhisattvā jetavane tatra acintye tathāgataviṣaye supariśuddhajñānacakṣuṣo'cintyatathāgatajñānaviṣayāvatīrṇāstāni buddhavikurvitāni paśyanti /
analyzed: evam te bodhisattvāḥ jetavane tatra acintye tathāgata viṣaye su pariśuddha jñāna cakṣuṣā ucintya tathāgata jñāna viṣaya avatīrṇāḥ tāni buddha vikurvitāni paśyanti
translated: In that way, those bodhisattvas, in the Jeta Grove, with the completely pure eye of knowledge in that inconceivable domain of the Tathāgata, having entered the inconceivable domain of the Tathāgata's knowledge, saw those manifestations of the Buddha.

analyzed: dharma naya sāgarān ca avataranti
translated: They entered the ocean of the way of the Dharma.

analyzed: samādhi samudrān ca niṣpādayanti
translated: They accomplished the ocean of samādhis.

analyzed: tathāgata pūjā upasthāne ca prayujyante
translated: They were dedicated to worshipping and serving the Tathāgata.

analyzed: sarva dharma parigrahāya ca udyujyante
translated: They were diligent in embracing all dharmas.

analyzed: sarva sattvān ca saṃgṛhṇanti caturbhiḥ saṃgraha vastubhiḥ
translated: They gathered all beings with the four means of gathering disciples.

original: te ca mahāśrāvakāstāni tathāgatavikurvitāni taṃ ca mahāntaṃ bodhisattvagaṇasaṃnipātaṃ na paśyanti na jānanti //
analyzed: te ca mahāśrāvakāḥ tāni tathāgata vikurvitāni tam ca mahāntam bodhisattva gaṇa saṃnipātam na paśyanti na jānanti
translated: But those great disciples did not see those manifestations of the Tathāgata or that great assembly of bodhisattvas. They did not know about them.

original: tadyathāpi nāma puruṣo dūṣyavastrābaddhābhyāṃ netrābhyāṃ ratnadvīpamanuprāptaḥ syāt /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma puruṣaḥ dūṣya vastra ābaddhābhyām netrābhyām ratna dvīpam anuprāptaḥ syāt
translated: It was as if a man, with eyes bound with cloth, had arrived at an island of jewels.

analyzed: sa tatra ratna dvīpe caṃkramet  tiṣṭhet
translated: He would walk on that island of jewels.🔽He would stand.

analyzed: niṣīdet
translated: He would sit.

original: śayyāṃ vā kalpayet /🔽na ca taṃ ratnākaraṃ paśyet /
analyzed: śayyām vā kalpayet  na ca tam ratna ākaram paśyet
translated: He would make a bed.🔽But he would not see that source of jewels.

analyzed: na ratna vṛkṣān
translated: He would not see the jewel trees.

analyzed: na vastra ratnāni
translated: Not the cloth jewels.

analyzed: na gandha ratnāni
translated: Not the perfume jewels.

analyzed: na sarva ratnāni paśyet
translated: One should not see all the jewels.

original: nāpi tāni ratnāni parijānīyādviṣayato vā mūlyato vā paribhogato va /
analyzed: na api tāni ratnāni parijānīyāt viṣayataḥ vā mūlyataḥ vā paribhogataḥ
translated: Nor should one know those jewels as objects, as prices, or as enjoyments.

analyzed: sa tāni ratnāni na parigṛhṇīyāt
translated: One should not accept those jewels.

analyzed: na ca ratna kāryam anubhavet
translated: Nor should one experience the use of jewels.

analyzed: an āvṛta cakṣuṣaḥ etat sarvam paśyeyuḥ vijānīyuḥ
translated: Those with uncovered eyes would see all this and know it.

original: evameva te bodhisattvā dharmaratnadvīpamanuprāptā anuttaraṃ tathāgataratnaṃ sarvalokālaṃkāraṃ saṃmukhībhūtaṃ jetavane sthitamacintyāni buddhavikurvitāni saṃdarśayamānaṃ paśyanti /
analyzed: evam eva te bodhisattvāḥ dharmaratna dvīpam anuprāptāḥ anuttaram tathāgata ratnam sarva loka alaṃkāram saṃmukhībhūtam jetavane sthitam acintyāni buddha vikurvitāni saṃdarśayamānam paśyanti
translated: In the same way, those bodhisattvas, having reached the island of the jewel of the Dharma, see the unsurpassed jewel of the Tathāgata, the ornament of the entire world, appearing in person, dwelling in Jetavana, displaying inconceivable Buddha miracles.

original: te ca mahāśrāvakāstatraiva bhagavataḥ pādamūle tiṣṭhanti yāpayanti /
analyzed: te ca mahāśrāvakāḥ tatra eva bhagavataḥ pāda mūle tiṣṭhanti yāpayanti
translated: And those great hearers stand and remain right there at the feet of the Blessed One.

analyzed: na ca tam tathāgata samādhi viṣaya vikurvita prātihāryam paśyanti
translated: But they do not see that miracle of the Tathāgata's samādhi sphere, that marvel.

original: na ca taṃ mahāntaṃ bodhisattvasaṃnipātaṃ mahāratnākaram /
analyzed: na ca tam mahāntam bodhisattva saṃnipātam mahā ratna ākaram
translated: Nor do they see that great gathering of bodhisattvas, that great jewel mine.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: tathā hi teṣām sarvajña tā vipakṣa avidyā dūṣya avabaddha jñāna cakṣuṣām tat asaṅga bodhisattva jñāna cakṣuḥ na pariśuddham
translated: For, their eye of knowledge is bound by the defilements of ignorance, which are adverse to omniscience, and their eye of knowledge of the bodhisattvas, which is free from attachment, is not purified.

analyzed: na ca taiḥ dharmadhātu paraṃparā praveśaḥ anubuddhaḥ
translated: And they have not realized the entry into the succession of the dharma-dhātu,

analyzed: yena tad acintya tathāgata samādhi vṛṣabhitā vikurvita prātihāryam paśyeyuḥ
translated: by which they would see that inconceivable marvelous power of the tathāgatas, that miraculous display of the bull among sages.

original: tadyathāpi nāma asti virajaḥprabhāsavatī nāma cakṣuḥpariśuddhiḥ /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma asti virajaḥprabhāsavatī nāma cakṣuḥ pariśuddhiḥ
translated: For example, there is a purification of the eye called free from dust and radiant.

analyzed: yā sarva tamaḥ ndhakāreṇa sārdham na saṃvasati
translated: It does not coexist with any darkness at all.

analyzed: tām kaścid puruṣaḥ pratilabheta
translated: Some person would obtain that.

original: sa virajaḥprabhāsavatyā cakṣuḥpariśuddhyā samanvāgatastamondhakāraparyavanaddhāyāṃ rātryāmanekeṣāṃ prāṇakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrāṇāṃ saṃnipatītānāṃ vividhākalperyāpathānāṃ nimirāndhakāraparyākulanetrāṇāṃ manuṣyāṇāṃ madhye'nuvicaret /
analyzed: sa virajaḥ prabhāsavatyā cakṣuḥ pariśuddhyā samanvāgataḥ tamaḥ ndhakāra paryavanaddhāyām rātryām anekeṣām prāṇa koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇām saṃnipatītānām vividha ākalpa īryāpathānām nimira andhakāra paryākula netrāṇām manuṣyāṇām madhyenuvicaret
translated: Endowed with that purification of the eye free from dust and radiant, he would wander in the midst of many hundreds of thousands of millions of beings gathered together, of various kinds of conduct, whose eyes are confused by the darkness of night.

analyzed: anucaṃkramet  tiṣṭhet
translated: He would move about.🔽He would stand.

analyzed: niṣīdet  nānā īryāpathān
translated: He would sit.🔽He would perform various kinds of conduct.

analyzed: vā kalpayet
translated: Or he would imagine them.

original: na ca te manuṣyāstaṃ puruṣaṃ paśyeyuḥ /
analyzed: na ca te manuṣyāḥ tam puruṣam paśyeyuḥ
translated: And those people would not see that man.

analyzed: na saṃjānīyuḥ vividhān īryāpathān kalpayamānam
translated: They would not know him, even though he were performing various kinds of actions.

original: sa ca puruṣastaṃ mahāntaṃ janakāyaṃ paśyet nāneryāpathākalpavihāriṇaṃ nānādigabhimukhaṃ nānāsaṃsthānaṃ nānāvarṇaṃ nānāprāvaraṇam /
analyzed: sa ca puruṣaḥ tam mahāntam jana kāyam paśyet nānā īryāpatha akalpa vihāriṇam nānā diś abhimukham nānā saṃsthānam nānā varṇam nānā prāvaraṇam
translated: And that man would see that great crowd of people, engaged in various actions, facing various directions, of various shapes, various colors, and various garments.

original: evemeva tathāgataḥ sabodhisattvagaṇaparivāro viśuddhāsaṅgajñānacakṣuḥ sarvalokaṃ jānāti paśyati /
analyzed: eva īm iva tathāgataḥ sa bodhisattva gaṇa parivāraḥ viśuddha asaṅga jñāna cakṣuḥ sarva lokam jānāti paśyati
translated: In the same way, the Tathāgata, surrounded by an assembly of all Bodhisattvas, with a pure and unobstructed eye of knowledge, knows and sees the entire world.

analyzed: mahābuddha samādhi vikurvita prātihāryam saṃdarśayati
translated: He displays the great miracle of the Buddha's samādhi.

analyzed: na ca te mahāśrāvakāḥ tam tathāgata mahā jñāna samādhi vikurvita prātihāryam paśyanti
translated: But those great disciples do not see that great miracle of the Tathāgata's knowledge and samādhi.

analyzed: na ca tam mahā bodhisattva saṃnipāta parivāram
translated: Nor do they see that great assembly of Bodhisattvas.

original: tadyathāpi nāma bhikṣurmahato janakāyasya madhye pṛthivīkṛtsnaṃ samādhiṃ samāpadyeta /🔽apkṛtsnaṃ vā /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bhikṣuḥ mahataḥ jana kāyasya madhye pṛthivī kṛtsnam samādhim samāpadyeta  ap kṛtsnam vā
translated: Just as, for example, a bhikṣu, in the midst of a great crowd of people, might enter the samādhi called 'earth-pervasiveness,'🔽or 'water-pervasiveness,'

analyzed: tejaḥ kṛstnam vā
translated: or 'fire-pervasiveness,'

analyzed: vāyu kṛtsnam vā  nīla kṛtnram vā
translated: or 'wind-pervasiveness,'🔽or 'blue-pervasiveness,'

analyzed: pītakṛtsnam vā  lohitakṛtsnam vā
translated: or 'yellow-pervasiveness,'🔽or 'red-pervasiveness,'

analyzed: avadāta kṛtsnam vā
translated: or 'white-pervasiveness,'

analyzed: devakṛtsnam vā  vividha sattva kārya kṛtsnam vā
translated: Or the entire realm of the gods.🔽Or the entire realm of various beings.

analyzed: na ca sa mahā jana kāyaḥ tam ap skandham paśyet

analyzed: anyatra tad samādhi samāpatti vihāra prāptebhyaḥ

original: evameva tathāgatasya tadacintyabuddhasamādhiviṣayavikurvitaṃ saṃdarśayataḥ ye mahāśrāvakā na paśyanti /

translated: In the same way, when the Tathāgata displays that inconceivable transformation of the Buddha's concentration, the great hearers do not see it.

analyzed: te ca bodhisattvaḥ tathāgata mārga pratipannāḥ tam tathāgata viṣayam avataranti
translated: And those bodhisattvas who are on the path of the Tathāgata enter that domain of the Tathāgata.

original: tadyathāpi nāma añjanasiddhaḥ puruṣo netrayorañjitamātrayoḥ sarvajanakāyenādṛśyaśarīro bhavati /

translated: For example, a man who has mastered eye ointment, as soon as he applies the ointment to his eyes, becomes invisible to the whole multitude of people.

original: sa gacchan vā sthito vā niṣaṇṇo vā sarvajanakāyaṃ paśyati /
analyzed: sa gacchan vā sthitaḥ vā niṣaṇṇaḥ vā sarva jana kāyam paśyati

analyzed: tathāgataḥ lokottara sarva jagat viṣaya samatikrāntaḥ sarvajña jñāna viṣaya avakrāntaḥ bodhisattva jñāna cakṣuḥ vijñeyaḥ
translated: In the same way, the Tathāgata, who has transcended the entire mundane sphere and has entered the domain of omniscient wisdom, is to be known by the eye of the bodhisattva's wisdom.

analyzed: sa sarva jagat paśyati
translated: He sees the entire world.

original: te ca mahāśrāvakāstāni tathāgatavikurvitāni na paśyanti //
analyzed: te ca mahāśrāvakāḥ tāni tathāgata vikurvitāni na paśyanti
translated: But those great śrāvakas do not see those transformations of the Tathāgata.

original: tadyathāpi nāma puruṣasya sahajātā devatā nityānubaddhā /

analyzed: sā tam puruṣam paśyati

original: sa ca puruṣastāṃ devatāṃ na paśyati /

translated: In the same way, the Tathāgata, abiding in the domain of omniscient wisdom, displays the great transformations of a Buddha in the midst of a great assembly of bodhisattvas.

original: te ca mahāśrāvakāstaṃ tathāgatavikurvitaprātihāryaṃ tacca bodhisattvaparṣanmaṇḍalavikurvitaṃ na paśyanti na jānanti //

translated: But those great śrāvakas do not see that miraculous display of the Tathāgata's transformations or that transformation of the assembly of the bodhisattva retinue. They do not know.

original: tadyathāpi nāma bhikṣuḥ sarvacetovaśiparamapāramitāprāptaḥ saṃjñāvedayitanirodhaṃ samāpanno na saṃjānāti na vedayati /

analyzed: na ca ṣaṣ indriyeṇa kiṃcid kāryam anubhavati

analyzed: na ca parinirvṛtaḥ saḥ

analyzed: sarva loka vyavahāraḥ ca tasmin pradeśe pravartante

analyzed: na ca tān saṃjānāti

analyzed: na vedayati yat uta tasyāḥ eva samāpatteḥ adhiṣṭhāna ādhipatyena
translated: And he does not feel them, namely by the power of the basis of that very attainment.

analyzed: eva imā iva te mahāśrāvakāḥ tatra eva jetavane viharanti
translated: In just the same way, those great disciples dwell right there in Jetavana.

analyzed: ṣaṣ indriyam ca eṣām asti

analyzed: na ca tam tathāgata samādhi vikurvita vṛṣabhi tā prātihāryam paśyanti

analyzed: na avataranti

analyzed: na vijānanti

analyzed: na paśyanti na jānanti
translated: They do not see it. They do not know it.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ

translated: Some in the form of ascetics, some in the form of brahmins, some in the form of all kinds of beings with different ages, sizes, and appearances, some in the form of physicians, some in the form of merchants, some in the form of laborers, some in the form of dancers, some in the form of musicians, some in the form of all kinds of craftsmen, were seen to have gone to all the villages, towns, markets, countries, states, and capitals, following the times and circumstances, with different appropriate bodies, different appropriate colors and forms, different voices, different languages, different ways of conduct, and different situations, practicing the bodhisattva conduct that is like the magical illusions of all beings, illuminating the maṇḍalas of all crafts, illuminating the knowledge of all beings, illuminating the arrays of all truths, illuminating all phenomena, purifying the arrays in all directions, and illuminating the maṇḍala of all dharmas.

analyzed: kalyāṇa mitrāṇi

analyzed: mañjuśrīḥ

original: atha khalu mañjuśrīrapi kumarabhūtaḥ pratiṣṭhānakūṭāgāragataḥ sārdhaṃ sabhāgacaritairbodhisattvaiḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu mañjuśrīḥ api kumara bhūtaḥ pratiṣṭhāna kūṭāgāra gataḥ sārdham sa bhāga caritaiḥ bodhisattvaiḥ

analyzed: nitya anubaddhaiḥ ca vajra pāṇibhiḥ
translated: And with vajra-handed ones who are always attached,

analyzed: sarva loka bala karaṇa prayuktābhiḥ ca sarva buddha upasthāna praṇidhāna cittābhiḥ śarīra kāyikābhiḥ devatābhiḥ

analyzed: pūrva praṇidhāna anubaddhābhiḥ ca padakāyikābhiḥ devatābhiḥ
translated: And with deities of the form realm who are bound by previous aspirations,

analyzed: dharma śravaṇa abhimukhābhiḥ ca pṛthivī devatābhiḥ
translated: And with earth deities who are facing towards listening to the Dharma,

analyzed: mahā karuṇā prayuktābhiḥ ca utsa saraḥ hrada taḍāga udadhāna nadī devatābhiḥ

analyzed: prajñā loka bala prabhā avabhāsābhiḥ ca jvalana devatābhiḥ

analyzed: ābaddha makuṭābhiḥ ca vāyu devatābhiḥ

analyzed: sarva diś avabhāsa jñānābhiḥ ca diś devatābhiḥ avidyā andhakāra vidhamana prayuktābhiḥ ca rātri devatābhiḥ

analyzed: sarva dharmadhātu gagana pratimaṇḍala prayuktābhiḥ ca gagana devatābhiḥ
translated: and with celestial beings of the sky who were dedicated to adorning the sky of the realm of the Dharma;

analyzed: sarva jagat bhava samudra saṃtāraṇa prayuktābhiḥ ca sāgara devatābhiḥ
translated: and with celestial beings of the ocean who were dedicated to crossing the ocean of existence of the whole world;

analyzed: sarvajña tā saṃbhāra samārjana prayuktābhiḥ ca kuśala mūla kūṭāgāra abhyudgata cittābhiḥ parvata devatābhiḥ

analyzed: sarva jagat śarīra alaṃkāra prayuktābhiḥ ca sarva buddha varṇa adhiṣṭhāna praṇidhāna prayuktābhiḥ nadī devatābhiḥ
translated: and with celestial beings of the rivers who were dedicated to the adornment of the bodies of all beings and to the vow to have the color of all Buddhas;

analyzed: sarva jagat citta nagara paripālana prayuktābhiḥ ca nagara devatābhiḥ
translated: and with celestial beings of the cities who were dedicated to protecting the cities of the minds of all beings;

analyzed: sarva dharma nagara praṇidhāna adhimuktaiḥ ca nāga indraiḥ sārdham sarva sattva ārakṣā pratipannaiḥ ca yakṣa indraiḥ
translated: and with lords of the nāgas who were dedicated to the city of all the Dharma and were devoted to the vow, and with lords of the yakṣas who were intent on protecting all beings;

analyzed: sarva sattva prīti vega vivardhana prayuktaiḥ ca gandharva indraiḥ
translated: and with lords of the gandharvas who were dedicated to increasing the force of joy in all beings;

analyzed: sarva preta gati vinivartana prayuktaiḥ ca kumbhāṇḍa indraiḥ
translated: and with lords of the kumbhāṇḍas who were dedicated to turning away the destiny of all hungry ghosts;

analyzed: sarva sattva bhava sāgara abhyuddharaṇa praṇidhi pratipannaiḥ ca garuḍa indraiḥ
translated: and with lords of the garuḍas who were intent on the vow to rescue all beings from the ocean of existence.

analyzed: sarva loka abhyudgata tathāgata kāya bala pariniṣpatti praṇidhāna saṃjātaiḥ ca asura indraiḥ
translated: the asura lords who had generated the aspiration to perfect the body and strength of a tathagata that surpasses all worlds;

analyzed: tathāgata darśana prīti labdhaiḥ ca praṇata kāyaiḥ mahā uraga indraiḥ
translated: the mahoraga lords who had attained joy from seeing the tathagata and bowed their bodies;

analyzed: saṃsāra udvigna mānasaiḥ ca ullokita vadanaiḥ deva indraiḥ
translated: the deva lords whose minds were anxious about samsara and who looked up to the face [of the Buddha];

translated: the Brahma lords who had attained great respect and bowed their bodies;

original: atha khalu āyuṣmān śariputro buddhānubhāvena adrākṣīnmañjuśriyaṃ kumārabhūtamanayā īdṛśyā bodhisattvavikurvitavyūhasaṃpadā jetavanānniṣkamya yena dakṣiṇā dik tenopasaṃkramamāṇam /

translated: and the others who had attained great respect and praised the Buddha. In this way, Manjushri, the bodhisattva, left his own abode and circumambulated the Blessed One many hundreds of times, made offerings in many forms, and after departing from the presence of the Blessed One, set out on a journey through the countryside towards the south.

original: dṛṣṭvā ca asyaitadabhavatyannvahaṃ mañjuśriyā kumārabhūtena sārdhaṃ janapadacaryāṃ prakrameyam /

translated: Seeing this, he thought, I should go on a journey through the countryside every day with Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta.

original: sa ṣaṣṭimātrairbhikṣubhiḥ parivṛtaḥ puraskṛtaḥ svakādvihārānniṣkramya yena bhagavāṃstenopasaṃkrāmat /

translated: He was surrounded and honored by sixty such monks,

original: sarve ca te bhikṣavaḥ pūrvajinakṛtādhikārā avaropitakuśalamūlā dūrānugatādhimuktayaḥ śraddhānayapariśuddhā mahācetanāsamudācārā buddhadigvilokanasamarthā dharmasvabhāvaprakṛtiniṣpatticetasaḥ parahitapariṇatabuddhayastathāgataguṇābhilāṣiṇo mañjuśrīdharmadeśanāvainayikāḥ //
analyzed: sarve ca te bhikṣavaḥ pūrva jina kṛta adhikārāḥ avaropita kuśala mūlāḥ dūra anugata adhimuktayaḥ śraddhā naya pariśuddhāḥ mahā cetanā samudācārāḥ buddha diś vilokana samarthāḥ dharma svabhāva prakṛti niṣpatti cetasaḥ para hita pariṇata buddhayaḥ tathāgata guṇa abhilāṣiṇaḥ mañjuśrī dharma deśanā vainayikāḥ
translated: all of whom had served past buddhas, planted roots of virtue, had profound aspirations, had pure faith and understanding, had great thoughts and deeds, were able to look in the direction of the buddhas, had minds that had realized the nature and essence of phenomena, had minds that had turned to benefiting others, longed for the qualities of the Tathāgatas, and were disciplined by Mañjuśrī's teaching of the Dharma.

original: atha khalu āyuṣmān śāriputro gacchanneva mārgaṃ sarvāstān bhikṣūnavalokya sāgarabuddhiṃ bhikṣumāmantrayāmāsapaśya sāgarabuddhe mañjuśriyo bodhisattvasya kāyapariśuddhimacintyāṃ sadevakena lokena /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ gacchan eva mārgam sarvāḥ tān bhikṣūn avalokya sāgarabuddhim bhikṣum āmantrayāmāsa paśya sāgarabuddhe mañjuśriyaḥ bodhisattvasya kāya pariśuddhim acintyām sa devakena lokena
translated: Then the Venerable Śāriputra, while walking on the road, looking at all those monks, addressed the monk Sāgarabuddhi, saying, Sāgarabuddhi, behold the inconceivable purity of the body of the bodhisattva Mañjuśrī, which is unsurpassed in the world with its gods.

analyzed: lakṣaṇa anuvyañjana vicitritām prabhā maṇḍala pariśuddhim ca  aprameya sattva saṃjana nīraśmi jāla vyūham ca
translated: See his body adorned with the major and minor marks, and the purity of his halo.🔽See his net of light rays that gives rise to immeasurable beings.

analyzed: aparimāṇa sarva duḥkha praśamanam parivāra saṃpadam ca
translated: See his perfection of retinue that alleviates immeasurable suffering.

analyzed: pūrva kuśala mūla su parigṛhītān mārga vyūhān ca gacchataḥ aṣṭāpadaḥ mārgaḥ saṃtiṣṭhate
translated: For those who go by the path of the array of the previous roots of virtue, the eight-fold path is established.

original: mārgavikramavyūhāṃśca sarvadigmaṇḍalābhimukhān vartamānān puṇyasamyagvyūhāṃśca vāmadakṣiṇena mahānidhānānyudvelāni bhavanti /
analyzed: mārga vikrama vyūhān ca sarva diś maṇḍala abhimukhān vartamānān puṇya samyak vyūhān ca vāma dakṣiṇena mahā nidhānāni udvelāni bhavanti
translated: For those who go by the path of the array of the heroic march, facing all the directions and circles, and by the path of the array of merit, great treasures well up on the left and right.

analyzed: pūrva buddha upasthāna kuśala mūla nisyandaiḥ ca sarva vṛkṣa kośebhyaḥ vyūhāḥ nirgacchanti
translated: From all the tree-groves, arrays emerge through the outpouring of the roots of virtue of previously serving the Buddhas.

analyzed: sarva loka indrāḥ pūjā meghān abhipravarṣantaḥ praṇamanti
translated: All the lords of the world bow down, raining down clouds of offerings.

original: daśabhyo digbhyaḥ sarvatathāgatorṇākośebhyo raśmijālamaṇḍalāni niścaritvā sarvabuddhadharmānnigarjamānān mūrdhni nipatanti /
analyzed: daśabhyaḥ digbhyaḥ sarva tathāgata ūrṇā kośebhyaḥ raśmi jāla maṇḍalāni niścaritvā sarva buddha dharmān nigarjamānān mūrdhni nipatanti
translated: From the whorls of all the Tathagatas in the ten directions, nets of light rays emerge, roaring all the Buddha-dharmas, and fall upon their heads.

original: evaṃpramukhānāyuṣmān śāriputro mañjuśriyaḥ kumārabhūtasya aparimāṇān mārgakramaṇaguṇavyūhāṃsteṣāṃ bhikṣūṇāṃ saṃdarśayati /
analyzed: evaṃpramukhān āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ mañjuśriyaḥ kumāra bhūtasya aparimāṇān mārga kramaṇa guṇa vyūhān teṣām bhikṣūṇām saṃdarśayati
translated: The Venerable Shariputra thus displays to those monks the immeasurable arrays of qualities of the path traversed by Manjushri Kumara.

original: bhāṣate udīrayati prabhāvayati saṃvarṇayati vivarati vibhajati uttānīkaroti /
analyzed: bhāṣate udīrayati prabhāvayati saṃvarṇayati vivarati vibhajati uttānīkaroti
translated: He speaks, utters, proclaims, praises, reveals, analyzes, and elucidates them.

original: yathā yathā svaviraḥ śāriputro mañjuśriyaḥ kumārabhūtasya guṇānudīrayati /
analyzed: yathā yathā svaviraḥ śāriputraḥ mañjuśriyaḥ kumāra bhūtasya guṇān udīrayati
translated: As Śāriputra extolled the qualities of Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta,

original: tathā tathā teṣāṃ bhikṣūṇāṃ cittāni viśuddhyanti prasīdanti /
analyzed: tathā tathā teṣām bhikṣūṇām cittāni viśuddhyanti prasīdanti
translated: the minds of those monks became purified and serene.

analyzed: prīti vegāḥ vivardhante
translated: Waves of joy increased.

analyzed: harṣaḥ utpadyate  saṃtānāni ca eṣām karmaṇyāni bhavanti
translated: Delight arose.🔽Their continuums became pliable.

analyzed: indriyāṇi prasīdanti  saumanasyam vivardhate
translated: Their faculties became serene.🔽Contentment increased.

analyzed: daurmanasyam prahīyate
translated: Discontent was abandoned.

analyzed: citta mala upagacchati
translated: The impurities of the mind disappeared.

analyzed: sarva āvaraṇāni vinivartante
translated: All obscurations were removed.

analyzed: buddha darśanam abhimukhībhavati
translated: The vision of the Buddha became manifest.

analyzed: buddha dharmeṣu cittāni pariṇamanti
translated: Their minds turned to the Buddha's teachings.

analyzed: bodhisattva indriyāṇi pariśuddhi ante
translated: The faculties of the bodhisattvas became pure.

analyzed: bodhisattva prasāda vegāḥ utpadyante
translated: Waves of faith in the bodhisattvas arose.

analyzed: mahā karuṇā saṃbhavati
translated: Great compassion arose.

analyzed: pāramitā maṇḍalam avakrāmati
translated: He entered the mandala of the perfections.

analyzed: mahā praṇidhānāni saṃjāyante
translated: Great vows arose.

analyzed: daśasu dikṣu buddha samudrāḥ ābhāsībhavanti
translated: The ocean of buddhas in the ten directions became manifest.

original: te evamudāraṃ sarvajñatāprasādavegaṃ pratilabdhā etadavocanupanayatu upādhyāyo'smānetasya satpuruṣasya sakāśam /
analyzed: te evam udāram sarvajña tā prasāda vegam pratilabdhāḥ etat avocan upanayatu upādhyāyaḥ usmān etasya sat puruṣasya sakāśam
translated: Having attained this vast impetus of faith in omniscience, they said, Let the preceptor lead us to that good man.

original: atha khalu āyuṣmān śāriputra trairbhikṣubhiḥ sārdhaṃ yena mañjuśrīḥ kumārabhūtastenopasaṃkramya etadavocatime mañjuśrīḥ bhikṣavaḥ tvaddarśanakāmāḥ
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān śāriputra traiḥ bhikṣubhiḥ sārdham yena mañjuśrīḥ kumāra bhūtaḥ tena upasaṃkramya etat avocat ime mañjuśrīḥ bhikṣavaḥ tvad darśana kāmāḥ
translated: Then the Venerable Śāriputra, together with the three monks, approached Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta and said this: Mañjuśrī, these monks desire to see you.

original: atha khalu mañjuśrīḥ kumārabhūto mahatā bodhisattvavikurvitena sārdha parṣanmaṇḍalapramāṇena bhūmimaṇḍalena nāgāvalokitena pratyudāvṛtya tān bhikṣūnavalokayāmāsa /
analyzed: atha khalu mañjuśrīḥ kumāra bhūtaḥ mahatā bodhisattva vikurvitena sārdha parṣad maṇḍala pramāṇena bhūmi maṇḍalena nāgāvalokitena pratyudāvṛtya tān bhikṣūn avalokayāmāsa
translated: Then Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta, with a great bodhisattva display, with a retinue equal to the extent of the assembly circle, with a gaze like a nāga, turned back and looked at those monks.

original: atha khalu te bhikṣavo mañjuśriyaḥ kumārabhūtasya pādau śirobhirabhivandya añjalīn pragṛhya etadavocananena vayaṃ satpuruṣa tvaddarśanakuśalamūlena yadapyasmākamanyatkuśalamūlaṃ tvaṃ jānīṣe /
analyzed: atha khalu te bhikṣavaḥ mañjuśriyaḥ kumāra bhūtasya pādau śirobhiḥ abhivandya añjalīn pragṛhya etat avocan anena vayam sat puruṣa tvad darśana kuśala mūlena yat api asmākam anyat kuśala mūlam tvam jānīṣe
translated: Then those monks, having bowed their heads at the feet of Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta, with palms joined, said this: By this, good man, through the root of merit of seeing you, whatever other root of merit we have, you know,

analyzed: upādhyāyaḥ ca
translated: and our preceptor,

analyzed: yat ca bhagavataḥ śākyamuneḥ tathāgatasya pratyakṣam
translated: and whatever is directly perceived by the Blessed One, the Tathāgata Śākyamuni,

original: tena vayaṃ kuśalamūlena īdṛśā eva bhavem /
analyzed: tena vayam kuśala mūlena īdṛśāḥ eva bhavem
translated: By that root of merit, may we become just like you.

analyzed: yādṛśaḥ tvam
translated: Just as you are.

analyzed: evaṃrūpam ca kāyam pratilabhema
translated: And may we attain a body like that.

analyzed: evaṃrūpam ghoṣam  evaṃrūpāṇi lakṣaṇāni
translated: Such a voice.🔽Such marks.

analyzed: īdṛśāni vikurvitāni yādṛśāni tava
translated: Such transformations as you have.

original: evamukte ebhirbhikṣubhiḥ mañjuśrīḥ kumārabhūtastān bhikṣūnidamavocatdaśabhiraparikhedacittotpādaiḥ samanvāgato bhikṣavo mahāyānasaṃprasthitaḥ kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā tathāgatabhūmimavakrāmati /
analyzed: evam ukte ebhiḥ bhikṣubhiḥ mañjuśrīḥ kumāra bhūtaḥ tān bhikṣūn idam avocat daśabhiḥ a parikheda citta utpādaiḥ samanvāgataḥ bhikṣavaḥ mahāyāna saṃprasthitaḥ kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā tathāgata bhūmim avakrāmati
translated: When this was said, Mañjuśrī, the youth, said to those monks, Monks, the son of a good family or the daughter of a good family who has set out in the Great Vehicle, endowed with ten kinds of production of the thought of non-exhaustion, enters the stage of the Tathāgata,

analyzed: prāk eva bodhisattva bhūmim
translated: let alone the stage of the Bodhisattva.

analyzed: katamaiḥ daśabhiḥ
translated: What are the ten?

analyzed: yat uta sarva tathāgata darśana paryupāsana pūjā upasthāneṣu a parikheda citta utpādena
translated: Namely, by the production of the thought of non-exhaustion in the service, worship, and attendance of all Tathāgatas, seen and honored.

analyzed: sarva kuśala mūla upacayeṣu a nivartya a parikheda citta utpādena
translated: By the production of the thought of non-exhaustion in the accumulation of all roots of merit, without turning back.

analyzed: sarva dharma paryeṣṭiṣu a parikheda citta utpādena
translated: By the production of the thought of non-exhaustion in the search for all Dharmas.

analyzed: sarva bodhisattva pāramitā prayogeṣu a parikheda citta utpādena
translated: By the production of the thought of non-exhaustion in the application of all the perfections of the Bodhisattvas.

analyzed: sarva bodhisattva samādhi pariniṣpādaneṣu a parikheda citta utpādena
translated: He generates the thought of never tiring of perfecting all the bodhisattva meditative absorptions.

analyzed: sarva adhva paraṃparā avatāreṣu a parikheda citta utpādena
translated: He generates the thought of never tiring of entering into the succession of all the ages.

analyzed: daśa diś sarva buddhakṣetra samudra spharaṇa pariśuddhiṣu a parikheda citta utpādena
translated: He generates the thought of never tiring of pervading and purifying the oceans of all the buddha-fields in the ten directions.

analyzed: sarva sattvadhātu paripāka vinayeṣu a parikheda citta utpādena
translated: He generates the thought of never tiring of ripening and guiding all the realms of beings.

analyzed: sarva kṣetra kalpa bodhisattva caryā nirhāreṣu a parikheda citta utpādena
translated: He generates the thought of never tiring of accomplishing the bodhisattva conduct in all the fields and kalpas.

analyzed: sarva buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ sama pāramitā prayoga eka sattva paripācana krameṇa sarva sattvadhātu paripācanena
translated: He generates the thought of never tiring of ripening all the realms of beings by the method of ripening each being through the practices of the perfections equal to the number of atoms in all buddha-fields.

analyzed: eka tathāgata bala pariniṣpādaneṣu a parikheda citta utpādena
translated: He generates the thought of never tiring of accomplishing the power of a single tathagata.

original: ebhirbhikṣavo daśabhiraparikhedacittotpādaiḥ samanvāgataḥ śrāddhaḥ kulaputraḥ kuladuhitā vā saṃvartate sarvakuśalamūleṣu /🔽vivartate sarvasaṃsāragatibhyaḥ /
analyzed: ebhiḥ bhikṣavaḥ daśabhiḥ a parikheda citta utpādaiḥ samanvāgataḥ śrāddhaḥ kula putraḥ kula duhitā vā saṃvartate sarva kuśala mūleṣu  vivartate sarva saṃsāra gatibhyaḥ
translated: Monks, the faithful son or daughter of good family who possesses these ten thoughts of never tiring generates all roots of virtue.🔽He turns away from all the destinies of samsara.

analyzed: uccalati sarva loka vaṃśebhyaḥ
translated: He rises above all the lineages of the world.

analyzed: atikrāmati sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddha bhūmibhyaḥ ca
translated: He surpasses all the stages of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

analyzed: saṃbhavati sarva tathāgata kula vaṃśeṣu
translated: He is born into all the families and lineages of the tathāgatas.

analyzed: saṃpadyate bodhisattva praṇidhāneṣu
translated: He is perfected in the bodhisattva vows.

analyzed: viśudhyate sarva tathāgata guṇa pratipattiṣu
translated: He is purified in the practice of all the qualities of the tathāgatas.

analyzed: pariśudhyate sarva bodhisattva caryāsu
translated: He is cleansed in all the bodhisattva conducts.

analyzed: samudāgacchati sarva tathāgata baleṣu
translated: He attains all the powers of the tathāgatas.

analyzed: pramardati sarva māra para pravādinaḥ
translated: He conquers all the māras and opponents.

analyzed: ākrāmati sarva bodhisattva bhūmīḥ
translated: He conquers all the bodhisattva stages.

analyzed: āsannībhavati tathāgata bhūmeḥ
translated: He draws near to the stage of the tathāgatas.

original: atha khalu te bhikṣava imaṃ dharmanayaṃ śrutvā sarvabuddhavidarśanāsaṅgacakṣurviṣayaṃ nāma samādhiṃ pratyalabhanta /
analyzed: atha khalu te bhikṣavaḥ imam dharma nayam śrutvā sarva buddha vidarśana asaṅga cakṣuḥ viṣayam nāma samādhim pratyalabhanta
translated: Then those monks, having heard this Dharma method, attained the samādhi called The Eye of Non-Attachment to the Vision of All Buddhas.

analyzed: yasya anubhāvāt daśa diś anantā paryanta lokadhātu sthitān tathāgatān parṣad maṇḍalān adrākṣuḥ
translated: By the power of that [samādhi], they saw the tathāgatas and their assemblies in the world systems of the ten directions, without end or limit.

original: ye ca teṣu lokadhātuṣu sarvajagatyupapannāḥ sattvāstānaśeṣānadrākṣuḥ /
analyzed: ye ca teṣu lokadhātuṣu sarva jagatī upapannāḥ sattvāḥ tān aśeṣān adrākṣuḥ
translated: They saw all the beings born in all the worlds without exception.

analyzed: tān ca lokadhātūn nānā vibhakti tān apaśyan
translated: They saw those world systems with their various distinctions.

analyzed: yāni ca teṣu lokadhātuṣu paramāṇu rajāṃsi
translated: and the atoms in those world systems,

analyzed: tāni api gaṇanā yogena prajānanti sma
translated: they knew them all by means of calculation.

original: ye ca teṣāṃ sattvānāṃ nānāratnamayā bhavanavimānaparibhogāstānapi paśyanti sma /
analyzed: ye ca teṣām sattvānām nānā ratna mayāḥ bhavana vimāna paribhogāḥ tān api paśyanti sma
translated: They also saw the various jeweled palaces and celestial mansions enjoyed by those beings.

analyzed: teṣām ca tathāgatānām svara aṅga samudrān aśrauṣuḥ
translated: They heard the ocean of melodious voices of those Tathāgatas.

analyzed: tām ca dharma deśanām nānā pada vyañjana nirukti mantra nāma saṃjñābhiḥ ājānanti sma
translated: They understood that Dharma teaching with various words, phrases, etymologies, mantras, names, and designations.

original: teṣāṃ ca sattvānāṃ cittendriyāśayān vyavalokayanti sma /
analyzed: teṣām ca sattvānām citta indriya āśayān vyavalokayanti sma
translated: They observed the mental faculties and aspirations of those beings.

analyzed: daśa ca pūrva anta apara anta jāti parivartān anusmaranti sma
translated: They remembered ten previous and future births.

analyzed: teṣām ca tathāgatānām daśa dharma cakra nirukti nirhārān avataranti sma
translated: They penetrated the ten Dharma wheel etymologies of those Tathāgatas.

analyzed: daśa ṛddhi vikurvita vihārān daśa ādeśanā naya nirhārān daśa anuśāsti pada nirhārān avataranti sma
translated: They penetrated the ten enjoyments of miraculous transformations, the ten accomplishments of the methods of teaching, and the ten accomplishments of the instructions.

analyzed: teṣām ca tathāgatānām daśa pratisaṃvinnayā abhinirhārān avataranti sma
translated: They penetrated the ten accomplishments of the methods of the Tathāgatas' analytical knowledges.

analyzed: saha pratilambhāt asya samādheḥ daśa bodhi citta aṅga sahasrāṇi pariniṣpādayanti sma
translated: Immediately upon attaining this samādhi, they accomplished ten thousand aspects of the mind of enlightenment.

analyzed: daśa samādhi sahasrāṇi avakrāmanti sma
translated: They entered ten thousand samādhis.

analyzed: daśa pāramitā aṅga sahasrāṇi viśodhayanti sma
translated: They purified ten thousand aspects of the perfections.

original: te mahāvabhāsapratilabdhā mahāprajñāmaṇḍalāvabhāsitā daśa bodhisattvābhijñāḥ pratilabhante sma /
analyzed: te mahā avabhāsa pratilabdhāḥ mahā prajñāmaṇḍala avabhāsitāḥ daśa bodhisattva abhijñāḥ pratilabhante sma
translated: Having attained great illumination and being illuminated by the great maṇḍala of wisdom, they attained the ten higher knowledges of bodhisattvas.

original: tān mṛdusūkṣmābhijñāṅkurapratilabdhān bodhicittotpādadṛḍhapratiṣṭhitān mañjuśrīḥ kumārabhūtaḥ samantabhadrāyāṃ bodhisattvacaryāyāṃ samādāpya pratiṣṭhāpayāmāsa /
analyzed: tān mṛdu sūkṣma abhijñā aṅkura pratilabdhān bodhi citta utpāda dṛḍha pratiṣṭhitān mañjuśrīḥ kumāra bhūtaḥ samantabhadrāyām bodhisattva caryāyām samādāpya pratiṣṭhāpayāmāsa
translated: Having attained the sprouts of those subtle and gentle higher knowledges, firmly established in the generation of the mind of enlightenment, Mañjuśrī, the youth, inspired and established them in the conduct of bodhisattvas that is completely good.

analyzed: te samantabhadra bodhisattva caryā pratiṣṭhitāḥ mahā praṇidhāna samudrān avatīrya abhinirharanti sma
translated: Having entered the ocean of great vows, they accomplished them.

original: te mahāpraṇidhānasāgarābhinirhṛtayā cittaviśuddhyā kāyaviśuddhiṃ pratilabhante sma /
analyzed: te mahā praṇidhāna sāgara abhinirhṛtayā citta viśuddhyā kāya viśuddhim pratilabhante sma
translated: Having accomplished the ocean of great vows, they attained the purification of the mind and the purification of the body.

analyzed: kāya viśuddhyā kāya laghu tām pratilabhante sma
translated: Through the purification of the body, they attained lightness of body.

analyzed: yayā kāya viśuddhyā kāya laghu tayā tāni abhijñā mukhāni vipulīkurvante
translated: Through that purification of the body and lightness of body, they expanded those doors of higher knowledge.

analyzed: acyuta āgāminīḥ abhijñāḥ pratilabhante sma
translated: They attained the higher knowledges that do not decline.

analyzed: yena abhijñā pratilābhena mañjuśriyaḥ ca kumāra bhūtasya pāda mūlāt na calanti
translated: By which attainment of higher knowledge they did not move from the feet of Mañjuśrī, the youthful one.

original: daśasu ca dikṣu sarvatathāgatakāyameghānabhinirharanti sma sarvabuddhadharmapariniṣpattaye //
analyzed: daśasu ca dikṣu sarva tathāgata kāya meghān abhinirharanti sma sarva buddha dharma pariniṣpattaye
translated: And in the ten directions they manifested clouds of the bodies of all the Tathāgatas for the complete accomplishment of all the Buddha's teachings.

original: atha khalu mañjuśrīḥ kumārabhūtastān bhikṣūnanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau pratiṣṭhāpya anupūrveṇa janapadacaryāṃ caran yena dakṣiṇāpathe dhanyākaraṃ nāma mahānagaraṃ tenopajagāma /
analyzed: atha khalu mañjuśrīḥ kumāra bhūtaḥ tān bhikṣūn anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau pratiṣṭhāpya anupūrveṇa janapada caryām caran yena dakṣiṇāpathe dhanyākaram nāma mahā nagaram tena upajagāma
translated: Then Mañjuśrī, the youthful one, having established those monks in the highest, complete enlightenment, gradually traveled through the countryside and arrived at the great city called Dhanakosa in the southern region.

original: upetya dhanyākarasya mahānagarasya pūrveṇa vicitrasāradhvajavyūhaṃ nāma mahāvanaṣaṇḍaṃ pūrvabuddhādhyuṣitacaityaṃ tathāgatādhiṣṭhitaṃ sattvaparipākāya
analyzed: upetya dhanyākarasya mahā nagarasya pūrveṇa vicitrasāradhvajavyūham nāma mahā vana ṣaṇḍam pūrva buddha adhyuṣita caityam tathāgata dhiṣṭhitam sattva paripākāya
translated: Having arrived, to the east of the great city of Dhanakosa, there is a great forest grove called Vīcikrama-dhvaja-vyūha, a former holy place inhabited by the Buddhas, blessed by the Tathāgatas for the maturation of beings,

original: yatra bhagavatā pūrvaṃ bodhisattvacaryāṃ caratā aneke duṣkaraparityāgāḥ parityaktāḥ /
analyzed: yatra bhagavatā pūrvam bodhisattva caryām caratā aneke duṣkara parityāgāḥ parityaktāḥ
translated: where in the past the Blessed One, while practicing the conduct of a bodhisattva, abandoned many difficult sacrifices.

analyzed: yasmin pṛthivī pradeśe satata samitam deva nāga yakṣa gandharva asura garuḍa kinnara mahoraga manuṣya amanuṣyāḥ pūjām pratyutsukāḥ
translated: In that place on earth, gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, humans, and non-humans were always eager to make offerings.

analyzed: tatra vāsam upagataḥ sārdham sa parivāreṇa
translated: There he dwelt together with his retinue.

original: tatra mañjuśrīḥ kumārabhūto dharmadhātunayaprabhāsaṃ nāma sūtrāntaṃ prakāśayāmāsa daśasūtrāntakoṭīniyutaśatasahasraprasravam /
analyzed: tatra mañjuśrīḥ kumāra bhūtaḥ dharmadhātunayaprabhāsam nāma sūtrāntam prakāśayāmāsa daśa sūtrānta koṭī niyuta śata sahasra prasravam
translated: There Mañjuśrī, the youthful one, revealed the sūtra called Illuminating the Approach to the Dharma Realm, which flowed forth as ten quintillion sūtras.

analyzed: tasya saṃprakāśayataḥ mahā samudrāt anekāni nāga koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi upasaṃkrāntāni
translated: While he was teaching it, many trillions of nāgas came from the great ocean.

original: te taṃ dharmanayaṃ śrutvā nāgagatiṃ vijugupsantastathāgataguṇān spṛhayanto nāgagatiṃ vivartya devamanuṣyopapattiṃ parigṛhṇanti sma /
analyzed: te tam dharma nayam śrutvā nāga gatim vijugupsantaḥ tathāgata guṇān spṛhayantaḥ nāga gatim vivartya deva manuṣya upapattim parigṛhṇanti sma
translated: Having heard that Dharma approach, they despised the nāga state, longed for the qualities of the Tathāgata, turned away from the nāga state, and accepted birth as gods and humans.

analyzed: tatra daśa nāga sahasrāṇi a vaivartikāni abhūvan anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ
translated: There ten thousand nāgas became irreversible from the highest complete enlightenment.

original: tasya taṃ dharmaṃ deśayataḥ kālāntareṇa anantamadhyasattvadhāturvinayaṃ gatastribhiryānaiḥ //
analyzed: tasya tam dharmam deśayataḥ kāla antareṇa ananta madhya sattvadhātuḥ vinayam gataḥ tribhiḥ yānaiḥ
translated: As he taught that Dharma, after some time the infinite and immeasurable realm of beings was disciplined by the three vehicles.

analyzed: aśrauṣuḥ dhanyākara manuṣyāḥ mañjuśrīḥ kumāra bhūtaḥ idam dhanyākaram nagaram anuprāptaḥ
translated: The people of Dhanakosa heard that Manjushri Kumara had arrived in the city of Dhanakosa.

analyzed: iha eva vicitra sāra dhvaja vyūhe caitye viharati iti
translated: They heard that he was dwelling in the stupa called Array of Various Jewels and Banners right there.

original: śrutvā ca punarupāsakopāsikā dārakadārikā mahāprajñopāsakaśreṣṭhipūrvaṃgamāḥ pratyekaṃ pañcaśataparivārā dhanyākarānnagarānniṣkramya yena mañjuśrīḥ kumārabhūtastenopasaṃkrāntāḥ /
analyzed: śrutvā ca punar upāsaka upāsikāḥ dāraka dārikāḥ mahā prajñā upāsaka śreṣṭhi pūrvaṃgamāḥ pratyekam pañca śata parivārāḥ dhanyākarāt nagarāt niṣkramya yena mañjuśrīḥ kumāra bhūtaḥ tena upasaṃkrāntāḥ
translated: Having heard this, the male and female lay followers, the boys and girls, with the foremost lay disciple of great wisdom leading the way, each with a retinue of five hundred, left the city of Dhanakosa and approached Manjushri Kumara.

original: tatra mahāprajñopāsakaḥ sudattena copāsakena sārdhaṃ vasudattena ca puṇyaprabheṇa ca yaśodevena ca somaśrityā ca somanandinā ca sumatinā ca mahāmatinā ca rāhulabhadreṇa ca bhadraśriyā copāsakena sārdhametatpramukhaiḥ pañcabhirupāsakaśataiḥ parivṛtaḥ puraskṛtaḥ yena mañjuśrīḥ kumārabhūtastenopasaṃkramya mañjuśriyaḥ kumārabhūtasya pādau śirasābhivandya mañjuśriyaṃ kumārabhūtaṃ triḥ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya ekānte nyaṣīdat //
analyzed: tatra mahāprajña upāsakaḥ sudattena ca upāsakena sārdham vasudattena ca puṇyaprabheṇa ca yaśodevena ca somaśrityā ca somanandinā ca sumatinā ca mahāmatinā ca rāhulabhadreṇa ca bhadraśriyā ca upāsakena sārdham etad pramukhaiḥ pañcabhiḥ upāsaka śataiḥ parivṛtaḥ puraskṛtaḥ yena mañjuśrīḥ kumāra bhūtaḥ tena upasaṃkramya mañjuśriyaḥ kumāra bhūtasya pādau śirasā abhivandya mañjuśriyam kumāra bhūtam tris pradakṣiṇīkṛtya ekānte nyaṣīdat
translated: There, the great wise lay disciple, together with the lay disciples Sudatta, Vasudatta, Puṇyaprabha, Yaśodeva, Somanandin, Sumati, Mahāmati, Rāhulabhadra, and the lay disciple Bhadrasena, surrounded and honored by these and five hundred other lay disciples, approached where Mañjuśrī, the youthful one, was. Having approached, he bowed his head at the feet of Mañjuśrī, the youthful one, circumambulated Mañjuśrī, the youthful one, three times, and sat to one side.

original: tatra mahāprajñā nāmopāsikā suprabhayā copāsikayā sārdhaṃ sugātrayā ca subhadrayā ca bhadraśriyā ca candraprabhāsayā ca ketuprabhayā ca śrībhadrayā ca sulocanayā copāsikayā sārdhametatpramukhaiḥ pañcabhirupāsikāśataiḥ parivṛtā puraskṛtā yena mañjuśrīḥ kumārabhūtastenopasaṃkramya mañjuśriyaḥ kumārabhūtasya pādau śirasābhivandya mañjuśriyaṃ kumārabhūtaṃ triḥ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya ekānte nyaṣīdat //
analyzed: tatra mahāprajñā nāma upāsikā suprabhayā ca upāsikayā sārdham sugātrayā ca subhadrayā ca bhadraśriyā ca candraprabhāsayā ca ketuprabhayā ca śrībhadrayā ca sulocanayā ca upāsikayā sārdham etad pramukhaiḥ pañcabhiḥ upāsikā śataiḥ parivṛtā puraskṛtā yena mañjuśrīḥ kumāra bhūtaḥ tena upasaṃkramya mañjuśriyaḥ kumāra bhūtasya pādau śirasā abhivandya mañjuśriyam kumāra bhūtam tris pradakṣiṇīkṛtya ekānte nyaṣīdat
translated: There, the laywoman Mahāprajñā, together with the laywomen Suprabhā, Sugātrā, Subhadrā, Bhadraśrī, Candraprabhā, Ketuprabhā, Śrībhadrā, and Sulocana, and with five hundred other such leading laywomen, approached Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta. Having approached, they bowed their heads to the feet of Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta, circumambulated Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta three times, and then sat to one side.

original: tatra sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhidārakaḥ suvratena ca śreṣṭhidārakeṇa sārdhaṃ suśīlena ca svācāreṇa ca suvikrāmīṇā ca sucintinā ca sumatinā ca subuddhinā ca sunetreṇa ca subāhunā ca suprabheṇa ca śreṣṭhidārakeṇa sārdhametatpramukhaiḥ pañcabhiḥ śreiṣṭhidārakaśataiḥ parivṛtaḥ puraskṛto yena mañjuśrīḥ kumārabhūtastenopasaṃkramya mañjuśriyaḥ kumārabhūtasya pādau śirasābhivandya mañjuśriyaṃ kumārabhūtaṃ triḥ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya ekānte nyaṣīdat //
analyzed: tatra sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhi dārakaḥ suvratena ca śreṣṭhi dārakeṇa sārdham suśīlena ca su ācāreṇa ca suvikrāmīṇā ca sucintinā ca sumatinā ca subuddhinā ca sunetreṇa ca subāhunā ca suprabheṇa ca śreṣṭhi dārakeṇa sārdham etad pramukhaiḥ pañcabhiḥ śreiṣṭhi dāraka śataiḥ parivṛtaḥ puraskṛtaḥ yena mañjuśrīḥ kumāra bhūtaḥ tena upasaṃkramya mañjuśriyaḥ kumāra bhūtasya pādau śirasā abhivandya mañjuśriyam kumāra bhūtam tris prad
translated: There, the merchant’s son Sudhana, together with the merchant’s sons Suvrata, Suśīla, Svācāra, Suvikramī, Sucinta, Sumati, Subuddhi, Sunetra, Subāhu, and Suprabha, the foremost among five hundred merchant’s sons, surrounded and attended by them, approached Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta. Having approached, he bowed his head at the feet of Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta, circumambulated Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta three times, and sat to one side.

original: tatra subhadrā dārikā mahāprajñasya gṛhapaterduhitā bhadrayā ca dārikayā sārdhamabhirāmavartayā ca dṛḍhamatyā ca śrībhadrayā ca brahmadattayā ca śrīprabhayā ca suprabhayā dārikayā sārdhametatpramukhaiḥ pañcabhirdārikāśataiḥ parivṛtā puraskṛtā yena mañjuśrīḥ kumārabhūtastenopasaṃkramya mañjuśriyaḥ kumārabhūtasya pādau śirasābhivandya mañjuśriyaṃ kumārabhūtaṃ triḥ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya ekānte nyaṣīdat //
analyzed: tatra subhadrā dārikā mahāprajñasya gṛhapateḥ duhitā bhadrayā ca dārikayā sārdham abhirāmavartayā ca dṛḍhamatyā ca śrībhadrayā ca brahmadattayā ca śrīprabhayā ca suprabhayā dārikayā sārdham etad pramukhaiḥ pañcabhiḥ dārikā śataiḥ parivṛtā puraskṛtā yena mañjuśrīḥ kumāra bhūtaḥ tena upasaṃkramya mañjuśriyaḥ kumāra bhūtasya pādau śirasā abhivandya mañjuśriyam kumāra bhūtam tris pradakṣiṇīkṛtya ekānte nyaṣīdat
translated: There, the girl Subhadrā, the daughter of the householder Mahāprajña, together with the girls Bhadrā, Abhirāmā, Dṛḍhamati, Śrībhadrā, Brahmadatta, Śrīprabhā, and the girl Suprabhā, surrounded and attended by these and five hundred other girls at their head, approached Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta. Having approached, she bowed her head at the feet of Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta, circumambulated Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta three times, and sat to one side.

original: atha khalu mañjuśrīḥ kumārabhūto dhanyākarānnagarāt tāḥ strīpuruṣadārakadārikāḥ saṃnipatitāḥ saṃniṣaṇṇā viditvā yathāśayaṃ saṃdarśanādhipatyenābhibhūya mahāmaitryādhipatyena prahlādya mahākaruṇādhipatyena dharmadeśanāmabhinirhṛtya jñānādhipatyena cittāśayān pravicintya mahāpratisaṃvidā dharmamupadeṣṭukāmaḥ sudhanaṃ śreiṣṭhidārakamvalokayāmāsa /
analyzed: atha khalu mañjuśrīḥ kumāra bhūtaḥ dhanyākarāt nagarāt tāḥ strī puruṣa dāraka dārikāḥ saṃnipatitāḥ saṃniṣaṇṇāḥ viditvā yathāśayam saṃdarśana ādhipatyena abhibhūya mahā maitrī ādhipatyena prahlādya mahā karuṇā ādhipatyena dharma deśanām abhinirhṛtya jñāna ādhipatyena citta āśayān pravicintya mahā pratisaṃvidā dharmam upadeṣṭu kāmaḥ sudhanam śreiṣṭhi dārakam valokayāmāsa
translated: Then Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta, knowing that the men, women, boys, and girls of the city of Dhanayakara had assembled and were seated, having seen them according to their aspirations, having overwhelmed them with the power of vision, having delighted them with the power of great love, having brought forth the teaching of the Dharma with the power of great compassion, having examined their minds and aspirations with the power of knowledge, and desiring to teach the Dharma with great discernment, looked at the merchant boy Sudhana.

original: sudhanaḥ khalu punaḥ śreṣṭhidārakaḥ kena kāraṇenocyate sudhana iti /
analyzed: sudhanaḥ khalu punar śreṣṭhi dārakaḥ kena kāraṇena ucyate sudhanaḥ iti
translated: Now, why is the merchant boy Sudhana called Sudhana?

original: sudhanasya khalu śreṣṭhidārakasya samanantarāvakrāntasya mātuḥ kukṣau tasmin gṛhe sapta ratnāṅkurāḥ prādurbhūtāḥ samantādgṛhasya suvibhaktāḥ
analyzed: sudhanasya khalu śreṣṭhi dārakasya samanantara avakrāntasya mātuḥ kukṣau tasmin gṛhe sapta ratna aṅkurāḥ prādurbhūtāḥ samantāt gṛhasya su vibhaktāḥ
translated: As soon as the merchant boy Sudhana entered his mother's womb, seven jewels sprouted in that house, well-arranged all around the house.

analyzed: teṣām ca ratna aṅkurāṇām adhas sapta mahā nidhānāni
translated: And below those jewel sprouts there were seven great treasures.

original: yataste ratnāṅkurāḥ samutpatya dharaṇitalamabhinirbhidya abhyudgatāḥ suvarṇasya rūpyasya vaiḍūryasya sphaṭikasya lohitamukteraśmagarbhasya musāaragalvasya saptamasya ratnasya /
analyzed: yatas te ratna aṅkurāḥ samutpatya dharaṇi talam abhinirbhidya abhyudgatāḥ suvarṇasya rūpyasya vaiḍūryasya sphaṭikasya lohitamukteḥ aśmagarbhasya musāaragalvasya saptamasya ratnasya
translated: Because those jewel sprouts grew up, broke through the surface of the earth, and emerged, of gold, silver, lapis lazuli, crystal, red pearl, emerald, and the seventh jewel, musāragalva.

original: sa yadā sarvāṅgapratyaṅgaiḥ paripūrṇo daśānāṃ māsānāmatyayājjātaḥ /
analyzed: sa yadā sarva aṅga pratyaṅgaiḥ paripūrṇaḥ daśānām māsānām atyayāt jātaḥ
translated: When he was born after ten months, complete with all the major and minor limbs,

original: tadā tāni sapta mahānidhānāni saptahastāyāmavistārodvedhapramāṇāni dharaṇitalādabhyudgamya vivṛttāni virocanti bhrājante sma /
analyzed: tadā tāni sapta mahā nidhānāni sapta hasta āyāma vistāra udvedha pramāṇāni dharaṇi talāt abhyudgamya vivṛttāni virocanti bhrājante sma
translated: then those seven great treasures, seven cubits in length, width, and height, rose up from the ground, opened, and shone brightly.

original: pañca ca bhājanaśatāni tasmin gṛhe prādurbhūtāni nānāratnamayāni /
analyzed: pañca ca bhājana śatāni tasmin gṛhe prādurbhūtāni nānā ratna mayāni
translated: And five hundred vessels appeared in that house, made of various jewels.

analyzed: yat uta sarpi bhājanāni taila bhājanāni madhu bhājanāni navanīta bhājanāni
translated: Namely, ghee vessels, oil vessels, honey vessels, and butter vessels.

analyzed: pratyekam ca sarva upakaraṇa paripūrṇāni
translated: And each one was filled with all the necessary implements.

analyzed: yat uta vajra bhājanāni sarva gandha paripūrṇāni su gandha bhājanāni
translated: Namely, diamond vessels filled with all fragrances, fragrant vessels,

analyzed: nānā vastra paripūrṇāni śilā bhājanāni
translated: filled with various garments, stone vessels,

analyzed: nānā bhakṣya bhojya rasa rasa agra paripūrṇāni maṇi bhājanāni  nānā ratna paripūrṇāni suvarṇa bhājanāni rūpya cūrṇa paripūrṇāni
translated: jeweled vessels filled with the essence of various delicacies and flavors,🔽golden vessels filled with various jewels, silver vessels filled with gold dust,

analyzed: rūpya bhājanāni suvarṇa varṇa cūrṇa paripūrṇāni
translated: silver vessels filled with gold-colored powder,

analyzed: suvarṇa rūpya bhājanāni vaiḍūrya maṇi ratna paripūrṇāni  sphaṭika bhājanāni musāragalva paripūrṇāni
translated: golden and silver vessels filled with vaiḍūrya gems,🔽crystal vessels filled with musāragalva,

analyzed: musāragalva bhājanāni sphaṭika ratna paripūrṇāni  aśma garbha bhājanāni lohita muktā paripūrṇāni
translated: musāragalva vessels filled with crystal gems,🔽aśmagarbha vessels filled with red pearls,

analyzed: lohita muktā bhājanāni aśma garbha paripūrṇāni  jyotiḥ dhvaja maṇī ratna bhājanāni udaka prasādaka maṇī ratna paripūrṇāni
translated: red pearl vessels filled with aśmagarbha,🔽jyotirdhvaja maṇi gem vessels filled with water-purifying maṇi gems,

analyzed: udaka prasādaka maṇī ratna bhājanāni jyotiḥ dhvaja maṇi ratna paripūrṇāni
translated: water-purifying maṇi gem vessels filled with jyotirdhvaja maṇi gems.

original: etatpramukhāni pañca ratnabhājanaśatāni sahajātasya khalu sudhanasya śreṣṭhidārakasya gṛhe sarvakośakoṣṭhāgāreṣu dhanadhānyahiraṇyasuvarṇavividharatnavarṣāṇyabhipravarṣitāni
analyzed: etad pramukhāni pañca ratna bhājana śatāni sahajātasya khalu sudhanasya śreṣṭhi dārakasya gṛhe sarva kośa koṣṭhāgāreṣu dhana dhānya hiraṇya suvarṇa vividha ratna varṣāṇi abhipravarṣitāni
translated: In the house of the merchant's son Sudhana, as soon as he was born, a rain of wealth, grain, gold, silver, and various jewels fell into all the treasuries and storehouses.

original: tasya naimittikairbrāhmaṇairmātāpitṛbhyāṃ jñātivargeṇa ca vipulasamṛddhirasya jātamātrasya gṛhe prādurbhūteti sudhanaḥ sudhana iti nāmadheyaṃ kṛtam /
analyzed: tasya naimittikaiḥ brāhmaṇaiḥ mātā pitṛbhyām jñāti vargeṇa ca vipula samṛddhiḥ asya jāta mātrasya gṛhe prādurbhūtā iti sudhanaḥ sudhanaḥ iti nāmadheyam kṛtam
translated: Because of this, the Brahmins who were astrologers, his parents, and his relatives' group, since great prosperity and abundance appeared in his house as soon as he was born, gave him the name Sudhana, Sudhana.

original: sudhanaḥ khalu śreṣṭhidārakaḥ pūrvajinakṛtādhikāro'varopitakuśalamūlaḥ udārādhimuktikaḥ kalyāṇamitrānugatāśayo'navadyakāyavāṅmanaskarmasamudācāro bodhisattvamārgapariśodhanaprayuktaḥ sarvajñatābhimukho bhājanībhūto buddhadharmāṇāmāśayagamanapariśuddho'saṅgabodhicittapariniṣpannaḥ //
analyzed: sudhanaḥ khalu śreṣṭhi dārakaḥ pūrva jina kṛta adhikāraḥ varopita kuśala mūlaḥ udāra adhimuktikaḥ kalyāṇa mitra anugata āśayaḥ navadya kāya vāc manaḥ karma samudācāraḥ bodhisattva mārga pariśodhana prayuktaḥ sarvajña tā abhimukhaḥ bhājanībhūtaḥ buddha dharmāṇām āśaya gamana pariśuddhaḥ ūsaṅga bodhi citta pariniṣpannaḥ
translated: Now, the young merchant Sudhana had previously served the Victors, had planted the roots of virtue, had lofty aspirations, had a mind that followed the spiritual friends, had conduct of body, speech, and mind that was irreproachable, was devoted to purifying the path of the bodhisattvas, was facing omniscience, was a vessel for the Buddha's teachings, had a pure intention and conduct, and had fully accomplished the unattached enlightened mind.

original: atha khalu mañjuśrīḥ kumārabhūtaḥ sudhanaṃ śreṣṭhidārakamavalokya pratisaṃmodate sma /
analyzed: atha khalu mañjuśrīḥ kumāra bhūtaḥ sudhanam śreṣṭhi dārakam avalokya pratisaṃmodate sma
translated: Then, indeed, Mañjuśrī, the youth, having looked at the young merchant Sudhana, rejoiced.

original: dharmaṃ cāsya deśayāmāsayaduta sarvabuddhadharmānārabhya sarvabuddhadharmasamudayāvāptimārabhya sarvabuddhānantatāmārabhya sarvabuddhaparaṃparāvatāramārabhya sarvabuddhaparṣanmaṇḍalaviśuddhimārabhya sarvabuddhadharmacakranirvāṇavyūhamārabhya sarvabuddharūpakāyalakṣaṇānuvyañjanaviśuddhimārabhya sarvabuddhadharmakāyapariniṣpattimārabhya sarvabuddhasarasvativyūhamārabhya sarvabuddhaprabhāmaṇḍalavyūhaviśuddhimārabhya sarvabuddhasamatāmārabhya dharmaṃ deśayāmāsa //

analyzed: bheṣyasi jagataḥ trāṇam eṣa nayaḥ bodhi caryāyāḥ

original: ye bodhisattva sudṛḍhā akhinnamanasaḥ saṃsāri te carim /

analyzed: samantabhadrām labhate aparājitām asaṅgām hi

analyzed: puṇya prabha puṇya ketu puṇya ākara puṇya sāgara viśuddhim
translated: O Puṇyaprabha, Puṇyaketu, Puṇyākāra, Puṇyāsāgara, you who have attained purity,

analyzed: yaḥ tvam samantabhadrām si sa cārikām jagat artham

analyzed: drakṣyasi buddhān daśat diśi loke

analyzed: teṣām ca dharma meghān dhārayitāsi smṛti balena

original: sa tvaṃ jinan daśaddiśi paśyannapi yeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu /

analyzed: teṣām praṇidhāna sāgara śodhayiṣyasi bodhi caryāyām

analyzed: ye sthihitva
translated: Those who have entered this ocean of ways and abide on the level of the Buddhas,

analyzed: te bhonti sarva darśī śikṣantaḥ lokanāthānām
translated: They become all-seers, training under the Lords of the world.

analyzed: tvam sarva kṣetra prasare kṣetra rajaḥ samān caritvā bahu kalpān
translated: You, having practiced for many eons in all the realms, equal to the atoms in the Buddha-fields,

analyzed: caryām samanta bhadrām spṛśiṣyasi śivām prasara bodhim
translated: You will attain the auspicious enlightenment, O you who have set out, having practiced the conduct of Samantabhadra.

analyzed: caritavya kalpa sāgara ananta madhya aśeṣa kṣetresu
translated: You should practice in the oceans of eons, without end or middle, in all the Buddha-fields,

analyzed: paripūritavya praṇidhī samantavarabhadracaryāyām

analyzed: ye bodhi prārthayante samanta bhadreṇa jñānena

original: atha khalu mañjuśrīḥ kumārabhūta imā gāthā bhāṣitvā sudhanaṃ śreṣṭhidārakametadavocatsādhu sādhu kulaputra /

translated: Then Mañjuśrī, the Youth, having spoken these verses, said this to the merchant's son Sudhana: Excellent, excellent, O son of noble family!

analyzed: yaḥ tvam anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye cittam utpādya bodhisattva caryām parigaveṣitavyām manyase

original: tena hi kulaputra bhūtakalyāṇamitreṣu niścayaprāptena bodhisattvena bhavitavyaṃ sarvajñajñānapratilambhāya /🔽aparikhinnamānasena bhavitavyaṃ kalyāṇamitraparyeṣṭiṣu /
analyzed: tena hi kula putra bhūta kalyāṇa mitreṣu niścaya prāptena bodhisattvena bhavitavyam sarvajña jñāna pratilambhāya  a parikhinna mānasena bhavitavyam kalyāṇa mitra paryeṣṭiṣu
translated: Therefore, noble sir, a bodhisattva who has attained certainty in the true spiritual friends should strive for the attainment of the omniscient knowledge.🔽One should be untiring in seeking the spiritual friends.

original: atṛptena bhavitavyaṃ kalyāṇamitradarśaneṣu /🔽pradakṣiṇagrāhiṇā te bhavitavyaṃ kalyāṇamitrānuśāsanīṣu /

translated: One should be insatiable in seeing the spiritual friends.🔽One should be receptive to the instructions of the spiritual friends.

analyzed: a pratihatena bhavitavyam kalyāṇa mitra upāya kauśalya cariteṣu
translated: One should be free from resistance in the skillful conduct of the spiritual friends.

original: asti kulaputra ihaiva dakṣiṇāpathe rāmāvarānto nāma janapadaḥ /

analyzed: tatra sugrīvaḥ nāma parvataḥ

analyzed: tatra meghaśrīḥ nāma bhikṣuḥ prativasati

analyzed: tam upasaṃkramya paripṛccha katham bodhisattvena bodhisattva caryāyām śikṣitavyam

translated: Then the merchant's son Sudhana, satisfied, elated, delighted, joyful, happy, and pleased, bowed his head to the feet of Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta, circumambulated Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta many hundreds of thousands of times, looked at him many hundreds of thousands of times, his mind following with love for the spiritual teacher, unable to bear not seeing the spiritual teacher, weeping with a tearful face, departed from the presence of Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta.

translated: so also in the southern, western, northern, northeastern, southeastern, southwestern, and northwestern directions, and below and above, I see one tathāgata

translated: up to as many tathāgatas as there are atoms in an anabhilāpyānabhilāpya number of buddha-fields.
