analyzed: ekaikasyām diśi anuvilokayan nānā varṇān tathāgatān paśyāmi nānā saṃsthānān nānā vikurvitān nānā vṛṣabhitā vikrīḍitān vicitra parṣad maṇḍala vyūhān aneka varṇa an aneka varṇa raśmi jāla avabhāsa muktān vividha buddhakṣetra viśuddhi bhavana vyūhān nānavidha āyuḥ pramāṇa viśuddhān yathā āśaya jagat vijñāpanān vividha abhisaṃbodhi viśuddhi mukha vikurvitān buddha ṛṣabha siṃhanāda vinarditān tathāgatān paśyāmi
translated: Looking in each direction, I see tathāgatas of various colors, with various forms, various miracles, various superior displays of playfulness, various arrays of retinues, various colors, various nets of light rays, various arrays of purified buddha realms, various purities of lifespans, various manifestations to the world according to inclinations, various purities of manifestations of complete enlightenment, and various lion's roars of the Buddha's power.

analyzed: asyāḥ aham kula putra samanta mukha sarva ārambaṇa vijñapti samavasaraṇa ālokāyāḥ buddha anusmṛteḥ lābhī
translated: Noble one, I have attained this recollection of the Buddha called 'Light Entering All Gates and Manifesting All Objects.'

analyzed: kim mayā śakyam bodhisattvānām ananta jñāna maṇḍala viśuddhānām caryā jñātum
translated: What can I, a bodhisattva, know of the conduct of bodhisattvas who have purified the infinite mandala of wisdom?

analyzed: guṇān vā vaktum
translated: Or what can I describe of their qualities?

analyzed: ye te samantāvabhāsa maṇḍala buddha anusmṛti mukha pratilabdhāḥ sarva tathāgata maṇḍala sarva buddhakṣetra bhavana viśuddhi vyūha abhimukha paśyana tayā
translated: Those who have attained the gate of the recollection of the Buddha called 'Universal Illumination' see face to face the mandalas of all tathāgatas and the arrays of the purification of all buddha realms.

analyzed: ye te sarva jagat samāropita buddha anusmṛti mukha pratilabdhāḥ yathā āśaya jagat vijñapti tathāgata darśana viśuddhyā
translated: Those who have attained the gateway of mindfulness of the Buddha that is projected into all worlds, by the purity of seeing the Tathagata in accordance with the dispositions of the world.

analyzed: ye te daśa bala samāropita buddha anusmṛti mukha pratilabdhāḥ daśa tathāgata bala apramāṇa anusaraṇa tayā
translated: Those who have attained the gateway of mindfulness of the Buddha that is projected into the ten powers, by following the immeasurability of the ten powers of the Tathagata.

analyzed: ye te dharma samāropita buddha anusmṛti mukha pratilabdhāḥ dharma śravaṇa ākāra sarva tathāgata kāya megha avalokana tayā  ye te digvirocana garbha buddha anusmṛti mukha pratilabdhāḥ sarva diś samudreṣu asaṃbhinna buddha samudra avataraṇa tayā
translated: Those who have attained the gateway of mindfulness of the Buddha that is projected into the Dharma, by listening to the Dharma and seeing the clouds of bodies of all Tathagatas.🔽Those who have attained the gateway of mindfulness of the Buddha that is the womb of the radiance of the directions, by entering the ocean of Buddhas that is not separate in the ocean of all directions.

analyzed: ye te dasa diś praveśa buddha anusmṛti mukha pratilabdhāḥ sūkṣma avalambana sarva tathāgata vikurvita vṛṣabhita avataraṇa tayā
translated: Those who have attained the gateway of mindfulness of the Buddha that enters the ten directions, by entering the supremacy of the miracles of all Tathagatas with subtle reliance.

analyzed: ye te kalpa samāropita buddha anusmṛti mukha pratilabdhāḥ avarahita sarva kalpa tathāgata darśana vijñaptyā
translated: Those who have attained the gateway of mindfulness of the Buddha that is projected into the kalpas, by seeing and being aware of the Tathagatas in all kalpas without being separated from them.

analyzed: ye te kāla samāropita buddha anusmṛti mukha pratilabdhāḥ sarva kāla tathāgata kāla darśana saṃvāsa avijahana tayā
translated: Those who have attained the gateway of mindfulness of the Buddhas through the superknowledge of time, never being separated from the vision and companionship of the Tathāgatas at all times.

analyzed: ye te kṣetra samāropita buddha anusmṛti mukha pratilabdhāḥ sarva buddhakṣetra abhyudgata anabhibhūta buddha kāya darśana vijñaptyā
translated: Those who have attained the gateway of mindfulness of the Buddhas through the superknowledge of the field, manifesting the vision of the unobstructed body of the Buddha rising above all buddha-fields.

analyzed: ye te tri adhva samāropita buddha anusmṛti mukha pratilabdhāḥ tri adhva tathāgata maṇḍala sva citta āśaya samavasaraṇa tayā
translated: Those who have attained the gateway of mindfulness of the Buddhas through the superknowledge of the three times, penetrating the mandala of the Tathāgata of the three times with their own mind and intention.

analyzed: ye te ārambaṇa samāropita buddha anusmṛti mukha pratilabdhāḥ sarva ārambaṇa tathāgata paraṃparā samudāgama darśana vijñaptyā  ye te śānta samāropita buddha anusmṛti mukha pratilabdhāḥ eka kṣaṇa sarva lokadhātuṣu sarva tathāgata parinirvāṇa vijñaptyā
translated: Those who have attained the gateway of mindfulness of the Buddhas through the superknowledge of objects, manifesting the vision of the continuous arising of the Tathāgatas from all objects.🔽Those who have attained the gateway of mindfulness of the Buddhas through the superknowledge of peace, manifesting the parinirvāṇa of all Tathāgatas in all world-systems in a single moment.

analyzed: ye te vigama samāropita buddha anusmṛti mukha pratilabdhāḥ eka divase sarva āvāseṣu sarva tathāgata prakramaṇa vijñaptyā
translated: Those who have attained the gateway of mindfulness of the Buddhas through the superknowledge of separation, manifesting the departure of all Tathāgatas from all abodes in a single day.

analyzed: ye te vipula samāropita buddha anusmṛti mukha pratilabdhāḥ ekaika tathāgata dharmadhātu paryaṅka parisphuṭa buddha śarīra vijñaptyā
translated: Those who have attained the gateway of recollection of the Buddha through extensive superimposition, who perceive the Buddha's body as filling the Dharma seat of each Tathāgata.

analyzed: ye te sūkṣma samāropita buddha anusmṛti mukha pratilabdhāḥ eka vāla pathena an abhilāpya buddha utpāda ārāgaṇa avataraṇa tayā
translated: Those who have attained the gateway of recollection of the Buddha through subtle superimposition, who enter into the arising of inexpressible Buddhas through a single hair's breadth.

analyzed: ye te vyūha samāropita buddha anusmṛti mukha pratilabdhāḥ eka kṣaṇe sarva lokadhātuṣu abhisaṃbodhi vikurvita saṃdarśana vijñaptyā
translated: Those who have attained the gateway of recollection of the Buddha through superimposition of arrays, who manifest the display of great enlightenment and transformations in all world systems in a single instant.

analyzed: ye te kārya samāropita buddha anusmṛti mukha pratilabdhāḥ sarva buddha utpāda dharma cakra vikurvita jñāna avabhāsa pratilābha tayā
translated: Those who have attained the gateway of recollection of the Buddha through superimposition of function, who attain the illumination of the knowledge of the transformations of the wheel of Dharma of all Buddhas.

analyzed: ye te samāropita buddha anusmṛti mukha pratilabdhāḥ sva citta āśaya darśana sarva tathāgata pratibhāsa prāptyā
translated: Those who have attained the gateway of recollection of the Buddha through superimposition, who attain the reflection of all Tathāgatas through the vision of their own mind's intentions.

analyzed: ye te karma samāropita buddha anusmṛti mukha pratilabdhāḥ sarva jagat yathā upacita karma pratibimba saṃdarśana tayā
translated: Those who have attained the gateway of recollection of the Buddha through superimposition of karma, who manifest the reflections of all the karma accumulated by the world in accordance with its accumulation.

analyzed: ye te vikurvita samāropita buddha anusmṛti mukha pratilabdhāḥ aśeṣa sarva dharmadhātu nalinī padma parisphuṭa vipula buddha vikurvita darśana samanta diś abhimukha vijñaptyā
translated: Those who have attained the gateway of mindfulness of the Buddha through the transformation of the body, who see the vast transformations of the Buddha, clearly manifest in the lotus ponds of the entire Dharma realm, facing in all directions,

analyzed: ye te gagana samāropita buddha anusmṛti mukha pratilabdhāḥ tathāgata bimba megha racita dharmadhātu gagana ālokana tayā
translated: Those who have attained the gateway of mindfulness of the Buddha through the transformation of space, who behold the Dharma realm and space adorned with clouds of the forms of Tathāgatas,

analyzed: gaccha kula putra
translated: Go, son of noble family.

analyzed: ayam iha eva dakṣiṇāpathe sāgaramukhaḥ nāma diś pratyuddeśaḥ
translated: Here, in the southern region, there is a place called the Mouth of the Ocean.

analyzed: tatra sāgarameghaḥ nāma bhikṣuḥ prativasati

analyzed: tam upasaṃkramya paripṛccha

analyzed: katham bodhisattvena bodhisattva caryāyām śikṣitavyam

analyzed: katham pratipattavyam  sa te kula putra kalyāṇa mitram paridīpayiṣyati

analyzed: kuśala mūla saṃbhāra hetum samavatārayiṣyati

analyzed: vipulām saṃbhāra bhūmim saṃjanayiṣyati

analyzed: vipulam kuśala mūla vega balam saṃvarṇayiṣyati

analyzed: vipulam mahāyāna avabhāsa hetum upastambhayiṣyati

translated: will increase the vast power of the accumulation of the perfections;🔽will purify the method of entering the vast ocean of conduct;🔽will purify the vast circle of vows;

analyzed: vipulam praṇidhāna maṇḍalam viśodhayiṣyati  vipulam samantamukha niryāṇa vyūham saṃvardhayiṣyati

analyzed: vipulam mahā karuṇā balam pravardhayiṣyati

analyzed: tam buddha maṇḍalam abhimukham adhimucyamānaḥ

analyzed: anupūrveṇa yena sāgara mukham diś pratyuddeśaḥ yena ca sāgara meghaḥ bhikṣuḥ tena upasaṃkramya sāgara meghasya bhikṣoḥ pādau śirasā abhivandya sāgara megham bhikṣum aneka śata sahasra kṛtvas pradakṣiṇīkṛtya sāgara meghasya bhikṣoḥ puratas prāñjaliḥ sthitvā etat avocata ham ārya anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃprasthitaḥ unuttaram jñāna sāgaram avatartu kāmaḥ
translated: he gradually went to the direction of Sāgaramukha, to where the monk Sāgaramegha was. Having approached, he bowed his head to the feet of the monk Sāgaramegha, circumambulated the monk Sāgaramegha many hundreds of thousands of times, and stood before the monk Sāgaramegha with palms joined in respect. He said this: Noble one, I have set out for unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, wishing to enter the ocean of unsurpassed knowledge.

original: na ca jāne kathaṃ bodhisattvā vivartante lokavaṃśāt /
analyzed: na ca jāne katham bodhisattvāḥ vivartante loka vaṃśāt

analyzed: avataranti sarvajña jñāna sāgaram

analyzed: uccalanti bāla pṛthagjana bhūmīḥ

analyzed: saṃpadyante tathāgata kule

analyzed: nivartante saṃsāra sāgara gati cakrāt

analyzed: āvartante bodhisattva caryā praṇidhāna cakram

analyzed: pramardayanti sarva māra maṇḍalam

analyzed: dyotayanti sarva buddha maṇḍala prabhavam

analyzed: śoṣayanti tṛṣṇā sāgaram

analyzed: vivardhayanti mahā karuṇā toyam

analyzed: pithanti sarva akṣaṇa apāya durgati vinipāta dvārāṇi

analyzed: vivṛścanti svarga nirvāṇa dvāram

analyzed: vinirbhindanti traidhātuka nagara kapāṭam

analyzed: vivṛṇvanti sarvajña tā pura dvāra kapāṭam

analyzed: vijahanti sarva upakaraṇa tṛṣṇām

analyzed: utpādayanti sarva jagat saṃgraha praṇidhim
translated: they generate the vow to gather all beings.

original: evamukte sāgaramegho bhikṣuḥ sudhanaṃ śreṣṭhidārakametadavocatsādhu sādhu kulaputra /
analyzed: evam ukte sāgarameghaḥ bhikṣuḥ sudhanam śreṣṭhi dārakam etat avocat sādhu sādhu kula putra
translated: When this was said, the monk Sāgaramegha said to the merchant's son Sudhana: Excellent, excellent!

analyzed: yat tvayā anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpāditam
translated: You have generated the mind set on unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

original: na hi kulaputra anavaropitakuśalamūlānāṃ sattvānāṃ bodhāya cittamutpadyate /
analyzed: na hi kula putra an avaropita kuśala mūlānām sattvānām bodhāya cittam utpadyate
translated: Noble sir, the mind set on awakening does not arise in beings who have not planted the roots of virtue.

original: samantamukhakuśalāvabhāsapratilabdhānāmupāyagarbhamārgasamādhijñānālokāvabhāsitānāṃ vipulapuṇyasāgarasaṃbhṛtasaṃbhārāṇāṃ sarvaśuklopacayāpratiprasrabdhānāṃ sarvakalyāṇamitropastabdhopāyāparikhinnānāṃ kāyajīvitanapekṣāṇāṃ sarvavastūdgrahavigatānāmanimnonnatapṛthivīsamacittānāmā prakṛtikṛpāsnehānugatānāṃ sarvabhavagatisaṃvāsābhimukhānāṃ tathāgataviṣayābhilāṣiṇāṃ sattvānāṃ bodhāya cittamutpadyate /🔽yaduta mahākaruṇācittaṃ sarvasattvaparitrāṇāya /
analyzed: samanta mukha kuśala avabhāsa pratilabdhānām upāya garbha mārga samādhi jñāna āloka avabhāsitānām vipula puṇya sāgara saṃbhṛta saṃbhārāṇām sarva śukla upacaya a pratiprasrabdhānām sarva kalyāṇa mitra upastabdha upāya a parikhinnānām kāya jīvita napekṣāṇām sarva vastu udgraha vigatānām animna unnata pṛthivī sama cittānām ā prakṛti kṛpā sneha anugatānām sarva bhava gati saṃvāsa abhimukhānām tathāgata viṣaya abhilāṣiṇām sattvānām bodh yat uta mahā karuṇā cittam sarva sattva paritrāṇāya
translated: It arises in beings who have obtained the light of the wholesome roots in all directions, who are illuminated by the light of the concentration and knowledge of the womb of skillful means, who have accumulated the provisions of vast oceans of merit, who are uninterrupted in increasing all that is wholesome, who are never tired of the skillful means of being supported by all spiritual friends, who are unconcerned with body and life, who are free from grasping at all things, whose minds are like the earth in being neither depressed nor elated, who are naturally compassionate and loving, who are intent on all the destinies of existence, and who long for the domain of the Tathāgatas.🔽Namely, the mind of great compassion, in order to deliver all beings.
The mind of great loving kindness, in order to be of equal benefit to the entire world.

analyzed: sukha cittam sarva jagat duḥkha skandha vyupaśamanāya
translated: The mind of happiness, in order to pacify the mass of suffering of the entire world.

analyzed: hita cittam sarva akuśala dharma vinivartana tāyai  dayā cittam sarva bhaya ārakṣāyai
translated: The mind of benefit, in order to turn away from all unwholesome dharmas.🔽The compassionate mind, in order to protect from all fears.

analyzed: asaṅga cittam sarva āvaraṇa vinivartana tāyai
translated: The unattached mind, in order to turn away from all obscurations.

analyzed: vipula cittam sarva dharmadhātu spharaṇa tāyai
translated: The vast mind, in order to pervade the entire dharma realm.

analyzed: ananta cittam ākāśa dhātu samavasaraṇa samatā anugamāya
translated: The infinite mind, in order to follow the equality of entering the space element.

analyzed: vimala cittam sarva tathāgata darśana vijñaptyai
translated: The pure mind, in order to perceive all tathagatas.

analyzed: viśuddha cittam tri adhva avaśeṣa jñāna spharaṇa tāyai
translated: The clear mind, in order to pervade the knowledge of the three times without remainder.

analyzed: jñāna cittam sarva āvaraṇa jñāna vinivartana tāyai sarvajña jñā sāgara avataraṇa tāyai
translated: The knowledge mind, in order to turn away from the knowledge of all obscurations and enter the ocean of omniscient knowledge.

original: ahaṃ kulaputra pūrṇāni dvādaśa varṣāṇi iha sāgaramukhe dikpratyuddeśe viharāmi imaṃ mahāsāgaramārambaṇīkṛtya āmukhīkṛtya /
analyzed: aham kula putra pūrṇāni dvādaśa varṣāṇi iha sāgara mukhe diś pratyuddeśe viharāmi imam mahā sāgaram ārambaṇīkṛtya ā mukhīkṛtya
translated: Son of noble family, for twelve years I have dwelt here at the entrance to the ocean, in the direction of the cardinal point, taking this great ocean as my object and making it manifest.

original: yaduta mahāsāgarasya vipulāpramāṇatāmanuvicintayan vimalaprasannatāṃ ca gambhīraduravagāhatāṃ ca anupūrvanimnasusthitāṃ ca anekaratnākaravicitratāṃ ca vāriskandhāpramāṇatāṃ ca acintyodāravarṇavimātratāṃ ca anantabhūtāṃ ca vicitrodārapraṇādhivāsanatāṃ ca mahāmeghapraticchannatāṃ ca antarāpurṇatāṃ ca anuvicintayan /
analyzed: yat uta mahā sāgarasya vipula apramāṇa tām anuvicintayan vimala prasanna tām ca gambhīra duravagāha tām ca anupūrva nimna susthitām ca aneka ratna ākara vicitra tām ca vāriskandha apramāṇa tām ca acintya udāra varṇa vimātra tām ca ananta bhūtām ca vicitra udāra praṇa adhivāsana tām ca mahā megha praticchanna tām ca antarāpurṇa tām ca anuvicintayan
translated: namely, contemplating the vast immeasurability of the great ocean, its clarity and purity, its depth and unfathomability, its gradual deepening, its variety as a source of many jewels, the immeasurability of its mass of water, its inconceivable and vast variety of colors, its endlessness, its ability to contain various vast and wonderful things, its being covered by great clouds, and its being filled in between.

original: tasya mama kulaputra evaṃ bhavatiasti na punaranyaḥ kaścidiha loke yo'smānmanāsāgarādvipulataraśca vistīrṇataraśca apramāṇataraśca gambhīrataraśca vicitrataraśca /
analyzed: tasya mama kula putraḥ evam bhavati asti na punar anyaḥ kaścid iha loke yaḥ smāt manā sāgarāt vipulataraḥ ca vistīrṇataraḥ ca apramāṇataraḥ ca gambhīrataraḥ ca vicitrataraḥ ca
translated: And I thought, There is no other thing in this world that is more vast, more extensive, more immeasurable, more deep, or more varied than this great ocean.

original: tasya mama kulaputra evaṃ yoniśaścintāmanasikāraprayuktasya mahāsāgarasyādhastānmahāpadmaṃ prādurabhūt /
analyzed: tasya mama kula putraḥ evam yoniśas cintā manasikāra prayuktasya mahā sāgarasya adhastāt mahā padmam prādurabhūt
translated: And, noble sir, as I applied myself to such proper reflection and attention, a great lotus appeared under the great ocean.

analyzed: aparājita maṇi ratna indranīla maṇi vajra daṇḍam mahā vaiḍūrya maṇi īratna avataṃsakam jāmbūnada suvarṇa vimala vipula patram kāla anusāri candana kalikā vyūham aśmagarbha ratna kesara upetam sāgara vipula vistīrṇa pramāṇam daśa asura indra śata sahasra saṃdhārita daṇḍa garbham daśa maṇi ratna śata sahasra vicitra ratna jāla saṃchannam daśa nāga indra śata sahasra gandhodaka megha abhipravarṣitam daśa garuḍa indra śata sahasra mukha pralambita pa
translated: with a handle of the most precious gems, such as the invincible gem, sapphire, diamond, and great lapis lazuli, with a crest jewel, with petals of pure and vast gold from the Jambū River, with a pericarp of black agarwood, with a pistil of jewels containing beryl, with a size vast and wide as the ocean, with a handle supported by a billion asura kings, covered with a net of a billion various precious gems, rained upon by clouds of fragrant water from a billion nāga kings, with a garland of jeweled necklaces hanging from the mouths of a billion garuḍa kings, gazed at with a kind mind by a billion kiṃnara kings, bowed to with the heads of a billion mahoraga kings, worshipped with the bowed bodies of a billion rākṣasa kings, praised with the songs and music of a billion gandharva kings, with clouds of a billion deva kings of divine flowers, incense, garlands, perfumes, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, banners, and flags,

original: tacca mahāpadmaṃ tathāgatalokottarakuśalamūlanirjātaṃ bodhisattvāśayaṃsaṃprasthitaṃ sarvadigabhimukhavijñapanaṃ mayāgatadharmaniryātaṃ nirāmagandhakarmasaṃbhutam araṇādharmatānayavyūhaṃ svapnasamadharmatāsamudācāram anabhisaṃskāradharmanayamudritam asaṅgadharmanayānugataṃ samantāddaśadikkuladharmadhātuspharaṇaṃ buddhaviṣayaprabhāvabhāsanākulam /
analyzed: tat ca mahāpadmam tathāgata lokottara kuśala mūla nirjātam bodhisattva āśayam saṃprasthitam sarva diś abhimukha vijñapanam mayā āgata dharma niryātam nirāma gandha karma saṃbhutam araṇā dharmatā naya vyūham svapna sama dharmatā samudācāram an abhisaṃskāra dharma naya mudritam asaṅga dharma naya anugatam samantāt daśa diś kula dharmadhātu spharaṇam buddha viṣaya prabhāva bhāsana ākulam
translated: That great lotus was born from the supramundane roots of virtue of the Tathāgata, was established in the intention of the bodhisattvas, was proclaimed in all directions, was produced from the Dharma that has come, was born from actions free from bad smells, was arrayed in the principle of the Dharma free from conflict, was the practice of the nature of phenomena that is like a dream, was sealed with the principle of the Dharma of non-origination, followed the principle of the Dharma of non-attachment, pervaded the entire Dharma-realm of the ten directions, and was filled with the radiance of the Buddha's domain.

analyzed: yasya na śakyam asaṃkhyeyaiḥ api kalpa śata sahasraiḥ ākāra guṇa saṃsthāna varṇa vyūha paryanta udhigantum
translated: Its form, qualities, composition, color, and array could not be fully comprehended even in countless hundreds of thousands of eons.

original: tacca mahāpadmaṃ tathāgatakāyaparyaṅkapariṣphuṭaṃ paripūrṇaṃ paśyāmi /🔽taṃ ca tathāgatakāyamita upādāya yāvadbhavāgraparamaṃ paśyāmi /
analyzed: tat ca mahāpadmam tathāgata kāya paryaṅka pariṣphuṭam paripūrṇam paśyāmi  tam ca tathāgata kāyam itas upādāya yāvat bhava agra paramam paśyāmi
translated: And I see that great lotus completely filled with the Tathāgata's body and sitting posture.🔽And I see that Tathāgata's body extending up to the peak of existence.

analyzed: tasya ca tathāgatasya acintyam āsana vyūham paśyāmi  acintya parṣad maṇḍala vyūhān
translated: And I see the inconceivable array of that Tathāgata's seat.🔽The inconceivable array of the circle of his assembly.

analyzed: acintiyān prabhā maṇḍala vyūhān
translated: The inconceivable array of his circle of light.

analyzed: acintyām lakṣaṇa saṃpadam acintyām anuvyañjana citra tām acintyām buddha vṛṣabhi tām
translated: the inconceivable perfection of characteristics, the inconceivable variety of minor marks, the inconceivable excellence of the Buddha,

analyzed: acintyam buddha vikurvitam
translated: the inconceivable miracles of the Buddha,

analyzed: acintyām tathāgata varṇa viśuddhim
translated: the inconceivable purity of the Tathāgata's complexion,

analyzed: acintyām avalokita mūrdhi tām
translated: the inconceivable looking over the head,

analyzed: acintyām prabhūta jihva tām paśyāmi
translated: I see the inconceivable abundance of tongues,

analyzed: acintyān buddha sarasvatī vyūhān śṛṇomi  acintyām bala apramāṇa tām
translated: I hear the inconceivable array of the Buddha's eloquence,🔽I follow the inconceivable purity of the immeasurables of strength,

analyzed: acintyām vaiśaradya vyūha viśuddhim
translated: the inconceivable purity of the array of fearlessness,

analyzed: acintyam pratisaṃvid bala abhinirhāram anugacchāmi
translated: I understand the inconceivable accomplishment of the power of analytical knowledge,

analyzed: acintyam pūrva bodhisattva caryā samudāgamam anusmarāmi
translated: I recollect the inconceivable completion of the practice of a bodhisattva in the past,

analyzed: acintyam abhisaṃbodhi vikurvitam paśyāmi
translated: I see the inconceivable miracle of perfect enlightenment,

analyzed: acintyam dharma megha abhinigarjitam
translated: I hear the inconceivable roaring of the Dharma clouds,

analyzed: acintyam samanta darśana vijñapti āśraya vyūham śṛṇomi  acintya apramāṇām vāma dakṣiṇena śarīra vibhaktim
translated: I hear the inconceivable array of the basis of omniscience that is seen everywhere,🔽I see the inconceivable measure of the differentiation of the body to the left and right,

analyzed: acintyam sattva artha kāya pariprāptim paśyāmi
translated: I see the inconceivable attainment of the body for the benefit of beings.

original: sa ca me tathāgato dakṣiṇaṃ pāṇiṃ prasārya śirasaṃ parimārjya samantanetraṃ nāma dharmaparyāyaṃ sarvatathāgataviṣayaṃ bodhisattvacaryāprabhāvanaṃ sarvadharmadhātutalaprabhedāvabhāsanaṃ sarvadharmamaṇḍalasamavasaraṇāvabhāsanaṃ sarvakṣetramaṇḍalākāraviśuddhyālokaṃ sarvaparapravādimaṇḍalavikiraṇaṃ sarvamārakalipramardanaṃ sarvasattvadhātusaṃtoṣaṇaṃ sarvasattvacittagahanāvabhāsanaṃ sarvasattvayathāśayavijñāpanaṃ sarvasattvendriyacakraparivartaprabhāsanaṃ prakāśayati /
analyzed: sa ca me tathāgataḥ dakṣiṇam pāṇim prasārya śirasam parimārjya samantanetram nāma dharmaparyāyam sarva tathāgata viṣayam bodhisattva caryā prabhāvanam sarva dharmadhātu tala prabheda avabhāsanam sarva dharma maṇḍala samavasaraṇa avabhāsanam sarva kṣetra maṇḍala ākāra viśuddhi ālokam sarva para pravādi maṇḍala vikiraṇam sarva māra kali pramardanam sarva sattva dhātu saṃtoṣaṇam sarva sattva citta gahana avabhāsanam sarva sattva yathāśaya vijñāpanam s
translated: That Tathagata extended his right hand and stroked my head, and then expounded a Dharma discourse called Samanta-netra, which is the domain of all Tathagatas, which proclaims the conduct of Bodhisattvas, which illuminates the distinctions in all Dharma realms, which illuminates the convergence of all Dharma circles, which illuminates the purity of the forms of all field circles, which scatters the circles of all opposing doctrines, which crushes the hordes of all Maras, which satisfies all realms of beings, which illuminates the depths of the minds of all beings, which makes known the aspirations of all beings, and which illuminates the turning of the wheel of faculties of all beings.

original: taṃ cāhaṃ samantanetraṃ dharmaparyāyamudgṛhṇāmi saṃdhārayāmi pravartayāmi puanidhyāyāmi evaṃrūpeṇodgaheṇa /🔽yasya likhyamānasya mahāsamudrāpskandhapramāṇā ca maṣiḥ /
analyzed: tam ca aham samantanetram dharmaparyāyam udgṛhṇāmi saṃdhārayāmi pravartayāmi evaṃrūpeṇa udgaheṇa  yasya likhyamānasya mahā samudra apskandha pramāṇā ca maṣiḥ
translated: I received and upheld that Dharma discourse called Samanta-netra, and I contemplated it with such an understanding.🔽As for the writing of that [Dharma discourse], the ink would be as vast as the waters of the great ocean,

analyzed: sumeru parvata rājamātra kalama saṃcayaḥ kṣayam vrajet
translated: and the collection of pens would be as large as Mount Sumeru, the king of mountains, and would be exhausted.

original: na ca tasya dharmaparyāyasya ekaikasmātparivartādekaikasmāddharmadvārākaikasmāddharmanayādekaikasmāddharmayoneḥ ekaikasmāddharmapadaprabhedāt kṣaya upalabhyate /
analyzed: na ca tasya dharmaparyāyasya ekaikasmāt parivartāt ekaikasmāt dharma dvārā kaikasmāt dharma nayāt ekaikasmāt dharma yoneḥ ekaikasmāt dharma pada prabhedāt kṣayaḥ upalabhyate
translated: “And I do not see any end to this Dharma discourse, to each chapter, to each Dharma gateway, to each Dharma method, to each source of the Dharma, or to each classification of words of the Dharma.

original: na ūnatvaṃ vā paryādānaṃ vā paryavasthānaṃ vā paryantaniṣṭhā vā //
analyzed: na ūna tvam vā paryādānam vā paryavasthānam vā paryanta niṣṭhā vā
translated: And I do not see any decrease, or diminution, or exhaustion, or end, or limit, of that Dharma discourse from each chapter, from each Dharma door, from each Dharma method, from each differentiation of Dharma words.

original: iti hi kulaputra pūrṇāni dvādaśa varṣāṇyahamimaṃ samantanetraṃ dharmaparyāyamudgṛhītavān /
analyzed: iti hi kula putra pūrṇāni dvādaśa varṣāṇi aham imam samantanetram dharmaparyāyam udgṛhītavān
translated: Thus, noble sir, for twelve years I have been upholding this Dharma discourse called The Eye of Dharma.

original: evaṃrūpeṇodgaheṇa yadekadivasena asaṃkhyeyan parivartān paryavāpnomi śrutodgahaṇadhāraṇyālokāvabhāsena /🔽asaṃkhyeyān parivartānavatarāmi śāntamukhadhāraṇyālokāvabhāsena /🔽asaṃkhyeyān parivartān avatarāmi śāntamukhadhāraṇyālokāvabhāsena /
analyzed: evaṃrūpeṇa udgaheṇa yat eka divasena asaṃkhyeyan parivartān paryavāpnomi śruta udgahaṇa dhāraṇī āloka avabhāsena  asaṃkhyeyān parivartān avatarāmi śānta mukha dhāraṇī āloka avabhāsena  asaṃkhyeyān parivartān avatarāmi śānta mukha dhāraṇī āloka avabhāsena
translated: With such an understanding, in one day I comprehend innumerable chapters through the illumination of the light of the retention dhāraṇī of hearing and retaining.🔽I enter into innumerable chapters through the illumination of the light of the retention dhāraṇī of the peaceful gateway.🔽I enter into innumerable chapters through the illumination of the light of the retention dhāraṇī of the peaceful gateway.

analyzed: asaṃkhyeyān parivartān samavasarāmi ananta āvarta dhāraṇī āloka avabhāsena
translated: I comprehend innumerable chapters through the illumination of the light of the retention dhāraṇī of endless cycles.

analyzed: asaṃkhyeyān parivartān vibhāvayāmi praticinomi bhūmi avacāraṇa anugama dhāraṇī āloka avabhāsena
translated: I illuminate countless cycles with the light of the dhāraṇī that follows the analysis of the earth.

analyzed: asaṃkhyeyān parivartān paryādadāmi tejovatī dhāraṇī āloka avabhāsena
translated: I comprehend countless cycles with the light of the dhāraṇī that has light.

original: asaṃkhyeyān parivartān abhinirharāmi padmavyūhadhāraṇyālokāvabhāsena /🔽asaṃkhyeyān parivartān saṃprakāśayāmi svaraviviktadhāraṇyālokāvabhāsena /
analyzed: asaṃkhyeyān parivartān abhinirharāmi padma vyūha dhāraṇī āloka avabhāsena  asaṃkhyeyān parivartān saṃprakāśayāmi svara vivikta dhāraṇī āloka avabhāsena
translated: I accomplish countless cycles with the light of the dhāraṇī that has the array of lotuses.🔽I make countless cycles resound with the light of the dhāraṇī that distinguishes sounds.

original: asaṃkhyeyān parivartān pratibhajāmi gaganagarbhadhāraṇyālokāvabhāsena /🔽asaṃkhyeyān parivartān pravistarāmi jyotiṣakūṭadhāraṇyālokāvabhāsena /
analyzed: asaṃkhyeyān parivartān pratibhajāmi gagana garbha dhāraṇī āloka avabhāsena  asaṃkhyeyān parivartān pravistarāmi jyotiṣakūṭa dhāraṇī āloka avabhāsena
translated: I distribute countless cycles with the light of the dhāraṇī that has the womb of space.🔽I expand countless cycles with the light of the dhāraṇī that has the peak of light.

analyzed: asaṃkhyeyān parivartān parisaṃsthāpayāmi sāgaragarbha dhāraṇī āloka avabhāsena
translated: I establish countless cycles with the light of the dhāraṇī that has the womb of the ocean.

original: ye ca me kecit sattvā upasaṃkrāmanti pūrvasyāṃ diśi devā vā devendrā vā nāgā vā nāgendrā vā yakṣā vā yakṣendrā vā asurā vā asurendrā vā garuḍā vā garuḍendrā vā mahoragā vā mahoragendrā vā manuṣyā vā manuṣyendrā vā brahmāṇo vā brahmendrā vā /
analyzed: ye ca me kecid sattvāḥ upasaṃkrāmanti pūrvasyām diśi devāḥ vā deva indrāḥ vā nāgāḥ vā nāga indrāḥ vā yakṣāḥ vā yakṣa indrāḥ vā asurāḥ vā asura indrāḥ vā garuḍāḥ vā garuḍa indrāḥ vā mahoragāḥ vā mahoraga indrāḥ vā manuṣyāḥ vā manuṣya indrāḥ vā brahmāṇaḥ vā brahma indrāḥ vā
translated: And whatever beings come to me from the east, whether gods, lords of gods, nāgas, lords of nāgas, yakṣas, lords of yakṣas, asuras, lords of asuras, garuḍas, lords of garuḍas, mahoragas, lords of mahoragas, humans, lords of humans, Brahmās, or lords of Brahmās,

original: tān sarvānatraiva samantanetre tathāgatabodhisattvacaryāvabhāse dharmaparyāye pratiṣṭhāpayāmi niveśayāmi /
analyzed: tān sarvān atra eva samantanetre tathāgata bodhisattva caryā avabhāse dharmaparyāye pratiṣṭhāpayāmi niveśayāmi
translated: I establish all of them in this very Dharma discourse called The Light of the Bodhisattva Conduct of the Tathāgata, the Universal Eye, and cause them to enter it.

original: sarveṣāṃ ca teṣāmeva samantanetraṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ rocayāmi nirūpayāmi paridīpayāmi saṃvarṇayāmi saṃdarśayāmi vibhajāmi vistārayāmi uttānīkaromi vivarāmi pramuñcāmi avabhāsayāmi /
analyzed: sarveṣām ca teṣām eva samantanetram dharmaparyāyam rocayāmi nirūpayāmi paridīpayāmi saṃvarṇayāmi saṃdarśayāmi vibhajāmi vistārayāmi uttānīkaromi vivarāmi pramuñcāmi avabhāsayāmi
translated: I delight in the Dharma discourse called The Universal Eye of all of them, I determine it, I illuminate it, I praise it, I reveal it, I analyze it, I explain it in detail, I make it clear, I open it up, I set it free, I illuminate it.

analyzed: yathā purvasyām diśi
translated: Just as in the east,

original: evaṃ dakṣiṇāyāḥ paścimāyā uttarāyā uttarapūrvāyāḥ purvadakṣiṇāyā dakṣiṇapaścimāyāḥ paścimottarāyā adha urdhvāyāśca diśaḥ ye kecit sattvā upasaṃkrāmantipūrvavat🔽etamahaṃ kulaputra /
analyzed: evam dakṣiṇāyāḥ paścimāyāḥ uttarāyāḥ uttara pūrvāyāḥ purva dakṣiṇāyāḥ dakṣiṇa paścimāyāḥ paścima uttarāyāḥ adhas urdhvāyāḥ ca diśaḥ ye kecid sattvāḥ upasaṃkrāmanti pūrvavat  etam aham kula putra
translated: In the same way, from the south, the west, the north, the northeast, the southeast, the southwest, the northwest, the nadir, and the zenith, whatever beings come, as before.

analyzed: ekam dharmaparyāyam jānāmi
translated: Son of noble family, I know this one Dharma discourse.

original: kiṃ mayā śakyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ caryā jñātuṃ guṇān vā vaktuṃ sarvabodhisattvacaryāsamudrāvatīrṇānāṃ pariśuddhapraṇidhyanugamena /
analyzed: kim mayā śakyam bodhisattvānām caryā jñātum guṇān vā vaktum sarva bodhisattva caryā samudra avatīrṇānām pariśuddha praṇidhi anugamena
translated: What is my ability to know the conduct of the bodhisattvas or to speak of their qualities? All bodhisattvas have entered the ocean of vows.

analyzed: sarva praṇidhāna sāgara avatīrṇānām sarva kalpa saṃvāsa vyavacchedāya  sarva sattva saṃsāra avatīrṇānām yathā āśaya caryā anuvartana tāyaiḥ sarva jagat citta sāgara avatīrṇānām ajñāna vijñaptyā
translated: They have entered the ocean of all aspirations in order to cut off dwelling in all kalpas.🔽They have entered the ocean of all beings' minds in order to follow the conduct according to their inclinations.

analyzed: sarva guṇa sāgara avatīrṇānām asaṅga daśa bala jñāna avaloka saṃjanana tāyai
translated: They have entered the ocean of all beings' minds in order to generate the unobstructed vision of the knowledge of the ten powers.

analyzed: sarva sattva indriya sāgara avatīrṇānām paripācana vinaya kāla an atikramaṇa tāyai
translated: They have entered the ocean of all beings' faculties in order not to transgress the time for ripening and guiding.

analyzed: sarva kṣetra sāgara avatīrṇānām sarva kṣetra viśuddhi praṇidhi abhinirhāreṇa
translated: those who have entered the ocean of all buddhafields, by the accomplishment of the vow to purify all buddhafields;

analyzed: sarva buddha sāgara avatīrṇānām tathāgata pūjā upasthāna praṇidhi balena
translated: those who have entered the ocean of all buddhas, by the power of the vow to worship and serve the tathagatas;

analyzed: sarva dharma sāgara avatīrṇānām jñāna vijñaptyā
translated: those who have entered the ocean of all dharmas, by the manifestation of knowledge;

analyzed: sarva guṇa sāgara avatīrṇānām pratipati anugamena
translated: those who have entered the ocean of all qualities, by following the practice;

analyzed: sarva jagat mantra sāgara avatīrṇānām sarva mantresu dharma cakra pravartana abhinirharaṇa tāyai
translated: those who have entered the ocean of all worldly mantras, in order to turn the wheel of the Dharma in all mantras.

analyzed: gaccha kula putra
translated: Go, son of noble family.

original: ayamihaiva dakṣiṇāpathe itaḥ ṣaṣṭiyojanaiḥ sāgaratīraṃ nāma laṅkāpatham /
analyzed: ayam iha eva dakṣiṇāpathe itas ṣaṣṭi yojanaiḥ sāgaratīram nāma laṅkāpatham
translated: Here, on the southern path, sixty yojanas from here, there is a place called Sagaratīra in the Laṅkā country.

analyzed: tatra supratisthitaḥ nāma bhikṣuḥ prativasati
translated: There lives a monk named Supratiṣṭhita.

original: tamupasaṃkramya paripṛccha kathaṃ bodhisattvena mahāsattvena bodhisattvacaryā pariśodhayitavyā //
analyzed: tam upasaṃkramya paripṛccha katham bodhisattvena mahāsattvena bodhisattva caryā pariśodhayitavyā
translated: Go to him and ask him how a bodhisattva mahāsattva should purify the practice of a bodhisattva.

original: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhidārakaḥ sāgarameghasya bhikṣoḥ pādau śirasābhivandya sāgarameghaṃ bhikṣumanekaśatasahasrakṛtvaḥ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya avalokya sāgarameghasya bhikṣorantikāt prakrāntaḥ // //
analyzed: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhi dārakaḥ sāgarameghasya bhikṣoḥ pādau śirasā abhivandya sāgaramegham bhikṣum aneka śata sahasra kṛtvas pradakṣiṇīkṛtya avalokya sāgarameghasya bhikṣoḥ antikāt prakrāntaḥ  /
translated: Then the merchant's son Sudhana bowed his head to the feet of the bhikṣu Sāgaramegha, circumambulated the bhikṣu Sāgaramegha many hundreds of thousands of times, observed him, and departed from the presence of the bhikṣu Sāgaramegha.

analyzed: su pratiṣṭhitaḥ
translated: Well-established.

original: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhidārakastāṃ kalyāṇamitrānuśāsanī taṃ ca samantanetraṃ dharmaparyāyamanusmaran /
analyzed: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhi dārakaḥ tām kalyāṇa mitra anuśāsanī tam ca samantanetram dharmaparyāyam anusmaran
translated: Then the merchant's son Sudhana, recollecting that instruction of the spiritual friend and that Dharma discourse called Universal Eye,

analyzed: tat ca tathāgata vikurvitam anuvicintayan  tān ca dharma pada vyañjana meghān dhārayan
translated: contemplating that miracle of the Tathāgata,🔽remembering those clouds of words and phrases of the Dharma,

analyzed: tān ca dharma mukha sāgarān avataran
translated: penetrating those oceans of Dharma doors,

analyzed: tam ca dharma vidhim anuvilokayan
translated: observing that Dharma method,

original: tāṃśca dharmāvartanayānavagāhyamānaḥ /🔽tacca dharmagaganaṃ samavasaran /🔽tacca dharmamaṇḍalaṃ pariśodhayan /
analyzed: tān ca dharma āvartanayā an avagāhyamānaḥ  tat ca dharma gaganam samavasaran  tat ca dharma maṇḍalam pariśodhayan
translated: engaging in those Dharma cycles,🔽contemplating that Dharma sky,🔽purifying that Dharma circle,

analyzed: tam ca dharmaratna dvīpam anuvicārayan
translated: examining that Dharma jewel island,

original: anupūrveṇa yena sāgaratīraṃ laṅkāpathastenopasaṃkramya pūrvāṃ diśamavalokayāmāsa supratiṣṭhitasya bhikṣordarśanakāmatayā /
analyzed: anupūrveṇa yena sāgara tīram laṅkā pathaḥ tena upasaṃkramya pūrvām diśam avalokayāmāsa su pratiṣṭhitasya bhikṣoḥ darśana kāma tayā
translated: In due course, he went to the shore of the ocean, to the path leading to Lanka, and looked to the east, desiring to see the monk Supratiṣṭhita.

original: evaṃ dakṣiṇāṃ paścimāmuttarāmuttarapūrvāṃ pūrvadakṣiṇāṃ dakṣiṇapaścimāṃ paścimottarāmadha ūrdhvāṃ diśamavalokayāmāsa supratiṣṭhitasya bhikṣordarśanakāmatayā
analyzed: evam dakṣiṇām paścimām uttarām uttara pūrvām pūrva dakṣiṇām dakṣiṇa paścimām paścima uttarām adhas ūrdhvām diśam avalokayāmāsa su pratiṣṭhitasya bhikṣoḥ darśana kāma tayā
translated: In the same way, he looked to the south, west, north, northeast, southeast, southwest, northwest, below, and above, desiring to see the monk Supratiṣṭhita.

analyzed: sā upaśyat supratiṣṭhitam bhikṣum gagana tale caṃkramyamāṇam asaṃkhyeya devatā śata sahasra parivṛtam
translated: He saw the monk Supratiṣṭhita walking in the sky, surrounded by an innumerable assembly of hundreds of thousands of gods.

analyzed: tat ca gagana talam divya puṣpa megha abhikīrṇam adrākṣīt asaṃkhyeya divya tūrya megha nirghoṣam
translated: He saw the sky covered with clouds of divine flowers, resounding with the sound of innumerable clouds of divine musical instruments,

analyzed: asaṃkhyeya paṭṭapatākā alaṃkāram deva indraiḥ su pratiṣṭhitasya bhikṣoḥ pūja karmaṇi
translated: and adorned with innumerable banners and flags, by the lords of the gods, in the act of worshipping the monk Supratiṣṭhita.

analyzed: acintya kālāguru megha unnata nigarjanam ca gagana talam apaśyat nāga indraiḥ
translated: He saw the sky with inconceivable clouds of thunder roaring high in the sky, by the lords of the nāgas.

analyzed: asaṃkhyeya divya manojña vacana upacāra stuti sarva vādya tūrya saṃgīti nirghoṣān ca kinnara indraiḥ saṃprayojitān gagana talāt aśrauṣīt
translated: He heard from the sky the sounds of all the musical instruments and songs of the lords of the kinnaras, which were accompanied by countless divine, pleasing words of praise.

original: acintyāṃśca sūkṣmasphuṭavastrameghān gaganatale prītimanobhirmahoragendraiḥ prahitān prasṛtānapaśyat supratiṣṭhitasya bhikṣoḥ spṛhamāṇarūpaiḥ🔽acintyāṃśca maṇiratnameghān asurendragaganatalamadhiṣṭhitān acintyaguṇavyūhāvabhāsamapaśyat /
analyzed: acintyān ca sūkṣma sphuṭa vastra meghān gagana tale prīti manobhiḥ mahā uraga indraiḥ prahitān prasṛtān apaśyat supratiṣṭhitasya bhikṣoḥ spṛhamāṇa rūpaiḥ  acintyān ca maṇi ratna meghān asura indra gagana talam adhiṣṭhitān acintya guṇa vyūha avabhāsam apaśyat
translated: He saw from the lords of the great serpents, with joyful minds, the clouds of subtle and clear garments spread out in the sky, which were sent forth by the bhikṣu Supratiṣṭhita, who was in the form of one who desires them.🔽He saw the clouds of inconceivable precious jewels, which were manifested in the sky by the lords of the asuras, shining with inconceivable arrays of good qualities.

analyzed: acintyān ca garuḍa indra gaṇān udāra mānava rūpa bala saṃsthānān garuḍa indra kanyā parivārān avihiṃsā paramān prāñjalībhūtān gagana tale paśyat
translated: He saw in the sky the inconceivable multitudes of the lords of the garuḍas, with their great and excellent forms, strength, and bodies, surrounded by the daughters of the lords of the garuḍas, with the highest non-violence, their palms joined.

original: acintyāni ca yakṣendraśatasahasrāṇi saparivārāṇi vikṛtaśarīrāṇi gaganatalagatānapaśyat supratiṣṭhitasya bhikṣormaitryādhipateyatayā /
analyzed: acintyāni ca yakṣa indra śata sahasrāṇi sa parivārāṇi vikṛta śarīrāṇi gagana tala gatān apaśyat supratiṣṭhitasya bhikṣoḥ maitrī ādhipateya tayā
translated: He saw in the sky the inconceivable hundreds of thousands of lords of the yakṣas with their retinues, with their bodies transformed, by the power of the loving kindness of the bhikṣu Supratiṣṭhita.

original: acintyāni ca rākṣasendraśatasahasrāṇi saparivārāṇi gaganatale anuparivartamānāni supratiṣṭhitasya bhikṣorārakṣāpratipannānyapaśyat /
analyzed: acintyāni ca rākṣasa indra śata sahasrāṇi sa parivārāṇi gagana tale anuparivartamānāni supratiṣṭhitasya bhikṣoḥ ārakṣā pratipannāni apaśyat
translated: He saw hundreds of thousands of inconceivable lords of the rākṣasas with their retinues flying through the sky, engaged in protecting the bhikṣu Supratiṣṭhita.

analyzed: acintyāni ca brahma indra śata sahasrāṇi gagana tale kṛta añjalipūṭāni abhipreta manojña vacana upacāra stuti pratyudāhāra prayuktāni apaśyat
translated: He saw hundreds of thousands of inconceivable lords of Brahmā, their palms placed together in reverence, speaking with pleasant voices, praising and welcoming him.

original: acintyāni ca śuddhāvāsakāyikadevatāśatasahasrāṇi gaganatale vimānagatānyapaśyat supratiṣṭhitasya bhikṣoḥ pūjākarmaṇi //
analyzed: acintyāni ca śuddhāvāsa kāyika devatā śata sahasrāṇi gagana tale vimāna gatāni apaśyat su pratiṣṭhitasya bhikṣoḥ pūjā karmaṇi
translated: He saw hundreds of thousands of inconceivable gods from the pure realms flying through the sky in their celestial palaces, engaged in making offerings to the bhikṣu Supratiṣṭhita.

original: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhidārakaḥ supratiṣṭhitaṃ bhikṣuṃ gaganatale caṃkramyamāṇaṃ dṛṣṭvā tuṣṭa udagra āttamanāḥ pramuditaḥ prītisaumanasyajātaḥ prāñjaliḥ supratiṣṭhitaṃ bhikṣuṃ namaskṛtya evamāhamayā ārya anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittamutpāditam /
analyzed: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhi dārakaḥ su pratiṣṭhitam bhikṣum gagana tale caṃkramyamāṇam dṛṣṭvā tuṣṭaḥ udagraḥ ātta manāḥ pramuditaḥ prīti saumanasya jātaḥ prāñjaliḥ su pratiṣṭhitam bhikṣum namaskṛtya evam āhamayā ārya anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpāditam
translated: Then the young man Sudhana, seeing the bhikṣu Supratiṣṭhita walking in the sky, became content, elated, joyful, delighted, pleased, and happy. With palms placed together, he bowed to the bhikṣu Supratiṣṭhita and said, Noble one, I have given rise to the mind set on unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: na ca jānāmikathaṃ bodhisattvena buddhadharmā anveṣṭavyāḥ /
analyzed: na ca jānāmi katham bodhisattvena buddha dharmāḥ anveṣṭavyāḥ
translated: But I do not know how bodhisattvas should seek the Buddha's teachings.

analyzed: katham bodhisattvena buddha dharmāḥ samudānayitavyāḥ
translated: How should the Buddha’s teachings be practiced by a bodhisattva?

original: kathaṃ bodhisattvena buddhadharmāḥ saṃhartavyāḥ /🔽kathaṃ bodhisattvena buddhadharmāḥ sevitavyāḥ /🔽kathaṃ bodhisattvena buddhadharmā bhāvayitavyāḥ /
analyzed: katham bodhisattvena buddha dharmāḥ saṃhartavyāḥ  katham bodhisattvena buddha dharmāḥ sevitavyāḥ  katham bodhisattvena buddha dharmāḥ bhāvayitavyāḥ
translated: How should the Buddha’s teachings be collected by a bodhisattva?🔽How should the Buddha’s teachings be attended to by a bodhisattva?🔽How should the Buddha’s teachings be cultivated by a bodhisattva?

original: kathaṃ bodhisattvena buddhadharmā anuvartitavyāḥ /🔽kathaṃ bodhisattvena buddhadharmāḥ paripiṇḍayitavyāḥ /
analyzed: katham bodhisattvena buddha dharmāḥ anuvartitavyāḥ  katham bodhisattvena buddha dharmāḥ paripiṇḍayitavyāḥ
translated: How should the Buddha’s teachings be followed by a bodhisattva?🔽How should the Buddha’s teachings be gathered together by a bodhisattva?

analyzed: katham bodhisattvena buddha dharmāḥ paribhāvayitavyāḥ
translated: How should the Buddha’s teachings be contemplated by a bodhisattva?

analyzed: katham bodhisattvena buddha dharmāḥ viśodhayitavyāḥ sarva bodhisattva kārya pariprāpaṇāya
translated: How should the Buddha’s teachings be purified by a bodhisattva in order to attain all the goals of a bodhisattva?

analyzed: katham bodhisattvena buddha dharmāḥ anugantavyāḥ
translated: How should the Buddha’s teachings be understood by a bodhisattva?

original: śrutaṃ ca ma āryo bodhisattvānāmavādānuśāsanīṃ dadātīti /
analyzed: śrutam ca me āryaḥ bodhisattvānām avāda anuśāsanīm dadāti iti
translated: I have heard, noble sir, that you give instructions to bodhisattvas.

original: tadvadatu me āryaḥkathaṃ bodhisattvena buddhadharmeṣu prayoktavyam /
analyzed: tat vadatu me āryaḥ katham bodhisattvena buddha dharmeṣu prayoktavyam
translated: Please tell me, noble sir, how a bodhisattva should practice in regard to the Buddha’s teachings.

analyzed: yathā prayujyamānaḥ virahitaḥ bhavati buddha darśanena
translated: How should one practice so as to be inseparable from seeing the Buddha?

analyzed: yathā bhūta vipravāsāya avirahitaḥ bhavati bodhisattva darśanena
translated: He is never separated from seeing the bodhisattvas, in order to be in the presence of the real thing.

analyzed: sarva bodhisattva kuśala mūla eka dhyātāyai avirahitaḥ bhavati buddha dharmaiḥ
translated: He is never separated from the qualities of the Buddha, in order to contemplate the roots of virtue of all bodhisattvas as one.

analyzed: jñāna anuga māyā virahitaḥ bhavati sarva bodhisattva praṇidhānaiḥ
translated: He is never separated from the realization of knowledge, in order to attain all the bodhisattva vows.

original: sarvabodhisattvakāryapariprāpaṇāya avirahito bhavati bodhisattvacaryayā /🔽sarvakalpasaṃvāsāparikhedatāyai avirahito bhavati sarvabuddhakṣetraspharaṇena /
analyzed: sarva bodhisattva kārya pariprāpaṇāya avirahitaḥ bhavati bodhisattva caryayā  sarva kalpa saṃvāsa a parikheda tāyai avirahitaḥ bhavati sarva buddhakṣetra spharaṇena
translated: He is never separated from bodhisattva conduct, in order to accomplish all the activities of the bodhisattvas.🔽He is never separated from pervading all buddha-fields, in order to not be weary of dwelling in all kalpas.

analyzed: sarva lokadhātu pariśuddhaye avirahitaḥ bhavati buddha vikurvita darśanena
translated: He is never separated from seeing the miracles of the Buddha, in order to purify all world systems.

analyzed: sarva tathāgata vikurvita vijñaptyai avirahitaḥ bhavati saṃskṛta āvāsena
translated: He is never separated from the manifestation of the miracles of all tathagatas, in order to not dwell in the conditioned.

analyzed: nirmita upama bodhisattva caryāyāḥ sarva bhava gati cyuti upapatti āyatana sva śarīra anugamana tāyai avirahitaḥ bhavati dharma śravaṇena
translated: He is never separated from hearing the Dharma, in order to follow with his own body all the realms of existence, deaths, births, and rebirths of the bodhisattva conduct that is like a magical creation.

analyzed: sarva tathāgata dharmamegha saṃpratīcchana tāyai avirahitaḥ bhavati jñāna ālokena tri adhva jñāna anugama anusaraṇa tāyai
translated: He is never separated from the light of wisdom in order to receive the clouds of the Dharma of all the tathāgatas, and he follows and practices the knowledge of the three times.”

original: evamukte supratiṣṭhito bhikṣuḥ sudhanaṃ śreṣṭhidārakametadavocatsādhu sādhu kulaputra /
analyzed: evam ukte supratiṣṭhitaḥ bhikṣuḥ sudhanam śreṣṭhi dārakam etat avocat sādhu sādhu kula putra
translated: When this was said, the bhikṣu Supratiṣṭhita said to the merchant’s son Sudhana, “It is excellent, excellent, noble one,

original: yastvamanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittamutpādya buddhadharmān sarvajñatādharmān svayaṃbhūdharmān paripṛcchasi /
analyzed: yaḥ tvam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpādya buddha dharmān sarvajña tā dharmān svayaṃbhū dharmān paripṛcchasi
translated: that you have generated the mind set on unsurpassed and perfect awakening and are asking about the qualities of the buddhas, the qualities of omniscience, and the qualities of self-awakening.

analyzed: aham kula putra asaṅga mukhasya bodhisattva vimokṣasya lābhī
translated: Noble one, I have attained the bodhisattva liberation called ‘the unobstructed gate.’

original: etaṃ me kulaputra asaṅgamukhaṃ bodhisattvavimokṣamāyūhatā niryūhatā anusaratā vibhajatā vicinvatā pravicinvatā pratibhāsayatā prabhāsayatā asaṅgakoṭirnāma jñānālokaḥ pratilabdhaḥ /🔽yasya pratilambhānnāsti me sarvasattvacittacaritāvabhāseṣu saṅgaḥ /
analyzed: etam me kula putra asaṅga mukham bodhisattva vimokṣam āyūhatā niryūhatā anusaratā vibhajatā vicinvatā pravicinvatā pratibhāsayatā prabhāsayatā asaṅga koṭiḥ nāma jñāna ālokaḥ pratilabdhaḥ  yasya pratilambhāt na asti me sarva sattva citta carita avabhāseṣu saṅgaḥ
translated: Noble one, as I have been gathering, spreading, following, analyzing, distinguishing, investigating, and illuminating this bodhisattva liberation called ‘the unobstructed gate,’ I have attained the light of wisdom called ‘the limitless apex,’🔽by attaining which I have no obstruction in illuminating the mental activities of all beings.

analyzed: na asti sarva sattva cyuti upapatti parijñāsu saṅgaḥ
translated: I have no obstruction in fully knowing the deaths and rebirths of all beings.

analyzed: na asti pūrva nivāsa anusmṛti mukha avatāreṣu saṅgaḥ
translated: There is no attachment to the doors of entry into the recollection of past abodes.

analyzed: na asti aparānta kalpa sarva jagat saṃvāseṣu saṅgaḥ  na asti pratyutpanna adhva sarva jagat vijñaptiṣu saṅgaḥ
translated: There is no attachment to the association with all beings in the future.🔽There is no attachment to the communication with all beings in the present.

analyzed: na asti sarva sattva ruta mantra saṃvṛti parijñāneṣu saṅgaḥ
translated: There is no attachment to the knowledge of the language, speech, and conventions of all beings.

analyzed: na asti sarva sattva saṃśaya chedeṣu saṅgaḥ
translated: There is no attachment to the cutting off of the doubts of all beings.

analyzed: na asti rātriṃdiva kṣaṇa muhūrta kāla saṃjñā gata avatāreṣu saṅgaḥ
translated: There is no attachment to the entry into the perception of the divisions of day and night.

analyzed: na asti daśa diś buddhakṣetresu aśarīra spharaṇa tāsu saṅgaḥ
translated: There is no attachment to the pervasion of the buddhafields in the ten directions with the body.

analyzed: yat uta abhāva pratiṣṭhita an abhisaṃskāra vipratilambhena
translated: That is to say, by the attainment of non-abiding in non-existence and non-performance.

original: asyāhaṃ kulaputra anabhisaṃskārikāyā ṛddheranubhāvena iha gaganatale caṃkramāmi /
analyzed: asya aham kula putra an abhisaṃskārikāyāḥ ṛddheḥ anubhāvena iha gagana tale caṃkramāmi
translated: Son of noble family, by the power of this non-performance of miracles, I walk, stand, sit, and lie down in this sky.🔽I stand.

analyzed: tiṣṭhāmi  niṣīdāmi
translated: I sit.

analyzed: niṣadyāmi
translated: I lie down.

analyzed: vividhān īryāpathān kalpayāmi
translated: I assume various postures.

analyzed: prādurbhavāmi
translated: I disappear and reappear.

analyzed: dhūmāyāmi prajvalāmi  ekaḥ bhūtvā bahudhā bhavāmi
translated: I emit smoke and flames.🔽Having been one, I become many.

analyzed: bahudhā bhūtvā ekaḥ bhavāmi
translated: Having been many, I become one.

analyzed: āvirbhāvam tirobhāvam pratyanubhavāmi
translated: I manifest and disappear.

original: tiraḥkuḍyaṃ tiraḥprākāramasajjan gacchāmi tadyathāpi nāma ākāśe /
analyzed: tiras kuḍyam tiras prākāram a sajjan gacchāmi tat yathā api nāma ākāśe
translated: I go unimpeded through walls, through ramparts, and through mountains, just as through space.

original: ākāśe'pi paryaṅkena kramāmi tadyathāpi nāma pakṣī śakuniḥ /🔽pṛthivyāmapi unmajjananimajjanaṃ karomi tadyathodake /
analyzed: ākāśe pi paryaṅkena kramāmi tat yathā api nāma pakṣī śakuniḥ  pṛthivyām api unmajjana nimajjanam karomi tat yathā udake
translated: I travel through space cross-legged, just as a bird does on the wing.🔽I dive in and out of the earth as if it were water.

analyzed: udake ipi a sajjamānaḥ gacchāmi tat yathā pṛthivyām
translated: I walk on water without sinking as if it were dry land.

analyzed: dhūmāyāmi prajvalāmi tat yathā api nāma mahān agni skandhaḥ
translated: I emit smoke and flames like a great bonfire.

analyzed: pṛthivīm api kampayāmi
translated: I shake the whole earth with its mountains and forests.

original: imāvapi candrasūryau evaṃ maharddhikau evaṃ mahānubhāvau evaṃ mahaujasvinau pāṇinā saṃparimārjayāmi /
analyzed: imau api candra sūryau evam maharddhikau evam mahā anubhāvau evam mahā ojasvinau pāṇinā saṃparimārjayāmi
translated: I touch and stroke with my hand even the sun and moon, so mighty and powerful.

analyzed: yāvadbrahmalokam kāye ca saṃvartayāmi

original: samanantarasamāpannasya ca muktakasya śreṣṭhinastathārūpā kāyapariśuddhiḥ saṃsthitā yayā kāyapariśuddhayā daśasu dikṣu daśabuddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamā buddhā bhagavantaḥ saha buddhakṣetrapariśuddhayā saparṣanmaṇḍalāḥ saha prabhāviśuddhayā sapūrvacaryāsaṃvāsāḥ sabuddhavikurvitāḥ sapraṇidhānasaṃbhārāḥ sahacaryāniryāṇavyūhaviśuddhayā sābhisaṃbodhisaṃdarśanāḥ sahadharmacakroddayotanāḥ sasattvaparipākāḥ sadharmaniṣṭhāparyantāḥ sarvakāye'ntargatāḥ anupraviṣṭāḥ saṃdṛśyante sma /
analyzed: samanantara samāpannasya ca muktakasya śreṣṭhinaḥ tathārūpā kāya pariśuddhiḥ saṃsthitā yayā kāya pariśuddhayā daśasu dikṣu daśa buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samāḥ buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ saha buddhakṣetra pariśuddhayā sa parṣad maṇḍalāḥ saha prabhā viśuddhayā sa pūrva caryā saṃvāsāḥ sa buddha vikurvitāḥ sa praṇidhāna saṃbhārāḥ saha caryā niryāṇa vyūha viśuddhayā sa abhisaṃbodhi saṃdarśanāḥ saha dharma cakra uddayotanā
translated: As soon as Muktaka the guild president entered this meditative absorption, his body became purified in such a way that the blessed buddhas in the ten directions, as numerous as the atoms in ten buddha-fields, together with their buddha-fields, their circles of followers, their pure lights, their previous conduct, their shared experiences, their miraculous manifestations, their accumulations of aspirations, their emanations, their arrays of purification, and their displays of full enlightenment and turning the wheel of Dharma, together with their development of sentient beings and their final nirvāṇa, all became visible within his body.

original: anyonyāsaṃbhinnā anyonyānāvaraṇā anyonyasuvibhaktā anyonyasuvyavasthitanānākalpasaṃsthānā yathāvadvijñaptā nānābuddhakṣetravyūhāḥ nānābodhisattvaparṣanmaṇḍalālaṃkārā nānābuddhavikurvitaṃ saṃdarśayantaḥ saṃdṛśyante sma /
analyzed: anyonya a saṃbhinnāḥ anyonya an āvaraṇāḥ anyonya su vibhaktāḥ anyonya su vyavasthita nānā kalpa saṃsthānāḥ yathāvat vijñaptāḥ nānā buddhakṣetra vyūhāḥ nānā bodhisattva parṣad maṇḍala alaṃkārāḥ nānā buddha vikurvitam saṃdarśayantaḥ saṃdṛśyante sma
translated: They were seen to be mutually unmixed, mutually unobstructed, mutually well-differentiated, mutually well-established in various world systems, well-known in their respective ways, with various arrays of buddha-fields, various adornments of circles of bodhisattvas, and various miraculous manifestations of buddhas.

analyzed: nānā yāna naya vyavasthānāḥ nānā praṇidhāna mukha paridīpanāḥ kvacid lokadhātau tuṣita bhavana upapannāḥ saṃdṛśyante
translated: In some world systems, they are seen to be born in the Tusita heaven, establishing the systems of various vehicles and illuminating various vows.

original: sarvabuddhakāryaṃ kurvantaḥ kvacittuṣitabhavanāccyavamānāḥ /🔽kvacinmātuḥ kukṣigatāḥ vividhavikurvitāni saṃdarśayantaḥ /
analyzed: sarva buddha kāryam kurvantaḥ kvacid tuṣita bhavanāt cyavamānāḥ  kvacid mātuḥ kukṣi gatāḥ vividha vikurvitāni saṃdarśayantaḥ
translated: Performing all the deeds of a Buddha, in some places they are seen to be passing away from the Tusita heaven.🔽In some places, they are seen in their mother's womb, displaying various transformations.

analyzed: kvacid jāyamānāḥ bāla krīḍām upadarśayantaḥ
translated: In some places, they are seen to be born, displaying the play of children.

analyzed: kvacid antaḥpura madhya gatāḥ
translated: In some places, they are seen in the inner palace.

analyzed: kvacid abhiniṣkrāmantaḥ kvacid bodhimaṇḍa vara gatāḥ mahā vyūha vikurvita māra sainya parājayam kurvantaḥ saṃdṛśyante
translated: In some places, they are seen to be leaving home, in some places to have attained the supreme seat of enlightenment, and to be defeating the army of the demon Mara with great displays of transformation.

analyzed: kvacid deva nāga yakṣa gandharva parivṛtāḥ brahma indraiḥ dharmacakra pravartanāya adhyeṣyamāṇāḥ
translated: In some places, they are seen surrounded by gods, nagas, yakshas, and gandharvas, being requested by Brahma and Indra to turn the wheel of the Dharma.

analyzed: kvacid dharmacakram pravartayantaḥ kvacid sarva sattva bhavana gatāḥ kvacid parinirvāyamāṇāḥ saṃdṛśyante
translated: In some places, they are seen turning the wheel of the Dharma, in some places going to the abodes of all beings, and in some places they are seen to be attaining final nirvana.

analyzed: kvacid lokadhātau tathāgatānām parinirvṛtānām dhātu vibhaṅgāḥ saṃdṛśyante
translated: In some world systems, the distribution of the relics of Tathagatas who have attained final nirvana is seen.

analyzed: kvacid buddhakṣetra deva manuṣyāḥ tathāgata caityāni alaṃkurvantaḥ saṃdṛśyante
translated: In some places, gods and humans in buddha-fields are seen adorning stūpas of the Tathāgata.

original: yacca te buddhā bhagavanto bhāṣante nānāsattvanikāyeṣu nānāsattvalokeṣu nānāsattvagatiṣu nānāsattvopapattiṣu nānāsattvasaṃnipāteṣu nānāsattvakuśalamūlaparivarteṣu nānāsattvagatiparivarteṣu nānāsattvāśayaparivarteṣu nānāsattvādhimuktiparivarteṣu nānāsattvendriyaparivarteṣu nānākālaparivarteṣu nānāsattvakarmasaṃbhedeṣu nānāsattvakarmavimātratāsu nānāsattvalokavibhāvanāsu nānāgaticaryāvicariteṣu sattvanayeṣu nānāśayaprayogeṣu sattvasamudreṣu nānendriyavimātratāviśuddheṣu nānākleśavāsanānuśayiteṣu sattvaprasareṣu vividhabuddhivikurvitasaṃdarśanairnānāniruktibhirnānāsvarāṅgarutanirhārairnānāsūtrāntanayodāhārairnānādhāraṇīmukhaparivartairnānāpratisaṃvinnayaprabhavairnānāsatyanāmasamudraparivartaiḥ nānābuddharṣabhasiṃhanādanaiḥ nānāsattvakuśalamūladeśanāprātihāryasaṃdarśanaiḥ nānāmukhasmṛtinidarśanavikurvitaiḥ nānābodhisattvavyākaraṇasiṃhanādaiḥ nānātathāgatadharmacakravijṛmbhitaiḥ anantamadhyeṣu parṣanmaṇḍaleṣu anantasaṃbhedeṣvanyonyārambaṇeṣu nānāviśuddhaparṣanmaṇḍaleṣu vipuleṣu sūkṣmaparṣanmaṇḍalasamavasaraṇeṣu yojanapramāṇeṣu daśayojanapramāṇeṣu yāvadanabhilāpyabuddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamalokadhātupramāṇeṣu parṣanmaṇḍaleṣu yatte buddhā bhagavanto dharmaṃ bhāṣante sarvasvarāṅgarutaghoṣānugāminyā tathāgatavācā /
analyzed: yat ca te buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ bhāṣante nānā sattva nikāyeṣu nānā sattva lokeṣu nānā sattva gatiṣu nānā sattva upapattiṣu nānā sattva saṃnipāteṣu nānā sattva kuśala mūla parivarteṣu nānā sattva gati parivarteṣu nānā sattva āśaya parivarteṣu nānā sattva adhimukti parivarteṣu nānā sattva indriya parivarteṣu nānā kāla parivarteṣu nānā sattva karma saṃbhedeṣu nānā sattva karma vimātra tāsu nānā sattva loka vibhāvanāsu nānā gati caryā
translated: And whatever those Buddha Bhagavans teach in the various realms of beings, in the various worlds of beings, in the various destinies of beings, in the various births of beings, in the various assemblies of beings, in the various transformations of beings' roots of virtue, in the various transformations of beings' destinies, in the various transformations of beings' intentions, in the various transformations of beings' aspirations, in the various transformations of beings' faculties, in the various transformations of time, in the various mixtures of beings' karma, in the various varieties of beings' karma, in the various manifestations of beings' worlds, in the various wanderings through destinies and conduct of beings' ways, in the various oceans of beings' intentions and practices, in the various purities of the varieties of beings' faculties, in the various latent tendencies of beings' afflictions, in the various proliferations of beings, with various displays of miraculous powers of wisdom, with various etymologies, with various accomplishments of the sounds of the components of speech, with various presentations of the way of the sūtras, with various turns of the doorways of dhāraṇīs, with various origins of the way of the analytical knowledges, with various turns of the ocean of the names of the truths,

original: taṃ sarvaṃ sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhidārakaḥ śṛṇoti udgṛhṇāti saṃdhārayati pravartayati upanidhyāyati /
analyzed: tam sarvam sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhi dārakaḥ śṛṇoti udgṛhṇāti saṃdhārayati pravartayati upanidhyāyati
translated: The merchant’s son Sudhana heard all of that, received it, remembered it, put it into practice, contemplated it, and meditated on it.

analyzed: tat ca vikurvitam paśyati
translated: He saw that miracle

analyzed: tām ca acintyām bodhisattva samādhi vṛṣabhi tām
translated: and that inconceivable mastery of the bodhisattvas’ samādhis.

original: atha khalu muktakaḥ śreṣṭhī smṛtaḥ saṃprajānaṃstasmātsamādhervyūtthāya sudhanaṃ śreṣṭhidārakametadavocatahaṃ kulaputra asaṅgavyūhaṃ nāma tathāgatavimokṣamāyūhāmi niryūhāmi /
analyzed: atha khalu muktakaḥ śreṣṭhī smṛtaḥ saṃprajānan tasmāt samādheḥ vyūtthāya sudhanam śreṣṭhi dārakam etat avocata ham kula putra asaṅga vyūham nāma tathāgata vimokṣam āyūhāmi niryūhāmi
translated: Then the merchant Muktaka, mindful and fully aware, rose from that samādhi and said to the merchant’s son Sudhana, “Noble one, I have attained and realized a tathāgata’s liberation called the unattached array.

original: tasya me kulaputra asaṅgavyūhaṃ tathāgatavimokṣamāyūhato niryūhataḥ pūrvasyāṃ diśi jāmbūnadaprabhāsavatyāṃ lokadhātau tāreśvararājo nāma tathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sārdhaṃ vairocanagarbhabodhisattvapramukhena sarvabodhisattvaparṣanmaṇḍalena cakṣuṣa ābhāsamāgacchati /
analyzed: tasya me kula putra asaṅga vyūham tathāgata vimokṣam āyūhataḥ niryūhataḥ pūrvasyām diśi jāmbūnadaprabhāsavatyām lokadhātau tāreśvararājaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sārdham vairocanagarbha bodhisattva pramukhena sarva bodhisattva parṣad maṇḍalena cakṣuṣaḥ ābhāsam āgacchati
translated: “Noble one, when I attain and realize the tathāgata’s liberation called the unattached array, in the eastern direction, in the world realm named Jāmbūnada Prabhāvatī, the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha named Tārīśvararāja, together with the entire assembly of bodhisattvas headed by the bodhisattva Vairocana­garbha, appears to my eyes.

original: dakṣiṇāyāṃ diśi sarvabalavegavatyāṃ lokadhātau samantagandhavitāno nāma tathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sārdhaṃ cintārājabodhisattvapramukhena sarvabodhisattvaparṣanmaṇḍalena cakṣuṣa ābhāsamāgacchati /🔽paścimāyāṃ diśi sarvagandhaprabhāsavatyāṃ lokadhātau merupradīparājo nāma tathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sārdhamasaṅgacittabodhisattvapramukhena sarvabodhisattvaparṣanmaṇḍalena cakṣuṣa ābhāsamāgacchati /
analyzed: dakṣiṇāyām diśi sarvabalavegavatyām lokadhātau samantagandhavitānaḥ nāma tathāgata ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sārdham cintārāja bodhisattva pramukhena sarva bodhisattva parṣad maṇḍalena cakṣuṣaḥ ābhāsam āgacchati  paścimāyām diśi sarvagandhaprabhāsavatyām lokadhātau merupradīparājaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sārdham asaṅgacitta bodhisattva pramukhena sarva bodhisattva parṣad maṇḍalena cakṣuṣaḥ ābhāsam āgacchati
translated: In the southern direction, in the world system called Endowed with All Strength and Speed, the Tathagata named Universal Fragrant Canopy, a Worthy One, a Perfectly Enlightened One, together with the entire assembly of Bodhisattvas headed by the Bodhisattva Mind of Courage, appeared in the vision of the eye.🔽In the western direction, in the world system called Endowed with All Fragrant Lights, the Tathagata named Meru Lamp King, a Worthy One, a Perfectly Enlightened One, together with the entire assembly of Bodhisattvas headed by the Bodhisattva Unimpeded Mind, appeared in the vision of the eye.

original: uttarāyāṃ diśi kāṣāyadhvajāyāṃ lokadhātau vajrapramardano nāma tathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sārdhaṃ vajrapadavikrāmibodhisattvapramukhena sarvabodhisattvaparṣanmaṇḍalena cakṣuṣaābhāsamāgacchati /
analyzed: uttarāyām diśi kāṣāyadhvajāyām lokadhātau vajrapramardanaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sārdham vajrapada vikrāmi bodhisattva pramukhena sarva bodhisattva parṣad maṇḍalena cakṣuṣa ābhāsam āgacchati
translated: In the northern direction, in the world system called Banner of Saffron Robes, the Tathagata named Vajra Crusher, a Worthy One, a Perfectly Enlightened One, together with the entire assembly of Bodhisattvas headed by the Bodhisattva Vajra Step, appeared in the vision of the eye.

original: uttarapūrvāyāṃ diśi sarvaratnarucirāyāṃ lokadhātau anilambhacakṣurvairocano nāma tathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sārdhamanilambhasunirmitabodhisattvapūrvaṃgamena sarvabodhisattvaparṣanmaṇḍalena cakṣuṣa ābhāsamāgacchati /🔽pūrvadakṣiṇāyāṃ diśi gandhārciḥprabhāsvarāyāṃ lokadhātau gandhapradīpo nāma tathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sārdhaṃ sarvadharmadhātutalabhedaketurājabodhisattvapūrvaṃgamena bodhisattvaparṣanmaṇḍalena cakṣuṣa ābhāsamāgacchati /
analyzed: uttara pūrvāyām diśi sarva ratna rucirāyām lokadhātau anilambhacakṣuḥ vairocanaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sārdham anilambhasunirmita bodhisattva pūrvaṃgamena sarva bodhisattva parṣad maṇḍalena cakṣuṣaḥ ābhāsam āgacchati  pūrva dakṣiṇāyām diśi gandha arciḥ prabhāsvarāyām lokadhātau gandhapradīpaḥ nāma tathāgata ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sārdham sarva dharmadhātu talabheda ketu rāja bodhisattva pūrvaṃgamena bodhisattva parṣad maṇḍalena cakṣuṣaḥ ābhāsam āgacchati
translated: In the northeast direction, in the world system called Adorned with All Jewels, the Tathāgata named Animbhachakshu Vairocana, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, together with the entire assembly of Bodhisattvas headed by the Bodhisattva Animbha Sunirmita, appeared within the range of sight.🔽In the southeast direction, in the world system called Gandharciḥprabhāsvārā, the Tathāgata named Gandhapradīpa, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, together with the entire assembly of Bodhisattvas headed by the Bodhisattva Sarvadharma-dhātu-talabha-dhekarāja, appeared within the range of sight.

original: dakṣiṇapaścimāyāṃ diśi sūryakesaranirbhāsāyāṃ lokadhātau samantamukhajñānavirocanaghoṣo nāma tathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sārdhaṃ samantakusumārciḥpralambacūḍabodhisattvapūrvaṃgamena sarvabodhisattvaparṣanmaṇḍalena cakṣuṣa ābhāsamāgacchati /
analyzed: dakṣiṇa paścimāyām diśi sūrya kesara nirbhāsāyām lokadhātau samantamukhajñānavirocanaghoṣaḥ nāma tathāgata ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sārdham samanta kusuma arciḥ pralamba cūḍa bodhisattva pūrvaṃgamena sarva bodhisattva parṣad maṇḍalena cakṣuṣaḥ ābhāsam āgacchati
translated: In the southwest direction, in the world system called Sūryakesarinirbhāsā, the Tathāgata named Samantamukha-jñāna-virocana-ghosha, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, together with the entire assembly of Bodhisattvas headed by the Bodhisattva Samanta-kusuma-arciḥ-pramlamba-cūḍa, appeared within the range of sight.

original: paścimottarāyāṃ diśi gandhālaṃkāraruciraśubhagarbhāyāṃ lokadhātāvapramāṇaguṇasāgaraprabho nāma tathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sārdhamasaṅgakāyaraśmitejomatibodhisattvapūrvaṃgamena sarvabodhisattvaparṣanmaṇḍalena cakṣuṣa ābhāsamāgacchati /
analyzed: paścima uttarāyām diśi gandha alaṃkāra rucira śubha garbhāyām lokadhātau apramāṇaguṇasāgaraprabhaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ urhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sārdham asaṅga kāya raśmi tejaḥ mati bodhisattva pūrvaṃgamena sarva bodhisattva parṣad maṇḍalena cakṣuṣaḥ ābhāsam āgacchati
translated: In the northwest, in the world system called Womb of Beautiful Adornments with Fragrances, the Tathagata Arhat Samyaksambuddha named Ocean of Immeasurable Qualities appeared, together with the entire assembly of Bodhisattvas headed by the Bodhisattva Asangakaya-rashitajomati.

original: aghodiśi ratnasiṃhāvabhāsajvalanāyāṃ lokadhātau dharmadhātuvidyotitaraśmirnām tathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sārdhaṃ dharmadhātvarcirvairocanasaṃbhavamatibodhisattvapūrvaṃgamena sarvabodhisattvaparṣanmaṇḍalena cakṣuṣa ābhāsamāgacchati /
analyzed: aghas diśi ratnasiṃha avabhāsa jvalanāyām lokadhātau dharmadhātu vidyotitaraśmiḥ nām tathāgata urhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sārdham dharmadhātu arciḥ vairocana saṃbhava mati bodhisattva pūrvaṃgamena sarva bodhisattva parṣad maṇḍalena cakṣuṣaḥ ābhāsam āgacchati
translated: In the nadir, in the world system called Blazing Light of Jewel Lions, the Tathagata Arhat Samyaksambuddha named Light Rays Illuminating the Dharma Realm appeared, together with the entire assembly of Bodhisattvas headed by the Bodhisattva Arisen from the Radiance of the Dharma Realm.

original: ūrdhvāyāṃ diśi lakṣaṇaruciravairocanāyāṃ lokadhātāvapratihataguṇakīrtivimokṣaprabharājo nāma tathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sārdhamasaṅgabalavīryamatibodhisattvapūrvaṃgamena sarvabodhisattvaparṣanmaṇḍalena cakṣuṣa ābhāsamāgacchati //
analyzed: ūrdhvāyām diśi lakṣaṇaruciravairocanāyām lokadhātau apratihataguṇakīrtivimokṣaprabharājaḥ nāma tathāgata ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sārdham asaṅga bala vīrya mati bodhisattva pūrvaṃgamena sarva bodhisattva parṣad maṇḍalena cakṣuṣaḥ ābhāsam āgacchati
translated: In the upward direction, in the world system called Laksanaruci, the Tathagata called Aparajitagunakirtiviमोक्षप्रभराज, the Arhat, the Fully Enlightened One, together with the entire assembly of Bodhisattvas headed by the Bodhisattva Asangabala-virya-mati, appeared to my eyes.

analyzed: iti hi kula putra
translated: Thus, noble sir,

original: etān daśa tathāgatān pramukhān kṛtvā daśasu dikṣu daśabuddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamāṃstathāgatānarhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhān paśyāmi /
analyzed: etān daśa tathāgatān pramukhān kṛtvā daśasu dikṣu daśa buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samān tathāgatān arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhān paśyāmi
translated: having made these ten Tathagatas the foremost, I see as many Tathagatas, Arhats, Fully Enlightened Ones as there are atoms in ten Buddha-fields, in the ten directions.

analyzed: na ca te tathāgatāḥ iha āgacchanti
translated: But those Tathagatas do not come here,

analyzed: na ca aham tatra gacchāmi
translated: and I do not go there.

analyzed: yasyām ca velāyām icchāmi
translated: But at whatever time I wish,

original: tasyāṃ velāyāṃ sukhāvatyāṃ lokadhātāvamitābhaṃ tathāgataṃ paśyāmi /🔽candanavatyāṃ lokadhātau vajrābhaṃ tathāgataṃ paśyāmi /
analyzed: tasyām velāyām sukhāvatyām lokadhātau amitābham tathāgatam paśyāmi  candanavatyām lokadhātau vajrābham tathāgatam paśyāmi
translated: at that time I see the Tathagata Amitabha in the world system Sukhavati.🔽I see the Tathagata Vajra in the world system Candanavati.

analyzed: gandhavatyām lokadhātau ratnābham tathāgatam paśyāmi
translated: I see the Tathagata Ratna in the world system GandhavatI.

analyzed: padmavatyām lokadhātau ratnapadmābham tathāgatam paśyāmi
translated: In the Padmavati world realm, I see the Tathagata Ratnapadmin.

analyzed: kanakavatyām lokadhātau śāntābham tathāgatam paśyāmi
