translated: They do not turn back, because their hearts are greedy for the thirst of spiritual friends.

analyzed: na pratyudāvartante kalyāṇa mitra mukha avalokena  na saṃsīdanti kalyāṇa mitra anuśāsanī patheṣu
translated: They do not turn away, because they look at the face of spiritual friends.🔽They do not become discouraged, because they follow the path of the instructions of spiritual friends.

analyzed: na khidyante kalyāṇa mitra upasthāna paricaryāsu
translated: They do not become weary, because they serve and attend to spiritual friends.

analyzed: paśyasi tvam kula putra
translated: Do you see, son of noble family,

analyzed: imam mama parivāram
translated: this retinue of mine?

analyzed: āha paśyāmi ārya
translated: He said, I see, noble one.

original: āhasarva ete kulaputra mayā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittamutpāditāḥ /
analyzed: āha sarve ete kula putra mayā anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpāditāḥ
translated: He said, All these, son of noble family, have I caused to generate the mind of supreme perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: mayā ete janitāḥ tathāgata kule
translated: I have given birth to them in the family of the Tathagata.

analyzed: mayā ete poṣitāḥ pāramitā upasaṃhāraiḥ
translated: I have nourished them with the accumulations of the perfections.

analyzed: mayā ete saṃcaritāḥ sarva śukla dharmaiḥ
translated: I have made them grow in all the wholesome dharmas.

analyzed: mayā ete vivardhitāḥ daśasu tathāgata baleṣu
translated: I have made them increase in the ten powers of the Tathagata.

analyzed: mayā ete uccālitāḥ loka vaṃśāt
translated: I have lifted them out of the lineage of the world.

analyzed: mayā ete pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ tathāgata vaṃśe
translated: I have established them in the lineage of the Tathagata.

analyzed: mayā ete vivartitāḥ loke gati cakrāt
translated: I have turned them away from the wheel of destinies in the world.

analyzed: mayā ete āvartitāḥ dharma cakra pravartana tāyām
translated: I have caused them to revolve in the turning of the wheel of Dharma.

analyzed: mayā ete sattvāḥ tāritāḥ tri adhva apāya gati prapātāt
translated: I have caused these beings to be liberated from the abyss of the three times and the destinies.

analyzed: mayā ete pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ dharma samatā anugamena
translated: I have established them through the realization of the equality of phenomena.

original: evaṃ hi kulaputra bodhisattvāstrātāro bhavanti sarvasattvānām /
analyzed: evam hi kula putra bodhisattvāḥ trātāraḥ bhavanti sarva sattvānām
translated: Thus, noble sir, bodhisattvas are saviors of all sentient beings.

original: ahaṃ kulaputra manaḥkośasaṃbhavānāṃ puṇyānāṃ lābhī /🔽so'hamannārthibhyo'nnaṃ dadāmi /🔽pānārthibhyaḥ pānam /
analyzed: aham kula putra manaḥ kośa saṃbhavānām puṇyānām lābhī  sā uham anna arthibhyaḥ annam dadāmi  pāna arthibhyaḥ pānam
translated: Noble sir, I have obtained the merit that comes from the treasure of the mind.🔽I give food to those who want food.🔽I give drink to those who want drink.

analyzed: rasa agra arthibhyaḥ rasa agram  khādya arthibhyaḥ khādyam  bhojya arthibhyaḥ bhojyam
translated: I give the best flavors to those who want the best flavors.🔽I give snacks to those who want snacks.🔽I give meals to those who want meals.

analyzed: lehya arthibhyaḥ lehyam  coṣya arthibhyaḥ coṣyam
translated: I give sweets to those who want sweets.🔽I give beverages to those who want beverages.

analyzed: vastra arthibhyaḥ vastram
translated: I give clothes to those who want clothes.

analyzed: puṣpa arthibhyaḥ puṣpam  mālya arthibhyaḥ mālyam  gandha arthibhyaḥ gandham
translated: I give flowers to those who want flowers.🔽I give garlands to those who want garlands.🔽I give perfumes to those who want perfumes.🔽I give incense to those who want incense.

analyzed: dhūpa arthikebhyaḥ dhūpam  vilepana arthibhyaḥ vilepanam  cūrṇa arthibhyaḥ cūrṇam
translated: I give ointments to those who want ointments.🔽I give powders to those who want powders.🔽I give ornaments and decorations to those who want ornaments and decorations.

analyzed: ābharaṇa vibhūṣaṇa arthibhyaḥ ābharaṇa vibhūṣaṇāni  ratna arthibhyaḥ ratnāni
translated: I give jewels to those who want jewels.🔽I give gold to those who want gold.

analyzed: suvarṇa arthibhyaḥ suvarṇam  rūpya arthibhyaḥ rūpyam  mukta arthibhyaḥ muktām  pratiśraya arthibhyaḥ pratiśrayam
translated: I give silver to those who want silver.🔽I give pearls to those who want pearls.🔽I give shelter to those who want shelter.

analyzed: āsana arthibhyaḥ āsanam
translated: I give seats to those who want seats.

analyzed: śayana arthibhyaḥ śayanam  glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkāra arthibhyaḥ glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkārān
translated: To those who need beds, I give beds.🔽To those who need medicines and medical supplies for the sick, I give medicines and medical supplies for the sick.

analyzed: yāna arthibhyaḥ yānam
translated: To those who need vehicles, I give vehicles.

analyzed: vāhana arthibhyaḥ vāhanam  hasti aśva ratha go gardabha mahiṣa aiḍaka arthibhyaḥ hasti aśva ratha go gardabha mahiṣa aiḍakān  chatra dhvaja patākā arthibhyaḥ chatra dhvaja patākāḥ
translated: To those who need conveyances, I give conveyances.🔽To those who need elephants, horses, chariots, cows, donkeys, buffaloes, and goats, I give elephants, horses, chariots, cows, donkeys, buffaloes, and goats.

analyzed: dāsī dāsa arthibhyaḥ dāsī dāsān  māṇava parivāra arthibhyaḥ māṇava parivāram  strī arthibhyaḥ striyaḥ
translated: To those who need parasols, banners, and flags, I give parasols, banners, and flags.🔽To those who need female and male servants, I give female and male servants.

analyzed: kumārī arthibhyaḥ
translated: To those who need a retinue of young men, I give a retinue of young men.🔽To those who need women, I give women.🔽To those who need girls,

analyzed: kumārīm  makuṭa cūḍāmaṇi arthibhyaḥ makuṭa cūḍāmaṇīn  sa carma cūḍāmaṇi arthibhyaḥ sa carma cūḍāmaṇīn
translated: I give girls.🔽To those who need crowns and jewels, I give crowns and jewels.🔽To those who need leather crowns and jewels, I give leather crowns and jewels.

analyzed: nīla vimala keśa maṇḍala arthibhyaḥ nīla vimala keśa maṇḍalam
translated: To those who need a head of hair that is blue and pure, I give a head of hair that is blue and pure.

analyzed: yāvat vividha sarva upakaraṇa arthibhyaḥ vividha sarva upakaraṇāni prayacchāmi
translated: Up to those who need various kinds of all the necessary things, I give various kinds of all the necessary things.

analyzed: āgamaya kula putra mūhūrtam yāvat pratyakṣaḥ bhaviṣyasi
translated: Wait, son of noble family, for a moment, until you will see with your own eyes.

analyzed: samanantara bhāṣitāyām ca asyām vāci viduṣā gṛhapatinā
translated: And immediately after the wise householder had spoken these words,

original: atha tāvadeva aparimāṇāḥ sattvā viduṣā gṛhapatinā pūrvapraṇidhānābhinimantritāḥ saṃnipatitāḥ /
analyzed: atha tāvat eva aparimāṇāḥ sattvāḥ viduṣā gṛhapatinā pūrva praṇidhāna abhinimantritāḥ saṃnipatitāḥ
translated: then, just as invited by the wise householder's previous aspiration, an immeasurable number of beings assembled.

original: nānādigbhyo nānājanapadapradeśebhyo nānānagarebhyo nānānigamebhyo nānāpaṭṭanebhyo nānākarvaṭebhyo nānāsattvajātibhyo nānāsattvakulebhyo nānāsattvakulavimātratābhyo nānāgatiparivartebhyo nānāpratiṣṭhānasaṃjñānagatibhyo nānāyatanaviśuddhā nānāhārārthino nānāhārābhilāṣiṇo nānāśayā śucyannapānakāmā māṃsārthino vividhabhojanavimātratābhikāṅkṣiṇo vividhagativiśeṣopapatyāyatanasthitāḥ yaduta manuṣyeṣvodanakulmāṣasūpamatsyamāṃsādivividhakavalīkāhārārthinaḥ yathā manuṣyeṣu /
analyzed: nānā digbhyaḥ nānā janapada pradeśebhyaḥ nānā nagarebhyaḥ nānā nigamebhyaḥ nānā paṭṭanebhyaḥ nānā karvaṭebhyaḥ nānā sattva jātibhyaḥ nānā sattva kulebhyaḥ nānā sattva kula vimātra tābhyaḥ nānā gati parivartebhyaḥ nānā pratiṣṭhāna saṃjñāna gatibhyaḥ nānā āyatana viśuddhāḥ nānā āhāra arthinaḥ nānā āhāra abhilāṣiṇaḥ nānā āśayāḥ śuci anna pāna kāmāḥ māṃsa arthinaḥ vividha bhojana vimātra tā abhikāṅkṣ
translated: From various directions, various regions of the country, various cities, various towns, various villages, various countries, various families of beings, various distinctions of families of beings, various transmigrations, various destinations with different perceptions, various abodes, various desires for food, various cravings for food, various intentions, desiring pure food and drink, desiring meat, longing for various kinds of food, dwelling in various special rebirths in various destinies, namely, among humans, desiring various foods such as rice, beans, soup, fish, meat, and various pastries, just as among humans.

original: evaṃ sarvagativicāreṣu nānābhojanapānārthina upasaṃkrāntāḥ yaduta bodhisattvānubhāvena asaṅgatyāgadundubhinirghoṣeṇa bodhisattvapraṇidhinimantritāḥ
analyzed: evam sarva gati vicāreṣu nānā bhojana pāna arthinaḥ upasaṃkrāntāḥ yat uta bodhisattva anubhāvena asaṅga tyāga dundubhi nirghoṣeṇa bodhisattva praṇidhi nimantritāḥ
translated: In the same way, in all the realms of existence, those who approached seeking various kinds of food and drink, namely, by the power of the bodhisattvas, by the sound of the drum of unattached giving, and by the invitation of the bodhisattvas' aspirations,

original: tamupasaṃkramya vidvāṃsaṃ gṛhapatiṃ yācante'valokayanti nirīkṣante vijñāpayanti //
analyzed: tam upasaṃkramya vidvāṃsam gṛhapatim yācanta ivalokayanti nirīkṣante vijñāpayanti
translated: approached the wise householder, begged, looked, observed, and informed him.

original: atha khalu vidvān gṛhapatistān yācanakān saṃnipatitān viditvā muhūrtamanuvicintya gaganatalamavalokayati sma /
analyzed: atha khalu vidvān gṛhapatiḥ tān yācanakān saṃnipatitān viditvā muhūrtam anuvicintya gagana talam avalokayati sma
translated: Then the wise householder, knowing that those beggars had assembled, contemplated for a moment and looked up at the sky.

original: tasya tato gaganatalādvividhā bhojanapānavidhayo nānārasā nānāvarṇā nānāgandhā avalambya hastatale pratyatiṣṭhan /
analyzed: tasya tatas gagana talāt vividhāḥ bhojana pāna vidhayaḥ nānā rasāḥ nānā varṇāḥ nānā gandhāḥ avalambya hasta tale pratyatiṣṭhan
translated: From the sky, various kinds of food and drink, with different tastes, colors, and fragrances, hung down and settled in the palm of his hand.

original: sa tānyādāya tān yathāsaṃnipatitān yācanakān nānādhimuktān yathābhipretairbhojanapānavidhibhiḥ sarvopakaraṇaviśaiṣaiḥ saṃtarpayati saṃpravārayati saṃtoṣayati saṃpraharṣayati saṃpramodayati pariprīṇayati /
analyzed: sa tāni ādāya tān yathā saṃnipatitān yācanakān nānā adhimuktān yathā abhipretaiḥ bhojana pāna vidhibhiḥ sarva upakaraṇa viśaiṣaiḥ saṃtarpayati saṃpravārayati saṃtoṣayati saṃpraharṣayati saṃpramodayati pariprīṇayati
translated: Taking them, he satisfied, served, pleased, delighted, gladdened, and filled with joy those beggars who had assembled, with various aspirations, with the various kinds of food and drink they desired, with all the best utensils.

analyzed: ātta manaskān karoti
translated: He made them feel at ease.

original: uttare vai nānāmiṣeṇa saṃtarpya tebhyo dharmaṃ deśayet /
analyzed: uttare vai nānā āmiṣeṇa saṃtarpya tebhyaḥ dharmam deśayet
translated: Having first satisfied them with various foods in the north, he should teach them the Dharma.

analyzed: yat uta vipula jñāna saṃbhāra upacaya hetum paridīpayan
translated: That is, illuminating the cause for the accumulation of the vast provisions of wisdom,

analyzed: sarva dāridrya asaṃbhava hetum paridīpayan
translated: illuminating the cause for the non-arising of all poverty,

analyzed: mahā bhoga tā samudāgama saṃbhava hetum paridīpayan
translated: illuminating the cause for the attainment of great enjoyment,

analyzed: paridīpayan
translated: illuminating the cause for the attainment of the knowledge and method of the Dharma,

analyzed: vipula puṇya saṃbhāra upacaya hetum paridīpayan
translated: illuminating the cause for the accumulation of vast merit,

analyzed: prīti bhakṣa bhojana pratilābha saṃbhava hetum paridīpayan  lakṣaṇa anuvyañjana upacita śarīra pratilābha saṃbhava hetum paridīpayan
translated: illuminating the cause for the attainment of food and drink that brings joy,🔽illuminating the cause for the attainment of a body adorned with the major and minor marks,

analyzed: an avamṛdya bala pariśuddhi pratilābha saṃbhava hetum paridīpayan
translated: illuminating the cause for the attainment of the purification of invincible strength,

analyzed: anantara āhāra prajñā pratilābha saṃbhava hetum paridīpayan
translated: illuminating the cause for the attainment of inexhaustible food and wisdom,

analyzed: sarva māra bala pramardana a paryādatta puṇya bala pratilābha saṃbhava hetum paridīpayan dharmam deśayet
translated: illuminating the cause for the attainment of the merit and strength that conquers all the powers of Mara without fail, he should teach the Dharma.

original: so'nnārthina upasaṃkrāntān gaganatalānnānānnavidhīn gṛhītvā saṃtarpya tebhya āyurvarṇabalamukhapratibhānaṃ saṃpaśyan pratilābhāya dharmaṃ deśayet
analyzed: sa unna arthinaḥ upasaṃkrāntān gagana talāt nānā anna vidhīn gṛhītvā saṃtarpya tebhyaḥ āyuḥ varṇa bala mukha pratibhānam saṃpaśyan pratilābhāya dharmam deśayet
translated: He, seeing that they desire food, taking various kinds of food from the sky, satisfies them, and for their benefit teaches the Dharma, looking at their lifespan, complexion, strength, and eloquence.

original: sa pānārthina upasaṃkrāntānnānāvidhaiḥ pānairudāraiḥ kalyāṇairanavadyairmanaḥsaṃpraharṣakaiḥ saṃtarpya tebhyaḥ saṃsāratṛṣṇārativinivartanatāyai buddhadharmaratitṛṣṇāsaṃjananatāyai dharmaṃ deśayet /
analyzed: sa pāna arthinaḥ upasaṃkrāntān nānāvidhaiḥ pānaiḥ udāraiḥ kalyāṇaiḥ anavadyaiḥ manaḥ saṃpraharṣakaiḥ saṃtarpya tebhyaḥ saṃsāra tṛṣṇā rati vinivartana tāyai buddha dharma rati tṛṣṇā saṃjanana tāyai dharmam deśayet
translated: He, seeing that they desire drink, satisfies them with various kinds of drinks, noble, wholesome, irreproachable, and delightful to the mind, and for them teaches the Dharma for turning away from the delight in craving for samsara and for generating the craving for the delight in the Buddha's Dharma.

analyzed: rasa rasa agra arthinaḥ upasaṃkrāntān nānāvidha rasa rasa agraiḥ madhura amla lavaṇa kaṭu tikta kaṣāyaiḥ saṃtarpayāmāsa
translated: He, seeing that they desire tastes and the best of tastes, satisfies them with various kinds of tastes and the best of tastes, sweet, sour, salty, pungent, bitter, and astringent.

analyzed: uttare ca eṣām rasa rasāgra tā mahāpuruṣa lakṣaṇa pratilābhāya dharmam deśayet
translated: And for their benefit teaches the Dharma for attaining the mark of a great man, the best of tastes.

original: sa yānārthino nānādiksrotobhyāgatānnānāvidhayānadānaiḥ saṃgṛhya tebhyo mahāyānādhirohaṇatāyai dharmaṃ deśayet /
analyzed: sa yāna arthinaḥ nānā diś srotaḥ bhyāgatān nānāvidha yāna dānaiḥ saṃgṛhya tebhyaḥ mahā yāna adhirohaṇa tāyai dharmam deśayet
translated: He, seeing that they desire vehicles, having gathered them with the gift of various kinds of vehicles from various directions, teaches the Dharma to them for mounting the Great Vehicle.

original: sa nānādigāgatān vastrārthina upasaṃkrāntān viditvā muhūrtaṃ vicintya gaganatalamullokayati sma /
analyzed: sa nānā diś āgatān vastra arthinaḥ upasaṃkrāntān viditvā muhūrtam vicintya gagana talam ullokayati sma
translated: Knowing that those who had come from various directions were in need of clothing, he thought for a moment and looked up into the sky.

original: tasya tato gaganatalānnānāraṅgānyanekavarṇāni viśuddhāni nīlapītalohitāvadātamāñjiṣṭhasphaṭikavarṇāni vividhāni vastrāṇyavalambya hastatale pratyatiṣṭhan /
analyzed: tasya tatas gagana talāt nānā raṅgāni aneka varṇāni viśuddhāni nīla pīta lohita avadāta māñjiṣṭha sphaṭika varṇāni vividhāni vastrāṇi avalambya hasta tale pratyatiṣṭhan
translated: From the sky, various colored and many-hued pure garments of blue, yellow, red, white, crimson, and crystal colors appeared and settled in the palm of his hand.

original: sa taistān yācanakān pratipādya tebhyo'nuttaratathāgatahrayapatrāpyasuvarṇavarṇacchavitāpratilābhaviśuddhaye dharmaṃ deśayet /
analyzed: sa taiḥ tān yācanakān pratipādya tebhyaḥ anuttara tathāgata hraya patrāpya suvarṇa varṇa chavi tā pratilābha viśuddhaye dharmam deśayet
translated: Having given those to the beggars, he taught them the Dharma for the sake of attaining the golden complexion of the Tathāgata's unsurpassed modesty and shame.

original: pratyekameva sarvopakaraṇavidhibhiryathāgatān yācanakān pratipādya tebhyo yathārhaṃ dharmaṃ deśayet //
analyzed: pratyekam eva sarva upakaraṇa vidhibhiḥ yathāgatān yācanakān pratipādya tebhyaḥ yathārham dharmam deśayet
translated: Having given each of the beggars all the necessary articles according to their wishes, he taught them the Dharma as appropriate.

original: atha khalu vidvān gṛhapatiḥ sudhanasya śreṣṭhidārakasya tamacintyaṃ bodhisattvavimokṣaviṣayamupadarśya evamāhaetamahaṃ kulaputra manaḥkośasaṃbhavavimokṣaṃ jānāmi /
analyzed: atha khalu vidvān gṛhapatiḥ sudhanasya śreṣṭhi dārakasya tam acintyam bodhisattva vimokṣa viṣayam upadarśya evam āha etam aham kula putra manaḥ kośa saṃbhava vimokṣam jānāmi
translated: Then the wise householder, having shown Sudhana, the merchant's son, that inconceivable field of the bodhisattva's liberation, said this: Noble one, I know this liberation that arises from the treasury of the mind.

original: kiṃ mayā śakyaṃ pariṣkāravaśitāprāptānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ ratnapāṇinā pratilabdhānāṃ caryāṃ jñātuṃ guṇān vā vaktum /
analyzed: kim mayā śakyam pariṣkāra vaśitā prāptānām bodhisattvānām ratna pāṇinā pratilabdhānām caryām jñātum guṇān vā vaktum
translated: What can I, a human, know about the conduct or qualities of the bodhisattvas who have attained mastery over requisites and obtained the state of Ratnapāṇi?

analyzed: vikurvitam vā nidarśayitum
translated: Or what can I teach about their transformations?

original: ye te sarvalokadhātūnanavaśeṣaṃ pāṇinā saṃchādya buddhapūjāvidhānatāyai sarvatathāgataparṣanmaṇḍaleṣu nānāvarṇaratnameghān pravarṣanti /
analyzed: ye te sarva lokadhātūn anavaśeṣam pāṇinā saṃchādya buddha pūjā vidhāna tāyai sarva tathāgata parṣad maṇḍaleṣu nānā varṇa ratna meghān pravarṣanti
translated: Those who, without exception, cover all world systems with their hands, and in the assemblies of all Tathāgatas, rain down clouds of various-colored jewels in order to arrange offerings to the Buddhas,

original: evaṃ nānāvarṇā bharaṇameghān nānāvarṇakūṭāgārameghān nānāvarṇavicitravastrameghān nānādivyatūryatālopacārasaṃgītimanojñāmadhuranirghoṣān nānāvarṇagandhameghān nānāvarṇadhūpamālyavilepanacūrṇacīvaracchatradhvajapatākāsarvopakaraṇameghān sarvākārasarvabuddhapūjāmeghān pravarṣanti /
analyzed: evam nānā varṇāḥ bharaṇa meghān nānā varṇa kūṭāgāra meghān nānā varṇa vicitra vastra meghān nānā divya tūrya tāla upacāra saṃgīti manojñā madhura nirghoṣān nānā varṇa gandha meghān nānā varṇa dhūpa mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja patākā sarva upakaraṇa meghān sarva ākāra sarva buddha pūjā meghān pravarṣanti
translated: In the same way, they rain down clouds of various-colored ornaments, clouds of various-colored kūṭāgāras, clouds of various-colored variegated garments, various-colored musical instruments, hand drums, cymbals, and songs with delightful sweet sounds, clouds of various-colored fragrances, clouds of various-colored incense, garlands, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, banners, flags, and all requisites, clouds of all kinds of offerings to all Buddhas,

original: sarvatathāgataparṣanmaṇḍaleṣu sarvasattvabhavaneṣu yaduta sarvabuddhapūjopasthānatāyai sarvasattvadhātuparipākavinayāya ca //
analyzed: sarva tathāgata parṣad maṇḍaleṣu sarva sattva bhavaneṣu yat uta sarva buddha pūjā upasthāna tāyai sarva sattvadhātu paripāka vinayāya ca
translated: In the assemblies of all Tathāgatas and in the abodes of all beings, namely, in order to make offerings and attend to all Buddhas and in order to ripen and guide all realms of beings.

analyzed: gaccha kula putra
translated: Go, son of noble family!

analyzed: iha eva dakṣiṇāpathe siṃhapotam nāma nagaram
translated: Here, in the southern region, there is a city called Siṃhapota.

analyzed: tatra ratnacūḍaḥ nāma dharma śreṣṭhī prativasati
translated: There lives a merchant named Ratnacūḍa.

original: tamupasaṃkramya paripṛcchakathaṃ bodhisattvena bodhisattvena bodhisattvacaryāyāṃ śikṣitavyam /
analyzed: tam upasaṃkramya paripṛccha katham bodhisattvena bodhisattvena bodhisattva caryāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: Approach him and ask him how a bodhisattva should train in the bodhisattva conduct,

analyzed: katham pratipattavyam
translated: and how one should practice.

original: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhidārakastuṣṭa udagra āttamanāḥ pramuditaḥ prītisaumanasyajāto viduṣi gṛhapatau dharmagauravācchiṣyabhāvamupadarśya tadadhiṣṭhānātsarvabuddhadharmān saṃpaśyan /
analyzed: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhi dārakaḥ tuṣṭaḥ udagraḥ ātta manāḥ pramuditaḥ prīti saumanasya jātaḥ viduṣi gṛhapatau dharma gauravāt śiṣya bhāvam upadarśya tad adhiṣṭhānāt sarva buddha dharmān saṃpaśyan
translated: Then the merchant's son Sudhana, filled with joy, uplifted, delighted, happy, and blissful, having shown his disciple-like attitude towards the householder Vidvān out of respect for the Dharma, perceiving all the Buddha teachings based on that,

analyzed: tad adhīnām sarvajña tām saṃpaśyan  kalyāṇa mitra an ācchedya prema tām upadarśayan  kalyāṇa mitreṣu atyanta ājñā cintya tām saṃdarśayan
translated: perceiving omniscience to be dependent on that,🔽demonstrating his unwavering love for the spiritual teachers,🔽showing the inconceivability of complete ignorance towards the spiritual teachers,

analyzed: kalyāṇa mitra vaśa varti tām anuvartayan
translated: following the control over the spiritual teachers,

analyzed: kalyāṇa mitra anuśāsanī vacanam śuśrūṣamāṇaḥ
translated: listening to the words of instruction from the spiritual teachers,

analyzed: kalyāṇa mitra prabhavam śraddhā indriyam nidhyāyan
translated: contemplating the faculty of faith originating from the spiritual teachers,

analyzed: kalyāṇamitra anuśāsanī anupreṣitaḥ
translated: being sent forth by the instruction of the spiritual teachers,

original: kalyāṇamitrābhirādhanānuvartanacitto viduṣo gṛhapateḥ pādau śirasābhivandya vidvāṃsaṃ gṛhapatimanekaśatasahasrakṛtvaḥ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya punaḥ punaravalokya viduṣo gṛhapaterantikātprakrāntaḥ // //
analyzed: kalyāṇa mitra abhirādhana anuvartana cittaḥ viduṣaḥ gṛhapateḥ pādau śirasā abhivandya vidvāṃsam gṛhapatim aneka śata sahasra kṛtvas pradakṣiṇīkṛtya punar punar avalokya viduṣaḥ gṛhapateḥ antikāt prakrāntaḥ  /
translated: with a mind to follow and please the spiritual friend, bowed his head to the feet of the wise householder, circumambulated the wise householder many hundreds of thousands of times, looked back again and again, and departed from the presence of the wise householder.

analyzed: ratnacūḍaḥ
translated: Ratnacūḍa.

original: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhidārakaḥ tatpuṇyatoyaṃ saṃbhāvayan /
analyzed: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhi dārakaḥ tat puṇya toyam saṃbhāvayan
translated: Then, the merchant's son Sudhana, contemplating that water of merit,

analyzed: tat puṇya kṣetram saṃpaśyan
translated: beholding that field of merit,

analyzed: tad puṇya sumerum pariśodhayan  tat puṇya tīrtham avagāhayamānaḥ  tad puṇya kośam vivṛṇvan
translated: purifying that Sumeru of merit,🔽immersed in that ford of merit,

analyzed: tad puṇya nidhim avalokayan  tat puṇya maṇḍalam pariśodhayan
translated: unfolding that treasure of merit,🔽beholding that mine of merit,🔽purifying that circle of merit,

analyzed: tat puṇya skadham samādadat  tat puṇya balam saṃjanayan
translated: accepting that element of merit,🔽generating that power of merit,

analyzed: tad puṇya vegam vivardhayan
translated: increasing that impetus of merit,

original: anupūrveṇa yena siṃhapotaṃ nagaraṃ tenopasaṃkramya ratnacūḍaṃ dharmaśreṣṭhinaṃ parimārgamāṇo'drākṣīdantarāpaṇamadhyagatam /
analyzed: anupūrveṇa yena siṃhapotam nagaram tena upasaṃkramya ratnacūḍam dharma śreṣṭhinam parimārgamāṇā udrākṣīt antarāpaṇa madhya gatam
translated: gradually approached the city of Siṃhapota and, searching for the merchant chief Ratnacūḍa, saw him in the middle of the marketplace.

original: tasya pādau śirasābhivandya pradakṣiṇīkṛtya purataḥ prāñjaliḥ sthitvā evamāhamayā ārya anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittamutpāditam /
analyzed: tasya pādau śirasā abhivandya pradakṣiṇīkṛtya puratas prāñjaliḥ sthitvā evam āham ayā ārya anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpāditam
translated: He bowed his head to the feet of Ratnachūḍa, circumambulated him, stood before him with palms joined, and said, “Noble one, I have developed the mind set on unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

original: na ca jānāmi kathaṃ bodhisattvena bodhisattvacaryāyāṃ śikṣitavyam /
analyzed: na ca jānāmi katham bodhisattvena bodhisattva caryāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: But I do not know how a bodhisattva should train in bodhisattva conduct.

analyzed: katham pratipattavyam
translated: How should one practice?

analyzed: tat sādhu me āryaḥ bodhisattva mārgam upadiśatu
translated: Therefore, noble one, please teach me the bodhisattva path.

analyzed: yena aham mārgeṇa sarvajña tāyām niryāyām
translated: By that path I will go to omniscience.”

original: atha khalu ratnacūḍo dharmaśreṣṭhī sudhanaṃ śreṣṭhidārakaṃ pāṇau gṛhītvā yena svaṃ niveśanaṃ tenopasaṃkramya tadgṛhamupadarśya evamāhaprekṣasva kulaputra mama niveśanam /
analyzed: atha khalu ratnacūḍaḥ dharma śreṣṭhī sudhanam śreṣṭhi dārakam pāṇau gṛhītvā yena svam niveśanam tena upasaṃkramya tat gṛham upadarśya evam āha prekṣasva kula putra mama niveśanam
translated: Then Ratnachūḍa, the foremost in the Dharma, took the merchant boy Sudhana by the hand, went to his own house, showed him the house, and said, “Look, noble son, at my house.

original: so'nuvilokayan adrākṣīttadgṛhaṃ śuddhaṃ prabhāsvaraṃ jāmbūnadasuvarṇamayaṃ vipulamudviddhaṃ rūpyaprākāraparikṣiptaṃ sphaṭikaprāsādasukṛtopaśobhitaṃ vaiḍūryakūṭaśatasahasrapratimaṇḍitaṃ musāragalvasamucchritastambhaṃ suprajñaptaṃ lohitamuktāmayasiṃhāsanaṃ jyotīrasamaṇiratnasiṃhadhvajasamuchritaṃ vairocanamaṇiratnavitānavitataṃ cintāmaṇivicitrahemajālasaṃchannamasaṃkhyeyamaṇiratnapratimaṇḍitavyūhaṃ śītajalāśmagarbhamayapuṣkariṇīsamupetaṃ sarvaratnadrumaparivṛtaṃ vipulaṃ vistīrṇaṃ daśapuramudviddhamaṣṭadvāram /
analyzed: sonu vilokayan adrākṣīt tat gṛham śuddham prabhāsvaram jāmbūnada suvarṇa mayam vipulam udviddham rūpya prākāra parikṣiptam sphaṭika prāsāda su kṛta upaśobhitam vaiḍūrya kūṭa śata sahasra pratimaṇḍitam musāragalva samucchrita stambham su prajñaptam lohita muktā maya siṃhāsanam jyotīrasa maṇi ratna siṃhadhvaja samuchritam vairocana maṇi ratna vitāna vitatam cintāmaṇi vicitra hema jāla saṃchannam asaṃkhyeya maṇi ratna pratimaṇḍita vyūham śīta j
translated: He saw that house to be pure, radiant, made of gold from the Jambū River, vast and lofty, surrounded by a silver wall, beautifully adorned with a crystal palace, ornamented with a hundred thousand peaks of beryl, with pillars made of coral, well-appointed with lion thrones made of red pearls, with banners of lion-banner jewels, covered with a canopy of vairocana jewels, shaded by a net of various golden wish-fulfilling jewels, adorned with an array of countless jewel gems, endowed with lotus ponds made of lapis lazuli with cool water, surrounded by all kinds of jeweled trees, vast and spacious, ten stories high, with eight gates.

analyzed: sa tat gṛham praviśya samantāt anuvilokayati sma
translated: Having entered that house, he looked all around.

analyzed: sa prathame purā inna pāna vidhi parityāgam adrākṣīt
translated: In the first story, he saw the giving away of all provisions of food and drink.

analyzed: dvitīye pure sarva vastra vidhi parityāgam
translated: In the second story, he saw the giving away of all provisions of clothing.

analyzed: tṛtīye pure sarva ratna ābharaṇa alaṃkāra parityāgam
translated: In the third city, he saw the bodhisattva mahāsattva Samantabhadra giving away all his precious ornaments and decorations.

analyzed: caturthe pure ntaḥpure paribhoga rati mahā pṛthivī kalyāṇa kanyā ratna parityāgam adrākṣīt
translated: In the fourth city, he saw the bodhisattva mahāsattva Samantabhadra giving away his harem, enjoyments, pleasures, the great earth, and the precious jewel of a virtuous daughter.

original: pañcame pure pañcamībhūmipratiṣṭhitānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ dharmasaṃgītiratiprayuktānāṃ lokahitasukhacittaceṣṭānāṃ sarvaśāstrāṇyabhinirhārayatāṃ dhāraṇīnayaṃ ca samādhisamudraṃ ca samādhivyutthānaṃ ca samādhivyavacāraṃ ca jñānālokaṃ ca abhinirhārayatāṃ saṃnipātamadrākṣīt /
analyzed: pañcame pure pañcamī bhūmi pratiṣṭhitānām bodhisattvānām dharma saṃgīti rati prayuktānām loka hita sukha citta ceṣṭānām sarva śāstrāṇi abhinirhārayatām dhāraṇī nayam ca samādhi samudram ca samādhi vyutthānam ca samādhi vyavacāram ca jñāna ālokam ca abhinirhārayatām saṃnipātam adrākṣīt
translated: In the fifth city, he saw the bodhisattva mahāsattvas dwelling on the fifth ground gathering to discuss the Dharma, engaged in benefiting and bringing happiness to the world, mastering all treatises, perfecting the methods of retention, the ocean of samādhis, the arising from samādhi, the discernment of samādhis, and the light of wisdom.

original: ṣaṣṭhe pure prajñāpāramitāvihārapratilabdhānāṃ gambhīraprajñānāṃ sarvadharmapraśāntābhijñānāṃ bhūmisamādhidhāraṇīmukhagarbhasamantamukhaniryātānām anāvaraṇagocarāṇām advayasamudācārāṇāṃ dharmasaṃgītiṃ kurvatāṃ prajñāpāramitāparivartanamanusaratāṃ vibhajatāmuttānī kurvatāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ saṃnipātamadrākṣīt imāni prajñāpāramitāmukhāni saṃgāyatāmyaduta śāntigarbhaṃ nāma prajñāpāramitāmukham /
analyzed: ṣaṣṭhe pure prajñāpāramitā vihāra pratilabdhānām gambhīra prajñānām sarva dharma praśānta abhijñānām bhūmi samādhi dhāraṇī mukha garbha samanta mukha niryātānām an āvaraṇa gocarāṇām advaya samudācārāṇām dharma saṃgītim kurvatām prajñāpāramitā parivartanam anusaratām vibhajatām uttānī kurvatām bodhisattvānām saṃnipātam adrākṣīt imāni prajñāpāramitā mukhāni saṃgāyatām yat uta śāntigarbham nāma prajñāpāramitā mukham
translated: In the sixth city, he saw a gathering of bodhisattvas who had attained the abode of the perfection of wisdom, who had profound wisdom, who had the higher knowledge of the peace of all dharmas, who had the womb of the doors of the stages, concentrations, and retentions, who had emerged through all gates, whose sphere was unobstructed, whose conduct was nondual, who were engaged in the Dharma assembly, who followed the chapters of the perfection of wisdom, who analyzed and proclaimed it. He saw them singing these gates of the perfection of wisdom, namely: the gate of the perfection of wisdom called Womb of Peace,

original: sarvajagajjñānasuvibhaktaṃ ca nāma prajñāpāramitāmukham /🔽acalāvartaṃ ca nāma prajñāpāramitāmukham /🔽virajaḥprabhāsaṃ ca nāma prajñāpāramitāmukham /
analyzed: sarva jagat jñāna suvibhaktam ca nāma prajñāpāramitā mukham  acalāvartam ca nāma prajñāpāramitā mukham  virajaḥprabhāsam ca nāma prajñāpāramitā mukham
translated: the gate of the perfection of wisdom called Thorough Analysis of the Knowledge of the Entire World,🔽the gate of the perfection of wisdom called Unwavering Vortex,🔽the gate of the perfection of wisdom called Radiant Without Dust,

original: duryodhanagarbhaṃ ca nāma prajñāpāramitāmukham /🔽jagadrocanāmaṇḍalaṃ ca nāma prajñāpāramitāmukham /
analyzed: duryodhanagarbham ca nāma prajñāpāramitā mukham  jagat rocanā maṇḍalam ca nāma prajñāpāramitā mukham
translated: the gate of the perfection of wisdom called Womb of Invincibility,🔽the gate of the perfection of wisdom called Disk Delightful to the World,

analyzed: anugama naya maṇḍalam ca nāma prajñāpāramitā mukham
translated: the gate of the perfection of wisdom called Disk of Following Methods,

original: sāgaragarbhaṃ ca nāma prajñāpāramitāmukham /🔽samantacakṣurupekṣāpratilabdhaṃ ca nāma prajñāpāramitāmukham /
analyzed: sāgaragarbham ca nāma prajñāpāramitā mukham  samantacakṣuḥ upekṣā pratilabdham ca nāma prajñāpāramitā mukham
translated: the gateway of the perfection of wisdom called The Womb of the Ocean,🔽the gateway of the perfection of wisdom called Attaining the Equanimity of Universal Vision,

original: akṣayakośānugamaṃ ca nāma prajñāpāramitāmukham /🔽sarvadharmanayasāgaraṃ ca nāma prajñāpāramitāmukham /
analyzed: akṣaya kośa anugamam ca nāma prajñāpāramitā mukham  sarva dharma naya sāgaram ca nāma prajñāpāramitā mukham
translated: the gateway of the perfection of wisdom called Following the Inexhaustible Treasury,🔽the gateway of the perfection of wisdom called The Ocean of All Dharma Methods,

analyzed: sarva jagat sāgara anugamam ca nāma prajñāpāramitā mukham
translated: the gateway of the perfection of wisdom called Following the Ocean of All Beings,

analyzed: asaṅga pratibhānam ca nāma prajñāpāramitā mukham
translated: the gateway of the perfection of wisdom called Unimpeded Eloquence,

analyzed: dharmamegha avalamba anupūrva abhilambha nilayam ca nāma prajñāpāramitā mukham
translated: and the gateway of the perfection of wisdom called The Gradual Attainment of the Abode of the Cloud of Dharma.

original: itīmāni prajñāpāramitāmukhāni pramukhaṃ kṛtvā paripūrṇāni daśa prajñāpāramitāsaṃkhyeyaśatasahasrāṇi /
analyzed: iti imāni prajñāpāramitā mukhāni pramukham kṛtvā paripūrṇāni daśa prajñāpāramitā saṃkhyeya śata sahasrāṇi
translated: Having taken these gateways of the perfection of wisdom as the main ones, there were a full ten trillion gateways of the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: yāni tān bodhisattvān anabhilāpya vyūha suvibhakta parṣad maṇḍala sthitān saṃgāyataḥ udrākṣīt
translated: He saw those bodhisattvas singing in the assembly circle, which was well-arranged with inexpressible adornments.

analyzed: saptame pure pratiśrut kopam a kṣānti pratilabdhānām upāya jñāna viniścaya niryātānām sarva tathāgata dharmamegha saṃpratyeṣakāṇām bodhisattvānām saṃnipātam adrākṣīt
translated: In the seventh city, he saw a gathering of bodhisattvas who had attained the acceptance that is like an echo, who had emerged through the knowledge and certainty of skillful means, who were entrusted with the Dharma clouds of all tathagatas.

original: aṣṭame pure'cyutagāminyabhijñāpratilabdhānāṃ sarvalokadhātvanuvicaraṇānāṃ sarvaparṣanmaṇḍalapratibhāsaprāptānāṃ sarvadharmadhātusuvibhaktaśarīrāṇāṃ sarvatathāgatapādamūlāsaṃbhinnaviṣayāṇāṃ sarvabuddhakāyasamavasaraṇānāṃ sarvatathāgataparṣanmaṇḍalapūrvagamakathāpuruṣāṇāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ saṃnipātamadrākṣīt navame pure ekajātipratibaddhānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ saṃnipātamadrākṣīt /
analyzed: aṣṭame purecyutagāminī abhijñā pratilabdhānām sarva lokadhātu anuvicaraṇānām sarva parṣad maṇḍala pratibhāsa prāptānām sarva dharmadhātu su vibhakta śarīrāṇām sarva tathāgata pāda mūla a saṃbhinna viṣayāṇām sarva buddha kāya samavasaraṇānām sarva tathāgata parṣad maṇḍala pūrva gama kathā puruṣāṇām bodhisattvānām saṃnipātam adrākṣīt navame pure eka jāti pratibaddhānām bodhisattvānām saṃnipātam adrākṣīt
translated: In the eighth city, he saw a gathering of bodhisattvas who had attained the unobstructed higher knowledge, who roamed through all world systems, who had attained the radiance in all assemblies, whose bodies were well-formed in all dharma realms, whose spheres were inseparable from the feet of all tathagatas, who were included in the bodies of all buddhas, who were the foremost speakers in the assemblies of all tathagatas. In the ninth city, he saw a gathering of bodhisattvas who were bound to one birth.

original: daśame pure sarvatathāgatānāṃ saprathamopacittotpādacaryāniryāṇapraṇidhānasāgarān sarvabuddhadharmavikurvitaviṣayān sarvabuddhakṣetraparṣanmaṇḍalān sarvabuddhadharmacakranirghoṣān sarvasattvavinayādhiṣṭhānavyūhānadrākṣīt //
analyzed: daśame pure sarva tathāgatānām sa prathama upacitta utpāda caryā niryāṇa praṇidhāna sāgarān sarva buddha dharma vikurvita viṣayān sarva buddhakṣetra parṣad maṇḍalān sarva buddha dharma cakra nirghoṣān sarva sattva vinaya adhiṣṭhāna vyūhān adrākṣīt
translated: In the tenth direction, he saw all the tathāgatas, their first generation of the mind of enlightenment, their conduct, their departure, their ocean of aspirations, their magical manifestations of all buddha-dharmas, all their buddha-fields and assemblies, the sound of the wheel of the Dharma of all buddhas, and the array of all the bases of training sentient beings.

analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca ratnacūḍam dharmaśreṣṭhinam etat avocata ārya
translated: Having seen this, he said to Ratnacūḍa, the foremost merchant in the Dharma, Noble one,

analyzed: kutas te iyam evaṃrūpā saṃpad viśodhitā
translated: where did you purify such a wealth as this?

original: kutra te kuśalamūlānyavaropitāni yasya tava iyamīdṛśī vipākasaṃpat /
analyzed: kutra te kuśala mūlāni avaropitāni yasya tava iyam īdṛśī vipāka saṃpad
translated: Where did you plant the roots of virtue that you have such a wealth of ripening as this?

original: sa āhasmarāmi kulaputra atīte'dhvani buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamānāṃ kalpānāṃ pareṇa paratareṇa cakravicitre lokadhātāvanantaraśmidharmadhātusamalaṃkṛtadharmarājo nāma tathāgato loke udapādi /
analyzed: saḥ āha smarāmi kula putra atīta idhvani buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samānām kalpānām pareṇa paratareṇa cakravicitre lokadhātau ananta raśmi dharmadhātu samalaṃkṛta dharmarājaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ loke udapādi
translated: He said, Son of noble family, I remember that in the past, beyond buddha-fields as numerous as the atoms in a buddha-field, in the world system called 'Wheel of Various Colors,' the tathāgata called 'King of the Dharma Adorned with the Infinite Light of the Dharma Realm' appeared in the world.

original: vidyācaraṇasaṃpannaḥ sugato lokavidanuttaraḥ puruṣadamyasārathiḥ śāstā devānāṃ ca manuṣyāṇāṃ ca buddho bhagavān /
analyzed: vidyā caraṇa saṃpannaḥ sugataḥ loka vid anuttaraḥ puruṣa damya sārathiḥ śāstā devānām ca manuṣyāṇām ca buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: He was accomplished in knowledge and conduct, a sugata, a knower of the world, an unsurpassed guide for those to be trained, a teacher of gods and humans, a buddha, a bhagavat.

original: sa khalu punastathāgato jñānavairocanapramukhena śrāvakakoṭīśatena jñānasūryatejaḥpramukhena ca bodhisattvakoṭīśatasahasreṇa sārdhaṃ maṇidhvajavyūharājamahodyānadharaṇipraviṣṭo rājñā dharmeśvararājena abhinimantritaḥ /
analyzed: sa khalu punar tathāgataḥ jñānavairocana pramukhena śrāvaka koṭī śatena jñānasūryatejaḥ pramukhena ca bodhisattva koṭī śata sahasreṇa sārdham maṇidhvaja vyūha rāja mahā udyāna dharaṇi praviṣṭaḥ rājñā dharmeśvara rājena abhinimantritaḥ
translated: That Tathāgata, together with a hundred million śrāvakas headed by Jñānavaiḍūryaprabha and a hundred thousand koṭis of bodhisattvas headed by Jñānasūryatejas, entered the great park Maṇidhvajavyūharājamaṇḍala, invited by King Dharmādhipateyeśvara.

original: tasya me tathāgatasya nagarapraviṣṭasyāntarāpaṇamadhyagatasya tūryanādanirnāditaṃ kāritam /
analyzed: tasya me tathāgatasya nagara praviṣṭasya antarāpaṇa madhya gatasya tūrya nāda nirnāditam kāritam
translated: When that Tathāgata entered the city and was in the middle of the marketplace, I made music with musical instruments.

original: ekā ca gandhagulikā nidhūpitā tasya bhagavataḥ sabodhisattvaśrāvakasaṃghasya pūjākarmaṇe /
analyzed: ekā ca gandha gulikā nidhūpitā tasya bhagavataḥ sa bodhisattva śrāvaka saṃghasya pūjā karmaṇe
translated: And I burned one incense pill for the sake of making offerings to that Blessed One, together with the community of bodhisattvas and śrāvakas.

original: tayā ca gandhagulikayā nidhūpitayā saptāhaṃ sarvajambudvīpo'nantavarṇaiḥ sarvasattvakāyasadṛśairdhūpapaṭalameghaiḥ saṃchanno'bhūt /
analyzed: tayā ca gandha gulikayā nidhūpitayā saptāham sarva jambudvīpaḥ unanta varṇaiḥ sarva sattva kāya sadṛśaiḥ dhūpa paṭala meghaiḥ
translated: When that incense pill was burned, for seven days the entire Jambudvīpa was covered with clouds of incense vapors of infinite colors, like the bodies of all beings.

original: tebhyaśca dhūpapaṭalameghebhya evaṃrūpaḥ śabdo niścarati smaaciantyastathāgatatryadhvavipulena skandhena samanvāgataḥ /
analyzed: tebhyaḥ ca dhūpa paṭala meghebhyaḥ evaṃrūpaḥ śabdaḥ niścarati smaaciantyaḥ tathāgata tri adhva vipulena skandhena samanvāgataḥ
translated: And from those clouds of incense vapors, this kind of sound came forth: The Tathāgata is inconceivable, endowed with a vast aggregate of the three times.

analyzed: sarvajñaḥ sarva āvaraṇa vigataḥ sarva kleśa vāsanā prahīṇaḥ
translated: He is omniscient, free from all obscurations, and has abandoned all afflictive tendencies.

analyzed: sarva tathāgata avaropitā dakṣiṇā
translated: The offerings made to all the Tathāgatas are made to him.

analyzed: apramāṇa sarvajñātā phala dāyikā sarvajña tā samavasaraṇā iti yat uta asmad kuśala mūla paripāka artham acintya sattva kuśala mūla vega saṃjanana artham ca
translated: They lead to the fruit of immeasurable omniscience, and culminate in omniscience. This is for the sake of ripening our own roots of virtue and for the sake of generating the inconceivable impetus of virtue in beings.

original: tebhyo dhūpapaṭalameghebhyo buddhādhiṣṭhānena ayamevaṃrūpaḥ śabdo niścacāra /
analyzed: tebhyaḥ dhūpa paṭala meghebhyaḥ buddha adhiṣṭhānena ayam evaṃrūpaḥ śabdaḥ niścacāra
translated: From those clouds of incense-filled canopies, by the blessing of the Buddhas, this kind of sound came forth:

original: tacca me kulaputra tathāgatādhiṣṭhānaṃ saṃdarśanaprātihāryakuśalamūlaṃ triṣu sthāneṣu pariṇāmitam /
analyzed: tat ca me kula putra tathāgata adhiṣṭhānam saṃdarśana prātihārya kuśala mūlam triṣu sthāneṣu pariṇāmitam
translated: And that blessing of the Tathāgatas, the roots of virtue of the skill in the miracle of showing that, I have dedicated to three things.

analyzed: katameṣu triṣu
translated: To which three?

analyzed: yat uta atyanta sarva dāridraya samucchedāya saddharma śravaṇa avirahita tāyai sarva buddha bodhisattva kalyāṇa mitra darśana paripūraye ca
translated: Namely, for the sake of completely cutting off all poverty, for the sake of not being separated from hearing the true Dharma, and for the sake of fulfilling the vision of all the Buddhas, Bodhisattvas, and spiritual friends.

analyzed: etam aham kula putra
translated: This, noble sir,

analyzed: a pratihata praṇidhi maṇḍala vyūha bodhisattva vimokṣam jānāmi
translated: I know this bodhisattva liberation called the unobstructed great wheel array.

original: kiṃ mayā śakyamacintyāpramāṇaguṇaratnākarāṇāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ caryāṃ jñātuṃ guṇān vā vaktum /
analyzed: kim mayā śakyam acintya apramāṇa guṇa ratna ākarāṇām bodhisattvānām caryām jñātum guṇān vā vaktum
translated: What am I able to know the conduct or describe the qualities of the bodhisattvas, who are mines of inconceivable and immeasurable qualities?

analyzed: ye te asaṃbhinna buddha śarīra sāgara avatīrṇāḥ
translated: They who have entered the ocean of the undivided body of the Buddha,

analyzed: ye te asaṃbhinna dharmamegha saṃpratīcchakāḥ
translated: they who have received the undivided rain of Dharma clouds,

analyzed: ye te asaṃbhinna guṇa sāgara pratipannāḥ
translated: they who have entered the ocean of undivided qualities,

analyzed: ye te samanta bhadra caryā jāla visṛtāḥ
translated: they who are spread out with the net of Samantabhadra's conduct,

original: ye te asaṃbhinnasamādhiviṣayāvatīrṇāḥ ye te asaṃbhinnasarvabodhisattvaikaghanakuśalamūlāḥ ye te asaṃbhinnatathāgatāvikalpavihāriṇaḥ /
analyzed: ye te asaṃbhinna samādhi viṣaya avatīrṇāḥ ye te asaṃbhinna sarva bodhisattva eka ghana kuśala mūlāḥ ye te asaṃbhinna tathāgata avikalpa vihāriṇaḥ
translated: they who have entered the domain of undivided concentration, they who have undivided roots of virtue with all bodhisattvas, they who dwell without conceptualization in the undivided thusness of the Tathagatas,

analyzed: ye te asaṃbhinna tri adhva samatā avatīrṇāḥ  ye te a saṃbhinna sarva kalpa saṃvāsa a parikhinnāḥ
translated: they who have entered the undivided equality of the three times,🔽they who are not exhausted by dwelling in the undivided for all kalpas,

analyzed: ye te asaṃbhinna samanta cakṣuḥ viṣaya bhūmi pratiṣṭhitāḥ
translated: they who are established in the undivided domain of the eye of Samantabhadra.

analyzed: gaccha kula putra
translated: Go, son of noble family.

analyzed: ayam iha eva dakṣiṇāpathe vetramūlakaḥ nāma janapadaḥ
translated: Here in the southern region there is a country named Vetramoolya.

original: tatra samantamukhe nagare samantanetro nāma gāndhikaḥ śreṣṭhī prativasati /
analyzed: tatra samantamukhe nagare samantanetraḥ nāma gāndhikaḥ śreṣṭhī prativasati
translated: There, in the city of Samantamukha, there lives a perfumer named Samantanetra.

analyzed: tam upasaṃkramya paripṛccha katham bodhisattvena bodhisattva caryāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: Go to him and ask him how a bodhisattva should train in bodhisattva conduct and how a bodhisattva should practice.

analyzed: katham pratipattavyam
translated: How should one practice?

original: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhidārako ratnacūḍasya dharmaśreṣṭhinaḥ pādau śirasābhivandya ratnacūḍaṃ dharmaśreṣṭhinamanekaśatasahasrakṛtvaḥ pradakṣiṇīkṛutya punaḥ punaravalokya ratnacūḍasya dharmaśreṣṭhino'ntikātprakrāntaḥ // //
analyzed: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhi dārakaḥ ratnacūḍasya dharma śreṣṭhinaḥ pādau śirasā abhivandya ratnacūḍam dharma śreṣṭhinam aneka śata sahasra kṛtvas pradakṣiṇīkṛutya punar punar avalokya ratnacūḍasya dharma śreṣṭhinā untikāt prakrāntaḥ  /
translated: Then the merchant's son Sudhana bowed his head to the feet of the merchant Ratna-cūḍa, circumambulated the merchant Ratna-cūḍa many hundreds of thousands of times, and looking back again and again, departed from the presence of the merchant Ratna-cūḍa.

analyzed: samanta netraḥ
translated: Samantanethra.

original: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhidārako'nantabuddhadarśanāvatīrṇo'nantabodhisattvasamavadhānaprāpto'nantabodhisattvamārganayāvabhāsito'nantabodhisattvadharmanayābhiṣyanditaniścitacitto'nantabodhisattvādhimuktipathaviśuddhiranantabodhisattvendriyāvabhāsapratilabdho'nantabodhisattvāśayabalapratiṣṭhito'nantabodhisattvacaryānugatacetāḥ anantabodhisattvapraṇidhānabalasaṃjāto'nantabodhisattvāparājitadhvajo'nantabodhisattvajñānālokaparivartī anantabodhisattvādharmāvabhāsapratilabdhaḥ anupūrveṇa yena vetramūlako nāma janapadastenopasaṃkramya samantamukhaṃ nagaraṃ parimārgan samantadigvidikṣu deśapradeśopacāreṣu nimnonnatasamaviṣameṣu aparikhinnāśayo'viśraman samānacitto'vivartyavīryo'paryādattacetano'vismṛtakalyāṇamitrānuśāsanaḥsadākalyāṇamitrasamudācārahṛdayavāsanaḥ samantamukhavijñaptīndriyaḥ sarvapramādavigato visphāritakarṇacakṣuḥ sarvataḥ parigaveṣamāṇo'drākṣītsamantamukhaṃ nagaram /
analyzed: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhi dārakaḥ unanta buddha darśana avatīrṇaḥ nanta bodhisattva samavadhāna prāptaḥ nanta bodhisattva mārga naya avabhāsitaḥ unanta bodhisattva dharma naya abhiṣyandita niścita cittaḥ unanta bodhisattva adhimukti patha viśuddhiḥ ananta bodhisattva indriya avabhāsa pratilabdhaḥ unanta bodhisattva āśaya bala pratiṣṭhitaḥ unanta bodhisattva caryā anugata cetāḥ ananta bodhisattva praṇidhāna bala saṃjātaḥ unanta bodhisattva aparājita
translated: Then the merchant's son Sudhana, having seen infinite buddhas, having attained association with infinite bodhisattvas, having been illuminated by the path system of infinite bodhisattva practices, having a mind confirmed by being sprinkled with the path system of infinite bodhisattva dharmas, having purified the path of infinite bodhisattva aspirations, having attained the illumination of infinite bodhisattva faculties, having been established in the power of infinite bodhisattva resolve, having a mind following infinite bodhisattva practices, having been born from the power of infinite bodhisattva vows, having the invincible banner of infinite bodhisattva knowledge, having the cycle of the light of infinite bodhisattva wisdom, having attained the illumination of infinite bodhisattva dharmas, in due course he approached the region called Vetramula, and having arrived, he searched for the city Samantamukha in all directions and intermediate directions, in the regions and sub-regions, in the low, high, even and uneven places, with an unwearied mind, with an undistracted mind, with irreversible effort, with an uninterrupted intention, with an unconfused mind,

original: madhye vetramūlasya janapadasya daśānāṃ paṭṭanasahasrāṇāṃ nigamaṃ supariniṣṭhitaṃ dṛḍhaprākāramudviddhamaṣṭacatvaropaśobhitam /
analyzed: madhye vetramūlasya janapadasya daśānām paṭṭana sahasrāṇām nigamam su pariniṣṭhitam dṛḍha prākāram udviddham aṣṭa catvara upaśobhitam
translated: In the middle of the country of Vetramoolya, he saw a city with ten thousand markets, well-constructed, with strong walls, high, and adorned with eight gates.

analyzed: tasya madhye samantanetram gāndhikam adrākṣīt gāndhika vīthyām upaviṣṭam
translated: In the middle of that, he saw Samantanetra, the perfumer, sitting in the perfumers' street.

original: dṛṣṭvā ca yena samantanetro gāndhikastenopasaṃkramya samantanetrasya gāndhikasya pādau śirasābhivandya purataḥ prāñjaliḥ sthitvā evamāhamayā
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca yena samantanetraḥ gāndhikaḥ tena upasaṃkramya samantanetrasya gāndhikasya pādau śirasā abhivandya puratas prāñjaliḥ sthitvā evam āhamayā
translated: Having seen him, he approached Samantanetra, the perfumer, and having bowed his head at the feet of Samantanetra, the perfumer, he stood before him with palms joined in respect and said this:

analyzed: anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpāditam
translated: I have generated the mind of enlightenment for the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: na ca jānāmi kathaṃ bodhisattvena bodhisattvacaryāyāṃ śikṣitavyam /
analyzed: na ca jānāmi katham bodhisattvena bodhisattva caryāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: But I do not know how a bodhisattva should train in the bodhisattva conduct.

analyzed: katham pratipattavyam
translated: How should one practice?

analyzed: āha sādhu sādhu kula putra
translated: He said, Good, good, son of noble family!

analyzed: yena te anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpāditam
translated: That you have generated the mind of enlightenment for the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: ahaṃ kulaputra sarvasattvānāṃ vyādhīn prajānāmi vātasamutthānapi /🔽pittasamutthānapi /🔽śleṣmasamutthānapi /
analyzed: aham kula putra sarva sattvānām vyādhīn prajānāmi vāta samutthān api  pitta samutthān api  śleṣma samutthān api
translated: Son of noble family, I know the illnesses of all beings, those arising from wind,🔽those arising from bile,🔽those arising from phlegm,

analyzed: sa bhāga kṣubhitān api
translated: those arising from a combination of humors,

analyzed: para upakramitān api
translated: and those caused by others.

analyzed: amanuṣya vaikārikān api
translated: And those caused by non-human beings.

analyzed: viṣama para upakramikān api
translated: And those caused by the harm of others.

analyzed: vividha mantra śastra vetāla prayoga agni samutthān api
translated: And those caused by various spells, weapons, and vetala practices, and by fire.

analyzed: udaka saṃkṣobha samutthān api
translated: And those caused by agitation of the water.

analyzed: vividha bhayam saṃtrāsa saṃbhavān api
translated: And those arising from various fears and terrors.

original: teṣāṃ ca sarvavyādhīnāṃ praśamaṃ prajānāmiyaduta snehanaṃ prajānāmi /
analyzed: teṣām ca sarva vyādhīnām praśamam prajānāmi yat uta snehanam prajānāmi
translated: And I know the cure for all those diseases, namely, I know oleation,

original: vamanaṃ virecanamāsthāpanaṃ raktāvasecanaṃ nāsākarma karṣupariṇāhaṃ pariṣvedanamanulepanaṃ viṣapratighātaṃ bhūtagrahapratiṣedhaṃ bṛṃhaṇaṃ snapanaṃ saṃvāsanaṃ saṃvardhanaṃ varṇapariśodhanaṃ balasaṃjananaṃ prajānāmi /
analyzed: vamanam virecanam āsthāpanam rakta avasecanam nāsākarma karṣu pariṇāham pariṣvedanam anulepanam viṣa pratighātam bhūta graha pratiṣedham bṛṃhaṇam snapanam saṃvāsanam saṃvardhanam varṇa pariśodhanam bala saṃjananam prajānāmi
translated: I know emesis, purgation, asthapana, bloodletting, nasal therapy, reduction and expansion, sweating, ointments, counteracting poison, repelling elemental grahas, tonification, bathing, cohabitation, nourishing, purifying complexion, and generating strength.

original: ye kulaputra sattvā mamāntikamupasaṃkrāmanti daśabhyo digbhyaḥ /
analyzed: ye kula putra sattvāḥ mama antikam upasaṃkrāmanti daśabhyaḥ digbhyaḥ
translated: Those beings, son of noble family, who come to me from the ten directions,

analyzed: teṣām aham sarveṣām vyādhīn praśamayāmi
translated: I cure all their diseases.

original: vyādhipraśāntāṃśca susnātānuliptagātrān kṛtvā yathārhābharaṇavibhūṣitāṅgān yathārhavastrasaṃchāditaśarīrān vividhabhojanarasāgraiḥ saṃtarpya aparimitadhanasamṛddhān karomi /
analyzed: vyādhi praśāntān ca su snāta anulipta gātrān kṛtvā yathārha ābharaṇa vibhūṣita aṅgān yathārha vastra saṃchādita śarīrān vividha bhojana rasa agraiḥ saṃtarpya aparimita dhana samṛddhān karomi
translated: I make them bathe and anoint their bodies, adorn their limbs with appropriate ornaments, cover their bodies with appropriate garments, and satisfy them with the best flavors of various foods.

original: uttare caiṣāṃ rāgaprahāṇāya dharmaṃ deśayāmi aśubhopasaṃhāreṇa /🔽doṣaprahāṇāya dharmaṃ deśayāmi mahāmaitrīsaṃvarṇanatayā /
analyzed: uttare ca eṣām rāga prahāṇāya dharmam deśayāmi aśubha upasaṃhāreṇa  doṣa prahāṇāya dharmam deśayāmi mahā maitrī saṃvarṇana tayā
translated: And to the north, in order to abandon passion, I teach the Dharma to them through the practice of impurity.🔽In order to abandon hatred, I teach the Dharma through praising great loving-kindness.

analyzed: moha prahāṇāya dharmam deśayāmi dharma pravicaya prabheda pradarśana tayā
translated: In order to abandon delusion, I teach the Dharma through showing the distinctions of discriminating wisdom.

analyzed: sama bhāga caryā kleśa prahāṇāya dharmam deśayāmi
translated: In order to abandon the afflictions of practicing equally, I teach the Dharma.

analyzed: bodhi citta saṃbhava hetum paridīpayāmi
translated: I illuminate the cause for the arising of the mind of enlightenment through revealing the entrance to the knowledge of distinctions.

analyzed: sarva buddha guṇa dharma saṃprayukta kathā saṃprakāśana tayā mahā karuṇā saṃbhava hetum paridīpayāmi
translated: I illuminate the cause for the arising of great compassion through revealing the teaching that is connected with all the qualities of the Buddhas.

analyzed: aparimāṇa saṃsāra duḥkha saṃprakāśana tayā aparimita guṇa pratilābha saṃbhava hetum paridīpayāmi
translated: I illuminate the cause for attaining immeasurable qualities through revealing the immeasurable sufferings of saṃsāra.

analyzed: vipula puṇya jñāna saṃbhāra upacaya saṃvarṇana tayā mahāyāna praṇidhāna saṃbhava hetum paridīpayāmi
translated: I reveal the cause for the arising of the great vehicle's aspirations by praising the accumulation of vast merit and wisdom.

analyzed: sarva sattva paripāka vinaya saṃdarśana tayā samantabhadra bodhisattva caryā pratilābha saṃbhava hetum paridīpayāmi
translated: I reveal the cause for attaining the conduct of the bodhisattva Samantabhadra by showing the ripening and training of all beings.

analyzed: sarva kṣetra sarva kalpa saṃvāsa caryā jāla pravistaraṇa tayā lakṣaṇa anuvyañjana upacita buddha śarīra pratilābha saṃbhava hetum paridīpayāmi
translated: I reveal the cause for attaining the Buddha's body adorned with the major and minor marks by spreading the net of conduct abiding in all realms and kalpas.

analyzed: dāna pāramitā saṃvarṇana tayā sarvatragāminī tathāgata pariśuddhi pratilābha saṃbhava hetum paridīpayāmi
translated: I reveal the cause for attaining the purification of the Tathagata's all-pervading nature by praising the perfection of generosity.

analyzed: śīla pāramitā saṃprakāśana tayā acintya tathāgata rūpa varṇa viśuddhi saṃbhava hetum paridīpayāmi
translated: I reveal the cause for the arising of the inconceivable purification of the Tathagata's form and complexion by revealing the perfection of morality.

analyzed: kṣānti pāramitā saṃprakāśana tayā duryodhana tathāgata śarīra saṃbhava hetum paridīpayāmi
translated: I reveal the cause for the arising of the unassailable Tathagata's body by revealing the perfection of patience.

analyzed: vīrya pāramitā saṃprakāśana tayā abhibhūta anabhibhūta tathāgata ātmabhāva viśuddhim paridīpayāmi
translated: I reveal the purification of the Tathagata's body that is superior and unsurpassed by revealing the perfection of effort.

analyzed: dhyāna pāramitā saṃprakāśana tayā dharma śarīra viśuddhim paridīpayāmi
translated: By teaching the perfection of meditation, I illuminate the purification of the body of the Dharma.

analyzed: prajñāpāramitā saṃprakāśana tayā sarva jagat abhimukha buddha ātmabhāva viśuddhim paridīpayāmi  upāya kauśalya pāramitā saṃprakāśana tayā sarva kalpa kāla jagat citta saṃveśana śarīra viśuddhim paridīpayāmi  praṇidhāna pāramitā saṃprakāśana tayā sarva buddhakṣetra abhyudgata ātmabhāva viśuddhim paridīpayāmi
translated: By teaching the perfection of wisdom, I illuminate the purification of the Buddha's body that faces all beings.🔽By teaching the perfection of skillful means, I illuminate the purification of the body that enters the minds of all beings throughout all kalpas.🔽By teaching the perfection of vows, I illuminate the purification of the body that rises above all Buddha-fields.

analyzed: bala pāramitā saṃprakāśana tayā sarva jagat yathā āśaya saṃtoṣaṇa kāya pariśuddhim paridīpayāmi
translated: By teaching the perfection of power, I illuminate the purification of the body that satisfies all beings according to their wishes.

analyzed: jñāna pāramitā saṃprakāśana tayā parama śubha darśana kāya pariśuddhim paridīpayāmi
translated: By teaching the perfection of knowledge, I illuminate the purification of the body that is seen as supremely auspicious.

analyzed: yat uta sarva akuśala dharma vinivartana saṃprakāśana tayā
translated: Namely, by teaching the turning away from all unwholesome dharmas.

original: evaṃ caitān dharmadānena saṃgṛhya anantadhanaratnopacayopastabdhān kṛtvā visarjayāmi /
analyzed: evam ca etān dharma dānena saṃgṛhya ananta dhana ratna upacaya upastabdhān kṛtvā visarjayāmi
translated: Having thus gathered them with the gift of Dharma and established them in the accumulation of infinite wealth and jewels, I send them away.

original: api tu khalu punarahaṃ kulaputra sarvagandhadhūpavāsanānulepanayuktīḥ prajānāmi yaduta atulagandharājapramukhāḥ /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar aham kula putra sarva gandha dhūpa vāsanā anulepana yuktīḥ prajānāmi yat uta atula gandha rāja pramukhāḥ
translated: Moreover, noble sir, I know all the methods of perfuming with all the incenses, perfumes, and ointments, namely, those headed by the incomparable king of incenses,

original: sindhuvāritagandharājapramukhā ajitāvatigandharājapramukhā vibodhanagandharājapramukhā aruṇavatigandharājapramukhāḥ kālānusārigandharājapramukhā uragasāracandanagandharājapramukhā meghāgarugandharājapramukhā akṣobhyendriyagandharājapramukhāḥ sarvagandhayuktīḥ prajānāmi /
analyzed: sindhuvārita gandharāja pramukhāḥ ajitāvati gandharāja pramukhāḥ vibodhana gandharāja pramukhāḥ aruṇavati gandharāja pramukhāḥ kālānusāri gandharāja pramukhāḥ uragasāracandana gandharāja pramukhāḥ meghāgaru gandharāja pramukhāḥ akṣobhya indriya gandharāja pramukhāḥ sarva gandha yuktīḥ prajānāmi
translated: those headed by the king of incenses, the ocean’s foam, those headed by the king of incenses, the invincible, those headed by the king of incenses, the awakener, those headed by the king of incenses, the reddish, those headed by the king of incenses, the time-following, those headed by the king of incenses, the sandalwood of serpents, those headed by the king of incenses, the fragrant aloe, and those headed by the king of incenses, the unshakable sense of smell. I know all the methods of perfuming with all the incenses.

original: api tu khalu punarahaṃ kulaputra sarvasattvasaṃtoṣaṇasamantamukhabuddhadarśanapūjopasthānagandhabimbaṃ prajānāmi //
analyzed: api tu khalu punar aham kula putra sarva sattva saṃtoṣaṇa samanta mukha buddha darśana pūjā upasthāna gandha bimbam prajānāmi
translated: Moreover, noble sir, I know the image of the perfume that satisfies all beings, and by which they see the Buddhas face to face, and worship and serve them.
