translated: He saw that ten thousand people had gathered in front of him, who were like the wardens of hell, like the servants of Yama, holding weapons such as swords, axes, spears, javelins, clubs, and pikes, with distorted and misshapen faces and bodies, with red eyes, lips bitten, and brows furrowed, with terrifying and hideous forms that generated fear, with voices as loud as thunder, with radiant energy that was difficult to gaze upon, causing great fear, generating terror in the hearts of hundreds of thousands of beings, employed in punishing and restraining those who should be punished.

original: tatra bahūni prāṇiśatasahasrāṇi corāṇāṃ parasvāpahāriṇā parasattvabhogavipralopināṃ panthamoṣakāṇāṃ grāmanagaranigamaghoṣadāhakānāṃ kulaghātakānāṃ saṃdhicchedakānāṃ kilbiṣakāriṇāṃ garadāyakānāṃ ḍāmarikānāṃ manuṣyaghātakānāṃ paradārasevināṃ mithyāpratipannānāṃ duṣṭacetasāmabhidhyālūnāṃ vividhapāpakrūrakarmakāriṇāṃ gāḍhapañcabandhanabaddhāni analasya rājño'ntikamupanīyamānānyapaśyat /
analyzed: tatra bahūni prāṇi śata sahasrāṇi corāṇām para sva apahāriṇām para sattva bhoga vipralopinām pantha moṣakāṇām grāma nagara nigama ghoṣa dāhakānām kula ghātakānām saṃdhi chedakānām kilbiṣa kāriṇām gara dāyakānām ḍāmarikānām manuṣya ghātakānām para dāra sevinām mithyā pratipannānām duṣṭa cetasām abhidhyālūnām vividha pāpa krūra karma kāriṇām gāḍha pañcabandhana baddhāni analasya rājñaḥ ntikam upanīyamānāni apaśyat
translated: There he saw many hundreds of thousands of living beings, thieves who took the possessions of others, who destroyed the enjoyments of other beings, who robbed on the roads, who burned villages, towns, and markets, who killed families, who broke agreements, who committed evil deeds, who gave poison, who were violent, who killed humans, who had intercourse with others' wives, who practiced falsely, who had evil minds, who were covetous, who did various evil and cruel actions, who were bound tightly with five fetters, being led to King Anala.

analyzed: tebhyaḥ analam rājānam yathārha daṇḍam praṇayantam adrākṣīt
translated: He saw King Anala applying the appropriate punishment to them.

original: sa tatra rājño'nalasyājñayā keṣāṃciddhastapādacchedaṃ keṣāṃcit karṇanāsācchedaṃ keṣāṃciccakṣurutpāṭanaṃ keṣāṃcidaṅgapratyaṅgaśīrṣacchedanaṃ keṣāṃcit sarvaśarīramagninā pradīpyamānāṃ kāṃścicchinnavikṛtataptakṣārodakapariṣicyamānaśarīrān /
analyzed: sa tatra rājñaḥ analasya ājñayā keṣāṃcid hasta pāda chedam keṣāṃcid karṇa nāsā chedam keṣāṃcid cakṣuḥ utpāṭanam keṣāṃcid aṅga pratyaṅga śīrṣa chedanam keṣāṃcid sarva śarīram agninā pradīpyamānām kāṃścid chinna vikṛta tapta kṣāra udaka pariṣicyamāna śarīrān
translated: By King Anala's order, some had their hands and feet cut off, some had their ears and noses cut off, some had their eyes gouged out, some had their limbs, minor parts of the body, and heads cut off, some had their entire bodies set on fire, some had their bodies sprinkled with boiling caustic water, which was cut and distorted.

original: evamanekavidhāstīvrāḥ kharāḥ kaṭukā amanāpāḥ prāṇahāriṇīḥ kāraṇāḥ kāryamāṇā apaśyat /
analyzed: evam anekavidhāḥ tīvrāḥ kharāḥ kaṭukāḥ amanāpāḥ prāṇa hāriṇīḥ kāraṇāḥ kāryamāṇāḥ apaśyat
translated: In this way, he saw many kinds of severe, harsh, bitter, unpleasant, and life-taking tortures being inflicted.

analyzed: tasmin ca āghātane parvata pramāṇān kara caraṇa nayana karṇa nāsā śiraḥ oṅga pratyaṅga rāśīn apaśyat
translated: And in that slaughterhouse, he saw heaps of hands, feet, eyes, ears, noses, heads, limbs, and minor body parts the size of mountains.

analyzed: tri yojana gambhīram ca aneka yojana āyāma vistīrṇam śoṇita sarā udrākṣīt
translated: He saw a lake of blood, three yojanas deep and many yojanas wide and long.

original: tatra ca aṅgapratyaṅgaśirovikalāni mṛtakalevaraśatasahasrāṇi vṛkaśṛgālāśvakākagṛdhraśyenakurarabhairavākīrṇāni bhakṣyamāṇāni apaśyat /
analyzed: tatra ca aṅga pratyaṅga śiraḥ vikalāni mṛta kalevara śata sahasrāṇi vṛka śṛgāla aśva kāka gṛdhra śyena kurara bhairava ākīrṇāni bhakṣyamāṇāni apaśyat
translated: And there, he saw hundreds of thousands of headless torsos, limbs, and heads, infested with wolves, jackals, dogs, crows, vultures, hawks, curlews, and other birds, being devoured.

original: kānicinnīlāni ca nīlavarṇāni vipūyakāni vyādhmātakāni vipaṭumakāni paramavikṛtabībhatsānyapaśyat /
analyzed: kānicid nīlāni ca nīla varṇāni vipūyakāni vyādhmātakāni vipaṭumakāni parama vikṛta bībhatsāni apaśyat
translated: Some were blue, with blue complexions, rotting, bloated, and split open, extremely distorted and repulsive.

original: teṣāṃ ca vadhyānāṃ hanyamānānāṃ vividhāḥ kāraṇāḥ kāryamāṇānāṃ ghoramārtasvaraṃ krandatāṃ mahāntaṃ nirnādanirghoṣamaśrauṣīt mahāsaṃvegodvegasaṃjananaṃ tadyathā saṃghāte mahānarake //
analyzed: teṣām ca vadhyānām hanyamānānām vividhāḥ kāraṇāḥ kāryamāṇānām ghoram ārta svaram krandatām mahāntam nirnāda nirghoṣam aśrauṣīt mahā saṃvega udvega saṃjananam tat yathā saṃghāte mahā narake
translated: And he heard the terrible cries of lamentation and the great loud wailing of those being killed and slaughtered, as various tortures were inflicted upon them, generating great fear and terror, just as in the great Saṃghāta hell.

original: tasya tadatidārūṇabhairavakaraṃ paramavaiśasaṃ dṛṣṭvaivametadabhavatahaṃ ca sarvasattvahitasukhahetoranuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃprasthito bodhisattvacaryāparimārgaṇatatparaḥ kalyāṇamitrāṇi paripṛcchāmikiṃ bodhisattvena kuśalaṃ kartavyam /
analyzed: tasya tat ati dārūṇa bhairava karam parama vaiśasam dṛṣṭvā evam etat abhavata ham ca sarva sattva hita sukha hetoḥ anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃprasthitaḥ bodhisattva caryā parimārgaṇa tatparaḥ kalyāṇa mitrāṇi paripṛcchāmi kim bodhisattvena kuśalam kartavyam
translated: Having seen that extremely terrible and frightening great misfortune of his, he thought this: “I have set out for unsurpassed perfect enlightenment for the sake of the welfare and happiness of all beings, and am intent on seeking out the conduct of a bodhisattva. I ask spiritual friends: ‘What should a bodhisattva do that is wholesome?

analyzed: kim akuśalam parivarjayitavyam iti
translated: What unwholesome should be avoided?’

original: ayaṃ ca analo rājā kuśaladharmaparihīṇo mahāsāvadyakarmakārī praduṣṭamanaḥsaṃkalpaḥ parasattvajīvitoparodhāya pratipannaḥ parasattvotpīḍanatatparaḥ paralokanirapekṣo durgatiprapātābhimukhaḥ /
analyzed: ayam ca analaḥ rājā kuśala dharma parihīṇaḥ mahā sāvadya karma kārī praduṣṭa manaḥ saṃkalpaḥ para sattva jīvita uparodhāya pratipannaḥ para sattva utpīḍana tatparaḥ para loka nirapekṣaḥ durgati prapāta abhimukhaḥ
translated: But this King Anala is devoid of wholesome qualities, a doer of great evil deeds, with a corrupted mind and intentions, engaged in harming the lives of other beings, intent on oppressing other beings, indifferent to the next world, facing a fall into the lower realms.

analyzed: tad kṛtaḥ usmāt bodhisattva caryā śravaḥ bhaviṣyati iti
translated: From him I will receive instruction on the conduct of a bodhisattva.”

original: tasyaivaṃ cintāmanasikāraprayuktasya sarvasattvadhātuparitrāṇābhimukhasya vipulakarūṇāsaṃbhūtacetasa upari gaganatale devatā ityevamārocayāmāsuḥ na smarasi kulaputra jayoṣmāyatanasyarṣeḥ kalyāṇamitrānuśāsanīmiti /
analyzed: tasya evam cintā manasikāra prayuktasya sarva sattvadhātu paritrāṇa abhimukhasya vipula karūṇā saṃbhūta cetasaḥ upari gagana tale devatāḥ iti evam ārocayāmāsuḥ na smarasi kula putra jaya ūṣma āyatanasya ṛṣeḥ kalyāṇa mitra anuśāsanīm iti
translated: For him, thus engaged in reflection and mental attention, facing the protection of the entire realm of beings, with a mind arisen from vast compassion, the deities in the upper sky announced thus: Noble son, do you not remember the instruction of the sage Jyotishka, the spiritual friend?

analyzed: saḥ ūrdhva mukhaḥ gagana talam avalokya evam āha smarāmi iti
translated: He, looking up at the sky, said: I remember.

analyzed: devatāḥ prāhuḥ mā tvam kula putra
translated: The deities said: Do not, noble son,

analyzed: kalyāṇa mitra anuśāsanīṣu vicikitsām utpādaya
translated: give rise to doubt in the instructions of the spiritual friends.

original: samyak samena kalyāṇamitrāṇi praṇayanti na viṣameṇa /
analyzed: samyak samena kalyāṇa mitrāṇi praṇayanti na viṣameṇa
translated: The spiritual friends lead correctly, evenly, not unevenly.

analyzed: acintyam hi kula putra bodhisattvānām upāya kauśalya caryā jñānam
translated: For, noble son, the knowledge of the skillful means and conduct of the bodhisattvas is inconceivable.

analyzed: acintyam sarva sattva saṃgraha jñānam  acintyam sattva anugraha jñānam  acintyam sattva nigraha jñānam
translated: The knowledge of gathering all beings is inconceivable.🔽The knowledge of benefiting beings is inconceivable.🔽The knowledge of restraining beings is inconceivable.

analyzed: acintyam sattva pragraha jñānam  acintyam sattva saṃgraha jñānam  acintyam sattva pariśodhana jñānam
translated: The knowledge of guiding beings is inconceivable.🔽The knowledge of gathering beings is inconceivable.🔽The knowledge of purifying beings is inconceivable.

analyzed: acintyam sattva paripālana jñānam
translated: The knowledge of protecting beings is inconceivable.

analyzed: acintyam sattva avataraṇa jñānam  acintyam sattva paripācana jñānam
translated: the inconceivable knowledge of guiding beings;🔽the inconceivable knowledge of ripening beings;

analyzed: acintyam sattva vinaya jñānam
translated: the inconceivable knowledge of guiding beings;

analyzed: gaccha kula putra
translated: Go, son of noble family.

analyzed: paripṛccha enam bodhisattva caryām iti
translated: Ask him about the conduct of a bodhisattva.

original: atha sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhidārako devatāvacanamupaśrutya yena analo rājā tenopajagāma /
analyzed: atha sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhi dārakaḥ devatā vacanam upaśrutya yena analaḥ rājā tena upajagāma
translated: Then the merchant's son Sudhana, having heard the words of the deity, approached King Anala.

original: upetya analasya rājñaḥ pādau śirasābhivandya analaṃ rājānamanekaśatasahasrakṛtvaḥ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya purataḥ prāñjaliḥ sthitvā evamāhamayā ārya /
analyzed: upetya analasya rājñaḥ pādau śirasā abhivandya analam rājānam aneka śata sahasra kṛtvas pradakṣiṇīkṛtya puratas prāñjaliḥ sthitvā evam āham ayā ārya
translated: Having approached, he bowed his head at the feet of King Anala, circumambulated King Anala many hundreds of thousands of times, stood before him with palms joined, and said, Noble one,

analyzed: anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpāditam
translated: I have given rise to the mind of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: na ca jānāmi kathaṃ bodhisattvena bodhisattvacaryāyāṃ śikṣitavyam /
analyzed: na ca jānāmi katham bodhisattvena bodhisattva caryāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: But I do not know how a bodhisattva should train in the conduct of a bodhisattva,

analyzed: katham pratipattavyam
translated: how one should practice.

original: śrutaṃ ca me āryo bodhisattvānāmavavādānuśāsanīṃ dadātīti /
analyzed: śrutam ca me āryaḥ bodhisattvānām avavāda anuśāsanīm dadāti iti
translated: And I have heard, noble one, that you give instructions and teachings to bodhisattvas.

original: tadvadatu me āryaḥ kathaṃ bodhisattvena bodhisattvacaryāyāṃ śikṣitavyam /
analyzed: tat vadatu me āryaḥ katham bodhisattvena bodhisattva caryāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: Therefore, noble one, tell me how a bodhisattva should train in the conduct of a bodhisattva,

analyzed: katham pratipattavyam
translated: how one should practice.

original: atha khalvanalo rājā rājakāryāṇi kṛtvā utthāya siṃhāsanāt sudhanaṃ śreṣṭhidārakaṃ dakṣiṇena pāṇinā gṛhītvā tāladhvajaṃ rājadhānīṃ prāviśat /
analyzed: atha khalu analaḥ rājā rāja kāryāṇi kṛtvā utthāya siṃhāsanāt sudhanam śreṣṭhi dārakam dakṣiṇena pāṇinā gṛhītvā tāladhvajam rājadhānīm prāviśat
translated: Then King Anala, having performed his royal duties, rose from his lion throne, took the merchant's son Sudhana by the right hand, and entered the royal palace Tālaketu.

original: so'nupūrveṇa svaṃ gṛhamanupraviśya sudhanaṃ śreṣṭhidārakamantaḥpuraṃ praveśya bhadrāsane niṣadya evamāhavyavalokayasva kulaputra imaṃ mama gṛhaparibhogamiti /
analyzed: sa ūnupūrveṇa svam gṛham anupraviśya sudhanam śreṣṭhi dārakam antaḥpuram praveśya bhadrāsane niṣadya evam āha vyavalokayasva kula putra imam mama gṛha paribhogam iti
translated: He gradually entered his own house, brought the merchant's son Sudhana into the inner apartments, seated him on an excellent seat, and said this: Noble one, look at this enjoyment of my house.

original: sa vyavalokayannadrākṣīttadgṛhaṃ vipulaṃ vistīrṇaṃ saptaratnaprākāraparikṣiptaṃ vividhamaṇiratnaprāsādopaśobhitamanekaratnakūṭāgāraśatasahasrālaṃkṛtamacintyamaṇiratnaprabhājvālojjvalitatejasaṃ nānāmaṇiratnavividhavibhakticitravirājitalohitamuktāmayasamucchritastambhaṃ suprajñaptamusāragalvamayānekaratnaśatasahasravicitropaśobhitasiṃhāsanaṃ jyotīrasamaṇiratnasiṃhadhvajasamucchritaṃ vairocanaṃ maṇiratnavitānavitataṃ cintāmaṇivicitramahājālasaṃchannamasaṃkhyeyavicitramaṇiratnapratimaṇḍitaniryūhavyūhaṃ śītajalāśmagarbhamayapuṣkiriṇīsamupetaṃ sarvaratnadumayapaṅktiparivṛtam /
analyzed: sa vyavalokayan adrākṣīt tat gṛham vipulam vistīrṇam sapta ratna prākāra parikṣiptam vividha maṇi ratna prāsāda upaśobhitam aneka ratna kūṭāgāra śata sahasra alaṃkṛtam acintya maṇi ratna prabhā jvālā ujjvalita tejasam nānā maṇi ratna vividha vibhakti citra virājita lohita muktā maya samucchrita stambham su prajñapta musāragalva maya aneka ratna śata sahasra vicitra upaśobhita siṃhāsanam jyotīrasa maṇi ratna siṃhadhvaja samucchritam vairocanam maṇi ratna
translated: He saw that house, vast and spacious, surrounded by walls of the seven precious substances, adorned with palaces of various precious jewels, ornamented with hundreds of thousands of multi-storied mansions made of various jewels, blazing with the radiant light of inconceivable precious jewels, with pillars made of red pearls, adorned with various divisions of various precious jewels, with lion thrones made of coral, beautifully adorned with various precious substances, with banners of lion flags made of jyotirasa precious jewels, covered with canopies of vairocana precious jewels, covered with a great net of various wish-fulfilling jewels, with towers adorned with innumerable various precious jewels, surrounded by rows of trees made of all precious substances, with lotus ponds made of lapis lazuli, filled with cool water,

original: daśa cāsya strīkoṭīparivāramadrākṣīt abhirūpāṇāṃ prāsādikānāṃ darśanīyānāṃ paramaśubhavarṇapuṣkalatayā samanvāgatānāṃ sarvakalāvidhijñānāṃ pūrvotthāyinīnāṃ paścānnipātinīnāṃ maitracittānāṃ kiṃkaropacāvaravacanapratikāriṇīnām //
analyzed: daśa ca asya strī koṭī parivāram adrākṣīt abhirūpāṇām prāsādikānām darśanīyānām parama śubha varṇa puṣkala tayā samanvāgatānām sarva kalā vidhi jñānām pūrva utthāyinīnām paścānnipātinīnām maitra cittānām kiṃkara upacāvara vacana pratikāriṇīnām
translated: He saw that he had a retinue of ten million women who were beautiful, pleasant, and attractive, endowed with the most excellent and pure complexion, skilled in all arts and knowledge, who rose before him and retired after him, who were friendly, who carried out their duties with a pleasant countenance and speech.

original: atha khalvanalo rājā sudhanaṃ śreṣṭhidārakamevamāhatatkiṃ manyase kulaputra /
analyzed: atha khalu analaḥ rājā sudhanam śreṣṭhi dārakam evam āha tat kim manyase kula putra
translated: Then King Anala said to the merchant's son Sudhana, What do you think, noble sir?

analyzed: api tu pāpa kāriṇām evaṃrūpaḥ karma vipākaḥ abhinirvartate  evaṃrūpā ātma bhāva saṃpad
translated: Do the results of evil actions ripen in this way?🔽Is the perfection of the body like this?

analyzed: evaṃrūpā parivāra saṃpad  evaṃrūpā mahā bhoga saṃpad
translated: Is the perfection of the retinue like this?🔽Is the perfection of great enjoyments like this?

analyzed: evaṃrūpā mahā aiśvarya ādhipatya saṃpad
translated: Is the perfection of great power and sovereignty like this?

analyzed: āhano hi idam ārya
translated: He said, Yes, noble sir, it is so.

analyzed: sā uvocata aham kula putra māyā gatasya bodhisattva vimokṣasya lābhī
translated: He said, Noble sir, I have attained the bodhisattva liberation called 'the illusion-like attainment.'

original: ime ca kulaputra madviṣayavāsinaḥ sattvā yadbhūyasā prāṇātipātino'dattādāyinaḥ kāmamithyācāriṇo mṛṣāvādinaḥ paiśunikāḥ pārūṣikāḥ saṃbhinnapralāpino'bhidhyālambā vyāpannācittā mithyādṛṣṭayaḥ pāpakarmāṇo raudrāścaṇḍāḥ sāhasikā vividhākuśalakarmakriyāparigatāḥ /
analyzed: ime ca kula putra mad viṣaya vāsinaḥ sattvāḥ yat bhūyasā prāṇa atipātinā udatta ādāyinaḥ kāma mithyācāriṇaḥ mṛṣāvādinaḥ paiśunikāḥ pārūṣikāḥ saṃbhinna pralāpinaḥ bhidhyā ālambāḥ vyāpanna acittāḥ mithyādṛṣṭayaḥ pāpa karmāṇaḥ raudrāḥ caṇḍāḥ sāhasikāḥ vividha akuśala karma kriyā parigatāḥ
translated: “These beings who live in my realm, for the most part, are killers, thieves, adulterers, liars, slanderers, harsh-spoken, gossipers, covetous, malicious, and have wrong views. They are evil-doers, violent, cruel, and engaged in various unwholesome actions.

original: te na śakyante'nyathā pāpacaryāyā nivārayituṃ vinivartayitumanuśāsitum /
analyzed: te na śakyante inyathā pāpa caryāyāḥ nivārayitum vinivartayitum anuśāsitum
translated: They cannot be stopped, turned away, or instructed from their evil conduct in any other way.

original: so'haṃ kulaputra eṣāṃ sattvānāṃ damanāya paripācanāya vinayena hite saṃniyojanārthaṃ mahākaruṇāṃ puraskṛtya nirmitairvadhyaghātakairnirmitān vadhyapuruṣān ghātayāmi /
analyzed: saḥ uham kula putraḥ eṣām sattvānām damanāya paripācanāya vinayena hite saṃniyojana artham mahā karuṇām puraskṛtya nirmitaiḥ vadhya ghātakaiḥ nirmitān vadhya puruṣān ghātayāmi
translated: Therefore, noble sir, in order to subdue these beings, to ripen them, to discipline them, and to establish them in what is beneficial, I, placing great compassion at the forefront, have executioners who are magical creations execute men who are magical creations.

analyzed: nirmitaiḥ kāraṇā puruṣaiḥ nimitān akuśala karma patha kāriṇaḥ vividhāḥ kāraṇāḥ kārayāmi
translated: With men who are magical creations, I have those who have engaged in the unwholesome paths of action undergo various punishments.

analyzed: hasta pāda karṇa nāsā aṅga pratyaṅga śīrṣa cheda ādhikārikāḥ ca duḥkhāḥ tīvrāḥ vedanāḥ pratyanubhavamānān saṃdarśayāmi
translated: I show them suffering, intense feelings, and the cutting off of their hands, feet, ears, noses, limbs, and minor appendages, and the beheading of their heads.

original: tacca dṛṣṭvā ete madvijitavāsinaḥ sattvā labhante saṃvegam /🔽jāyate bhayam /
analyzed: tat ca dṛṣṭvā ete mad vijita vāsinaḥ sattvāḥ labhante saṃvegam  jāyate bhayam
translated: Seeing that, these beings who live in my realm become alarmed.🔽Fear arises.

analyzed: jāyate saṃtrāsaḥ
translated: Terror arises.

analyzed: bhavati ca eṣām chambhita tvam
translated: And they become frightened.

analyzed: yat uta pāpa karma vyāpatti vinivṛttaye
translated: In order to turn away from evil actions and misfortune.

original: so'haṃ kulaputra imān sattvānanenopāyenodvignottrastacittātmavivignamanaso viditvā daśabhyo'kuśalebhyaḥ karmapathebhyo vinivartya daśakuśalakarmapathasamanvāgatān kṛtvā atyantaniṣṭhe yogakṣeme sarvaduḥkhopacchede sarvajñatāsukhe pratiṣṭhāpayāmi /
analyzed: saḥ ham kula putraḥ imān sattvān anena upāyena udvigna uttrasta citta ātma vivigna manasaḥ viditvā daśabhyaḥ a kuśalebhyaḥ karma pathebhyaḥ vinivartya daśa kuśala karma patha samanvāgatān kṛtvā atyanta niṣṭhe yogakṣeme sarva duḥkha upacchede sarvajña tā sukhe pratiṣṭhāpayāmi
translated: Therefore, noble sir, having known that these beings are alarmed, frightened, and anxious by this method, I turn them away from the ten unwholesome courses of action and establish them in the ten wholesome courses of action, and I establish them in the happiness of omniscience, in the ultimate, in the bliss of liberation from all suffering.

original: nāhaṃ kulaputra kasyacit sattvasya viheṭhaṃ karomi kāyena vācā manasā va /

original: ahaṃ kulaputra tiryagyonigatasya saṃmūḍhasya antaśaḥ kuntapipīlikasya ekacittotpādenāpi duḥkhoparodhaṃ neccheyam /

analyzed: svapna antara gatasya api me kula putra akuśala dharma samudācāraḥ na utpadyate

analyzed: etasya aham kula putra

translated: know about the conduct or describe the qualities of those bodhisattvas who have attained the acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas, who follow the ways of existence like an illusion, who have perfected the bodhisattva conduct like an emanation, who are known in all worlds like a reflection, who have penetrated the nature of dharmas like a dream, who follow the way of the unobstructed Dharma realm, who follow the net of conduct like a magical display, whose sphere of knowledge is unobstructed, who have perfected the path of the samādhi of universal convergence, who have mastered the dhāraṇī of infinite turns, whose sphere of activity is connected to the domain of the buddhas?

translated: Then the merchant's son Sudhana bowed his head to the feet of King Anala, circumambulated King Anala many hundreds of thousands of times, looked back at him again and again, and left King Anala's presence.

analyzed: mahā prabhaḥ

translated: In all the directions, intermediate directions, paths, lowlands, highlands, even and uneven places, water and land paths, mountains, valleys, villages, towns, markets, countries,🔽kingdoms, and capital cities, with an undaunted mind, an untiring body, and a desire to search everywhere. analyzed: adya tam drakṣyāmi kalyāṇa mitram

translated: That great city was adorned with palaces of innumerable gold, jewels, and gems, with innumerable golden roofs of Jambūnada gold, covered with nets of vaiḍūrya jewels and inconceivable jewel arrays, with innumerable silver roofs, covered with nets of red pearls and inconceivable jewel arrays, with innumerable roofs of vaiḍūrya, covered with nets of various jewel treasuries and inconceivable jewel arrays, with innumerable crystal roofs, covered with nets of the king of jewels with a vast interior and inconceivable jewel arrays, with innumerable roofs of jewels that illuminate the world, covered with nets of the king of jewels with the interior of the sun and inconceivable jewel arrays, with innumerable sapphire jewels, covered with nets of the king of jewels with the radiance of glory and inconceivable jewel arrays, with innumerable roofs of the king of jewels of the ocean of the world, covered with nets of the king of jewels with the radiance of stars and inconceivable jewel arrays, with innumerable diamond roofs, covered with nets of the king of jewels with the invincible banner and inconceivable jewel arrays, and with nets of divine coral tree flowers.

translated: In the center of that great city of Suprabha, the palace of King Mahāprabha was constructed.

original: samantāccaturyojanaṃ parikṣepeṇa saptaratnamayaṃ saptabhirnānāratnamayībhirvedikābhiḥ parivṛtaṃ saptabhī ratnakiṅkiṇījālaiḥ manojñamadhuranirghoṣaiḥ samantādanuracitaṃ saptaratnamayībhiḥ saptatālapaṅktibhiranuparikṣiptamacintyanānāratnamayakūṭāgāravyūhaśatasahasrasamalaṃkṛtaṃ divyotpalapadmakumudapuṇḍarīkasaṃchāditasalilābhiraṣṭāṅgopetavāriparipūrṇābhiḥ suvarṇavālikāsaṃstīrṇatalābhiḥ sarvaratnapuṣpaphalavṛkṣapratimaṇḍitābhiḥ caturdikṣu suvibhaktaratneṣṭakānicitasopānābhiranekaratnamayībhiḥ puṣkariṇībhirupaśobhitaṃ divyamadhuramanojñanānāśakunigaṇakūjitamamarapatibhavanapratispardhi /
analyzed: samantāt catur yojanam parikṣepeṇa sapta ratna mayam saptabhiḥ nānā ratna mayībhiḥ vedikābhiḥ parivṛtam saptabhiḥ ratna kiṅkiṇī jālaiḥ manojña madhura nirghoṣaiḥ samantāt anuracitam sapta ratna mayībhiḥ sapta tāla paṅktibhiḥ anuparikṣiptam acintya nānā ratna maya kūṭāgāra vyūha śata sahasra samalaṃkṛtam divya utpala padma kumuda puṇḍarīka saṃchādita salilābhiḥ aṣṭāṅga upeta vāri paripūrṇābhiḥ suvarṇa vālikā saṃstīrṇa
translated: It was surrounded on all sides by a perimeter of four yojanas, made of the seven precious substances, encircled by seven jeweled terraces made of various precious substances, adorned all around with nets of jeweled bells emitting delightful and sweet sounds, surrounded by rows of seven jeweled palm trees, adorned with hundreds of thousands of arrays of inconceivable jeweled palaces made of various precious substances, with its waters covered with divine blue lotuses, lotuses, white lotuses, and red lotuses, filled with water possessing the eight qualities, with its bottom covered with golden sand, adorned with trees of various precious substances bearing flowers and fruits, with its steps made of various precious substances well-arranged in the four directions, beautified with many jeweled ponds, resounding with the delightful and sweet songs of various flocks of birds, rivaling the palace of the lord of the gods.

analyzed: madhye ca asya jagadrocana maṇi ratna kūṭāgāraḥ saṃsthitaḥ
translated: In the middle of it stood a palace made of the precious substance illuminating the world.

analyzed: citraḥ darśanīya usaṃkhyeya maṇi ratna acintya vyūha virājitaḥ rājñā mahāprabheṇa saddharmagañjaḥ sthāpitaḥ
translated: The treasury of the true Dharma was established by King Mahāprabha, adorned with an inconceivable array of various, beautiful, innumerable precious jewels.

original: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhidārako ratnaparikhāsvananunītacitto ratnaprākāreṣvavismayamāno ratnatālapaṅktiṣvarajyamāno ratnaghaṇṭākiṅkiṇījālaghoṣamanāsvādayan divyavādyarutasaṃgītimadhuranirghoṣeṣvasaktacittaḥ nānāvicitraratnavimānakūṭāgāraparibhogānamanasikurvan pramuditeṣu naranārīgaṇeṣu dharmārāmaratirato rūpaśabdagandharasasparśarativiviktacetā dharmanidhyaptiparamo yathābhigatasattvakalyāṇamitranirantaraparipṛcchanatayā anupūrveṇa yena nagaraśṛṅgāṭakaṃ tenopajagāma /
analyzed: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhi dārakaḥ ratna parikhāsu an anunīta cittaḥ ratna prākāreṣu a vismayamānaḥ ratna tāla paṅktiṣu a rajyamānaḥ ratna ghaṇṭā kiṅkiṇī jāla ghoṣam an āsvādayan divya vādya ruta saṃgīti madhura nirghoṣeṣu asakta cittaḥ nānā vicitra ratna vimāna kūṭāgāra paribhogān a manasikurvan pramuditeṣu nara nārī gaṇeṣu dharma ārāma rati rataḥ rūpa śabda gandha rasa sparśa rati vivikta cetāḥ dharma nidhi apti paramaḥ y
translated: Then the merchant's son Sudhana, with a mind not attached to the jeweled moats, not amazed by the jeweled ramparts, not infatuated with the rows of jeweled palm trees, not savoring the sound of the nets of jeweled bells and small bells, with a mind unattached to the sweet sounds of the divine musical instruments and songs, not paying attention to the various jeweled palaces and kūṭāgāras, devoted to the joy of delighting in the Dharma among the joyful crowds of men and women, with a mind detached from the joy of form, sound, smell, taste, and touch, supremely intent on penetrating the Dharma, having asked the spiritual friends of beings who had come in due course, in due order he approached the city square.

original: upetya samantādanuvilokayan adrākṣīnmahāprabhaṃ rājānaṃ madhye nagaraśṛṅgāṭakasya caityagṛhasya nātidūre mahāvyūhe bhadrāsane nīlavaiḍūryamaṇiratnapāde śvetavaiḍūryamaye siṃhapratiṣṭhite jāmbūnadasuvarṇasūtraśvetajāle divyātirekavicitraratnavastrasuprajñaptopacāre asaṃkhyeyaratnabimbaracitālaṃkāre acintyamaṇiratnavyūhajālasaṃchādite divyaratnanānābhaktivicitrajāmbūnadakanakapaṭṭavitānavitate cintārājamaṇiratnapadmagarbhe mahādharmāsane paryaṅkena niṣaṇṇam /
analyzed: upetya samantāt anuvilokayan adrākṣīt mahāprabham rājānam madhye nagara śṛṅgāṭakasya caitya gṛhasya na atidūre mahā vyūhe bhadrāsane nīla vaiḍūrya maṇi ratna pāde śveta vaiḍūrya maye siṃha pratiṣṭhite jāmbūnada suvarṇa sūtra śveta jāle divya atireka vicitra ratna vastra su prajñapta upacāre asaṃkhyeya ratna bimba racita alaṃkāre acintya maṇi ratna vyūha jāla saṃchādite divya ratna nānā bhakti vicitra jāmbūnada kanaka paṭṭa vitāna vitate c
translated: Approaching, he looked all around and saw King Mahāprabha sitting on a great lion throne not far from the caitya house in the center of the city, on a throne with legs of blue beryl gems, supported by white beryl lions, with a white jeweled net of gold from the Jambū River, on a seat with cushions of various wonderful jewels surpassing those of the gods, adorned with an array of countless jeweled images, covered with a net of inconceivable jeweled ornaments, with a canopy of golden cloth from the Jambū River, variegated with various jewels of the gods, on a great Dharma throne with a lion seat in the center of a jeweled lotus of wish-fulfilling gems.

analyzed: dvātriṃśat mahāpuruṣa lakṣaṇa alaṃkṛta śarīram  vicitra aśīti anuvyañjana upaśobhita gātram
translated: His body was adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great being.🔽His body was beautified with the eighty minor marks.

analyzed: kanaka parvatam iva nānā ratna vinyāsa virājitam  āditya maṇḍalam iva dīpta tejasam
translated: He was radiant like a golden mountain with various jewels.🔽He had the blazing splendor of the orb of the sun.

analyzed: pūrṇa candra maṇḍalam iva saumya darśanam
translated: He was pleasant to behold like the orb of the full moon.

analyzed: brahmāṇam iva brahma parṣadi virocamānam
translated: He shone in the assembly of Brahmas like Brahmā.

analyzed: sāgaram iva gambhīra dharma ananta guṇa ratna nicayam
translated: Like the ocean, with its depths, its endless qualities, and its treasures of jewels.

analyzed: mahā megham iva varṣa svabhāva nirghoṣam
translated: Like a great cloud, with its rain and its thunder.

analyzed: gaganam iva dharma naya jyotiḥ gaṇa pratimaṇḍitam
translated: Like the sky, adorned with the multitude of stars of the teachings and methods.

analyzed: sumerum iva cāturvarṇa sattva sāgara citta pratibhāsa prāptam
translated: Like Mount Sumeru, the source of reflections in the minds of the oceans of beings of the four continents.

analyzed: ratna dvīpam iva vividha jñāna ratna ākīrṇa talam
translated: Like an island of jewels, its surface strewn with various jewels.

analyzed: puratas ca asya anekān suvarṇa maṇi muktā vaiḍūrya śaṅkha śilā pravāla jātarūpa rajata ratna rāśīn  nānā ratna divya vastra ratna rāśīn
translated: In front of him, he saw many heaps of gold, jewels, pearls, beryl, conch shells, quartz, coral, natural gold, silver, and jewels.🔽Heaps of various jewel-like divine garments.

analyzed: vividha divya ratna ābharaṇa rāśīn
translated: Heaps of various divine jewel ornaments.

analyzed: nānā bhakṣya bhojya rāśīn
translated: Various kinds of food and drink.

analyzed: vividha rasa agra viśeṣa nicayān  nānā vyūha viṣaya sthāpitān apaśyat
translated: Accumulations of various supreme flavors.🔽Arranged in various arrays.

analyzed: anekāni ca divya ratha ratna koṭī śata sahasrāṇi  anekāni divya tūrya koṭī śata sahasrāṇi
translated: He saw many hundreds of thousands of millions of divine jewel chariots.🔽Many hundreds of thousands of millions of divine musical instruments.

analyzed: anekāni divya gandha prākāra koṭī śata sahasrāṇi  anekān glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkārān
translated: Many hundreds of thousands of millions of divine fragrant walls.🔽Many provisions for treating the sick.

analyzed: anekān sarva upakaraṇa viśeṣa rāśīn
translated: Many heaps of various special utensils.

original: kalpikānanavadyān yathābhiprāyasattvaparibhogāya /🔽anekāni ca gośatasahasrāṇi suvarṇaśṛṅgakhurāṇi kaṃsadohāni daridrāṇāṃ sattvānāṃ saṃgrahāya sthāpitānyapaśyat /
analyzed: kalpikān anavadyān yathā abhiprāya sattva paribhogāya  anekāni ca go śata sahasrāṇi suvarṇa śṛṅga khurāṇi kaṃsa dohāni daridrāṇām sattvānām saṃgrahāya sthāpitāni apaśyat
translated: He saw that he had established many hundreds of thousands of cows with golden horns and hooves, whose milk was to be used for the poor.

original: anekāni ca kanyākoṭīniyutaśatasahasrāṇi abhirūpāṇi prāsādikāni darśanīyāni sarvābharaṇavibhūṣitāni divyāmbaradharāṇi divyoragasāracandanānuliptagātrāṇi catuḥṣaṣṭikalāvidhijñāni sarvakāmacaryopacārakuśalāni sthāpitānyapaśyat /
analyzed: anekāni ca kanyā koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi abhirūpāṇi prāsādikāni darśanīyāni sarva ābharaṇa vibhūṣitāni divya ambara dharāṇi divya uraga sāra candana anulipta gātrāṇi catuḥṣaṣṭi kalā vidhi jñāni sarva kāma caryā upacāra kuśalāni sthāpitāni apaśyat
translated: He saw that he had established many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of girls, who were beautiful, pleasing, and attractive, adorned with all ornaments, wearing divine garments, their bodies anointed with divine uragasāra sandalwood, skilled in the sixty-four arts, and skilled in the conduct and service of all desires.

original: yathā cāsya puratastathā sarvarathyācatvaraśṛṅgāṭakadvāravīthimukheṣu ekaikasyāṃ rathyāyāmubhayorantaryorviṃśativyomakakoṭīḥ sarvopakaraṇaparipūrṇaiḥ sthāpitā yaduta sattvasaṃgrahāya sattvaparigrahāya sattvaprītisaṃjananāya sattvaprāmodyotpādanāya sattvamanaḥsaṃprasādanāya sattvacittaprahlādanāya sattvakleśavyupaśamāya sarvadharmasvabhāvārthasaṃniyojanāya sattvasarvajñatāsamānārthokaraṇāya sattvaparadrohacittavinivartanāya sarvakāyavāgduścaritavinivartanāya sattvadṛṣṭiśalyasamuddharaṇāya sattvakarmapathapariśuddhaye //
analyzed: yathā ca asya puratas tathā sarva rathyā catvara śṛṅgāṭaka dvāra vīthi mukheṣu ekaikasyām rathyāyām ubhayoḥ antaryoḥ viṃśati vyomaka koṭīḥ sarva upakaraṇa paripūrṇaiḥ sthāpitāḥ yat uta sattva saṃgrahāya sattva parigrahāya sattva prīti saṃjananāya sattva prāmodya utpādanāya sattva manaḥ saṃprasādanāya sattva citta prahlādanāya sattva kleśa vyupaśamāya sarva dharma svabhāva artha saṃniyojanāya sattva sarvajña tā samāna arthaḥ karaṇāya
translated: Just as in front of him, in the same way, on each street, in each square, at each intersection, at each gate, and at each entrance to an alley, on both sides of the street, he had established twenty million celestial palaces filled with all kinds of implements, for the purpose of gathering beings, for the purpose of caring for beings, for the purpose of generating joy in beings, for the purpose of producing delight in beings, for the purpose of causing the minds of beings to become clear, for the purpose of gladdening the minds of beings, for the purpose of alleviating the afflictions of beings, for the purpose of establishing beings in the meaning of the nature of all phenomena, for the purpose of bringing beings to the same goal as omniscience, for the purpose of turning beings away from the intention to harm others, for the purpose of turning beings away from all misconduct of body and speech, for the purpose of extracting the dart of false views from beings, and for the purpose of purifying the path of action of beings.

original: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhidārako mahāprabhasya rājñaḥ sarvaśarīreṇa praṇipatya mahāprabhaṃ rājānamanekaśatasahasrakṛtvaḥ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya purataḥ prāñjaliḥ sthitvā evamāhamayā ārya anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittamutpāditam /
analyzed: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhi dārakaḥ mahāprabhasya rājñaḥ sarva śarīreṇa praṇipatya mahāprabham rājānam aneka śata sahasra kṛtvas pradakṣiṇīkṛtya puratas prāñjaliḥ sthitvā evam āham ayā ārya anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpāditam
translated: Then Sudhana, the head merchant's son, having bowed his whole body to King Mahāprabha, circumambulated King Mahāprabha many hundreds of thousands of times, and standing in front of him with palms joined, said this: Noble one, I have generated the mind of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: na ca jānāmi kathaṃ bodhisattvena bodhisattvacaryāyāṃ śikṣitavyam /
analyzed: na ca jānāmi katham bodhisattvena bodhisattva caryāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: But I do not know how a bodhisattva should train in bodhisattva conduct.

analyzed: katham pratipattavyam
translated: How should one practice?

original: śrutaṃ ca me āryo bodhisattvānāmavavādānuśāsanīṃ dadātīti /
analyzed: śrutam ca me āryaḥ bodhisattvānām avavāda anuśāsanīm dadāti iti
translated: And I have heard, noble one, that you give instructions and teachings to bodhisattvas.

original: tadvadatu me āryaḥkathaṃ bodhisattvena bodhisattvacaryāyāṃ śikṣitavyam /
analyzed: tat vadatu me āryaḥ katham bodhisattvena bodhisattva caryāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: Therefore, noble one, tell me how a bodhisattva should train in bodhisattva conduct.

original: kathaṃ pratipattavyam /🔽āhaahaṃ kulaputra mahāmaitrīdhvajāṃ bodhisattvacaryāṃ pariśodhayāmi /
analyzed: katham pratipattavyam  āha aham kula putra mahā maitrī dhvajām bodhisattva caryām pariśodhayāmi
translated: How should one practice?

analyzed: paripūrayāmi
translated: He said, Noble one, I am purifying and fulfilling the bodhisattva conduct called the banner of great love.

original: eṣā ca me kulaputra mahāmaitrīdhvajā bodhisattvacaryā anekeṣāṃ buddhaśatānāmanekeṣāṃ buddhasahasrāṇāmanekeṣāṃ buddhakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrāṇāṃ yāvadanabhilāpyānabhilāpyānāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāmantikāt paripṛṣṭā paripraśnīkṛtā viśodhitā vyūhitā vilokitā vicāritā anugaveṣitā paryanviṣṭā vicitritā vipulīkṛtā /
analyzed: eṣā ca me kula putra mahā maitrīdhvajā bodhisattva caryā anekeṣām buddha śatānām anekeṣām buddha sahasrāṇām anekeṣām buddha koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇām yāvat anabhilāpya anabhilāpyānām buddhānām bhagavatām antikāt paripṛṣṭā paripraśnīkṛtā viśodhitā vyūhitā vilokitā vicāritā anugaveṣitā paryanviṣṭā vicitritā vipulīkṛtā
translated: “Noble one, I have asked this bodhisattva conduct, which is the banner of great love, of many hundreds of buddhas, many thousands of buddhas, many hundreds of thousands of buddhas, many millions of buddhas, many tens of millions of buddhas, many billions of buddhas, many tens of billions of buddhas, many trillions of buddhas, and so on, up to many unspeakable numbers of buddhas, and I have purified it, expanded it, contemplated it, analyzed it, followed it, searched for it, examined it, diversified it, and extended it.”

original: so'haṃ kulaputra asyāṃ mahāmaitrīdhvajāyāṃ bodhisattvacaryāyāṃ sthitvā dharmeṇa rājyamanuśāsāmi /🔽dharmeṇa lokamanugṛhṇāmi /
analyzed: saḥ ham kula putra asyām mahā maitrīdhvajāyām bodhisattva caryāyām sthitvā dharmeṇa rājyam anuśāsāmi  dharmeṇa lokam anugṛhṇāmi
translated: “Noble one, abiding in this bodhisattva conduct, which is the banner of great love, I rule my kingdom through the Dharma.🔽I benefit the world through the Dharma.

analyzed: dharmeṇa lokam anuvicarāmi  dharmeṇa sattvān praṇayāmi
translated: I conduct myself in the world through the Dharma.🔽I love beings through the Dharma.

analyzed: dharmeṇa sattveṣu pratipadye
translated: I practice in relation to beings through the Dharma.

analyzed: dharmamaṇḍale sattvān āvartayāmi  dharma nayam sattvānām upasaṃharāmi  dharmeṇa sattvān paribhāvayāmi
translated: I bring beings into the Dharma maṇḍala.🔽I cause beings to take up the Dharma method.🔽I contemplate beings through the Dharma.

analyzed: dharma pratipattau sattvān niyojayāmi
translated: I engage beings in the practice of the Dharma.

analyzed: dharma svabhāva nidhi aptau sattvān pratiṣṭhāpayāmi
translated: I establish beings in the realization of the nature of phenomena.

original: maitracittatāyāṃ mahāmaitryādhipatye maitrībale hitacittatāyāṃ sukhacittatāyāṃ dayācittatāyāmanugrahacittatāyāṃ sattvānugrahacittatāyāṃ sattvaparigrahānutsargacittatāyāṃ sarvaduḥkhavinivartanapraṇidhyanupacchedacittatāyāmatyantasukhapratiṣṭhāpanasamudācārān pratiprasrabdhaye sattvān pratiṣṭhāpayāmi /
analyzed: maitra citta tāyām mahāmaitrī ādhipatye maitrī bale hita citta tāyām sukha citta tāyām dayā citta tāyām anugraha citta tāyām sattva anugraha citta tāyām sattva parigraha an utsarga citta tāyām sarva duḥkha vinivartana praṇidhi an upaccheda citta tāyām atyanta sukha pratiṣṭhāpana samudācārān pratiprasrabdhaye sattvān pratiṣṭhāpayāmi
translated: I establish beings in the practice of the mind of loving kindness, in the supremacy of great loving kindness, in the power of loving kindness, in the mind of benefit, in the mind of happiness, in the mind of compassion, in the mind of assistance, in the mind of benefiting beings, in the mind of not abandoning the embrace of beings, in the mind of the vow to turn away from all suffering, and in the mind of uninterrupted practice of establishing beings in ultimate happiness.

original: āśrayaṃ caiṣāṃ prahlādayāmi /🔽prasrabdhisukhasaṃjananatayā cittalatāṃ caiṣāṃ vyāvartayāmi /
analyzed: āśrayam ca eṣām prahlādayāmi  prasrabdhi sukha saṃjanana tayā cittala tām ca eṣām vyāvartayāmi
translated: I delight in their support.🔽And by generating the bliss of tranquility, I turn away their mind's clinging.

analyzed: saṃsāra rati prasaṅgāt citta saṃtatim ca eṣām pariṇāmayāmi
translated: I transform their mind-stream from attachment to the pleasures of saṃsāra.

analyzed: dharma ārāma ratyām viśodhayāmi  sarva akuśala dharmebhyaḥ pariśodhayāmi
translated: I purify them in the joy of delighting in the Dharma.🔽I purify them from all unwholesome qualities.

analyzed: sarva akuśala dharmebhyaḥ vinivartayāmi
translated: I turn them away from all unwholesome qualities.

analyzed: saṃsāra srotasaḥ āvartayāmi
translated: I turn them back from the stream of saṃsāra.

analyzed: dharmadhātu naya samudreṣu citta avidyām ca eṣām nirdahāmi sarva bhava gati upapatti vyavacchedāya
translated: I burn away the ignorance in their minds in order to cut off all their rebirths in existences and destinies.

analyzed: citta arciṣā āśayam ca eṣām saṃjanayāmi sarvajña tā phala pratilābhāya
translated: I generate the aspiration in their minds for the light of wisdom in order that they may attain the fruit of omniscience.

analyzed: citta sāgaram ca eṣām prasādayāmi asaṃhārya śraddhā bala saṃjananāya
translated: I purify the ocean of their minds in order to generate the power of unshakable faith.

original: evamāhaṃ kulaputra maitrīdhvajāyāṃ bodhisattvacaryāyāṃ sthitvā dharmeṇa lokamanuśāsāmi /🔽na khalu kulaputra madvijitavāsinaḥ sattvā mamāntikādbhayaṃ trāsaṃ chambhitatvaṃ romaharṣaṇaṃ vā nirgacchanti /
analyzed: evam ā aham kula putra maitrīdhvajāyām bodhisattva caryāyām sthitvā dharmeṇa lokam anuśāsāmi  na khalu kula putra mad vijita vāsinaḥ sattvāḥ mama antikāt bhayam trāsam chambhita tvam romaharṣaṇam vā nirgacchanti
translated: “Noble one, in that way, remaining in the bodhisattva conduct that is bannered by love, I rule the world through the Dharma.🔽Noble one, the beings who live in my realm do not leave me out of fear, terror, fright, or horripilation.

original: ye ca kulaputra daridrāḥ sattvā vividhopakaraṇavikalā māmupasaṃkrāmanti annārthino vā pānārthino vā vastrārthino vā yāvat sarvārthino vā /
analyzed: ye ca kula putra daridrāḥ sattvāḥ vividha upakaraṇa vikalāḥ mām upasaṃkrāmanti anna arthinaḥ vā pāna arthinaḥ vā vastra arthinaḥ vā yāvat sarva arthinaḥ vā
translated: “Noble one, the poor beings who are lacking in various necessities, who come to me seeking food, drink, clothing, and so on, up to all necessities,

original: tānahaṃ pūrvaparicitāneva vivṛtān rājakośān gṛhṇīdhvamityapyanujānāmi yasyārthe yūyaṃ pāpakaṃ karma ārabhetha prāṇivadhaṃ vā adattādānaṃ vā kāmamithyācāraṃ vā mṛṣāvādaṃ vā paiśunyaṃ vā pāruṣyaṃ vā saṃbhinnapralāpaṃ vā abhidhyāṃ vā vyāpādaṃ vā mithyādṛṣṭiṃ vā tadanyāni vā vividhāni dṛṣṭikṛtānyabhiniviśetha /
analyzed: tān aham pūrva paricitān eva vivṛtān rāja kośān gṛhṇīdhvam iti api anujānāmi yasya arthe yūyam pāpakam karma ārabhetha prāṇi vadham vā adatta ādānam vā kāma mithyā ācāram vā mṛṣāvādam vā paiśunyam vā pāruṣyam vā saṃbhinna pralāpam vā abhidhyām vā vyāpādam vā mithyādṛṣṭim vā tad anyāni vā vividhāni dṛṣṭi kṛtāni abhiniviśetha
translated: I also allow you to take from the open royal treasuries those things that you have previously known, for the sake of which you would engage in evil actions, such as killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, false speech, slander, harsh speech, frivolous speech, covetousness, ill-will, wrong view, or other various views.

original: ataḥ tasmāt suprabhānmahānagarānnagaradvārebhyo vīthirathyāmukhacatvaraśṛṅgāṭakebhyo yo yenārthī sa taṃ gṛhṇātu /
analyzed: atas tasmāt suprabhāt mahā nagarāt nagara dvārebhyaḥ vīthi rathyā mukha catvara śṛṅgāṭakebhyaḥ yaḥ yena arthī sa tam gṛhṇātu
translated: Therefore, from the city gates of this great city of Suprabha, from the streets, crossroads, and intersections, let anyone who needs anything take it.

analyzed: pūrva dattam eva yat tat mayā iti
translated: It is already given by me.

original: ye khalu punaḥ kulaputra suprabhamahānagarābhyantaranivāsinaḥ sattvāḥ /
analyzed: ye khalu punar kula putra suprabha mahā nagara abhyantara nivāsinaḥ sattvāḥ
translated: Moreover, O son of noble family, all the beings who dwell within the great city of Suprabha,

analyzed: sarve te bodhisattvāḥ mahāyāna saṃprasthitāḥ
translated: they are all bodhisattvas who have set out in the Great Vehicle.

analyzed: teṣām yathā āśaya pariśuddhyā idam suprabham mahā nagaram ābhāsam āgacchati
translated: According to the purity of their intentions, this great city of Suprabha appears to them.

original: yaduta keṣāṃcit parīttaṃ keṣāṃcidvipulaṃ keṣācinmṛttikātalaṃ keṣācidvaiḍūryamaṇiratnasaṃstṛtatalaṃ keṣācinmṛttikāprākāraṃ keṣāṃcidaparājitavastradhvajavastraratnamahāprākāraparikṣiptaṃ keṣāṃcidākīrṇaśarkarakaṭhallamutkūlanikūlaṃ śvabhraprapātabahulam /🔽keṣāṃcidanekamahāmaṇiratnasaṃstṛtatalaṃ kṛtopacāraṃ samapāṇitalajātam /
analyzed: yat uta keṣāṃcid parīttam keṣāṃcid vipulam keṣāṃcid mṛttikā talam keṣāṃcid vaiḍūrya maṇi ratna saṃstṛta talam keṣāṃcid mṛttikā prākāram keṣāṃcid aparājita vastra dhvaja vastra ratna mahā prākāra parikṣiptam keṣāṃcid ākīrṇa śarkara kaṭhallam utkūla nikūlam śvabhra prapāta bahulam  keṣāṃcid aneka mahā maṇi ratna saṃstṛta talam kṛta upacāram sama pāṇi tala jātam
translated: Some saw it as small, some as vast, some as having a ground of earth, some as having a ground covered with lapis lazuli jewels, some as having earthen walls, some as surrounded by great walls of invincible cloth banners and cloth jewels, some as strewn with sand and gravel, uneven and full of holes and precipices,🔽some as having a ground covered with many great jewels, well-arranged, level like the palm of a hand.

analyzed: keṣāṃcid asaṃkhyeya ratna bhavana vimāna prāsāda kūṭāgāra harmya tala niryūha gavākṣa jāla ardhacandrasiṃha pañjara maṇi vicitra darśanīyam ābhāsam āgacchati
translated: Some saw it as having countless jewel palaces, mansions, and pavilions, with terraces, upper floors, and windows, lattice windows, half-moons, and lion turrets, adorned with various jewels, appearing beautiful.

original: bahirnagaranivāsināmapi śuddhāśayānāṃ kṛtakuśalamūlānāṃ paryupāsitabahubuddhotpādānāṃ sarvajñatābhimukhānāṃ sarvajñatāpratiśaraṇānāṃ ratnamayamābhāsamāgacchati
analyzed: bahis nagara nivāsinām api śuddha āśayānām kṛta kuśala mūlānām paryupāsita bahu buddha utpādānām sarvajña tā abhimukhānām sarvajña tā pratiśaraṇānām ratna mayam ābhāsam āgacchati
translated: Even those living outside the city, of pure intention, who had planted roots of merit, served many Buddhas, were intent on omniscience, and had taken refuge in omniscience, saw it as made of jewels.

original: ye mayā pūrvaṃ bodhisattvacaryāyāṃ caratā caturbhiḥ saṃgrahavastubhiḥ saṃgṛhītāḥ /
analyzed: ye mayā pūrvam bodhisattva caryāyām caratā caturbhiḥ saṃgraha vastubhiḥ saṃgṛhītāḥ
translated: Those whom I previously gathered through the four means of gathering disciples while practicing the conduct of a bodhisattva.

analyzed: mat anyeṣām mṛṇmaya ābhāsam āgacchati
translated: For others, it appears as if made of clay.

original: yadā ca kulaputra madvijatavāsinaḥ sattvā deśapradeśeṣu grāmanagaranigamarāṣṭrarājadhānīṣu pañcakaṣāye loke kālasvabhāvasaṃkṣobhitān daśākuśalānāṃ
analyzed: yadā ca kula putra mad vijata vāsinaḥ sattvāḥ deśa pradeśeṣu grāma nagara nigama rāṣṭra rājadhānīṣu pañca kaṣāye loke kāla svabhāva saṃkṣobhitān daśā kuśalānām
translated: When, noble sir, the beings living in my realm, in the countries, regions, villages, towns, cities, states, and capitals, in the world of the five degenerations, are agitated by the nature of the times, and engage in the ten unwholesome courses of action,

original: tadāhaṃ teṣāmanugrahāya mahāmaitrīpūrvaṃgamaṃ lokendriyāvartaṃ nāma bodhisattvasamādhiṃ samāpadye /
analyzed: tadā aham teṣām anugrahāya mahā maitrī pūrvaṃgamam lokendriyāvartam nāma bodhisattva samādhim samāpadye
translated: then, in order to benefit them, I attain the bodhisattva absorption called 'the ocean of the faculties of the lords of the world,' which is preceded by great loving kindness.

original: samanantarasamāpannasya ca me kulaputra imaṃ samādhim /
analyzed: samanantara samāpannasya ca me kula putraḥ imam samādhim
translated: Immediately upon attaining this absorption, noble sir,

original: atha teṣāṃ sattvānāṃ tāni bhayāni te upasargāḥ tāni vairāṇi te vigrahavivādāḥ te cittasaṃkṣobhāḥ tāni vihiṃsācittāni praśamanti vyupaśamanti nivartante nirudhyante tadyathāpi tadasyaiva mahāmaitrīpūrvaṃgamasya lokendriyāvartasya bodhisattvasamādhidharmatāpratilābhena /
analyzed: atha teṣām sattvānām tāni bhayāni te upasargāḥ tāni vairāṇi te vigraha vivādāḥ te citta saṃkṣobhāḥ tāni vihiṃsā cittāni praśamanti vyupaśamanti nivartante nirudhyante tat yathā api tat asya eva mahā maitrī pūrvaṃgamasya loka indriya āvartasya bodhisattva samādhi dharmatā pratilābhena
translated: then those fears, those calamities, those hostilities, those disputes and disagreements, those mental disturbances, those thoughts of violence of those beings are pacified, subside, cease, and are extinguished, just like the attainment of the nature of the bodhisattva absorption called 'the ocean of the faculties of the lords of the world,' which is preceded by great loving kindness.

analyzed: api tu kula putra
translated: But, son of noble family,

analyzed: āgamaya muhūrtam yāvat pratyakṣībhaviṣyasi
translated: wait a moment until you see it with your own eyes.”

original: atha khalu mahāprabho rājā tasyāṃ velāyāṃ mahāmaitrīpūrvaṃgamaṃ lokendriyāvartaṃ bodhisattvasamādhiṃ samāpannaḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu mahāprabhaḥ rājā tasyām velāyām mahā maitrī pūrvaṃgamam loka indriya āvartam bodhisattva samādhim samāpannaḥ
translated: Then at that time King Mahāprabha entered the bodhisattva samādhi called “The Wheel of the World-Controlling Lord,” which is preceded by great loving-kindness.

translated: at that very moment the great city of Suprabha, with its regions and districts, its villages, towns, markets, countries, states, and royal capitals, shook in six ways.

translated: As it shook, those jeweled walls, jeweled palaces, jeweled chambers, and jeweled houses,

analyzed: ratna bhavanāni ratna vimānāni ratna kūṭāgārāṇi ratna niryūhāḥ ratna harmyāṇi ratna gavākṣāḥ ratna vedikāḥ ratna toraṇāni ratna ardhacandrāḥ ratna siṃhapañcarāṇi ratna khoṭakāni ratna bimbāni ratna vitānāni ratna sūtra kiṅkiṇī jālāni ratna ghaṇṭāḥ ratna dhvajāḥ ratna patākāḥ ratna tālāḥ saṃpracalitāḥ saṃpragarjitāḥ saṃghaṭṭitāḥ
translated: The jeweled palaces, jeweled aerial palaces, jeweled multi-storied buildings, jeweled terraces, jeweled mansions, jeweled windows, jeweled platforms, jeweled archways, jeweled half-moons, jeweled lion-thrones, jeweled turrets, jeweled mirrors, jeweled canopies, jeweled nets with bells, jeweled bells, jeweled banners, jeweled flags, and jeweled palm trees shook, roared, and clashed.

original: te ca saṃghadṛmānā valgu manojñaṃ śravaṇīyaṃ śabdamanuravanto yena rājā mahāprabhaḥ /🔽tenāvanamanti sma /
analyzed: te ca valgu manojñam śravaṇīyam śabdam anuravantaḥ yena rājā mahā prabhaḥ  tena avanamanti sma

analyzed: praṇamanti sma

analyzed: ye ca te suprabhasya mahā nagara abhyantara vāsinaḥ
translated: And all those who lived inside the great city of Suprabha,

analyzed: ye ca asya vijita vāsinaḥ sattvāḥ sarva grāma nagara nigama janapada rāṣṭra rājadhānīṣu
translated: And all the beings who lived in his realm, in all the villages, towns, markets, countries, regions, and capital cities,

translated: All of them, their bodies and minds delighted, filled with joy and gladness, bowed to King Mahāprabha.

analyzed: ye ca tiryagyoni gatāḥ sattvāḥ
translated: And all the beings in the animal realm,

original: te'pi sarve anyonyamaitracittā hitacittā yena rājā mahāprabhastenābhipraṇatāḥ /
analyzed: te api sarve anyonya maitra cittāḥ hita cittāḥ yena rājā mahāprabhaḥ tena abhipraṇatāḥ
translated: they too, all of them, with friendly minds, benevolent minds, bowed to King Mahāprabha.

analyzed: yāni ca parvata śikharāṇi tad anye ca api unnatāḥ pṛthivī pradeśāḥ
translated: And the mountain peaks and other elevated parts of the earth,

analyzed: te api sarve yena rājā mahā prabhaḥ tena abhinatāḥ
translated: they too all bowed to King Mahāprabha.

original: ye ca puṣpavṛkṣāḥ phalavṛkṣāḥ patravṛkṣā bījagrāmabhūtagrāmaśasyatṛṇagulmauṣadhivanaspatayo vā /
analyzed: ye ca puṣpa vṛkṣāḥ phala vṛkṣāḥ patra vṛkṣāḥ bīja grāma bhūta grāma śasya tṛṇa gulma oṣadhi vanaspatayaḥ vā
translated: And the flower trees, fruit trees, leaf trees, seeds, grains, crops, grasses, bushes, herbs, and forest trees,

translated: they too all bowed to King Mahāprabha.

translated: And all the ponds, lakes, pools, streams, rivers, lotus ponds, and springs in his realm,

analyzed: tāni api sarvāṇi yena rājā mahāprabhaḥ tena abhimukham vegam prāmuñcan
translated: they too all released their current in the direction of King Mahāprabha.

analyzed: daśa ca nāga rāja sahasrāṇi mahā kāla agaru dhūpa paṭala gandha udaka meghaiḥ vicitra vidyut latā jvālā avabhāsitaiḥ abhigarjadbhiḥ sūkṣmābhiḥ gandha udaka dhārābhiḥ caturdiśam abhiprāvarṣan
translated: And ten thousand nāga kings, with clouds of fragrant water perfumed with the incense of black agaru, illuminated by the flickering light of various lightning bolts, rumbling, and with fine streams of fragrant water, rained down in the four directions.

translated: And ten thousand devaputras, headed by Śakra, Suyāma, Santuṣita, Sunirmita, and Vaśavartin, the kings of the gods, went into the sky.🔽It was adorned with the loud and vast sound of the resounding of many quintillions of divine musical clouds.🔽It was adorned with the pleasant and sweet sound of the resounding of the clouds of the divine songs of countless hosts of celestial nymphs.

analyzed: asaṃkhyeya divya vicitra ratna puṣpa megha pravarṣaṇa alaṃkāram  asaṃkhyeya nānā varṇa divya gandha pravarṣaṇa alaṃkāram

analyzed: asaṃkhyeya divya ratna vicitra mālya megha pravarṣaṇa alaṃkāram  asaṃkhyeya nānā varṇa divya cūrṇa megha pravarṣaṇa alaṃkāram
translated: It was adorned with the rain of clouds of countless divine garlands of various jewels.🔽It was adorned with the rain of clouds of countless powders of various colors.

analyzed: asaṃkhyeya divya ratna vicitra ābharaṇa megha pravarṣaṇa alaṃkāram
translated: It was adorned with the rain of clouds of countless divine ornaments of various jewels.

analyzed: asaṃkhyeya divya ratna vastra vicitra vimala sūkṣma nānā varṇa megha pravarṣaṇa alaṃkāram
translated: an adornment raining clouds of countless divine jewels, garments, various colors, pure and fine, in various patterns;

analyzed: asaṃkhyeya divya ratna nānā vicitra chatra megha pravarṣaṇa alaṃkāram
translated: an adornment raining clouds of countless divine jewels, various and wonderful parasols;
