analyzed: asaṃkhyeya apsaraḥ gaṇa divya tūrya saṃgīti madhura manojña nirghoṣa saṃprayukta stuti megha saṃchādita abhipravarṣaṇa alaṃkāram sarva gagana talam adhyatiṣṭhat acintya nāga indra vṛṣabhitā vikurvita prabhāvena
translated: The entire sky was filled with clouds of praise accompanied by the sweet and delightful sounds of the music of innumerable celestial maidens and various celestial instruments, raining down, adorned with the inconceivable power of the miraculous manifestations of the supreme king of elephants.

original: asaṃkhyeyāni ca rākṣasendraśatasahasrāṇi jaladharanivāsīni cāturdvīpikalokadhātvadhiṣṭhānadharaṇitalanivāsīni ca māṃsarudhirabhakṣāṇi jalacaramṛgapaśupakṣigavāśvagajagardabhanaranārīgaṇojohārīṇi praduṣṭamanaḥsaṃkalpāni nityaṃ jagadviheṭhāvihiṃsāpratipannāni sarvāṇi paramamaitrahitacittāni suprasannamukhavarṇāni sarvajagadavihiṃsāviheṭhāparamāṇi paralokasāpekṣāṇi kṛtāñjalipuṭāni paramaprīticittāni yena rājā mahāprabhastenābhipraṇatānyabhūvan /
analyzed: asaṃkhyeyāni ca rākṣasa indra śata sahasrāṇi jaladhara nivāsīni cāturdvīpika lokadhātu adhiṣṭhāna dharaṇi tala nivāsīni ca māṃsa rudhira bhakṣāṇi jalacara mṛga paśu pakṣi gava aśva gaja gardabha nara nārī gaṇa ujaḥ hārīṇi praduṣṭa manaḥ saṃkalpāni nityam jagat viheṭhā vihiṃsā pratipannāni sarvāṇi parama maitra hita cittāni su prasanna mukha varṇāni sarva jagat avihiṃsā viheṭhā paramāṇi para loka sāpekṣāṇi kṛta añjali p
translated: Countless hundreds of thousands of Rākṣasa lords, those who dwell in the ocean, those who dwell in the four continents, those who dwell on the surface of the earth, those who feed on flesh and blood, those who devour the vital essence of aquatic animals, deer, cattle, horses, elephants, donkeys, men, and women, those with malicious intentions, those who are always engaged in harming and injuring the world, all of them became supremely loving and benevolent, with cheerful facial expressions, intent on non-harming and non-injury towards all beings, concerned about the next world, with palms joined in reverence, and with supremely joyful minds, they bowed to King Mahāprabha.

original: atulyaṃ ca kāyikacaitasikamudāraṃ sukhaṃ pratyanubhavanti sma /
analyzed: atulyam ca kāyika caitasikam udāram sukham pratyanubhavanti sma
translated: And they experienced an incomparable, vast, and blissful physical and mental state.

original: anekāni ca yakṣakumbhāṇḍapiśācabhūtādhipatiśatasahasrāṇi paramamaitrahitacittāni suprasannamukhavarṇāni sarvajagadavihiṃsāviheṭhāparamāṇi paralokasāpekṣāṇi kṛtāñjalipuṭāni paramaprīticittāni yena rājā mahāprabhaḥ /
analyzed: anekāni ca yakṣa kumbhāṇḍa piśāca bhūta adhipati śata sahasrāṇi parama maitra hita cittāni su prasanna mukha varṇāni sarva jagat avihiṃsā viheṭhā paramāṇi para loka sāpekṣāṇi kṛta añjali puṭāni parama prīti cittāni yena rājā mahā prabhaḥ
translated: And many hundreds of thousands of yakṣas, kumbhāṇḍas, piśācas, and bhūta lords, with supremely loving and helpful minds, with very joyful facial complexions, intent on non-harming and non-violence towards all beings, concerned about the next world, with palms joined, with supremely joyful minds, approached King Mahāprabha.

analyzed: tena abhipraṇatāni abhūvan
translated: They bowed down to him.

original: atulyaṃ ca kāyikacaitasikamudāraṃ sukhaṃ pratyanubhavanti sma /
analyzed: atulyam ca kāyika caitasikam udāram sukham pratyanubhavanti sma
translated: And they experienced an incomparable, vast, physical and mental bliss.

original: evaṃ sarvāvatyāṃ cāturdvīpikāyāṃ lokadhātau sarvasattvānāṃ sarvabhayopadravopasargavairavigrahavivādāścittasaṃkṣobhāvihiṃsācittāni praśāmyanti vyupaśāmyanti vinivartante nirudhyante pratyudāvartante /
analyzed: evam sarvāvatyām cāturdvīpikāyām lokadhātau sarva sattvānām sarva bhaya upadrava upasarga vaira vigraha vivādāḥ citta saṃkṣobha avihiṃsā cittāni praśāmyanti vyupaśāmyanti vinivartante nirudhyante pratyudāvartante
translated: In the same way, in the entire four-continent world system, all the fears, calamities, afflictions, enmities, disputes, mental disturbances, and thoughts of violence of all beings were pacified, subsided, ceased, stopped, and turned back.

analyzed: yathā cāturdvīpikāyām lokadhātau
translated: And just as in the four-continent world system,

original: evaṃ sarvasyāṃ trisāhasramahāsāhasrāyāṃ lokadhātau yāvaddaśasu dikṣu daśalokadhātukoṭīniyutaśatasahasreṣu sarvasattvānāṃ sarvabhayopadravopasargavairavigrahavivādāścittasaṃkṣobhāḥ pāpavihiṃsācittāni praśāntānyabhūvan /
analyzed: evam sarvasyām tri sāhasra mahā sāhasrāyām lokadhātau yāvat daśasu dikṣu daśa lokadhātu koṭī niyuta śata sahasreṣu sarva sattvānām sarva bhaya upadrava upasarga vaira vigraha vivādāḥ citta saṃkṣobhāḥ pāpa vihiṃsā cittāni praśāntāni abhūvan
translated: In the same way, in the entire great trichiliocosm, up to the ten directions, in the hundred thousand quintillion world systems, all the fears, calamities, misfortunes, enmities, disputes, mental disturbances, sinful and harmful thoughts of all beings were pacified.

analyzed: vyupaśāntāni vinivṛttāni niruddhāni pratyudāvartāni abhūvan
translated: They were calmed, ceased, stopped, and turned away.

original: yaduta mahāmaitrīpūrvaṃgamasya lokendriyāvartasya bodhisattvasamādherdharmatāpratilambhena //🔽atha khalu mahāprabho rājā tasmātsamādhervyūtthāya sudhanaṃ śreṣṭhidārakametadavocatetamahaṃ kulaputra /
analyzed: yat uta mahā maitrī pūrvaṃgamasya loka indriya āvartasya bodhisattva samādheḥ dharmatā pratilambhena  atha khalu mahāprabhaḥ rājā tasmāt samādheḥ vyūtthāya sudhanam śreṣṭhi dārakam etat avocat itam aham kula putra
translated: This was due to the attainment of the nature of the bodhisattva samādhi called the whirlpool of the lords of the world, which is preceded by great loving-kindness.

original: mahāmaitrīdhvajaṃ bodhisattvacaryājñānālokamukhaṃ prajānāmi /🔽kiṃ mayā śakyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāmaitryapramāṇacchatrāṇāṃ sarvalokadhātusukhāśayaspharaṇatayā /
analyzed: mahā maitrī dhvajam bodhisattva caryā jñāna āloka mukham prajānāmi  kim mayā śakyam bodhisattvānām mahā maitrī apramāṇa chatrāṇām sarva lokadhātu sukha āśaya spharaṇa tayā
translated: Then, the king Mahāprabha, having risen from that samādhi, said to the merchant's son Sudhana: Noble one, I know this bodhisattva conduct, the gateway to the light of knowledge, called the banner of great loving-kindness.🔽What can I, a bodhisattva, do? I am a bodhisattva with the immeasurable parasol of great loving-kindness, who fills the entire world system with a blissful intention.

analyzed: sarva jagat parivārāṇām abhinna parivāra tayā
translated: I am a bodhisattva with an unbroken retinue, whose retinue is the entire world.

analyzed: sarva jagat paritrāṇa prasṛtānām hina utkṛṣṭa madhyama sama prayoga tayā
translated: Of those who are engaged in saving all beings, by their practice of inferior, superior, and middling means.

analyzed: dharaṇi sama maitra cittānām sarva jagat saṃdhāraṇa pratipanna tayā
translated: Of those whose loving minds are like the earth, by their engagement in supporting all beings.

analyzed: pūrṇa candra maṇḍala samānānām sarva jagat sama prasṛta puṇya jñāna raśmīnām āditya maṇḍala samānānām sarva jñeya jñāna āloka avabhāsana tayā
translated: Of those who are like the full moon, by their rays of merit and knowledge that extend equally to all beings, and who are like the orb of the sun, by their illumination of all knowable things with the light of knowledge.

analyzed: mahā pradīpa kalpānām sarva sattva citta gahana andhakāra vidhamana tayā  udaka prasādaka maṇi ratna sadṛśānām sarva sattva citta sa raḥ māyā śāṭya kāluṣya apanayana tayā
translated: Of those who are like a great lamp, by their dispelling the darkness in the depths of the minds of all beings.🔽Of those who are like a water-purifying jewel, by their removing the turbidity and impurities in the lakes of the minds of all beings.

analyzed: cintārāja maṇi ratna sadṛśānām sarva jagat abhiprāya praṇidhi paripūraṇa tayā
translated: Of those who are like the wish-fulfilling jewel, by their fulfilling the wishes and aspirations of all beings.🔽Of those who are like a great wind, by their establishing all beings in the great city of omniscience, which is the abode of all meditative concentrations and meditative attainments.

original: mahāmārutasadṛśānāṃ sarvajagatsamādhisamāpattibhavanasarvajñatāmahāpuraparisaṃsthāpanatayā caryāṃ jñātuṃ guṇān vā vaktum /🔽puṇyaparvato vā tulayitum /
analyzed: mahāmāruta sadṛśānām sarva jagat samādhi samāpatti bhavana sarvajña tā mahā pura parisaṃsthāpana tayā caryām jñātum guṇān vā vaktum  puṇya parvataḥ vā tulayitum
translated: To know their conduct or describe their qualities,🔽or to weigh the mountain of their merit,

analyzed: guṇa jyotiḥ gaṇa gaganam vā avalokayitum
translated: or to behold the sky of the multitude of their jewel-like qualities.

analyzed: mahā praṇidhi vāyu maṇḍalam vā paricchettum
translated: to measure the wind circle of great vows,

analyzed: dharma sama tā balam vā pramātum
translated: to fathom the power of the equality of phenomena,

analyzed: mahāyāna vyūha varṇān vā paridīpayitum
translated: to illuminate the descriptions of the adornments of the Great Vehicle,

analyzed: samantabhadra caryā naya viśeṣān vā vaktum
translated: to speak of the special ways of conduct of Samantabhadra,

analyzed: mahā bodhisattva samādhi bhāvanā dvāram vā vivaritum
translated: to open the door of meditation on the great bodhisattva concentrations,

analyzed: mahā karuṇā meghān vā saṃvarṇayitum
translated: or to praise the clouds of great compassion.

analyzed: gaccha kula putra
translated: Go, son of noble family.

analyzed: iyam iha eva dakṣiṇāpathe sthirā nāma rājadhānī
translated: Here, in the southern region, there is a capital city called Sthira.

analyzed: tatra acalā nāma upāsikā prativasati
translated: There lives a laywoman named Acalā.

analyzed: tām upasaṃkramya paripṛccha katham bodhisattvena bodhisattva caryāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: Approach her and ask how a bodhisattva should train in bodhisattva conduct.

analyzed: katham pratipattavyam
translated: How should one practice?

original: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhidārako mahāprabhasya rājñaḥ pādau śirasābhivandya mahāprabhaṃ rājānamanekaśatasahasrakṛtvaḥ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya punaḥ punaravalokya mahāprabhasya rājño'ntikāt prakrāntaḥ // //
analyzed: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhi dārakaḥ mahāprabhasya rājñaḥ pādau śirasā abhivandya mahāprabham rājānam aneka śata sahasra kṛtvas pradakṣiṇīkṛtya punar punar avalokya mahāprabhasya rājñaḥ ntikāt prakrāntaḥ  /
translated: Then the merchant's son Sudhana bowed his head to the feet of King Mahāprabha, circumambulated King Mahāprabha many hundreds of thousands of times, looked at him again and again, and left King Mahāprabha's presence.

analyzed: acalā
translated: Acalā.

original: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhidārakaḥ suprabhānmahānagarānniṣkramya muhūrtaṃ mārgamanusṛtya mahāprabhasya rājño'nuśāsanīmanuvicintayan /
analyzed: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhi dārakaḥ suprabhāt mahā nagarāt niṣkramya muhūrtam mārgam anusṛtya mahāprabhasya rājñaḥ anuśāsanīm anuvicintayan
translated: Then the merchant's son Sudhana left the great city of Suprabha, followed the road for a while, and reflected on the instructions of King Mahāprabha.

analyzed: tam mahā maitrī dhvajam bodhisattva caryā nayam anusmaran
translated: He remembered that bodhisattva conduct and method, the banner of great love.

analyzed: tam loka indriya āvarta mahā samādhi mukha ālokam paribhāvayan
translated: He contemplated that great light of the samādhi gateway that turns the faculties of the world leaders.

analyzed: tām acintyām bodhisattva kāya viśuddhi alaṃkāra siṃhāsana vyūha vimātra tām abhinirharamāṇaḥ
translated: He manifested that inconceivable variety of the lion throne's array, adorned with the purity of the bodhisattvas' bodies.

analyzed: tām acintyām bodhisattva praṇidhi puṇya ādhipateya bala tām anubṛṃhayan
translated: He increased that inconceivable power of the bodhisattvas' vows and merit.

analyzed: tam acintyam bodhisattvānām sattva paripāka jñāna nayam dṛḍhīkurvāṇaḥ  tām a cintyām a sādhāraṇām bodhisattva paribhoga māhātmya tām anuvicintayan
translated: He made firm that inconceivable method of the bodhisattvas' knowledge of ripening beings.🔽He contemplated that inconceivable greatness of the bodhisattvas' uncommon enjoyment.

analyzed: tām acintyām bodhisattva adhimātra tām nimittīkurvan
translated: He took as a sign that inconceivable greatness of the bodhisattvas.

analyzed: tām acintyām bodhisattvānām sattva paripāka viśuddhim anusmaran
translated: He remembered that inconceivable purity of the bodhisattvas' ripening of beings.

analyzed: tām acintyām bodhisattva parivāra saṃpad pariśuddhim avakalpayan
translated: Contemplating that inconceivable purity of the assembly of bodhisattvas,

original: tamacintyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ sattvakāryanidhyānālokanayamadhimucyamānaḥ pratilebhe cittaprītiprasādavegaṃ cittapraharṣaṃ cittotplavaṃ cittanandīṃ cittānāvilatāṃ cittaprabhāsvaratāṃ cittadṛḍhatāṃ cittavipulatāṃ cittāparyādanatām /
analyzed: tam acintyam bodhisattvānām sattva kārya nidhyāna ālokanayam adhimucyamānaḥ pratilebhe citta prīti prasāda vegam citta praharṣam citta utplavam citta nandīm citta anāvila tām citta prabhāsvara tām citta dṛḍha tām citta vipula tām citta a paryādana tām
translated: and having faith in that inconceivable method of the bodhisattvas' contemplation of the light of the welfare of beings, he attained a surge of mental joy and faith, mental delight, mental buoyancy, mental bliss, mental clarity, mental brilliance, mental firmness, mental vastness, and mental inexhaustibility.

original: sa evaṃ kalyāṇamitrānusmṛtimanasikāraprayukto'śrūṇi pravartayan anuvicintayāmāsaaho batedaṃ kalyāṇamitradarśanaṃ sarvaguṇaratnākarabhūtaṃ sarvabodhisattvacaryāpariśodhanaparipūraṇaṃ sarvabodhisattvasmṛtiviśuddhikaraṃ sarvabodhisattvadhāraṇīmaṇḍalapariśodhanaṃ sarvabodhisattvasamādhyālokasaṃjananaṃ sarvabuddhadarśanapratilābhasaṃbhāvanaṃ sarvabuddhadharmameghasaṃpravarṣaṇaṃ sarvabodhisattvapraṇidhinayasūcanamacintyaprajñājñānālokasaṃjananaṃ dṛḍhabodhisattvendriyāṅkuravivardhanam paritrāyakā mama kalyāṇamitrāḥ sarvadurgatiprapātagatibhyaḥ /🔽praṇetāro mama kalyāṇamitrā dharmasamatānayānugamena /
analyzed: saḥ evam kalyāṇa mitra anusmṛti manasikāra prayukta uśrūṇi pravartayan anuvicintayāmāsa aho bata idam kalyāṇa mitra darśanam sarva guṇa ratna ākara bhūtam sarva bodhisattva caryā pariśodhana paripūraṇam sarva bodhisattva smṛti viśuddhi karam sarva bodhisattva dhāraṇī maṇḍala pariśodhanam sarva bodhisattva samādhi āloka saṃjananam sarva buddha darśana pratilābha saṃbhāvanam sarva buddha dharma megha saṃpravarṣaṇam sarva bodhisattva praṇidhi naya sūcan praṇetāraḥ mama kalyāṇa mitrāḥ dharma samatā naya anugamena
translated: The spiritual friends are my protectors from all the falls and paths of the lower realms.🔽The spiritual friends are my guides by following the path of the equality of phenomena.

analyzed: darśayitāraḥ mama kalyāṇa mitrāḥ mārga sama viṣa tāyāḥ
translated: The spiritual friends are my teachers of the equality of the path.

analyzed: paridīpakāni mama kalyāṇa mitrāṇi mahāyānasya
translated: The spiritual friends are my illuminators of the Great Vehicle.

original: avavādakāni mama kalyāṇamitrāṇi samantabhadrabodhisattvacaryāyām /🔽deśayitṝṇi mama kalyāṇamitrāṇi sarvajñatānagaramārgasya /
analyzed: avavādakāni mama kalyāṇa mitrāṇi samantabhadra bodhisattva caryāyām  deśayitṝṇi mama kalyāṇa mitrāṇi sarvajña tā nagara mārgasya
translated: My spiritual teachers are my spiritual friends in the practice of the conduct of the bodhisattva Samantabhadra.🔽My spiritual teachers are my spiritual friends in the path to the city of omniscience.

analyzed: praveśayitṝṇi mama kalyāṇa mitrāṇi sarvajña tā puram
translated: My spiritual teachers are my spiritual friends in entering the city of omniscience.

original: avatārakāṇi mama kalyāṇamitrāṇi dharmadhātunayasāgare /🔽ālokakarāṇi mama kalyāṇamitrāṇi tryadhvajñeyasāgaranayasya /
analyzed: avatārakāṇi mama kalyāṇa mitrāṇi dharmadhātu naya sāgare  āloka karāṇi mama kalyāṇa mitrāṇi tri adhva jñeya sāgara nayasya
translated: My spiritual teachers are my spiritual friends in the ocean of the way of the dharma realm.🔽My spiritual teachers are my spiritual friends in the way of the ocean of knowledge of the three times.

analyzed: darśayitṝṇi mama kalyāṇa mitrāṇi sarva artha maṇḍala gaṇasya
translated: My spiritual teachers are my spiritual friends in showing the entire assembly of the orb of meaning.

analyzed: vivardhayitāraḥ mama kalyāṇa mitrāḥ sarva śukla dharmāṇām
translated: My spiritual teachers are my spiritual friends in increasing all virtuous dharmas.

original: tasyaivaṃ rudataḥ krandataḥ paridevamānasya gagatalagatā devagaṇāḥ sadānubaddhāśca saṃcodakā buddhadūtā bodhisattvadevatā evamāhukalyāṇamitrānuśāsanīpratipannasya kulaputra bodhisattvasya buddhā bhagavanto'bhirādhitacittā bhavanti /
analyzed: tasya evam rudataḥ krandataḥ paridevamānasya gaga tala gatāḥ deva gaṇāḥ sadā anubaddhāḥ ca saṃcodakāḥ buddha dūtāḥ bodhisattva devatāḥ evam āhu kalyāṇa mitra anuśāsanī pratipannasya kula putra bodhisattvasya buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ abhirādhita cittāḥ bhavanti
translated: While he was thus weeping, crying, and lamenting, the hosts of gods in the sky and the constantly attendant admonishers, the messengers of the buddhas, the deities of the bodhisattvas, said this: The buddhas, the blessed ones, are pleased with the bodhisattva, O son of noble family, who practices in accordance with the instructions of the spiritual teachers.

analyzed: kalyāṇa mitra vacana aviloma sthāyinaḥ bodhisattvasya sarvajña tā āsannībhavati
translated: For a bodhisattva who does not go against the words of the spiritual friend, omniscience becomes near.

analyzed: kalyāṇa mitra vacana a vicikitsakasya bodhisattvasya āsannībhavanti kalyāṇa mitrāṇi
translated: For a bodhisattva who does not doubt the words of the spiritual friend, the spiritual friends become near.

analyzed: kalyāṇa mitra manasikāra avirahitasya bodhisattvasya sarva arthāḥ abhimukhībhavanti
translated: For a bodhisattva who is not separated from the mental attention of the spiritual friend, all aims become manifest.

analyzed: gaccha kula putra
translated: Go, son of noble family!

analyzed: yena sthirāyām rājadhānyām acalā upāsikā
translated: To the capital city of Sthira, to the upāsikā Acalā.

analyzed: tatas śroṣyasi bodhisattva caryām
translated: There you will hear about the conduct of a bodhisattva.

original: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhidārakastataḥ samādhijñānālokād vyutthāya anupūrveṇa yena sthirā rājadhānī tenopasaṃkramya acalāmupāsikāṃ parimārgati parigaveṣate /
analyzed: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhi dārakaḥ tatas samādhi jñāna ālokāt vyutthāya anupūrveṇa yena sthirā rājadhānī tena upasaṃkramya acalām upāsikām parimārgati parigaveṣate
translated: Then the merchant's son Sudhana, having arisen from that light of the knowledge of concentration, gradually went to the capital city of Sthira and searched for the upāsikā Acalā, seeking her.

original: tasya mahājanakāya upadarśayatieṣā kulaputra acalopāsikā svaniveśane mātāpitṛsabhāginī kumārabhūtā svajñātigaṇaparivṛtā mahato janakāyasya dharmaṃ deśayati //
analyzed: tasya mahā jana kāyaḥ upadarśayati eṣā kula putra acala upāsikā sva niveśane mātā pitṛ sabhāginī kumāra bhūtā sva jñāti gaṇa parivṛtā mahataḥ jana kāyasya dharmam deśayati
translated: A great crowd of people showed him, saying, Son of noble family, this upāsikā Acalā, in her own dwelling, together with her mother and father, as a young girl, surrounded by her relatives, is teaching the Dharma to a great crowd of people.

original: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhidārako mahāprītiprasādaprāmodyaparisphuṭacetā yena acalāyā upāsikāyā niveśanaṃ tenopajagāma /
analyzed: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhi dārakaḥ mahā prīti prasāda prāmodya parisphuṭa cetāḥ yena acalāyāḥ upāsikāyāḥ niveśanam tena upajagāma
translated: Then the merchant's son Sudhana, his mind filled with great joy, faith, and delight, went to the house of the laywoman Achala.

original: upetya acalāyā upāsikāyā niveśanadvāre sthito'paśyat sarvaṃ taṃ niveśanaṃ suvarṇavarṇayā ābhayā sphuṭamavabhāsitaṃ kāyacittaprahlādinyā /
analyzed: upetya acalāyāḥ upāsikāyāḥ niveśana dvāre sthitā upaśyat sarvam tam niveśanam suvarṇa varṇayā ābhayā sphuṭam avabhāsitam kāya citta prahlādinyā
translated: Having arrived, he stood at the door of the laywoman Achala's house and saw that entire house filled with light, shining with a golden color, delighting body and mind.

original: samanantaraspṛṣṭasya ca sudhanasya śreṣṭhidārakasya tayā prabhayā /
analyzed: samanantara spṛṣṭasya ca sudhanasya śreṣṭhi dārakasya tayā prabhayā
translated: And as soon as the light touched the merchant's son Sudhana,

original: sarvavedayitaiśvaryadhvajasamādhipramukhāni śāntipradeśasamādhipramukhāni sarvajagaddhitasamādhipramukhāni samantacakṣurupekṣāvatīsamādhipramukhāni tathāgatakośasamādhipramukhāni pañcamātrāṇi samādhimukhaśatānyavakrāntāni saṃbhūtāni sūkṣmāṇi mṛdūni /
analyzed: sarva vedayita aiśvarya dhvaja samādhi pramukhāni śānti pradeśa samādhi pramukhāni sarva jagat hita samādhi pramukhāni samantacakṣuḥ upekṣāvatī samādhi pramukhāni tathāgata kośa samādhi pramukhāni pañca mātrāṇi samādhi mukha śatāni avakrāntāni saṃbhūtāni sūkṣmāṇi mṛdūni
translated: five hundred doors of concentration, beginning with the concentration of the sovereignty of all sensations, beginning with the concentration of the region of peace, beginning with the concentration of the benefit of all beings, beginning with the concentration of the all-seeing equanimity, beginning with the concentration of the treasure of the Tathagatas, subtle and gentle, entered and arose.

analyzed: tat yathā api nāma tad divasa ardha krāntasya garbhasya vijñānam
translated: Just as the consciousness of an embryo that has entered the womb for half a day.

analyzed: evam tāni samādhi mukhāni sūkṣmāṇi mṛdūni ājātāni
translated: Thus those doors of concentration were subtle and gentle, unborn.

original: tathārūpaṃ ca gandhamajighrat yo na devānāṃ na devakanyānāṃ na nāgānāṃ na nāgakanyānāṃ na yakṣāṇāṃ na yakṣakanyānāṃ na gandharvāṇāṃ na gandharvakanyānāṃ nāsurāṇāṃ nāsurakanyānāṃ na garuḍānāṃ na garūḍakanyānāṃ na kinnarāṇāṃ na kinnarakanyānāṃ na mahoragāṇāṃ na mahoragakanyānāṃ na manuṣyāṇāṃ na manuṣyakanyānām /🔽na sā strī daśadiśi loke saṃvidyate /
analyzed: tathārūpam ca gandham ajighrat yaḥ na devānām na deva kanyānām na nāgānām na nāga kanyānām na yakṣāṇām na yakṣa kanyānām na gandharvāṇām na gandharva kanyānām na asurāṇām na asura kanyānām na garuḍānām na garūḍa kanyānām na kinnarāṇām na kinnara kanyānām na mahoragāṇām na mahoraga kanyānām na manuṣyāṇām na manuṣya kanyānām  na sā strī daśa diśi loke saṃvidyate
translated: He smelled such a fragrance that was not of the gods, not of the daughters of gods, not of the nāgas, not of the daughters of nāgas, not of the yakṣas, not of the daughters of yakṣas, not of the gandharvas, not of the daughters of gandharvas, not of the asuras, not of the daughters of asuras, not of the garuḍas, not of the daughters of garuḍas, not of the kinnaras, not of the daughters of kinnaras, not of the mahoragas, not of the daughters of mahoragas, not of humans, not of the daughters of humans.

analyzed: yā tasyāḥ rūpeṇa samā
translated: There is no woman in the world of the ten directions who is equal to her in beauty.

analyzed: kutas punar uttari
translated: How much less so is there someone superior?

original: na sa varṇāvabhāso'sti daśadiśi loke sthāpayitvā tathāgatavarṇāvabhāsam /
analyzed: na sa varṇa avabhāsaḥ usti daśa diśi loke sthāpayitvā tathāgata varṇa avabhāsam
translated: There is no radiance of color in the world of the ten directions, except for the radiance of color of the Tathāgata.

analyzed: abhiṣeka prāpta bodhisattva varṇa avabhāsam ca
translated: And the radiance of color of a bodhisattva who has attained consecration.

analyzed: yaḥ tasyāḥ varṇa avabhāsena samaḥ
translated: Who is equal to her in radiance of color?

analyzed: kutas punar uttari
translated: How much less so is there someone superior?

original: nāsti tadātmabhāvārohapariṇāhasaṃsthānaṃ daśadiśi loke sthāpayitvā tathāgatātmabhāvārohapariṇāhasaṃsthānam /
analyzed: na asti tat ātma bhāva āroha pariṇāha saṃsthānam daśa diśi loke sthāpayitvā tathāgata ātma bhāva āroha pariṇāha saṃsthānam
translated: There is no body size, circumference, or shape in the world of the ten directions, except for the body size, circumference, and shape of the Tathāgata.

analyzed: abhiṣeka prāpta bodhisattva ātmabhāva āroha pariṇāha saṃsthānam ca
translated: The body of a bodhisattva who has attained consecration is superior in height, girth, and form.

analyzed: yat tasyāḥ ātma bhāva āroha pariṇāha saṃsthānena samam
translated: There is nothing equal to the height, girth, and form of that body.

analyzed: kutas punar uttari
translated: How much less could there be anything superior?

original: nāsti sa prabhāvyūho daśadiśi loke sthāpayitvā tathāgataprabhāvyūham /
analyzed: na asti sa prabhā vyūhaḥ daśa diśi loke sthāpayitvā tathāgata prabhā vyūham
translated: There is no such array of power in the worlds of the ten directions, except for the array of power of the Tathāgata.

analyzed: abhiṣeka prāpta bodhisattva caryā prabhā vyūham ca
translated: And the array of power of a bodhisattva who has attained consecration.

analyzed: yaḥ tasyāḥ prabhā vyūhena samaḥ
translated: There is nothing equal to the array of power of that.

analyzed: kutas punar uttari
translated: How much less could there be anything superior?

original: nāsti sa gandho daśadiśi loke devabhavaneṣu vā nāgayakṣagandharvāsuragaruḍakinnaramahoragamanuṣyāmanuṣyabhavaneṣu vā yastasyā mukhakośavisṛtagandhena
analyzed: na asti sa gandhaḥ daśa diśi loke deva bhavaneṣu vā nāga yakṣa gandharva asura garuḍa kinnara mahoraga manuṣya amanuṣya bhavaneṣu vā yaḥ tasyāḥ mukha kośa visṛta gandhena
translated: There is no such fragrance in the worlds of the ten directions, in the heavenly abodes, or in the abodes of nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, humans, or non-humans, that is equal to the fragrance emanating from the mouth of that.

analyzed: kutas punar uttari
translated: How much less could there be anything superior?

original: nāsti sa bhavanavyūhaparibhogo daśadiśi loke sthāpayitvā tathāgataparibhogam /
analyzed: na asti sa bhavana vyūha paribhogaḥ daśa diśi loke sthāpayitvā tathāgata paribhogam
translated: There is no such enjoyment of the array of abodes in the worlds of the ten directions, except for the enjoyment of the Tathāgata.

analyzed: abhiṣeka prāpta bodhisattva paribhogam ca
translated: And the enjoyment of a bodhisattva who has attained consecration.

analyzed: yaḥ tasyāḥ bhavana vyūha paribhogena samaḥ
translated: There is nothing equal to the enjoyment of the array of abodes of that.

analyzed: kutas punar uttari
translated: How much less could there be anything superior?

original: nāsti sā parivārasaṃpat daśadiśi loke sthāpayitvā tathāgataparivārasaṃpadam /
analyzed: na asti sā parivāra saṃpad daśa diśi loke sthāpayitvā tathāgata parivāra saṃpadam
translated: There is no such perfection of retinue in the world in the ten directions, except for the perfection of retinue of the Tathāgata,

analyzed: abhiṣeka prāpta bodhisattva parivāra saṃpadam ca
translated: and the perfection of retinue of the bodhisattvas who have attained consecration.

analyzed: yā tasyāḥ parivāra saṃpadā samā
translated: What is equal to that perfection of retinue?

original: kutaḥ punaruttari /🔽na sa sattvaḥ sattvanikāye saṃvidyate daśadiśi loke yaḥ samartho'calāmupāsikāṃ rāgacittena prekṣitum /
analyzed: kutas punar uttari  na sa sattvaḥ sattva nikāye saṃvidyate daśa diśi loke yaḥ samartha ucalām upāsikām rāga cittena prekṣitum
translated: How much more so for what is superior?🔽There is no such being in the assembly of beings in the world in the ten directions who is able to look at the laywoman Acalā with a mind of passion.

original: na sa sattvaḥ sattvanikāye saṃvidyate daśadiśi loke yaḥ acalāyā upāsikāyāḥ sahadarśanena kleśo na vyupaśamaṃ gacchet /
analyzed: na sa sattvaḥ sattva nikāye saṃvidyate daśa diśi loke yaḥ acalāyāḥ upāsikāyāḥ saha darśanena kleśaḥ na vyupaśamam gacchet
translated: There is no such being in the assembly of beings in the world in the ten directions whose afflictions would not be pacified upon seeing the laywoman Acalā.

original: tadyathāpi nāma daśa śatasahasravaśavartino mahābrahmāṇaḥ kāmāvacarāḥ kleśānna samudācaranti /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma daśa śata sahasra vaśa vartinaḥ mahābrahmāṇaḥ kāmāvacarāḥ kleśān na samudācaranti
translated: Just as the ten great Brahmās who rule over a thousand worlds do not engage in the afflictions of the desire realm,

original: evameva sahadarśanena acalāyā upāsikāyāḥ sattvānāṃ kleśā na samudācaranti /
analyzed: evam eva saha darśanena acalāyāḥ upāsikāyāḥ sattvānām kleśāḥ na samudācaranti
translated: in the same way, upon seeing the laywoman Acalā, the afflictions of beings do not engage [in them].

original: na sa sattvaḥ sattvanikāye saṃvidyate daśadiśi loke yo acalāyā upāsikāyāḥ sahadarśanena tṛptimāpadyeta sthāpayitvā prajñātṛptān //
analyzed: na sa sattvaḥ sattva nikāye saṃvidyate daśa diśi loke yaḥ acalāyāḥ upāsikāyāḥ saha darśanena tṛptim āpadyeta sthāpayitvā prajñā tṛptān
translated: There is no such being in the assembly of beings in the world in the ten directions who would be satisfied upon seeing the laywoman Acalā, except for those who are satisfied with wisdom.

original: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhidārakaḥ kṛtāñjalipuṭo'calāyā upāsikāyā acintyāṃ kāyādhipateyatām /
analyzed: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhi dārakaḥ kṛta añjali puṭa ucalāyāḥ upāsikāyāḥ acintyām kāya ādhipateya tām
translated: Then the merchant's son Sudhana, with palms joined, beheld the inconceivable mastery of body of the laywoman Achala,

analyzed: acintyam rūpa varṇa saṃsthāna āroha pariṇāham
translated: the inconceivable form, complexion, shape, height, and girth,

original: acintyaṃ ca sarvakṣititalanagaramahāparvatāpratihataṃ raśmijālavyūhaṃ dṛṣṭvā acintyaṃ sattvārthakaraṇaṃ ca sarvaromakūpavisṛtaṃ gandhamāghrāya aparyantāṃ ca parivārasaṃpadamavalokya asaṃhāryaṃ ca bhavanavimānavyūhasaṃpadamudvīkṣya aparimāṇāṃśca guṇasamudrānavagāhya acalāmupāsikāmanayā gāthayā abhyaṣṭauṣīt
analyzed: acintyam ca sarva kṣiti tala nagara mahā parvata a pratihatam raśmi jāla vyūham dṛṣṭvā acintyam sattva artha karaṇam ca sarva romakūpa visṛtam gandham āghrāya aparyantām ca parivāra saṃpadam avalokya asaṃhāryam ca bhavana vimāna vyūha saṃpadam udvīkṣya aparimāṇān ca guṇa samudrān avagāhya acalām upāsikām anayā gāthayā abhyaṣṭauṣīt
translated: and having seen the inconceivable array of light rays unobstructed by the entire earth, cities, and great mountains, and having smelled the inconceivable benefit for beings emanating from all her pores, having observed the endless perfection of retinue, having looked at the inconceivable perfection of the array of her dwelling and palace, having contemplated the immeasurable ocean of qualities, he praised the laywoman Achala with this verse:

analyzed: śīlam sadā yat amalam parirakṣitam te
translated: The stainless morality that you have always guarded,

analyzed: kṣāntiḥ yatas su vipulā paribhāvitā ca
translated: and the vast patience that you have cultivated,

analyzed: vīryam ca vajram iva yat dṛḍham āsthitam te
translated: and the diligence that you have firmly established like a vajra -

analyzed: tena udgatā jagati bhāsya cala indra kalpā
translated: by that, you have risen in the world like a great mountain-like light.

original: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhidārako'calāmupāsikāmanayā gāthayā abhiṣṭutya evamāhamayā ārye anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittamutpāditam /
analyzed: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhi dārakā ucalām upāsikām anayā gāthayā abhiṣṭutya evam āha ayā ārye anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpāditam
translated: Then Sudhana, the head merchant’s son, having praised the upāsikā Acalā with this verse, said, “Noble one, I have developed the aspiration for the highest, complete enlightenment.

original: na ca jānāmi kathaṃ bodhisattvena bodhisattvacaryāyāṃ śikṣitavyam /
analyzed: na ca jānāmi katham bodhisattvena bodhisattva caryāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: But I do not know how a bodhisattva should train in bodhisattva conduct.

analyzed: katham pratipattavyam
translated: How should one practice?

original: śrutaṃ ca me āryā bodhisattvānāmavavādānuśāsanīṃ dadātīti /
analyzed: śrutam ca me āryā bodhisattvānām avavāda anuśāsanīm dadāti iti
translated: And I have heard, noble one, that you give instructions and teachings to bodhisattvas.

original: tadvadatu me āryākathaṃ bodhisattvena bodhisattvacaryāyāṃ śikṣitavyam /
analyzed: tat vadatu me āryā akatham bodhisattvena bodhisattva caryāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: Therefore, noble one, tell me how a bodhisattva should train in bodhisattva conduct.

analyzed: katham pratipattavyam
translated: How should one practice?”

original: atha khalvacalopāsikā snigdhayā bodhisattvavācā manojñayā premaṇīyayā sudhanaṃ śreṣṭhidārakaṃ pratisaṃmodya evamāhasādhu sādhu kulaputra /
analyzed: atha khalu acalā upāsikā snigdhayā bodhisattva vācā manojñayā premaṇīyayā sudhanam śreṣṭhi dārakam pratisaṃmodya evam āha sādhu sādhu kula putra
translated: Then the upāsikā Acalā, with a loving bodhisattva voice, with a pleasing and delightful voice, encouraged Sudhana, the head merchant’s son, and said to him, “Excellent, excellent, son of good family!

analyzed: yena tena uttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpāditam
translated: That you have developed the aspiration for the highest, complete enlightenment.

analyzed: aham kula putra duryodhana jñāna garbhasya bodhisattva vimokṣasya lābhinī
translated: Son of good family, I have attained the bodhisattva liberation called the womb of invincible wisdom.

analyzed: dṛḍha samādāna bodhisattva caryā mukhe ca anuśikṣāmi
translated: And I am training in the gateway of the bodhisattva conduct of firm commitment.

analyzed: sarva dharma samatā bhūmi dhāraṇī mukhasya ca lābhinī
translated: I have attained the dhāraṇī gateway of the stage of equality of all phenomena.

analyzed: dṛḍha samādāna bodhisattva caryā mukhe ca anuśikṣāmi
translated: I train in the gateway of the bodhisattva conduct of firm commitment.

analyzed: sarva dharma samatā bhūmi dhāraṇī mukhasya ca lābhinī
translated: I have attained the dhāraṇī gateway of the stage of equality of all phenomena.

analyzed: sarva dharma tattva udyotanam ca me pratibhāna jñāna āloka mukham avakrāntam
translated: I have entered the gateway of the light of the knowledge of eloquence that illuminates the truth of all phenomena.

analyzed: dharma paryeṣṭaya parikheda vyūham ca me samādhi mukham pratilabdham
translated: I have attained the gateway of samādhi that is arrayed without weariness in seeking the Dharma.

original: āhaka etasya ārye duryodhanajñānagarbhasya bodhisattvavimokṣamukhasya viṣayaḥ /
analyzed: āhakaḥ etasya ārye duryodhana jñāna garbhasya bodhisattva vimokṣa mukhasya viṣayaḥ
translated: She said, This is the domain of the bodhisattva liberation gateway called the womb of invincible knowledge.

original: dṛḍhasamādānabodhisattvacaryāmukhasya ca sarvadharmasamatābhūmidhāraṇamukhasya ca sarvadharmatattvodyotanapratibhānālokamukhasya ca dharmaparyeṣṭyaparikhedavyūhasamādhimukhasya ca viṣayaḥ /
analyzed: dṛḍha samādāna bodhisattva caryā mukhasya ca sarva dharma samatā bhūmi dhāraṇa mukhasya ca sarva dharma tattva udyotana pratibhā an āloka mukhasya ca dharma paryeṣṭya parikheda vyūha samādhi mukhasya ca viṣayaḥ
translated: It is the domain of the gateway of the bodhisattva conduct of firm commitment, the gateway of the stage of equality of all phenomena, the gateway of the light of eloquence that illuminates the truth of all phenomena, and the gateway of samādhi that is arrayed without weariness in seeking the Dharma.

analyzed: āha duradhimokṣam kula putra idam sthānam
translated: He said, Noble one, this is a difficult subject to comprehend.

analyzed: āhavade ārye
translated: He said, Noble one, please speak.

original: buddhānubhāvena kalyāṇamitraparigraheṇa ca adhimokṣye avatariṣyāmi vijñāsyāmi vicārayiṣyāmi anusariṣyāmi nidhyāsyāmi upanidhyāsyāmi pratyavekṣiṣye
analyzed: buddha anubhāvena kalyāṇa mitra parigraheṇa ca adhimokṣye avatariṣyāmi vijñāsyāmi vicārayiṣyāmi anusariṣyāmi nidhyāsyāmi upanidhyāsyāmi pratyavekṣiṣye
translated: By the power of the Buddha and by the support of spiritual friends, I will understand, penetrate, know, contemplate, follow, discern, thoroughly discern, and investigate.

analyzed: na virodhayiṣyāmi  na vikalpayiṣyāmi
translated: I will not contradict.🔽I will not conceptualize.

analyzed: na samāropayiṣyāmi
translated: I will not superimpose.

analyzed: samīkariṣyāmi
translated: I will make equal.

original: atha khalu acalopāsikā sudhanaṃ śreṣṭhidārakamevamāhabhūtapūrvaṃ kulaputra /
analyzed: atha khalu acalā upāsikā sudhanam śreṣṭhi dārakam evam āha bhūta pūrvam kula putra
translated: Then the laywoman Achala said to Sudhana the merchant's son, In the past, noble one,

original: atīte'dhvani vimalaprabhe kalpe pralambabāhurnāma tathāgato loke udapādi /
analyzed: atīta idhvani vimalaprabhe kalpe pralambabāhuḥ nāma tathāgataḥ loke udapādi
translated: in the Vimalaprabha eon, a Tathagata named Pralambabahu appeared in the world.

original: ahaṃ ca rājño vidyuddattasyaikā duhitā abhūvam /🔽tayā me rātryāṃ praśāntāyāṃ pihiteṣu rājapuradvāreṣu /
analyzed: aham ca rājñaḥ vidyuddattasya ekā duhitā abhūvam  tayā me rātryām praśāntāyām pihiteṣu rāja pura dvāreṣu
translated: And I was the only daughter of King Vidyunmatta.🔽When the night had passed and the royal city gates were closed,

analyzed: suptayoḥ mātā pitroḥ
translated: while my parents were asleep,

analyzed: saṃprasupteṣu nara nārī gaṇeṣu
translated: and the crowds of men and women were sleeping,

analyzed: vyupaśānteṣu tūrya tālāvacara nirghoṣeṣu
translated: and the sounds of musical instruments and singing had ceased,

analyzed: śayiteṣu sabhāga cariteṣu pañcasu kanyā śateṣu
translated: and the five hundred maidens who shared my activities were lying down,

original: śayanatalagatayā gaganatalagatāṃ jyotirgaṇavatīṃ rajanīṃ prekṣantyā uparyantarikṣe sa bhagavān pralambabāhustathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sumeruriva acalendrānekadevanāgayakṣagandharvāsuragaruḍakinnaramahoragaparivāro'cintyāsaṃkhyeyabodhisattvagaṇaparivṛtaḥ sarvadigapratihataraśmijālaspharaṇakāyo dṛṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: śayana tala gatayā gagana tala gatām jyotiḥ gaṇavatīm rajanīm prekṣantyā upari antarikṣe sa bhagavān pralamba bāhuḥ tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sumeruḥ iva acala indra aneka deva nāga yakṣa gandharva asura garuḍa kinnara mahoraga parivāra ucintya asaṃkhyeya bodhisattva gaṇa parivṛtaḥ sarva diś a pratihata raśmi jāla spharaṇa kāyaḥ dṛṣṭaḥ
translated: As I lay in bed, I saw the night sky filled with stars, and above me in the sky, the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened Buddha Potalaka, like Mount Sumeru, surrounded by many gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas, surrounded by an inconceivable and innumerable assembly of bodhisattvas, his body radiating a web of light unobstructed in all directions, was seen.

original: tasya ca tathāgatasya sarvaromavivarebhyastathārūpo gandhaḥ pravāti /
analyzed: tasya ca tathāgatasya sarva roma vivarebhyaḥ tathārūpaḥ gandhaḥ pravāti
translated: And from all the pores of that Tathāgata, such a fragrance was emitted,

analyzed: yena asmi prahlādita kāya cittā praharṣita mānasā
translated: by which my body and mind were delighted, and my mind was filled with joy.

original: śayanatalādutthāya daśanakhakṛtakarapuṭāñjalirdharaṇitalapratiṣṭhitā taṃ bhagavantaṃ pralambabāhuṃ tathāgatamarhantaṃ samyaksaṃbuddhaṃ namaskṛtvā mūrdhnā namasya avalokayamānā paryantaṃ nādhigacchāmi /
analyzed: śayana talāt utthāya daśa nakha kṛta kara puṭa añjaliḥ dharaṇi tala pratiṣṭhitā tam bhagavantam pralambabāhum tathāgatam arhantam samyaksaṃbuddham namaskṛtvā mūrdhnā namasya avalokayamānā paryantam na adhigacchāmi
translated: Rising from my bed, with my ten fingers placed together in homage, standing on the ground, I bowed to that Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened Buddha Potalaka, and with my head bowed in homage, looking at him, I did not reach his end.

analyzed: vāma dakṣiṇataḥ pramāṇam na upaimi
translated: I did not reach his measure to the right or left.

analyzed: lakṣaṇa anuvyañjana saṃpadam anuvicintayamānā tṛptim na āpnomi
translated: Contemplating the perfection of the major and minor marks, I was not satisfied.

original: tasyā mama kulaputra etadabhavatkīdṛśaṃ karma kṛtvā iyamīdṛśī kāyasaṃpat pratilabhyate /🔽lakṣaṇānuvyañjanasaṃpadā jāyate /🔽prabhāvyūhasaṃpatsaṃbhavati /
analyzed: tasyāḥ mama kula putraḥ etat abhavat kīdṛśam karma kṛtvā iyam īdṛśī kāya saṃpad pratilabhyate  lakṣaṇa anuvyañjana saṃpadā jāyate  prabhāvī ūha saṃpad saṃbhavati
translated: Son of noble family, this occurred to me: 'What kind of karma, when performed, results in the attainment of such a perfect body?🔽How does one attain the perfection of the major and minor marks?🔽How does the perfection of splendor arise?

analyzed: parivāra saṃpad abhinirvartate
translated: How does the perfection of retinue manifest?

analyzed: manaḥ maya bhavana paribhoga saṃpad prādurbhavati
translated: How does the perfection of enjoying a mind-made abode come about?

analyzed: puṇya saṃpad utpadyate
translated: How does the perfection of merit arise?

analyzed: jñāna saṃpad viśuddhyate
translated: How is the perfection of knowledge purified?

analyzed: acintya samādhi vikurvita saṃpad samudāgacchati  dhāraṇī saṃpad pariniṣpadyate
translated: How does the perfection of inconceivable samādhi transformations come to be accomplished?🔽How is the perfection of dhāraṇīs perfected?

analyzed: pratibhāna saṃpad vaśībhavati
translated: How does the perfection of eloquence become mastered?'

original: atha khalu kulaputra sa bhagavān pralambabāhustathāgato mamādhyāṃśayaṃ viditvā evamāhaduryodhanacittaṃ te dārike utpādayitavyaṃ sarvakleśanirghātāya
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra sa bhagavān pralamba bāhuḥ tathāgataḥ mama adhyāṃśayam viditvā evam āha duryodhana cittam te dārike utpādayitavyam sarva kleśa nirghātāya
translated: Then, son of noble family, the Blessed One, the Tathāgata Pralambabāhu, knowing my thoughts, said this: 'Young woman, you should arouse an invincible mind in order to destroy all afflictions.

analyzed: aparājita cittam sarva abhiniveśa nirvedāya
translated: You should arouse an unconquered mind in order to be disenchanted with all attachments.

analyzed: asaṃkucita cittam gambhīra dharma naya anugamāya
translated: You should arouse an unretreating mind in order to follow the profound Dharma methods.'

analyzed: akṣobhya cittam viṣaya āśaya sattva sāgara āvarta prapāteṣu
translated: An unshakable mind in the whirlpools and abysses of the ocean of beings' desires and intentions.

analyzed: asaṃmūḍha cittam sarva bhava gati upapatti āyataneṣu
translated: An undeluded mind in all the destinies and rebirths of existence.

analyzed: a vitṛpta cittam sarva buddha darśana abhilāṣa a pratiprasrabdhaye
translated: An insatiable mind in the unceasing aspiration to behold all Buddhas.

analyzed: a saṃtuṣṭi cittam sarva tathāgata dharmamegha saṃpratyeṣaṇāya  nidhi apti cittam sarva buddha dharma naya āloka anugamāya
translated: A mind of dissatisfaction in receiving the Dharma clouds of all Tathāgatas.🔽A mind of certainty in following the light of all the ways of the Buddhadharma.

analyzed: saṃghāraṇā cittam sarva tathāgata dharmacakrāṇām
translated: A mind of retention for all the Dharma wheels of the Tathāgatas.

analyzed: a saṃpramoha cittam antaśas saṃketa kṛte
translated: An unconfused mind, even in the creation of mere conventions,

analyzed: kim uta tathāgata vadana vinirgata jñāne
translated: let alone in the knowledge issuing forth from the mouth of the Tathāgata.

analyzed: vibhājana cittam ca te dārike utpādayitavyam yathā āśaya sarva sattva dharma ratna saṃvibhajanāya
translated: And, young woman, you should generate a mind of distribution in order to share the jewel of the Dharma with all beings according to their inclinations.

original: sāhaṃ kulaputra tasya bhagavataḥ pralambabāhostathāgasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasyāntikādimāni evaṃrūpāṇi dharmanayānuśāsanīmukhāni śrutvā sarvajñajñānamabhikāṅkṣamāṇā daśabalabhāvamabhiprārthayamānā buddhasarasvatīmabhilaṣantī buddhaprabhāvyūhaṃ pariśodhayitukāmā buddhaśarīrasaṃpadaṃ pariniṣpādayitukāmā buddhalakṣaṇānuvyañjanaviśuddhimabhikāṅkṣamāṇā buddhaparṣanmaṇḍalasaṃpadamabhiprārthayamānā buddhakṣetraviśuddhimabhilaṣantī buddheryāpathasaṃpadamabhikāṅkṣamāṇā buddhāyuḥpramāṇasaṃpadamabhinandantī sarvakleśasarvaśrāvakapratyekabuddhābhedyacittamutpādaditavatī duryodhanavajramiva sarvaparvatāyudhabalaiḥ /
analyzed: sā aham kula putra tasya bhagavataḥ pralambabāhoḥ tathāgasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya antikāt imāni evaṃrūpāṇi dharma naya anuśāsanī mukhāni śrutvā sarvajña jñānam abhikāṅkṣamāṇā daśa bala bhāvam abhiprārthayamānā buddha sarasvatīm abhilaṣantī buddha prabhā vyūham pariśodhayitu kāmā buddha śarīra saṃpadam pariniṣpādayitu kāmā buddha lakṣaṇa anuvyañjana viśuddhim abhikāṅkṣamāṇā buddha parṣad maṇḍala saṃpadam abhiprārthayam
translated: I, noble sir, having heard from the Blessed One, the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, these Dharma methods, these doors of instruction, longing for omniscient knowledge, aspiring to the state of the ten powers, desiring the eloquence of the Buddha, wishing to purify the array of the Buddha's power, wishing to perfect the abundance of the Buddha's body, longing for the purity of the Buddha's major and minor marks, aspiring to the abundance of the Buddha's retinue circle, longing for the purity of the Buddha's field, longing for the abundance of the Buddha's conduct, rejoicing in the abundance of the Buddha's lifespan, longing for the indestructible mind of all afflictions, all śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, generated an invincible mind like a vajra, as if with all the strength of weapons and mountains.

original: nābhijānāmi kulaputra tata upādāya etena cittotpādena jambudvīpaḥ paramāṇurajaḥsamaiḥ kalpairapi kāmān paribhoktum /
analyzed: na abhijānāmi kula putra tatas upādāya etena citta utpādena jambudvīpaḥ paramāṇu rajaḥ samaiḥ kalpaiḥ api kāmān paribhoktum
translated: Noble sir, ever since then, with that thought in my mind, I have not even enjoyed sensual pleasures for an instant, even in dreams, much less indulged in sexual intercourse.

analyzed: kaḥ punar vādaḥ dvaya dvaya samāpattyā
translated: What need to speak of actually engaging in sexual intercourse?🔽Noble sir, ever since then, I do not recall having given rise to a single thought of anger, even in a dream, much less have I actually harmed any living being.🔽What need to speak of harming those who have done nothing wrong?

original: nābhijānāmi kulaputra tata upādāya ekapratighacittamutpādayituṃ svabāndhaveṣu /
analyzed: na abhijānāmi kula putra tatas upādāya eka pratigha cittam utpādayitum sva bāndhaveṣu
translated: Noble sir, ever since then, I do not recall having given rise to a single thought of desire, even in a dream, much less have I ever intentionally taken anything that was not given.

analyzed: prāk eva anaparādhiṣu tad anyeṣu sattveṣu
translated: What need to speak of taking the wealth of others?

analyzed: na abhijānāmi tatas upādāya eka citta utpādam adhyātma dṛṣṭi sahagatam utpādayitum
translated: Noble sir, ever since then, I do not recall having given rise to a single thought of pride, even in a dream, much less have I ever had the conceit ‘I am superior’ or ‘I am equal’ or ‘I am inferior.’

analyzed: prāk eva tad anyeṣu upakaraṇeṣu mamakāra abhiniveśam
translated: What need to speak of having the conceit ‘I am superior’ or ‘I am equal’ or ‘I am inferior’ when awake?

analyzed: na abhijānāmi citta saṃmoham na anyatva saṃjñām avyākṛta citta tām vā cyuti upapatti garbha saṃvāseṣu api
translated: Noble sir, ever since then, I do not recall having given rise to a single thought of wrong views, even in a dream, much less have I ever intentionally denied cause and effect or rejected the scriptures.

analyzed: prāk eva samanvāharamāṇā  na abhijānāmi tāvadbhiḥ kalpaiḥ ekabuddha darśanam api vismartum
translated: What need to speak of rejecting the scriptures when awake?

analyzed: antaśas svapna darśana vijñaptim api
translated: Noble sir, ever since then, I do not recall having given rise to a single thought of doubt, even in a dream, much less have I ever been confused about cause and effect or about the scriptures.

analyzed: prāk eva daśa bodhisattva cakṣuḥ pratibhāsa prāpteṣu
translated: What need to speak of being confused about cause and effect or about the scriptures when awake?🔽Noble sir, ever since then, I do not recall having given rise to a single thought of desire for sensual pleasure, even in a dream, much less have I ever intentionally taken anything that was not given.🔽What need to speak of taking the wealth of others?

original: nābhijānāmi tata upādāya sarvatathāgatadharmameghān saṃpratīcchamānā ekadharmapadavyañjanamapi manasā vismartum /🔽antaśaḥ saṃjñākṛtamapi /🔽prāgeva tathāgatavadanakośaviniḥsṛtam /🔽nābhijānāmi tata upādāya tāvato dharmasāgarān pibantī ekapadamapyanidhyātamavilokitam /🔽antaśo laukikeṣu dharmeṣu /🔽nābhijānāmi tata upādāya tāvatāṃ dharmanayasāgarāṇāmekadharmanayadvāramapi yatra mayā na samādhirabhinirhṛtaḥ /🔽antaśo laukikaśilpajñānanayeṣvapi /

original: nābhijānāmi tata upādāya tāvatāṃ buddhadarśanasamudrāṇāmekapraṇidhānamapi yanmayā na sarvasattvasāgaraviśuddhaye'bhinirhṛtam /
analyzed: na abhijānāmi tatas upādāya tāvatām buddha darśana samudrāṇām eka praṇidhānam api yat mayā na sarva sattva sāgara viśuddhayā abhinirhṛtam
translated: Since then, I do not recall a single aspiration that I have not made for the sake of purifying the ocean of all beings.

analyzed: antaśas nirmāṇa buddha praṇidhi vicāreṣu api
translated: Even in the consideration of aspirations for emanation buddhas.

analyzed: na abhijānāmi tatas upādāya tāvatām buddha samudrāṇām pūrva bodhisattva caryā samudrāt eka bodhisattva caryām api
translated: Since then, I do not recall a single bodhisattva practice among the ocean of previous bodhisattva practices of those ocean-like buddhas.

analyzed: yā mayā na sva caryā pariśuddhyā abhinirhṛtā
translated: Which I have not carried out for the sake of purifying my own conduct.

original: nābhijānāmi tata upādāya ekasattvamapi cakṣuravabhāsamāgataṃ yo mayānuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau na samādāpitaḥ /
analyzed: na abhijānāmi tatas upādāya eka sattvam api cakṣuḥ avabhāsam āgatam yaḥ mayā anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau na samādāpitaḥ
translated: Since then, I do not recall a single being who has come within the range of my eyes whom I have not inspired toward supreme perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: na abhijānāmi tatas upādāya eka citta utpādam api śrāvaka pratyekabuddha manasikāra pratisaṃyuktam abhinirhartum
translated: Since then, I do not recall a single thought that I have carried out connected with the mental attentions of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: nābhijānāmi kulaputra tata upādāya jambudvīpaparamāṇurajaḥsamaiḥ kalpairekapadavyañjane'pi saṃśayamutpādayituṃ dvayasaṃjñāṃ vā vikalpasaṃjñāṃ vā nānātvasaṃjñāṃ vā agrahasaṃjñāṃ vā hīnapraṇītasaṃjñāṃ vā anunayapratighasaṃjñāṃ vā utpādayitum //
analyzed: na abhijānāmi kula putra tatas upādāya jambudvīpa paramāṇu rajaḥ samaiḥ kalpaiḥ eka pada vyañjane pi saṃśayam utpādayitum dvaya saṃjñām vā vikalpa saṃjñām vā nānātva saṃjñām vā agraha saṃjñām vā hīna praṇīta saṃjñām vā anunaya pratigha saṃjñām vā utpādayitum
translated: Noble sir, ever since then, for eons as numerous as the dust particles in a billion buddha-fields, I have not had even a single doubt about a single word or letter, nor have I had any dualistic or conceptual thoughts, nor any thoughts of variety, nor any thoughts of grasping, nor any thoughts of high and low, nor any thoughts of attraction and aversion.

original: sāhaṃ kulaputra tataḥ paścādavirahitā abhūvaṃ buddhotpādaiḥ /
analyzed: sā aham kula putra tatas paścāt avirahitā abhūvam buddha utpādaiḥ
translated: “Noble sir, after that, I was never again separated from the appearance of buddhas.

analyzed: avirahitāḥ buddhaiḥ bhagavadbhiḥ
translated: I was never separated from the buddhas, the Blessed Ones.

analyzed: avirahitā bodhisattvaiḥ
translated: I was never separated from bodhisattvas.

analyzed: avirahitā bhūta kalyāṇa mitraiḥ
translated: I was never separated from true spiritual benefactors.

analyzed: avirahitāḥ buddha praṇidhāna śraveṇa  avirahitāḥ bodhisattva caryā śraveṇa
translated: I was never separated from hearing the vow of the buddhas.🔽I was never separated from hearing the conduct of the bodhisattvas.

analyzed: avirahitāḥ bodhisattva pāramitā naya śraveṇa  avirahitāḥ bodhisattva bhūmi jñāna āloka naya śraveṇa  avirahitāḥ bodhisattva dhāraṇī samādhya kṣaya koṣa nidhāna śravaṇa pratilābhena
translated: I was never separated from hearing the way of the perfections of the bodhisattvas.🔽I was never separated from hearing the way of the light of knowledge of the stages of the bodhisattvas.🔽I was never separated from the attainment of the dhāraṇīs and concentrations, the inexhaustible treasures of the bodhisattvas.

analyzed: avirahitāḥ ananta madhya lokadhātu jāla praveśa avatāra naya śraveṇa
translated: I was never separated from hearing the way of entering into and penetrating the net of infinite world-realms.

analyzed: avirahitāḥ ananta madhya sattvadhātu saṃbhava hetu śravaṇa pratilābhena
translated: They are never separated from the attainment of hearing the cause of the origin of the infinite and immeasurable realm of beings.

analyzed: avirahitā sarva jagat kleśa jāla maṇḍala paryādāna jñāna ālokena
translated: They are never separated from the light of the knowledge that eliminates the net of afflictions of all beings.

analyzed: avirahitā sarva sattva kuśala mūla saṃbhava hetu jñāna pratilābhena
translated: They are never separated from the attainment of the knowledge of the cause of the origin of the roots of virtue of all beings.

analyzed: avirahitā sarva sattva yathā āśaya kāya saṃdarśanena
translated: They are never separated from manifesting their bodies according to the aspirations of all beings.

analyzed: avirahitā sarva sattva ājñāpana svara maṇḍala viśuddhyā
translated: They are never separated from the purity of the sphere of their voices that instructs all beings.

original: etaṃ ca me kulaputra duryodhanajñānagarbhaṃ bodhisattvavimokṣasukham /
analyzed: etam ca me kula putra duryodhana jñāna garbham bodhisattva vimokṣa sukham
translated: Noble one, this is the womb of the knowledge of invincibility, the happiness of the bodhisattva liberation.

analyzed: etat ca sarva dharma paryeṣṭya parikheda vyūham samādhi mukham samāpannāyāḥ
translated: This is the entrance into the samādhi called 'The Array of the Inexhaustible Search for All Dharmas'.

analyzed: etat ca dṛḍha samādāna bodhi caryā mukham pravicinvantyāḥ
translated: This is the entrance into the practice of the conduct of enlightenment with a firm commitment.

analyzed: etat ca sarva dharma samatā bhūmi dhāraṇī mukham
translated: This is the entrance into the dhāraṇī of the level of equality of all dharmas.🔽This is the entrance into the light of knowledge that illuminates the level of all dharmas.

analyzed: etat ca sarva dharma tala udyotana pratibhāva jñāna āloka mukham vyavacārayantyāḥ acintyāni prātihāryāṇi bhavanti
translated: Do you wish, noble one, to see the inconceivable miracles?

analyzed: icchasi tvam kula putra 🔽pratyakṣaḥ bhavitum 🔽āha aicchāmi ārye
translated: He said, 'Noble one, I wish to see them.'🔽She said, 'Noble one, if you wish to see them, look at my body.'

original: atha khalu acalopāsikā yathāniṣaṇṇaiva duryodhanajñānagarbhabodhisattvavimokṣamukhapūrvaṃgamāni sarvadharmaparyeṣṭyaparikhedavyūhasamādhimukhapūrvaṃgamāni amoghamaṇḍalavyūhasamādhimukhapūrvaṃgamāni daśabalajñānamaṇḍalābhimukhasamādhimukhapūrvaṃgamāni buddhavaṃśākṣayakośasamādhivimokṣamukhapūrvaṃgamāni ca daśa samādhimukhaśatasahasrāṇi vyavalokayati anuvicārayati anusarati nidhyapayati /
analyzed: atha khalu acalā upāsikā yathā niṣaṇṇā eva duryodhana jñāna garbha bodhisattva vimokṣa mukha pūrvaṃgamāni sarva dharma paryeṣṭya parikheda vyūha samādhi mukha pūrvaṃgamāni amogha maṇḍala vyūha samādhi mukha pūrvaṃgamāni daśa bala jñāna maṇḍala abhimukha samādhi mukha pūrvaṃgamāni buddha vaṃśa akṣaya kośa samādhi vimokṣa mukha pūrvaṃgamāni ca daśa samādhi mukha śata sahasrāṇi vyavalokayati anuvicārayati anusarati nidhyapayati
translated: Then the laywoman Achala, while seated, contemplated, considered, followed, and ascertained one hundred thousand gates of samādhi, beginning with the gate of the samādhi called “The Array of the Unceasing Search for All Dharmas,” beginning with the gate of the samādhi called “The Array of the Unfailing Sphere,” beginning with the gate of the samādhi called “The Sphere of the Knowledge of the Ten Powers,” beginning with the gate of the samādhi called “The Unceasing Treasury of the Lineage of the Buddhas,” and so on.

analyzed: samanantara samāpannāyām ca acalāyām upāsikāyām
translated: Immediately after the laywoman Achala had entered into samādhi,

original: apaśyat sudhanaḥ śreiṣṭhidārako daśasu dikṣu daśabuddhakṣetrānabhilāpyaparamāṇurajaḥsamān lokadhātūn ṣaḍvikāraṃ prakampamānān /
analyzed: apaśyat sudhanaḥ śreiṣṭhi dārakaḥ daśasu dikṣu daśa buddhakṣetrān abhilāpya paramāṇu rajaḥ samān lokadhātūn ṣaṣ vikāram prakampamānān
translated: Sudhana, the head merchant’s son, saw the ten directions, as many world realms as there are atoms in ten inexpressibly vast buddha-fields, shaking in six ways.

analyzed: pariśuddha vaiḍūrya mayān saṃsthitān
translated: They were made of pure beryl, and were well-arranged.

original: ekaikasmiṃśca lokadhātau koṭīśate cāturmahādvīpakānāṃ lokadhātūnāṃ koṭīśataṃ tathāgatānāmapaśyat /
analyzed: ekaikasmin ca lokadhātau koṭī śate cāturmahādvīpakānām lokadhātūnām koṭī śatam tathāgatānām apaśyat
translated: In each world realm, in one hundred billion four-continent world realms, he saw one hundred billion tathāgatas.

analyzed: kāṃścid tuṣita vara bhavana gatān
translated: some in the excellent Tuṣita realm,

analyzed: kāṃścid yāvat parinirvāyamāṇān apaśyat yat uta an āvaraṇa tvāt pariśuddha vaiḍūrya maya lokadhātūnām
translated: and some up to the time of their parinirvāṇa. That is to say, due to the unobstructed, pure world system made of beryl.

analyzed: ekaikam ca tathāgatam sarva dharmadhātu spharaṇa raśmi jāla prabhā maṇḍalam
translated: And each Tathāgata was surrounded by a halo of light rays that pervaded the entire Dharma realm.

analyzed: ekaikam ca tathāgatam suvibhakta parṣad maṇḍala samudram apaśyat
translated: And each Tathāgata he saw had a well-arranged assembly of ocean-like retinues.

original: ekaisya ca tathāgatasya sarvadharmacakrodyotanaṃ sarvasattvaśrotravijñapanaṃ svaramaṇḍalamaśrauṣīt //
analyzed: ekaisya ca tathāgatasya sarva dharma cakra udyotanam sarva sattva śrotra vijñapanam svara maṇḍalam aśrauṣīt
translated: And he heard the sound circle of each Tathāgata, which illuminates all Dharma wheels and makes itself known to the ears of all beings.

original: atha khalvacalopāsikā tataḥ samādhervyutthāya sudhanaṃ śreṣṭhidārakamevamāhadṛṣṭaṃ te kulaputra /
analyzed: atha khalu acalā upāsikā tatas samādheḥ vyutthāya sudhanam śreṣṭhi dārakam evam āha dṛṣṭam te kula putra
translated: Then the laywoman Acalā, having risen from that samādhi, said to the merchant's son Sudhana, Noble one, have you seen?

analyzed: śrutam vijñātam
translated: Have you heard? Have you understood?

analyzed: āha dṛṣṭam ārye
translated: He said, Noble one, I have seen.

analyzed: śrutam vijñātam
translated: I have heard. I have understood.

analyzed: āha evam aham kula putra
translated: She said, Noble one, it is so.

original: dṛḍhasamādānāyāṃ bodhisattvacaryāyāmanuśikṣamāṇā sarvadharmaparyeṣṭyaparikhedavyūhasamādhisamāpannā duryodhanajñānagarbhabodhisattvavimokṣamukhapratiṣṭhitā sarvadharmasamatābhūmidhāraṇyanugamena sarvadharmatalodyotanapratibhānajñānālokakauśalyena sarvasattvān subhāṣitena saṃtoṣayāmi /
analyzed: dṛḍha samādānāyām bodhisattva caryāyām anuśikṣamāṇā sarva dharma paryeṣṭya parikheda vyūha samādhi samāpannā duryodhana jñāna garbha bodhisattva vimokṣa mukha pratiṣṭhitā sarva dharma samatā bhūmi dhāraṇī anugamena sarva dharma tala udyotana pratibhāna jñāna āloka kauśalyena sarva sattvān subhāṣitena saṃtoṣayāmi
translated: I am engaged in the practice of the bodhisattva conduct, which is firmly undertaken. I am absorbed in the samadhi called “The Array of Unflagging Search for All Dharmas.” I am established in the gateway of the bodhisattva liberation called “The Womb of Knowledge Invincible.” By following the acceptance of the stage of equality of all dharmas, and by the skill in the light of knowledge and eloquence that illuminates the entire surface of reality, I satisfy all beings with good advice.

original: kiṃ mayā śakyamacintyāprameyaguṇasamanvāgatānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ caryāṃ jñātuṃ guṇān vā vaktum /
analyzed: kim mayā śakyam acintya aprameya guṇa samanvāgatānām bodhisattvānām caryām jñātum guṇān vā vaktum
translated: What can I, a human, know of the conduct or qualities of bodhisattvas who possess inconceivable and immeasurable qualities?

analyzed: ye te dvijarṣabhāḥ iva gagana taleniketa cāriṇaḥ
translated: They are like bulls among the twice-born, wandering without a home in the sky.

original: ye te mahāgaruḍendrā iva sattvasāgaramavagāhante paripakvabodhisattvoddharaṇatāyai /
analyzed: ye te mahā garuḍa indrāḥ iva sattva sāgaram avagāhante paripakva bodhisattva uddharaṇa tāyai
translated: They are like the great kings of garudas, diving into the ocean of beings to rescue mature bodhisattvas.

original: ye te vaṇija iva sarvajñatāratnadvīpe'nuvicaranti daśabalajñānaratnābhikāṅkṣiṇaḥ /
analyzed: ye te vaṇijaḥ iva daśa bala jñāna ratna abhikāṅkṣiṇaḥ
translated: They are like merchants who roam the island of jewels of omniscience, longing for the jewel of the knowledge of the ten powers.

original: ye te balavatkaivartā iva saṃsārasāgare'nuvicaranti ruciradharmacakramaṇḍalajālahastāḥ tṛṣṇodbhavasattvaparipācanābhyuddharaṇatāyai /
analyzed: ye te balavat kaivartāḥ iva saṃsāra sāgare nu vicaranti rucira dharma cakra maṇḍala jāla hastāḥ tṛṣṇā udbhava sattva paripācana abhyuddharaṇa tāyai
translated: Those who move about in the ocean of cyclic existence like powerful fishermen, with the net of their beautiful wheel of Dharma in their hands, in order to rescue and ripen beings who arise from craving.

original: ye te'surendrā iva tribhuvanapuraṃ spharitvā vicaranti kleśāsurasaṃkṣobhodvṛttasaṃśamanatāyai /
analyzed: ye tesura indrāḥ iva tribhuvana puram spharitvā vicaranti kleśa asura saṃkṣobha udvṛtta saṃśamana tāyai
translated: Those who move about pervading the city of the three worlds like lords of the asuras, in order to pacify the agitation and disturbance caused by the asuras of afflictions.

original: ye te dinakaramaṇḍalamiva dharmadhātugaganatale samudāgacchanti sattvatṛṣṇāsalilakleśapaṅkocchoṣaṇatāyai /
analyzed: ye te dinakara maṇḍalam iva dharmadhātu gagana tale samudāgacchanti sattva tṛṣṇā salila kleśa paṅka ucchoṣaṇa tāyai
translated: Those who arise in the sky of the Dharma realm like the orb of the sun, in order to dry up the mud of afflictions in the water of craving for beings.

original: ye te pūrṇacandramaṇḍalamiva jñānanabhasyudāgacchanti vineyamanaḥkumudavibodhanatāyai /🔽ye te dharaṇitalamivānunayapratighonnāmāvanāmaviṣame samā loke saṃtiṣṭhante sarvajagatkuśalendriyāṅkuraprarohaṇavivardhanatāyai /
analyzed: ye te pūrṇa candra maṇḍalam iva jñāna nabhasi udāgacchanti vineya manaḥ kumuda vibodhana tāyai  ye te dharaṇi talam iva anunaya pratigha unnāma avanāma viṣame samāḥ loke saṃtiṣṭhante sarva jagat kuśala indriya aṅkura prarohaṇa vivardhana tāyai
translated: Those who arise in the sky of wisdom like the orb of the full moon, in order to awaken the water lilies of the minds of those to be trained.🔽Those who stand in the world like the surface of the earth, without affection, aversion, pride, or arrogance, in order to make all beings grow the sprouts of wholesome faculties.

analyzed: ye te mārute iva asaṅga sarva diś vicāriṇaḥ sarva sattva kleśa dṛṣṭi druma latā vana ārāma unmūlana tāyai
translated: Those who move about in all directions without attachment like the wind, in order to uproot the forest groves of afflictions and views of all beings.

original: ye te cakravartina iva loke vicaranti catuḥsaṃgrahavastupariṣkāropakaraṇasarvajagatsaṃgrahaṇatāyai /
analyzed: ye te cakravartinaḥ iva loke vicaranti catur saṃgraha vastu pariṣkāra upakaraṇa sarva jagat saṃgrahaṇa tāyai
translated: who, like universal monarchs, move in the world for the sake of gathering all beings with the requisites of the four means of gathering.

analyzed: gaccha kula putra
translated: Go, son of noble family.

original: ihaiva dakṣiṇāpathe'mitatosale janapade tosalaṃ nāma nagaram /
analyzed: iha eva dakṣiṇāpatha imitatosale janapade tosalam nāma nagaram
translated: Here, in the southern region, in the country of Amitosala, there is a city called Tosala.

analyzed: tatra sarvagāmī nāma parivrājakaḥ prativasati
translated: There lives a wandering mendicant named Sarvagamin.

analyzed: tam upasaṃkramya paripṛccha katham bodhisattvena bodhisattva caryāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: Approach him and ask him how a bodhisattva should train in the conduct of a bodhisattva, and how he should practice.

analyzed: katham pratipattavyam
translated: How should he proceed?

original: atha khalu sughanaḥ śreṣṭhidārako'calāyā upāsikāyāḥ pādau śirasābhivandya acalāmupāsikāmanekaśatasahasrakṛtvaḥ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya punaḥ punaravalokya acalāyā upāsikāyā antikātprakrāntaḥ // //
analyzed: atha khalu sughanaḥ śreṣṭhi dārakaḥ ucalāyāḥ upāsikāyāḥ pādau śirasā abhivandya acalām upāsikām aneka śata sahasra kṛtvas pradakṣiṇīkṛtya punar punar avalokya acalāyāḥ upāsikāyāḥ antikāt prakrāntaḥ  /
translated: Then the merchant's son Sudhana, having bowed his head at the feet of the laywoman Acala, circumambulated the laywoman Acala many hundreds of thousands of times, keeping her to his right, and looking back at her again and again, left the presence of the laywoman Acala.

analyzed: sarva gāmī
translated: Sarvagamin.

original: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhidārako'calāmupāsikāmāmukhīkṛtya acalāyā upāsikāyā anuśāsanīmanusmaran /
analyzed: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhi dārakaḥ ucalām upāsikām ā mukhīkṛtya acalāyāḥ upāsikāyāḥ anuśāsanīm anusmaran
translated: Then the merchant's son Sudhana, keeping the laywoman Acala in his thoughts, remembering the laywoman Acala's instructions,

original: yadacalayopāsikayā darśitaṃ śrāvitaṃ deśitaṃ saṃvarṇitaṃ yojitaṃ vibhaktaṃ prabhāvitaṃ visṛtaṃ tatsaṃbhāvayan /
analyzed: yat acalayā upāsikayā darśitam śrāvitam deśitam saṃvarṇitam yojitam vibhaktam prabhāvitam visṛtam tat saṃbhāvayan
translated: He contemplated, contemplated well, and contemplated perfectly the Dharma that was shown, heard, taught, praised, connected, analyzed, manifested, and spread by the laywoman Acalā.

analyzed: anusaran
translated: Contemplating, following,

original: anuvicintayan avataran bhāvayan nigamayan nidhyāyan avabhāsayan samīkurvan anupūrveṇa deśena deśaṃ janapadena janapadamanucaṃkraman anuvicaran yenāmitatosalo janapadastenopajagāma /
analyzed: anuvicintayan avataran bhāvayan nigamayan nidhyāyan avabhāsayan samīkurvan anupūrveṇa deśena deśam janapadena janapadam anucaṃkraman anuvicaran yena amitatosalaḥ janapadaḥ tena upajagāma
translated: reflecting, penetrating, cultivating, concluding, contemplating, illuminating, equalizing, gradually going from country to country, from region to region, he went to the region of Amitotso.

original: upetya tosalaṃ nagaraṃ parimārgan parigaveṣamāṇo'nupūrveṇa tosalaṃ nagaramanuprāptaḥ /
analyzed: upetya tosalam nagaram parimārgan parigaveṣamāṇaḥ anupūrveṇa tosalam nagaram anuprāptaḥ
translated: Having arrived, searching for and seeking the city of Tosala, he gradually reached the city of Tosala.

original: sūryāstaṃgamanakāle sa tosalaṃ nagaramanupraviśya madhye nagaraśṛṅgāṭakasya sthitvā vīthīmukhena vīthīmukhaṃ catvareṇa catvaraṃ rathyayā rathyāṃ sarvagāminaṃ parivrājakaṃ parigaveṣamāṇo vyavacārayan adrākṣīdrātryāṃ praśāntāyāṃ tosalasya nagarasyottare digbhāge sulabhaṃ nāma parvatam /
analyzed: sūrya astaṃgamana kāle sa tosalam nagaram anupraviśya madhye nagara śṛṅgāṭakasya sthitvā vīthī mukhena vīthī mukham catvareṇa catvaram rathyayā rathyām sarvagāminam parivrājakam parigaveṣamāṇaḥ vyavacārayan adrākṣīt rātryām praśāntāyām tosalasya nagarasya uttare digbhāge sulabham nāma parvatam
translated: At sunset, having entered the city of Tosala, standing in the middle of the city square, searching for the all-going mendicant from street to street, from crossroads to crossroads, from alley to alley, he saw in the still of the night to the north of the city of Tosala the mountain named Sulabha.

analyzed: tasya śikhare vividha tṛṇa gulma oṣadhi vana ārāma racite mahā avabhāsa prāptam bhāskaram iva uditam
translated: On its peak, adorned with various grasses, shrubs, herbs, and forests, he saw the Greatly Illuminating One, like the rising sun.

original: tasya tamavabhāsaṃ dṛṣṭvā udāraprītivegasaṃjātasya etadabhavatasaṃśayamahamatra parvataśikhare kalyāṇamitraṃ drakṣyāmīti /
analyzed: tasya tam avabhāsam dṛṣṭvā udāra prīti vega saṃjātasya etat abhavat asaṃśayam aham atra parvata śikhare kalyāṇa mitram drakṣyāmi iti
translated: Seeing that light, he was filled with a surge of great joy and thought, Without a doubt, I will see a spiritual friend on this mountain peak.

analyzed: sa tasmāt nagarāt abhiniṣkramya yena sulabhaḥ parvataḥ
translated: He then left that city and went to the mountain called Easy to Climb.

original: tenopetya sulabhaṃ parvatamabhiruhya yena tanmahāvabhāsaṃ parvataśikharaṃ tenopasaṃkrāmannadrākṣīddūrata eva sarvagāminaṃ parivrājakaṃ mahābrahmātirekavarṇaṃ śriyā dedīpyamānaṃ daśabhirbrahmasahasraiḥ parivṛtaṃ caṃkrame caṃkramyamāṇam /
analyzed: tena upetya sulabham parvatam abhiruhya yena tat mahā avabhāsam parvata śikharam tena upasaṃkrāman adrākṣīt dūratas eva sarvagāminam parivrājakam mahābrahma atireka varṇam śriyā dedīpyamānam daśabhiḥ brahma sahasraiḥ parivṛtam caṃkrame caṃkramyamāṇam
translated: Having approached and climbed the mountain, he went to the peak that was greatly illuminated and saw from afar the wandering mendicant Sarvagamin, whose complexion surpassed that of Great Brahmā, shining with splendor, surrounded by ten thousand Brahmas, walking on a path.

original: sa tasya pādau śirasābhivandya tamanekaśatasahasrakṛtvaḥ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya purataḥ prāñjaliḥ sthitvā evamāhamayā ārya anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittamutpāditam /
analyzed: sa tasya pādau śirasā abhivandya tam aneka śata sahasra kṛtvas pradakṣiṇīkṛtya puratas prāñjaliḥ sthitvā evam āham ayā ārya anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpāditam
translated: He bowed his head to the mendicant's feet, circumambulated him many hundreds of thousands of times, stood before him with palms joined, and said, Noble one, I have given rise to the mind set on unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

original: na ca jānāmi kathaṃ bodhisattvena bodhisattvacaryāyāṃ śikṣitavyam /
analyzed: na ca jānāmi katham bodhisattvena bodhisattva caryāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: I do not know how a bodhisattva should train in the bodhisattva conduct.

analyzed: katham pratipattavyam
translated: How should one practice?

original: śrutaṃ ca me āryo bodhisattvānāmavavādānuśāsanīṃ dadātīti /
analyzed: śrutam ca me āryaḥ bodhisattvānām avavāda anuśāsanīm dadāti iti
translated: And I have heard that the noble one gives instructions and teachings to bodhisattvas.

original: tadvadatu me āryaḥkathaṃ bodhisattvena bodhisattvaryāyāṃ śikṣitavyam /
analyzed: tat vadatu me āryaḥ katham bodhisattvena bodhisattva aryāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: Therefore, may the noble one tell me how a bodhisattva should train in the bodhisattva conduct.

analyzed: katham pratipattavyam
translated: How should one practice?

analyzed: āha sādhu sādhu kula putra
translated: He said, Good, good, O son of noble family!

analyzed: yaḥ tvam anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃprasthitaḥ
translated: That you have set out for supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: ahaṃ kulaputra sarvagāmī sarvatrānugatāyāṃ bodhisattvacaryāyāṃ sthitaḥ samantamukhavyavacāraṇālokena samādhimukhena abhāvapratiṣṭhitayā āryānabhisaṃskārikayā samantadharmadhātutalabhedena ca prajñāpāramitājñānālokamukhena samanvāgataḥ /
analyzed: aham kula putra sarva gāmī sarvatra anugatāyām bodhisattva caryāyām sthitaḥ samanta mukha vyavacāraṇa ālokena samādhi mukhena abhāva pratiṣṭhitayā ārya an abhisaṃskārikayā samanta dharmadhātu tala bhedena ca prajñāpāramitā jñāna āloka mukhena samanvāgataḥ
translated: I, O son of noble family, abiding in the bodhisattva conduct that goes everywhere and follows everywhere, endowed with the gateway of concentration called the light of thorough investigation in all directions, with the gateway of the perfection of wisdom called the light of knowledge that is not established in anything, not produced by effort, and that distinguishes the planes of the entire realm of phenomena,

original: so'haṃ kulaputra sarvasattvabhājanalokavyavacāreṣu sarvasattvagativyavacāreṣu sarvasattvacyutimukheṣu sarvasattvopapattimukheṣu sarvabhavagatisaṃbhedeṣu vividhopapattyāyatanavicitre lokasaṃniveśe vicitravarṇasaṃsthānārohapariṇāhānāṃ sattvānāṃ nānāvidhopapattisaṃyojanānāṃ nānāprayogāṇāṃ vicitrādhimuktānāṃ yaduta devagatiparyāpannānāṃ nāgagatiparyāpannānāṃ yakṣagatiparyāpannānāṃ gandharvagatiparyāpannānāmasuragatiparyāpannānāṃ garuḍagatiparyāpannānāṃ kinnaragatiparyāpannānāṃ mahoragagatiparyāpannānāṃ narakagatiparyāpannānāṃ tiryagyonigatiparyāpannānāṃ yamalokagatiparyāpannānāṃ manuṣyagatiparyāpannānāmanuṣyagatiparyāpannānāṃ vividhadṛṣṭigatiniśritānāṃ śrāvakayānādhimuktānāṃ pratyekabuddhayānādhimuktānāṃ mahāyānādhimuktānāṃ sattvānāmarthaṃ karomi vividhairupāyairvividhairjñānanayaprayogaiḥ yaduta keṣāṃcitsattvānāṃ vividhalaukikaśilpaśikṣaṇatayā arthaṃ karomi sarvaśilpajñānabhedavatīdhāraṇyālokena /
analyzed: saḥ uham kula putra sarva sattva bhājana loka vyavacāreṣu sarva sattva gati vyavacāreṣu sarva sattva cyuti mukheṣu sarva sattva upapatti mukheṣu sarva bhava gati saṃbhedeṣu vividha upapatti āyatana vicitre loka saṃniveśe vicitra varṇa saṃsthāna āroha pariṇāhānām sattvānām nānāvidha upapatti saṃyojanānām nānā prayogāṇām vicitra adhimuktānām yat uta deva gati paryāpannānām nāga gati paryāpannānām yakṣa gati paryāpannānām gandharva gati paryāpannān
translated: I, noble sir, in all the worlds of beings and vessels, in all the destinies of beings, in all the doors of death of beings, in all the doors of birth of beings, in all the mixed destinies of existence, in the various diverse abodes of rebirth, in the various diverse arrangements of the world, among beings with various diverse colors, forms, sizes, and shapes, with various diverse bonds
