analyzed: sadā pakvān anupama svādu phala nicita nāmān ca su phala vṛkṣān suvarṇa meru śikhara saṃsthānān sadā phala saṃpannān  vairocana kośa nāmnaḥ ca maṇi rāja vṛkṣān anupama maṇi ratna rāja saṃsthānān divya ratna sraj mālā ābharaṇa cintārāja maṇi ratna pramukta kośa samṛddhi dharān asaṃkhyeya varṇa maṇi ratna ākārān
translated: He saw fruit trees named Always Ripened and Incomparable Flavor, with fruits like the peaks of golden Mount Meru, always abundant with fruits.🔽He saw jewel king trees named Vairocana Treasury, with shapes like incomparable jewel king gems, bearing inexhaustible treasures of divine jewel necklaces, ornaments, and wish-fulfilling gems, with the forms of innumerable colored jewel gems.

analyzed: prasādana nāmān ca vastra vṛkṣān nānā varṇa divya ratna vastra kośa pramukta pralamba upaśobhitān
translated: He saw cloth trees named Delightful, adorned with hanging divine jewel cloth treasuries of various colors.

analyzed: pramodana nāmnaḥ ca vādya vṛkṣān divya atireka tūrya manojña madhura nirghoṣān
translated: He saw musical instrument trees named Joyful, emitting delightful and sweet sounds surpassing those of the divine musical instruments.

analyzed: samantaśubhavyūha nāmnaḥ ca gandhavṛkṣān sarva diś a pratihata sarva ākāra manojña gandha abhipramodanān adrākṣīt
translated: He saw incense trees named All-Pervasive Beautiful Array, delighting all with their delightful fragrances that are not obstructed in any direction.

analyzed: utsa saraḥ taḍāga puṣkiriṇīḥ ca sapta ratna iṣṭakā nicitāḥ catur dikṣu vibhakta ratna sopānāḥ kāla anusāri candana paridigdha vividha ratna vedikā parivṛtāḥ
translated: They were made of the seven precious substances, with steps in the four directions made of precious substances, surrounded by various precious altars anointed with black agaru sandalwood.

analyzed: nīla vaidūrya maṇi rājakṛta tala saṃsthānāḥ
translated: The floors were made of the king of sapphires and cat's eyes.

analyzed: jāmbūnada kanaka vālikā āstīrṇa talāḥ
translated: The floors were covered with golden sand from the Jambū River.

analyzed: manojña divya gandha aṣṭāṅga upeta vāri paripūrṇāḥ  vicitra varṇa divya gandha sparśa ratna utpala padma kumuda puṇḍarīka saṃchādita salilāḥ  divya atireka manojña rūpa nānā śakuni gaṇa madhura nirghoṣa nikūjitāḥ
translated: They were filled with water possessing the eight qualities, fragrant with divine fragrances.🔽Their waters were covered with various colored divine fragrant and soft lotuses, blue lotuses, red lotuses, and white lotuses.🔽They were filled with the sweet sounds of various flocks of birds with beautiful divine forms.

analyzed: vividha divya ratna su rucira druma paṅki parikṣepa upaśobhitāḥ
translated: They were adorned with various divine precious trees planted in rows.

original: sarveṣu ca teṣu nānāratnavṛkṣamūleṣu vicitramanojñarūpāṇi ratnasiṃhāsanāni prajñaptāni acintyānekavividharatnavyūhāni /
analyzed: sarveṣu ca teṣu nānā ratna vṛkṣa mūleṣu vicitra manojña rūpāṇi ratna siṃhāsanāni prajñaptāni acintya aneka vividha ratna vyūhāni
translated: Under all those various precious trees, various beautiful and delightful jeweled lion thrones were arranged, adorned with inconceivable various precious substances.

analyzed: nānā divya ratna vastra prajñapta upacārāṇi
translated: They were set up with various divine precious garments.

analyzed: sarva ākāra divya gandha dhūpa nirdhūpitāni
translated: They were perfumed with incense of all kinds of divine fragrances.

analyzed: divya atikrānta ratna paṭṭa abhipralambita vicitra ratna vitāna vitatāni
translated: They were covered with canopies of various jewels that hung down from divine, surpassing jeweled cords.

analyzed: nānā ratna vicitra jāmbūnada kanaka jāla saṃchannāni
translated: They were covered with nets of various jewels and gold from the Jambū River.

analyzed: ratna kiṅkiṇī jāla manojña madhura nirghoṣāṇi
translated: They had pleasant and melodious sounds from nets of jeweled bells.

analyzed: aneka divya ratna āsana śata sahasra parivārāṇi apaśyat  sa kvacid ratna vṛkṣa mūle ratna padma garbha siṃhāsanam prajñaptam apaśyat  kvacid gandharāja maṇi ratna padmagarbha siṃhāsanam
translated: He saw them surrounded by hundreds of thousands of divine jeweled seats.🔽At the foot of some jeweled trees, he saw lion thrones set up, with jeweled lotuses in their centers.🔽At some, there were lion thrones with jeweled lotuses in their centers made of the king of perfumes and jewels.

analyzed: kvacid nāgavyūha maṇi rāja padmagarbha siṃhāsanam  kvacid ratna siṃha skandha maṇi rāja padmagarbha siṃhāsanam
translated: At some, there were lion thrones with jeweled lotuses in their centers made of the king of jewels with nāga patterns.🔽At some, there were lion thrones with jeweled lotuses in their centers made of the king of jewels with lion-like shoulders.

analyzed: kvacid vairocana maṇi rāja padmagarbha siṃhāsanam  kvacid digvirocana maṇi rāja padmagarbha siṃhāsanam
translated: At some, there were lion thrones with jeweled lotuses in their centers made of the king of jewels that illuminate everywhere.🔽At some, there were lion thrones with jeweled lotuses in their centers made of the king of jewels that illuminate the directions.

analyzed: kvacid indra vajra maṇi rāja padmagarbha siṃhāsanam  kvacid jagat rocana maṇi rāja padmagarbha siṃhāsanam
translated: At some, there were lion thrones with jeweled lotuses in their centers made of the king of jewels that are Indra's thunderbolt.🔽At some, there were lion thrones with jeweled lotuses in their centers made of the king of jewels that illuminate the world.

analyzed: kvacid ratna vṛkṣa mūle sita ābha maṇi rāja padmagarbha siṃhāsanam prajñaptam apaśyat
translated: At the foot of some jeweled trees, he saw lion thrones set up with jeweled lotuses in their centers made of the king of jewels that are white in color.

original: sarvāvacca tanmahodyānaṃ nānāratnākīrṇatalaṃ mahāsāgaramiva ratnadvīpākīrṇamapaśyat nīlavaiḍūryarājakhacitasarvaratnapratyarpitakācilindikasukhasaṃsparśabhūmibhāgaṃ caraṇanikṣepotkṣeponnāmāvanāmavigataṃ vajraratnarājamayasukhasaṃsparśamanojñagandhanalinasaṃstīrṇatalaṃ haṃsakrauñcamayūrakuṇālakalaviṅkakokilajīvaṃjīvakarutanirnādamadhuranirghoṣaṃ divyaratnacandanadrumavanasuracitapraviṣṭavyūhopaśobhitaṃ vicitraratnapuṣpamegharatnakusumākṣayadhārābhipravarṣitaṃ miśrakāvanaprativiśiṣṭaṃ suracitanānāratnakūṭāgārātulagandharājasatatapradhūpitopacāraṃ sudharmadevasabhāprativiśiṣṭavyūhaṃ upariṣṭāddivyātirekavicitraratnajālasaṃchannaṃ muktāmaṇipuṣpahārakalāpapralambitopaśobhitadeśaṃ samantādratnakiṅkiṇīvicitravinyāsojjvalitasuvarṇajālapariṣkṛtaṃ vividhavādyavṛkṣaratnatālakiṅkiṇījālamārutasamīritamadhuramanojñaśabdanirghoṣaṃ vaśavartidevarājapramukhāpsaraḥsaṃgītirutaparamaramaṇīyanirghoṣaṃ vicitravarṇadivyakalpadūṣyameghābhipravarṣaṇavirājitaṃ mahāsāgaramivānantavarṇāvabhāsamasecanakadarśanamacintyāsaṃkhyeyaratnavyūhakūṭāgāraśatasahasrapratimaṇḍitaṃ tridaśendrapuramiva sudarśanaṃ sarvākāranānāratnabhaktipratimaṇḍitaṃ supariṇatacchatravinyāsasamantaśubhadarśanaṃ mahendralokamiva citrakūṭopaśobhitaṃ sadāpramuktamanojñamahāprabhāvabhāsaṃ jagadrocanamaṇiratnarājaprabhājvalitamiva mahābrahmavihāramasaṃkhyeyalokadhātvadhiṣṭhānākāśakośavipulāpramāṇāvakāśaṃ tatsūryaprabhaṃ mahodyānamapaśyat siṃhavijṛmbhitāyā bhikṣuṇyā mahatā acintyarddhiprabhāvabalādhānena //
analyzed: sarvāvat ca tat mahā udyānam nānā ratna ākīrṇa talam mahā sāgaram iva ratna dvīpa ākīrṇam apaśyat nīla vaiḍūrya rāja khacita sarva ratna pratyarpita kācilindika sukha saṃsparśa bhūmi bhāgam caraṇa nikṣepa utkṣepa unnāma avanāma vigatam vajra ratna rāja maya sukha saṃsparśa manojña gandha nalina saṃstīrṇa talam haṃsa krauñca mayūra kuṇāla kalaviṅka kokila jīvaṃjīvaka ruta nirnāda madhura nirghoṣam divya ratna candana druma vana su racita praviṣ
translated: He saw that entire great park, with its ground strewn with various jewels like the great ocean strewn with islands of jewels, with its ground made of blue sapphire king jewels, all inlaid with various jewels, soft to the touch like kācilindika cloth, without any depressions or elevations, made of diamond king jewels, soft to the touch, with a pleasant scent, covered with lotuses, with the sweet sounds of the calls of geese, cranes, peacocks, kuṇāla birds, partridges, cuckoos, and pheasants, adorned with well-arranged trees of divine jewels and sandalwood, with a rain of various jewel flowers and an unceasing stream of jewel flowers falling like a cloud, surpassing the Miśraka park, with its various jewel kūṭāgāras constantly perfumed with the incomparable gandharāja incense, with a layout surpassing the divine assembly hall of Sudharmā, covered above with a net of various divine and extraordinary jewels, with its regions adorned with hanging garlands of pearl jewels and flowers, with its various jewel kiṃśuka trees all around,

original: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhidārakaḥ imānevamapramāṇācintyaguṇasamuditān mahodyānavyūhān bodhisattvakarmavipākapariniṣpannān lokottaravipulakuśalamūlanirjātānacintyabuddhapūjopasthānaniṣyandasaṃbhavān sarvalokagatānavaśeṣakuśalamūlāsaṃhāryān māyāgatadharmasvabhāvanirvṛttān vimalavipulaśubhapuṇyavipākasaṃbhūtān siṃhavijṛmbhitāyā bhikṣuṇyāḥ pūrvasukṛtasucaritaniṣyandabalādhānasaṃbhūtānasādhāraṇān saśrāvakapratyekabuddhairasaṃhāryān sarvatīrthyaparapravādibhiranavamardyān sarvamārapathasamudācārairanavalokyān sarvabālapṛthagjanaiḥ samantādanuvilokayannadrākṣīt /
analyzed: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhi dārakaḥ imān evam apramāṇa acintya guṇa samuditān mahā udyāna vyūhān bodhisattva karma vipāka pariniṣpannān lokottara vipula kuśala mūla nirjātān acintya buddha pūjā upasthāna nisyanda saṃbhavān sarva loka gatān avaśeṣa kuśala mūla a saṃhāryān māyā gata dharma svabhāva nirvṛttān vimala vipula śubha puṇya vipāka saṃbhūtān siṃhavijṛmbhitāyāḥ bhikṣuṇyāḥ pūrva su kṛta su carita nisyanda bala ādhāna saṃb
translated: Then the merchant’s son Sudhana, looking all around at those great parks, which were endowed with such immeasurable and inconceivable qualities, which were the result of the bodhisattvas’ actions, which arose from the roots of merit that were beyond the world and vast, which were the manifestation of inconceivable offerings and service to the buddhas, which were not destroyed by the roots of virtue of all those who had gone to the worlds, which were the result of the Dharma nature of the way of illusion, which arose from the ripening of pure, vast, and good roots of virtue, which were the result of the power of the nun Siṃhavijṛmbhitā’s previous good actions and good conduct, which were not shared in common with śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, which were not to be taken away by any tīrthikas or opponents, which were not to be crushed by any of the activities of Māra, and which were not to be seen by any foolish ordinary beings,

original: sarveṣu ca teṣu nānāratnavṛkṣamūlagateṣu mahāsiṃhāsaneṣu siṃhavijṛmbhitāṃ bhikṣuṇīṃ saṃniṣaṇṇāṃ mahāparivāraparivṛtāṃ prāsādikenātmabhāvena praśānteryāpathāṃ śāntendriyāṃ śāntamanasaṃ suguptāṃ jitendriyāṃ nāgamiva sudāntāṃ hradamiva acchānāvilaviprasannacittāṃ cintāmaṇirājamiva sarvakāmapradāṃ padmamiva vāriṇānupaliptāṃ lokadharmaiḥ /
analyzed: sarveṣu ca teṣu nānā ratna vṛkṣa mūla gateṣu mahā siṃhāsaneṣu siṃhavijṛmbhitām bhikṣuṇīm saṃniṣaṇṇām mahā parivāra parivṛtām prāsādikena ātmabhāvena praśānta īryāpathām śānta indriyām śānta manasam su guptām jita indriyām nāgam iva su dāntām hradam iva accha anāvila viprasanna cittām cintāmaṇi rājam iva sarva kāma pradām padmam iva vāriṇā an upaliptām lokadharmaiḥ
translated: And on all those great lion thrones at the foot of jeweled trees, she saw the bhikṣuṇī Siṃhavijṛmbhitā seated, surrounded by a great retinue, with a pleasing physical form, with tranquil deportment, with tranquil senses, with a tranquil mind, well-guarded, with senses subdued like a well-tamed elephant, with a mind as clear and unruffled as a lake free from silt, bestowing all wishes like the wish-fulfilling king of jewels, unstained by worldly things like a lotus by water.

analyzed: siṃhaḥ iva vigata bhaya roma harṣām vaiśāradya viśuddhyā
translated: Like a lion, free from fear and horripilation, through the purity of her fearlessness.

analyzed: mahā acala indrarājam iva aprakampām śīla viśuddhyā
translated: Like the king of great immovable mountains, through the purity of her morality.

original: manoharagandharājamiva jagaccittaprahlādanakarīṃ himacandanamiva kleśaparidāhapraśamanakarīṃ sudarśanabhaiṣajyarājamiva sarvajagadduḥkhavyupaśamanakarīṃ varuṇapāśamivāmoghadarśanāṃ tathāgataprabhāmiva kāyacittaprasrabdhisukhasaṃjananīṃ mahābrahmāṇamiva vigatarāgadoṣamohaparyutthānām udakaprasādakamaṇiratnarājamiva kleśāvilasattvacittaprahlādanakarīṃ sukṣetramiva kuśalamūlavivardhanīm /
analyzed: manohara gandha rājam iva jagat citta prahlādana karīm himacandanam iva kleśa paridāha praśamana karīm sudarśana bhaiṣajya rājam iva sarva jagat duḥkha vyupaśamana karīm varuṇa pāśam iva amogha darśanām tathāgata prabhām iva kāya citta prasrabdhi sukha saṃjananīm mahābrahmāṇam iva vigata rāga doṣa moha paryutthānām udaka prasādaka maṇi ratna rājam iva kleśa āvila sattva citta prahlādana karīm sukṣetram iva kuśala mūla vivardhanīm
translated: Like the captivating king of perfumes, she delighted the minds of the world; like the snow-sandalwood, she alleviated the burning of afflictions; like the well-seen king of medicines, she alleviated the suffering of all beings; like Varuna's noose, her sight was never fruitless; like the Tathagata's light, she generated the bliss of mental and physical relaxation; like the great Brahma, she was free from the afflictions of passion, hatred, and delusion; like the king of water-purifying jewels, she delighted the minds of beings defiled by afflictions; like a good field, she increased the roots of virtue.

analyzed: teṣu ca āsana parivāreṣu vicitrām parṣadam saṃniṣaṇṇām adrākṣīt
translated: And in those seats and retinues, he saw a diverse assembly gathered.

original: sa kvacidāsanaparivāre maheśvaradevaputrapramukhānāṃ śuddhāvāsakāyikānāṃ devaputrāṇāṃ saṃniṣaṇṇānāṃ siṃhavijṛmbhitāṃ bhikṣuṇīmakṣayavimokṣasaṃbhedaṃ nāma dharmamukhaṃ prakāśayamānāmapaśyat /
analyzed: sa kvacid āsana parivāre maheśvara devaputra pramukhānām śuddhāvāsa kāyikānām devaputrāṇām saṃniṣaṇṇānām siṃhavijṛmbhitām bhikṣuṇīm akṣayavimokṣasaṃbhedam nāma dharma mukham prakāśayamānām apaśyat
translated: In one seat and retinue, he saw the bhikṣuṇī Siṃhavijṛmbhitā teaching the Dharma door called The Inseparability of the Inexhaustible Liberation to a gathering headed by the devaputra Maheśvara and the gods of the Pure Abodes.

original: kvacidāsanaparivāre rucirabrahmapramukhānāṃ brahmakāyikānāṃ devaputrāṇāṃ saṃniṣaṇṇānāṃ siṃhavijṛmbhitāṃ bhikṣuṇīṃ samantatalabhedaṃ nāma svaramaṇḍalaviśuddhiṃ saṃprakāśayamānāmapaśyat /🔽kvacidāsanaparivāre vaśavartidevarājapramukhānāṃ paranirmitavaśavartidevarājapramukhānāṃ paranirmitavaśavartināṃ devaputrāṇāṃ sadevakanyāparivārāṇāṃ saṃniṣaṇṇānāṃ siṃhavijṛmbhitāṃ bhikṣuṇīṃ bodhisattvāśayaviśuddhivaśitāvyūhaṃ nāma dharmamukhaṃ saṃprakāśayamānāmapaśyat /
analyzed: kvacid āsana parivāre rucira brahma pramukhānām brahmakāyikānām devaputrāṇām saṃniṣaṇṇānām siṃhavijṛmbhitām bhikṣuṇīm samantatalabhedam nāma svara maṇḍala viśuddhim saṃprakāśayamānām apaśyat  kvacid āsana parivāre vaśavarti devarāja pramukhānām paranirmitavaśavarti devarāja pramukhānām paranirmitavaśavartinām deva putrāṇām sa deva kanyā parivārāṇām saṃniṣaṇṇānām siṃhavijṛmbhitām bhikṣuṇīm bodhisattva āśaya viśuddhi vaśitā vyūham nāma dharma mukham saṃprakāśayamānām apaśyat
translated: In one circle of seats, he saw the bhikṣuṇī Siṃhavijṛmbhitā teaching the purification of the sphere of sound called the complete destruction of the ground to the devas of Brahmā’s retinue, with the beautiful Brahmā at their head.🔽In one circle of seats, he saw the bhikṣuṇī Siṃhavijṛmbhitā teaching the Dharma gateway called the array of the power of the purity of the bodhisattva mind to the devas of the class of the lord of the devas who controls others’ emanations, with the king of the devas who controls others’ emanations at their head, and to the devas of the class of the lord of the devas who controls others’ emanations, with the female devas at their head.

original: kvacidāsanaparivāre sunirmitadevarājapramukhānāṃ nirmāṇaratīnāṃ devaputrāṇāṃ sadevakanyāparivārāṇāṃ saṃniṣaṇṇānāṃ siṃhavijṛmbhitāṃ bhikṣuṇīṃ sarvadharmaśubhavyūhaṃ nāma dharmamukhaṃ saṃprakāśayamānāmapaśyat /
analyzed: kvacid āsana parivāre sunirmita devarāja pramukhānām nirmāṇaratīnām devaputrāṇām sa deva kanyā parivārāṇām saṃniṣaṇṇānām siṃhavijṛmbhitām bhikṣuṇīm sarvadharmaśubhavyūham nāma dharma mukham saṃprakāśayamānām apaśyat
translated: In one circle of seats, he saw the bhikṣuṇī Siṃhavijṛmbhitā teaching the Dharma gateway called the array of the auspiciousness of all phenomena to the devas of the class of the lord of the devas who delights in emanations, with the king of the devas who delights in emanations at their head, and to the devas of the class of the lord of the devas who delights in emanations, with the female devas at their head.

original: kvacidāsanaparivāre saṃtuṣitadevarājapramukhānāṃ tuṣitakāyikānāṃ devaputrāṇāṃ sadevakanyāparivārāṇāṃ saṃniṣaṇṇānāṃ siṃhavijṛmbhitāṃ bhikṣuṇīṃ svacittakośāvartaṃ nāma dharmamukhaṃ saṃprakāśayamānāmapaśyat /🔽kvacidāsanaparivāre suyāmadevarājapramukhānāṃ devaputrāṇāṃ sadevakanyāparivārāṇāṃ saṃniṣaṇṇānāṃ siṃhavijṛmbhitāṃ bhikṣuṇīmanantavyūhaṃ nāma dharmamukhaṃ saṃprakāśayamānāmapaśyat /
analyzed: kvacid āsana parivāre saṃtuṣita devarāja pramukhānām tuṣita kāyikānām devaputrāṇām sa deva kanyā parivārāṇām saṃniṣaṇṇānām siṃhavijṛmbhitām bhikṣuṇīm sva cittakośāvartam nāma dharma mukham saṃprakāśayamānām apaśyat  kvacid āsana parivāre suyāma devarāja pramukhānām devaputrāṇām sa deva kanyā parivārāṇām saṃniṣaṇṇānām siṃhavijṛmbhitām bhikṣuṇīm anantavyūham nāma dharmamukham saṃprakāśayamānām apaśyat
translated: In one circle of attendants, she saw the bhikṣuṇī Siṃhavijṛmbhitā teaching the Dharma gateway called “The Wheel of the Treasury of One’s Own Mind” to the devas of Tuṣita, headed by the deva king Santuṣita, together with their deva maidens and retinues, who were assembled there.🔽In one circle of attendants, she saw the bhikṣuṇī Siṃhavijṛmbhitā teaching the Dharma gateway called “Infinite Array” to the devas headed by the deva king Suyāma, together with their deva maidens and retinues, who were assembled there.

original: kvacidāsanaparivāre śakradevarājapramukhānāṃ trāyastriṃśakāyikānāṃ devaputrāṇāṃ sadevakanyāparivārāṇāṃ saṃniṣaṇṇānāṃ siṃhavijṛmbhitāṃ bhikṣuṇīmudvegamukhaṃ nāma dharmamukhaṃ saṃprakāśayamānāmapaśyat /
analyzed: kvacid āsana parivāre śakra devarāja pramukhānām trāyastriṃśa kāyikānām deva putrāṇām sa deva kanyā parivārāṇām saṃniṣaṇṇānām siṃhavijṛmbhitām bhikṣuṇīm udvegamukham nāma dharma mukham saṃprakāśayamānām apaśyat
translated: In one circle of attendants, she saw the bhikṣuṇī Siṃhavijṛmbhitā teaching the Dharma gateway called “The Door of Arousing Fear” to the devas of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, headed by the deva king Śakra, together with their deva maidens and retinues, who were assembled there.

original: kvacidāsanaparivāre sāgaranāgarājapramukhānāṃ śataraśminandopanandamanasyairāvatānavataptaprabhṛtīnāṃ nāgarājñāṃ sanāgakanyānāṃ nāgakumāraparivārāṇāṃ saṃniṣaṇṇānāṃ siṃhavijṛmbhitāṃ bhikṣuṇīṃ buddhaviṣayaprabhāvyūhaṃ nāma dharmamukhaṃ saṃprakāśayamānāmapaśyat /🔽kvacidāsanaparivāre vaiśravaṇamahārājapramukhānāṃ yakṣendrāṇāṃ sayakṣakanyāyakṣakumāraparivārāṇāṃ saṃniṣaṇṇānāṃ siṃhavijṛmbhitāṃ bhikṣuṇīṃ jagatparitrāṇakośaṃ nāma dharmamukhaṃ saṃprakāśayamānāmapaśyat /
analyzed: kvacid āsana parivāre sāgara nāga rāja pramukhānām śataraśmi nanda upananda manasya airāvata anavatapta prabhṛtīnām nāga rājñām sa nāga kanyānām nāga kumāra parivārāṇām saṃniṣaṇṇānām siṃhavijṛmbhitām bhikṣuṇīm buddha viṣaya prabhā vyūham nāma dharma mukham saṃprakāśayamānām apaśyat  kvacid āsana parivāre vaiśravaṇa mahārāja pramukhānām yakṣa indrāṇām sa yakṣa kanyā yakṣa kumāra parivārāṇām saṃniṣaṇṇānām siṃhavijṛmbhitām bhikṣuṇīm jagatparitrāṇakośam nāma dharma mukham saṃprakāśayamānām apaśyat
translated: In one circle of seats, he saw the bhikṣuṇī Siṃhavijṛmbhitā teaching the Dharma door called “The Array of the Buddha’s Domain” to the nāga kings headed by Sāgara, the nāga kings Śatarṣa, Nandopananda, Manasvat, Airāvaṇa, Anavatapta, and so forth, together with their nāga daughters and retinues of nāga princes, who were all seated.🔽In one circle of seats, he saw the bhikṣuṇī Siṃhavijṛmbhitā teaching the Dharma door called “The Treasury of Protection for the World” to the yakṣa lords headed by the great king Vaiśravaṇa, together with their yakṣa daughters and retinues of yakṣa princes, who were all seated.

original: kvacidāsanaparivāre dhṛtarāṣṭragandharvarājapramukhānāṃ gandharvāṇāṃ sagandharvakanyāgandharvakumāraparivārāṇāṃ saṃniṣaṇṇānāṃ siṃhavijṛmbhitāṃ bhikṣuṇīmakṣayapraharṣaṇaṃ nāma dharmamukhaṃ saṃprakāśayamānāmapaśyat /
analyzed: kvacid āsana parivāre dhṛtarāṣṭra gandharva rāja pramukhānām gandharvāṇām sa gandharva kanyā gandharva kumāra parivārāṇām saṃniṣaṇṇānām siṃhavijṛmbhitām bhikṣuṇīm akṣayapraharṣaṇam nāma dharma mukham saṃprakāśayamānām apaśyat
translated: In one circle of seats, he saw the bhikṣuṇī Siṃhavijṛmbhitā teaching the Dharma door called “The Inexhaustible Delight” to the gandharva kings headed by the gandharva king Dhṛtarāṣṭra, together with their gandharva daughters and retinues of gandharva princes, who were all seated.

original: kvacidāsanaparivāre rāhvasurendrapramukhānāmasurendrāṇāṃ sāsurakanyāsurakumāraparivārāṇāṃ saṃniṣaṇṇānāṃ siṃhavijṛmbhitāṃ bhikṣuṇīṃ dharmadhātujñānayavegavyūhaṃ nāma dharmamukhaṃ saṃprakāśayamānāmapaśyat /🔽kvacidāsanaparivāre mahāvegadhārigaruḍendrapramukhānāṃ garuḍendrāṇāṃ sagaruḍakanyāgarūḍakumāraparivārāṇāṃ saṃniṣaṇṇānāṃ siṃhavijṛmbhitāṃ bhikṣuṇīṃ bhavasāgarasaṃtrāsaviṣayaṃ nāma dharmamukhaṃ saṃprakāśayamānāmapaśyat /
analyzed: kvacid āsana parivāre rāhu asura indra pramukhānām asura indrāṇām sa asura kanyā asura kumāra parivārāṇām saṃniṣaṇṇānām siṃhavijṛmbhitām bhikṣuṇīm dharmadhātu jñānaya vegavyūham nāma dharma mukham saṃprakāśayamānām apaśyat  kvacid āsana parivāre mahāvega dhāri garuḍa indra pramukhānām garuḍa indrāṇām sa garuḍa kanyā garūḍa kumāra parivārāṇām saṃniṣaṇṇānām siṃhavijṛmbhitām bhikṣuṇīm bhava sāgara saṃtrāsa viṣayam nāma dharma mukham saṃprakāśayamānām apaśyat
translated: In one circle of seats, he saw the bhikṣuṇī Siṃhavijṛmbhitā teaching the Dharma gateway called “The Array of the Force of the Knowledge of the Dharma Realm” to the lords of the asuras, headed by the asura king Rāhu, who were seated together with their retinues of asura maidens and asura youths.🔽In one circle of seats, he saw the bhikṣuṇī Siṃhavijṛmbhitā teaching the Dharma gateway called “The Domain of Fearlessness in the Ocean of Existence” to the lords of the garuḍas, headed by the great garuḍa lord Mahāvega­dhārin, who were seated together with their retinues of garuḍa maidens and garuḍa youths.

original: kvacidāsanaparivāre drumakinnararājapramukhānāṃ kinnarendrāṇāṃ sakinnarakanyākinnarakumāraparivārāṇāṃ saṃniṣaṇṇānāṃ siṃhavijṛmbhitāṃ bhikṣuṇīṃ buddhacaryāvabhāsaṃ nāma dharmamukhaṃ saṃprakāśayamānāmapaśyat /
analyzed: kvacid āsana parivāre druma kinnara rāja pramukhānām kinnara indrāṇām sa kinnara kanyā kinnara kumāra parivārāṇām saṃniṣaṇṇānām siṃhavijṛmbhitām bhikṣuṇīm buddhacaryāvabhāsam nāma dharma mukham saṃprakāśayamānām apaśyat
translated: In one circle of seats, he saw the bhikṣuṇī Siṃhavijṛmbhitā teaching the Dharma gateway called “The Illumination of the Conduct of the Buddhas” to the lords of the kiṃnaras, headed by the kiṃnara king Druma, who were seated together with their retinues of kiṃnara maidens and kiṃnara youths.

original: kvacidāsanaparivāre bhṛkuṭīmukhamahoragendrapramukhānāṃ mahoragendrāṇāṃ samahoragakanyāmahoragakumāraparivārāṇāṃ saṃniṣaṇṇānāṃ siṃhavijṛmbhitāṃ bhikṣuṇīṃ buddhaprītisaṃbhavaṃ nāma dharmamukhaṃ saṃprakāśayamānāmapaśyat /
analyzed: kvacid āsana parivāre bhṛkuṭīmukha mahā uraga indra pramukhānām mahā uraga indrāṇām sa mahā uraga kanyā mahā uraga kumāra parivārāṇām saṃniṣaṇṇānām siṃhavijṛmbhitām bhikṣuṇīm buddhaprītisaṃbhavam nāma dharma mukham saṃprakāśayamānām apaśyat
translated: In one circle of seats, he saw the bhikṣuṇī Siṃhavijṛmbhitā expounding the Dharma gateway called “Arisen from the Buddha’s Joy” to a gathering of great nāga kings headed by the great nāga king Bhṛkuṭīmukha, surrounded by the great nāga maidens and great nāga youths.

original: kvacidāsanaparivāre'nekeṣāṃ strīpuruṣadārakadārikāśatasahasrāṇāṃ saṃniṣaṇṇānāṃ siṃhavijṛmbhitāṃ bhikṣuṇīṃ jñānaviśeṣagamanaṃ nāma dharmamukhaṃ saṃprakāśayamānāmapaśyat /
analyzed: kvacid āsana parivārena ekeṣām strī puruṣa dāraka dārikā śata sahasrāṇām saṃniṣaṇṇānām siṃhavijṛmbhitām bhikṣuṇīm jñānaviśeṣagamanam nāma dharma mukham saṃprakāśayamānām apaśyat
translated: In one circle of seats, he saw the bhikṣuṇī Siṃhavijṛmbhitā expounding the Dharma gateway called “Progressing to Distinctive Knowledge” to a gathering of many hundreds of thousands of men, women, boys, and girls.

original: kvacidāsanaparivāre nityaujoharadrumarājarākṣasendrapramukhānāṃ rākṣasendrāṇāṃ sarākṣasakanyārākṣasakumāraparivārāṇāṃ saṃniṣaṇṇānāṃ siṃhavijṛmbhitāṃ bhikṣuṇīṃ kṛpāsaṃbhavaṃ nāma dharmamukhaṃ saṃprakāśayamānāmapaśyat /
analyzed: kvacid āsana parivāre nitya ojaḥ hara druma rāja rākṣasa indra pramukhānām rākṣasa indrāṇām sa rākṣasa kanyā rākṣasa kumāra parivārāṇām saṃniṣaṇṇānām siṃhavijṛmbhitām bhikṣuṇīm kṛpāsaṃbhavam nāma dharma mukham saṃprakāśayamānām apaśyat
translated: In one circle of seats, he saw the bhikṣuṇī Siṃhavijṛmbhitā expounding the Dharma gateway called “Arisen from Compassion” to a gathering of rākṣasa kings headed by the rākṣasa king Nityaaujo’dharadruma, surrounded by the rākṣasa maidens and rākṣasa youths.

original: kvacidāsanaparivāre śrāvakayānādhimuktānāṃ sattvānāṃ saṃniṣaṇṇānāṃ siṃhavijṛmbhitāṃ bhikṣuṇīṃ jñānaviśeṣaprabhāvaṃ nāma dharmamukhaṃ saṃprakāśayamānāpaśyat
analyzed: kvacid āsana parivāre śrāvaka yāna adhimuktānām sattvānām saṃniṣaṇṇānām siṃhavijṛmbhitām bhikṣuṇīm jñānaviśeṣaprabhāvam nāma dharma mukham saṃprakāśayamānā apaśyat
translated: In one circle of followers, he saw the bhikṣuṇī Siṃhavijṛmbhitā teaching the Dharma door called “The Power of the Superior Knowledge” to beings seated there who were inclined toward the Śrāvaka Vehicle.

original: kvacidāsanaparivāre pratyekabuddhayānādhimuktānāṃ sattvānāṃ saṃniṣaṇṇānāṃ siṃhavijṛmbhitāṃ bhikṣuṇīmudārabuddhaguṇāvabhāsaṃ nāma dharmamukhaṃ saṃprakāśayamānāmapaśyat /
analyzed: kvacid āsana parivāre pratyekabuddha yāna adhimuktānām sattvānām saṃniṣaṇṇānām siṃhavijṛmbhitām bhikṣuṇīm udārabuddhaguṇāvabhāsam nāma dharma mukham saṃprakāśayamānām apaśyat
translated: In one circle of followers, he saw the bhikṣuṇī Siṃhavijṛmbhitā teaching the Dharma door called “The Illumination of the Vast Qualities of the Buddhas” to beings seated there who were inclined toward the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle.

original: kvacidāsanaparivāre mahāyānādhimuktānāṃ sattvānāṃ saṃniṣaṇṇānāṃ siṃhavijṛmbhitāṃ bhikṣuṇīṃ samantamukhaṃ nāma samādhijñānālokamukhaṃ saṃprakāśayamānāmapaśyat
analyzed: kvacid āsana parivāre mahāyāna adhimuktānām sattvānām saṃniṣaṇṇānām siṃhavijṛmbhitām bhikṣuṇīm samantamukham nāma samādhi jñāna āloka mukham saṃprakāśayamānām apaśyat
translated: In one circle of followers, he saw the bhikṣuṇī Siṃhavijṛmbhitā teaching the Dharma door called “The Light of the Knowledge of Samādhis” to beings seated there who were inclined toward the Mahāyāna.

original: kvacidāsanaparivāre prathamacittotpādikānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ saṃniṣaṇṇānāṃ siṃhavijṛmbhitāṃ bhikṣuṇīṃ sarvabuddhapraṇidhikūṭaṃ nāma samādhimukhaṃ saṃprakāśayamānāmapaśyat /
analyzed: kvacid āsana parivāre prathamacittotpādikānām bodhisattvānām saṃniṣaṇṇānām siṃhavijṛmbhitām bhikṣuṇīm sarvabuddhapraṇidhikūṭam nāma samādhi mukham saṃprakāśayamānām apaśyat
translated: In one circle of followers, he saw the bhikṣuṇī Siṃhavijṛmbhitā teaching the Dharma door called “The Peak of the Aspirations of All Buddhas” to bodhisattvas who had first given rise to the mind of enlightenment.

original: kvacidāsanaparivāre dvitīyabhūmipratiṣṭhitānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ saṃniṣaṇṇānāṃ siṃhavijṛmbhitāṃ bhikṣuṇīṃ virajomaṇḍalaṃ nāma samādhimukhaṃ saṃprakāśayamānāmapaśyat
analyzed: kvacid āsana parivāre dvitīya bhūmi pratiṣṭhitānām bodhisattvānām saṃniṣaṇṇānām siṃhavijṛmbhitām bhikṣuṇīm virajaḥ maṇḍalam nāma samādhi mukham saṃprakāśayamānām apaśyat
translated: In some assembly circles, he saw the nun Siṃhavijṛmbhitā teaching the door of meditative absorption called the stainless maṇḍala to bodhisattvas seated in the second bhūmi.

original: kvacidāsanaparivāre tṛtīyabhūmipratiṣṭhitānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ saṃniṣaṇṇānāṃ siṃhavijṛmbhitāṃ bhikṣuṇīṃ praśāntavyūhaṃ nāma samādhimukhaṃ saṃprakāśayamānāmapaśyat
analyzed: kvacid āsana parivāre tṛtīya bhūmi pratiṣṭhitānām bodhisattvānām saṃniṣaṇṇānām siṃhavijṛmbhitām bhikṣuṇīm praśāntavyūham nāma samādhi mukham saṃprakāśayamānām apaśyat
translated: In some assembly circles, he saw the nun Siṃhavijṛmbhitā teaching the door of meditative absorption called the peaceful array to bodhisattvas seated in the third bhūmi.

original: kvacidāsanaparivāre caturthībhūmipratiṣṭhitānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ saṃniṣaṇṇānāṃ siṃhavijṛmbhitāṃ bhikṣuṇīṃ sarvajñatāvegaviṣayasaṃbhavaṃ nāma samādhimukhaṃ saṃprakāśayamānāmapaśyat /
analyzed: kvacid āsana parivāre caturthī bhūmi pratiṣṭhitānām bodhisattvānām saṃniṣaṇṇānām siṃhavijṛmbhitām bhikṣuṇīm sarvajña tā vega viṣaya saṃbhavam nāma samādhi mukham saṃprakāśayamānām apaśyat
translated: In some assembly circles, he saw the nun Siṃhavijṛmbhitā teaching the door of meditative absorption called the arising of the domain of the impetus of omniscience to bodhisattvas seated in the fourth bhūmi.

original: kvacidāsanaparivāre pañcamībhūmipratiṣṭhitānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ saṃniṣaṇṇānāṃ siṃhavijṛmbhitāṃ bhikṣuṇīṃ cittalatākusumagarbhaṃ nāma samādhimukhaṃ saṃprakāśayamānamapaśyat /
analyzed: kvacid āsana parivāre pañcamī bhūmi pratiṣṭhitānām bodhisattvānām saṃniṣaṇṇānām siṃhavijṛmbhitām bhikṣuṇīm cittalatākusumagarbham nāma samādhi mukham saṃprakāśayamānam apaśyat
translated: In some assembly circles, he saw the nun Siṃhavijṛmbhitā teaching the door of meditative absorption called the inner core of the flowers of the creeper of the mind to bodhisattvas seated in the fifth bhūmi.

original: kvacidāsanaparivāre ṣaṣṭhībhūmipratiṣṭhitānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ saṃniṣaṇṇānāṃ siṃhavijṛmbhitāṃ bhikṣuṇīṃ vairocanagarbhaṃ nāma samādhimukhaṃ saṃprakāśayamānāmapaśyat
analyzed: kvacid āsana parivāre ṣaṣṭhī bhūmi pratiṣṭhitānām bodhisattvānām saṃniṣaṇṇānām siṃhavijṛmbhitām bhikṣuṇīm vairocanagarbham nāma samādhi mukham saṃprakāśayamānām apaśyat
translated: In one circle of seats, he saw the bhikṣuṇī Siṃha­vijṛmbhitā teaching the Dharma gateway called the lion’s yawn, which is the gateway to the samādhi called the womb of Vairocana, to bodhisattvas who were seated and who were on the sixth bhūmi.

original: kvacidāsanaparivāre saptamībhūmipratiṣṭhitānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ saṃniṣaṇṇānāṃ siṃhavijṛmbhitāṃ bhikṣuṇīṃ samantabhūmyalaṃkāraṃ nāma samādhimukhaṃ saṃprakāśayamānāmapaśyat /🔽kvacidāsanaparivāre aṣṭamībhūmipratiṣṭhitānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ saṃniṣaṇṇānāṃ siṃhavijṛmbhitāṃ bhikṣuṇīṃ dharmadhātupañjarasuvibhaktaśarīraviṣayaṃ nāma samādhimukhaṃ saṃprakāśayamānāmapaśyat /
analyzed: kvacid āsana parivāre saptamī bhūmi pratiṣṭhitānām bodhisattvānām saṃniṣaṇṇānām siṃhavijṛmbhitām bhikṣuṇīm samantabhūmyalaṃkāram nāma samādhi mukham saṃprakāśayamānām apaśyat  kvacid āsana parivāre aṣṭamī bhūmi pratiṣṭhitānām bodhisattvānām saṃniṣaṇṇānām siṃhavijṛmbhitām bhikṣuṇīm dharmadhātu pañjara suvibhakta śarīra viṣayam nāma samādhi mukham saṃprakāśayamānām apaśyat
translated: In one circle of seats, he saw the bhikṣuṇī Siṃha­vijṛmbhitā teaching the Dharma gateway called the lion’s yawn, which is the gateway to the samādhi called the ornament of all bhūmis, to bodhisattvas who were seated and who were on the seventh bhūmi.🔽In one circle of seats, he saw the bhikṣuṇī Siṃha­vijṛmbhitā teaching the Dharma gateway called the lion’s yawn, which is the gateway to the samādhi called the body’s domain that is well differentiated in the cage of the Dharma realm, to bodhisattvas who were seated and who were on the eighth bhūmi.

original: kvacidāsanaparivāre navamībhūmipratiṣṭhitānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ saṃniṣaṇṇānāṃ siṃhavijṛmbhitāṃ bhikṣuṇīmanilambhabalanilayavyūhaṃ nāma dharmamukhaṃ saṃprakāśayamānāmapaśyat /
analyzed: kvacid āsana parivāre navamī bhūmi pratiṣṭhitānām bodhisattvānām saṃniṣaṇṇānām siṃhavijṛmbhitām bhikṣuṇīm anilambhabalanilayavyūham nāma dharma mukham saṃprakāśayamānām apaśyat
translated: In one circle of seats, he saw the bhikṣuṇī Siṃha­vijṛmbhitā teaching the Dharma gateway called the lion’s yawn, which is the gateway to the samādhi called the array of the power of nonapprehending, to bodhisattvas who were seated and who were on the ninth bhūmi.

original: kvacidāsanaparivāre daśamībhūmipratiṣṭhitānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ saṃniṣaṇṇānāṃ siṃhavijṛmbhitāṃ bhikṣuṇīmanāvaraṇamaṇḍalaṃ nāma samādhimukhaṃ saṃprakāśayamānāmapaśyat
analyzed: kvacid āsana parivāre daśamī bhūmi pratiṣṭhitānām bodhisattvānām saṃniṣaṇṇānām siṃhavijṛmbhitām bhikṣuṇīm anāvaraṇamaṇḍalam nāma samādhi mukham saṃprakāśayamānām apaśyat
translated: In some assembly circles, he saw the bhikṣuṇī Siṃhavijṛmbhitā teaching the Dharma door of the unobstructed maṇḍala samādhi to bodhisattvas established in the tenth bhūmi who were seated.

original: kvacidāsanaparivāre saṃniṣaṇṇasya vajrapāṇiparṣanmaṇḍalasya siṃhavijṛmbhitāṃ bhikṣuṇīṃ jñānavajranārāyaṇavyūhaṃ nāma dharmamukhaṃ saṃprakāśayamānāmapaśyat
analyzed: kvacid āsana parivāre saṃniṣaṇṇasya vajrapāṇi parṣad maṇḍalasya siṃhavijṛmbhitām bhikṣuṇīm jñāna vajra nārāyaṇa vyūham nāma dharma mukham saṃprakāśayamānām apaśyat
translated: In some assembly circles, he saw the bhikṣuṇī Siṃhavijṛmbhitā teaching the Dharma door called the array of knowledge-vajra-nārāyaṇa to the assembly circle of Vajrapāṇi who was seated.

original: iti hi yāvatyaḥ sarvopapattyāyatanasaṃbhedeṣu sattvaprajñaptayaḥ sattvagatayaḥ /
analyzed: iti hi yāvatyaḥ sarva upapatti āyatana saṃbhedeṣu sattva prajñaptayaḥ sattva gatayaḥ
translated: Thus, in all the various realms of rebirth, the designations of beings, the destinies of beings,

original: tāsu ye sattvāḥ paripakvā vainayikā bhājanībhūtāḥ /
analyzed: tāsu ye sattvāḥ paripakvāḥ vainayikāḥ bhājanībhūtāḥ
translated: among those beings who are ripe for training, who are vessels,

original: teṣāṃ tasmin mahodyāne samavasṛtya pratyekamāsanaparivārasaṃniṣaṇṇānāṃ nānāśayānāṃ nānādhimuktānāṃ niyatāśayānāṃ ghanarasaśraddhānāṃ siṃhavijṛmbhitāṃ bhikṣuṇīṃ tathā tathā dharmaṃ deśayamānāmapaśyat /

translated: “Noble one, when the Tathāgata Atyuccagāmin entered the capital city of Sumukhā in order to benefit beings, as he stepped on the threshold, the entire city trembled.🔽It became vast and wide, made of many jewels, arrayed with the radiance of many jewels, strewn with various divine flowers, and filled with the sounds of many divine musical instruments.

analyzed: udāra aprameya deva kāya megha pracchannam ca antarīkṣam saṃsthitam abhūt
translated: The sky was covered with an immeasurable cloud of divine bodies.

original: ahaṃ ca kulaputra tena samayena sumatirnāma śreṣṭhibhāryā abhūvam /
analyzed: aham ca kula putra tena samayena sumatiḥ nāma śreṣṭhi bhāryā abhūvam
translated: “Noble one, at that time I was a merchant’s wife named Sumatī.

original: tato me buddhaprātihāryasaṃcoditayā svāminā sārdhaṃ pradhāvitvā tasya tathāgatasya vīthīmukhamupasaṃkrāntasya udāraprasādajātayā ekā ratnakākaṇiḥ pratipāditā /
analyzed: tatas me buddha prātihārya saṃcoditayā svāminā sārdham pradhāvitvā tasya tathāgatasya vīthī mukham upasaṃkrāntasya udāra prasāda jātayā ekā ratna kākaṇiḥ pratipāditā
translated: Then, inspired by the Buddha’s miracle, I ran with my husband to the entrance to the street where the Tathāgata was, and with a feeling of great faith, I offered a single jewel.

analyzed: tadā ca mañjuśrīḥ kumāra bhūtaḥ tasya bhagavatā utyuccagāminaḥ tathāgatasya upasthānakaḥ bhūt
translated: At that time, Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta was the attendant of the blessed Atyuccagāmin Tathāgata.

analyzed: tena aham anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpāditā
translated: Therefore, I have generated the mind of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: etamahaṃ kulaputra virāgakoṭīgataṃ bodhisattvavimokṣaṃ prajānāmi /🔽kiṃ mayā śakyamanantopāyajñānakauśalapratiṣṭhitānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ vipulākṣayapuṇyakośānāmaparājitajñānaviṣayāṇāṃ caryāṃ jñātum /
analyzed: etam aham kula putra virāga koṭī gatam bodhisattva vimokṣam prajānāmi  kim mayā śakyam ananta upāya jñāna kauśala pratiṣṭhitānām bodhisattvānām vipula akṣaya puṇya kośānām aparājita jñāna viṣayāṇām caryām jñātum
translated: Noble one, I know this bodhisattva liberation called the peak of passionlessness.

analyzed: guṇān vā vaktum
translated: How could I know the conduct or describe the qualities of the bodhisattvas who are established in the knowledge of infinite skillful means, who have vast, inexhaustible treasuries of merit, and whose sphere of knowledge is invincible?

analyzed: gaccha kula putra
translated: Go, noble one!

analyzed: iha eva dakṣiṇāpathe śubhapāraṃgamam nāma nagaram
translated: Here, in the southern region, there is a city called Shubhapāraṅgama.

original: tatra veṣṭhilo nāma gṛhapatiścandanapīṭhaṃ tathāgatacaityaṃ pūjayati /🔽tamupasaṃkramya paripṛcchakathaṃ bodhisattvena bodhisattvacaryāyāṃ śikṣitavyam /
analyzed: tatra veṣṭhilaḥ nāma gṛhapatiḥ candanapīṭham tathāgata caityam pūjayati  tam upasaṃkramya paripṛccha katham bodhisattvena bodhisattva caryāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: There, a householder named Veṣṭhila is worshipping the caitya of the Tathāgata called Candanapeṭha.

analyzed: katham pratipattavyam
translated: Approach him and ask him how a bodhisattva should train in the bodhisattva conduct and how he should practice.

original: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhidārako vasumitrāyā bhāgavatyāḥ pādau śirasābhivandya vasumitrāṃ bhāgavatīmanekaśatasahasrakṛtvaḥ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya punaḥ punaravalokya vasumitrāyā bhāgavatyā antikāt prakrāntaḥ // //
analyzed: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhi dārakaḥ vasumitrāyāḥ bhāgavatyāḥ pādau śirasā abhivandya vasumitrām bhāgavatīm aneka śata sahasra kṛtvas pradakṣiṇīkṛtya punar punar avalokya vasumitrāyāḥ bhāgavatyāḥ antikāt prakrāntaḥ  /
translated: Then the merchant's son Sudhana bowed his head to the feet of the noble Vasumitra, circumambulated Vasumitra many hundreds of thousands of times, keeping her to his right, and, looking back again and again, departed from the presence of the noble Vasumitra.

analyzed: veṣṭhilaḥ
translated: [Chapter 1: The Householder Veṣṭhila]

original: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhidārako yena śubhapāraṃgame nagare veṣṭhilasya gṛhapaterniveśanaṃ tenopajagāma /
analyzed: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhi dārakaḥ yena śubha pāraṃgame nagare veṣṭhilasya gṛhapateḥ niveśanam tena upajagāma
translated: Then the merchant's son Sudhana went to the city of Śubhapāraga and to the house of the householder Veṣṭhila.

original: upetya veṣṭhilasya gṛhapateḥ pādau śirasābhivandya purataḥ prāñjaliḥ sthitvā evamāhamayā ārya anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittamutpāditam /
analyzed: upetya veṣṭhilasya gṛhapateḥ pādau śirasā abhivandya puratas prāñjaliḥ sthitvā evam āham ayā ārya anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpāditam
translated: Having arrived, he bowed his head to the feet of the householder Veṣṭhila, stood before him with palms joined, and said, Noble one, I have generated the mind of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: na ca jānāmi kathaṃ bodhisattvena bodhisattvacaryāyāṃ śikṣitavyam /
analyzed: na ca jānāmi katham bodhisattvena bodhisattva caryāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: But I do not know how a bodhisattva should train in bodhisattva conduct.

analyzed: katham pratipattavyam
translated: How should one practice?

original: śrutaṃ ca me āryo bodhisattvānāmavavādānuśāsanīṃ dadātīti /
analyzed: śrutam ca me āryaḥ bodhisattvānām avavāda anuśāsanīm dadāti iti
translated: And I have heard, noble one, that you give instructions and teachings to bodhisattvas.

original: tadvadatu me āryaḥkathaṃ bodhisattvena bodhisattvacaryāyāṃ śikṣitavyam /
analyzed: tat vadatu me āryaḥ katham bodhisattvena bodhisattva caryāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: Therefore, noble one, tell me how a bodhisattva should train in bodhisattva conduct.

analyzed: katham pratipattavyam
translated: How should one practice?”

analyzed: sā uvocata aham kula putra a paryādatta koṭī gatasya bodhisattva vimokṣasya lābhī
translated: He said, “Noble sir, I have attained the bodhisattva liberation called ‘the irreproachable stage.’

original: na mama kulaputra saṃtānāttathāgataḥ parinirvṛto na parinirvāti na parinirvāsyati sarvalokadhātuṣu atyantaparinirvāṇena anyatra vainayikasattvavaśamupādāya
analyzed: na mama kula putra saṃtānāt tathāgataḥ parinirvṛtaḥ na parinirvāti na parinirvāsyati sarva lokadhātuṣu atyanta parinirvāṇena anyatra vainayika sattva vaśam upādāya
translated: Noble sir, the Tathagata has not attained final nirvāṇa, does not attain it, and will not attain it in my realm, in the ultimate sense, in all world-realms, except by way of instructing sentient beings.

analyzed: saḥ u ham kula putra candanapīṭhasya tathāgata caityasya dvāram uddhāṭayāmi
translated: “Noble sir, I open the door of the shrine of the Tathagata Sandalwood Throne.

analyzed: tat ca me caitya dvāram uddhāṭayataḥ ukṣayabuddhavaṃśavyūhaḥ nāma bodhisattva samādhiḥ pratilabdhaḥ
translated: When I open the door of that shrine, I attain the bodhisattva trance called ‘the array of the inexhaustible lineage of Buddhas.’

original: etaṃ cāhaṃ kulaputra samādhiṃ cittakṣaṇe cittakṣaṇe samāpadye /
analyzed: etam ca aham kula putra samādhim citta kṣaṇe citta kṣaṇe samāpadye
translated: Noble sir, I enter that trance at every moment of thought.

analyzed: sarvatra citta kṣaṇe aneka ākāra viśeṣa tām adhigacchāmi
translated: At every moment of thought I attain many different kinds of special qualities.”

analyzed: āhakaḥ etasya ārya samādheḥ viṣayaḥ
translated: He said, “What is the scope of this trance?”

original: āhaetaṃ mama kulaputra samādhiṃ samāpannasya asmin lokadhātuvaṃśe buddhaparaṃparayā kāśyapapramukhāḥ sarvatathāgatāḥ kanakamunikrakucchandaviśvabhukaśikhivipaśyitiṣyapuṣyayaśottarapadmottarapramukhāḥ sarvatathāgatā abhimukhā bhavanti /
analyzed: āha etam mama kula putra samādhim samāpannasya asmin lokadhātu vaṃśe buddha paraṃparayā kāśyapa pramukhāḥ sarva tathāgatāḥ kanaka muni krakucchanda viśvabhuka śikhi vipaśyi tiṣya puṣyayaśa uttara padmottara pramukhāḥ sarva tathāgatāḥ abhimukhāḥ bhavanti
translated: He said, Son of noble family, when I enter this samādhi, all the Tathāgatas, headed by Kāśyapa, and all the Tathāgatas of this world system's lineage, such as Kanakamuni, Krakucchanda, Viśvabhuk, Śikhin, Vipaśyin, Tiṣya, Puṣya, Yaśottara, Padmottara, and so forth, all the Tathāgatas, become manifest.

original: buddhadarśanānusaṃdhau buddhaparaṃparānupacchedena cittakṣaṇe cittakṣaṇe buddhaśataṃ paśyāmi /🔽tadanantareṇa cittena buddhasahasramavatarāmi /
analyzed: buddha darśana anusaṃdhau buddha paraṃparā an upacchedena citta kṣaṇe citta kṣaṇe buddha śatam paśyāmi  tad anantareṇa cittena buddha sahasram avatarāmi
translated: In the continuity of seeing the Buddhas, without interruption in the succession of Buddhas, moment by moment of mind, I see a hundred Buddhas.🔽In the next moment of mind, I perceive a thousand Buddhas.

analyzed: tad anantareṇa cittena buddha śata sahasram avatarāmi

original: evaṃ buddhakoṭīṃ buddhakoṭīśataṃ buddhakoṭīsahasraṃ buddhakoṭīśatasahasraṃ buddhakoṭyayutaṃ buddhakoṭīniyutaṃ buddhakoṭīkaṅkaraṃ buddhakoṭībimbaram

translated: In the same way, I perceive a koṭi of Buddhas, a hundred koṭis of Buddhas, a thousand koṭis of Buddhas, a hundred thousand koṭis of Buddhas, a nayuta of koṭis of Buddhas, a niyuta of koṭis of Buddhas, a kaṅkara of koṭis of Buddhas, a bimbara of koṭis of Buddhas,

analyzed: atulam śraddhā gamanīyam bodhisattva vīrya vyavasāya gamyam bodhisattva vīrya vega vivardhanam asaṃhāryam sarva lokena sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddhaiḥ tad viṣaya anavakrāntaiḥ ca bodhisattvaiḥ pratyutpannānām ca daśasu dikṣu sarva lokadhātuṣu vairocana pramukhānām tathāgatānām paraṃparām avatarāmi
translated: It is beyond compare, to be reached by faith, to be reached by the resolve of a bodhisattva's effort, to increase the impetus of a bodhisattva's effort, and cannot be taken away by all worlds, by all śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, and by bodhisattvas who have not entered into that sphere. I enter into the succession of tathāgatas who are present in all the world systems in the ten directions, beginning with Vairocana.

analyzed: eka citta kṣaṇe buddha śatam paśyāmi avatarāmi

analyzed: kim mayā śakyam tri adhva eka kṣaṇa jñāna pratilabdhānām bodhisattvānām kṣaṇa koṭī samādhi vyūha vihāriṇām tathāgata divasa avakrāntānām sarva kalpa vikalpa samatā anugatānām sarva buddha samatā samādhi anubaddhānām ātma sattva buddha advaya vihāriṇām prakṛti prabhāsvara dharma vyūha maṇḍalānām jñāna yantra loka jāla spharaṇānām sarva tathāgata dharma mudrā vikopita vihāriṇām sarva dharmadhātu vijñapana jñāna viṣayāṇām sarva tathāga
translated: What am I able to know the conduct of bodhisattvas who have attained the knowledge of the three times in a single instant, who abide in the array of the ten million instants of concentration, who are pervaded by the light of the Tathagatas, who have attained the equality of all kalpas and vikalpas, who are bound to the equality of all Buddhas in concentration, who abide in the non-duality of self, beings, and Buddha, who have the mandala array of the naturally radiant Dharma, who pervade the net of the world with the knowledge machine, who abide in the non-disturbance of the seal of the Dharma of all Tathagatas, whose sphere of knowledge is the proclamation of the entire realm of Dharma, whose sphere of knowledge is the understanding of the Dharma teachings of all Tathagatas?

original: āhakatamasya tvayā ārya tathāgatasya pādamūlādeṣa samantamukhanirjavano nāma bodhisattvavimokṣaḥ pratilabdhaḥ /
analyzed: āha katamasya tvayā ārya tathāgatasya pāda mūlāt eṣa samantamukhanirjavanaḥ nāma bodhisattva vimokṣaḥ pratilabdhaḥ
translated: He said, “Noble one, from which tathāgata did you first hear of this bodhisattva liberation called the door of liberation of the vision of the wisdom of the aspects of the path to enlightenment?

analyzed: kiyat dūre vā saḥ itas lokadhātuḥ
translated: How far is that world realm from here?

analyzed: kiyat cira uccalitaḥ vā asi tatas lokadhātoḥ
translated: How long has it been since you left that world realm?”

original: āhadurvijñeyametatkulaputra sthānaṃ sadevamānuṣāsureṇa lokena saśramaṇabrāhmaṇikayā prajayāyaduta bodhisattvaparākramī bodhisattvavīryānivartyatā bodhisattvavīryasaṃhāryatā /
analyzed: āha durvijñeyam etat kula putra sthānam sa deva mānuṣa asureṇa lokena sa śramaṇa brāhmaṇikayā prajayā yat uta bodhisattva parākramī bodhisattva vīrya a nivartya tā bodhisattva vīrya saṃhārya tā
translated: He said, “Noble one, this is a matter that is difficult for the world with its gods, humans, and asuras, and for the hearers and solitary buddhas, to understand, namely, the bodhisattva’s heroism, the bodhisattva’s diligence, and the bodhisattva’s power.

original: nedaṃ kulaputra śakyaṃ kalyāṇamitrāparigṛhītairbuddhāsamanvāhṛtairanupacitakuśalamūlairapariśuddhāśayairapratilabdhabodhisattvendriyaiḥ prajñācakṣuvirahitaiḥ śrotuṃ vā saṃdhārayituṃ vā adhimoktuṃ vā avatarituṃ vā /
analyzed: na idam kula putra śakyam kalyāṇa mitra a parigṛhītaiḥ buddha a samanvāhṛtaiḥ an upacita kuśala mūlaiḥ a pariśuddha āśayaiḥ a pratilabdha bodhisattva indriyaiḥ prajñā cakṣu virahitaiḥ śrotum vā saṃdhārayitum vā adhimoktum vā avataritum vā
translated: Noble one, this is not something that can be heard, retained, understood, or penetrated by those who are not sustained by spiritual benefactors, who are not inspired by the buddhas, who have not accumulated roots of virtue, who do not have pure superior intention, who have not attained the bodhisattva’s powers, and who are devoid of the eye of wisdom.”

analyzed: āhavadatu me āryaḥ
translated: He said, “Noble one, please tell me.

analyzed: adhimokṣyāmi śraddhāsyāmi buddha anubhāvena kalyāṇa mitra parigraheṇa ca
translated: Through the power of the buddhas and through the support of spiritual benefactors, I will have faith and understanding.”

original: so'vocatahaṃ kulaputra pūrvasyāṃ diśi śrīgarbhavatyā lokadhātorāgacchāmi samantaśrīsaṃbhavasya tathāgatasya buddhakṣetrāt /
analyzed: sā uvocata ham kula putra pūrvasyām diśi śrīgarbhavatyāḥ lokadhātoḥ āgacchāmi samantaśrīsaṃbhavasya tathāgatasya buddhakṣetrāt
translated: He said, “Noble one, I come from the world realm called Śrīgarbha in the east, from the buddha realm of the Tathāgata Samantaprabhāsa.

original: tasya me kulaputra samantaśrīsaṃbhavasya tathāgatasya pādamūlādeṣa samantamukhanirjavano nāma bodhisattvavimokṣaḥ pratilabdhaḥ /
analyzed: tasya me kula putra samantaśrīsaṃbhavasya tathāgatasya pāda mūlāt eṣa samantamukhanirjavanaḥ nāma bodhisattva vimokṣaḥ pratilabdhaḥ
translated: “Noble one, from the feet of the Tathāgata Samantaprabhāsa I obtained this bodhisattva liberation called the manifestation of the doors of the aspects of omniscience in all directions.

original: tataśca me kulaputra śrīgarbhavatyā lokadhātoruccalitasya anabhilāpyānabhilāpyabuddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamāḥ kalpāḥ kṣīṇāḥ /🔽ekaikena ca cittotpādena anabhilāpyānabhilāpyabuddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamān padavyavahārān vyatikramāmi /
analyzed: tatas ca me kula putra śrīgarbhavatyāḥ lokadhātoḥ uccalitasya anabhilāpya anabhilāpya buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samāḥ kalpāḥ kṣīṇāḥ  ekaikena ca citta utpādena anabhilāpya anabhilāpya buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samān pada vyavahārān vyatikramāmi
translated: “Noble one, since I left the world realm Śrīgarbha, as many kalpas have passed as there are atoms in an anabhilāpyānabhilāpya number of buddha realms.🔽With each thought I have passed through as many stages of speech as there are atoms in an anabhilāpyānabhilāpya number of buddha realms.

analyzed: ekaikena ca pada vyavahāreṇa anabhilāpya anabhilāpya buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samāni buddhakṣetrāṇi atikramāmi
translated: With each stage of speech I have passed through as many buddha realms as there are atoms in an anabhilāpyānabhilāpya number of buddha realms.

original: sarvāṇi ca tāni buddhakṣetrāṇi avirahitāni tathāgataiḥ /

translated: All those buddha realms are not separate from tathāgatas.

analyzed: avatarāmi sarvān ca tān buddhān bhagavataḥ
translated: I enter into all those buddha bhagavāns.

original: anuttarayā manomayyā anabhisaṃskāradharmadhātumudrāmudritayā tathāgatānujñātayā sarvabodhisattvapraharṣasaṃjananyā tathāgataṃ pūjayāmi /

translated: I worship the Tathāgata with the unsurpassed mind-made offering, sealed with the seal of the unconditioned dharmadhātu, approved by the Tathāgata, which delights all bodhisattvas.

analyzed: yāvataḥ ca tāsu lokadhātuṣu sattva samudrān paśyāmi
translated: And as many oceans of beings as I see in those world systems,

translated: Then the merchant's son Sudhana, his mind following the vast conduct of a bodhisattva, aspiring to the field of knowledge of the bodhisattva who goes nowhere else, seeing the special qualities of the domain of the accomplishment of great higher knowledge, attaining the joy of the firm armor of diligence, following the intention of playfully enjoying the inconceivable liberation, practicing the stage of the qualities of a bodhisattva, contemplating the stage of concentration, establishing himself in the stage of mnemonic powers, entering the stage of vows, training in the stage of discernment, accomplishing the stage of powers, gradually went to the city of Dvāravatī and asked about Mahādeva.

original: tasya mahājanakāya ārocayāmāsaeṣa kulaputra mahādevo nagaraśṛṅgāṭake devāgāre audārikeṇātmabhāvena sattvānāṃ dharmaṃ deśayati /
analyzed: tasya mahā jana kāyaḥ ārocayāmāsa eṣa kula putra mahādevaḥ nagara śṛṅgāṭake devāgāre audārikeṇa ātmabhāvena sattvānām dharmam deśayati
translated: A great crowd of people informed him, Noble sir, Mahādeva, with a coarse physical body, is teaching the Dharma to beings in the temple of the gods on the city's central hill.

original: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhidārako yena mahādevastenopasaṃkramya mahādevasya pādau śirasābhivandya purataḥ prāñjaliḥ sthitvā evamāhamayā ārya anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittamutpāditam /
analyzed: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhi dārakaḥ yena mahādevaḥ tena upasaṃkramya mahādevasya pādau śirasā abhivandya puratas prāñjaliḥ sthitvā evam āham ayā ārya anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpāditam
translated: Then the merchant’s son Sudhana went to Mahādeva, bowed his head at the feet of Mahādeva, stood before him with palms joined, and said, “Noble one, I have developed the aspiration for the highest, complete enlightenment,

original: na ca jānāmi kathaṃ bodhisattvena bodhisattvacaryāyāṃ śikṣitavyam /
analyzed: na ca jānāmi katham bodhisattvena bodhisattva caryāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: but I do not know how a bodhisattva should train in bodhisattva conduct,

analyzed: katham pratipattavyam
translated: how one should practice.

original: śrutaṃ ca me āryo bodhisattvānāmavavādānuśāsanīṃ dadātīti /
analyzed: śrutam ca me āryaḥ bodhisattvānām avavāda anuśāsanīm dadāti iti
translated: I have heard, noble one, that you give instructions and teachings to bodhisattvas.

original: tadvadatu me āryaḥkathaṃ bodhisattvena bodhisattvacaryāyāṃ śikṣitavyam /
analyzed: tat vadatu me āryaḥ katham bodhisattvena bodhisattva caryāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: Therefore, noble one, tell me how a bodhisattva should train in bodhisattva conduct,

analyzed: katham pratipattavyam
translated: how one should practice.”

original: atha khalu mahādevo devaścaturdiśaṃ caturaḥ pāṇīn prasārya caturbhyo mahāsamudrebhyaḥ paramaśīghrajavena vāryānīya svamukhaṃ prakṣālya sudhanaṃ śreṣṭhidārakaṃ suvarṇapuṣpairabhyavakīrya evamāhasudurlabhadarśanā hi kulaputra bodhisattvāḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu mahādevaḥ devaḥ caturdiśam caturaḥ pāṇīn prasārya caturbhyaḥ mahā samudrebhyaḥ parama śīghra javena vāri ānīya sva mukham prakṣālya sudhanam śreṣṭhi dārakam suvarṇa puṣpaiḥ abhyavakīrya evam āha su durlabha darśanāḥ hi kula putra bodhisattvāḥ
translated: Then Mahādeva, stretching out his four hands in the four directions, quickly bringing water from the four great oceans, washing his face, and scattering golden flowers over the merchant’s son Sudhana, said this: “Noble son, bodhisattvas are difficult to see.

original: paramadurlabhaśravaṇā āścaryaprādurbhāvā loke'gratvāt paramapuruṣapuṇḍarīkā jagatrtrātāraḥ /🔽pratiśaraṇabhūtā lokasya /
analyzed: parama durlabha śravaṇāḥ āścarya prādurbhāvāḥ lokegra tvāt paramapuruṣa puṇḍarīkāḥ jagatrtrātāraḥ  pratiśaraṇa bhūtāḥ lokasya
translated: They are extremely rare to hear, and their appearance in the world is a wonder. They are the supreme among men, the saviors of the world.🔽They are a refuge for the world.

analyzed: pratiṣṭhāna bhūtāḥ jagataḥ
translated: They are a support for the world.

analyzed: mahā avabhāsa karāḥ sattvānām
translated: They are great illuminators for beings.

analyzed: kṣema patha darśakāḥ saṃmūḍha mārgāṇām
translated: They show the path of safety to those who have lost their way.

analyzed: nāyaka bhūtāḥ dharma naya avataraṇa tāyai
translated: They are guides for entering the way of the Dharma.

analyzed: pariṇāyaka bhūtāḥ sarvajña tā pura upanayana tāyai
translated: They are leaders for bringing one to the city of omniscience.

original: tasya mama kulaputra evaṃ bhavatidurdṛṣṭighātanaṃ nāmadheyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ yena nirmalacittānāṃ svakāyapratibhāsaṃ darśayati /

translated: Noble one, I think thus: 'The bodhisattvas have a name that destroys bad views, by which they show their own body's reflection to those with pure minds.'

analyzed: viśuddha kāya karmaṇām abhimukhāḥ bhavanti
translated: They appear in front of those with pure physical actions.

analyzed: vacana doṣa vivarjitānām sarasvatī ālokam avakrāmayanti
translated: They illuminate Sarasvatī for those who are free from faults of speech.

original: viśuddhāśayānāṃ sarvakālamabhimukhāstiṣṭhanti /🔽ahaṃ kulaputra meghajālasya bodhisattvavimokṣasya lābhī /
analyzed: viśuddha āśayānām sarvakālam abhimukhāḥ tiṣṭhanti  aham kula putra megha jālasya bodhisattva vimokṣasya lābhī
translated: They always stand in front of those with pure intentions.🔽Noble one, I have attained the bodhisattva liberation called 'cloud net.'

original: āhaka etasya ārya meghajālasya bodhisattvavimokṣasya viṣayaḥ /
analyzed: āhakaḥ etasya ārya meghajālasya bodhisattva vimokṣasya viṣayaḥ

translated: I manifest all that agitation and commotion in order to show to those beings who are overcome by anger, who are arrogant, proud, and conceited, who are engaged in disputes and quarrels, who have bodies that are fierce, demonic, distorted, and terrifying, who eat flesh and blood, the forms of those beings.

analyzed: sarva pāramitā vipakṣa nirghātāya sarva pāramitā saṃbhāra upacayāya sarva āvaraṇa parvata prapāta patha samatikramaṇāya anāvaraṇa dharma avatārāya ca

translated: Then the earth goddess Sthāvarā, striking the great earth with her feet, revealing countless hundreds of thousands of millions of trillions of treasures of jewels, said this: Noble one, these hundreds of thousands of millions of trillions of treasures of jewels are your followers.

analyzed: tebhyaḥ tvam gṛhītvā yat kārtham tat kuruṣva
translated: Taking them from them, do what you need to do with them.

original: sā ahametena bodhisattvavimokṣeṇa samanvāgatā dīpaṃkaratathāgatamupādāya bodhisattvasya nityānubaddhā satatamārakṣāpratipannā /

analyzed: sarva praṇidhāna maṇḍalam avatarāmi

analyzed: sarva samādhi nayam anusarāmi

analyzed: sarva bodhisattva bala ādhipateya tām sarva bodhisattva asaṃhārya tām sarva kṣetra jāla spharaṇa tām sarva tathāgata vyākaraṇa saṃpratīcchana tām sarva kāla abhisaṃbodhi saṃdarśana tām sarva dharma cakra pravartana nayam sarva sūtrānta saṃprabhāṣaṇa dharmamegha nayam mahā dharma avaloka avabhāsa nayam sarva sattva paripācana vinaya jñāna nayam sarva buddha vikurvita saṃdarśana nayam ca anugacchāmi saṃdhārayāmi saṃpratīcchāmi
translated: I follow the sovereignty of all the powers of the bodhisattvas, the unassailability of all the bodhisattvas, the pervasion of all the nets of realms, the acceptance of all the prophecies of the tathagatas, the manifestation of the complete enlightenment at all times, the method of turning the wheel of the Dharma in all ways, the method of expounding all the sutras, the method of the Dharma clouds, the method of the great illumination of the Dharma, the knowledge of ripening and training all beings, and the method of manifesting all the miracles of the buddhas. I follow, uphold, and accept them all.

original: eṣa ca me kulaputra jñānaduryodhanagarbho bodhisattvavimokṣaḥ sumeruparamāṇurajaḥsamānāṃ kalpānāṃ pareṇa paratareṇa candradhvajāyāṃ lokadhātau sunetrasya tathāgatasyāntikātpratilabdhaḥ avabhāsavyūhe kalpe /
