translated: In its center is a world realm system named Sarvatathāgataprabhapraṇidhāninirghoṣa.

original: tasya madhye kanakavimalaprabhāvyūho nāma lokadhātuḥ sarvaratnameghavicitra adholokadhātau sarvaratnahārajālasāgarapratiṣṭhitaḥ sarvagandhavajramaṇirājavyūhaśarīraḥ kūṭāgārapariṇāhasaṃsthāno viśuddho'saṃkliṣṭaḥ divyavimānabhavanameghasaṃchāditaḥ /
analyzed: tasya madhye kanakavimalaprabhāvyūhaḥ nāma lokadhātuḥ sarva ratna megha vicitra adhas lokadhātau sarva ratna hāra jāla sāgara pratiṣṭhitaḥ sarva gandha vajra maṇi rāja vyūha śarīraḥ kūṭāgāra pariṇāha saṃsthānaḥ viśuddhaḥ asaṃkliṣṭaḥ divya vimāna bhavana megha saṃchāditaḥ
translated: In its center is a world realm named Kanakavimalaprabhāvyūha, adorned with a network of all jewels in the lower world realm, with a body adorned with the king of all vajra-perfumed jewels, shaped like a multi-storied building, pure, uncontaminated, covered with clouds of divine celestial palaces.

analyzed: tatra samantāvabhāsadhvajaḥ nāma kalpaḥ
translated: In that world realm, there is an eon named Samantāvabhāsa­dhvaja.

analyzed: tasmin lokadhātau sarvaratnagarbhavicitrābhaḥ nāma bodhimaṇḍaḥ bhūt
translated: In that world realm, there was a bodhimaṇḍa named Sarvaratnagarbhavicitrābha.

analyzed: tatra bhagavān avivartyadharmadhātunirghoṣaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ unuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: There the Blessed One, the Tathagata named Avivartyadharmadhatunirghosa, attained the highest complete enlightenment.

original: ahaṃ ca tena kālena tena samayena tasmin bodhivṛkṣe puṇyapradīpasaṃpatketuprabhā nāma bodhimaṇḍadevatā abhūvam /
analyzed: aham ca tena kālena tena samayena tasmin bodhivṛkṣe puṇya pradīpa saṃpad ketuprabhā nāma bodhimaṇḍa devatā abhūvam
translated: And I, at that time and at that moment, on that Bodhi tree, was a goddess of the Bodhi tree named Punyapradipasampatketupribha.

original: tayā me tasya tathāgatasya abhisaṃbodhivikurvitaṃ dṛṣṭvā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittamutpāditam /
analyzed: tayā me tasya tathāgatasya abhisaṃbodhi vikurvitam dṛṣṭvā anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpāditam
translated: Having seen the miraculous manifestation of the enlightenment of that Tathagata, I generated the mind directed towards the highest complete enlightenment.

original: tasya ca me tathāgatasya sahadarśanena tathāgataguṇasamudrāvabhāso nāma samādhiḥ pratilabdhaḥ /
analyzed: tasya ca me tathāgatasya saha darśanena tathāgata guṇa samudrāvabhāsaḥ nāma samādhiḥ pratilabdhaḥ
translated: And by merely seeing that Tathagata, I attained the samadhi called 'Illumination of the Ocean of the Qualities of the Tathagata'.

original: tasyānantaraṃ tasminneva lokadhātau samantasaṃpūrṇaśrīgarbhāyāṃ rājadhānyāṃ tatraiva bodhimaṇḍe dharmadrumaparvatatejo nāma tathāgato'bhisaṃbuddhaḥ
analyzed: tasya anantaram tasmin eva lokadhātau samanta saṃpūrṇa śrīgarbhāyām rājadhānyām tatra eva bodhimaṇḍe dharmadrumaparvatatejaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ abhisaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: Immediately after that, in that very world realm, in the royal capital Samantasampurnaśrigarbha, on that very Bodhi tree, the Tathagata named Dharmadrumaparvatatejas attained complete enlightenment.

original: ahaṃ ca tataścyutvā tatraiva bodhimaṇḍe jñānaśrīpuṇyaprabhā nāma rātridevatā abhūvam /
analyzed: aham ca tatas cyutvā tatra eva bodhimaṇḍe jñānaśrī puṇyaprabhā nāma rātri devatā abhūvam
translated: And I, having passed away from there, on that very Bodhi tree, became a goddess of the night named Jnanashripuṇyaprabha.

original: tayā me tasya bhagavato dharmadrumaparvatatejastathāgatasya dharmacakrapravartanavikurvitaṃ dṛṣṭvā sarvajagatsaṃdarśanasamatāvabhāsaviṣayo nāma samādhiḥ pratilabdhaḥ /
analyzed: tayā me tasya bhagavataḥ dharmadrumaparvatatejaḥ tathāgatasya dharma cakra pravartana vikurvitam dṛṣṭvā sarva jagat saṃdarśana samatā avabhāsa viṣayaḥ nāma samādhiḥ pratilabdhaḥ
translated: By that, I saw the Dharma wheel of the Dharma tree mountain radiance thus-gone one, and attained the samādhi called the field of light of the equality of the appearance of all worlds.

original: tasyānantaraṃ tatraiva bodhimaṇḍe sarvadharmasāgaranirghoṣarājo nāma tathāgata ārāgitaḥ /
analyzed: tasya anantaram tatra eva bodhimaṇḍe sarvadharmasāgaranirghoṣarājaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: After that, at that very bodhimaṇḍa, I pleased the thus-gone one named all-dharma-ocean-voice-king.

original: tasya me sahadarśanena sarvadharmabhūmisaṃvardhanasthāno nāma samādhiḥ pratilabdhaḥ /
analyzed: tasya me saha darśanena sarva dharma bhūmi saṃvardhana sthānaḥ nāma samādhiḥ pratilabdhaḥ
translated: By seeing him, I attained the samādhi called the place of increasing all-dharma-grounds.

original: tasyānantaraṃ tatraiva bodhimaṇḍe ratnaraśmipradīpadhvajarājo nāma tathāgata ārāgitaḥ /
analyzed: tasya anantaram tatra eva bodhimaṇḍe ratnaraśmipradīpadhvajarājaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: After that, at that very bodhimaṇḍa, I pleased the thus-gone one named jewel-light-banner-king.

original: tasya me sahadarśanena samantavṛkṣaprabhamegho nāma samādhiḥ pratilabdhaḥ /
analyzed: tasya me saha darśanena samantavṛkṣaprabhameghaḥ nāma samādhiḥ pratilabdhaḥ
translated: By seeing him, I attained the samādhi called the light-cloud of all trees.

original: tasyānantaraṃ tatraiva bodhimaṇḍe guṇasumeruprabhatejo nāma tathāgata ārāgitaḥ /
analyzed: tasya anantaram tatra eva bodhimaṇḍe guṇasumeruprabhatejaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: After that, at that very bodhimaṇḍa, I pleased the thus-gone one named the radiance-flame of the mountain of qualities.

original: tasya me sahadarśanena buddhasamudrāvabhāso nāma samādhiḥ pratilabdhaḥ /
analyzed: tasya me saha darśanena buddha samudrāvabhāsaḥ nāma samādhiḥ pratilabdhaḥ
translated: By seeing him, I attained the samādhi called the illumination of the ocean of buddhas.

original: tasyānantaraṃ tatraiva bodhimaṇḍe dharmameghanirghoṣarājo nāma tathāgata ārāgitaḥ /
analyzed: tasya anantaram tatra eva bodhimaṇḍe dharmameghanirghoṣarājaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: After him, on that very Bodhimaṇḍa, I propitiated a Tathāgata named Dharmamegha-nirghoṣa-rāja.

original: tasya me sahadarśanena dharmasāgarapradīpo nāma samādhiḥ pratilabdhaḥ /
analyzed: tasya me saha darśanena dharmasāgarapradīpaḥ nāma samādhiḥ pratilabdhaḥ
translated: As soon as I saw him, I attained a samādhi called Dharma-sāgara-pradīpa.

original: tasyānantaraṃ tatraiva bodhimaṇḍe jñānolkāvabhāsarājo nāma tathāgata ārāgito devakanyābhūtayā /
analyzed: tasya anantaram tatra eva bodhimaṇḍe jñānolkāvabhāsarājaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ deva kanyā bhūtayā
translated: After him, on that very Bodhimaṇḍa, I propitiated a Tathāgata named Jñānolkā-vabhāsa-rāja, as a celestial maiden.

original: tasya me sahadarśanena sarvasattvaduḥkhapraśamanapratibhāsapradīpo nāma samādhiḥ pratilabdhaḥ /
analyzed: tasya me saha darśanena sarva sattva duḥkha praśamana pratibhāsa pradīpaḥ nāma samādhiḥ pratilabdhaḥ
translated: As soon as I saw him, I attained a samādhi called Sarva-sattva-duḥkha-praśamana-prabhāsa-pradīpa.

original: tasyānantaraṃ tatraiva bodhimaṇḍe dharmavikurvitavegadhvajaśrīrnāma tathāgata ārāgitaḥ /
analyzed: tasya anantaram tatra eva bodhimaṇḍe dharmavikurvitavegadhvajaśrīḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: After him, on that very Bodhimaṇḍa, I propitiated a Tathāgata named Dharma-vikurvita-vega-dhvaja-śrī.

original: tasya me sahadarśanena tryadhvatathāgatasaṃprasthānāvabhāsagarbho nāma samādhiḥ pratilabdhaḥ /
analyzed: tasya me saha darśanena tri adhva tathāgatasaṃprasthānāvabhāsagarbhaḥ nāma samādhiḥ pratilabdhaḥ
translated: As soon as I saw him, I attained a samādhi called Tryadhva-tathāgata-saṃprasthānāvabhāsa-garbha.

original: tasyānantaraṃ tatraiva bodhimaṇḍe dharmapradīpavikramajñānasiṃho nāma tathāgata ārāgitaḥ /
analyzed: tasya anantaram tatra eva bodhimaṇḍe dharmapradīpavikramajñānasiṃhaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: After him, on that very Bodhimaṇḍa, I propitiated a Tathāgata named Dharma-pradīpa-vikrama-jñāna-siṃha.

original: tasya me sahadarśanena sarvalokāpratihatajñānacakraprabhatejo nāma samādhiḥ pratilabdhaḥ /
analyzed: tasya me saha darśanena sarva loka apratihata jñāna cakra prabha tejaḥ nāma samādhiḥ pratilabdhaḥ
translated: As soon as I saw him, I attained the samādhi called “The Light of the Wheel of Knowledge Unimpeded in All Worlds.”

original: tasyānantaraṃ tatraiva bodhimaṇḍe jñānabalaparvatatejo nāma tathāgata ārāgitaḥ /
analyzed: tasya anantaram tatra eva bodhimaṇḍe jñānabalaparvatatejaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: Immediately after that, on that very seat of awakening, I pleased the Tathāgata named Jñānabala-parvata-tejas.

original: tasya me sahadarśanena tryadhvasarvasattvacaryendriyaprabhāso nāma samādhiḥ pratilabdhaḥ /
analyzed: tasya me saha darśanena tri adhva sarva sattva caryā indriya prabhāsaḥ nāma samādhiḥ pratilabdhaḥ
translated: As soon as I saw him, I attained the samādhi called “The Light of the Faculties of the Conduct of All Beings in the Three Times.”

original: iti hi kulaputra tasmin samaye mayā kanakavimalaprabhe lokadhātau tasmin samantāvabhāsadhvajakalpe daśabuddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamāḥ tathāgatā ārāgitāḥ /
analyzed: iti hi kula putra tasmin samaye mayā kanaka vimala prabhe lokadhātau tasmin samanta avabhāsa dhvaja kalpe daśa buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samāḥ tathāgatāḥ ārāgitāḥ
translated: Thus, noble sir, at that time, in the world system called Kanaka-vimala-prabhā, in the kalpa called Samanta-avabhāsa-dhvaja, I pleased as many tathāgatas as there are atoms in ten buddha-fields.

original: keciddevendrabhūtayā kecinnāgendrabhūtayā kecidyakṣendrabhūtayā kecidgandharvendrabhūtayā kecidasurendrabhūtayā kecidgaruḍendrabhūtayā kecitkinnarendrabhūtayā kecinmahoragendrabhūtayā kecinmanuṣyendrabhūtayā kecidbrahmendrabhūyatā keciddevabhūtayā kecinmanuṣyabhūtayā kecitstrībhūtayā kecitpuruṣabhūtayā keciddārakabhūtayā keciddārikābhūtayā ārāgitāḥ /
analyzed: kecid deva indra bhūtayā kecid nāga indra bhūtayā kecid yakṣa indra bhūtayā kecid gandharva indra bhūtayā kecid asura indra bhūtayā kecid garuḍa indra bhūtayā kecid kinnara indra bhūtayā kecid mahoraga indra bhūtayā kecid manuṣya indra bhūtayā kecid brahma indra bhūyatā kecid deva bhūtayā kecid manuṣya bhūtayā kecid strī bhūtayā kecid puruṣa bhūtayā kecid dāraka bhūtayā kecid dārikā bhūtayā ārāgitāḥ
translated: Some were inspired by one who had become the lord of gods, some by one who had become the lord of nāgas, some by one who had become the lord of yakṣas, some by one who had become the lord of gandharvas, some by one who had become the lord of asuras, some by one who had become the lord of garuḍas, some by one who had become the lord of kinnaras, some by one who had become the lord of mahoragas, some by one who had become the lord of humans, some by one who had become the lord of Brahmā, some by one who had become a god, some by one who had become a human, some by one who had become a woman, some by one who had become a man, some by one who had become a boy, and some by one who had become a girl.

original: sarve ca me tathāgatāḥ pūjitā yathāsaṃprāptaiḥ pūjāpariṣkāraiḥ /
analyzed: sarve ca me tathāgatāḥ pūjitāḥ yathā saṃprāptaiḥ pūjā pariṣkāraiḥ
translated: And all those Tathāgatas were worshipped by me with whatever offerings and requisites I had obtained.

analyzed: sarve ca te tathāgatāḥ upasthitāḥ
translated: And all those Tathāgatas were attended upon by me.

original: sarveṣāṃ ca me teṣāṃ tathāgatānāṃ dharmadeśanā śrutā //
analyzed: sarveṣām ca me teṣām tathāgatānām dharma deśanā śrutā
translated: And the Dharma teachings of all those Tathāgatas were heard by me.

original: sā ahaṃ tataścyutvā tasminneva lokadhātau buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamān kalpān bodhisattvacaryāṃ caritvā tataścyutvā iha kusumatalagarbhavyūhālaṃkāre lokadhātusamudre asmin sahālokadhātāvupapannā /
analyzed: sā aham tatas cyutvā tasmin eva lokadhātau buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samān kalpān bodhisattva caryām caritvā tatas cyutvā iha kusuma tala garbha vyūha alaṃkāre lokadhātu samudre asmin sahā lokadhātau upapannā
translated: I transmigrated from there and practiced bodhisattva conduct for eons equal to the atoms in a buddha-field in that very world realm. Transmigrating from there, I was reborn in this Sahā world realm in the ocean of world realms called Kusumatalagarbhavyūhālaṃkāra.

analyzed: tayā me bhagavān krukucchandaḥ tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: I pleased the Blessed One, the Tathāgata Krakucchanda.

original: tasya ca me sahadarśanena sarvāndhakāravirajapratibhāso nāma samādhiḥ pratilabdhaḥ /
analyzed: tasya ca me saha darśanena sarvāndhakāravirajapratibhāsaḥ nāma samādhiḥ pratilabdhaḥ
translated: And by merely seeing him, I attained the samādhi called The Light of the Absence of All Darkness and Impurity.

analyzed: tasya anantaram kanakamuniḥ tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: Immediately after that, I pleased the Tathāgata Kanakamuni.

original: tasya ca me sahadarśanena sarvakṣetrasāgarāvabhāsānugataspharaṇo nāma samādhiḥ pratilabdhaḥ /
analyzed: tasya ca me saha darśanena sarva kṣetra sāgara avabhāsa anugata spharaṇaḥ nāma samādhiḥ pratilabdhaḥ
translated: And by merely seeing him, I attained the samādhi called The Light of All the Ocean of Fields, Which Follows and Pervades.

analyzed: tasya anantaram kāśyapaḥ tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: Immediately after that, I pleased the Tathāgata Kāśyapa.

original: tasya ca me sahadarśanena sarvasattvamantrasamudranigarjanasvaranirghoṣo nāma samādhiḥ pratilabdhaḥ /
analyzed: tasya ca me saha darśanena sarva sattva mantra samudra nigarjana svara nirghoṣaḥ nāma samādhiḥ pratilabdhaḥ
translated: And by merely seeing him, I attained the samādhi called The Sound of the Thunder of the Ocean of All Beings' Mantras.

analyzed: tasya anantaram ayam bhagavān vairocanaḥ tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: Immediately after that, I pleased this Blessed One, the Tathāgata Vairocana.

original: tadbodhimaṇḍe tathāgatābhisaṃbodhivikurvitamukhasamudrān praticittakṣaṇe saṃdarśayamānān dṛṣṭvā mayā eṣa vipulaprītivegasaṃbhavacittakṣaṇavyūho bodhisattvavimokṣaḥ pratilabdhaḥ /
analyzed: tad bodhimaṇḍe tathāgata abhisaṃbodhi vikurvita mukha samudrān prati citta kṣaṇe saṃdarśayamānān dṛṣṭvā mayā eṣa vipula prīti vega saṃbhava citta kṣaṇa vyūhaḥ bodhisattva vimokṣaḥ pratilabdhaḥ
translated: Seeing them, I attained this bodhisattva liberation called the array of the instant of mind that arises from the vast force of joy.

analyzed: yasya saha pratilambhāt daśa buddhakṣetrān abhilāpya anabhilāpya paramāṇu rajaḥ samān
translated: As soon as I attained it, I saw as many oceans of the manifestations of the tathāgatas’ enlightenment at the seat of enlightenment as there are atoms in inexpressibly many buddhafields.

original: sarvadharmadhātunayasamudrānavatīrṇā /🔽teṣu ca sarvadharmadhātunayasamudrāntargateṣu sarvabuddhakṣetreṣu yāni sarvaparamāṇurajāṃsi /
analyzed: sarva dharmadhātu naya samudra an avatīrṇā  teṣu ca sarva dharmadhātu naya samudra antargateṣu sarva buddhakṣetreṣu yāni sarva paramāṇu rajāṃsi
translated: I entered the ocean of the ways of all the aspects of the realm of phenomena.🔽In all those oceans of the ways of the realm of phenomena, in all the buddhafields, I saw as many buddhafields as there are atoms in all the buddhafields.

analyzed: teṣu ekaikasmin paramāṇu rajasi daśa anabhilāpya buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samāni buddhakṣetrāṇi avatīrya paśyāmi
translated: I saw them in each atom.

original: teṣu ca sarvakṣetreṣvekaikasmin buddhakṣetre bhagavantaṃ vairocanaṃ bodhimaṇḍavaragataṃ praticittakṣaṇamabhisaṃbodhivikurvitaṃ saṃdarśayamānānekaikena ca abhisaṃbodhivikurvitena sarvadharmadhātunayasāgarān spharantaṃ paśyāmi /
analyzed: teṣu ca sarva kṣetreṣu ekaikasmin buddhakṣetre bhagavantam vairocanam bodhimaṇḍa vara gatam prati citta kṣaṇam abhisaṃbodhi vikurvitam saṃdarśayamānān ekaikena ca abhisaṃbodhi vikurvitena sarva dharmadhātu naya sāgarān spharantam paśyāmi
translated: In all those buddha-fields, in each buddha-field, I see the Blessed One Vairocana seated at the site of enlightenment, manifesting the miracles of perfect enlightenment in every instant of mind, and with each miracle of perfect enlightenment pervading the ocean of all the ways of the Dharma-element.

original: teṣāṃ ca sarvatathāgatānāmekaikasya ca tathāgatasya pādamūlagatamātmānaṃ saṃjāne /
analyzed: teṣām ca sarva tathāgatānām ekaikasya ca tathāgatasya pāda mūla gatam ātmānam saṃjāne
translated: And I consider myself at the feet of each of those Tathāgatas.

original: ye ca teṣu lokadhātuṣu te tathāgatā bodhimaṇḍagatā dharmaṃ deśayanti /
analyzed: ye ca teṣu lokadhātuṣu te tathāgatāḥ bodhimaṇḍa gatāḥ dharmam deśayanti
translated: And those Tathāgatas who are seated at the site of enlightenment in those world-realms and are teaching the Dharma,

analyzed: tam sarvam śṛṇomi
translated: I hear all that.

original: ye ca teṣāṃ sarvatathāgatānāṃ nirmāṇasamudrāḥ sarvaromavivarebhyo niścarya dharmameghasamudrān nigarjamānān nānāvikurvitāni saṃdarśayamānān sarvadharmadhātudiksamudrāntargateṣu kṣetrasamudreṣu sarvalokadhātuvaṃśeṣu sarvalokadhātuprasareṣu sarvasattvaprasareṣu nānāgatyupapanneṣu sattvāśayavaśena nānāsaṃjñāgatairdharmacakraṃ pravartayanti /
analyzed: ye ca teṣām sarva tathāgatānām nirmāṇa samudrāḥ sarva roma vivarebhyaḥ niścarya dharma megha samudrān nigarjamānān nānā vikurvitāni saṃdarśayamānān sarva dharmadhātu diś samudra antargateṣu kṣetra samudreṣu sarva lokadhātu vaṃśeṣu sarva lokadhātu prasareṣu sarva sattva prasareṣu nānā gati upapanneṣu sattva āśaya vaśena nānā saṃjñā gataiḥ dharmacakram pravartayanti
translated: And the oceans of emanations of all those tathāgatas, issuing from all their pores, roaring the clouds of Dharma, displaying various manifestations, turning the wheel of the Dharma with various appellations according to the inclinations of beings, in the oceans of realms within the entire realm of phenomena and directions, in all the lineages of worlds, in all the expanses of worlds, in all the expanses of beings, in beings born in various destinies.

analyzed: tam sarvam saṃdhārayāmi
translated: And all the clouds of emanations of those tathāgatas, issuing from all their pores, roaring the ocean of Dharma clouds, manifesting various transformations, turning the wheel of the Dharma with various names and appellations in accordance with the dispositions of beings, in all the oceans of realms within the ocean of directions of the entire Dharma realm, in all the lineages of worlds, in all the expansions of world systems, in all the expansions of beings, in those born in various destinies, I uphold all of that.

analyzed: pratipadye
translated: I practice it.

analyzed: nidhyāyāmi
translated: I contemplate it.

original: sarvārthapadavyañjanodgrahavegavikramayā dhāraṇyā udgṛhṇāmi sarvadharmamaṇḍalaviśuddhigarbhānugamayā prajñayā pariśodhayāmi /

analyzed: sarvajña tā āveśaprabheṇa ca nāmnā dhāraṇī maṇḍalena
translated: and the dhāraṇī maṇḍala called the light of the entry into omniscience.

original: etāni ca kulaputra daśa dhāraṇīmaṇḍalāni pramukhaṃ kṛtvā daśabhirdhāraṇīmaṇḍalaparivartasahasraiḥ sattvānāṃ dharmaṃ deśayāmi //
analyzed: etāni ca kula putra daśa dhāraṇī maṇḍalāni pramukham kṛtvā daśabhiḥ dhāraṇī maṇḍala parivarta sahasraiḥ sattvānām dharmam deśayāmi
translated: Noble one, taking those ten dhāraṇī maṇḍalas as the main ones, I teach the Dharma to beings through ten thousand sections of dhāraṇī maṇḍalas.

original: punaraparaṃ kulaputra śrutamayyā prajñayā sattvānāṃ dharmaṃ deśayāmi /
analyzed: punar aparam kula putra śruta mayyā prajñayā sattvānām dharmam deśayāmi
translated: “Moreover, noble one, I teach the Dharma to beings through the wisdom that comes from hearing.

original: cintāmayyā bhāvanāmayyā prajñayā sattvānāṃ dharmaṃ deśayāmi /
analyzed: cintā mayyā bhāvanā mayyā prajñayā sattvānām dharmam deśayāmi
translated: I teach the Dharma to beings through the wisdom that comes from reflection and the wisdom that comes from meditation.

analyzed: ekam api bhava parivartam ārabhya sattvānām dharmam deśayāmi
translated: I teach the Dharma to beings beginning with a single cycle of existence.

analyzed: sarva bhava samudra parivartān api ārabhya sattvānām dharmam deśayāmi
translated: I teach the Dharma to beings beginning with all the oceans of existences.

analyzed: ekasya api tathāgatasya nāma cakra samudram ārabhya dharmam deśayāmi
translated: I teach the Dharma beginning with the ocean of the wheel of the name of a single tathāgata.

analyzed: ekam api lokadhātu samudram ārabhya dharmam deśayāmi
translated: I teach the Dharma beginning with a single ocean of world realms.

analyzed: sarva lokadhātu samudrān api ārabhya dharmam deśayāmi
translated: I teach the Dharma beginning with all oceans of world realms.

analyzed: ekam api buddha vyākaraṇa samudrām ārabhya dharmam deśayāmi
translated: I teach the Dharma beginning with a single ocean of the predictions of Buddhas.

analyzed: sarva tathāgata vyākaraṇa samudrān api ārabhya dharmam deśayāmi
translated: I teach the Dharma beginning with all oceans of the predictions of all Tathāgatas.

analyzed: ekam api tathāgata parṣad maṇḍala samudram ārabhya dharmam deśayāmi
translated: I teach the Dharma beginning with a single ocean of the assemblies of followers of a Tathāgata.

analyzed: sarva tathāgata parṣad maṇḍala samudrān api ārabhya dharmam deśayāmi
translated: I teach the Dharma beginning with all oceans of the assemblies of followers of all Tathāgatas.

analyzed: ekam api tathāgata dharma cakram ārabhya dharmam deśayāmi
translated: I teach the Dharma beginning with a single Dharma wheel of a Tathāgata.

analyzed: sarva tathāgata dharma cakra samudrān api ārabhya dharmam deśayāmi
translated: I teach the Dharma beginning with all oceans of the Dharma wheels of all Tathāgatas.

analyzed: ekam api sūtrāntam ārabhya dharmam deśayāmi
translated: I teach the Dharma beginning with a single sūtra.

analyzed: sarva tathāgata dharma cakra samavasaraṇān api sūtrāntam ārabhya dharmam deśayāmi
translated: I teach the Dharma beginning with a sūtra that includes all the oceans of the Dharma wheels of all Tathāgatas.

analyzed: ekam api tathāgata parṣad maṇḍala saṃnipātam ārabhya dharmam deśayāmi
translated: I teach the Dharma beginning with a single assembly of followers of a Tathāgata.

analyzed: sarva tathāgata parṣad maṇḍala samudrān api ārabhya dharmam deśayāmi
translated: I teach the Dharma beginning with all the ocean-like assemblies of the retinue of all the tathāgatas.

analyzed: ekam api sarvajña tā cittam ārabhya dharmam deśayāmi
translated: I teach the Dharma beginning with even a single thought of omniscience.

analyzed: sarva bodhi citta aṅga samudrān api ārabhya dharmam deśayāmi
translated: I teach the Dharma beginning with all the ocean-like aspects of the mind of enlightenment.

analyzed: ekam api yānam ārabhya dharmam deśayāmi
translated: I teach the Dharma beginning with even a single vehicle.

analyzed: sarva yāna niryāṇa samudrān api ārabhya dharmam deśayāmi
translated: I teach the Dharma beginning with all the ocean-like exits from the vehicles.

original: etatpramukhairahaṃ kulaputra anabhilāpyairdeśanānayābhinirhāraiḥ sattvānāṃ dharmaṃ deśayāmi /
analyzed: etad pramukhaiḥ aham kula putra anabhilāpyaiḥ deśanā anayā abhinirhāraiḥ sattvānām dharmam deśayāmi
translated: Noble one, I teach the Dharma to beings with these and other innumerable methods of teaching and accomplishments.

original: evamahaṃ kulaputraṃ dharmadhātunayāsaṃbhinnāṃstathāgatasamudrānavataramāṇā sarvasattvānāṃ dharmadeśanayā anuttaradharmasaṃgrahaṃ kurvāṇā samantabhadrabodhisattvacaryāparāntakoṭīgatān kalpasamudrān saṃvasamānā etanmanojñarūtagambhīravikurvitapraveśaṃ bodhisattvavimokṣaṃ bhāvayāmi ekaikacittakṣaṇavivardhanena vimokṣaviṣayabhāvanānayena ekaikena ca vimokṣaviṣayabhāvanānayena praticittakṣaṇaṃ sarvadharmadhātuṃ spharāmi //
analyzed: evam aham kula putram dharmadhātu nayā a saṃbhinnān tathāgata samudrān avataramāṇā sarva sattvānām dharma deśanayā anuttara dharma saṃgraham kurvāṇā samantabhadra bodhisattva caryā parānta koṭī gatān kalpa samudrān saṃvasamānā etad manojña rūta gambhīra vikurvita praveśam bodhisattva vimokṣam bhāvayāmi ekaika citta kṣaṇa vivardhanena vimokṣa viṣaya bhāvanā nayena ekaikena ca vimokṣa viṣaya bhāvanā nayena prati citta kṣaṇam sarva dharmadhātum spha
translated: In this way, noble sir, I am cultivating the bodhisattva liberation called “the profound manifestation of beautiful sounds,” while not separating from the ocean of tathāgatas, the way of the realm of reality, teaching the Dharma to all sentient beings, gathering the unsurpassed Dharma, living in the ocean of kalpas that extends to the end of the future, and practicing the conduct of the bodhisattva Samantabhadra, with the way of cultivating the sphere of liberation through the development of each instant of mind. And with each way of cultivating the sphere of liberation, I pervade the entire realm of phenomena in each instant of mind.”

original: sudhana āhaāścaryaṃ devate yāvadgambhīra eṣa bodhisattvavimokṣaḥ /
analyzed: sudhanaḥ āha āścaryam devate yāvat gambhīraḥ eṣa bodhisattva vimokṣaḥ
translated: Sudhana said, “Goddess, it is wonderful how profound this bodhisattva liberation is!

analyzed: kiyat cira pratilabdhaḥ tvayā ayam ārye bodhisattva vimokṣaḥ
translated: Goddess, how long ago did you attain this bodhisattva liberation?”

original: āhabhūtapūrvaṃ kulaputra atīte'dhvani lokadhātuparivartaparamāṇurajaḥsamānāṃ kalpāṇāṃ pareṇa dharmārcinagarameghā nāma lokadhāturabhūt cāturdvīpalokadhātuparamāṇurajaḥsamagandhamaṇisumerujālapratiṣṭhitā sarvatathāgatapūrvapraṇidhāṇanirghoṣapadmasaṃdhivyūhā sarvasattvakarmasamudrasaṃbhūtamaṇirājasāgaraśarīrā mahāpadmasaṃsthānā viśuddhasaṃkliṣṭā sumeruparamāṇurajaḥsamapuṣpacakravālaparivṛtā sumeruparamāṇurajaḥsamagandhamaṇisumervabhyudgatālaṃkārā sumeruparamāṇurajaḥsamamahācāturdvīpikālaṃkārā ekaikasyāṃ cāturdvīpikāyāmanabhilāpyānabhilāpyanagarakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrāṇyabhūvan //
analyzed: āha bhūta pūrvam kula putra atīta idhvani lokadhātu parivarta paramāṇu rajaḥ samānām kalpāṇām pareṇa dharmārcinagarameghā nāma lokadhātuḥ abhūt cāturdvīpa lokadhātu paramāṇu rajaḥ sama gandha maṇi sumeru jāla pratiṣṭhitā sarva tathāgata pūrva praṇidhāṇa nirghoṣa padma saṃdhi vyūhā sarva sattva karma samudra saṃbhūta maṇirāja sāgara śarīrā mahāpadma saṃsthānā viśuddha saṃkliṣṭā sumeru paramāṇu rajaḥ sama puṣpa cakravāla par
translated: He said, “In the past, noble one, beyond as many kalpas as there are atoms in a world realm, there was a world realm called Cloud of Dharma Lamp Cities, which was as vast as the atoms in a four-continent world realm, supported by a network of fragrant jewels and great central mountains, with the array of lotuses opening at the sound of all tathāgatas’ past vows, arisen from the ocean of karma of all beings, with a body of an ocean of jewel kings, shaped like a great lotus, pure and defiled, surrounded by a ring of mountains of as many flower continents as there are atoms in Mount Meru, adorned with as many great four-continent worlds as there are atoms in Mount Meru, and in each four-continent world there were as many millions of billions of inconceivable cities as there are atoms in an inconceivable number of continents.”

original: tasyāṃ khalu kulaputra lokadhātau vimalaprabho nāma kalpo'bhūt sumeruparamāṇurajaḥsamatathāgataprabhavaḥ /
analyzed: tasyām khalu kula putra lokadhātau vimalaprabhaḥ nāma kalpaḥ bhūt sumeru paramāṇu rajaḥ sama tathāgata prabhavaḥ
translated: “Noble one, in that world realm there was a kalpa called Vimalaprabha, with as many appearances of tathāgatas as there are atoms in Mount Meru.

original: tasyāṃ ca dharmārcinagarameghāyāṃ lokadhātau madhyamā vicitradhvajā nāma cāturdvīpikābhūt /
analyzed: tasyām ca dharma arci nagara meghāyām lokadhātau madhyamā vicitradhvajā nāma cāturdvīpikā abhūt
translated: And in that world sphere called Dharma Light City Cloud, there was a central four-continent world called Variously Bannered.

analyzed: tasyāḥ madhye samantaratnakusumaprabhā nāma rājadhānī abhūt
translated: In its center was a royal capital called All Jewels and Flower Light.

original: tasyā rājadhānyā nātidūre dharmarājabhavanapratibhāso nāma bodhimaṇḍo'bhūt /
analyzed: tasyāḥ rājadhānyāḥ na atidūre dharmarājabhavanapratibhāsaḥ nāma bodhimaṇḍaḥ bhūt
translated: Not far from that royal capital was a bodhimanda called Dharma King Palace Reflection.

original: tatra bodhimaṇḍe sarvadharmasāgaranirghoṣaprabharājo nāma tathāgata udapādi teṣāṃ sumeruparamāṇurajaḥsamānāṃ tathāgatānāṃ prathamakalpikaḥ /
analyzed: tatra bodhimaṇḍe sarvadharmasāgaranirghoṣaprabharājaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ udapādi teṣām sumeru paramāṇu rajaḥ samānām tathāgatānām prathama kalpikaḥ
translated: At that bodhimanda, a tathagata named All Dharma Ocean Sound Light King appeared, the first kalpa of those tathagatas as numerous as the atoms in Sumeru.

original: tena ca samayena vimalavakrabhānuprabho nāma rājā abhūt cakravartī /
analyzed: tena ca samayena vimalavakrabhānuprabhaḥ nāma rājā abhūt cakravartī
translated: At that time, there was a chakravartin king named Pure Curved Light Radiance.

original: tena tasya bhagavataḥ sarvadharmasāgaranirghoṣaprabharājñastathāgatasyāntikāt sarvadharmasāgaro nāma sūtrānta udgṛhītaḥ /
analyzed: tena tasya bhagavataḥ sarva dharma sāgara nirghoṣa prabha rājñaḥ tathāgatasya antikāt sarvadharmasāgaraḥ nāma sūtrāntaḥ udgṛhītaḥ
translated: He received from that bhagavat, the tathagata All Dharma Ocean Sound Light King, a sutra called All Dharma Ocean.

analyzed: udgṛhya ca dharmacakram anupravartitam
translated: Having received it, he turned the dharmachakra.

analyzed: parinirvṛtasya ca pravrajitvā śāsanam saṃdhāritam
translated: After the nirvana, he entered the monastic life and upheld the teachings.

original: śāsanāntardhānakāle ca sahasradhā bhinne śāsane daśanayaśatabhinnāyāṃ dharmadeśanāyāmanantarakalpakaṣāye pratyupasthite sarvakarmakleśāvaraṇāvṛtānāṃ sattvānāṃ kalahavigrahavivādamāpannānāṃ bhikṣūṇāṃ ca buddhaśāsanaguṇānarthikānāṃ viṣayaratiparāyaṇānāṃ rājacaurakathābhiratānāṃ strījanapadasamudrakathābhiratānāṃ lokāyatamantrābhiratānāmudvegasaṃjananārthaṃ dhārmika utkāsaḥ kṛto'bhūtaho bateyamanekakalpasamudānītā mahādharmolkā antardhāsyatīti saṃvegajananīyā kathā kṛtā /
analyzed: śāsana antardhāna kāle ca sahasradhā bhinne śāsane daśa naya śata bhinnāyām dharma deśanāyām anantara kalpa kaṣāye pratyupasthite sarva karma kleśa āvaraṇa āvṛtānām sattvānām kalaha vigraha vivādam āpannānām bhikṣūṇām ca buddha śāsana guṇa anarthikānām viṣaya rati parāyaṇānām rāja caura kathā abhiratānām strī janapada samudra kathā abhiratānām lokāyata mantra abhiratānām udvega saṃjanana artham dhārmikaḥ utkāsaḥ kṛtaḥ bhūta ho bata
translated: And at the time of the disappearance of the teachings, when the teachings were divided into a thousand sects and the Dharma teachings were divided into a hundred and ten sects, when the defilement of the intermediate eon was present, for beings covered by the obscurations of karma and afflictions, for monks who had fallen into quarrels, disputes, and arguments, who were not interested in the qualities of the Buddha's teachings, who were devoted to pleasures of the senses, who were fond of stories about kings and thieves, who were fond of stories about women and countries, who were fond of worldly mantras, in order to generate anxiety, a religious cough was made, thinking Alas! This great torch of the Dharma, which has been accomplished over many eons, will disappear. Thus, a discourse was given to generate anxiety.

original: sa ūrdhvaṃ gaganatale saptatālamātramabhyudgamya anantavarṇānarcimeghānniścārya nānāvarṇān mahāraśmijālavyūhān kāyādutsṛjya anekavarṇayā prabhayā loke kleśatāpaṃ śamayitvā anantamadhyān sattvān bodhau pratiṣṭhāpayāmāsa /
analyzed: saḥ ūrdhvam gagana tale sapta tāla mātram abhyudgamya ananta varṇān arci meghān niścārya nānā varṇān mahā raśmi jāla vyūhān kāyāt utsṛjya aneka varṇayā prabhayā loke kleśa tāpam śamayitvā ananta madhyān sattvān bodhau pratiṣṭhāpayāmāsa
translated: He rose up into the sky to the height of seven palm trees, emitted clouds of light of infinite colors, and emitted from his body a great net of light rays of various colors. With his light of many colors, he pacified the torment of afflictions in the world, and established infinite and immeasurable beings in enlightenment.

analyzed: tat ca tathāgata śāsanam punar jvālayitvā ṣaṣṭi varṣa sahasrāṇi asthāt
translated: And that teaching of the Tathāgata continued to shine for another sixty thousand years.

original: tena ca samayena dharmacakranirmāṇaprabhā nāma bhikṣuṇyabhūt tasyaiva vimalacakrabhānuprabhasya cakravartino duhitā bhikṣuṇīśatasahasraparivārā
analyzed: tena ca samayena dharmacakranirmāṇaprabhā nāma bhikṣuṇī abhūt tasya eva vimala cakrabhānuprabhasya cakravartinaḥ duhitā bhikṣuṇī śata sahasra parivārā
translated: At that time, there was a bhikṣuṇī named Dharmacakra-nirmanaprabhā, the daughter of that very universal monarch Vimalacarakṣabhānu. She was surrounded by a retinue of one hundred thousand bhikṣuṇīs.

original: sā taṃ saṃvegaśabdaṃ śrutvā tacca mahāprātihāryaṃ dṛṣṭvā saparivārā bodhāya cittamutpādayāmāsa /
analyzed: sā tam saṃvega śabdam śrutvā tat ca mahā prātihāryam dṛṣṭvā sa parivārā bodhāya cittam utpādayāmāsa
translated: Having heard that sound of agitation and seen that great miracle, she and her retinue generated the mind of awakening.

analyzed: tat ca bhikṣuṇī śata sahasram anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau a vaivartikam abhūt
translated: And that assembly of one hundred thousand bhikṣuṇīs became irreversible from unsurpassed perfect awakening.

original: tathāgatasaṃmukhībhāvasamavasaraṇaṃ ca nāma samādhiṃ pratyalabhata /🔽sarvatathāgatadharmacakranirmāṇaprabhaṃ ca nāma dhāraṇī sarvadharmasāgaranayapraveśāṃ ca nāma prajñāpāramitāṃ pratyalabhata /
analyzed: tathāgata saṃmukhībhāva samavasaraṇam ca nāma samādhim pratyalabhata  sarva tathāgata dharma cakra nirmāṇa prabham ca nāma dhāraṇī sarva dharma sāgara naya praveśām ca nāma prajñāpāramitām pratyalabhata
translated: And they attained the samādhi named Attaining the Presence of the Tathāgatas.🔽And they attained the dhāraṇī named The Light of the Creation of the Dharma Wheel of All Tathāgatas and the perfection of wisdom named Entering the Ways of the Ocean of All Dharmas.

original: dharmacakranirmāṇaprabhā ca bhikṣuṇī sarvatathāgataśāsanasaṃbhavāvabhāsapradīpaṃ ca nāma samādhim /
analyzed: dharmacakranirmāṇaprabhā ca bhikṣuṇī sarva tathāgata śāsana saṃbhava avabhāsa pradīpam ca nāma samādhim
translated: And the bhikṣuṇī Dharmacakra-nirmanaprabhā attained the samādhi named The Light of the Lamp Illuminating the Origin of the Teachings of All Tathāgatas.

original: etaṃ ca manojñarutagambhīravikurvitapraveśaṃ ca bodhisattvavimokṣaṃ sūkṣmamṛdukaṃ pratyalabhata /
analyzed: etam ca manojña ruta gambhīra vikurvita praveśam ca bodhisattva vimokṣam sūkṣma mṛdukam pratyalabhata
translated: He attained the subtle and gentle bodhisattva liberation called “entering the profound manifestation of the pleasant sound.”

analyzed: yad pratilābhāt asya sarva dharma sāgaranirghoṣaprabharājasya tathāgatasya tat sarvam vikurvitam āmukhībhūtam
translated: By attaining that, he directly perceived all the transformations of the Tathāgata Sarva­dharma­sāgara­nirghosa­prabhāsa­rāja.

original: tatkiṃ manyase kulaputra anyaḥ sa tena kālena tena samayena vimalavaktrabhānuprabho nāma rājābhūccakravartī yena tatsarvadharmasāgaranirghoṣaprabharājñastathāgatasya śāsane pravrajitvā dharmacakramanupravartitam /
analyzed: tat kim manyase kula putra anyaḥ sa tena kālena tena samayena vimalavaktrabhānuprabhaḥ nāma rājā abhūt cakravartī yena tat sarva dharma sāgara nirghoṣa prabha rājñaḥ tathāgatasya śāsane pravrajitvā dharmacakram anupravartitam
translated: What do you think, noble son? Was the universal monarch named Vimalavaktrābhanu, who in that time and in those days went forth in the teaching of the Tathāgata Sarva­dharma­sāgara­nirghosa­prabhāsa­rāja and turned the wheel of the Dharma, someone other than that?

analyzed: parinirvṛttasya ca śāsana antardhāna kāla samaye śāsanam saṃdhāritam
translated: He was the one who, at the time of the passing into nirvāṇa and the disappearance of the teaching, upheld the teaching.

analyzed: mahā dharma ulkā ca jvalitā
translated: He was the one who lit the great torch of the Dharma.

original: na khalu punaste kulaputra evaṃ draṣṭavyam /
analyzed: na khalu punar te kula putra evam draṣṭavyam
translated: Noble son, you should not see it like that.

original: samantabhadro bodhisattvaḥ sa tena kālena tena samayena vimalavaktrabhānuprabho nāma rājā abhūccakravartī /
analyzed: samantabhadraḥ bodhisattvaḥ sa tena kālena tena samayena vimalavaktrabhānuprabhaḥ nāma rājā abhūt cakravartī
translated: The bodhisattva Samantabhadra was the universal monarch named Vimalavaktrābhanu at that time and in those days.

original: tatkiṃ manyase kulaputra anyā sā tena kālena tena samayena vimalavaktrabhānuprabhasya rājñaścakravartino dharmacakranirmāṇaprabhā nāma duhitā
analyzed: tat kim manyase kula putra anyā sā tena kālena tena samayena vimalavaktrabhānuprabhasya rājñaḥ cakravartinaḥ dharmacakranirmāṇaprabhā nāma duhitā
translated: What do you think, noble sir? Was the daughter of the universal monarch Vimalavaktrprabhāsa, named Dharmacakranirmāṇaprabhā, at that time, on that occasion,🔽someone other than me?

analyzed: na khalu evam draṣṭavyam
translated: You should not see it like that.

original: ahaṃ sā tena kālena tena samayena dharmacakranirmāṇaprabhā nāma bhikṣuṇyabhūvam /
analyzed: aham sā tena kālena tena samayena dharmacakranirmāṇaprabhā nāma bhikṣuṇī abhūvam
translated: I was that nun named Dharmacakranirmāṇaprabhā at that time, on that occasion.

analyzed: mayā tat tasya sarva dharma sāgara nirghoṣa prabha rājñaḥ tathāgatasya śāsanam saṃdhāritam
translated: I upheld the teaching of that Tathāgata Sarva­dharma­sāgara­nirghosa­prabha.

analyzed: tat ca bhikṣuṇī śata sahasram sarvam avaivartikam kṛtam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: And that hundred thousand of nuns were all established in irreversibility toward supreme, perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: tathāgata saṃmukhībhāva samavasaraṇe ca samādhau pratiṣṭhāpitam
translated: And they were established in the samādhi called 'direct presence of the Tathāgatas'.

original: sarvatathāgatadharmacakravajraprabhāyāṃ dhāraṇyāṃ sarvadharmasāgaranayapraveśāyāṃ ca prajñāpāramitāyāṃ pratiṣṭhāpitam //
analyzed: sarva tathāgata dharma cakra vajra prabhāyām dhāraṇyām sarva dharma sāgara naya praveśāyām ca prajñāpāramitāyām pratiṣṭhāpitam
translated: They were established in the dhāraṇī called 'vajra light of the wheel of the Dharma of all Tathāgatas' and in the perfection of wisdom called 'entering the way of the ocean of all Dharmas'.

original: tasya ca mayā tathāgatasyānantaraṃ vimaladharmaparvatajñānaśikharābho nāma tathāgata ārāgitaḥ /

translated: “Noble one, I know this bodhisattva liberation called the entry into the profound manifestation of beautiful sounds. translated: Then the merchant’s son Sudhana, having praised the night goddess Sarva­nagara­rakṣā­saṃbhava­tejaḥ­śrī with these appropriate verses, bowed his head to the feet of the night goddess Sarva­nagara­rakṣā­saṃbhava­tejaḥ­śrī, circumambulated the night goddess Sarva­nagara­rakṣā­saṃbhava­tejaḥ­śrī many hundreds of thousands of times, keeping her to his right, and, looking back again and again, departed from the presence of the night goddess Sarva­nagara­rakṣā­saṃbhava­tejaḥ­śrī.

analyzed: sarva vṛkṣa praphullana sukha saṃvāsā

translated: He saw the night goddess Sarva­vṛkṣpraphullana­sukhasaṃvāsa, who was seated on a lion throne in a pavilion made of the branches of all fragrant jeweled trees, in the womb of a sprout of a precious tree, surrounded by a retinue of ten thousand night goddesses.

translated: When this was said, the night goddess Sarva­vṛkṣpraphullana­sukha­saṃvāsa said to the merchant’s son Sudhana, “Noble one, by the power of my knowledge of the night, at the time of sunset in the Sahā world realm, the lotuses bloom and become fragrant.

analyzed: sarve nagara nārī gaṇāḥ ca udyāna gatāḥ rati krīḍā prayuktāḥ gṛha gamanāya matim utpādayanti
translated: All the women in the city, who are in the parks, engaged in play and enjoyment, form the intention to return home.

original: pathotpathagatāḥ sattvā rātristhāne cetanābahulāḥ sarvajagatpālanābhimukhā bhavanti /🔽darīgahanaguhāśrayāḥ sattvā darīgahanaguhāsu praviśanti /

original: api tu khalu punarahaṃ kulaputra naranārīgaṇānāṃ daharāṇāṃ taruṇānāṃ yauvanamadamattānāṃ nṛtyagītavādyaratipramattānāṃ sattvānāṃ kāmaguṇapramuktānāṃ jātijarāmaraṇamahāndhakārabhayapratipakṣāya kuśalamūlasaṃjānābhiyogaṃ saṃvarṇayāmi /

analyzed: kusīdān sattvān bodhisattva vīrya ārambhe pratiṣṭhāpayāmi

analyzed: vibhrānta cittān sattvān dhyāneṣu pratiṣṭhāpayāmi

analyzed: duḥprajñān sattvān prajñāpāramitāyām niyojayāmi

analyzed: hīna yāna adhimuktān sattvān mahāyān pratiṣṭhāpayāmi

analyzed: traidhātuka abhiniviṣṭān sattvān bhava gati niṣṭhā maṇḍala cāriṇaḥ bodhisattva praṇidhāna pāramitāyām pratiṣṭhāpayāmi

original: āvaraṇavaśagatān sattvān karmakleśaprapīḍitān puṇyajñānabalaparihīṇān bodhisattvabalapāramitāyāṃ pratiṣṭhāpayāmi /

translated: I establish beings who are subject to obscurations, who are afflicted by karma and afflictions, who are deprived of the power of merit and wisdom, in the perfection of the power of the bodhisattvas.

analyzed: ajñāna tamaḥ vanaddhān sattvān ahaṃkāra mamakāra vidyā andhakāra prāptān bodhisattva jñāna pāramitāyām pratiṣṭhāpayāmi
translated: I establish beings who are enveloped in the darkness of ignorance, who have fallen into the darkness of the ignorance of the views of 'I' and 'mine', in the perfection of the bodhisattvas' knowledge.

translated: She said, Noble sir, this liberation is the radiance of the knowledge and means of gathering beings who have the merit of the Tathagatas.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

analyzed: yat kiṃcid kula putra sattvāḥ sukham anubhavanti
translated: Whatever happiness sentient beings experience,

original: sarvaṃ tattathāgatapuṇyaprabhāvena tathāgatānuśāsanīpathena tathāgatavacanapratipattyā tathāgatānuśikṣaṇena tathāgatādhiṣṭhānena tathāgatajñānamārgapratipattyā tathāgatabhāgakuśalamūlāvaropaṇena tathāgatadharmadeśanāniṣyandena tathāgatajñānasūryāvabhāsena /
analyzed: sarvam tat tathāgata puṇya prabhāvena tathāgata anuśāsanī pathena tathāgata vacana pratipattyā tathāgata anuśikṣaṇena tathāgata adhiṣṭhānena tathāgata jñāna mārga pratipattyā tathāgata bhāga kuśala mūla avaropaṇena tathāgata dharma deśanā nisyandena tathāgata jñāna sūrya avabhāsena
translated: all of that is by the power of the Tathāgata's merit, by the path of the Tathāgata's instructions, by practicing the Tathāgata's words, by following the Tathāgata's teachings, by the Tathāgata's blessing, by practicing the Tathāgata's path of knowledge, by planting roots of virtue that are a share of the Tathāgata, by the outflow of the Tathāgata's Dharma teaching, by the light of the Tathāgata's sun of knowledge,

translated: and by the light of the Tathāgata's mandala of pure karma in the lineage of the Tathāgata, noble sir, the happinesses of sentient beings come to be.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

translated: Because, noble sir, when I enter this bodhisattva liberation called 'the radiance of contentment born of vast joy,' remembering the seal of the Bhagavān Vairocana's past bodhisattva conduct, entering it, and penetrating it, I know in this way:

analyzed: evam anugacchāmi yathā bhagavataḥ pūrva bodhisattva bhūmim adhyālambamānasya sattvān ahaṃkāra mamakāra abhiniviṣṭān avidyā andhakāra prāptān dṛṣṭi gahana kāntāra praviṣṭān tṛṣṇā vaśaṃgatān rāga bandhana baddhān doṣa pratigha cetasaḥ moha ākula saṃtāna anīrṣyā mātsarya paryavanaddhān kleśa samākula cittān mahat saṃsāra duḥkham pratyanubhavataḥ saṃsāra dāridrya duḥkha prapīḍitān buddha darśana vimukhān sattvān dṛṣṭvā
translated: In this way, I will follow. original: sarvasattvānāmarthaṃ sarvajagadupakaraṇaratnasaṃgrahaparigrahacittaṃ sarvasattvasaṃsāropakaraṇasaṃbhavacittaṃ sarvavastvāgrahavigatacittaṃ sarvaviṣayālubdhacittaṃ sarvaratiṣvanadhyavasitacittaṃ sarvaparibhogeṣvagṛddhacittaṃ sarvadāneṣu vipākāpratikāṅkṣaṇacittaṃ sarvalokasaṃpattiṣvaspṛhaṇācittaṃ hetupratyayasaṃmūḍhacittaṃ suparyeṣitayathāvaddharmanidhyapticittaṃ sarvasattvārthapratiśaraṇatābhinirharaṇacittaṃ prādurabhavat //

original: bhūtapūrvaṃ kulaputra atīte'dhvani lokadhātusamudraparamāṇurajaḥsamānāṃ kalpānāṃ pareṇa parataraṃ maṇikanakaparvataśikharavairocano nāma lokadhātusamudro'bhūt

translated: In the past, noble one, in a time gone by, even further than the atoms in an ocean of world systems in the past, there was an ocean of world systems called Peak of the Golden Mountain of Jewels,

original: tasmin khalu punaḥ kulaputra maṇikanakaparvataśikharavairocanalokadhātusamudre jñānaparvatadharmadhātudikpratapanatejorājo nāma tathāgato'bhūt

original: tena khalu punaḥ kulaputra jñānaparvatadharmadhātudikpratapanatejorājonāmnā tathāgatena pūrvaṃ bodhisattvacaryāṃ caratā sa maṇikanakaparvataśikharavairocano lokadhātusamudraḥ pariśodhitaḥ /🔽tasmin lokadhātusamudre pṛthivīparvataparamāṇurajaḥsamalokadhātuprasaranirdeśaḥ /🔽ekaikasmiṃśca lokadhātuprasare lokadhātuvaṃśaparamāṇurajaḥsamā lokadhātunirdeśāḥ /
analyzed: tena khalu punar kula putra jñāna parvata dharmadhātu diś pratapana tejaḥ rājaḥ nāmnā tathāgatena pūrvam bodhisattva caryām caratā sa maṇi kanaka parvata śikhara vairocanaḥ lokadhātu samudraḥ pariśodhitaḥ  tasmin lokadhātu samudre pṛthivī parvata paramāṇu rajaḥ sama lokadhātu prasara nirdeśaḥ  ekaikasmin ca lokadhātu prasare lokadhātu vaṃśa paramāṇu rajaḥ samāḥ lokadhātu nirdeśāḥ
translated: In the past, noble one, when that thus-gone one named Wisdom Mountain Dharma Realm Illuminating All Directions Light King was practicing bodhisattva conduct, he purified that Jewel and Gold Mountain Peak Luminous World Ocean.🔽In that world ocean, the arrangement of world systems was taught to be as numerous as the atoms in the earth and mountains.🔽In each world system, the directions of world systems were taught to be as numerous as the atoms in a world system.

analyzed: ekaikasmin ca loka vaṃśe lokadhātu paramāṇu rajaḥ samāḥ kalpa saṃkhyā nirdeśāḥ  ekaikasmin ca kalpena ekena antara kalpa nirdeśāḥ
translated: In each world direction, the enumeration of world systems was taught to be as numerous as the atoms in a world system.🔽In each world system, the enumeration of eons was taught to be as numerous as the atoms in a world system.🔽In each eon, the enumeration of eons was taught to be as numerous as the atoms in a world system.

analyzed: ekaikasmin ca anantara kalpena eka lokadhātu nānākaraṇa nirdeśāḥ
translated: In each eon, the enumeration of world systems was taught to be as numerous as the atoms in a world system.

analyzed: tathāgata utpādāḥ vividha vikurvita nirdeśāḥ
translated: The manifestations of the various miracles of the Tathāgata.

analyzed: ekaikasmin ca tathāgata utpāde lokadhātu paramāṇu rajaḥ samāḥ sūtrānta saṃprakāśa nirdeśāḥ
translated: In each manifestation of the Tathāgata, there were as many sūtras taught as there are atoms in a world-system.

original: ekaikasmiṃśca sūtrānte lokadhātuparamāṇurajaḥsamā bodhisattvavyākaraṇanirdeśāḥ anantamadhyasattvavinayanirdeśā nānāyānanayaiḥ pravartitā nānāvikurvitaprātihāryavinayatāḥ🔽tasmin khalu punarmaṇikanakaparvataśikharavairocane lokadhātusamudre samantadigabhimukhadvāradhvajavyūho nāma madhyamo lokadhātuvaṃśo'bhūt /

translated: In each sūtra, there were as many predictions of enlightenment for bodhisattvas as there are atoms in a world-system, and as many teachings on the training of beings without end or middle, set forth with various vehicles and various miracles and wonders for training.🔽In that ocean of world systems called Maṇikanakagiritaṭavibhūṣita, there was a middle world system called Samantād diksamandalarājasamalaṃkṛta.

original: tasmin khalu punaḥ kulaputra samantadigabhimukhadvāradhvajavyūhe madhyame lokadhātuvaṃśe sarvaratnavarṇasamantaprabhāsaśrīrnāma lokadhāturabhūt

translated: In that middle world system called Samantād diksamandalarājasamalaṃkṛta, there was a world system called Sarvaratnavarṇasamantālokaprabhāśrī.

analyzed: sarva tathāgata bodhimaṇḍa pratibhāsa maṇi rājaḥ lokadhātu saṃdhi vyūhaḥ sarva ratna kusuma sāgara pratiṣṭhitaḥ sarva tathāgata nirmāṇa nirbhāsa nidarśana maṇi rāja śarīraḥ deva nagara saṃsthānaḥ viśuddha saṃkliṣṭaḥ
translated: It was adorned with the light of the bodhimaṇḍas of all tathāgatas, with the arrays of the junctions of world realms, with the foundation of an ocean of all jewels, with the body of the king of jewels that manifests the emanations of all tathāgatas, with the arrangement of the cities of devas, and with the pure and defiled.

analyzed: tasmin punar lokadhātau sumeru paramāṇu rajaḥ samāḥ cāturdvīpakāḥ lokadhātavaḥ bhūvan
translated: In that world realm there were as many four-continent world realms as there are atoms in Sumeru.

original: teṣāṃ ca sumeruparamāṇurajaḥsamānāṃ cāturdvīpakānāṃ sarvaratnaśikharadhvajo nāma madhyamaścāturdvīpako'bhūt /
analyzed: teṣām ca sumeru paramāṇu rajaḥ samānām cāturdvīpakānām sarvaratnaśikharadhvajaḥ nāma madhyamaḥ cāturdvīpakaḥ bhūt
translated: And among those four-continent world realms, which were as numerous as the atoms in Sumeru, there was a central four-continent world realm called All Jewels Peak Banner.

original: tasmin khalu punaḥ sarvaratnaśikharadhvaje cāturdvīpake lokadhātau aprameyayojanaśatasahasrāyāmavistārāścatvāro dvīpā abhūvan /
analyzed: tasmin khalu punar sarva ratna śikhara dhvaje cāturdvīpake lokadhātau aprameya yojana śata sahasra āyāma vistārāḥ catvāraḥ dvīpāḥ abhūvan
translated: In that four-continent world realm called All Jewels Peak Banner, there were four continents, each of which was immeasurable in length and breadth, extending for many hundreds of thousands of yojanas.

analyzed: ekaikasmin ca dvīpake daśa mahā nagara sahasrāṇi abhūvan
translated: In each of the four continents there were ten thousand great cities.

original: tasmiṃśca khalu punaḥ cāturdvīpake jambudvīpakasya madhye ratnasālavyūhameghapradīpā nāma rājadhānyabhūddaśanagarasahasraparivārā /
analyzed: tasmin ca khalu punar cāturdvīpake jambudvīpakasya madhye ratnasālavyūhameghapradīpā nāma rājadhānī abhūt daśa nagara sahasra parivārā
translated: In that four-continent world realm, in the center of Jambudvīpa, there was a royal capital city called Array of Jewel Palaces and Clouds of Light, surrounded by ten thousand cities.

original: tasmin khalu punarjambudvīpe daśa varṣasahasrāṇi manuṣyāṇāmāyuṣpramāṇamabhūt /
analyzed: tasmin khalu punar jambudvīpe daśa varṣa sahasrāṇi manuṣyāṇām āyuṣpramāṇam abhūt
translated: In that Jambudvīpa, the lifespan of humans was ten thousand years.

original: tasyāṃ khalu punā ratnasālavyūhameghapradīpāyāṃ rājadhānyāṃ sarvadharmanirnādacchatramaṇḍalanirghoṣo nāma rājābhūccakravartī /

translated: In that very Ratnasaṃpūrṇa-megha-pradīpā royal capital, there was a king named Sarva-dharma-nirnādacchatra-maṇḍala-nirghoṣa, a wheel-turning king.

analyzed: rājñaḥ khalu punar sarvadharma nirnāda chatra maṇḍala nirghoṣasya pañca amātya śatāni abhūvan
translated: King Sarva-dharma-nirnādacchatra-maṇḍala-nirghoṣa had five hundred ministers.

analyzed: ṣaṣṭiḥ strī sahasrāṇi antaḥpuram abhūt
translated: He had a harem of sixty thousand women.

original: sapta putraśatānyabhūvan sarveṣāṃ śūrāṇāṃ vīrāṇāṃ varāṅgarūpiṇāṃ sudarśanānāṃ mahātejasāṃ mahābalānām /
analyzed: sapta putra śatāni abhūvan sarveṣām śūrāṇām vīrāṇām vara aṅga rūpiṇām sudarśanānām mahā tejasām mahā balānām
translated: He had seven hundred sons, all of whom were brave, heroic, of excellent bodily form, handsome, of great splendor, and of great strength.

original: tasya khalu punaḥ sarvadharmanirnādacchatramaṇḍalanirghoṣasya rājñaḥ sarvo jambudvīpa ekacchatro'bhūnnihataparacakrapratyarthikaḥ //
analyzed: tasya khalu punar sarva dharma nirnāda chatra maṇḍala nirghoṣasya rājñaḥ sarvaḥ jambudvīpaḥ
translated: Moreover, that King Sarva-dharma-nirnādacchatra-maṇḍala-nirghoṣa had the entire Jambudvīpa under one umbrella, with all opposing and hostile forces destroyed.

original: tena ca samayena lokadhātāvantarakalpakṣaye pratyupasthite pañcasu kaṣāyeṣu loke prādurbhūteṣu daśasu kuśaleṣu karmapatheṣvantarhiteṣu daśākuśalakarmapathavartinaḥ sattvā yadbhūyasā durgatigāmino'bhūvan /
analyzed: tena ca samayena lokadhātau antara kalpa kṣaye pratyupasthite pañcasu kaṣāyeṣu loke prādurbhūteṣu daśasu kuśaleṣu karma patheṣu antarhiteṣu daśā akuśala karma patha vartinaḥ sattvāḥ yat bhūyasā durgati gāminaḥ bhūvan
translated: At that time, in the world realm, when the destruction of the intermediate eon was imminent, the five corruptions appeared in the world, and the ten wholesome courses of action disappeared. Beings engaged in the ten unwholesome courses of action mostly went to the lower realms.

original: te daśākuśalakarmapathasamādānahetoḥ parīttāyuṣo'bhūvan alpabhogā virūpā vivarṇā duḥsaṃsthitaśarīrā alpasukhasamudācārā duḥkhavedanāsamudācārabahulā anyonyavisaṃvādavacanaśīlā anyonyabhedapratipannāḥ paruṣavacanasamudācārāḥ prakīrṇavacaso viṣayalobhābhibhūtāḥ praduṣṭamanaḥsaṃkalpā vividhadṛṣṭigahanakāntārapraviṣṭāḥ teṣāmadharmarāgaraktānāṃ viṣamalobhābhibhūtānāṃ mithyādharmaparigatānāṃ na devaḥ kāle vāridhārā udasṛjat yena pṛthivyāṃ bījagrāmāḥ sasyagrāmā viroheyuḥ //
analyzed: te daśā kuśala karma patha samādāna hetoḥ parītta āyuṣaḥ bhūvan alpa bhogāḥ virūpāḥ vivarṇāḥ duḥsaṃsthita śarīrāḥ alpa sukha samudācārāḥ duḥkha vedanā samudācāra bahulāḥ anyonya visaṃvāda vacana śīlāḥ anyonya bheda pratipannāḥ paruṣa vacana samudācārāḥ prakīrṇa vacasaḥ viṣaya lobha abhibhūtāḥ praduṣṭa manaḥ saṃkalpāḥ vividha dṛṣṭi gahana kāntāra praviṣṭāḥ teṣām adharma rāga raktānām viṣama lobha a
translated: Because of undertaking the ten unwholesome courses of action, they had short lifespans, little wealth, were ugly, discolored, had poorly formed bodies, had little experience of happiness, had much experience of painful feelings, were inclined to speak in mutual contradiction, were inclined to be divisive towards each other, were inclined to speak harshly, had scattered speech, were overcome by greed for objects, had corrupt mental intentions, and had entered the dense jungle of various views. For them, who were attached to unrighteous passion, overcome by greed for what is improper, and engaged in false Dharma, the gods did not release timely showers of rain, by which the various seeds and crops on the earth would grow.

original: tena khalu punaḥ sattvāḥ śuṣkeṣu tṛṇagulmauṣadhivanodyānadrumeṣu nānāvyādhispṛṣṭā digvidiśo vidhāvanti sma aparāyaṇāḥ /
analyzed: tena khalu punar sattvāḥ śuṣkeṣu tṛṇa gulma oṣadhi vana udyāna drumeṣu nānā vyādhi spṛṣṭāḥ diś vidiśaḥ vidhāvanti sma aparāyaṇāḥ
translated: Because of this, beings afflicted with various diseases ran in all directions, without any protector, to the dry grass, shrubs, herbs, forests, parks, and trees.

original: te samāgamya sarva eva yena ratnasālavyūhameghapradīparājadhānī tenopasaṃkramya tāṃ samantādanuparivārya kecidūrdhvabāhavaḥ /
analyzed: te samāgamya sarve eva yena ratna sāla vyūha meghapradīpa rājadhānī tena upasaṃkramya tām samantāt anuparivārya kecid ūrdhvabāhavaḥ
translated: Having gathered together, they all went to the capital city called Ratnasālavyūhamegha-pradīpa-rāja, surrounded it on all sides, some with their arms raised,

analyzed: kecid kṛta añjali puṭāḥ  kecid saṃkampita śarīrāḥ
translated: some with their hands folded in respect,🔽some with their bodies trembling,

analyzed: kecid abhyudgata aṅgāḥ

analyzed: kecid adhomukham prapatitāḥ
translated: some fallen with their faces to the ground,

analyzed: kecid sarva śarīreṇa praṇipatitāḥ  kecid dharaṇi tala jānu pratiṣṭhitāḥ
translated: some prostrating their entire bodies,🔽some kneeling on the ground,

analyzed: kecid gagana tala abhinata bāhavaḥ
translated: some with their arms raised to the sky,

analyzed: kecid nagnāḥ nirvasanāḥ
translated: some naked and without clothes,

analyzed: kecid vikṛta vadana nayanāḥ sarva dharma nirnāda chatra maṇḍala nirghoṣasya rājñaḥ abhimukham mahāntam ārta svaram utkrośam akārṣuḥ upadrutāḥ sma
translated: some with their faces and eyes distorted, they cried out in a loud voice of distress in the direction of King Sarva-dharma-nirnāda-cchattra-maṇḍala-nirghoṣa: We are oppressed.

analyzed: deva apasṛṣṭāḥ sma  kṣudh pipāsā duḥkha prapīḍitāḥ sma  vividha bhaya upataptāḥ sma
translated: We are abandoned by the gods.🔽We are afflicted by the suffering of hunger and thirst.🔽We are tormented by various fears.

analyzed: trāṇa virahitāḥ sma

analyzed: deva aśaraṇāḥ aparāyaṇāḥ sma

analyzed: duḥkha pañjara gatāḥ sma jīvita uparodha prāptāḥ maraṇa abhimukhāḥ
translated: We are in the cage of suffering, facing death.

analyzed: iti nānāvidhān pralāpān pralapantaḥ nānā svara aṅgaiḥ nānā vacanaiḥ nānā vikṛta vaktra nayanāḥ vividha saṃjñā vacana vyāhāra nimantra padaiḥ nānā artha sūcaka vacana padaiḥ utkrośam akārṣuḥ
translated: Thus, they cried out in various ways, with various voices, words, distorted faces and eyes, with various concepts, words, utterances, and invitations, with various words indicating meanings,

original: ye ca tasyāṃ rājadhānyāṃ strīpuruṣadārakadārikāḥ kṣutpipāsāprapīḍitā nirābharaṇagātrā nagnanirvasanā duṣṭavivarṇā rūkṣaparuṣagātrā duḥkhitā
analyzed: ye ca tasyām rājadhānyām strī puruṣa dāraka dārikāḥ kṣudh pipāsā prapīḍitāḥ nirābharaṇa gātrāḥ nagna nirvasanāḥ duṣṭa vivarṇāḥ rūkṣa paruṣa gātrāḥ duḥkhitāḥ
translated: And the women, men, boys and girls in that capital city, afflicted by hunger and thirst, with their bodies devoid of ornaments, naked and without clothes, ugly and discolored, with rough and harsh bodies, suffering,

analyzed: te ca api sattvāḥ duḥkha anabhilāṣiṇaḥ duḥkha bhaya nirviṇṇāḥ
translated: And those beings, not desiring suffering, disgusted with the fear of suffering,

original: te sarvadharmanirnādacchatramaṇḍalanirghoṣaṃ rājānaṃ mahājñānapuruṣaṃ pratiśaraṇabhūtaṃ śaraṇamupāgatāḥ sarvasukhapratilambhasaṃjñayā sarvapriyasamavadhānapratilambhasaṃjñayā jīvitāśāparigatanidhānapratilambhasaṃjñayā tīrthasaṃdarśanasaṃjñayā mahāpathapratipattisaṃjñayā mahāyānapātrasaṃjñayā mahājñānaratnadvīpasaṃjñayā mahārthapratilambhasaṃjñayā svargasarvaratisukhapratilambhasaṃjñayā //
analyzed: te sarva dharma nirnāda chatra maṇḍala nirghoṣam rājānam mahā jñāna puruṣam pratiśaraṇa bhūtam śaraṇam upāgatāḥ sarva sukha pratilambha saṃjñayā sarva priya samavadhāna pratilambha saṃjñayā jīvita āśā parigata nidhāna pratilambha saṃjñayā tīrtha saṃdarśana saṃjñayā mahāpatha pratipatti saṃjñayā mahā yānapātra saṃjñayā mahā jñāna ratna dvīpa saṃjñayā mahā artha pratilambha saṃjñayā svarga sarva rati sukha pratilambha saṃjñayā
translated: They had taken refuge in King Sarva-dharma-nirnada-chhatra-mandala-nirghoṣa, the great man of wisdom, as their protector, with the perception of attaining all happiness, with the perception of attaining the company of all loved ones, with the perception of attaining the treasure of hope for life, with the perception of seeing holy places, with the perception of embarking on the great path, with the perception of the great vehicle as a vessel, with the perception of the great island of the jewel of wisdom, with the perception of attaining great wealth, with the perception of attaining the happiness of all pleasures in heaven.

original: aśrauṣīdrājā sarvadharmanirnādacchatramaṇḍalanirghoṣaḥ tasya mahataḥ samantādyācanakasamūhasya taṃ mahāntamārtasvaramutkrośanaśabdam /
analyzed: aśrauṣīt rājā sarva dharma nirnāda chatra maṇḍala nirghoṣaḥ tasya mahataḥ samantāt yācanaka samūhasya tam mahāntam ārta svaram utkrośana śabdam
translated: King Sarva-dharma-nirnada-chhatra-mandala-nirghoṣa heard the great sound of lamentation and crying from that great assembly of beggars from all around.

analyzed: śrutvā ca asya daśa mahā karuṇā mukha asaṃkhyeya śata sahasrāṇi avakrāman
translated: And upon hearing it, he entered a hundred thousand asaṃkhyeya great gates of compassion.

original: sa mahākaruṇānayacetanānidhyapticitto muhūrtamekāgratāmanubhūya daśa mahākaruṇopasaṃhitāni vacanapadānyudīrayāmāsa /
analyzed: sa mahā karuṇā naya cetanā nidhi apti cittaḥ muhūrtam ekāgra tām anubhūya daśa mahā karuṇā upasaṃhitāni vacana padāni udīrayāmāsa
translated: He, with the thought of the aspiration of the volition of the method of great compassion, having experienced one-pointedness for a moment, uttered ten statements endowed with great compassion.

analyzed: katamāni daśa
translated: What are the ten?

analyzed: aho bata anālambanāḥ sattvāḥ mahā saṃsāra prapāta prapatitāḥ
translated: Alas, beings are without support, fallen into the great abyss of saṃsāra.

original: kadā tadbhaviṣyati yadvayaṃ saṃsāramahāprapātaprapatitānāṃ sattvānāṃ layanabhūtā bhaviṣyāmaḥ tathāgatalayanabhūmipratiṣṭhāpanatayā /
analyzed: kadā tat bhaviṣyati yat vayam saṃsāra mahā prapāta prapatitānām sattvānām layana bhūtāḥ bhaviṣyāmaḥ tathāgata layana bhūmi pratiṣṭhāpana tayā
translated: When will it be that we will become a refuge for beings fallen into the great abyss of saṃsāra, by establishing them in the stage of the Tathāgata's refuge?

analyzed: aho bata atrāṇāḥ sattvāḥ nānā kleśa upadrava upadrutāḥ
translated: Alas, beings are without protection, afflicted by various afflictions.

original: kadā tadbhaviṣyati yadvayaṃ vividhakleśabhayopadrutānāṃ sattvānāmatrāṇānāṃ trāṇabhūtā bhaviṣyāmo'navadyakarmāntapratiṣṭhāpanatayā /
analyzed: kadā tat bhaviṣyati yat vayam vividha kleśa bhaya upadrutānām sattvānām atrāṇānām trāṇa bhūtāḥ bhaviṣyāmaḥ ūnavadya karmānta pratiṣṭhāpana tayā
translated: When will it be that we will become a refuge for beings afflicted by various fears of afflictions, for beings without protection, by establishing them in irreproachable actions?

original: aho bata aśaraṇāḥ sattvā loke jarāmaraṇabhayāviṣṭāḥ /
analyzed: aho bata aśaraṇāḥ sattvāḥ loke jarā maraṇa bhaya āviṣṭāḥ
translated: Alas, beings in the world are without a protector, afflicted by the fear of old age and death.

original: katā tadbhaviṣyati yadvayamaśaraṇānāṃ sattvānāṃ śaraṇabhūtā bhaviṣyāmaḥ sarvasaṃsārabhayavinivartanatayā /
analyzed: ka tā tat bhaviṣyati yat vayam aśaraṇānām sattvānām śaraṇa bhūtāḥ bhaviṣyāmaḥ sarva saṃsāra bhaya vinivartana tayā
translated: When will it be that we will become a protector for beings without a protector, by turning away from all the fears of saṃsāra?

analyzed: aho bata aparāyaṇāḥ sattvāḥ vividha loka bhaya upadrutāḥ
translated: Alas! Beings are helpless, afflicted by the various dangers of the world.

original: katā tadbhaviṣyati yadvayaṃ vividhalokabhayopadrutānāmaparāyaṇānāṃ sattvānāṃ parāyaṇaṃ bhaviṣyāmo'tyantayogakṣeme sarvajñatāmārge pratiṣṭhāpanatayā
analyzed: ka tā tat bhaviṣyati yat vayam vividha loka bhaya upadrutānām aparāyaṇānām sattvānām parāyaṇam bhaviṣyāmaḥ utyanta yogakṣeme sarvajña tā mārge pratiṣṭhāpana tayā
translated: When will that be for us, that we will be a refuge for beings who are helpless and afflicted by the various dangers of the world, by establishing them in the path to omniscience with the highest peace?

analyzed: aho bata avidyā andhakāra prāptaḥ sarva lokaḥ vimati saṃśaya timira āvṛtaḥ
translated: Alas! The whole world has fallen into the darkness of ignorance, covered by doubt and confusion.

analyzed: kadā tat bhaviṣyati yat vayam ulkā bhūtāḥ bhaviṣyāmaḥ sarva sattvānām avidyā andhakāra vidhamana tayā
translated: When will that be for us, that we will be like a torch, dispelling the darkness of ignorance for all beings?

analyzed: aho bata āloka virahitāḥ sattvāḥ
translated: Alas! Beings are devoid of light.

original: kadā tadbhaviṣyati yadvayaṃ mahājñānālokakarā bhaviṣyāmaḥ sarvasattvānāṃ vitimirajñānamukhasaṃdarśanatayā /
analyzed: kadā tat bhaviṣyati yat vayam mahā jñāna āloka karāḥ bhaviṣyāmaḥ sarva sattvānām vitimira jñāna mukha saṃdarśana tayā
translated: When will that be for us, that we will be the bringers of the great light of knowledge, showing the way of knowledge free from darkness to all beings?

analyzed: aho bata jñāna jyotiḥ virahitaḥ sarva sattvadhātuḥ īrṣyā mātsarya māyā śāṭhya kāluṣa āśayaḥ
translated: Alas! The whole realm of beings is devoid of the light of knowledge, with a mind defiled by envy, stinginess, deceit, and fraud.

analyzed: kadā tat bhaviṣyati yat vayam anuttara jñāna pradyota karāḥ bhaviṣyāmaḥ sarva sattvānām atyanta pariśuddhi pratipratiṣṭhāpana tayā
translated: When will that be? We will be those who hold up the lamp of unsurpassed knowledge for all beings, establishing them in complete purity.

analyzed: aho bata nāyaka virahitaḥ sarva lokaḥ mahā saṃsāra sāgara viṣama srotaḥ prapannaḥ
translated: Alas, the whole world is without a leader, plunged into the turbulent stream of the great ocean of saṃsāra.

original: kadā tadbhaviṣyati yadvayaṃ nāyakabhūtā bhaviṣyāmaḥ sarvasattvānāṃ karmasamudranayāvataraṇatayā /
analyzed: kadā tat bhaviṣyati yat vayam nāyaka bhūtāḥ bhaviṣyāmaḥ sarva sattvānām karma samudra naya avataraṇa tayā
translated: When will that be? We will be the leaders for all beings, leading them into the way of the ocean of karma.

analyzed: aho bata vināyaka virahitaḥ sarva lokaḥ durvinītaḥ
translated: Alas, the whole world is without a guide, difficult to discipline.

original: kadā tadbhaviṣyati yadvayaṃ vināyakabhūtā bhaviṣyāmaḥ sarvasattvānāṃ sarvākāraparipākavinayatathāgatādhiṣṭhānakālānatikramaṇena /
analyzed: kadā tat bhaviṣyati yat vayam vināyaka bhūtāḥ bhaviṣyāmaḥ sarva sattvānām sarva ākāra paripāka vinaya tathāgata adhiṣṭhāna kāla an atikramaṇena
translated: When will that be? We will be the guides for all beings, maturing and disciplining them in all ways, without transgressing the time determined by the Tathāgatas.

analyzed: aho bata apariṇāyakaḥ sarva lokaḥ jāti andha bhūtaḥ
translated: Alas, the whole world is without a leader, like one born blind.

analyzed: kadā tat bhaviṣyati yat vayam pariṇāyaka bhūtāḥ bhaviṣyāmaḥ sarvaṃsattvānām anāvaraṇa sarvajña jñāna naya avataraṇa tayā
translated: When will that be? We will be the leaders for all beings, leading them into the way of unobstructed omniscient knowledge.

original: sa imāni daśa mahākaruṇopasaṃhitāni vacanapadānyudīrya tasyāṃ rājadhānyāṃ ghaṇṭāvaghoṣaṇamakārṣīt /
analyzed: saḥ imāni daśa mahā karuṇā upasaṃhitāni vacana padāni udīrya tasyām rājadhānyām ghaṇṭā avaghoṣaṇam akārṣīt
translated: He proclaimed these ten words of great compassion and had it announced with ringing bells throughout the capital city:

analyzed: mahā tyāga dundubhi nirghoṣam ca akārayat sarva jagat saṃtarpayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: Let the great drum of generosity resound! We will satisfy all beings.

analyzed: yasya yena arthaḥ tasmai tat anupradāsyāmaḥ iti
translated: To whomever and whatever is needed, we will give it.

original: tena sarvajambudvīpe sarvarājadhānīṣu sarvagrāmanagaranigamajanapadapattaneṣu sarvopakaraṇakośā vivṛtāḥ /
analyzed: tena sarva jambudvīpe sarva rājadhānīṣu sarva grāma nagara nigama janapada pattaneṣu sarva upakaraṇa kośāḥ vivṛtāḥ
translated: He opened all the treasuries of supplies throughout the entire kingdom of Jambudvīpa, in all the royal cities, villages, towns, regions, and markets.

analyzed: sarva śṛṅgāṭaka rathyā catvareṣu vividha upakaraṇa vidhayaḥ sthāpitāḥ
translated: In all the crossroads, streets, and squares, he set up various kinds of supplies.

analyzed: sarva jagat upajīvyāḥ su prativihitāḥ
translated: They were well-arranged and available to all beings.

analyzed: sarva kośa koṣṭhāgārāṇi vivṛtāni
translated: All the treasuries and storehouses were opened.

analyzed: mahā ratna nidhāna nicayāḥ nidarśitāḥ
translated: Great treasures and riches were revealed.

analyzed: aneka nānāvidha ratna rāśayaḥ sthāpitāḥ
translated: Piles of various kinds of jewels were set up.

analyzed: anna pāna vastra yāna puṣpa mālya gandha vilepana cūrṇa nānā gandha varṇa cīvara ratna kośāḥ vivṛtāḥ
translated: Food, drink, clothes, vehicles, flowers, garlands, perfumes, ointments, powders, various fragrant-colored robes, and jewel treasuries were opened.

analyzed: śayana āsana vasana bhavana vimāna gṛhāṇi alaṃkṛtāni sarva dhana kanaka samṛddhāni jyotiḥ dhvaja māṇi rāja vinyāsa vidhūta andhakārāṇi
translated: They were adorned with beds, seats, garments, palaces, mansions, and houses, and were rich with all kinds of wealth and gold. They were illuminated by luminous banners and the light of the king's jewels, dispelling the darkness.

original: sa teṣāṃ sattvānāṃ yathābhilaṣitasarvābhiprāyaparipūraṇārthaṃ teṣu gṛheṣu pratyekamātmabhāvasadṛśamupādāya kāyamabhinirmāya sthāpayāmāsa /
analyzed: sa teṣām sattvānām yathā abhilaṣita sarva abhiprāya paripūraṇa artham teṣu gṛheṣu pratyekam ātma bhāva sadṛśam upādāya kāyam abhinirmāya sthāpayāmāsa
translated: In order to fulfill all the wishes of those beings, in each of those houses he manifested bodies similar to their own and established them there.

analyzed: sarva sattva sarva vyādhi praśamanāya ca vaidya bhaiṣajya upasthāyaka vividha jīvita upakaraṇa pratyaya saṃpadam upasthāpayāmāsa  yathārha vividha upakaraṇa pūrṇāni ca nānā ratna vicitra bhājanāni upasthāpayāmāsayat uta vajra maṇi bhājanāni nānā gandha maṇi ratna paripūrṇāni  nānā gandha ratna bhājanāni vividha udāra vicitra varṇa raṅga vastra paripūrṇāni
translated: In order to cure all the illnesses of all beings, he provided an abundance of medical treatments, medicines, attendants, and various necessities for life.🔽He also provided various vessels filled with suitable necessities, such as diamond vessels filled with various fragrant jewels,🔽various fragrant jewel vessels filled with various kinds of fine and colorful cloth,

analyzed: yāna yugyāni su bahūni nānā ākāra saṃsthānāni vicitra ratna pratimaṇḍitāni ājāneya aśva gaja go yuktāni
translated: and many kinds of vehicles with various shapes and forms, adorned with various jewels, yoked with well-trained horses, elephants, and oxen.

original: vividhāṃśca rathān rājārhān sarvaratnābharaṇaparibhogāṃśca sarvāsanavidhīṃśca nānāratnavicitrān vividhavitānavitatān ratnakiṅkiṇījālāvanaddhān ucchritacchatradhvajapatākopaśobhitān sarvajanapadapradeśeṣu sthāpayāpāsa /
analyzed: vividhān ca rathān rāja arhān sarva ratna ābharaṇa paribhogān ca sarva āsana vidhīn ca nānā ratna vicitrān vividha vitāna vitatān ratna kiṅkiṇī jāla avanaddhān ucchrita chatra dhvaja patākā upaśobhitān sarva janapada pradeśeṣu sthāpaya apāsa
translated: He also established in all the regions of the country various kinds of chariots fit for kings, with all kinds of precious ornaments and enjoyments, all kinds of seats adorned with various jewels, covered with canopies, hung with nets of jeweled bells, and beautified with raised parasols, banners, and flags.

analyzed: grāma nagara nigama janapada pradānāni ca uddhoṣayāmāsa
translated: He proclaimed the gifts of villages, towns, markets, and countries.

analyzed: nānāvidha udyāna ramya ārāma tapovana paribhogān api sarva gṛha kalatra putra dāraka parityāgān api anardhya sarva ratna parityāgān api sva hṛdaya majja antra guṇa vṛkka meda māṃsa rudhira chavi carma kara caraṇa bāhu karṇa nāsā nayana jihvā danta uṣṭha śīrṣa parityāgān api yāvat sarva bāhya ādhyātmika sarva ākāra parityāgān api uddhoṣayāmāsa
translated: He also proclaimed the enjoyments of various kinds of delightful parks, gardens, and hermitages, the complete abandonment of all homes, wives, sons, and daughters, the abandonment of all priceless jewels, and the abandonment of his own heart, liver, intestines, kidneys, fat, flesh, blood, skin, hair, hands, feet, ears, nose, eyes, tongue, teeth, lips, and head, and so forth, up to the complete abandonment of all external and internal things of all kinds.

analyzed: sa tam evaṃrūpam upakaraṇa parityāga vidhim pratyupasthāpya mahā yajñavāṭam kārayāmāsa
translated: Having thus arranged for the distribution of such equipment, he held a great sacrificial ceremony.

original: yastasyā ratnasālavyūhameghapradīpāyā rājadhānyāḥ pūrveṇa maṇiśikharatejonāmno nagaradvārasya purataḥ samavipulāyāmaḥ paramavistīrṇadharaṇītalapraveśo nimnonnataviśuddhasamatalo'pagataśvabhraprapātaḥ sarvasthāṇukaṇṭakāpagataḥ utsannaśarkarākaṭhallaḥ sarvaratnadhātusaṃcayaḥ sarvaratnamayamaṇiratnarājasaṃstīrṇatalaḥ anekamaṇiratnavyuhopaśobhito nānāratnakusumābhikīrṇaḥ sarvacūrṇasugandharājasamākulaḥ sarvagandhadhūpaparidhūpito ratnārciḥpradīpaḥ tejaḥśrīsarvagandhadhūpapaṭalameghagaganasaṃchāditālaṃkāraḥ sarvaratnadrumapaṅktisuvibhaktopaśobhito nānābhavanavimānakūṭāgārasamalaṃkṛtaḥ ucchritacchatradhvajapatāko nānāratnapaṭṭapralambavidyotito vividharatnakusumajālasaṃchannaḥ sarvagandharājaratnajālacchatramaṇḍalaḥ suvarṇajālaratnaghaṇṭānirghoṣo nānāratnavirājitavitānavitataḥ sarvagandharājacūrṇavikīrṇaḥ sarvaratnakusumaprakīrṇābhirāmaḥ tūryakoṭīniyutaśatasahasramanojñarutaghoṣanirnāditaḥ sarvaratnavicitrālaṃkāravyūhasupariśuddho bodhisattvakarmavipākābhinirvṛttaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ tasyāḥ ratna sāla vyūha megha pradīpāyāḥ rājadhānyāḥ pūrveṇa maṇiśikhara tejaḥ nāmnaḥ nagara dvārasya puratas sama vipula āyāmaḥ parama vistīrṇa dharaṇī tala praveśaḥ nimna unnata viśuddha sama tala upagata śvabhra prapātaḥ sarva sthāṇu kaṇṭaka apagataḥ utsanna śarkarā kaṭhallaḥ sarva ratna dhātu saṃcayaḥ sarva ratna maya maṇi ratna rāja saṃstīrṇa talaḥ aneka maṇi ratna vyuha upaśobhitaḥ nānā ratna kusuma abhikīrṇa
translated: In front of the city gate named Jewel Peak Radiance, to the east of that royal capital Jewel Array Cloud Light, there was a flat and vast entrance to the ground, with a pure and even surface, free from pits and precipices, devoid of all stumps and thorns, with its gravel and pebbles removed, a collection of all jewels and minerals, its surface covered with the king of jewel gems made of all jewels, adorned with arrays of many jewel gems, strewn with flowers of various jewels, filled with all fragrant king incenses, perfumed with all fragrances and incense, with the light of jewels, adorned with clouds of fragrant incense and fragrant incense-filled canopies covering the sky, beautifully adorned with rows of trees made of all jewels, adorned with various palaces, mansions, and multi-storied houses, with raised parasols, banners, and flags, illuminated by hanging silk ribbons of various jewels, covered with nets of various jewel flowers, with jewel trees made of all fragrant king jewels,

analyzed: tasya madhye mahā siṃhāsanam abhinirvṛttam daśa ratna nicita vicitra bhūmi tala saṃsthānam daśa ratna nānā vedikā parivāra virājitam daśa maṇi druma śākhā vedikā antara suvibhakta upaśobhita vyūham abhedya vajra cakra dharaṇī tala su pratiṣṭhita pādam sarva ratna bimba vigraha saṃdhārita āsana cakram
translated: In the middle of that, a great lion throne appeared, with a base made of ten kinds of jewels, adorned with ten kinds of jewel railings, beautifully arranged with jewel trees and branches, firmly established on an indestructible vajra wheel base, with a wheel of seats held by the forms of all jewels.

original: tasya samanantaraniṣaṇṇasya tasmin siṃhāsane sarvo janakāyo'bhimukhaḥ prāñjaliḥ sthito'bhūttameva rājānaṃ namasyan //

translated: As soon as he sat down on that lion throne, the entire assembly faced him with palms joined in respect, paying homage to the king.

original: atha khalu sarvadharmanirnādacchatramaṇḍalanirghoṣasya rājño'saṃkhyeyeṣu prāṇikoṭīniyutaśatasahasreṣu saṃnipatiteṣu nānāyācanakeṣu nānāvastuparigrāhakeṣu nānopakaraṇādhimukteṣu nānājātiṣu nānāgatiparyāpanneṣu nānābhilāṣacitteṣu nānāśayābhiprāyeṣu nānādiksaṃnipatiteṣu nānāviṣayaparibhogopacāreṣu nānāparibhogābhilāṣitacetaneṣu nānābhiprāyakalpeṣu nānāmanuṣyanikāyeṣu nānākulopapatyupapanneṣu nānājanapadasamāgateṣu nānaniruktivacanamantrasaṃskāreṣu nānāsvaramaṇḍalapramocakeṣu nānavastuvyañjaneṣu nānāvacanapadānyudīrayatsu /
