translated: who were brought before the Blessed One by Satyaka, the great debater.

analyzed: vādi dhvaja dhāraṇa tayā bhagavataḥ vādāya upasaṃkrāntāni
translated: They had come to debate with the Blessed One, bearing the banner of debate.

original: tāni ca sarvāṇi bhagavatā vyākṛtānyanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: tāni ca sarvāṇi bhagavatā vyākṛtāni anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: And all of them were prophesied by the Blessed One to attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: nānā buddhakṣetra vyūhaiḥ nānā kalpaiḥ nānā nāmadheyaiḥ tathāgatām loke utpatsyante
translated: They will appear in the world as Tathagatas with various names, in various Buddha-fields, in various kalpas.

original: sa khalu punaḥ kulaputra vijitāvī rājakumāro mātāpitṛbhyāmanujñātastān bandhanagatān sattvān parimocya sphītāṃ vasumatīṃ dhanakanakaratnasamṛddhāmapahāya putradāraṃ cotsṛjya tasya bhagavato dharmacakranirghoṣagaganameghapradīparājasya tathāgatasyāntike prāvrajat /
analyzed: sa khalu punar kula putra vijitāvī rāja kumāraḥ mātā pitṛbhyām anujñātaḥ tān bandhana gatān sattvān parimocya sphītām vasumatīm dhana kanaka ratna samṛddhām apahāya putra dāram ca utsṛjya tasya bhagavataḥ dharmacakra nirghoṣa gagana meghapradīparājasya tathāgatasya antike prāvrajat
translated: Moreover, noble sir, Prince Vijitāvin, having obtained permission from his parents, having liberated those beings who were in prison, having abandoned the prosperous land with its wealth, gold, and jewels, and having given up his son and wife, went forth into the presence of the Blessed One, the Tathāgata Dharmacakrakīrtigaganamegha-pradīparāja.

analyzed: pravrajitvā pañca varṣa sahasrāṇi brahmacaryam acarat
translated: Having gone forth, he practiced celibacy for five thousand years.

analyzed: etasmin antare daśa samādhi mukha sahasrāṇi saṃniṣpādayāmāsa
translated: In the meantime, he accomplished ten thousand doors to meditative absorption.

analyzed: daśa ca dhāraṇīmukha sahasrāṇi pratyalabhata
translated: He attained ten thousand Dharma gateways.

analyzed: daśa ca abhijñā naya sahasrāṇi avakrāntāni
translated: He entered ten thousand higher knowledges.

analyzed: daśa bodhisattva mahā nidhāna sahasrāṇi pratilabhate sma
translated: He attained ten thousand great treasures of bodhisattvas.

original: daśa cāsya sarvajñatāvegasahasrāṇyājātāni /🔽daśa cānena kṣāntimukhasahasrāṇi pariśodhitāni /
analyzed: daśa ca asya sarvajña tā vega sahasrāṇi ājātāni  daśa ca anena kṣānti mukha sahasrāṇi pariśodhitāni
translated: Ten thousand impulses toward omniscience arose in him.🔽He purified ten thousand gateways of patience.

analyzed: daśa citta nidhi apti sahasrāṇi abhinirhṛtāni
translated: He accomplished ten thousand ascertainment of mind.

analyzed: daśa ca bodhisattva bala śarīrāṇi saṃvardhitāni
translated: He increased ten thousand bodies of bodhisattva power.

analyzed: daśa ca bodhisattva jñāna mukha sahasrāṇi avakrāntāni
translated: He entered ten thousand gateways of bodhisattva knowledge.

analyzed: daśa ca asya prajñāpāramitā naya sahasrāṇi ājātāni
translated: Ten thousand methods of the perfection of wisdom arose in him.

analyzed: daśa ca buddha sahasra darśana diṅbhukha sahasrāṇi āmukhībhūtāni
translated: Ten thousand directions of seeing ten thousand buddhas manifested before him.

analyzed: daśa ca anena bodhisattva praṇidhāna sahasrāṇi abhinirhṛtāni
translated: He accomplished ten thousand bodhisattva vows.

original: sa evaṃ dharmasamanvāgataḥ praticittakṣaṇe daśasu dikṣu daśabuddhakṣetrasahasrāṇyākrāmati sma /
analyzed: saḥ evam dharma samanvāgataḥ prati citta kṣaṇe daśasu dikṣu daśa buddhakṣetra sahasrāṇi ākrāmati sma
translated: Endowed with such Dharma, in every moment of thought he pervaded ten thousand buddha-fields in the ten directions.

original: ekaikasyāṃ ca lokadhātau cittakṣaṇe cittakṣaṇe daśa buddhasahasrāṇi pūrvāntāparāntato'nusmarati sma /🔽teṣāṃ ca tathāgatānāṃ daśa buddhanirmāṇasamudrasahasrāṇi daśadikprasṛtānyavataranti sma /
analyzed: ekaikasyām ca lokadhātau citta kṣaṇe citta kṣaṇe daśa buddha sahasrāṇi pūrva anta apara antataḥ anusmarati sma  teṣām ca tathāgatānām daśa buddha nirmāṇa samudra sahasrāṇi daśa diś prasṛtāni avataranti sma
translated: And in each world realm, moment by moment, he remembered ten thousand buddhas of past and future times.🔽And he entered into the ten thousand oceans of emanations of those thus-gone ones, which extended into the ten directions.

analyzed: citta kṣaṇe citta kṣaṇe daśa buddhakṣetra sahasra paryāpannān sarva sattvān adrākṣīt
translated: Moment by moment, he saw all the beings in ten thousand buddha-fields,

original: nānāgatyupapannāṃścyavata upapadyamānān hīnān praṇītān sugatān durgatān suvarṇān durvarṇān yathākāmopagatān /
analyzed: nānā gati upapannān cyavate upapadyamānān hīnān praṇītān sugatān durgatān suvarṇān durvarṇān yathākāma upagatān
translated: born in various states of existence, passing away and being reborn, low and high, good and bad, beautiful and ugly, according to their desires.

analyzed: teṣām ca sattvānām cyuti upapattīḥ avatarati sma
translated: And he entered into the deaths and rebirths of those beings.

original: cittaparivartān cittacaritāni cintānantaryatāmāśayanānātvamindriyasāgarānapi prayogaprasarānapi karmāvasānamapi paripākavinayakālamapi avatarati sma //
analyzed: citta parivartān citta caritāni cintā ānantarya tām āśaya nānātvam indriya sāgarān api prayoga prasarān api karma avasānam api paripāka vinaya kālam api avatarati sma
translated: He entered into the changes of mind, the activities of mind, the continuity of thought, the variety of intentions, the oceans of faculties, the arrays of practices, the conclusions of actions, and the times of ripening and training.

original: sa khalu punaḥ kulaputra vijitāvī rājakumārastataścyutvā tatraiva jambudvīpe rativyūhāyāṃ rājadhānyāṃ tasminneva rājakule upapadya cakravartirājyaiścaryaṃ pratyalabhata /
analyzed: sa khalu punar kula putra vijitāvī rāja kumāraḥ tatas cyutvā tatra eva jambudvīpe rativyūhāyām rājadhānyām tasmin eva rāja kule upapadya cakravarti rājyaiḥ caryam pratyalabhata
translated: “Moreover, noble one, after the prince Vijitāvin passed away from there, he was reborn in the royal family of the capital city of Rativyūhā in that very Jambudvīpa, and attained the glory of a universal monarch.

original: tena cakravartirājabhūtena tasya bhagavato dharmacakranirghoṣagaganameghapradīparājasya tathāgatasya parinirvṛtasyānantaraṃ dharmagaganābhyudgataśrīrājo nāma tathāgata ārāgitaḥ /
analyzed: tena cakravarti rāja bhūtena tasya bhagavataḥ dharmacakranirghoṣagaganameghapradīparājasya tathāgatasya parinirvṛtasya anantaram dharmagaganābhyudgataśrīrājaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: When he became a universal monarch, after the bhagavat Tathāgata Dharmacakra­nirghोṣа­gagana­megha­pradīpa­rāja had passed into parinirvāṇa, he pleased the tathāgata named Dharma­gagana­abhyudgata­śrī­rāja.

original: tasyānantaraṃ tatraiva bodhimaṇḍe śakrabhūtena devendragarbho nāma tathāgata ārāgitaḥ /🔽tasyānantaraṃ tatraiva lokadhātau suyāmadevarājabhūtena dharaṇīśrīparvatatejo nāma tathāgata ārāgitaḥ /
analyzed: tasya anantaram tatra eva bodhimaṇḍe śakra bhūtena devendragarbhaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ  tasya anantaram tatra eva lokadhātau suyāma devarāja bhūtena dharaṇīśrīparvatatejaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: After him, while he was Śakra, he pleased the tathāgata named Devendra­garbha at that very Bodhimaṇḍa.🔽After him, while he was the king of the Suyāma gods in that very world realm, he pleased the tathāgata named Dharanīśrī­parvata­tejas.

original: tasyānantaraṃ tasminneva lokadhātau saṃtuṣitadevarājabhūtena dharmacakraprabhanirghoṣarājo nāma tathāgata ārāgitaḥ /
analyzed: tasya anantaram tasmin eva lokadhātau saṃtuṣita devarāja bhūtena dharmacakraprabhanirghoṣarājaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: After him, while he was the king of the Tuṣita gods in that very world realm, he pleased the tathāgata named Dharma­cakra­prabha­nirghоṣа­rāja.

original: tasyānantaraṃ tasminneva lokadhātau sunirmitadevarājabhūtena gaganakāntarājo nāma tathāgata ārāgitaḥ /
analyzed: tasya anantaram tasmin eva lokadhātau sunirmita devarāja bhūtena gaganakāntarājaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: “After him, in that very world realm, when the god Sunirmāṇarāja became the king of the gods, a tathāgata named Gaganakāntarāja was worshipped.

original: tasyānantaraṃ tasminneva lokadhātau vaśavartidevarājabhūtenānavamardabalaketurnāma tathāgata ārāgitaḥ /🔽tasyānantaraṃ tasminneva lokadhātāvasurendrabhūtena sarvadharmanigarjitarājo nāma tathāgata ārāgitaḥ /
analyzed: tasya anantaram tasmin eva lokadhātau vaśavarti devarāja bhūtena anavamardabalaketuḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ  tasya anantaram tasmin eva lokadhātau asura indra bhūtena sarvadharmanigarjitarājaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: “After him, in that very world realm, when the god Vaśavartin became the king of the gods, a tathāgata named Anāvamardabala­ketu was worshipped.🔽“After him, in that very world realm, when the asura king became the king of the gods, a tathāgata named Sarva­dharma­nigarjita­rāja was worshipped.

original: tasyānantaraṃ tasminneva lokadhātau brahmendrabhūtena dharmacakranirmāṇasamantapratibhāsanirghoṣo nāma tathāgata ārāgitaḥ /
analyzed: tasya anantaram tasmin eva lokadhātau brahmendra bhūtena dharmacakranirmāṇasamantapratibhāsanirghoṣaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: “After him, in that very world realm, when the Brahmā king became the king of the gods, a tathāgata named Dharma­cakra­nirvāṇa­saṃpanna­pratibhāsa­nirghoṣa was worshipped.

original: iti hi kulaputra etāṃstathāgatān pramukhān kṛtvā tasyāmeva ratnaprabhāyāṃ lokadhātau tasminneva suprabhe kalpe daśa buddhasahasrāṇyudapadyanta
analyzed: iti hi kula putraḥ etān tathāgatān pramukhān kṛtvā tasyām eva ratnaprabhāyām lokadhātau tasmin eva suprabhe kalpe daśa buddha sahasrāṇi udapadyanta
translated: “Thus, noble son, having made those tathāgatas the foremost, in that very Ratnaprabhā world realm, in that very Supriya eon, ten thousand buddhas appeared.

original: sarve ca te tathāgatā vijitāvinā rājakumāreṇārāgitāḥ /
analyzed: sarve ca te tathāgatāḥ vijitāvinā rāja kumāreṇa ārāgitāḥ
translated: And all those tathāgatas were worshipped by Prince Vijitāvin.🔽“After him, in that very world realm, when the god Sunirmāṇarāja became the king of the gods, a tathāgata named Gaganakāntarāja was worshipped.

original: tasya khalu punaḥ kulaputra suprabhasya mahākalpasyānantaraṃ suraśmirnāma kalpo'bhūt /
analyzed: tasya khalu punar kula putra suprabhasya mahā kalpasya anantaram suraśmiḥ nāma kalpaḥ bhūt
translated: “After that good kalpa of Splendor, there was a kalpa called Light of the Gods.

analyzed: tasmin ca suraśmi kalpe daśa buddha sahasrāṇi upapadyanta
translated: In that kalpa of Light of the Gods, ten thousand buddhas appeared.

original: ahaṃ ca tasmin kalpe mahāmatirnāma rājā abhūvam /
analyzed: aham ca tasmin kalpe mahāmatiḥ nāma rājā abhūvam
translated: And in that kalpa I was a king named Great Mind.

original: tena me rājabhūtena lakṣaṇaśrīparvato nāma tathāgata ārāgitaḥ /🔽tasyānantaraṃ tasminneva kalpe gṛhapatibhūtena saṃvṛtaskandho nāma tathāgata ārāgitaḥ /
analyzed: tena me rāja bhūtena lakṣaṇaśrīparvataḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ  tasya anantaram tasmin eva kalpe gṛhapati bhūtena saṃvṛtaskandhaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: As a king, I pleased a thus-gone one named Mountain of the Glory of Marks.🔽After him, in that very kalpa, as a householder, I pleased a thus-gone one named Boundless Shoulder.

original: tasyānantaraṃ tasminneva kalpe amātyabhūtena vimalavatso nāma tathāgata ārāgitaḥ /🔽tasyānantaraṃ tasminneva kalpe'surendrabhūtena veśadhārī nāma tathāgata ārāgitaḥ /
analyzed: tasya anantaram tasmin eva kalpe amātya bhūtena vimalavatsaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ  tasya anantaram tasmin eva kalpe sura indra bhūtena veśadhārī nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: After him, in that very kalpa, as a minister, I pleased a thus-gone one named Stainless Moon.🔽After him, in that very kalpa, as a lord of the asuras, I pleased a thus-gone one named Wearing Garlands.

original: tasyānantaraṃ tasminneva kalpe vṛkṣadevatābhūtena lakṣaṇasumerurnāma tathāgata ārāgitaḥ /
analyzed: tasya anantaram tasmin eva kalpe vṛkṣa devatā bhūtena lakṣaṇasumeruḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: After him, in that very kalpa, as a tree deity, I pleased a thus-gone one named Mount Meru of Marks.

original: tasyānantaraṃ tasminneva kalpe sārthavāhabhūtena vimalabāhurnāma tathāgata ārāgitaḥ /
analyzed: tasya anantaram tasmin eva kalpe sārthavāha bhūtena vimalabāhuḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: After him, in that very kalpa, as a caravan leader, I pleased a thus-gone one named Stainless Arm.

original: tasyānantaraṃ tasminneva kalpe nagaradevatābhūten siṃhavikrāntagāmī nāma tathāgata ārāgitaḥ /
analyzed: tasya anantaram tasmin eva kalpe nagara devatā bhūten siṃhavikrāntagāmī nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: “After that, in that very kalpa, when I was a city goddess, I pleased a tathagata named Simhavikramagati.

original: tasyānantaraṃ tasminneva kalpe vaiśravaṇabhūtena devendracūḍo nāma tathāgata ārāgitaḥ /
analyzed: tasya anantaram tasmin eva kalpe vaiśravaṇa bhūtena devendracūḍaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: “After that, in that very kalpa, when I was Vaishravana, I pleased a tathagata named Devendracuda.

original: tasyānantaraṃ tasminneva kalpe gandharvarājabhūtena dharmodgatakīrtināma tathāgata ārāgitaḥ /
analyzed: tasya anantaram tasmin eva kalpe gandharvarāja bhūtena dharmodgatakīrti nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: “After that, in that very kalpa, when I was a gandharva king, I pleased a tathagata named Dharmodgata-kirti.

original: tasyānantaraṃ tasminneva kalpe kumbhāṇḍendrabhūtena avabhāsamakuṭī nāma tathāgata ārāgitaḥ //
analyzed: tasya anantaram tasmin eva kalpe kumbhāṇḍa indra bhūtena avabhāsamakuṭī nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: “After that, in that very kalpa, when I was a kumbhanda king, I pleased a tathagata named Avabhâsa-makuta.

original: iti hi kulaputra mayaitān daśa tathāgatān pramukhān kṛtvā tatra suraśmikalpe ṣaṣṭirbuddhakoṭya ārāgitāḥ /
analyzed: iti hi kula putra mayā etān daśa tathāgatān pramukhān kṛtvā tatra suraśmi kalpe ṣaṣṭiḥ buddha koṭyaḥ ārāgitāḥ
translated: “Thus, noble sir, having taken those ten tathagatas as my leaders, I pleased sixty million buddhas in that kalpa of Suruchi.

original: nānopapattikāyikayā sarve ca me tathāgatāḥ pūjitāḥ /
analyzed: nānā upapatti kāyikayā sarve ca me tathāgatāḥ pūjitāḥ
translated: And all those tathagatas were worshipped by me, taking on various births.

original: ekaikaṃ ca tathāgatamupasaṃkrāmantyā anantamadhyaḥ sattvadhāturanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau paripācitaḥ /
analyzed: ekaikam ca tathāgatam upasaṃkrāmantyāḥ ananta madhyaḥ sattvadhātuḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau paripācitaḥ
translated: And as I went to each tathagata, I ripened for supreme perfect enlightenment an endless and limitless mass of beings.

analyzed: ekaikam ca tathāgatam upasaṃkrāmantyā nānā samādhi mukhāni pratilabdhāni
translated: And as I went to each tathagata, I attained the doors of various samadhis.

original: nānādhāraṇīmukhāni nānābhinirhāranayā nānāpratisaṃvinnayābhinirhārā nānāsarvajñatānayānugamā nānādharmālokamukhapratilābhanayā nānājñānanayānugamavicārā nānādiksamudrapraveśāvabhāsā nānākṣetrasamudrāvatārapraveśāvabhāsā nānātathāgatadarśanasamudravijñaptyavabhāsāḥ pratilabdhāḥ /
analyzed: nānā dhāraṇī mukhāni nānā abhinirhāra nayāḥ nānā pratisaṃvid nayā abhinirhārāḥ nānā sarvajña tā naya anugamāḥ nānā dharma āloka mukha pratilābha nayāḥ nānā jñāna naya anugama vicārāḥ nānā diś samudra praveśa avabhāsāḥ nānā kṣetra samudra avatāra praveśa avabhāsāḥ nānā tathāgata darśana samudra vijñapti avabhāsāḥ pratilabdhāḥ
translated: I attained the illumination of the various doors of dhāraṇīs, the various methods of accomplishment, the various methods of accomplishment of the various analytical knowledges, the various methods of following the various knowledges, the various methods of attaining the various doors of the light of the Dharma, the various methods of contemplating the various knowledges, the various illuminations of entering the ocean of the various directions, the various illuminations of entering the ocean of the various realms, and the various illuminations of the manifestation of the ocean of seeing the various Tathāgatas.

analyzed: avakrāntāḥ viśuddhāḥ saṃvardhitāḥ prasṛtāḥ pratisṛtāḥ
translated: They were entered, purified, increased, expanded, and returned.

original: yathā ca tatra suraśmikalpe tathāgatā ārāgitāḥ /
analyzed: yathā ca tatra suraśmi kalpe tathāgatāḥ ārāgitāḥ
translated: Just as the Tathāgatas were pleased in that Suraśmi eon,

analyzed: tathā sarvatra lokadhātu samudra paramāṇu rajaḥ sameṣu kalpeṣu ye kecid tathāgatāḥ upapadyante
translated: in the same way, in eons equal to the atoms in the ocean of all world-realms, all the Tathāgatas who appeared,

original: ye'pi tadanyebhyo lokadhātubhya āgatya tathāgatā dharmaṃ deśayamāsuḥ /
analyzed: ye api tad anyebhyaḥ lokadhātubhyaḥ āgatya tathāgatāḥ dharmam deśayamāsuḥ
translated: and also the Tathāgatas who came from other world-realms and taught the Dharma,

analyzed: teṣām mayā sarveṣām tathāgatānām antikāt dharma deśanā śrutā
translated: I heard the Dharma teachings from all those Tathāgatas.

analyzed: śrutvā ca saṃdhāritā
translated: Having heard them, I retained them.

original: sarve ca mayā te tathāgatā ārāgitā abhirādhitāḥ /
analyzed: sarve ca mayā te tathāgatāḥ ārāgitāḥ abhirādhitāḥ
translated: And I pleased all those Tathāgatas and delighted them.

original: teṣāṃ ca me buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ śāsanaṃ saṃdhāritam /
analyzed: teṣām ca me buddhānām bhagavatām śāsanam saṃdhāritam
translated: I upheld the teachings of those Buddha Bhagavats.

original: sarveṣāṃ ca me teṣāṃ tathāgatānāmantikādeṣa sarvasattvaparipākayathāśayasaṃcodanakuśalamūlasaṃbhavo bodhisattvavimokṣaḥ pratilabdho nānāpratilābhanayanānāvimokṣanayamukhaiḥ
analyzed: sarveṣām ca me teṣām tathāgatānām antikāt eṣa sarva sattva paripāka yathā āśaya saṃcodana kuśala mūla saṃbhavaḥ bodhisattva vimokṣaḥ pratilabdhaḥ nānā pratilābha naya nānā vimokṣa naya mukhaiḥ
translated: From all those Tathagatas, I obtained this Bodhisattva liberation called the origin of the roots of virtue that inspires the development of all beings according to their inclinations, through various methods of attainment and various gateways of liberation.

original: atha khalu sarvajagadrakṣāpraṇidhānavīryaprabhā rātridevatā tasyāṃ velāyāmetaṃ vimokṣanayaṃ paridīpayantī saṃdarśayamānā sudhanaṃ śreṣṭhidārakaṃ
analyzed: atha khalu sarva jagat rakṣā praṇidhāna vīryaprabhā rātri devatā tasyām velāyām etam vimokṣa nayam paridīpayantī saṃdarśayamānā sudhanam śreṣṭhi dārakam
translated: Then, at that time, the night goddess Sarvajagaddhitaiṣiṇī, in order to fully reveal and demonstrate this liberation,

analyzed: acintyam etam paramam vimokṣam
translated: This inconceivable supreme liberation,

analyzed: mām pṛcchasi tvam khalu yad prapītaḥ
translated: You have asked me about it.

analyzed: vinirdiśatyāḥ sugata anubhavā
translated: I will explain it to you, as I have experienced it from the Sugatas.

analyzed: chṛṇuṣva tat me nikhilam yathāvat  kalpān anantān vipulān acintyān
translated: Listen to it all from me, just as it is.🔽 Countless, vast, inconceivable eons,

analyzed: kṣetra arṇavān ca a pratimāna saṃkhyān

translated: He approached the Lumbinī Grove, circumambulated it, and while searching for the Lumbinī Grove goddess named Radiance of the Circle of Light of Supreme Beauty, he saw her in the Lumbinī Grove, seated on a lion throne in the heart of a jeweled lotus in a multi-storied pavilion with branches of all jewels, surrounded and revered by 200,000 quintillion grove goddesses, teaching the Dharma, expounding the sutra called The Teaching on the Ocean of All Bodhisattva Births, causing the ocean of qualities to increase in the bodhisattvas born in the lineage of the Tathagata.

original: upetya sutejomaṇḍalaratiśrīlumbinīvanadevatāyāḥ pādau śirasābhivandya purataḥ prāñjaliḥ sthitvā evamāhamayā devate anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittamutpāditam /

translated: Having approached, he bowed his head to the feet of the Lumbinī Grove goddess named Radiance of the Circle of Light of Supreme Beauty, stood before her with palms joined, and said, Goddess, I have given rise to the mind set on unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

original: anivartayā śraddhayā puṇyaṃ samārjayan atṛptaḥ sarvatathāgatapūjāsaṃbhārasamudānayanaprayukto'pratiprasrabdhaprayogo bhavati /

translated: This, noble sir, is the first birth of a bodhisattva, called the womb of the application of the vow to worship and attend to all the Buddhas of the bodhisattvas, which leads to the accumulation of the roots of goodness that come from the attainment of omniscience.

analyzed: tatra kula putra katamat bodhi citta aṅga pariniṣpatti saṃbhavagarbham nāma dvitīyam bodhisattva janma

analyzed: iha kula putra bodhisattvaḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpādayati

analyzed: yat uta mahā karuṇā cittam sarva sattva paritrāṇāya  sarva buddha ārāgaṇa cittam atyanta abhirādhana tāyai

analyzed: sarva buddha dharma paryeṣṭi cittam sarva vastu an apekṣa tāyai
translated: The thought of seeking all the Buddhadharmas, in order to be indifferent to all possessions.

analyzed: mahāprasthāna cittam sarvajña tā abhimukha tāyai
translated: The thought of the great departure, in order to face omniscience.

analyzed: mahā maitrī cittam sarva jagat saṃgraha prayoga spharaṇa tāyai
translated: The mind of great loving kindness, in order to pervade the practice of gathering all beings.

analyzed: sarva jagat aparityāga cittam sarvajña tā saṃnāha dṛḍha tāyai
translated: The mind of not abandoning any being, in order to be firm in the armor of omniscience.

analyzed: a śāṭhya a māyā cittam yathā bhūta jñāna avabhāsa pratilābha tāyai

analyzed: yathāvādī tathākāri cittam bodhisattva mārga pratipadyana tāyai

analyzed: sarva buddha avisaṃvādana cittam sarva tathāgata praṇidhi anupālana tāyai
translated: The mind of not deceiving any buddha, in order to uphold the vows of all tathagatas.

analyzed: sarvajña tā mahā praṇidhāna cittam aparānta koṭī gata sarva sattva paripāka vinaya a pratiprasrabdhaye
translated: The mind of the great vow for omniscience, in order to continuously ripen and guide all beings until the end of time.

analyzed: etad pramukhaiḥ buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samaiḥ bodhi citta aṅga saṃbhāraiḥ abhiniṣpannaḥ sa bodhisattvaḥ jātaḥ bhavati tathāgata kule
translated: The bodhisattva is born into the family of the tathagatas when he has accomplished these and other accumulations of bodhicitta as numerous as the atoms in the buddha-fields.

translated: Here, noble sir, the bodhisattva, with a mind intent on the attainment of the door of the manifestation of the way of all phenomena, with a mind intent on the fulfillment of the aspects of the path to omniscience, with a mind intent on the performance of irreproachable actions, with a mind intent on the purification of the ocean of all bodhisattva meditative absorptions, with a mind intent on the accomplishment of all bodhisattva qualities, with a mind intent on the manifestation of the arrays of all the components of the bodhisattva path, with a mind of uninterrupted effort, burning with the conflagration of the eon in order to create the vast scope of omniscience, with a mind intent on the accomplishment of the bodhisattva conduct, which is infinite and immeasurable in its application to the development and guidance of all beings, with a mind that has entered into the realization of all the bodhisattva qualities that are well practiced in all trainings and disciplines, with a mind that contemplates all existents through the discernment of all existents,

analyzed: idam kula putra dharma naya nidhi apti yoga netrī abhimukha saṃbhavagarbham nāma tṛtīyam bodhisattva janma
translated: This, noble sir, is the third bodhisattva birth, called the womb of the manifestation of the door of the eye of yoga intent on the way of the Dharma.

analyzed: iha kula putra bodhisattvaḥ pariśuddhaḥ bhavati adhyāśaya dhātau

analyzed: avabhāsa prāptaḥ bhavati buddha bodhau  avatīrṇaḥ bhavati bodhisattva naya samudreṣu
translated: He becomes one who has attained the illumination of Buddha-enlightenment.🔽He becomes one who has descended into the ocean of the methods of the bodhisattvas.

analyzed: viśeṣa gāminī prāptaḥ bhavati bodhisattva tīkṣṇa indriya tā vivardhana tāyai

analyzed: kalyāṇa cittaḥ bhavati adhyāśaya prabhāsvara tāyai

analyzed: acalaḥ bhavati dṛḍha mahā praṇidhāna vivardhana tāyai

analyzed: pratiśaraṇa bhūtaḥ bhavati sarva jagat upajīvyaḥ

analyzed: idam kula putra bodhisattvānām tryadhvalokādhyāśayaviśuddhigarbham nāma caturtham bodhisattva janma
translated: This, noble sir, is the fourth birth of a bodhisattva, called the womb of the purification of the higher intention regarding the three times and the world.

analyzed: prajñā vīrya prabhaḥ bhavati sarva dharma avabhāsa pratilabdhaḥ

analyzed: asaṅga cakṣuḥ bhavati buddha darśana samudra vijñapti avatīrṇaḥ

analyzed: su prayuktaḥ bhavati yathāvat dharma naya pratilābheṣu

analyzed: idam kula putra bodhisattvānām samantāvabhāsaprabhāgarbham nāma pañcamam bodhisattva janma
translated: This, noble sir, is the bodhisattvas' fifth bodhisattva birth, called the womb of the light of universal illumination.

original: tatra kulaputra katamadbodhisattvānāṃ sarvatathāgatakulagotrasaṃbhavagarbhaṃ nāma ṣaṣṭhaṃ bodhisattvajanma /

analyzed: iha kula putra bodhisattvaḥ jātaḥ bhavati tathāgata kulena ujātaḥ bhavati
translated: Here, noble sir, the bodhisattva is born in the family of the Tathagata, and is born after him.

analyzed: tathāgata vaṃśe niṣpannaḥ bhavati sarva buddha dharma naya mukheṣu
translated: He is accomplished in the lineage of the Tathagata, in the way of all the teachings of the Buddhas.

analyzed: viśuddhaḥ bhavati atīta anāgata pratyutpanna tathāgata mahā praṇidhāneṣu
translated: He is pure in the great vows of the Tathagatas of the past, future, and present.

analyzed: eka dhana kuśala mūlaḥ bhavati sarva tathāgata kuśala mūleṣu
translated: He is one with the roots of virtue of all the Tathagatas.

analyzed: eka śarīraḥ bhavati sarva buddhaiḥ
translated: He is one with the body of all the Buddhas.

analyzed: loka uttara gāmī śukla dharmaiḥ
translated: He goes beyond the world with the bright qualities.

analyzed: mahātma dharma vihārī bhavati buddha adhiṣṭhāna darśana samādhau
translated: He abides in the great Dharma, seeing the blessings of the buddhas in the samādhi.

analyzed: sattva viśuddhi dharma pratipannaḥ bhavati yathākāle
translated: He is engaged in the purification of beings and the Dharma in a timely way.

analyzed: a pratiprasrabdha pratibhānaḥ bhavati buddha dharma paripṛcchāsu
translated: He has uninterrupted eloquence in asking questions about the Buddha's teachings.

original: idaṃ kulaputra bodhisattvānāṃ sarvatathāgatakulagotrasaṃbhavagarbhaṃ nāma ṣaṣṭhaṃ bodhisattvajanma //
analyzed: idam kula putra bodhisattvānām sarvatathāgatakulagotrasaṃbhavagarbham nāma ṣaṣṭham bodhisattva janma
translated: This, noble sir, is the bodhisattvas' sixth birth, called the womb of the origin of the lineage of the family of all the Tathāgatas.

original: tatra kulaputra katamadbodhisattvānāṃ tathāgatabalāvabhāsālokālaṃkāragarbhaṃ nāma saptamaṃ bodhisattvajanma /
analyzed: tatra kula putra katamat bodhisattvānām tathāgatabalāvabhāsālokālaṃkāragarbham nāma saptamam bodhisattva janma
translated: There, noble sir, what is the bodhisattvas' seventh birth, called the womb that is the ornament of the light of the radiance of the Tathāgata's powers?

original: iha kulaputra bodhisattvo buddhabalapraveśāvabhāse na nivartate buddhakṣetragamaneṣu /
analyzed: iha kula putra bodhisattvaḥ buddha bala praveśa avabhāse na nivartate buddhakṣetra gamaneṣu
translated: Here, noble sir, the bodhisattva, in the radiance of the entry into the Buddha's powers, does not turn back from going to the Buddha-fields.

analyzed: na pratyudāvartate nānā bodhisattva guṇa samudra upasthānāya
translated: He does not turn back from attending to the ocean of various bodhisattva qualities.

analyzed: na paritrasyati sarva dharma māyā gata yathā bhūta jñānena
translated: He does not tremble in the knowledge of the way things really are, that all phenomena are like illusions.

analyzed: svapna upamam sarva lokam pratividhyati
translated: He penetrates that the whole world is like a dream.

analyzed: pratibhāsa upamam sarva rūpa vijñapti adhiṣṭhānam abhinirharati
translated: He manifests the basis of the perception of all forms as being like a reflection.

analyzed: nirmita upama abhijñā vikurvita vaśitā prāptaḥ bhavati
translated: He attains the mastery of emanations, superknowledges, and transformations.

analyzed: chāyā upamam sarva bhava gati upapattiṣu mukham saṃdarśayati
translated: He displays his face in all the destinies and rebirths, like a shadow.

analyzed: pratiśrutkā upamāni sarva tathāgata dharma cakrāṇi prajānāti
translated: He knows that all the Dharma wheels of the Tathagatas are like echoes.

analyzed: dharmadhātu naya nirdeśa parama pāramitā prāptaḥ bhavati nānā artha upāya naya nirdeśa prayuktaḥ
translated: He attains the perfection of teaching the way of the Dharma realm, and is engaged in teaching the way of various meanings and methods.

original: idaṃ kulaputra bodhisattvānāṃ tathāgatabalāvabhāsālokālaṃkāragarbhaṃ nāma saptamaṃ bodhisattvajanma //
analyzed: idam kula putra bodhisattvānām tathāgatabalāvabhāsālokālaṃkāragarbham nāma saptamam bodhisattva janma
translated: This, noble son, is the seventh bodhisattva birth of the bodhisattvas, called the womb of the ornament of the light of the power of the Tathagatas.

analyzed: tatra kula putra katamat bodhisattvānām samantajñānamukhavyavacārapariniṣpattisaṃbhavagarbham nāma aṣṭamam bodhisattva janma
translated: There, noble son, what is the eighth bodhisattva birth of the bodhisattvas, called the womb of the arising of the perfect accomplishment of the knowledge of all aspects?

original: iha kulaputra bodhisattvaḥ kumārabhūta eva bodhisattvavyavasthānavyavasthito bhavati /
analyzed: iha kula putra bodhisattvaḥ kumāra bhūtaḥ eva bodhisattva vyavasthāna vyavasthitaḥ bhavati
translated: Here, noble son, the bodhisattva, even as a prince, becomes established in the bodhisattva's system.

analyzed: yatra pratiṣṭhāya sarvajña jñāna nayam vyavacārayati
translated: Having been established there, he investigates the way of omniscient knowledge.

original: ekaikatra jñānanayamukhe'prameyāḥ kalpāḥ kṣayaṃ vrajeyuraprameyaṃ bodhisattvagocaraṃ nirdiśataḥ /
analyzed: eka ekatra jñāna naya mukhe prameyāḥ kalpāḥ kṣayam vrajeyuḥ aprameyam bodhisattva gocaram nirdiśataḥ
translated: In each door of the method of knowledge, he would spend immeasurable eons explaining the immeasurable domain of the bodhisattvas.

analyzed: sarva bodhisattva samādhiṣu ca vaśī bhavati parama pāramitā prāptaḥ
translated: And he becomes a master of all the bodhisattva concentrations, having attained the highest perfection.

analyzed: prati citta kṣaṇam sarva citta kṣaṇeṣu daśa diś anabhilāpya buddhakṣetra gatānām tathāgatānām pāda mūleṣu upapadyate
translated: In every moment of thought, in every moment of thought, he is born at the feet of the Tathagatas in the buddha-fields of the ten directions, which are inexpressible beyond expression.

analyzed: asaṃbhinnaiḥ ca ārambaṇaiḥ asaṃbhinnān samādhīn samāpadyate
translated: And he enters the undivided concentrations with undivided objects.

analyzed: asaṃbhinneṣu ca dharmeṣu asaṃbhinna jñāna vaśitām saṃdarśayati
translated: And in the undivided dharmas, he manifests the mastery of undivided knowledge.

analyzed: aparyantāni ca ārambaṇāni anārambaṇe dhātau avakrāmati  parīttaiḥ ca ārambaṇaiḥ ananta nirdeśa bhūmim avatarati
translated: And he enters the infinite objects in the realm of no objects.🔽And with limited objects, he enters the stage of infinite teaching.

original: aprameyāṃ ca dharmatāṃ parīttāṃ mahadgatāṃ vā pratividhyati /
analyzed: aprameyām ca dharmatām parīttām mahadgatām vā pratividhyati
translated: And he penetrates the immeasurable dharmata, whether limited or vast.

analyzed: vijñapti samam ca sarva lokam avatarati
translated: And he enters the entire world as equal to consciousness.

analyzed: sarva dharma ārambaṇāni sarva vijñapti pathān ca bhāvanayā anugacchati
translated: And he follows with meditation all the objects of dharmas and all the paths of consciousness.

analyzed: idam kula putra bodhisattvānām samantajñānamukhavyavacāraṇapariniṣpattisaṃbhavagarbham nāma aṣṭamam bodhisattva janma
translated: This, noble sir, is the eighth birth of a bodhisattva, called the womb of the arising of the accomplishment of the discernment of the all-knowledge gateways.

original: tatra kulaputra katamadbodhisattvānāṃ dharmadhātunirmāṇavyūhagarbhaṃ nāma bodhisattvajanma /
analyzed: tatra kula putra katamat bodhisattvānām dharmadhātu nirmāṇavyūhagarbham nāma bodhisattva janma
translated: There, noble sir, what is the bodhisattvas’ birth called the womb of the array of emanations in the dharma-realm?

original: iha kulaputra bodhisattvaḥ sarvatra cittakṣaṇe nānāvyūhāni buddhakṣetrāṇi adhitiṣṭhati /
analyzed: iha kula putra bodhisattvaḥ sarvatra citta kṣaṇe nānā vyūhāni buddhakṣetrāṇi adhitiṣṭhati
translated: Here, noble sir, a bodhisattva, in every instant of thought, determines buddha-fields with various arrays.

analyzed: sattva nirmāṇe vaiśāradya parama pāramitā prāptaḥ ca bhavati
translated: And he attains the perfection of fearlessness in the emanation of beings.

analyzed: buddha nirmāṇa kauśalya prāptaḥ ca bhavati
translated: And he attains skill in the emanation of buddhas.

analyzed: dharma nirmāṇa vaiśāradya viśuddhaḥ ca bhavati
translated: And he is purified by fearlessness in the emanation of the Dharma.

analyzed: asaṅga vara dharmadhātu gocaraḥ ca bhavati
translated: And he has the range of the unobstructed dharma-realm.

analyzed: yathā āśaya sarva kāya vijñapti adhiṣṭhāna kuśalaḥ ca bhavati
translated: And he is skilled in the manifestation of all bodies according to the inclinations of beings.

analyzed: acintya sattva vinaya kauśalya gataḥ ca bhavati
translated: And he has attained the skill of the inconceivable conversion of beings.

analyzed: nānā caryā abhisaṃbodhi saṃdarśakaḥ ca bhavati
translated: And he manifests various practices and complete awakenings.

analyzed: anāvaraṇa sarvajña tā mārga abhinirhāra kuśalaḥ ca bhavati
translated: And he is skilled in accomplishing the path to unobstructed omniscience.

analyzed: tad anantaram dharma cakra pravartana kauśalyam saṃdarśayati
translated: After that, he displays the skill in setting the wheel of the Dharma in motion.

analyzed: ananta madhyasattva vinaya upāya abhinirhāra kuśalaḥ ca bhavati
translated: He is skilled in accomplishing the means of training sentient beings without end or middle.

analyzed: kāla prāpte sattva vinaye sadā samāhitaḥ ca bhavati vairocana jñāna garbha kośaḥ
translated: When the time comes to train sentient beings, he is always in meditative concentration, the womb of the treasury of the knowledge of Vairocana.

original: idaṃ kulaputra bodhisattvānāṃ dharmadhātunirmāṇavyūhagarbhaṃ nāma navamaṃ bodhisattvajanma //
analyzed: idam kula putra bodhisattvānām dharmadhātunirmāṇavyūhagarbham nāma navamam bodhisattva janma
translated: Noble sir, this is the ninth birth of a bodhisattva, called the womb of the array of emanations from the realm of phenomena, of the bodhisattvas.

original: tatra kulaputra katamadbodhisattvānāṃ tathāgatabhūmyākramaṇavegagarbhaṃ nāma daśamaṃ bodhisattvajanma /
analyzed: tatra kula putra katamat bodhisattvānām tathāgatabhūmyākramaṇavegagarbham nāma daśamam bodhisattva janma
translated: There, noble sir, what is the tenth birth of the bodhisattvas, called the womb of the impetus to ascend the stage of the tathagatas?

original: iha kulaputra bodhisattvo vivikto bhavati sarvatryadhvatathāgataikībhāvaviṣaye /
analyzed: iha kula putra bodhisattvaḥ viviktaḥ bhavati sarva tri adhva tathāgata ekībhāva viṣaye
translated: Here, noble sir, the bodhisattva is secluded in the domain of the single essence of all tathagatas in the three times.

analyzed: sarva lokadhātu ānantarya viṣayam ca avatarati
translated: He enters the domain of the uninterrupted [realization] of all world systems.

analyzed: sarva sattvānām pūrva anta apara anta cyuti upapattiṣu citta ānantarya utpādam jānāti
translated: He knows the uninterrupted arising of the minds of all sentient beings in their deaths and rebirths in the past and future.

analyzed: sarva bodhisattvānām caryā jñāna ānantarya viṣayam prajānāti
translated: He understands the uninterrupted domain of the knowledge of the conduct of all bodhisattvas.

analyzed: atīta anāgata pratyutpannānām ca sarva buddhānām abhisaṃbodha ānantaryam prajānāti
translated: He knows the immediate succession of the perfect enlightenment of all the Buddhas of the past, future, and present.

analyzed: sarva dharmāṇām ca upakāra kauśalya ānantaryam prajānāti
translated: He knows the immediate succession of the benefits of all the Dharmas.

original: sarvakalpasaṃvartavivartakalpānāṃ ca pūrvāntāparāntapratyuatpannānāṃ sanāmnāṃ sopadeśānāmānantaryaṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: sarva kalpa saṃvarta vivarta kalpānām ca pūrva anta apara anta pratyuatpannānām sa nāmnām sa upadeśānām ānantaryam prajānāti
translated: He knows the immediate succession of the past, future, and present names of all the kalpas of creation and destruction.

analyzed: yathā paripāciteṣu ca sattveṣu yathā kāla prāpteṣu abhisaṃbodhi vyūha vibuddhi an aviṣaya saṃdarśana adhiṣṭhāna jñānam abhinirharati
translated: He manifests the knowledge of the consecration of the manifestation of the array of perfect enlightenment in accordance with the time for those beings who are ripe for it.

analyzed: sarva buddha utpādeṣu ca abhisaṃbodhi upanayana dharma cakra pravartana kauśalya naya ānantarya tām saṃdarśayati ananta sattvadhātu vinaya upāya abhinirhāra kauśalyena
translated: And in the births of all the Buddhas, he manifests the immediate succession of the skill in the turning of the wheel of the Dharma that leads to perfect enlightenment, by the skill in the manifestation of the means of training infinite numbers of beings.

original: idaṃ kulaputra bodhisattvānāṃ tathāgatabhūmyākramaṇavegagarbhaṃ nāma daśamaṃ bodhisattvajanma //
analyzed: idam kula putra bodhisattvānām tathāgatabhūmyākramaṇavegagarbham nāma daśamam bodhisattva janma
translated: This, son of noble family, is the tenth birth of a bodhisattva, called the womb of the impetus to traverse the stage of the Tathāgata, of the bodhisattvas.

original: imāni kulaputra bodhisattvānāṃ daśa bodhisattvajanmāni yeṣu bodhisattvā jāyante upapadyante samarjayanti saṃvardhayanti pratipūrayanti saṃbhavanti parisaṃbhavanti pariniṣpadyante /🔽sarvakṣetraniravaśeṣānubodhāyaikavyūhālaṃkārasamudācārānadhitiṣṭhanti /🔽sattvadhātunayāpratiprasrambhaṇāya aparāntakoṭīgatakalpādhiṣṭhānānadhitiṣṭhante /🔽sarvadharmasamudranānārambaṇānekavicitranānāparaṃparānirdeśānantadharmaparaṃparāsroto'bhisaṃbudhyante /
analyzed: imāni kula putra bodhisattvānām daśa bodhisattva janmāni yeṣu bodhisattvāḥ jāyante upapadyante samarjayanti saṃvardhayanti pratipūrayanti saṃbhavanti parisaṃbhavanti pariniṣpadyante  sarva kṣetra niravaśeṣa anubodhāya eka vyūha alaṃkāra samudācārān adhitiṣṭhanti  sattvadhātu naya a pratiprasrambhaṇāya aparānta koṭī gata kalpa adhiṣṭhānān adhitiṣṭhante  sarva dharma samudra nānā ārambaṇa aneka vicitra nānā paraṃparā nirdeśa ananta dharma paraṃparā srotaḥ abhisaṃbudhyante
translated: These, noble sir, are the ten births of the bodhisattvas, in which the bodhisattvas are born, are reborn, accumulate, increase, fulfill, are born, are born again, and are fully born.🔽They resolve to have the same array of adornments as all the unexcelled fields.🔽They resolve to have the same basis as the endless future of world ages.🔽They awaken to the stream of the endless succession of teachings, with its infinite variety of different subjects, different meanings, and different expressions, which is the ocean of all the teachings.🔽

original: acintyāṃ buddhavṛṣabhitāṃ dharmadhātuparamākāśadhātuparyavasānāṃ saṃdarśayanti /🔽aprameyasattvacaryānānātvasamudreṣu paripākavinayasaṃgṛhīteṣu dharmacakrapravartanaṃ saṃdarśayanti /🔽sarvalokadhātūn buddhotpādāvirahitānadhitiṣṭhanti /
analyzed: acintyām buddha vṛṣabhi tām dharmadhātu parama ākāśa dhātu paryavasānām saṃdarśayanti 🔽aprameya sattva caryā nānātva samudreṣu paripāka vinaya saṃgṛhīteṣu dharma cakra pravartanam saṃdarśayanti 🔽sarva lokadhātūn buddha utpāda avirahitān adhitiṣṭhanti
