original: tāmupasaṃkramya paripṛcchakathaṃ bodhisattvena bodhisattvaparipākāya saṃsāre saṃsaritavyam //
analyzed: tām upasaṃkramya paripṛccha katham bodhisattvena bodhisattva paripākāya saṃsāre saṃsaritavyam
translated: Go to her and ask her how a bodhisattva should practice in saṃsāra in order to ripen beings.”

original: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhidārakaḥ sutejomaṇḍalaratiśriyo lumbinīvanadevatāyāḥ pādau śirasābhivandya sutejomaṇḍalaratiśriyaṃ lumbinīvanadevatāmanekaśatasahasrakṛtvaḥ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya punaḥ punaravalokya sutejomaṇḍalaratiśriyo lumbinīvanadevatāyā antikātprakrāntaḥ // //🔽gopā /
analyzed: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhi dārakaḥ su tejaḥ maṇḍala rati śriyaḥ lumbinī vana devatāyāḥ pādau śirasā abhivandya su tejaḥ maṇḍala rati śriyam lumbinī vana devatām aneka śata sahasra kṛtvas pradakṣiṇīkṛtya punar punar avalokya su tejaḥ maṇḍala rati śriyaḥ lumbinī vana devatāyāḥ antikāt prakrāntaḥ  /🔽gopāḥ
translated: Then Sudhana, the head merchant’s son, bowed his head to the feet of the Lumbinī grove goddess Sutejomaṇḍalaratiśrī, circumambulated the Lumbinī grove goddess Sutejomaṇḍalaratiśrī many hundreds of thousands of times, keeping her to his right, and, looking back again and again, departed from the presence of the Lumbinī grove goddess Sutejomaṇḍalaratiśrī.

original: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhidārakaḥ sutejomaṇḍalaratiśriyo lumbinīvanadevatāyā antikādapakramya yena kapilavastu mahānagaraṃ tenopasaṃkramya etamevāprameyakalpasarvārambaṇabodhisattvajanmavikurvitasaṃdarśanaṃ bodhisattvavimokṣaṃ bhāvayan avataran vipulīkurvan anutiṣṭhan uttāpayan parijayan paricintayan pravicinvan anupūrveṇa yena dharmadhātupratibhāsaprabho bodhisattvasaṃgītiprāsādastenopasaṃkrāmat /
analyzed: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhi dārakaḥ sutejaḥ maṇḍala rati śriyaḥ lumbinī vana devatāyāḥ antikāt apakramya yena kapilavastu mahā nagaram tena upasaṃkramya etam eva aprameya kalpa sarva ārambaṇa bodhisattva janma vikurvita saṃdarśanam bodhisattva vimokṣam bhāvayan avataran vipulīkurvan anutiṣṭhan uttāpayan parijayan paricintayan pravicinvan anupūrveṇa yena dharmadhātu pratibhāsa prabhaḥ bodhisattva saṃgīti prāsādaḥ tena upasaṃkrāmat
translated: Then the merchant’s son Sudhana, having departed from the presence of the Lumbini grove goddess Sutejomaṇḍalaratiśrī, went to the great city of Kapilavastu and, contemplating, entering, expanding, practicing, purifying, mastering, examining, and investigating that bodhisattva liberation called the manifestation of the inconceivable life of the bodhisattva in all objects of the past, approached the assembly hall of the bodhisattvas called Dharmadhātupratibhāsaprabha.

original: tasyopasaṃkramaṇasya aśokaśrīrnāma bodhisattvasaṃgītiprāsādadevatā daśabhirgṛhadevatāsahasraiḥ sārdhaṃ pratyudgamya sudhanaṃ śreṣṭhidārakamevamāhasvāgataṃ te mahāpuruṣa mahāprajñājñānavikrāmin acintyabodhisattvavimokṣabhāvanādhyālambanapraṇidhicittavipuladharmavimānagocaracārin dharmanagarābhimukha anantabodhisattvopāyanayāvatāraṇāpratiprasrabdhatathāgataguṇasāgarāvabhāsapratilabdha sarvajagadvinayapratibhāsapratibhānajñānābhimukhasarvasattvacaryājñānakāyamantrānuvartana caryābhimukhacitta sarvajagadvedanāprītisamudravegavivardhanapraṇidhāna sarvatathāgatadharmaprativedhamārgapratipanna /
analyzed: tasya upasaṃkramaṇasya aśokaśrīḥ nāma bodhisattva saṃgīti prāsāda devatā daśabhiḥ gṛha devatā sahasraiḥ sārdham pratyudgamya sudhanam śreṣṭhi dārakam evam āha svāgatam te mahā puruṣa mahā prajñā jñāna vikrāmin acintya bodhisattva vimokṣa bhāvanā adhyālambana praṇidhi citta vipula dharma vimāna gocara cārin dharma nagara abhimukha ananta bodhisattva upāya nayā avatāraṇā pratiprasrabdha tathāgata guṇa sāgara avabhāsa pratilabdha sarva jagat vinaya
translated: The goddess of the assembly hall named Aśokashri, who was the deity of the assembly hall of the bodhisattvas, together with ten thousand household deities, came out to meet Sudhana, the merchant's son, and said to him, Welcome, great being, you who have great wisdom and knowledge, you who are intent on the inconceivable bodhisattva liberation, you who are focused on the cultivation of the aspiration mind, you who have the vast domain of the Dharma palace, you who are facing the city of the Dharma, you who are continuously engaged in guiding beings through the infinite bodhisattva methods, you who have attained the illumination of the ocean of qualities of the Tathagatas, you who are facing the knowledge of the wisdom of the reflections of guiding all beings, you who are focused on the practice of the knowledge of the conduct of all beings, you who are focused on the mind that increases the momentum of the ocean of joy and happiness of all beings, you who are engaged in the path of penetrating the Dharma of all Tathagatas.

analyzed: yathā tvām paśyāmi animiṣa netra gambhīra caryā īryāpatha viśuddha gocaram
translated: As I see you, with eyes that do not blink, with the pure domain of conduct and behavior that is profound,

original: nacireṇa tvamanuttaratathāgatakāyavākcittālaṃkāraviśuddhiṃ pratilabdho lakṣaṇānuvyañjanapratimaṇḍitena kāyena daśabalajñānālokālaṃkṛtena cittena lokaṃ vicariṣyasi /
analyzed: nacireṇa tvam anuttara tathāgata kāya vāc citta alaṃkāra viśuddhim pratilabdhaḥ lakṣaṇa anuvyañjana pratimaṇḍitena kāyena daśa bala jñāna āloka alaṃkṛtena cittena lokam vicariṣyasi
translated: Before long you will attain the purity of the adornments of the body, speech, and mind of the unsurpassed Tathāgata, with a body adorned with the major and minor marks, and with a mind adorned with the light of the knowledge of the ten powers, you will move through the world.

analyzed: yādṛśīm ca te dṛḍha vīrya parākrama tām paśyāmi
translated: And I see that your steadfastness and valor are firm.

original: nacireṇa tvaṃ sarvatryadhvatathāgatasaṃmukhībhāvadarśanasamaṅgī sarvatathāgatadharmameghān saṃpratīcchan sarvabodhisattvadhyānavimokṣasamādhisamāpattiśāntadharmavimānaratimanubhavan gambhīraṃ buddhavimokṣamanupravekṣyasi /
analyzed: nacireṇa tvam sarva tri adhva tathāgata saṃmukhībhāva darśana samaṅgī sarva tathāgata dharmameghān saṃpratīcchan sarva bodhisattva dhyāna vimokṣa samādhi samāpatti śānta dharma vimāna ratim anubhavan gambhīram buddha vimokṣam anupravekṣyasi
translated: Before long you will enter the profound liberation of the Buddhas, experiencing the joy of the Dharma of tranquility, the liberations, concentrations, and absorptions of all bodhisattvas, receiving the Dharma clouds of all Tathāgatas, endowed with the vision of the presence of all Tathāgatas in the three times.

original: tathā hi tvaṃ kalyāṇamitropasaṃkramaṇadarśanaparyupāsanānuśāsanīḥ saṃpratīcchaṃstadguṇapratinayeṣu prayujyamāno na parikhidyase /🔽na vinivartase /
analyzed: tathā hi tvam kalyāṇa mitra upasaṃkramaṇa darśana paryupāsana anuśāsanīḥ saṃpratīcchan tad guṇa pratinayeṣu prayujyamānaḥ na parikhidyase  na vinivartase
translated: Because you, approaching, seeing, attending, and receiving the instructions of the spiritual friends, being engaged in the practice of their qualities, do not become weary.🔽You do not turn back.

analyzed: na paritapasi
translated: You do not become tormented.

original: na ca te kaścidantarāyo vā āvaraṇaṃ vā nivaraṇaṃ vā prasahate /
analyzed: na ca te kaścid antarāyaḥ vā āvaraṇam vā nivaraṇam vā prasahate
translated: And no obstacle, obstruction, or hindrance can overcome you,

analyzed: mārāḥ vā māra kāyikāḥ vā devatāḥ
translated: whether Māra or the gods of Māra's retinue.

original: tena acirādeva tvaṃ sarvasattvānāṃ prītikaro bhaviṣyasi //
analyzed: tena acirāt eva tvam sarva sattvānām prīti karaḥ bhaviṣyasi
translated: Therefore, you will soon become one who delights all beings.”

original: evamukte sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhidārako'śokaśriyaṃ bodhisattvasaṃgītiprāsādadevatāmetadavocattathāstu devate yathā vadasi /
analyzed: evam ukte sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhi dāraka uśokaśriyam bodhisattva saṃgīti prāsāda devatām etat avocat tathā astu devate yathā vadasi
translated: When this was said, the merchant’s son Sudhana said to the goddess of the assembly hall of the bodhisattvas called “Undefiled Banner,” “Goddess, it shall be as you say.

original: ahaṃ khalu devate sarvasattvakleśasaṃtāpavyupaśamena paramāṃ prītiṃ vindāmi /
analyzed: aham khalu devate sarva sattva kleśa saṃtāpa vyupaśamena paramām prītim vindāmi
translated: Goddess, I find the highest joy in the cessation of the torment of the afflictions of all beings.

original: sarvasattvaviṣayakarmavipākavinivartanena sarvasattvasukhasaṃbhavena sarvasattvānavadyakarmapratipattyā paramāṃ prītiṃ vindāmi /
analyzed: sarva sattva viṣaya karma vipāka vinivartanena sarva sattva sukha saṃbhavena sarva sattva anavadya karma pratipattyā paramām prītim vindāmi
translated: I find the highest joy in the cessation of the ripening of the karma of the objects of all beings, in the arising of happiness for all beings, and in the practice of irreproachable actions by all beings.

original: yadā ca devate sattvā vividhaviṣayakarmakleśaprayogākṣiptacittā durgatiṣu prapatanti sugatiṣu vā /
analyzed: yadā ca devate sattvāḥ vividha viṣaya karma kleśa prayoga ākṣipta cittāḥ durgatiṣu prapatanti sugatiṣu vā
translated: When, goddess, beings, their minds cast by the various objects, actions, and afflictions, fall into the lower realms or into the higher realms,

analyzed: vividhāni kāyika caitasikāni duḥkha daurmanasyāni pratyanubhavanti
translated: and experience various bodily and mental sufferings and sorrows,

analyzed: durmanasaḥ tasmin samaye bodhisattvāḥ bhavanti parama durmanasaḥ
translated: at that time the bodhisattvas become sorrowful, extremely sorrowful.

original: tadyathāpi nāma devate puruṣasyaikāntatṛṣṇācaritasya ekaputrako bhavet priyo manāpaḥ /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma devate puruṣasya ekānta tṛṣṇā caritasya eka putrakaḥ bhavet priyaḥ manāpaḥ
translated: Goddess, it is just as for a man who is solely devoted to sensual pleasures, who has a beloved and agreeable only son.

original: sa tasyāṅgapratyaṅgeṣu cchidyamāneṣu ekāntatṛṣṇācaritatvāt paramadurmanāḥ syādanāttamanaskaḥ /
analyzed: sa tasya aṅga pratyaṅgeṣu chidyamāneṣu ekānta tṛṣṇā carita tvāt parama durmanāḥ syāt an ātta manaskaḥ
translated: He, due to being completely devoted to craving, would be extremely unhappy and have a troubled mind, while his limbs and minor body parts are being cut off.

original: evameva devate bodhisattvo bodhisattvacārikāṃ caran sattvān karmakleśavaśena tisṛṣu durgatiṣu patitān dṛṣṭvā durmanā bhavati paramadurmanāḥ
analyzed: evam eva devate bodhisattvaḥ bodhisattva cārikām caran sattvān karma kleśa vaśena tisṛṣu durgatiṣu patitān dṛṣṭvā durmanāḥ bhavati parama durmanāḥ
translated: In the same way, O Goddess, the bodhisattva, practicing the bodhisattva conduct, seeing beings fallen into the three lower realms due to the power of karma and afflictions, becomes unhappy, extremely unhappy.

original: yasmin vā punaḥ samaye sattvāḥ kāyavāṅbhanaḥsucaritasamādanahetoḥ kāyasya bhedātsugatau svargaloke deveṣūpapadyante /
analyzed: yasmin vā punar samaye sattvāḥ kāya vāc bhanaḥsu carita samādana hetoḥ kāyasya bhedāt sugatau svarga loke deveṣu upapadyante
translated: Or, on the other hand, when beings, due to taking up good conduct of body, speech, and mind, upon the dissolution of the body are reborn among the gods in the happy realms of the heavens,

analyzed: deva manuṣya gatiṣu ca kāyika caitasikāni sukhāni pratyanubhavanti
translated: and experience bodily and mental pleasures in the destinies of gods and humans,

original: paramasukhī tasmin samaye bodhisattvo bhavati sumanā āttamanaskaḥ pramuditaḥ prītisaumanasyajātaḥ /
analyzed: parama sukhī tasmin samaye bodhisattvaḥ bhavati sumanāḥ ātta manaskaḥ pramuditaḥ prīti saumanasya jātaḥ
translated: the bodhisattva is supremely happy at that time, joyful, with a delighted mind, filled with joy, delight, and gladness.

original: na khalu punardevate bodhisattvā ātmārthāya sarvajñatāmabhiprārthayante /
analyzed: na khalu punar devate bodhisattvāḥ ātma arthāya sarvajña tām abhiprārthayante
translated: O Goddess, the bodhisattvas do not aspire to omniscience for their own sake.

original: na vicitrasaṃsāraratisukhaprabhavanārthaṃ na kāmadhātuparyāpannaṃ vividharativyūhaprārthanayā saṃjñācittadṛṣṭiviparyāsavaśena na saṃyojanabandhanānuśayaparyavasthānavaśagatāḥ
analyzed: na vicitra saṃsāra rati sukha prabhavana artham na kāmadhātu paryāpannam vividha rati vyūha prārthanayā saṃjñā citta dṛṣṭi viparyāsa vaśena na saṃyojana bandhana anuśaya paryavasthāna vaśa gatāḥ
translated: Not for the sake of the various pleasures and joys of cyclic existence, not for the sake of the various arrays of pleasures included in the desire realm, not under the influence of the perversions of perception, mind, and view, not under the influence of the fetters, bonds, latent tendencies, and envelopments,

analyzed: na tṛṣṇā dṛṣṭi vaśa gatāḥ
translated: not under the influence of craving and views,

analyzed: na vividha sattva saṃsarga rati saṃjñā vinibaddha cetasaḥ
translated: not with minds bound by the notion of delighting in various associations with beings,

analyzed: na dhyāna rati sukha āsvāda parigṛddhāḥ
translated: not attached to the taste of the bliss of meditative concentration,

analyzed: na vividha āvaraṇa āvṛtāḥ saṃsāra gatiṣu parivartante
translated: not obstructed by various obscurations, they revolve in the destinies of cyclic existence.

original: api tu khalu punardevate bodhisattvā bhavasamudragatānāmaparimitaduḥkhaprapīḍitānāṃ sattvānāmantike mahākaruṇāṃ saṃjanayitvā sarvajagatsaṃgrahamahāpraṇidhimabhinirharanti
analyzed: api tu khalu punar devate bodhisattvāḥ bhava samudra gatānām aparimita duḥkha prapīḍitānām sattvānām antike mahā karuṇām saṃjanayitvā sarva jagat saṃgraha mahā praṇidhim abhinirharanti
translated: Moreover, goddesses, the bodhisattvas, having generated great compassion for beings who are in the ocean of existence, afflicted by immeasurable suffering, accomplish the great vow to gather all beings.

original: te mahākaruṇāpraṇidhyabhinirhārabalavegena sattvaparipākavinayaprayuktāḥ saṃsāre bodhisattvacaryāṃ carantaḥ saṃdṛśyante /
analyzed: te mahā karuṇā praṇidhi abhinirhāra bala vegena sattva paripāka vinaya prayuktāḥ saṃsāre bodhisattva caryām carantaḥ saṃdṛśyante
translated: By the power of the force of the accomplishment of great compassion and vow, they are engaged in ripening and guiding beings, and are seen practicing the bodhisattva conduct in cyclic existence.

analyzed: te sarva sattvanām sarva āvaraṇa sarvajña tā jñānam paryeṣamāṇāḥ sarva tathāgata pūjā upasthāna praṇidhim abhinirharanti
translated: Seeking the knowledge of all things, which is the removal of all obscurations for all sentient beings, they make the vow to worship and serve all the Tathāgatas.

analyzed: te tathāgata pūjā upasthāna praṇidhi vaśaiḥ na parikhidyante bodhisattva caryāyām
translated: By the power of that vow to worship and serve the Tathāgatas, they do not become weary in the bodhisattva conduct.

original: te bodhisattvacaryāṃ carantaḥ saṃkliṣṭāni kṣetrāṇi saṃpaśyantaḥ sarvabuddhakṣetrapariśodhanapraṇidhimabhinirharanti saṃkliṣṭān kṣetrasāgarān pariśodhayamānāḥ sarvasattvānāmāyatananānātvaṃ saṃpaśyamānāḥ /
analyzed: te bodhisattva caryām carantaḥ saṃkliṣṭāni kṣetrāṇi saṃpaśyantaḥ sarva buddhakṣetra pariśodhana praṇidhim abhinirharanti saṃkliṣṭān kṣetra sāgarān pariśodhayamānāḥ sarva sattvānām āyatana nānātvam saṃpaśyamānāḥ
translated: Practicing the bodhisattva conduct, seeing defiled fields, they make the vow to purify all buddha fields. Purifying defiled oceans of fields, seeing the diversity of the sense-fields of sentient beings,

analyzed: anānātva anuttara dharmakāya pariśuddhaye praṇidhim abhinirharanti saṃkliṣṭa kāya vāc citta tām sattvānām saṃpaśyamānāḥ
translated: they make the vow to purify the unsurpassed Dharma body, which is non-diversity. Seeing the defilement of the body, speech, and mind of sentient beings,

analyzed: sarva sattva kāya vāc citta alaṃkāra pariśuddhaye praṇidhim abhinirharanti
translated: they make the vow to purify the adornment of the body, speech, and mind of all sentient beings.

original: vikalāyatanānapariśuddhacetasaḥ sarvān saṃpaśyamānāḥ sarvasattvacittacaritāni pariśodhayamānā bodhisattvacaryāṃ caranto na parikhidyante /
analyzed: vikala āyata nānā pariśuddha cetasaḥ sarvān saṃpaśyamānāḥ sarva sattva citta caritāni pariśodhayamānāḥ bodhisattva caryām carantaḥ na parikhidyante
translated: They see all beings with incomplete sense bases and impure minds, and while purifying the conduct of the minds of all beings, they practice the conduct of the bodhisattvas without becoming weary.

original: evaṃ hi devate bodhisattvā anantamadhyāṃ bodhisattvacaryāṃ caranto'parikhinnacittāḥ /
analyzed: evam hi devate bodhisattvāḥ ananta madhyām bodhisattva caryām carantaḥ upari khinna cittāḥ
translated: In this way, Goddess, the bodhisattvas, while practicing the infinite and immeasurable conduct of the bodhisattvas, have undaunted minds.

original: evaṃ caranto'laṃkārabhūtā bhavanti sadevakasya lokasya devamanuṣyasaṃpattisaṃjananatayā /
analyzed: evam carantaḥ ulaṃkāra bhūtāḥ bhavanti sa devakasya lokasya deva manuṣya saṃpatti saṃjanana tayā
translated: Practicing in this way, they become ornaments for the world with its gods, generating the prosperity of gods and humans.

analyzed: mātā pitṛ bhūtāḥ bhavanti bodhisattva utpāda pratiṣṭhāpana tayā
translated: They become like mothers and fathers, establishing the arising of the bodhisattvas.

analyzed: dhātrī bhūtāḥ bhavanti bodhisattva mārga avataraṇa tayā
translated: They become like midwives, delivering the bodhisattvas onto the path.

analyzed: nitya anubaddha sahaja devatāḥ bhavanti durgati prapāta bhaya arakṣaṇa tayā
translated: They become constant attendant innate deities, protecting from the fear of falling into the lower realms.

analyzed: mahādāśa bhūtāḥ bhavanti saṃsāra samudra uttāraṇa tayā
translated: They become like great captains, delivering from the ocean of saṃsāra.

analyzed: śaraṇa bhūtāḥ bhavanti sarva māra kleśa bhaya vinivartana tayā
translated: They become a refuge, turning away the fear of all māras and afflictions.

analyzed: parāyaṇa bhūtāḥ bhavanti anta paramaśīti bhāva upanayana tayā
translated: They become a final resort, leading to the ultimate peace.

analyzed: tīrtha bhūtāḥ bhavanti sarva buddha samudra avataraṇayā
translated: They become a holy place by entering the ocean of all buddhas.

analyzed: saṃgrāhaka bhūtāḥ bhavanti dharma ratna dvīpa upanayana tayā
translated: They become a collector by bringing to the island of the jewel of the Dharma.

analyzed: puṣpa bhūtāḥ bhavanti sarva buddha guṇa saṃpuṣpita citta tayā  alaṃkāra bhūtāḥ bhavanti vipula puṇya jñāna prabhā pramuñcana tayā
translated: They become a flower by having a mind blossomed with all the qualities of the buddhas.🔽They become an ornament by emitting the light of vast merit and knowledge.

analyzed: parama prīti karāḥ bhavanti samanta prāsādika tayā
translated: They become givers of supreme joy by being completely beautiful.

analyzed: abhigamanīyāḥ bhavanti anavadya karma pratipattyā
translated: They become approachable by practicing irreproachable actions.

analyzed: samanta bhadrāḥ bhavanti sarva ākāra vara aṅga su paripūrṇa kāya tayā
translated: They become completely good by having a body fully endowed with all the best limbs.

analyzed: asecanaka rūpāḥ bhavanti a pratikūla darśana tayā
translated: They become pleasing to look at by being unobjectionable to behold.

analyzed: avabhāsa karāḥ bhavanti jñāna raśmi pramuñcana tayā
translated: They become illuminators by emitting the light of the rays of knowledge.

analyzed: āloka karāḥ bhavanti dharma pradīpa dhāraṇa tayā
translated: They become givers of light by holding the lamp of the Dharma.

analyzed: pradyota karāḥ bhavanti bodhi āśaya pariśodhana tayā
translated: They become givers of illumination by purifying the intention for enlightenment.

analyzed: senāpati bhūtāḥ bhavanti māra karma vinivartana tayā
translated: They become generals by turning away the actions of Mara.

analyzed: sūrya bhūtāḥ bhavanti prajñā raśmi jāla prabhā pramuñcana tayā
translated: They become suns by emitting the light of the net of the rays of wisdom.

analyzed: candra bhūtāḥ bhavanti gagana buddhi candra udāgamana tayā
translated: They become like the moon, with the moon of the sky-like mind rising.

translated: He saw Gopā, the Śākya maiden, in the middle of the Dharma realm’s palace of light, the assembly hall of the bodhisattvas, seated on a lion throne in the center of a lotus of precious gems that reflected the abodes of all bodhisattvas, surrounded by 84,000 women, all of whom were born into royal families, had previously planted roots of virtue in the company of bodhisattvas, had been gathered by the bodhisattva through the practice of generosity, had spoken to him with gentle and sweet words, had been gathered by the bodhisattva through his happiness in facing omniscience, had been well gathered by the bodhisattva through his attainment of the same purpose as the buddhas and bodhisattvas, had been well taken care of by the bodhisattva through his practice of great compassion toward his wife and children, had been purified by the bodhisattva through his practice of great love toward his own wife, and had been ripened by the bodhisattva through his inconceivable skill in means in the past.

translated: All of those eighty-four thousand women were irreversible from highest, complete enlightenment. They had entered the way of the perfections of the bodhisattvas. Their minds were the lamp of the orb of the sun of wisdom.

translated: For each hair, in each pore, a hair grew, blue like the color of lapis lazuli, curling to the right, well-rounded, well-arranged, well-established.

original: ūrdhvāṅgaromā ca sa kumāro'bhūdavinivartanīyaromā apratyudāvartanīyaromā asaṃsṛṣṭaromā /
analyzed: ūrdhva aṅga romā ca sa kumāraḥ bhūt a vinivartanīya romā a pratyudāvartanīya romā a saṃsṛṣṭa romā
translated: That prince had hair on the upper part of his body, with hair that was irreversible, hair that did not turn back, hair that was not mixed.

analyzed: indranīla varṇa keśa tā mahāpuruṣa lakṣaṇa pratilabdhaḥ
translated: He attained the great man's mark of hair the color of sapphires.

analyzed: sa kumāraḥ bhūt
translated: That prince was born.

original: tasya nīlāḥ keśā abhūvan vairocanamaṇiratnanīlavarṇanirbhāsāḥ snigdhā mṛdavaḥ sukuñcitāḥ pradakṣiṇāvartakuṇḍalinaḥ sujātamūlā anuddhatāḥ niṣpīḍitā asaṃlulitāḥ samasadṛśasthānasaṃsthitāḥ /
analyzed: tasya nīlāḥ keśāḥ abhūvan vairocana maṇi ratna nīla varṇa nirbhāsāḥ snigdhāḥ mṛdavaḥ su kuñcitāḥ pradakṣiṇa āvarta kuṇḍalinaḥ sujāta mūlāḥ anuddhatāḥ niṣpīḍitāḥ a saṃlulitāḥ sama sadṛśa sthāna saṃsthitāḥ
translated: His hair was blue, shining with the color of the vaiḍūrya jewel, glossy, soft, well-curled, curling to the right, well-grown at the roots, not raised, pressed down, not tangled, evenly and properly arranged.

original: nyagrodhaparimaṇḍalatāmahāpuruṣalakṣaṇapratilabdhaḥ sa khalu punaḥ tejodhipatī rājakumāro'bhūt samantabhadraparimaṇḍalaḥ samantabhadraḥ samantaprāsādikaḥ
analyzed: nyagrodha parimaṇḍala tā mahāpuruṣa lakṣaṇa pratilabdhaḥ sa khalu punar tejaḥ adhipatiḥ rāja kumāraḥ bhūt samantabhadra parimaṇḍalaḥ samantabhadraḥ samanta prāsādikaḥ
translated: He had attained the mark of a great being, the circular shape of a banyan tree. That Prince Tejovahana was perfectly circular, perfectly good, and perfectly pleasing on all sides.

analyzed: sa
translated: He was a delightful and beautiful sight to behold, even from the front.

original: pṛṣṭhato'pi dakṣiṇato'pi vāmato'pi gacchannapi tiṣṭhannapi niṣaṇṇo'pi bhāṣamāṇo'pi tūṣṇībhūto'pi atṛptikaramanāpacārudarśano'bhut /
analyzed: pṛṣṭhatas api dakṣiṇatas api vāmatas api gacchan api tiṣṭhan api niṣaṇṇaḥ api bhāṣamāṇaḥ api tūṣṇībhūtaḥ api a tṛpti kara manāpa cāru darśana ubhut
translated: Whether walking, standing, sitting, speaking, or silent, he was a delightful and beautiful sight to behold, even from the back, the right, or the left.

original: ebhiḥ kulaputra dvātriṃśatā mahāpuruṣalakṣaṇaiḥ samalaṃkṛtakāyaḥ sa tejodhipatī rājakumāro'bhūt sarvasattvāpratikūladarśanaḥ sarvābhiprāyaparipūrikadarśanaḥ sarvasattvaratikaradarśanaḥ //
analyzed: ebhiḥ kula putra dvātriṃśatā mahāpuruṣa lakṣaṇaiḥ samalaṃkṛta kāyaḥ sa tejaḥ adhipatiḥ rāja kumāraḥ bhūt sarva sattva a pratikūla darśanaḥ sarva abhiprāya paripūrika darśanaḥ sarva sattva ratikara darśanaḥ
translated: With a body adorned with these thirty-two marks of a great being, Prince Tejovahana was a sight that no being could ever have enough of, and he fulfilled all wishes, bringing joy to all beings.

original: sa khalu kulaputra tejodhipatī rājakumāro'pareṇa samayena pitrābhyanujñāto drumameruśriyo rājadhānyā gandhāṅkuraprabhameghaṃ nāmodyānam /
analyzed: sa khalu kula putra tejaḥ adhipatiḥ rāja kumāra upareṇa samayena pitrā abhyanujñātaḥ druma meru śriyaḥ rājadhānyāḥ gandhāṅkuraprabhamegham nāma udyānam
translated: Then, noble son, at another time, Prince Tejovahana, with his father's permission, went to the pleasure grove called Gandha-ankura-prabha-megha, which was located in the capital city of Druma-meru-shri.

original: tatra bhūmidarśanāya abhiniryayau viṃśatyā kanyāsahasraiḥ sārdhaṃ mahatā puṇyatejautaḥśrīsaubhāgyavikurvitavyūhena naranārīgaṇaiḥ samantādabhinandyamāno jāmbūnadasuvarṇarathamāruhya mahāvajraratnacatuścakraṃ nārāyaṇavajramayadṛḍhākṣayākṣamuttamacandanasupariniṣṭhitapratiṣṭhiteṣaṃ sarvagandhamaṇirājasuvibhaktapañjaraṃ sarvaratnapuṣpasuvicitropaśobhitavyūhaṃ sarvaratnajālasaṃchāditavyūhaṃ mahāmaṇiratnarājavyūhagarbhamadhyapratiṣṭhāpitasiṃhāsanaṃ pañcakanyāśataratnasūtradāmaparigṛhītaṃ gaganāsaktavāyusamajavājāneyāśvasahasrayuktam anupūrvapariṇatacārudarśanena śvetavaidūryamaṇirājamayacchadanena vimalāpramāṇaprabheṇa acintyādbhutasarvaratnaviracanābhaktivinyāsacitrasarvākāravyūhopaśobhitena nīlavaidūryamaṇirājodviddhadaṇḍena mahatā ratnacchatreṇa dhriyatā bahuprāṇiśatasahasraparivṛtadivyamadhuramanojñanirdhoṣaistūryaśatasahasraiḥ pravādyamānaiḥ mahadbhiḥ puṣpameghairabhipravarṣadbhiḥ surabhidivyagandhadhūpaghaṭikāniyutaśatasahasraiḥ pradhūpyamānaiḥ /
analyzed: tatra bhūmi darśanāya abhiniryayau viṃśatyā kanyā sahasraiḥ sārdham mahatā nara nārī gaṇaiḥ samantāt abhinandyamānaḥ jāmbūnada suvarṇa ratham āruhya mahā vajra ratna catur cakram nārāyaṇa vajra maya dṛḍha akṣaya akṣam uttama candana su pariniṣṭhita pratiṣṭhita iṣam sarva gandha maṇi rāja su vibhakta pañjaram sarva ratna puṣpa su vicitra upaśobhita vyūham sarva ratna jāla saṃchādita vyūham mahā maṇi ratna rāja vyūha garbham abhinirvṛttam
translated: For the sake of seeing the ground, he set out with twenty thousand maidens, surrounded by a great multitude of men and women who were praising him with great merit, splendor, and the display of good fortune, riding in a chariot made of Jāmbū River gold, with a great vajra jewel, four wheels, an axle made of Nārāyaṇa vajra, firm and indestructible, well-established on the best sandalwood, a cage made of the king of all fragrant jewels, well-arranged, adorned with the display of all jewel flowers, covered with a display of nets of all jewels, with a lion throne in the middle, established in the womb of the display of the king of great jewel mountains, surrounded by garlands of threads of five hundred jewels, yoked to a thousand horses that were as swift as the wind in the sky, with a beautiful and pure white canopy made of the king of lapis lazuli jewels, with immeasurable pure light, adorned with an inconceivable and marvelous arrangement of all jewels, with a display of all aspects and colors, blue

original: tasya tathā vrajato'ṣṭavartmā mārgaḥ samavasthiṣata nimnonnatavigato'pagataśarkarakaṭhallotsado jātarūparajatasarvaratnarājadhātusaṃcitabhūmitalapratiṣṭhānaḥ suvarṇavālikāsaṃstīrṇo vicitraratnapuṣpābhikīrṇaḥ ubhayato ratnavṛkṣapaṅktisamalaṃkṛtavicitraratnavedikāparivṛtaḥ /
analyzed: tasya tathā vrajatā uṣṭa vartmā mārgaḥ samavasthiṣata nimna unnata vigata upagata śarkara kaṭhalla utsadaḥ jātarūpa rajata sarva ratna rājadhātu saṃcita bhūmi tala pratiṣṭhānaḥ suvarṇa vālikā saṃstīrṇaḥ vicitra ratna puṣpa abhikīrṇaḥ ubhayatas ratna vṛkṣa paṅkti samalaṃkṛta vicitra ratna vedikā parivṛtaḥ
translated: As he was going, an eight-lane road appeared, free from low and high, free from gravel and pebbles, its surface established with gold, silver, and all precious substances, strewn with golden sand, strewn with various precious flowers, adorned on both sides with rows of precious trees, surrounded by various precious altars,

original: upari ratnakiṅkiṇījālasaṃchanno vividharatnavitatapratimaṇḍito'nekaratnadhvajapatākāpaṭṭaśatasahasrābhipralambitopaśobhitavyūhaḥ ubhayato nānāratnavyomakapaṅktiviracitavyūhaḥ🔽tatra keṣucidratnavyomakeṣu vividharatnaparipūrṇāni ratnabhājanāni sthāpitānyabhūvan yācanakasaṃghapratipādanakārtham /
analyzed: upari ratna kiṅkiṇī jāla saṃchannaḥ vividha ratna vitata pratimaṇḍita uneka ratna dhvaja patākā paṭṭa śata sahasra abhipralambita upaśobhita vyūhaḥ ubhayatas nānā ratna vyomaka paṅkti viracita vyūhaḥ  tatra keṣucid ratna vyomakeṣu vividha ratna paripūrṇāni ratna bhājanāni sthāpitāni abhūvan yācanaka saṃgha pratipādanaka artham
translated: above covered with a net of precious bells, adorned with various precious canopies, beautified by hanging hundreds of thousands of precious banners, flags, and streamers,🔽In some of those precious sky-covers, precious vessels filled with various precious substances were placed for the sake of giving to the assembly of beggars.

analyzed: keṣucid vyomakeṣu sarva ratna ābharaṇa vidhayaḥ sthāpitāḥ alaṃkāra arthinām yācakānām alaṃkaraṇa artham
translated: In some sky-covers, all kinds of precious ornaments were placed for the sake of adorning those who came seeking ornaments.

analyzed: keṣucid vyomakeṣu cintāmaṇi ratnāni sthāpitāni sarva sattvānām sarva abhiprāya paripūraṇa artham
translated: In some sky-points, wish-fulfilling jewel gems were placed for the fulfillment of all beings' every wish.

analyzed: keṣucid vyomakeṣu sarva ākāra vividha anna pāna rasa paripūrṇāni bhojanāni sthāpitāni
translated: In some sky-points, various kinds of food and drink were placed, filled with all kinds of flavors,

analyzed: yasya yena arthaḥ tasya tam pratipādana artham
translated: for the purpose of providing whatever anyone needed.

analyzed: keṣucid vyomakeṣu sarva ākāra parama svādu manojña varṇa gandha rasa sparśāḥ divya bhakta vidhayaḥ sthāpitāḥ
translated: In some sky-points, divine dishes of the highest taste, beautiful color, fragrance, flavor, and texture were placed.

analyzed: keṣucid vyomakeṣu vicitra rasa āsvāda divya sarva phala vidhayaḥ sthāpitāḥ
translated: In some sky-points, divine dishes of all kinds of fruits with various tastes and flavors were placed.

original: keṣucidvyomakeṣu vividhojjvalavicitraraṅgaraktāni nānācitrabhaktivinyāsavirājitāni paramamahārhāṇi sūkṣmāṇi sukumārakāntavarṇāni divyavastrakoṭīśatasahasrāṇi sthāpitāni vastrārthināṃ yathābhiprāyaparibhogārtham /
analyzed: keṣucid vyomakeṣu vividha ujjvala vicitra raṅga raktāni nānā citra bhakti vinyāsa virājitāni parama mahārhāṇi sūkṣmāṇi sukumāra kānta varṇāni divya vastra koṭī śata sahasrāṇi sthāpitāni vastra arthinām yathā abhiprāya paribhoga artham
translated: In some sky-points, hundreds of thousands of millions of divine garments of various bright and variegated colors, adorned with various beautiful patterns, extremely valuable, fine, soft, and lovely, were placed for the enjoyment of those who needed garments, according to their wishes.

original: keṣucidvyomakeṣu sarvākāravividhadivyamanojñavarṇagandhāḥ sarvagandhavidhayaḥ sthāpitā abhuvan vilepanārthināṃ yathābhiprāyaparibhogārtham /
analyzed: keṣucid vyomakeṣu sarva ākāra vividha divya manojña varṇa gandhāḥ sarva gandha vidhayaḥ sthāpitāḥ abhuvan vilepana arthinām yathā abhiprāya paribhoga artham
translated: In some of the sky-terraces were placed all kinds of divine, beautiful, and pleasant colors and fragrances, all kinds of perfumes, for the enjoyment of those who desired ointments, according to their wishes.

original: keṣucidvyomakeṣu sarvopakaraṇarāśayaḥ sthāpitā abhūvan sattvānāṃ yathāśayābhiprāyaparibhogārtham /
analyzed: keṣucid vyomakeṣu sarva upakaraṇa rāśayaḥ sthāpitāḥ abhūvan sattvānām yathā āśaya abhiprāya paribhoga artham
translated: In some of the sky-terraces were placed heaps of all kinds of implements, for the enjoyment of beings according to their wishes and intentions.

original: keṣucidvyomakeṣu nāryo'bhirūpāḥ prāsādikā darśanīyā vividhacārurūpaveśā vicitramanojñavastrasaṃdhitāḥ sarvābharaṇasvalaṃkṛtā vividhavilepanabhaktivinyāsapratimaṇḍitopaśobhitaśarīrāḥ sarvastrīśilpamāyākalāvidhijñāḥ sthāpitā abhūvan //
analyzed: keṣucid vyomakeṣu nāryaḥ abhirūpāḥ prāsādikāḥ darśanīyāḥ vividha cāru rūpa veśāḥ vicitra manojña vastra saṃdhitāḥ sarva ābharaṇa su alaṃkṛtāḥ vividha vilepana bhakti vinyāsa pratimaṇḍita upaśobhita śarīrāḥ sarva strī śilpa māyā kalā vidhi jñāḥ sthāpitāḥ abhūvan
translated: In some of the sky-terraces were placed beautiful, pleasing, and attractive women, adorned with various beautiful garments, all adorned with ornaments, their bodies beautified with various ointments and decorations, skilled in all the arts, wiles, and techniques of women.

original: tena khalu punaḥ samayena tasyāmeva drumameruśriyāṃ rājadhānyāṃ sudarśanā nāma agragaṇikābhūdrājaparibhogyā /
analyzed: tena khalu punar samayena tasyām eva drumameruśriyām rājadhānyām sudarśanā nāma agra gaṇikā abhūt rāja paribhogyā
translated: At that time, in that very capital city of Drumameruśrī, there was a chief courtesan named Sudarśanā, who was enjoyed by the king.

original: tasyāḥ sucalitaratiprabhāsaśrīrnāma dārikābhūdabhirūpā prāsādikā darśanīyā nātidīrghā nātihrasvā nātisthūlā nātikṛśā nātigaurā nātiśyāmā abhinīlanetrā abhinīlakeśī abhirāmavaktrā brahmasvarā madhurapriyavādinī prājñā sarvakalāvidhijñā sarvaśāstrakovidā dakṣā analasā sagauravā saprasādā maitracittā apratighātabahulā atṛptikaramanāpadarśanā mandarāgadoṣamohā hryapatrāpyasaṃpannā mārdavā ṛjvī aśāṭyā amāyā vinītā /
analyzed: tasyāḥ sucalitaratiprabhāsaśrīḥ nāma dārikā abhūt abhirūpā prāsādikā darśanīyā na ati dīrghā na ati hrasvā na ati sthūlā na ati kṛśā na ati gaurā na ati śyāmā abhinīla netrā abhinīla keśī abhirāma vaktrā brahma svarā madhura priya vādinī prājñā sarva kalā vidhi jñā sarva śāstra kovidā dakṣā analasā sa gauravā sa prasādā maitra cittā a pratighāta bahulā atṛpti kara manāpa darśanā manda rāga doṣa mohā hrī apatrāpya saṃpannā mārdavā
translated: She had a daughter named Sucalitaratiprabhāsaśrī, who was beautiful, pleasing to the eye, and lovely to behold. She was not too tall or too short, not too fat or too thin, not too fair or too dark. Her eyes were very dark, her hair was very dark, her face was charming, her voice was like Brahmā's, she spoke sweetly and pleasantly, she was wise, she knew the rules of all arts, she was skilled in all scriptures, she was diligent, not lazy, respectful, serene, had a loving mind, was full of patience, her appearance was delightful to behold, her desire, hatred, and ignorance were weak, she was modest and conscientious, gentle, honest, guileless, and humble.

original: sā mātrā sārdhamanekakanyāparivṛtā ratnarathābhirūḍhā drumameruśriyo rājadhānyā niṣkramya tejodhipate rājakumārasya purataḥ tejodhipatiṃ rājakumāraṃ parimārgayamāṇā rājājñāniyogādgacchantī tejodhipatiṃ rājakumāraṃ dṛṣṭvā tīvraṃ rāgacittamutpādayāmāsa /
analyzed: sā mātrā sārdham aneka kanyā parivṛtā ratna ratha abhirūḍhā druma meruśriyaḥ rājadhānyāḥ niṣkramya tejodhipate rāja kumārasya puratas tejodhipatim rāja kumāram parimārgayamāṇā rāja ājñā niyogāt gacchantī tejodhipatim rāja kumāram dṛṣṭvā tīvram rāga cittam utpādayāmāsa
translated: She, together with her mother and surrounded by many maidens, riding in a jeweled chariot, left the royal capital Drumameru and went in front of Prince Tejovaṃśa, looking for Prince Tejovaṃśa, by the order of the king's command. Seeing Prince Tejovaṃśa, she gave rise to a mind of intense passion.

original: sā tejodhipate rājakumārasyāntike'dhimātraṃ saṃjātasnehānubaddhā asvatantracittā mātaraṃ sudarśanāmetadavocatyatkhalu amba jānīyāḥsacenmāṃ tejodhipate rājakumārasya na dāsyasi /
analyzed: sā tejodhipate rāja kumārasya antika idhi mātram saṃjāta sneha anubaddhā asvatantra cittā mātaram sudarśanām etat avocat yat khalu amba jānīyāḥ saced mām tejodhipate rāja kumārasya na dāsyasi
translated: She, having generated a strong affection for Prince Tejovaṃśa, and her mind being not independent, said this to her mother Sudarśanā: “Mother, you should know that if you do not give me to Prince Tejovaṃśa,

analyzed: maraṇam vā upagamiṣyāmi maraṇa mātrakam vā duḥkham
translated: I will either die or experience suffering equal to death.”

analyzed: sā prāhama evam dārike cetanām utpādaya
translated: She said, “Do not think like that, daughter.

analyzed: eṣa hi kumāraḥ cakravarti lakṣaṇa samanvāgataḥ
translated: For this prince possesses the marks of a universal monarch.

analyzed: sthānam etat vidyate yat eṣa pituḥ dhanapateḥ atyayāt cakravarti rājyam adhyāvasiṣyati
translated: It is possible that after the passing of his father Dhanapaṭi, he will rule the universal monarchy.

analyzed: sa rājā bhaviṣyati cakravartī
translated: He will become a universal monarch.

analyzed: tatas asya strī ratnam prādurbhaviṣyati vaihāyasaṃgamam
translated: Then his jewel of a wife will appear, coming through the sky.

original: api tu khalu punardārike gaṇikā vayaṃ sarvalokaratikarāḥ /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar dārike gaṇikāḥ vayam sarva loka rati karāḥ
translated: Moreover, daughter, we are courtesans, bringing pleasure to the entire world.

analyzed: na vayam eka sattvam pratiniyamena yāvajjīvam upatiṣṭhāmahe
translated: We do not serve one being exclusively for as long as we live.

original: vayaṃ hi rājño dhanapaterājñayā tejodhipateḥ kumārasyopasthānāya niryātāḥ /
analyzed: vayam hi rājñaḥ dhanapateḥ ājñayā tejodhipateḥ kumārasya upasthānāya niryātāḥ
translated: We have been sent forth to serve Prince Tejovaṃśa by the command of King Dhanapaṭi.

analyzed: mā enām cetanām dṛḍhīkuruṣva
translated: Do not strengthen this resolve of yours.”

analyzed: durlabham etat sthānam
translated: This place is difficult to obtain.

original: tena ceha samayena sūryagātrapravaro nāma tathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho loka udapādi vidyācaraṇasaṃpannaḥ sugato lokavidanuttaraḥ puruṣadamyasārathiḥ śāstā devamanuṣyāṇāṃ buddho bhagavān /
analyzed: tena ca iha samayena sūryagātrapravaraḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ loke udapādi vidyā caraṇa saṃpannaḥ sugataḥ loka vid anuttaraḥ puruṣa damya sārathiḥ śāstā deva manuṣyāṇām buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: At that time, there appeared in the world a Tathāgata, an Arhat, a Perfectly Enlightened One, perfect in knowledge and conduct, a Sugata, a knower of the world, an unsurpassed trainer of those who can be trained, a teacher of gods and humans, a Buddha, a Blessed One named Sūryagaत्रप्रवर.

analyzed: tasya khalu punar gandha aṅkura śikhara prabha meghasya udyānasya antare dharmameghodgataprabhāsaḥ nāma bodhimaṇḍaḥ bhūt
translated: In the middle of that very garden called Gandhāṅkuraśikharaprabhamegh, there was a Bodhi tree called Dharmameghodgataप्रभास.

original: tatra sa bhagavān sūryagātrapravarastathāgataḥ prathamasaptāhābhisaṃbuddho vyāhārṣīt /
analyzed: tatra sa bhagavān sūryagātrapravaraḥ tathāgataḥ prathama saptāha abhisaṃbuddhaḥ vyāhārṣīt
translated: There, the Blessed One Sūryagaत्रप्रवर, the Tathāgata, attained enlightenment during the first week.

original: sa tayā dārikayā rathābhirūḍhayaiva pracalāyamānayā svapnāntare dṛṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: sa tayā dārikayā ratha abhirūḍhayā eva pracalāyamānayā svapna antare dṛṣṭaḥ

analyzed: sa prāha su calita rati prabhāsa śriyā dārikayā iti
translated: He replied, By the girl Sucalitaratiprabhasri.

original: atha khalu rājā dhanapatirbuddhotpādaśravaṇena mahānidhānapratilābhasaṃjñī sudurlabhabuddharatnaparilābhasaṃjñī tathāgatadarśane sarvadurgatiprapātabhayavinivartanasaṃjñī sarvakleśavyādhipraśamanamahāvaidyarājapratilābhasaṃjñī sarvasaṃsāraduḥkhaparimocakasaṃjñī atyantayogakṣemapratiṣṭhāpakasaṃjñī vitimirajñānālokadarśakasaṃjñī avidyāndhakāravidhvaṃsanamaholkāprādurbhāvasaṃjñī anāyakasya lokasya dharmanayavināyakapratilābhasaṃjñī apariṇāyakasya sarvajñatāyānapariṇāyakasamutpādasaṃjñī mahāprītiprasādaprāmodyapratilabdho buddhotpādaṃ śrutvā kṣatriyabrāhmaṇanaigamajanapadāmātyapurohitakumārakoṭṭarājāno dauvārikapārṣadyāṃśca saṃnipātya buddhotpādanandaśabdāvedinastejodhipateḥ kumārasya tadrājyaṃ dharmācchādaṃ prādāt /
analyzed: atha khalu rājā dhanapatiḥ buddha utpāda śravaṇena mahā nidhāna pratilābha saṃjñī su durlabha buddha ratna parilābha saṃjñī tathāgata darśane sarva durgati prapāta bhaya vinivartana saṃjñī sarva kleśa vyādhi praśamana mahā vaidya rāja pratilābha saṃjñī sarva saṃsāra duḥkha parimocaka saṃjñī atyanta yogakṣema pratiṣṭhāpaka saṃjñī vitimira jñāna āloka darśaka saṃjñī avidyā andhakāra vidhvaṃsana mahā ulkā prādurbhāva saṃjñī anāyakas
translated: Then, King Dhanapati, hearing of the Buddha's appearance, thinking of it as the acquisition of a great treasure, thinking of it as the acquisition of the rare jewel of the Buddha, thinking of seeing the Tathagata as the turning away from all the dangers of falling into bad destinies, thinking of it as the acquisition of the great physician king who alleviates all the afflictions and illnesses, thinking of it as the liberator from all the sufferings of samsara, thinking of it as the establishment in the highest union of yoga and peace, thinking of it as the manifestation of the great torch that destroys the darkness of ignorance, thinking of it as the appearance of the great light of knowledge that dispels the darkness, thinking of it as the acquisition of the guide in the path of Dharma for the world that has no leader, thinking of it as the arising of the guide to the vehicle of omniscience for the one who has no guide, having attained great joy, faith, and delight, having heard of the appearance of the Buddha, having assembled the kshatriyas, Brahmins, city-dwellers, country-people, ministers, priests, princes, and vassal kings, doorkeepers, and courtiers, having announced the joyful news of the Buddha's appearance, to Prince Tejo'dhipati, his kingdom,

original: sa taṃ kumāraṃ rājye'bhiṣicya sārdhaṃ daśabhiḥ prāṇisahasrairyena bhagavān sūryagātrapravarastathāgatastenopajagāma /
analyzed: sa tam kumāram rājye abhiṣicya sārdham daśabhiḥ prāṇi sahasraiḥ yena bhagavān sūryagātra pravaraḥ tathāgataḥ tena upajagāma
translated: He consecrated the prince in the kingdom and, together with ten thousand beings, went to where the Blessed One, the Tathagata Suryagatrapravara, was.

original: upetya tasya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasābhivandya taṃ bhagavantamanekaśatasahasrakṛtvaḥ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya tasya bhagavataḥ purastānnyaṣīdat sārdhaṃ svakena parivāreṇa //
analyzed: upetya tasya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā abhivandya tam bhagavantam aneka śata sahasra kṛtvas pradakṣiṇīkṛtya tasya bhagavataḥ purastāt nyaṣīdat sārdham svakena parivāreṇa
translated: Having approached, he bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One, circumambulated the Blessed One many hundreds of thousands of times, and sat down in front of the Blessed One together with his retinue.

original: atha khalu kulaputra sa bhagavān sūryagātrapravarastathāgato dhanapatiṃ rājānaṃ sarvāvacca parṣanmaṇḍalamavalokya tasyāṃ velāyāmūrṇākośātsarvajagaccittapradīpaṃ nāma raśmiṃ prāmuñcat /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra sa bhagavān sūrya gātra pravaraḥ tathāgataḥ dhanapatim rājānam sarvāvat ca parṣad maṇḍalam avalokya tasyām velāyām ūrṇā kośāt sarvajagat citta pradīpam nāma raśmim prāmuñcat
translated: Then, noble son, the Blessed One, the Tathagata Suryagatrapravara, looked at King Dhanapati and the entire assembly, and at that time emitted a ray called Illuminating the Minds of All Beings from his forehead.

original: sā daśasu dikṣu sarvalokadhātūnavabhāsya sarvalokendrānabhimukhaṃ parisaṃsthāpya acintyāni buddhavikurvitāni saṃdarśya buddhavainayikānāṃ sattvānāmāśayān viśodhya tasyāṃ velāyāmacintyena buddhādhipateyena sarvalokābhyudgatena buddhakāyena sarvasvarāṅgasāgarasaṃprayuktena buddhaghoṣeṇa sarvadharmavitimirārthapradīpaṃ nāma dhāraṇīmukhaṃ saṃprakāśayāmāsa buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamadhāraṇīmukhaparivāram /
analyzed: sā daśasu dikṣu sarva lokadhātūn avabhāsya sarva loka indrān abhimukham parisaṃsthāpya acintyāni buddha vikurvitāni saṃdarśya buddha vainayikānām sattvānām āśayān viśodhya tasyām velāyām acintyena buddha ādhipateyena sarva loka abhyudgatena buddha kāyena sarva svara aṅga sāgara saṃprayuktena buddha ghoṣeṇa sarva dharma vitimira artha pradīpam nāma dhāraṇīmukham saṃprakāśayāmāsa buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ sama dhāraṇīmukha parivāram
translated: She illuminated all the world systems in the ten directions, and then, standing in the presence of all the lords of the world, she revealed inconceivable manifestations of the Buddha, purified the aspirations of beings who were to be guided by the Buddha, and at that time, by the inconceivable power of the Buddha, with a Buddha body that rose above all worlds, with a Buddha voice endowed with all the oceans of vocal qualities, she revealed the door of the dhāraṇī called The Lamp of the Meaning of the Removal of Mental Darkness with regard to all phenomena, which was accompanied by the door of dhāraṇī called The Dust of the Buddha-fields.

original: atha rājño dhanapatestaddhāraṇīmukhaṃ śrutvā sarvadharmeṣu mahān dharmāvabhāsaḥ prādurabhūt /
analyzed: atha rājñaḥ dhanapateḥ tat dhāraṇī mukham śrutvā sarva dharmeṣu mahān dharma avabhāsaḥ prādurabhūt
translated: Then, when King Dhanapati heard that door of dhāraṇī, a great illumination of the Dharma appeared to him with regard to all phenomena.

original: tasyāṃ ca parṣadi jambudvīpaparamāṇurajaḥsamānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ sarvadharmavitimirārthapradīpāyā dhāraṇyāḥ pratilambho'bhūt /
analyzed: tasyām ca parṣadi jambudvīpa paramāṇu rajaḥ samānām bodhisattvānām sarva dharma vitimira artha pradīpāyāḥ dhāraṇyāḥ pratilambhaḥ bhūt
translated: And in that assembly, bodhisattvas as numerous as the atoms in Jambudvīpa attained the dhāraṇī called The Lamp of the Meaning of the Removal of Mental Darkness with regard to all phenomena.

analyzed: ṣaṣṭeḥ ca prāṇi niyutānām an upādāya āsravebhyaḥ cittāni vimuktāni
translated: And the minds of sixty quintillions of beings were liberated from defilements without further appropriation.

original: daśānāṃ ca prāṇisahasrāṇāṃ virajo vigatamalaṃ dharmeṣu dharmacakṣurviśuddham /
analyzed: daśānām ca prāṇi sahasrāṇām virajaḥ vigata malam dharmeṣu dharma cakṣuḥ viśuddham
translated: And ten thousand beings attained the stainless and immaculate Dharma eye that sees phenomena.

analyzed: aparimāṇānām an utpanna pūrvam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpannam
translated: And an immeasurable number of beings who had not previously given rise to the mind set on unsurpassed perfect enlightenment gave rise to it.

original: daśasu dikṣu acintyabuddhavikurvitasaṃdarśanenānantamadhyaḥ sattvadhāturvinayamagamāt tribhiryānaiḥ //🔽rājñaśca dhanapatermahādharmāvabhāsapratilabdhasya etadabhavatna śakyamagāramadhyāvasatā imā evaṃrūpā dharmā adhimoktum /
analyzed: daśasu dikṣu acintya buddha vikurvita saṃdarśanena ananta madhyaḥ sattvadhātuḥ vinayam agamāt tribhiḥ yānaiḥ  rājñaḥ ca dhanapateḥ mahā dharma avabhāsa pratilabdhasya etat abhavat na śakyam agāram adhyāvasatā imāḥ evaṃrūpāḥ dharmāḥ adhimoktum
translated: And the infinite and immeasurable realm of beings in the ten directions was guided by the three vehicles through the inconceivable display of the Buddha's miracles.

analyzed: evaṃrūpam ca jñānam niṣpādayitum
translated: Then King Dhanapati, having attained great illumination of the Dharma, thought, It is not possible to realize such teachings and attain such knowledge while living in a household.

analyzed: yat nu aham bhagavatā untike pravrājayeyam
translated: Therefore, I should go forth in the presence of the Blessed One.

original: atha khalu rājā dhanapatistaṃ bhagavantametadavocatlabheyāhaṃ bhagavato'ntike pravrajyāmupasaṃpadaṃ bhikṣubhāvam /
analyzed: atha khalu rājā dhanapatiḥ tam bhagavantam etat avocat labheya aham bhagavataḥ ntike pravrajyām upasaṃpadam bhikṣu bhāvam
translated: Then King Dhanapati said to the Blessed One, Blessed One, may I receive the going forth, full ordination, and state of a monk in the presence of the Blessed One?

analyzed: āhayasya idānīm mahā rāja kālam manyase
translated: The Blessed One said, Great King, if you think the time is right.

original: atha khalu rājā dhanapatiḥ sūryagātrapravarasya tathāgatasyāntike prāvrajat sārdhaṃ daśabhiḥ prāṇisahasraiḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu rājā dhanapatiḥ sūryagātrapravarasya tathāgatasya antike prāvrajat sārdham daśabhiḥ prāṇi sahasraiḥ
translated: Then King Dhanapati went forth into the presence of the Tathāgata Sūryagaत्रप्रवर, together with ten thousand living beings.

original: tena acireṇa pravrajitena sarvadharmavitimirārthapradīpaṃ dhāraṇīmukhaṃ saparivāraṃ niṣpāditaṃ bhāvitam /
analyzed: tena acireṇa pravrajitena sarva dharma vitimira artha pradīpam dhāraṇī mukham sa parivāram niṣpāditam bhāvitam
translated: Soon after going forth, he accomplished and cultivated the dhāraṇī gateway called The Lamp for the Meaning of the Removal of All Dharmas, together with its retinue.

analyzed: tāvanti eva ca samādhi mukhāni pratilabdhāni
translated: He also attained as many samādhi gateways.

analyzed: daśa ca bodhisattva abhijñāḥ pratilabdhā
translated: And he attained the ten higher knowledges of a bodhisattva.

analyzed: ananta madhyam ca pratisaṃvid naya sāgarām avatīrṇaḥ
translated: He entered the ocean of the system of infinite and immeasurable discernment.

original: asaṅgagocarā ca nāma kāyapariśuddhiḥ daśadiktathāgatopasaṃkramaṇeṣu pratilabdhā /
analyzed: asaṅgagocarā ca nāma kāya pariśuddhiḥ daśa diś tathāgata upasaṃkramaṇeṣu pratilabdhā
translated: And he attained the purification of the body called the sphere of unobstructed activity, in going to the tathāgatas of the ten directions.

original: sa tasya bhagavato dharmacakraṃ pratīcchitavān saṃdhāritavān /
analyzed: sa tasya bhagavataḥ dharmacakram pratīcchitavān saṃdhāritavān
translated: He received and upheld the wheel of the Dharma of that Bhagavān.

analyzed: kathāpuruṣa tvam ca kārayāmāsa
translated: He became a man of discourse.

analyzed: mahā dharma bhāṇaka tvam ca akarot
translated: He became a great Dharma preacher.

analyzed: śāsana parigraham ca akārṣīt
translated: He took up the teaching.

original: abhijñāpratilābhabalena ca sarvāvatīṃ lokadhātuṃ spharitvā yathāśayānāṃ sattvānāṃ kāyaṃ saṃdarśya etaṃ buddhotpādaṃ prabhāvayan tāṃ sarvatathāgatasamudayadharmatāmabhidyotayan tāṃ pūrvayogasaṃpadaṃ saṃprakāśayan taṃ buddhavikurvitaprabhāvaṃ saṃvarṇayamānaḥ śāsanaparigrahamakārṣīt //
analyzed: abhijñā pratilābha balena ca sarvāvatīm lokadhātum spharitvā yathā āśayānām sattvānām kāyam saṃdarśya etam buddha utpādam prabhāvayan tām sarva tathāgata samudaya dharmatām abhidyotayan tām pūrva yoga saṃpadam saṃprakāśayan tam buddha vikurvita prabhāvam saṃvarṇayamānaḥ śāsana parigraham akārṣīt
translated: And by the power of attaining the superknowledges, he pervaded the entire world, manifested his body to beings according to their inclinations, proclaimed this appearance of the Buddha, revealed the nature of the assembly of all the Tathagatas, explained his own perfection of past practice, and praised the power of the Buddha's miracles, and thus he undertook the task of preserving the teaching.

original: tejodhipatinā ca rājaputreṇa tatraiva divase pūrṇāyāṃ pūrṇamāsyāṃ sapta ratnāni pratilabdhāni /
analyzed: tejodhipatinā ca rājaputreṇa tatra eva divase pūrṇāyām pūrṇamāsyām sapta ratnāni pratilabdhāni
translated: And on that very day, on the full moon, the prince Tेजोधिपति obtained the seven treasures.

original: tasyopariprāsādatalagatasya strīgaṇaparivṛtasya purastādapratihatavegaṃ nāma śatasahasrāraṃ sarvaratnasamalaṃkṛtaṃ divyaṃ jāmbūnadasuvarṇamayaṃ samantaprabhaṃ sarvākāravaropetaṃ mahācakraratnaṃ prādurabhūt /🔽vajraratnagiritejaśca nāma mahāhastiratnaṃ prādurabhūt /
analyzed: tasya upari prāsāda tala gatasya strī gaṇa parivṛtasya purastāt apratihatavegam nāma śata sahasra aram sarva ratna samalaṃkṛtam divyam jāmbūnada suvarṇa mayam samanta prabham sarva ākāra vara upetam mahā cakra ratnam prādurabhūt  vajraratna giri tejaḥ ca nāma mahā hasti ratnam prādurabhūt
translated: While he was on the top floor of the palace, surrounded by the women, in front of him appeared the great wheel treasure, with a hundred thousand spokes, unimpeded speed, adorned with all jewels, divine, made of Jambunada gold, radiant on all sides, endowed with all supreme aspects.🔽And the great elephant treasure appeared, named Vajra-Jewel-Mountain-Radiance.

analyzed: nīlagiri anilavegam ca nāma aśva ratnam prādurabhavat
translated: And the horse treasure appeared, named Blue-Mountain-Wind-Speed.

analyzed: ādityagarbha prabha megharājam ca nāma mahā maṇi ratnam prādurabhavat
translated: The great precious jewel called “King of Clouds with the Essence of the Sun” appeared.

original: sā ca sucalitaratiprabhāsaśrī dārikā strīratnaṃ prādurabhavat /
analyzed: sā ca su calita rati prabhāsa śrī dārikā strī ratnam prādurabhavat
translated: The girl Sudhana­ratiprabhāsaśrī appeared as the precious woman.

analyzed: prabhūtaghanaskandham ca nāma gṛhapati ratnam prādurabhavat
translated: The householder called Prabhūta­ghana­skandha appeared as the precious householder.

original: vimalanetraṃ ca nāma pariṇāyakaratnaṃ saptamaṃ prādurabhavat /
analyzed: vimalanetram ca nāma pariṇāyaka ratnam saptamam prādurabhavat
translated: The precious counselor called Vimalanetra appeared as the seventh.

original: sa saptaratnasamanvāgato rājābhavaccakravartī caturdvīpeśvaro dhārmiko dharmarājo vijitāvī janapadasthāmavīryaprāptaḥ /
analyzed: sa sapta ratna samanvāgataḥ rājā abhavat cakravartī catur dvīpa īśvaraḥ dhārmikaḥ dharma rājaḥ vijitāvī janapada sthāma vīrya prāptaḥ
translated: The king who possessed the seven treasures became a universal monarch, a lord of the four continents, a righteous Dharma king, a conqueror, one who obtains stability and power in the country.

original: pūrṇaṃ khalu punarasya sahasraṃ putrāṇāmabhūcchūrāṇāṃ vīrāṇāṃ varāṅgarūpiṇāṃ parasainyapramardakānām /
analyzed: pūrṇam khalu punar asya sahasram putrāṇām abhūt śūrāṇām vīrāṇām vara aṅga rūpiṇām para sainya pramardakānām
translated: He had a full thousand sons, who were brave, heroic, of the highest physical beauty, and crushers of enemy armies.

original: sa imāṃ mahāpṛthivīṃ sasāgaragiriparyantāmakhilāmakaṇṭakāmanītikāmanupadravāmṛddhāṃ sphītāṃ kṣemāṃ subhikṣāṃ ramaṇīyāmākīrṇabahujanamanuṣyāṃ dharmeṇābhinirjitya adhyāvasati sma //
analyzed: saḥ imām mahā pṛthivīm sa sāgara giri paryantām akhilām akaṇṭakām anītikām anupadravām ṛddhām sphītām kṣemām subhikṣām ramaṇīyām ākīrṇa bahu jana manuṣyām dharmeṇa abhinirjitya adhyāvasati sma
translated: He ruled over this great earth, with its oceans and mountains, in its entirety, without any thorns or troubles, in prosperity, abundance, peace, happiness, and plenty, with its people and lands flourishing, having conquered it through the Dharma.

original: sa tasmin jambudvīpe caturaśītirājadhānīsahasreṣu ekaikasyāṃ rājadhānyāṃ pañca vihāraśatāni kārayāmāsa sarvākāravaropetāni sarvopabhogaparibhogopacārasaṃpannāni sarvodyānaprāsādacaṃkramaniryāṇasukhaparibhogyavanarājīvibhūṣitāni /
analyzed: sa tasmin jambudvīpe caturaśīti rājadhānī sahasreṣu ekaikasyām rājadhānyām pañca vihāra śatāni kārayāmāsa sarva ākāra vara upetāni sarva upabhoga paribhoga upacāra saṃpannāni sarva udyāna prāsāda caṃkrama niryāṇa sukha paribhogya vana rājī vibhūṣitāni
translated: In each of those eighty-four thousand royal cities, he had five hundred monasteries built, endowed with all excellent features, complete with all enjoyments and possessions, adorned with groves and pleasure gardens, palaces, promenades, and delightful forests.

analyzed: ekaikasmin ca vihāre tathāgata caityam kārayāmāsa vipula udviddham atyantara aneka ākāra ratna vyūham sarva maṇi ratnarāja vicitram
translated: In each monastery, he built a caitya for the Tathāgata, vast and lofty, adorned with many kinds of jewels, and decorated with all kinds of precious gems.

original: sarvāsu ca tāsu rājadhānīṣu taṃ bhagavantaṃ sūryagātrapravaraṃ tathāgataṃ saparivāramupanimantrayāmāsa nagarapraveśāya /
analyzed: sarvāsu ca tāsu rājadhānīṣu tam bhagavantam sūryagātra pravaram tathāgatam sa parivāram upanimantrayāmāsa nagara praveśāya
translated: In all those royal cities, he invited the Blessed One, the Tathāgata Sūryagātrapravara, together with his retinue, to enter the city.

original: sarvāsu rājadhānīṣu taṃ tathāgataṃ sarvākārayā acintyayā tathāgatapūjayā pūjayan praveśayāmāsa /
analyzed: sarvāsu rājadhānīṣu tam tathāgatam sarvākārayā acintyayā tathāgata pūjayā pūjayan praveśayāmāsa
translated: In all the royal cities, he worshipped the Tathāgata with inconceivable and all-encompassing worship of the Tathāgata, and led him in.

original: sa buddhanagarapraveśaprātihāryavikurvitena apramāṇānāṃ sattvānāṃ kuśalamūlāni saṃjanayamāsa /
analyzed: sa buddha nagara praveśa prātihārya vikurvitena apramāṇānām sattvānām kuśala mūlāni saṃjanayamāsa
translated: By the miraculous display of the Buddha's entry into the city, he generated the roots of virtue in countless beings.

analyzed: tatra aprasanna cittāḥ sattvāḥ prasādam pratyalabhanta
translated: There, beings with displeased minds attained faith.

analyzed: prasanna cittāḥ sattvāḥ buddha darśana prīti vegān vivardhayāmāsuḥ
translated: Beings with faithful minds increased the force of their joy in seeing the Buddha.

analyzed: prīti vega vivardhitāḥ sattvāḥ bodhi āśaya viśuddhim pratyalabhanta
translated: Beings with increased force of joy attained the purity of the intention for enlightenment.

original: bodhyāśayaviśuddhāḥ sattvāḥ mahākaruṇācetanāmutpādayāmāsuḥ /🔽sattvahitapratipannāḥ sattvāḥ sarvabuddhadharmaparyeṣṭyabhiyuktā abhūvan /
analyzed: bodhi āśaya viśuddhāḥ sattvāḥ mahā karuṇā cetanām utpādayāmāsuḥ  sattva hita pratipannāḥ sattvāḥ sarva buddha dharma paryeṣṭi abhiyuktāḥ abhūvan
translated: Beings with pure intention for enlightenment generated the aspiration for great compassion.🔽Beings engaged in benefiting beings became devoted to seeking all the qualities of the Buddha.

analyzed: buddha dharma naya vidhi jñāḥ sattvāḥ sarva dharma svabhāva nidhi aptaye cittam abhinirṇāmayāmāsuḥ
translated: Beings who knew the method of the Buddha's teachings directed their minds to penetrating the nature of all phenomena.

analyzed: dharma samatā avatīrṇāḥ sattvāḥ tri adhva samatā avatārāya cittam abhinirṇāmayāmāsuḥ
translated: Beings who had entered the equality of phenomena directed their minds to entering the equality of the three times.

analyzed: tri adhva jñāna avabhāsa pratilabdhāḥ sattvāḥ sarva buddha paraṃparā vijñaptaye jñāna ālokam avakrāmati sma
translated: Beings who had attained the illumination of the knowledge of the three times entered the light of knowledge for the sake of understanding the succession of all Buddhas.

analyzed: vicitra tathāgata vijñapti avakrāntāḥ sattvāḥ sarva jagat saṃgrahāya cittam abhinirṇāmayāmāsuḥ
translated: Beings who had entered the manifestation of various Tathāgatas directed their minds to gathering all beings.

analyzed: sarva jagat saṃgraha prayuktāḥ sattvāḥ bodhisattva mārga viśuddhaye praṇidhānam utpādayāmāsuḥ
translated: The beings who were engaged in gathering the entire world generated the aspiration for the purification of the bodhisattva path.

analyzed: mārga samatā avatīrṇāḥ sattvāḥ sarva tathāgata dharma cakra abhinirhārāya jñāna ālokam utpādayāmāsuḥ
translated: The beings who had entered the equality of the path generated the light of knowledge in order to accomplish the wheel of the Dharma of all the tathāgatas.

analyzed: dharma sāgara vinaya abhimukhā sattvāḥ sarva kṣetra jāla sva kāya spharaṇa tāyai cittam abhinirṇāmayāmāsuḥ
translated: The beings who were intent on the ocean of Dharma and discipline generated the mind to pervade all the nets of realms with their own bodies.

analyzed: kṣetra samatā avatīrṇāḥ sattvāḥ sarva sattva indriya samudra parijñāyai praṇidhānam akārṣuḥ
translated: The beings who had entered the equality of the realms made the aspiration to fully know the ocean of faculties of all beings.

analyzed: sarva jagat indriya yathā adhimukti vicāra prayuktāḥ sattvāḥ sarvajña tā adhigamāya adhyāśayam viśodhayāmāsuḥ
translated: The beings who were engaged in investigating the faculties and inclinations of the entire world purified their superior intention in order to attain omniscience.

original: ityevaṃrūpāṇāṃ sattvānāmimāmevaṃrūpārthasiddhiṃ saṃpraveśya tejodhipatī rājā sarvāsu rājadhānīṣu taṃ sūryagātrapravaraṃ tathāgataṃ praveśayāmāsa acintyena buddhavikurvitaprātihāryasaṃdarśanena teṣāṃ sattvānāṃ paripākavinayāya //
analyzed: iti evaṃrūpāṇām sattvānām imām evaṃrūpa artha siddhim saṃpraveśya tejodhipatiḥ rājā sarvāsu rājadhānīṣu tam sūryagātrapravaram tathāgatam praveśayāmāsa acintyena buddha vikurvita prātihārya saṃdarśanena teṣām sattvānām paripāka vinayāya
translated: Having thus introduced beings of such kinds to the accomplishment of such kinds of aims, King Tejovibhu caused the Tathāgata Sūryagātrapravara to enter all the royal palaces, in order to ripen and guide those beings through the display of the inconceivable miraculous manifestations of the Buddha.

original: tatkiṃ manyase kulaputraanyaḥ sa tena kālena tena samayena tejodhipatirnāma rājaputro'bhūt /
analyzed: tat kim manyase kula putra anyaḥ sa tena kālena tena samayena tejodhipatiḥ nāma rāja putraḥ bhūt
translated: What do you think, noble sir? Was there another prince named Tejopabhva at that time, at that moment?

analyzed: na khalu punar tvayā evam draṣṭavyam
translated: You should not see it like that.

original: ayaṃ sa bhagavān śākyamunistathāgatastena kālena tena samayena tejodhipatirnāma rājaputro'bhūt /
analyzed: ayam sa bhagavān śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ tena kālena tena samayena tejodhipatiḥ nāma rāja putraḥ bhūt
translated: The Blessed One, the Tathagata Shakyamuni, at that time, at that moment, was the prince named Tejopabhva.

analyzed: yena tat cakravarti rājyam pratilabdham
translated: He obtained that universal monarch's kingdom.

original: sa ca sūryagātrapravaro nāma tathāgata ārāgitaḥ /
analyzed: sa ca sūryagātrapravaraḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: And that Tathagata named Suryagatraprabha was propitiated.

original: tatkiṃ manyase kulaputraanyaḥ sa tena kālena tena samayena dhanapatirnāma rājā abhūt tejodhipateḥ kumārasya pitā /
analyzed: tat kim manyase kula putra anyaḥ sa tena kālena tena samayena dhanapatiḥ nāma rājā abhūt tejaḥ adhipateḥ kumārasya pitā
translated: What do you think, noble sir? Was there a king named Dhanapati at that time, at that moment, who was the father of Prince Tejopabhva?

analyzed: na khalu evam draṣṭavyam
translated: You should not see it like that.

original: ratnakusumaprabho nāma tathāgatastena kālena tena samayena dhanapatirnāma rājā abhūt /
analyzed: ratnakusumaprabhaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ tena kālena tena samayena dhanapatiḥ nāma rājā abhūt
translated: The Tathagata named Ratnakusumaprabha, at that time, at that moment, was the king named Dhanapati.

original: ya etarhi pūrvasyāṃ diśi lokadhātau sāgaraparamāṇurajaḥsamānāṃ lokadhātusamudrāṇāṃ pareṇa dharmadhātugaganapratibhāsameghanāmni lokadhātusamudre tryadhvapratibhāsamaṇirājasaṃbhavakulamadhyame lokadhātuvaṃśe buddhaprabhāmaṇḍalaśrīpradīpāyāṃ lokadhātau sucandrakāyapratibhāsadhvaje bodhimaṇḍe anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddho'nabhilāpyabuddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamabodhisattvaparivṛto dharmaṃ deśayati /
analyzed: yaḥ etarhi pūrvasyām diśi lokadhātau sāgara paramāṇu rajaḥ samānām lokadhātu samudrāṇām pareṇa dharmadhātu gagana pratibhāsa megha nāmni lokadhātu samudre tryadhva pratibhāsa maṇirāja saṃbhava kula madhyame lokadhātu vaṃśe buddha prabhā maṇḍala śrīpradīpāyām lokadhātau sucandra kāya pratibhāsa dhvaje bodhimaṇḍe anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhaḥ ūna abhilāpya buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ sama bodhisattva parivṛtaḥ dharmam deśayat
translated: In the east, beyond the ocean of world systems as numerous as the particles of a great trichiliocosm, in the world system called Cloud of Reflections in the Sky of the Dharma Realm, in the world system continuum called Born from the King of Jewels Illuminating the Three Times, in the world system called Lamp of the Glory of the Buddha's Radiance, on the Bodhimanda called Banner of the Reflection of the Beautiful Moon, the Tathagata called King of the Radiance of the Dharma Realm attained supreme perfect enlightenment surrounded by an assembly of bodhisattvas as numerous as the particles of an anabhilāpyānabhilāpya buddha field, and he expounds the Dharma.

original: tena ca bhagavatā ratnakusumaprabheṇa tathāgatena pūrvaṃ bodhisattvacaryāṃ caratā sarvadharmadhātugaganapratibhāsamegho lokadhātusamudraḥ pariśodhitaḥ
analyzed: tena ca bhagavatā ratnakusumaprabheṇa tathāgatena pūrvam bodhisattva caryām caratā sarva dharmadhātu gagana pratibhāsa meghaḥ lokadhātu samudraḥ pariśodhitaḥ
translated: And by that Blessed One, the Tathagata Ratnakusumaprabha, when he was previously practicing the conduct of a bodhisattva, the ocean of world systems called Cloud of Reflections in the Sky of the Dharma Realm was purified.

original: yāvantaśca tasmin lokadhātusamudre tathāgatā utpannāśca utpadyante ca utpatsyante ca /
analyzed: yāvantaḥ ca tasmin lokadhātu samudre tathāgatāḥ utpannāḥ ca utpadyante ca utpatsyante ca
translated: And as many Tathagatas as there are in that ocean of world systems, who have arisen, are arising, and will arise,

original: te sarve ca bhagavatā ratnakusumaprabheṇa tathāgatena pūrvabodhisattvacaryāścaratā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau paripācitāḥ //
analyzed: te sarve ca bhagavatā ratnakusumaprabheṇa tathāgatena pūrva bodhisattva caryāḥ caratā anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau paripācitāḥ
translated: All of them were ripened for unsurpassed and perfect awakening by the blessed Thus-Gone Ratnakusumaprabha while he was practicing bodhisattva conduct in the past.

original: tatkiṃ manyase kulaputraanyā sā tena kālena tena samayena padmaśrīgarbhasaṃbhavā nāma rājabhāryā abhūt tejodhipateḥ kumārasya mātā caturaśītistrīsahasrāṇāṃ
analyzed: tat kim manyase kula putra anyā sā tena kālena tena samayena padmaśrīgarbhasaṃbhavā nāma rāja bhāryā abhūt tejodhipateḥ kumārasya mātā caturaśīti strī sahasrāṇām
translated: What do you think, noble son? Was the queen named Padmaśrīgarbhasaṃbhavā, the mother of Prince Tejovaṃśa, at that time, on that occasion, someone else among those eighty-four thousand women?

analyzed: na khalu evam draṣṭavyam
translated: No, it should not be seen like that.

original: eṣā sā kulaputra māyādevī bhagavato mātā bodhisattvajananī samantāvabhāsānāvaraṇavimokṣapratiṣṭhitā asaṃkhyeyasarvatathāgatasamudrāgamapratyakṣā sarvabodhisattvajanmasaṃdarśanavidhijñā tena kālena tena samayena padmaśrīgarbhasaṃbhavā nāma rājño dhanateragramahiṣyabhūt /
analyzed: eṣā sā kula putra māyādevī bhagavataḥ mātā bodhisattva jananī samanta avabhāsa an āvaraṇa vimokṣa pratiṣṭhitā asaṃkhyeya sarva tathāgata samudra āgama pratyakṣā sarva bodhisattva janma saṃdarśana vidhi jñā tena kālena tena samayena padmaśrīgarbhasaṃbhavā nāma rājñaḥ dhanateḥ agra mahiṣī abhūt
translated: Noble son, that Māyādevī, the mother of the Blessed One, the mother of the Bodhisattva, established in the unobstructed liberation of universal illumination, directly perceiving the ocean of innumerable thus-gone ones, skilled in the method of manifesting the birth of all bodhisattvas, at that time, on that occasion, was the chief queen of King Dhanatejā, named Padmaśrīgarbhasaṃbhavā.

original: tatkiṃ manyase kulaputraanyā sā tena kālena tena samayena sudarśanā nāma agragaṇikā abhūt /
analyzed: tat kim manyase kula putra anyā sā tena kālena tena samayena sudarśanā nāma agragaṇikā abhūt
translated: What do you think, noble son? Was the chief courtesan named Sudarśanā at that time, on that occasion, someone else?

analyzed: na khalu evam draṣṭavyam
translated: No, it should not be seen like that.

original: eṣā sā sunetrā nāma daṇḍapāṇeḥ śākyasya bhāryā mama mātā tena kālena tena samayena sudarśanā nāma agragaṇikābhūt /
analyzed: eṣā sā sunetrā nāma daṇḍapāṇeḥ śākyasya bhāryā mama mātā tena kālena tena samayena sudarśanā nāma agragaṇikā abhūt
translated: She was the wife of the Śākya Daṇḍapāṇi, and my mother at that time.

original: tatkiṃ manyase kulaputraanyā sā tena kālena tena samayena sucalitaratiprabhāsaśrīrnāma gaṇikādārikābhūt /
analyzed: tat kim manyase kula putra anyā sā tena kālena tena samayena su calita ratiprabhāsaśrīḥ nāma gaṇikā dārikā bhūt
translated: What do you think, noble sir? Was the prostitute’s daughter named Sucalitaratiprabhāsaśrī at that time, at that moment, someone other than me?

analyzed: na khalu evam draṣṭavyam
translated: You should not see it like that.

original: ahaṃ sā tena kālena tena samayena sucalitaratiprabhāsaśrīrgaṇikādārikā abhūt /
analyzed: aham sā tena kālena tena samayena su calita rati prabhāsa śrīḥ gaṇikā dārikā abhūt
translated: I was the prostitute’s daughter named Sucalitaratiprabhāsaśrī at that time, at that moment.

original: tatkiṃ manyase kulaputraanyaḥ sa tena kālena tena samayena tejodhipate rājñaḥ parivāro'bhūt /
analyzed: tat kim manyase kula putra anyaḥ sa tena kālena tena samayena tejodhipateḥ rājñaḥ parivāraḥ bhūt
translated: What do you think, noble sir? Was the retinue of King Tejovaṃśa at that time, at that moment, someone other than that?

analyzed: na khalu evam draṣṭavyam
translated: You should not see it like that.

analyzed: ime te bodhisattvāḥ sarve samantabhadra bodhisattva caryā praṇidhāna paripūryām bhagavatā pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ asmin eva parṣad maṇḍale saṃniṣaṇṇa a sarva lokadhātu pratibhāsa prāptena kāyena sarva bodhisattva samādhi vihāra saṃbhinnena cittena sarva tathāgataḥ saṃmukha bhāva vadana vijñaptena cakṣuṣā sarva tathāgata gagana svara aṅga megha cakra nigarjita nirghoṣa vijñaptena śrotreṇa sarva dharma vihāra vaśavartinā āśvāsa praśvāsena sarva budd

original: sa khalu kulaputra sūryagātrapravarastathāgatastejodhipatinā cakravartinā ca mayā ca yāvajjīvamupasthito'bhūt cīvarapiṇḍapātaśayanāsanaglānapratyayabhaiṣajyapariṣkāraiḥ
analyzed: sa khalu kula putra sūryagātra pravaraḥ tathāgataḥ tejaḥ adhipatinā cakravartinā ca mayā ca yāvajjīvam upasthitaḥ bhūt cīvara piṇḍapāta śayana āsana glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkāraiḥ
translated: “Noble one, I and the cakravartin Tathāgata Tejopaśānta served the Tathāgata Sūryagaṇḍakusumitābhijña for as long as we lived, with robes, alms, bedding, medicine for the sick, and all requirements.

original: tasya khalu punaḥ kulaputra sūryagātrapravarasya tathāgatasya parinirvṛtasyānantaraṃ tasyāmeva lokadhātau prasannagātro nāma tathāgato loka udapādi /
analyzed: tasya khalu punar kula putra sūryagātrapravarasya tathāgatasya parinirvṛtasya anantaram tasyām eva lokadhātau prasannagātraḥ nāma tathāgataḥ loke udapādi
translated: “Noble one, after the Tathāgata Sūryagaṇḍakusumitābhijña passed into nirvāṇa, the Tathāgata Prasannagaṇa appeared in that very world realm.

analyzed: saḥ api asmābhiḥ ārāgitaḥ satkṛtaḥ gurukṛtaḥ mānitaḥ pūjitaḥ
translated: We also pleased him, venerated him, honored him, and made offerings to him.

original: tasyānantaraṃ sarvagātrajñānapratibhāsacandro nāma tathāgato loka udapādi /
analyzed: tasya anantaram sarvagātrajñānapratibhāsacandraḥ nāma tathāgataḥ loke udapādi
translated: After him, the Tathāgata Sarva­gaṇajñāna­prabhāsa­candra appeared in the world.

original: so'pyasmābhirdevendrabhūtairārāgitaḥ /🔽tasyānantaraṃ jāmbūnadatejorājo nāma tathāgata ārāgitaḥ /🔽tasyānantaraṃ lakṣaṇabhūṣitagātro nāma tathāgata ārāgitaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ upi asmābhiḥ deva indra bhūtaiḥ ārāgitaḥ  tasya anantaram jāmbūnadatejorājaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ  tasya anantaram lakṣaṇabhūṣitagātraḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: We, as lords of the gods, also pleased him.🔽After him, the Tathāgata Jāmbūnada­tejorāja appeared and was pleased.🔽After him, the Tathāgata Lakṣaṇa­bhūṣita­gātra appeared and was pleased.

analyzed: tasya anantaram vicitraraśmijvalanacandraḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: After him, the Tathāgata Vicitra­raśmi­jvāla­candra appeared and was pleased.

analyzed: tasya anantaram suvilokitajñānaketuḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: After him, I venerated the Tathagata named Suvilokitajnana-ketu.

analyzed: tasya anantaram vipulamahājñānaraśmirājaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: After him, I venerated the Tathagata named Vipula-maha-jnana-rasmi-raja.

original: tasyānantaraṃ nārāyaṇavajravīryo nāma tathāgata ārāgitaḥ /🔽tasyānantaramaparājitajñānasthāmo nāma tathāgata ārāgitaḥ /
analyzed: tasya anantaram nārāyaṇavajravīryaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ  tasya anantaram aparājitajñānasthāmaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: After him, I venerated the Tathagata named Narayana-vajra-viriya.🔽After him, I venerated the Tathagata named Aparajita-jnana-sthama.

original: tasyānantaraṃ samantavilokitajñāno nāma tathāgata ārāgitaḥ /🔽tasyānantaraṃ vimalaśrīmegho nāma tathāgata ārāgitaḥ /
analyzed: tasya anantaram samantavilokitajñānaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ  tasya anantaram vimalaśrīmeghaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: After him, I venerated the Tathagata named Samanta-vilokita-jnana.🔽After him, I venerated the Tathagata named Vimalashri-megha.

original: tasyānantaraṃ siṃhavijṛmbhitaprabho nāma tathāgata ārāgitaḥ /🔽tasyānantaraṃ jñānaraśmijvalanacūḍo nāma tathāgata ārāgitaḥ /
analyzed: tasya anantaram siṃhavijṛmbhitaprabhaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ  tasya anantaram jñānaraśmi jvalanacūḍaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: After him, I venerated the Tathagata named Simhavijrmbhitaprabha.🔽After him, I venerated the Tathagata named Jnana-rasmi-jvala-chuda.

analyzed: tasya anantaram guṇaraśmidhvajaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: After him, I venerated the Tathagata named Guna-rasmi-dhvaja.

analyzed: tasya anantaram jñānabhāskaratejaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: After him, I venerated the Tathagata named Jnana-bhaskara-tejas.

analyzed: tasya anantaram ratnapadmapraphullitagātraḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: After him, I venerated the Tathagata named Ratna-padma-praphullita-gatra.

analyzed: tasya anantaram puṇyapradīpadhvajaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: After him, I propitiated the Tathagata named Punyapradipadhvaja.

original: tasyānantaraṃ jñānaraśmimeghaprabho nāma tathāgata ārāgitaḥ /🔽tasyānantaraṃ samantavairocanacandro nāma tathāgata ārāgitaḥ /
analyzed: tasya anantaram jñānaraśmi meghaprabhaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ  tasya anantaram samantavairocanacandraḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: After him, I propitiated the Tathagata named Jnanarasmi-megha-prabha.🔽After him, I propitiated the Tathagata named Samanta-vairocana-chandra.

analyzed: tasya anantaram ābharaṇacchatranirghoṣaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: After him, I propitiated the Tathagata named Alankarachatra-nirghosa.
