translated: After him, I propitiated the Tathagata named Samanta-jnana-aloka-vikrama-simha.

analyzed: tasya anantaram dharmadhātu viṣayam aticandraḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: After him, I propitiated the Tathagata named Dharma-dhatu-visaya-mati-chandra.

analyzed: tasya anantaram sattva gagana cittapratibhāsabimbaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: After him, I propitiated the Tathagata named Satva-gagana-citta-pratibhasa-bimba.

analyzed: tasya anantaram praśamagandhasunābhaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: After him, I propitiated the Tathagata named Prashana-gandha-sunabha.

analyzed: tasya anantaram samantānuravitaśāntanirghoṣaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: After him, I propitiated the Tathagata named Samanta-anuravita-shanta-nirghosa.

analyzed: tasya anantaram su dṛḍha jñāna raśmi jāla bimbaskandhaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: After him, I propitiated the Tathagata named Sudridha-jnana-rasmi-jala-bimba-skandha.

analyzed: tasya anantaram amṛtaparvata prabhātejaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: After him, I pleased a tathagata named Amritaparvataprabhatejoraja.

analyzed: tasya anantaram dharmasāgaranigarjitaghoṣaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: After him, I pleased a tathagata named Dharmasagarinigarjitaghosa.

original: tasyānantaraṃ buddhagaganaprabhāsacūḍo nāma tathāgata ārāgitaḥ /🔽tasyānantaraṃ raśmicandro nāma tathāgata ārāgitaḥ /
analyzed: tasya anantaram buddha gaganaprabhāsacūḍaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ  tasya anantaram raśmicandraḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: After him, I pleased a tathagata named Buddhagagana-prabhasacuda.🔽After him, I pleased a tathagata named Rasmicandra.

original: tasyānantaraṃ raśmicandrorṇamegho nāma tathāgata ārāgitaḥ /🔽tasyānantaraṃ suparipūrṇajñānamukhaktro nāma tathāgata ārāgitaḥ /
analyzed: tasya anantaram raśmicandrorṇameghaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ  tasya anantaram suparipūrṇajñānamukhaktraḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: After him, I pleased a tathagata named Rasmicandrornamegha.🔽After him, I pleased a tathagata named Suparipurnanana-muktakha.

original: tasyānantaraṃ suviśuddhajñānakusumāvabhāso nāma tathāgata ārāgitaḥ /🔽tasyānantaraṃ ratnārciḥparvataśrītejorājo nāma tathāgata ārāgitaḥ /
analyzed: tasya anantaram suviśuddhajñānakusumāvabhāsaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ  tasya anantaram ratnārciḥparvata śrītejorājaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: After him, I pleased a tathagata named Suvisuddha-jnanakusumavabhasa.🔽After him, I pleased a tathagata named Ratna-arcihparvatashri-tejoraja.

analyzed: tasya anantaram vipulaguṇajyotiḥprabhaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: After him, I pleased a tathagata named Vipulaguna-jyotishprabha.

analyzed: tasya anantaram samādhimervabhyudgatajñānaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: After him, I pleased a tathagata named Samadhimervabhyudgatajnan.

analyzed: tasya anantaram ratnacandradhvajaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: After him, I pleased a tathagata named Ratna-chandra-dhvaja.

analyzed: tasya anantaram arciḥ maṇḍalagātraḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: After him, I venerated the Tathagata named Arcih-mandala-gatra.

analyzed: tasya anantaram ratnāgraprabhatejaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: After him, I venerated the Tathagata named Ratnagra-prabha-tejas.

analyzed: tasya anantaram samantajñānacaryāvilambaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: After him, I venerated the Tathagata named Samanta-jnana-caryavilamba.

analyzed: tasya anantaram arciḥsamudramukhavegapradīpaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: After him, I venerated the Tathagata named Arcih-samudra-mukha-vega-pradīpa.

analyzed: tasya anantaram dharmavimānanirghoṣarājaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: After him, I venerated the Tathagata named Dharma-vimāna-nirghosa-rāja.

original: tasyānantaramasadṛśaguṇakīrtidhvajo nāma tathāgata ārāgitaḥ /🔽tasyānantaraṃ pralambabāhurnāma tathāgata ārāgitaḥ /
analyzed: tasya anantaram asadṛśaguṇakīrtidhvajaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ  tasya anantaram pralambabāhuḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: After him, I venerated the Tathagata named Asadṛśa-guṇa-kīrti-dhvaja.🔽After him, I venerated the Tathagata named Pralambabāhu.

analyzed: tasya anantaram pūrvapraṇidhi nirmāṇacandraḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: After him, I venerated the Tathagata named Pūrva-praṇidhāna-nir-māna-candra.

analyzed: tasya anantaram ākāśajñānārthapradīpaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: After him, I venerated the Tathagata named Ākāśa-jñānārtha-pradīpa.

analyzed: tasya anantaram dharmodgatanabheśvaraḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: After him, I venerated the Tathagata named Dharma-udgata-nabheśvara.

analyzed: tasya anantaram vairocanaśrīgarbharājaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: After him, I venerated the Tathagata named Vairocana-śrī-garbha-rāja.

analyzed: tasya anantaram dharmanārāyaṇaketuḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: After him, the Tathagata named Dharmanarayanaketu was worshipped.

analyzed: tasya anantaram jñānaketuḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: After him, the Tathagata named Jnanaketu was worshipped.

analyzed: tasya anantaram dharmasāgarapadmaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: After him, the Tathagata named Dharmasagarapadmashri was worshipped.

original: iti hi kulaputra etāṃstathāgatān pramukhān kṛtvā tasyāṃ lokadhātau ṣaṣṭibuddhakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrāṇyutpannāni abhūvan /
analyzed: iti hi kula putraḥ etān tathāgatān pramukhān kṛtvā tasyām lokadhātau ṣaṣṭi buddha koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi utpannāni abhūvan
translated: Thus, noble son, having made these Tathagatas the foremost, in that world system sixty hundred thousand kotis of nayutas of Buddhas arose.

analyzed: yāni asmābhiḥ ārāgitāni satkṛtāni gurukṛtāni mānitāni pūjitāni cīvara piṇḍapāta śayana āsana glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkāraiḥ
translated: They were worshipped, revered, honored, and offered robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, and medicines for sickness by us.

original: teṣāṃ khalu kulaputra ṣaṣṭerbuddhakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrāṇāṃ sarvapaścimo vipuladharmādhimuktisaṃbhavatejo nāma tathāgata utpanno'bhūt /
analyzed: teṣām khalu kula putra ṣaṣṭeḥ buddha koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇām sarvapaścimaḥ vipuladharmādhimuktisaṃbhavatejaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ utpannaḥ bhūt
translated: Noble son, the last of those sixty hundred thousand kotis of nayutas of Buddhas was the Tathagata named Vipuladharmadhimuktisambhavatejoraja.

original: tasya bhagavato nagare praviṣṭasya mayā rājabhāryābhūtayā sārdhaṃ svāminā sarvākārapūjāmukhaṃ prayuktayā tathāgatapūjayā pūjāṃ kṛtvā sarvatathāgatotpattisaṃbhavapradīpo nāma tathāgatadharmaparyāyastasya bhagavato'ntikāt śrutaḥ /
analyzed: tasya bhagavataḥ nagare praviṣṭasya mayā rāja bhāryā bhūtayā sārdham svāminā sarva ākāra pūjā mukham prayuktayā tathāgata pūjayā pūjām kṛtvā sarva tathāgata utpatti saṃbhava pradīpaḥ nāma tathāgata dharmaparyāyaḥ tasya bhagavatā untikāt śrutaḥ
translated: When that Blessed One entered the city, I, who was the queen, together with my husband, engaged in all kinds of offerings, made an offering to the Thus-Gone One with the offering of all thus-gone ones, and from that Blessed One I heard the Dharma discourse of the Thus-Gone One called The Lamp for the Arising and Origination of All Thus-Gone Ones.

analyzed: yasya saha śravaṇāt mayā jñāna cakṣuḥ pratilabdham
translated: As soon as I heard it, I attained the eye of wisdom.

analyzed: eṣa ca sarva bodhisattva samādhi naya sāgara vyavalokana viṣayaḥ bodhisattva vimokṣaḥ pratilabdhaḥ
translated: And I attained this bodhisattva liberation called The Range of Vision of the Ocean of Methods for All Bodhisattva Samādhis.

original: sā khalvahaṃ kulaputra etaṃ vimokṣaṃ bhāvayamānā buddhakṣetraśataparamāṇurajaḥsamān kalpānāgatān bodhisattvena sārdhaṃ bodhisattvacaryāṃ caramāṇā
analyzed: sā khalu aham kula putraḥ etam vimokṣam bhāvayamānā buddhakṣetra śata paramāṇu rajaḥ samān kalpān āgatān bodhisattvena sārdham bodhisattva caryām caramāṇā
translated: Son of noble family, as I was cultivating this liberation, for as many eons as there are atoms in a hundred buddha-fields, I practiced bodhisattva conduct together with a bodhisattva.

original: teṣu ca me buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsameṣu kalpeṣu anantamadhyāstathāgatā ārāgitāḥ /🔽kvacit kalpe kalpastho'pi ekatathāgata ārāgitaḥ /
analyzed: teṣu ca me buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ sameṣu kalpeṣu ananta madhyāḥ tathāgatāḥ ārāgitāḥ  kvacid kalpe kalpasthaḥ api eka tathāgataḥ ārāgitaḥ
translated: And in those eons, as many as the atoms in a buddha-field, I pleased infinite and immeasurable thus-gone ones.🔽In some eons, I pleased one thus-gone one for the duration of an eon.

analyzed: kvacid kalpe dvau tathāgatau ārāgitau
translated: In some eons, I pleased two thus-gone ones.

analyzed: kvacid kalpe yāvat anabhilāpyāḥ tathāgatāḥ ārāgitāḥ
translated: In some eons, up to inexpressibly indescribable tathāgatas were honored.

analyzed: kvacid kalpe buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samāḥ tathāgatāḥ ārāgitāḥ
translated: In some eons, tathāgatas equal to the atoms in a buddha-field were honored.

original: na ca me jātu bodhisattvasya kāyo jñātaḥkiṃpramāṇaḥ kīdṛksaṃsthānaḥ kīdṛgvarṇaḥ /
analyzed: na ca me jātu bodhisattvasya kāyaḥ jñātaḥ kiṃpramāṇaḥ kīdṛś saṃsthānaḥ kīdṛś varṇaḥ
translated: But I never knew the bodhisattva's body - what size, what shape, what color.

original: na kāyakarma jñātaṃ na vākkarma na manaskarma jñātaṃ na jñānadarśanaṃ na jñānagocaraṃ na jñānasamādhiviṣayo jñātaḥ /
analyzed: na kāya karma jñātam na vāc karma na manaḥ karma jñātam na jñāna darśanam na jñāna gocaram na jñāna samādhi viṣayaḥ jñātaḥ
translated: I did not know his bodily actions, nor his verbal actions, nor his mental actions, nor his knowledge and vision, nor his range of knowledge, nor the sphere of his concentration and knowledge.

original: ye khalu punaḥ kulaputra sattvā bodhisattvaṃ bodhisattvacārikāṃ carantaṃ dṛṣṭvā bodhisattvasyāntike'nunayacittamutpādayāmāsuḥ /
analyzed: ye khalu punar kula putra sattvāḥ bodhisattvam bodhisattva cārikām carantam dṛṣṭvā bodhisattvasya antikena nu naya cittam utpādayāmāsuḥ
translated: Moreover, noble sir, those beings who, seeing the bodhisattva practicing the bodhisattva's way of life, gave rise to a sympathetic mind in the presence of the bodhisattva,

analyzed: nānā saṃketaiḥ nānā saṃvāsaiḥ ca prasādam janayāmāsuḥ
translated: and generated faith through various agreements and various associations,

original: sarve te bodhisattvena laukikalokottarairvividhairupāyaiḥ saṃgṛhītā bodhisattvasya parivārā bhavanti sma /
analyzed: sarve te bodhisattvena laukika lokottaraiḥ vividhaiḥ upāyaiḥ saṃgṛhītāḥ bodhisattvasya parivārāḥ bhavanti sma
translated: all of them were gathered by the bodhisattva through various worldly and transcendental means, and became the bodhisattva's retinue.

original: te bodhisattvasya bodhisattvacaryāṃ carataḥ parivārasaṃvāse na avaivartikā bhavanti sma anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau //
analyzed: te bodhisattvasya bodhisattva caryām carataḥ parivāra saṃvāse na a vaivartikāḥ bhavanti sma anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: They became irreversible from the highest, complete enlightenment.”

original: sāhaṃ kulaputra vipuladharmādhimuktisaṃbhavatejastathāgatasya sahadarśanādimaṃ sarvabodhisattvasamādhisāgaravyavalokanaviṣayaṃ bodhisattvavimokṣaṃ pratilabhya bodhisattvena sārdhaṃ buddhakṣetraśataparamāṇurajaḥsamān kalpānāgatā etaṃ vimokṣaṃ saṃbhāvayamānā /
analyzed: sā aham kula putra vipula dharma adhimukti saṃbhava tejaḥ tathāgatasya saha darśanāt imam sarva bodhisattva samādhi sāgara vyavalokana viṣayam bodhisattva vimokṣam pratilabhya bodhisattvena sārdham buddhakṣetra śata paramāṇu rajaḥ samān kalpān āgatā etam vimokṣam saṃbhāvayamānā
translated: “Noble one, I obtained this bodhisattva liberation called the range of vision of an ocean of bodhisattva samādhis as soon as I saw the Tathāgata Vipaśyin, who had the splendor of the arising of vast faith in the Dharma. For as many eons as there are atoms in a hundred buddha realms, I have been cultivating this liberation together with that bodhisattva.

original: ye ca teṣu buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsameṣu kalpeṣu tathāgatā utpannāḥ /
analyzed: ye ca teṣu buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ sameṣu kalpeṣu tathāgatāḥ utpannāḥ
translated: In those eons, which are as numerous as the atoms in buddha realms, the tathāgatas who have appeared

original: sarve te mayā tathāgatā ārāgitāḥ pūjitā upasthitāḥ /
analyzed: sarve te mayā tathāgatāḥ ārāgitāḥ pūjitāḥ upasthitāḥ
translated: I have pleased, worshiped, and served all those tathāgatas.

original: sarveṣāṃ ca me teṣāṃ tathāgatānāṃ dharmadeśanā śrutā /
analyzed: sarveṣām ca me teṣām tathāgatānām dharma deśanā śrutā
translated: I have heard the Dharma taught by all those tathāgatas.

analyzed: śrutvā udgṛhītā saṃdhāritā
translated: Having heard it, I have retained it and remembered it.

original: sarveṣāṃ ca mayā teṣāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāmantikādeṣa vimokṣaḥ pratilabdho nānānayairvā nānāsūtrāntanayanirghoṣairnānāvimokṣaśarīrairnānāvimokṣadvārairnānāvimokṣavicārairnānādhvajapraveśaiḥ nānābuddhakṣetrasāgarāvatāraiḥ nānābuddhadarśanasamudravijñaptibhiḥ nānātathāgataparṣanmaṇḍalāvatāraiḥ nānābodhisattvapraṇidhānasāgaranayapathaiḥ nānābodhisattvacaryāprasaraiḥ nānābodhisattvacaryābhinirhāraiḥ nānābodhisattvaprasaraiḥ /
analyzed: sarveṣām ca mayā teṣām buddhānām bhagavatām antikāt eṣa vimokṣaḥ pratilabdhaḥ nānā nayaiḥ vā nānā sūtrānta naya nirghoṣaiḥ nānā vimokṣa śarīraiḥ nānā vimokṣa dvāraiḥ nānā vimokṣa vicāraiḥ nānā dhvaja praveśaiḥ nānā buddhakṣetra sāgara avatāraiḥ nānā buddha darśana samudra vijñaptibhiḥ nānā tathāgata parṣad maṇḍala avatāraiḥ nānā bodhisattva praṇidhāna sāgara naya pathaiḥ nānā bodhisattva caryā prasaraiḥ nānā
translated: I have received this liberation from all those buddha bhagavats through various methods, through various sounds of the ocean of the sutras, through various bodies of liberation, through various doors of liberation, through various investigations of liberation, through various entrances into the path, through various entrances into the ocean of buddha realms, through various perceptions of the ocean of seeing buddhas, through various entrances into the assemblies of tathagatas, through various paths of the ocean of bodhisattva vows, through various manifestations of bodhisattva conduct, through various accomplishments of bodhisattva conduct, through various bodhisattva paths.

analyzed: na ca bodhisattvasya samantabhadra vimokṣa nayam avatarāmi
translated: But I do not understand the method of the bodhisattva Samantabhadra's liberation.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: ākāśatalapraveśāpramāṇā hi kulaputra samantabhadrāṇāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ vimokṣanayāḥ sarvasattvasaṃjñāgatatalāpramāṇāḥ tryadhvaparivartasāgaratalāpramāṇā diksamudratalāpramāṇā dharmadhātunayasāgaratalāpramāṇāḥ /
analyzed: ākāśa tala praveśa apramāṇāḥ hi kula putra samantabhadrāṇām bodhisattvānām vimokṣa nayāḥ sarva sattva saṃjñā gata tala apramāṇāḥ tri adhva parivarta sāgara tala apramāṇāḥ diś samudra tala apramāṇāḥ dharmadhātu naya sāgara tala apramāṇāḥ
translated: Noble sir, the ways of liberation of the bodhisattvas who have the conduct of Samantabhadra are immeasurable, like the surface of space. They are immeasurable, like the range of perceptions of all sentient beings. They are immeasurable, like the range of the ocean of the three times. They are immeasurable, like the range of the ocean of directions. They are immeasurable, like the range of the ocean of ways of the Dharma realm.

original: tathāgataviṣayasamaśarīrā hi kulaputra samantabhadrāṇāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ vimokṣanayāḥ //
analyzed: tathāgata viṣaya sama śarīrāḥ hi kula putra samantabhadrāṇām bodhisattvānām vimokṣa nayāḥ
translated: Noble sir, the ways of liberation of the bodhisattvas who have the conduct of Samantabhadra have bodies that are the same as the domain of the Tathagatas.

original: sā ahaṃ kulaputra buddhakṣetraparmāṇurajaḥsamān kalpān bodhisattvaśarīraṃ prekṣamāṇā atṛptaiva darśanena /
analyzed: sā aham kula putra buddhakṣetra parma aṇu rajaḥ samān kalpān bodhisattva śarīram prekṣamāṇā atṛptā eva darśanena
translated: Noble sir, I have been looking at the body of the bodhisattva for eons equal to the atoms in a buddha-field, and I am never satisfied with seeing it.

original: tadyathāpi nāma kulaputra ekāntarāgacaritayoḥ strīpuruṣayoranyonyasamāgame saṃketakṛtayorapramāṇā ayoniśomanasikāraprabhavāḥ śubhasaṃjñāvitarkasaṃmohasaṃbhavāścittotpādā
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kula putraḥ ekānta rāga caritayoḥ strī puruṣayoḥ anyonya samāgame saṃketa kṛtayoḥ apramāṇāḥ a yoni śo manasikāra prabhavāḥ śubha saṃjñā vitarka saṃmoha saṃbhavāḥ citta utpādāḥ
translated: Noble sir, it is like this: For two people who are completely passionate, a man and a woman, who have made an appointment to meet, the thoughts that arise in their minds, which are born of improper attention, which are born of the delusion of thoughts of beauty, are immeasurable.

original: evameva kulaputra mama bodhisattvasya śarīraṃ prekṣamāṇāyā ekaikasmādromavivarādanantamadhyāpramāṇanirdeśā lokadhātuvaṃśaprasarā nānāpratiṣṭhānā nānāsaṃdhivyūhā nānāsaṃsthānā nānāparvatavyūhā nānāpṛthivītalavyūhanirdeśā nānāgaganameghasaṃchannālaṃkārā nānākalpanāmasaṃkhyānirdeśā nānābuddhotpādatathāgatavaṃśaprabhavā nānābodhimaṇḍālaṃkārā nānātathāgatadharmacakrapravartanavikurvitā nānātathāgataparṣanmaṇḍalavyūhā nānāsūtrāntanayanirdeśanirghoṣā nānāyānanayanirhāraprabhavā nānāpariśuddhaprabhālokāvabhāsā adṛṣṭapūrvanimittāḥ praticittakṣaṇaṃ cakṣuṣa ābhāsamāgacchanti /
analyzed: evam eva kula putra mama bodhisattvasya śarīram prekṣamāṇāyāḥ ekaikasmāt roma vivarāt ananta madhya a pramāṇa nirdeśāḥ lokadhātu vaṃśa prasarāḥ nānā pratiṣṭhānāḥ nānā saṃdhi vyūhāḥ nānā saṃsthānāḥ nānā parvata vyūhāḥ nānā pṛthivī tala vyūha nirdeśāḥ nānā gagana megha saṃchanna alaṃkārāḥ nānā kalpa nāma saṃkhyā nirdeśāḥ nānā buddha utpāda tathāgata vaṃśa prabhavāḥ nānā bodhimaṇḍa alaṃkārāḥ nānā t
translated: “In the same way, noble one, as I look at the body of the bodhisattva, from each of his pores there appear endless, immeasurable, and inconceivable world systems, with their various foundations, various junctions, various shapes, various mountains, various directions, various surfaces of the earth, various adornments of clouds in the sky, various names of kalpas, various buddhas appearing, various lineages of tathāgatas, various adornments of bodhimaṇḍas, various miracles of tathāgatas turning the wheel of the Dharma, various arrays of assemblies of tathāgatas, various sounds of the teaching of the sūtras, various origins of the teaching of the yāna, various pure lights and appearances, and various previously unseen signs.

analyzed: ekaikasmāt roma vivarāt ananta madhyāḥ buddha samudrāḥ cakṣuṣaḥ ābhāsam āgacchanti
translated: From each of his pores, endless oceans of buddhas appear to my eyes.

analyzed: atha khalu sudhanasya śreṣṭhi dārakasya māyāyāḥ devyāḥ sakāśam gamana abhimukhasya buddha gocara vicāra jñāna pratipannasya etat abhavat kena upāyena mayā śakyam sarva loka uccalita ṣaṣ āyatanānām apratiṣṭhitānām kalyāṇa mitrāṇām sarva saṅga samatikrānta kāyānām asaṅga gati gāminī pratipadā apratipannānām dharmakāya su viśuddhānām kāya karma māyā su nirmita śarīrāṇām jñāna māyā gata loka vicārāṇām praṇidhi rūpa kāyānām buddh
translated: Then, as the merchant’s son Sudhana was on his way to the presence of the goddess Māyā, having set out on the path of the domain of experience of the buddhas, he thought, “By what means am I able to see the spiritual benefactors who have transcended the six sense objects of all worlds, who are without abode, who have gone beyond all attachment, who have set out on the path that goes to the state of nonattachment, who have the well-purified Dharma body, whose physical actions are well-formed, whose bodies are well-formed, who have the knowledge of the domain of experience of the world through magical power, who have the form of vows, whose bodies are the mind that is empowered by the buddhas, whose bodies are neither born nor extinguished, whose bodies are neither true nor false, whose bodies are neither transferred nor destroyed,

analyzed: nāma saṃbhava avibhava kāyānām alakṣaṇa eka lakṣaṇa kāyānām
translated: Bodies that are beyond name, origination, and destruction, bodies that are characterized by the single characteristic of being without characteristics,

analyzed: advaya saṃṅga vinirmukta kāyānām
translated: bodies that are free from the bondage of duality,

analyzed: an ālaya nilaya kāyānām
translated: bodies that are without a home or abode,

analyzed: an akṣata kāyānām pratibhāsa sama nirvikalpa kāyānām svapna sama vicāra kāyānām
translated: bodies that are without injury, bodies that are like reflections, bodies that are without conceptualization, bodies that are like dreams, bodies that are without investigation,

original: ādarśamaṇḍalasamasadṛśākrāntakāyānāṃ diksamapraśāntapratiṣṭhakāyānāṃ sarvadikspharaṇanirmāṇakāyānāṃ tryadhvāsaṃbhinnakāyānāmaśarīracittanirvikalpakāyānāṃ sarvalokacakṣuṣpathasamatikrāntakāyānāṃ samantabhadracakṣuḥprasaravijñeyavinayakāyānām asaṅgagaganagocarāṇāṃ kalyāṇamitrāṇāṃ darśanamārāgayituṃ saṃmukhībhāvatāmanuprāptuṃ samavadhānaṃ cāptuṃ nimittaṃ codgrahītuṃ ghoṣamaṇḍalaṃ vā vijñātuṃ mantravyavacārān vā ājñātumanuśāsanīṃ codgrahītum tamevaṃ cintāmanasikāraprayuktaṃ ratnanetrā nāma nagaradevatā gaganadevatāgaṇaparivṛtā gaganatalagatamātmānamupadarśya nānāvibhūṣaṇavibhūṣitaśarīrā anekākāravarṇadivyakusumapuṭaparigṛhītā saṃmukhamabhyavakīramāṇā sudhanaṃ śreṣṭhidārakametadavocatcittanagaraparipālanaprayuktena te kulaputra bhavitavyaṃ sarvasaṃsāraviṣayaratyasaṃvasanatayā /
analyzed: ādarśa maṇḍala sama sadṛśa ākrānta kāyānām diś sama praśānta pratiṣṭha kāyānām sarva diś spharaṇa nirmāṇa kāyānām tri adhva asaṃbhinna kāyānām aśarīra citta nirvikalpa kāyānām sarva loka cakṣuṣpatha samatikrānta kāyānām samantabhadra cakṣuḥ prasara vijñeya vinaya kāyānām asaṅga gagana gocarāṇām kalyāṇa mitrāṇām darśanam ārāgayitum saṃmukhībhāva tām anuprāptum samavadhānam ca āptum nimittam ca udgrahītum ghoṣa maṇḍalam
translated: When Sudhana, the son of a merchant, was thus engaged in thoughts and reflections, a city goddess named Ratnāvatī, surrounded by a host of sky goddesses, manifested herself in the sky, her body adorned with various ornaments, holding in her hands divine flowers of various forms and colors, and scattering them in front of him. She said to Sudhana, the son of a merchant:

analyzed: citta nagara alaṃkāra prayuktena te kula putra bhavitavyam daśa tathāgata bala ādhyāna lambana tayā
translated: You, noble sir, should apply yourself to the adornment of the city of mind, by focusing on the ten powers of the Tathagata.

analyzed: citta nagara pariśodhana prayuktena te kula putra bhavitavyam īrṣyā mātsarya śāṭhya apanayana tayā
translated: You, noble sir, should apply yourself to the purification of the city of mind, by removing envy, stinginess, and deceit.

analyzed: citta nagara saṃtāpa praśama abhiyuktena te kula putra bhavitavyam sarva dharma nidhi aptyā
translated: You, noble sir, should apply yourself to the pacification of the burning of the city of mind, by penetrating all dharmas.

original: cittanagaravivardhanābhiyuktena te kulaputra bhavitavyaṃ sarvajñatāsaṃbhāramahāvīryavegavivardhanatayā /🔽cittanagarabhavanakośavyūhārakṣāprayuktena te kulaputra bhavitavyaṃ sarvasamādhisamāpattidhyānavimokṣavipuladharmavinayamānavihāravaśavartitayā
analyzed: citta nagara vivardhana abhiyuktena te kula putra bhavitavyam sarvajña tā saṃbhāra mahā vīrya vega vivardhana tayā  citta nagara bhavana kośa vyūha ārakṣā prayuktena te kula putra bhavitavyam sarva samādhi samāpatti dhyāna vimokṣa vipula dharma vinaya māna vihāra vaśa varti tayā
translated: You, noble sir, should apply yourself to the increase of the city of mind, by increasing the great impetus of vigor in accumulating the requisites for omniscience.🔽You, noble sir, should apply yourself to the protection of the palace treasury and array of the city of mind, by mastering all samadhis, samapattis, meditations, liberations, and the vast teachings of the Vinaya.

analyzed: citta nagara avabhāsa prayuktena te kula putra bhavitavyam sarva tathāgata parṣad maṇḍala samudaya samanta bhūmi prajñāpāramitā pratilambha pratīcchana tayā
translated: You, noble sir, should apply yourself to the illumination of the city of mind, by receiving the attainment of the perfection of wisdom of the universal stages in the assemblies of all Tathagatas.

analyzed: citta nagara upastambha prayuktena te kula putra bhavitavyam sarva tathāgata saṃbhava upāya mārga sva citta nagara samavasaraṇa tayā
translated: You should apply yourself, noble sir, to the pillar of the city of mind, in order to enter the city of your own mind, the path of means for the arising of all tathagatas.

analyzed: citta nagara dṛḍha prākāra abhinirhāra prayuktena te kula putra bhavitavyam samantabhadra bodhisattva caryā praṇidhāna abhinirhāra citta viśuddhaye
translated: You should apply yourself, noble sir, to the accomplishment of the firm ramparts of the city of mind, in order to purify the mind that accomplishes the vow of the bodhisattva Samantabhadra.

original: cittanagaraduryodhanadurāsadatābhinirhāraprayuktena te kulaputra bhavitavyaṃ sarvakleśamārakāyikapāpamitramāracakrānavamṛdyatayā /🔽cittanagarāvabhāsanaprayuktena te kulaputra bhavitavyaṃ sarvasattvatathāgatajñānāvabhāsapratipadyamānatayā /
analyzed: citta nagara duryodhana durāsada tā abhinirhāra prayuktena te kula putra bhavitavyam sarva kleśa māra kāyika pāpa mitra māra cakra an avamṛdya tayā  citta nagara avabhāsana prayuktena te kula putra bhavitavyam sarva sattva tathāgata jñāna avabhāsa pratipadyamāna tayā
translated: You should apply yourself, noble sir, to the accomplishment of the impregnability and inaccessibility of the city of mind, in order to be unassailable by the hosts of afflictions, evil companions, and Mara.🔽You should apply yourself, noble sir, to the illumination of the city of mind, in order to bring the light of the wisdom of all tathagatas to all beings.

analyzed: citta nagara abhiniṣyandana prayuktena te kula putra bhavitavyam sarva tathāgata dharma megha saṃpratīcchana tayā
translated: You should apply yourself, noble sir, to the outpouring of the city of mind, in order to receive the clouds of Dharma of all tathagatas.

analyzed: citta nagara upastambhana prayuktena te kula putra bhavitavyam sarva tathāgata puṇya samudra sva citta āśaya saṃpratīcchana tayā
translated: “Noble one, you should apply yourself to the pillar of the city of the mind in order to receive into your mind the ocean of the merit of all the tathāgatas.

original: cittanagarapravistaraṇaprayuktena te kulaputra bhavitavyaṃ mahāmaitrīsarvajagatpharaṇatayā /🔽cittanagarasaṃpraticchādanaprayuktena te kulaputra bhavitavyaṃ vipuladharmacchatrasarvākuśaladharmapratipakṣābhinirharaṇatayā /
analyzed: citta nagara pravistaraṇa prayuktena te kula putra bhavitavyam mahā maitrī sarva jagat pharaṇa tayā  citta nagara saṃpraticchādana prayuktena te kula putra bhavitavyam vipula dharma chatra sarva akuśala dharma pratipakṣa abhinirharaṇa tayā
translated: “Noble one, you should apply yourself to the expansion of the city of the mind in order to pervade the whole world with great love.🔽“Noble one, you should apply yourself to the covering of the city of the mind in order to create the antidote to all unwholesome dharmas with the vast parasol of the Dharma.

original: cittanagarapratisyandanaprayuktena te kulaputra bhavitavyaṃ vipulamahākaruṇāsarvajagadanukampanatayā /🔽cittanagaradvāravivaraṇaprayuktena te kulaputra bhavitavyamādhyātmikavāhyavastusarvajagatsaṃprāpaṇatayā /
analyzed: citta nagara pratisyandana prayuktena te kula putra bhavitavyam vipula mahā karuṇā sarva jagat anukampana tayā  citta nagara dvāra vivaraṇa prayuktena te kula putra bhavitavyam ādhyātmika vāhya vastu sarva jagat saṃprāpaṇa tayā
translated: “Noble one, you should apply yourself to the irrigation of the city of the mind in order to have compassion for the whole world with vast great compassion.🔽“Noble one, you should apply yourself to opening the gates of the city of the mind in order to give all inner and outer things to the whole world.

analyzed: citta nagara viśodhana prayuktena te kula putra bhavitavyam sarva saṃsāra viṣaya rati parāṅbhukha tayā
translated: “Noble one, you should apply yourself to the purification of the city of the mind in order to turn your back on all the pleasures of the world.

analyzed: citta nagara dṛḍha sthāma abhinirhāra prayuktena te kula putra bhavitavyam sarva akuśala dharma sva saṃtati asaṃbhavana tayā
translated: You should be one who is dedicated to the attainment of the firm strength of the city of mind, by not allowing any unwholesome dharmas to arise in your own continuum.

analyzed: citta nagara vīrya prayuktena te kula putra bhavitavyam sarvajña tā saṃbhāra samārjana vīrya abhinirvartana tayā
translated: You should be one who is dedicated to the effort of the city of mind, by accomplishing the effort to gather the requisites for omniscience.

analyzed: citta nagara prabhāsana prayuktena te kula putra bhavitavyam sarva tri adhva tathāgata maṇḍala smṛti avabhāsana tayā
translated: You should be one who is dedicated to illuminating the city of mind, by illuminating the maṇḍala of all tathāgatas of the three times with mindfulness.

analyzed: citta nagara vicaya vidhi jñena te kula putra sarva tathāgata dharma cakra sūtrānta vividha dharma dvāra pravicaya śruta abhijña tayā
translated: You should be one who knows the method of investigating the city of mind, by being skilled in listening to the various Dharma gateways of the sūtras and Dharma wheels of all tathāgatas.

analyzed: citta nagara niyāma vidhi jñena te kula putra bhavitavyam sarva jagat abhimukha sarvajña tā dvāra mārga vividha saṃdarśana tayā
translated: You should be one who knows the method of controlling the city of mind, by various displays of the path of the gateway to omniscience that faces all beings.

analyzed: citta nagara adhiṣṭhāna vidhi jñena te kula putra bhavitavyam sarva tri adhva tathāgata praṇidhāna nirhāra viśuddhaye
translated: You should be one who knows the method of consecrating the city of mind, for the purification of the fulfillment of the vows of all tathāgatas of the three times.

analyzed: citta nagara saṃbhāra bala vivardhana vidhi jñena te kula putra bhavitavyam sarva dharmadhātu vipula puṇya jñāna saṃbhāra vivardhana tayā
translated: You should, noble sir, know how to increase the strength of the army of the city of mind by increasing the merit and knowledge that extend throughout the whole realm of reality.

analyzed: citta nagara samanta prabhāsa pramuñcana vidhi jñena te kula putra bhavitavyam sarva sattva citta āśaya indriya adhimukti saṃkleśa vyavadāna jñāna abhijña tayā
translated: You should, noble sir, know how to emit the light that extends in all directions from the city of mind by knowing the inclinations, afflictions, and purities of the faculties, aspirations, and thoughts in the minds of all sentient beings.

analyzed: citta nagara vaśa vartana vidhi jñena te kula putra bhavitavyam sarva dharmadhātu naya samavasaraṇa tayā
translated: You should, noble sir, know how to rule over the city of mind by entering into the principles of all the realms of reality.

original: cittanagaraprabhāsvarābhiyuktena te kulaputra bhavitavyaṃ sarvatathāgatasmṛtyavabhāsanatayā /🔽cittanagarasvabhāvaparijñābhiyuktena te kulaputra bhavitavyamaśarīrasarvadharmanayapratividhyanatayā /
analyzed: citta nagara prabhāsvara abhiyuktena te kula putra bhavitavyam sarva tathāgata smṛti avabhāsana tayā  citta nagara svabhāva parijñā abhiyuktena te kula putra bhavitavyam aśarīra sarva dharma naya pratividhyana tayā
translated: You should, noble sir, be dedicated to making the city of mind radiant by the illumination of the mindfulness of all the Tathāgatas.🔽You should, noble sir, be dedicated to fully understanding the nature of the city of mind by penetrating the principles of all phenomena that have no body.

analyzed: citta nagara māyā upama pratyavekṣaṇa abhiyuktena te kula putra bhavitavyam sarvajña tā dharma nagara gamana tayā
translated: You should, noble sir, be dedicated to investigating the city of mind as an illusion by going to the city of omniscience.

original: evaṃ cittanagarapariśuddhyabhiyuktena te kulaputra bodhisattvena śakyaṃ sarvakuśalasamārjanamanuprāptum /
analyzed: evam citta nagara pariśuddhi abhiyuktena te kula putra bodhisattvena śakyam sarva kuśala samārjanam anuprāptum
translated: In this way, noble sir, a bodhisattva who is dedicated to purifying the mind-city can attain the accumulation of all virtues.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hi bodhisattvasya evaṃ cittanagarapariśuddhasya sarvāvaraṇāni purato na saṃtiṣṭhante buddhadarśanāvaraṇaṃ vā dharmaśravaṇāvaraṇaṃ vā tathāgatapūjopasthānāvaraṇaṃ vā sattvasaṃgrahaprayogāvaraṇaṃ vā buddhakṣetrapariśuddhyāvaraṇaṃ vā /
analyzed: tathā hi bodhisattvasya evam citta nagara pariśuddhasya sarva āvaraṇāni puratas na saṃtiṣṭhante buddha darśana āvaraṇam vā dharma śravaṇa āvaraṇam vā tathāgata pūjā upasthāna āvaraṇam vā sattva saṃgraha prayoga āvaraṇam vā buddhakṣetra pariśuddhi āvaraṇam vā
translated: Because for a bodhisattva whose mind-city is thus purified, all obscurations do not stand before him: the obscuration to seeing the Buddha, the obscuration to hearing the Dharma, the obscuration to worshipping and serving the Tathāgatas, the obscuration to gathering beings through application, or the obscuration to purifying the Buddha-field.

original: sarvāvaraṇavigatena hi kulaputra cittādhyāśayena kalyāṇamitraparyeṣṭyabhiyuktasya bodhisattvasya alpakṛcchreṇa kalyāṇamitrāṇyābhāsamāgacchanti
analyzed: sarva āvaraṇa vigatena hi kula putra citta adhyāśayena kalyāṇa mitraparyeṣṭiabhiyuktasya bodhisattvasya alpa kṛcchreṇa kalyāṇa mitrāṇi ābhāsam āgacchanti
translated: For one who is free from all obscurations, noble sir, with a virtuous superior attitude, a bodhisattva who is dedicated to seeking spiritual friends, spiritual friends appear easily.

analyzed: kalyāṇa mitra adhīnā ca kula putra bodhisattvānām sarvajña tā
translated: And, noble sir, omniscience is dependent on spiritual friends for bodhisattvas.

original: tatra dharmapadmaśrīkuśalā śarīrakāyikadevatā hrīśrīmañjariprabhāvā aparimāṇadevatāgaṇaparivṛtā māyāyā devyā varṇamudīrayamāṇā bodhimaṇḍānniṣkramya sudhanasya śreṣṭhidārakasyābhimukhaṃ gaganatale sthitvā svakasvakebhyo'nekaratnavarṇāni raśmijālāni anekagandhadhūpavimalārcirvarṇāni cittāśayaprasādanavarṇāni cittaprītivegavivardhanavarṇāni kāyaparidāhaprahlādanavarṇāni kāyapariśuddhisaṃdarśanavarṇāni asaṅgakāyavikramasaṃbhavaviṣayāṇi raśmijālāni prāmuñcat /
analyzed: tatra dharmapadma śrī kuśalā śarīra kāyika devatā hrī śrī mañjari prabhāvā aparimāṇa devatā gaṇa parivṛtā māyāyāḥ devyāḥ varṇam udīrayamāṇā bodhimaṇḍāt niṣkramya sudhanasya śreṣṭhi dārakasya abhimukham gagana tale sthitvā svaka svakebhyaḥ aneka ratna varṇāni raśmi jālāni aneka gandha dhūpa vimala arciḥ varṇāni citta āśaya prasādana varṇāni citta prīti vega vivardhana varṇāni kāya paridāha prahlādana varṇāni kāya pariśuddhi
translated: There, the goddess of the body, Dharma­padma­śrī­kusumā, who was the manifestation of the goddess Hriśrīmañjarī, surrounded by an immeasurable assembly of goddesses, having left the seat of awakening, stood in the sky in front of the merchant’s son Sudhana, and from her own body emitted webs of light rays of many jewel colors, webs of light rays of the colors of the stainless flames of many perfumes, colors that gladden the mind and intentions, colors that increase the force of mental joy, colors that cool the burning of the body, colors that show the purity of the body, webs of light rays that have as their domain the arising of the unattached valor of the body.

original: tāni vipulāni kṣetrāṇyavabhāsya sudhanasya śreṣṭhidārakasya sarvatrānugataṃ samantābhimukhaṃ sarvatathāgatakāyaṃ saṃdarśayitvā sarvāvantaṃ lokaṃ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya sudhanasya śreṣṭhidārakasya mūrdhasaṃdhau nipatanti sma /
analyzed: tāni vipulāni kṣetrāṇi avabhāsya sudhanasya śreṣṭhi dārakasya sarvatra anugatam samanta abhimukham sarva tathāgata kāyam saṃdarśayitvā sarvāvantam lokam pradakṣiṇīkṛtya sudhanasya śreṣṭhi dārakasya mūrdha saṃdhau nipatanti sma
translated: Having illuminated those vast realms, having shown to the merchant’s son Sudhana the body of all tathāgatas that is all-pervading and facing everywhere, having circumambulated the entire world, they fell onto the crown of the head of the merchant’s son Sudhana.

analyzed: tāni mūrdhānam upādāya sarva romakūpeṣu anupraviśya anuprasaranti sma
translated: They entered through the crown of his head and flowed through all his pores.

analyzed: samanantara spṛṣṭaḥ ca sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhi dārakaḥ tābhiḥ devatā raśmibhiḥ
translated: As soon as the young merchant Sudhana was touched by those light rays of the devas,

original: atha tāvadeva virajaḥprabhāsaṃ nāma cakṣuḥ pratilebhe /
analyzed: atha tāvat eva virajaḥprabhāsam nāma cakṣuḥ pratilebhe
translated: he immediately obtained an eye called stainless radiance,

analyzed: yat sarva tamaḥ ndhakāreṇa sārdham na saṃvasati
translated: which does not dwell together with any darkness.

analyzed: vitimiram ca nāma cakṣuḥ pratilebhe
translated: He obtained an eye called free from darkness,

analyzed: yena sattva svabhāvam avatarati
translated: by which he penetrates the nature of beings.

analyzed: virajaḥpatim ca nāma cakṣuḥ pratilebhe
translated: He obtained an eye called stainless lord,

translated: Then the Rākṣasa lord named Sunetra, the doorkeeper of the assembly hall of the bodhisattvas, the leader of ten thousand Rākṣasas, together with his wife, sons, and relatives, having scattered various colored beautiful fragrant flowers on the merchant youth Sudhana, said this: Son of good family, a bodhisattva endowed with ten qualities is close to all spiritual friends.

analyzed: katamaiḥ daśabhiḥ

original: yaduta dharmagaganavirajovicāramaṇḍalena ca samādhinidhyaptimukhena /🔽sarvadiksamudrābhimukhacakṣuṣā ca samādhinidhyaptimukhena /

analyzed: sarva ārambaṇa avikalpa avicāreṇa ca samādhi nidhi apti mukhena

translated: “Noble sir, the bodhisattva who has these ten gateways of the meditative absorption of the presence of spiritual benefactors attains the presence of all spiritual benefactors.

analyzed: sarva tathāgata dharma cakra kalyāṇa mitra mukha nirghoṣam ca nāma samādhi vimokṣam pratilabhate

analyzed: yatra pratipadyamānaḥ sarva buddha samatām avatarati
translated: When he practices it, the bodhisattva enters into the indivisible equality of all the Buddhas.

analyzed: a saṃbhinnāni ca sarvatra anugatāni kalyāṇa mitrāṇi pratilabhate

analyzed: anukampakaḥ usmākam anugraha pravṛttaḥ kalyāṇa mitrāṇām darśayitā

translated: He said, Noble son, you should go to the spiritual benefactors, bowing in all directions with your body, with all objects, with the intention bound by the mindfulness of spiritual benefactors, with the speed of going everywhere, with the realization of samādhi, with the speed of mind like a dream, with the movement of the mental body like a reflection.

analyzed: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhi dārakaḥ yathā anuśiṣṭaḥ sunetreṇa rākṣasa indreṇa pratipadyamānaḥ udrākṣīt puratas dharaṇi talāt mahā ratna padma samudgatam sarva vajra śarīra daṇḍam sarva jagat sāgara maṇi rāja garbham sarva maṇi rāja patra paṅkti vairocana maṇi rāja karkaṭikām sarva ratna varṇa gandha maṇi rāja kesaram asaṃkhyeya ratna jāla saṃchāditam tasyām ca mahā ratna rāja padma karkaṭikāyām dharmadhātu diś samavasaraṇagarbha
translated: Then the merchant's son Sudhana, practicing as instructed by the king of rākṣasas Sunetra, saw a great jewel lotus rising from the ground in front of him, with a body and stalk made of all vajras, the essence of the king of jewels of the ocean of all worlds, with rows of leaves of all king of jewels, a pericarp of the king of jewels Vairocana, and filaments of the king of jewels with the color and scent of all jewels, covered with an inconceivable net of jewels. analyzed: tasya kūṭāgārasya madhye cintārāja maṇi ratna padmagarbham āsanam adrākṣīt sarva loka indra saṃsthāna maṇi vigraha bimba pratiṣṭhitam sarva maṇi ratna vigraha varṇam indradhvaja pradyota saṃsthānam vajra maṇi cakra bhūmi tala pratiṣṭhitam nānā maṇi rāja paṅkti vyūham aneka ratna vedikā parivṛtam jyotirdhvaja maṇirāja su pratyarpitam nānā ratna vyūha upaśobhitam divya atikrānta maṇi rāja vastra su prajñaptam aneka varṇa vicitra vastra ratna su sa
translated: In the middle of that kūṭāgāra, he saw a seat with a throne made of the cintāmaṇi jewel, a lotus in its center, established with the images of the forms of jewels with the appearances of all the lords of the world, the color of the forms of all jewel-gems, the appearance of the banner of Indra's radiance, established on a ground of vajra-gems and a wheel, surrounded by rows of various jewel kings, with many jewel-pedestals, well-adorned with the king of jewels called the banner of light, beautified with various jewel arrays, covered with cloths of the king of jewels surpassing the divine, well-arranged with various jewel-cloths of many colors, adorned with the canopy of all jewel-cloths spread out in the sky, covered with nets of all jewels, resounding with the banners of vajras in all directions well-distinguished, shining with the banners of all jewel-cloths well-fluttering, well-adorned with the equality of the banners of the king of all fragrant jewels, raining down various flowers and clouds of flowers, with the pleasant sounds of the banners of all jewel-bells well-fluttering to the ears and mind,

analyzed: tasmin ca āsane māyādevīm niṣaṇṇām adrākṣīt trailokya samatikrāntena rūpeṇa
translated: And on that seat he saw Māyādevī, with a form that transcended the three worlds.

analyzed: sarva loka abhimukhena sarva bhava gati udgatena rūpeṇa
translated: With a form that faced all worlds, rising above all existences and destinies.

analyzed: yathā āśaya jagat vijñaptena sarva loka an upaliptena rūpeṇa
translated: With a form that manifested to the world according to their aspirations, yet untouched by any world.

analyzed: vipula puṇya saṃbhūtena sarva jagat sadṛśena rūpeṇa
translated: With a form born of vast merit, similar to that of all beings.

analyzed: sarva sattva sukha upadarśanena sarva jagat paripāka vinaya anukūlena rūpeṇa  sarva sattva abhimukha pralambitena sarva kāla gagana jagat vijñapti asaṃbhinnena rūpeṇa
translated: With a form that showed all beings happiness, in accord with the ripening and training of all beings.🔽With a form that hung down facing all beings, yet inseparable from the space and world that appears at all times.

analyzed: sarva jagat niṣṭhā vijñaptyā adhiṣṭhānena agatikena rūpeṇa
translated: With a form that is not a basis for the manifestation of the end of all worlds, yet not without a basis.

analyzed: sarva loka gatikena rūpeṇa  sarva loka gati niruddhena anāgatikena rūpeṇa
translated: With a form that moves through all worlds.🔽With a form that is not a movement, yet is the cessation of all worldly movements.

analyzed: sarva jagat asaṃbhūtena anutpannena rūpeṇa
translated: With a form that is not born in any world, yet is unborn.

analyzed: anutpatti sama dharma niratena aniruddhena rūpeṇa
translated: With a form that is not ceased, yet is absorbed in the truth of the non-arising of things.

analyzed: sarva loka vyavahāra parameṇa asatyena rūpeṇa
translated: With a form that is the highest in all worldly conventions, yet is not true.

analyzed: yathāvat pratilabdhena amṛṣeṇa rūpeṇa
translated: With a form that is not false, yet is truly attained.

analyzed: yathā loka vijñaptena a krāntena rūpeṇa
translated: With a form that is not entered by the appearances of the world.

analyzed: cyuti upapatti vinivṛtena a vinaṣṭena rūpeṇa
translated: With a form that is not destroyed by death and rebirth.

analyzed: dharmadhātu prakṛti avināśena alakṣaṇena rūpeṇa
translated: With a form that is the nature of the realm of phenomena, without characteristics.

analyzed: tri adhva vākpatha parameṇa eka lakṣaṇena rūpeṇa
translated: With a form that is the supreme path of the three times, with one characteristic.

analyzed: alakṣaṇa su lakṣaṇa niryātena pratibhāsa kalpena rūpeṇa
translated: With a form that is like a reflection, emerging from the absence of characteristics and good characteristics.

analyzed: sarva jagat citta yathā āśaya vijñaptena māyā kalpena rūpeṇa  jñāna māyā pariniṣpannena marīci kalpena rūpeṇa
translated: With a form that is like an illusion, manifesting in the minds of all beings according to their inclinations.🔽With a form that is like a mirage, perfected by the illusion of wisdom.

analyzed: prati kṣaṇa jagat saṃjñā adhiṣṭhāna parameṇa chāyā upamena rūpeṇa  praṇidhāna sarva jagat anubaddhena svapna upamena rūpeṇa
translated: With a form that is like a shadow, supreme in providing the basis for the world's perception of moments.🔽With a form that is like a dream, connected to all beings through vows.

analyzed: yathā āśaya jagat vijñapti asaṃbhinnena sarva dharmadhātu parameṇa rūpeṇa
translated: With a form that is the supreme realm of all phenomena, undifferentiated in manifesting to the world according to inclinations.

analyzed: ākāśa dhātu prakṛti pariśuddhena mahā karuṇā niryātena rūpeṇa
translated: With a form that is the nature of the space element, emerging from great compassion.

analyzed: sattva vaṃśa paripālana prayuktena asaṅga mukha niryātena rūpeṇa
translated: With a form that is dedicated to protecting the lineage of beings, emerging from the door of non-attachment.

original: ityevaṃprakāreṇa rūpeṇa sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhidārako māyādevīmadrākṣīdarūpeṇa rūpapratibhāsena avedanena rūpeṇa lokaduḥkhavedanāpraśāntiparameṇa /
analyzed: iti evaṃprakāreṇa rūpeṇa sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhi dārakaḥ māyādevīm adrākṣīt arūpeṇa rūpa pratibhāsena avedanena rūpeṇa loka duḥkha vedanā praśānti parameṇa
translated: In this way, the merchant’s son Sudhana saw Māyādevī in a form that was formless, in a form that was an appearance of form, in a form that was non-experience, in a form that was the highest pacification of the experience of the suffering of the world.

translated: The head merchant's son Sudhana saw Māyādevī with the foremost of those ways of seeing, which were as numerous as the atoms in Jambudvīpa.

original: sa tāṃ dṛṣṭvā yatpramāṇā māyādevī tatpramāṇaṃ svakāyamadhiṣṭhāya samantadigabhimukhāṃ māyādevīṃ sarvatrānugatena kāyena praṇipatitaḥ /

translated: Having seen her, he blessed his own body to be the same size as Māyādevī. With a body that extended everywhere, he bowed down to Māyādevī, facing all directions.

analyzed: tasya praṇipatamānasya ananta madhyāni samādhi mukhāni avakrāntāni
translated: As he bowed down, he entered into countless and immeasurable gateways to samādhi.

original: sa tāni samādhimukhāni vyavalokya animittīkṛtvā prabhāvayitvā sārīkṛtvā anusmṛtya spharitvā prasaritvā avalokayitvā vipulīkṛtvā abhinirhṛtya mudrayitvā tebhyaḥ samādhimukhebhyo vyutthāya māyādevīṃ saparivārāṃ sabhavanāsanāṃ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya purataḥ prāñjaliḥ sthitvā evamāhaahamārye mañjuśriyā kumārabhūtena anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittamutpādya kalyāṇamitraparyupāsanena samādāpitam /

translated: Having surveyed those gateways to samādhi, having made them signless, having made them manifest, having made them empty, having made them without memory, having made them expansive, having made them spread out, having made them look down, having made them vast, having brought them forth, having made them into a seal, having arisen from those gateways to samādhi, having circumambulated Māyādevī and her retinue, together with her palace and seat, to the right, he stood in front of her with palms joined and said this: Noble lady, I have given rise to the mind of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment through Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta, and have been inspired to attend upon spiritual benefactors by him.

analyzed: saḥ ham kalyāṇa mitram paryupāsamānaḥ anupūrveṇa yāvat tava sakāśam upasaṃkrāntaḥ
translated: I have attended spiritual benefactors and have come into your presence.

original: tadvadatu me āryākathaṃ bodhisattvena bodhisattvacaryāyāṃ śikṣamāṇaḥ pariniṣpanno bhavati sarvajñatāyām /
analyzed: tat vadatu me āryā katham bodhisattvena bodhisattva caryāyām śikṣamāṇaḥ pariniṣpannaḥ bhavati sarvajña tāyām
translated: Therefore, noble one, tell me how a bodhisattva who trains in the bodhisattva conduct becomes perfected in omniscience.”

original: sā avocatahaṃ kulaputra mahāpraṇidhānajñānamāyāgatavyūhasya bodhisattvavimokṣasya lābhinī /🔽sāhaṃ kulaputra anena vimokṣeṇa samanvāgatā yāvanti iha lokadhātusamudre bhagavato vairocanasya sarvalokadhātuṣu sarvajambudvīpeṣu caramabhavikabodhisattvajanmavikurvitāni
analyzed: sā avocata ham kula putra mahā praṇidhāna jñāna māyā gata vyūhasya bodhisattva vimokṣasya lābhinī  sā aham kula putra anena vimokṣeṇa samanvāgatā yāvanti iha lokadhātu samudre bhagavataḥ vairocanasya sarva lokadhātuṣu sarva jambudvīpeṣu caramabhavika bodhisattva janma vikurvitāni
translated: She said, “Noble one, I have attained the bodhisattva liberation called the array of the knowledge of great prayers and illusions.

original: sarveṣāṃ ca teṣāṃ caramabhavikānāṃ bodhisattvānāmahaṃ jananī /
analyzed: sarveṣām ca teṣām caramabhavikānām bodhisattvānām aham jananī
translated: “Noble one, endowed with this liberation, in all the Jambudvīpas in all the world realms of the ocean of world realms of the bhagavat Vairocana, I am the mother of all the bodhisattvas in their final birth.

original: sarve te bodhisattvā mama kukṣau saṃbhavanti /
analyzed: sarve te bodhisattvāḥ mama kukṣau saṃbhavanti
translated: All those bodhisattvas in their final birth are born from my womb.

analyzed: mama dakṣiṇāt pārśvāt niṣkramanti
translated: They emerge from my right side.

original: ihaiva tāvadahaṃ kulaputra bhāgavatyāṃ cāturdvīpikāyāṃ kapilavastuni mahānagare rājñaḥ śuddhodanasya kulabaddhakalpena siddhārthaṃ bodhisattvaṃ janitravatī mahatācintyena bodhisattvajanmavikurvitena //
analyzed: iha eva tāvat aham kula putra bhāgavatyām cāturdvīpikāyām kapilavastuni mahā nagare rājñaḥ śuddhodanasya kula baddha kalpena siddhārtham bodhisattvam janitravatī mahatā acintyena bodhisattva janma vikurvitena
translated: “Noble one, I was born in the city of Kapilavastu, in the family of King Śuddhodana, in this very Bhadrā world realm of the four continents, through the inconceivable miraculous birth of a bodhisattva, to the mother of the bodhisattva Siddhārtha, who was bound by the ties of family.”

original: sā khalvahaṃ kulaputra tadā rājñaḥ śuddhodanasya gṛhagatā bhavāmi /
analyzed: sā khalu aham kula putra tadā rājñaḥ śuddhodanasya gṛha gatā bhavāmi
translated: “Noble one, I was in the house of King Śuddhodana.

original: atha bodhisattvasya tuṣitabhavanāccyavanakālasamaye pratyupasthite sarvaromamukhebhya ekaikasmādromamukhādanabhilāpyabuddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamāḥ sarvabodhisattvajananīguṇanayavyūhāḥ sarvatathāgatajananīguṇamaṇḍalaprabhavaprabhāsā nāma raśmayo niścaritvā sarvāvantaṃ lokadhātumavabhāsya mama śarīre nipatya mūrdhānamupādāya sarvaromakūpeṣvanuprāviśan /
analyzed: atha bodhisattvasya tuṣita bhavanāt cyavana kāla samaye pratyupasthite sarva roma mukhebhyaḥ ekaikasmāt roma mukhāt anabhilāpya buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samāḥ sarva bodhisattva jananī guṇa naya vyūhāḥ sarva tathāgata jananī guṇa maṇḍala prabhava prabhāsāḥ nāma raśmayaḥ niścaritvā sarvāvantam lokadhātum avabhāsya mama śarīre nipatya mūrdhānam upādāya sarva romakūpeṣu anuprāviśan
translated: “Then, when the time came for the Bodhisattva to descend from the Tuṣita heaven, from every one of his pores there came forth light rays called the radiance that arises from the circle of qualities of the mother of all tathāgatas, which were as numerous as the atoms in an anabhilāpyānabhilāpya number of buddha realms. translated: “Noble one, as soon as those light rays of bodhisattvas entered my body,

translated: all appeared to my eyes.

translated: They were at the supreme site of enlightenment, seated on the lion throne of enlightenment, surrounded by an assembly of bodhisattvas, worshipped by the lords of the world, turning the wheel of the Dharma.

original: ye ca taistathāgataiḥ pūrvabodhisattvacaryāṃ caradbhistathāgatā ārāgitāḥ /
analyzed: ye ca taiḥ tathāgataiḥ pūrva bodhisattva caryām caradbhiḥ tathāgatāḥ ārāgitāḥ
translated: And all those tathāgatas whom those tathāgatas had honored while practicing bodhisattva conduct in the past

analyzed: te api sarve mama cakṣuṣaḥ ābhāsam agaman
translated: appeared to my eyes.

analyzed: prathama citta utpāda janma vikurvitāḥ sa abhisaṃbodhi dharma cakra pravartana parinirvāṇa vikurvitāḥ sarva buddhakṣetra viśuddha vyūhāḥ
translated: The first generation of the mind, the emanations at birth, the complete enlightenment, the turning of the wheel of Dharma, the emanations at parinirvāṇa, and the arrays of the purification of all buddha realms

original: yāni ca teṣāṃ tathāgatānāṃ nirmāṇamaṇḍalāni praticittakṣaṇaṃ sarvadharmadhātuṃ spharanti /
analyzed: yāni ca teṣām tathāgatānām nirmāṇa maṇḍalāni prati citta kṣaṇam sarva dharmadhātum spharanti
translated: and all those maṇḍalas of emanations of those tathāgatas that pervade the entire Dharma realm in every moment of mind

analyzed: tāni api sarvāṇi mama cakṣuṣaḥ ābhāsam agaman
translated: all appeared to my eyes.

original: tasyā mama kulaputra kāye tābhirbodhisattvaraśmibhiranupraviṣṭābhiḥ sarvajagadabhyudgataḥ kāyaḥ saṃsthito'bhūt /
analyzed: tasyāḥ mama kula putra kāye tābhiḥ bodhisattva raśmibhiḥ anupraviṣṭābhiḥ sarva jagat abhyudgataḥ kāyaḥ saṃsthitaḥ bhūt
translated: And, noble sir, my body, having been penetrated by those bodhisattva light rays, became established as a body surpassing the entire world.

analyzed: ākāśa dhātu vipulaḥ ca kukṣiḥ
translated: My belly became as vast as the realm of space.

analyzed: na ca manuṣya āśraya pramāṇāt atikrāntaḥ
translated: But it did not exceed the size of a human body.

analyzed: yāvantaḥ ca daśasu dikṣu bodhisattva garbha āvāsa bhavana vyūhāḥ
translated: And all the arrays of the abodes of the bodhisattva wombs in the ten directions

original: te sarve mama kāye'ntargatā anupraviṣṭāḥ sarve saṃdṛśyante //
analyzed: te sarve mama anupraviṣṭāḥ sarve saṃdṛśyante
translated: all appeared within my body, having entered it.

analyzed: samanantara prādurbhūtasya ca mama kula putra kāye bodhisattva garbha āvāsa bhavana vyūha paribhogasya
translated: “Noble one, as soon as I was born, I was in the womb of the bodhisattva Garbhāvāsa­bhavana­vyūha.

original: atha tāvadeva bodhisattvaḥ sārdhaṃ daśabuddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamairbodhisattvairekapraṇidhānaiḥ sabhāgacaritairekakuśalamūlairekavyūhairekavimokṣavihāribhirekajñānabhūmisaṃvāsibhirekavikurvitaniryātairekapraṇidhānasamudāgatairekacaryāniryātairdharmakāyapariśuddhairanantamadhyarūpakāyādhiṣṭhānaiḥ samantabhadrabodhisattvacaryāpraṇidhivikurvitaniryātairnāgendragarbhamaṇikūṭāgāragataiḥ sāgaranāgarājapūrvaṃgamairaśītyā nāgendrasahasraiḥ sarvalokendrasahasraiścābhipūjyamāno mahatā bodhisattvavikurvitena sarvatuṣitabhavanacyutisaṃdarśanena ekaikasmāttuṣitabhavanāt sarvalokadhātuprasṛtacāturdvīpopapattipratilābhasaṃdarśanena acintyasattvaparipākopāyakauśalyānugatena pramattasarvasattvasaṃcodanena sarvābhiniveśoccālanena mahāraśmijālapramuñcanena sarvalokāndhakāravidhamanena sarvāpāyaduḥkhavyupaśamanena sarvanirayagatinivartanena sarvasattvapūrvakarmasaṃcodanena sarvasattvadhātuparitrāyaṇena sarvasattvābhimukhakāyasaṃdarśanena tuṣitabhavanāccyutvā sārdhaṃ saparivāreṇa mama kukṣau prāviśat //
analyzed: atha tāvat eva bodhisattvaḥ sārdham daśa buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samaiḥ bodhisattvaiḥ eka praṇidhānaiḥ sa bhāga caritaiḥ eka kuśala mūlaiḥ eka vyūhaiḥ eka vimokṣa vihāribhiḥ eka jñāna bhūmi saṃvāsibhiḥ eka vikurvita niryātaiḥ eka praṇidhāna samudāgataiḥ eka caryā niryātaiḥ dharmakāya pariśuddhaiḥ ananta madhya rūpa kāya adhiṣṭhānaiḥ samantabhadra bodhisattva caryā praṇidhi vikurvita niryātaiḥ nāga indra garbha maṇi kūṭāg
translated: At that time, the Bodhisattva, together with bodhisattvas as numerous as the atoms in ten buddha-fields, all of whom had the same aspiration, engaged in similar practices, had the same roots of virtue, the same adornments, the same meditative absorptions and liberations, the same stage of wisdom, the same miraculous abilities, the same aspiration, the same accomplishments, the same pure Dharma body, the same boundless and immeasurable physical bodies, the same practice and aspirations as the bodhisattva Samantabhadra, the same miraculous abilities, the same jeweled palaces with the essence of the kings of nagas, the same leaders as the naga king of the ocean, and the same retinue of eighty thousand kings of nagas and all the world leaders, was greatly honored with the miraculous abilities of the bodhisattvas, manifesting the passing away from all the Tushita realms, manifesting the attainment of rebirth in the four continents extending throughout all world systems from each of the Tushita realms, with an inconceivable skill in the means of ripening beings, exhorting all heedless beings,

original: te sarve mama kukṣau trisāhasralokadhātuvipulena yāvadanabhilāpyabuddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamalokadhātuvipulena ākramavikrameṇa anuvicaranti sma /
analyzed: te sarve mama kukṣau tri sāhasra lokadhātu vipulena yāvat anabhilāpya buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ sama lokadhātu vipulena ākrama vikrameṇa anuvicaranti sma
translated: All of them, as numerous as the atoms in an anabhilāpyānabhilāpya number of buddha-fields, entered my womb, which was as vast as the three-thousand great one-thousand worlds, and roamed about with their strides of conquest.

original: sarvāṇi ca daśasu dikṣu sarvalokadhātuprasareṣu sarvatathāgatapādamūleṣu sarvabodhisattvaparṣanmaṇḍalāni praticittakṣaṇamanabhilāpyāni mama kukṣau samavasaranti sma bodhisattvagarbhāvāsavikurvitaṃ draṣṭum /
analyzed: sarvāṇi ca daśasu dikṣu sarva lokadhātu prasareṣu sarva tathāgata pāda mūleṣu sarva bodhisattva parṣad maṇḍalāni prati citta kṣaṇam anabhilāpyāni mama kukṣau samavasaranti sma bodhisattva garbha āvāsa vikurvitam draṣṭum
translated: And all the assemblies of bodhisattvas in all the buddha-fields in the ten directions, beyond thought, entered my womb at every moment to see the miracle of the bodhisattva’s dwelling in the womb.

original: catvāraśca mahārājāḥ śakrasuyāmasaṃtuṣitasunirmitavaśavartinaśca devendrāḥ brahmendrāśca garbhāvāsopagatabodhisattvamupasaṃkrāmanti sma darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya dharmaśravaṇāya sāṃkathyānubhāvanāya /🔽na cāyaṃ mama kukṣistāvanti parṣanmaṇḍalāni pratīcchan vipulībhavati /
analyzed: catvāraḥ ca mahārājāḥ śakrasuyāma saṃtuṣita sunirmita vaśavartinaḥ ca deva indrāḥ brahma indrāḥ ca garbhāvāsa upagata bodhisattvam upasaṃkrāmanti sma darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya dharma śravaṇāya sāṃkathya anubhāvanāya  na ca ayam mama kukṣiḥ tāvanti parṣad maṇḍalāni pratīcchan vipulībhavati
translated: The four great kings, Śakra, Suyāma, Santuṣita, Sunirmita, Vaśavartin, the lords of the gods, and the lords of the Brahmakāyika gods came to the bodhisattva who had entered the womb to see him, to pay homage to him, to honor him, to hear the Dharma, and to experience the Dharma talk.🔽But my womb, receiving those assemblies, did not become larger.

original: na cāsmānmanuṣyāśrayādayaṃ mama kāyo viśiṣṭataraḥ saṃtiṣṭhate /
analyzed: na ca asmāt manuṣya āśrayāt ayam mama kāyaḥ viśiṣṭataraḥ saṃtiṣṭhate
translated: And this body of mine, which is human, did not become smaller.

analyzed: tāni ca tāvanti parṣad maṇḍalāni saṃpratīcchati
translated: and he accepted all those assemblies.

analyzed: sarve ca te deva manuṣyāḥ nānā bodhisattva paribhoga pariśuddhi vyūhān apaśyan
translated: And all those gods and humans saw the adornments of the pure enjoyments of various bodhisattvas.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

analyzed: yathā api tat asya eva mahā praṇidhāna māyā gatasya bodhisattva vimokṣasya su bhāṣita tvāt
translated: It is because of the eloquence of this very bodhisattva liberation called Arisen from the Knowledge of Great Vows.

original: yathā cāhaṃ kulaputra asyāṃ bhāgavatyāṃ cāturdvīpikāyāṃ jambudvīpe bodhisattvaṃ kukṣiṇā saṃpratīcchāmi /
analyzed: yathā ca aham kula putra asyām bhāgavatyām cāturdvīpikāyām jambudvīpe bodhisattvam kukṣiṇā saṃpratīcchāmi
translated: Just as I, noble sir, accept the bodhisattva in my womb in this fortunate four-continent world system, in Jambudvīpa,

original: evaṃ trisāhasramahāsāhasre lokadhātau sarvacāturdvīpikājambudvīpeṣu saṃpratīcchāmi anena ca vikurvitavyūhena /
analyzed: evam tri sāhasra mahā sāhasre lokadhātau sarva cāturdvīpikā jambudvīpeṣu saṃpratīcchāmi anena ca vikurvita vyūhena
translated: in the same way, in the great trichiliocosm, in all the four-continent worlds, in the Jambudvīpas, I accept him with this array of transformations.

original: na cāyaṃ mama kāyo dvayībhavati nādvayībhavati /
analyzed: na ca ayam mama kāyaḥ dvayībhavati na a dvayībhavati
translated: And this body of mine does not become two, nor does it not become two.

analyzed: na ca ekatve saṃtiṣṭhate na bahutve
translated: It does not remain in oneness, nor in manyness.

original: yathāpi nāma tadasyaiva mahāpraṇidhānajñānamāyāgatasya bodhisattvavimokṣasya subhāṣitatvāt /
analyzed: yathā api nāma tat asya eva mahā praṇidhāna jñāna māyā gatasya bodhisattva vimokṣasya su bhāṣita tvāt
translated: It is because of the eloquence of this very bodhisattva liberation called 'Arisen from the Knowledge of Great Vows.'

original: yathā cāhaṃ kulaputra asya bhagavato vairocanasya mātā abhūvam /
analyzed: yathā ca aham kula putra asya bhagavataḥ vairocanasya mātā abhūvam
translated: Just as I, noble sir, was the mother of this Blessed One Vairocana,

analyzed: tathā pūrvakāṇām api tathāgatānām ananta madhyānām mātā abhūvam
translated: In the same way, I was the mother of the infinite and immeasurable past Tathāgatas.

original: yatra bodhisattvo loka upapāduka upāpadyata padmagarbhe /
analyzed: yatra bodhisattvaḥ loke upapādukaḥ upāpadyata padmagarbhe
translated: Where the Bodhisattva was born in the world in the womb of a lotus,

analyzed: tatra aham nalinī devatā bhūtvā bodhisattvam saṃpratīcchāmi
translated: there I became the goddess of the lotus pond and received the Bodhisattva.

analyzed: lokaḥ ca mām bodhisattva jananī iti saṃjānāti
translated: And the world recognized me as the mother of the Bodhisattva.

analyzed: yatra utsaṅge prādurbabhūva
translated: Where he appeared in the lap,

analyzed: tatra aham asya jananī abhūvam
translated: there I became his mother.

analyzed: yatra buddhakṣetre prādurbhavati
translated: In whatever Buddha-field he appears,

analyzed: tatra aham bodhimaṇḍa devatā bhavāmi
translated: there I become the goddess of the Bodhi tree.

original: iti hi kulaputra yāvadbhirupāyamukhaiścaramabhavikā bodhisattvā loka upapattiṃ saṃdarśayanti /
analyzed: iti hi kula putra yāvadbhiḥ upāya mukhaiḥ caramabhavikāḥ bodhisattvāḥ loke upapattim saṃdarśayanti
translated: Thus, noble sir, with as many doors of skillful means as the Bodhisattvas in their final existence display their birth in the world,

analyzed: tāvadbhiḥ upāya mukhaiḥ aham bodhisattva jananī bhavāmi
translated: with that many doors of skillful means I become the mother of the Bodhisattvas.

original: yathā ahaṃ kulaputra iha lokadhātau asya bhagavataḥ sarvabodhisattvajanmavikurvitasaṃdarśaneṣu janetryabhūvam /
analyzed: yathā aham kula putraḥ iha lokadhātau asya bhagavataḥ sarva bodhisattva janma vikurvita saṃdarśaneṣu janetrī abhūvam
translated: Just as, noble sir, I am in this world the mother who gives birth to this Blessed One in all the manifestations of the birth of the Bodhisattvas,

analyzed: tathā bhagavataḥ krakucchandasya api tathāgatasya
translated: in the same way I was the mother who gave birth to the Blessed One, the Tathāgata Krakucchanda,

analyzed: kanakamuneḥ
translated: to Kanakamuni,🔽and to Kāśyapa.

analyzed: kāśyapasya tathāgatasya janetrī abhūvam
translated: I was the mother of the Tathāgata Kāśyapa.

original: tathā sarveṣāṃ bhadrakalpikānāmanāgatānāṃ tathāgatānāṃ janetrī bhaviṣyāmi /
analyzed: tathā sarveṣām bhadrakalpikānām anāgatānām tathāgatānām janetrī bhaviṣyāmi
translated: In the same way, I will be the mother of all the future Tathāgatas of the Auspicious Eon.

original: tadyathā maitreyasya bodhisattvasya tuṣitabhavanagatasya cyutisaṃdarśanakāle pravṛtte sarvabodhisattvopapattisaṃbhavagarbhasaṃvāsavikurvitasaṃdarśanaprabhāsāyāṃ raśmyāmutsṛṣṭāyāṃ prabhāsiteṣu sarvadharmadhātunayataleṣu yāvanti mama dharmadhātunayatalāni cakṣuṣo'vabhāsamāgamiṣyanti /
analyzed: tat yathā maitreyasya bodhisattvasya tuṣita bhavana gatasya cyuti saṃdarśana kāle pravṛtte sarva bodhisattva upapatti saṃbhava garbha saṃvāsa vikurvita saṃdarśana prabhāsāyām raśmyām utsṛṣṭāyām prabhāsiteṣu sarva dharmadhātu naya taleṣu yāvanti mama dharmadhātu naya talāni cakṣuṣā uvabhāsam āgamiṣyanti
translated: Just as when the Bodhisattva Maitreya, dwelling in the Tuṣita realm, at the time of displaying his passing away, emits the radiance called 'Illuminating the Womb of Bodhisattvas' Entry into Existence, Birth, and Abiding in the Womb, which illuminates all the realms of the Dharma-dhātu, and all the realms of the Dharma-dhātu that come within the range of my vision,

original: yeṣu maitreyeṇa bodhisattvena manuṣyaloke manuṣyendrakuleṣu janmopapattisaṃdarśanena sattvā vinayitavyāḥ /
analyzed: yeṣu maitreyeṇa bodhisattvena manuṣya loke manuṣya indra kuleṣu janma upapatti saṃdarśanena sattvāḥ vinayitavyāḥ
translated: in which realms the Bodhisattva Maitreya, by displaying birth and taking rebirth in the families of human kings, will guide beings,

analyzed: teṣu aham sarvatra bodhisattva jananī bhaviṣyāmi
translated: in all those places I will be the mother of the Bodhisattvas.

analyzed: yathā ca maitreyasya bodhisattvasya
translated: And just as for the Bodhisattva Maitreya,

analyzed: tathā siṃhasya yaḥ maitreyasya anantaram anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate
translated: so also for Siṃha, who will attain the highest complete enlightenment after Maitreya,
