translated: Pradyota, Ketu, Sunetra, Kusuma, Kusumasri, Tisya, Pushya, Sumanas, Vajra, Viraja, Chandrolkadharin, Yasho, Vajrasuchi, Ekardhasin, Sitanghri, Parangat, Ratnaarcishparvata, Maholikadharin, Padmottara, Vighushtaghosha, Aparimitagunadharma, Dipashri, Vibhushitanga, Suprayana, Maitrashri, Nirmita, Aniketa, Jvalitejas, Anantagho, Aninema, Anineta, Vimatavikiran, Parisuddha, Suvishalabha, Yashashuddhodita, Meghaghosha, Vicitra, Sarvaratnavicitravarnam, Manikundala, Sagaramate, Shubha, Ratnanihata, Malla, Paripurna, Manorahtha, Mahesha, Indrasha, Agnishat, Chandanamegha, Sitas, Vishalaksha, Shresthamati, Vibhavatimati, Avaropanaraja, Uttara,

original: iti hi kulaputra etān maitreyapramukhānanāgatāṃstathāgatān pramukhān kṛtvā sarveṣāṃ bhadrakalpikānāṃ tathāgatānāmarhatāṃ samyaksaṃbuddhānāmahameva jananī bhaviṣyāmi asyāṃ trisāhasramahāsāhasrāyāṃ lokadhātau /
analyzed: iti hi kula putraḥ etān maitreya pramukhān anāgatān tathāgatān pramukhān kṛtvā sarveṣām bhadrakalpikānām tathāgatānām arhatām samyaksaṃbuddhānām aham eva jananī bhaviṣyāmi asyām tri sāhasra mahā sāhasrāyām lokadhātau
translated: “Thus, noble sir, I will be the mother of all the Tathāgatas, Arhans, Perfect Buddhas of the auspicious eon, headed by Maitreya, in this great world system of a billion worlds, having made the Tathāgata Maitreya, who is to appear first, the leader.

analyzed: yathā ca iha lokadhātau
translated: And just as in this world system,🔽so also in the immeasurable world systems in the ten directions, penetrating the ways of the Dharma realm that are infinite and immeasurable.

original: tathā daśasu dikṣu aparimāṇeṣu lokadhātuṣu anantamadhyān dharmadhātunayānavataramāṇā yathā ca maitreyasya tathāgatasya anabhilāpyairguṇaviśeṣairjananī
analyzed: tathā daśasu dikṣu aparimāṇeṣu lokadhātuṣu ananta madhyān dharmadhātu nayān avataramāṇā yathā ca maitreyasya tathāgatasya an abhilāpyaiḥ guṇa viśeṣaiḥ jananī
translated: And just as I am the mother of the Tathāgata Maitreya, who has immeasurable special qualities,

original: evamanabhilāpyaguṇaviśeṣaiḥ siṃhasya evaṃ yāvadrocamasya tathāgatasya jananī bhaviṣyāmi /
analyzed: evam an abhilāpya guṇa viśeṣaiḥ siṃhasya evam yāvat rocamasya tathāgatasya jananī bhaviṣyāmi
translated: so also I will be the mother of the Tathāgata Siṃha, who has immeasurable special qualities, and so on up to the Tathāgata Rocana.

analyzed: yathā ca bhadrakalpikānām tathāgatānām
translated: And just as I am the mother of the Tathāgatas of the auspicious eon,

original: evamasmin sarvāvati kusumatalagarbhavyūhālaṃkāre lokadhātusamudre sarvalokadhātuvaṃśeṣu sarvalokadhātuprasareṣu sarvalokadhātuṣu sarvajambudvīpeṣvaparāntakoṭīgatān kalpān samantabhadrāyāṃ bodhisattvacaryāyāṃ caramāṇā sarvakalpeṣu sarvasattvaparipākavinayamadhiṣṭhāya sarveṣāmanāgatānāṃ tathāgatānāṃ bodhisattvabhūtānāṃ jananī bhaviṣyāmi //
analyzed: evam asmin sarvāvati kusuma tala garbha vyūha alaṃkāre lokadhātu samudre sarva lokadhātu vaṃśeṣu sarva lokadhātu prasareṣu sarva lokadhātuṣu sarva jambudvīpeṣu aparānta koṭī gatān kalpān samantabhadrāyām bodhisattva caryāyām caramāṇā sarva kalpeṣu sarva sattva paripāka vinayam adhiṣṭhāya sarveṣām anāgatānām tathāgatānām bodhisattva bhūtānām jananī bhaviṣyāmi
translated: In the same way, in this ocean of world realms called Kusumatalagarbhavyūha, in all the world systems, in all the world systems, in all the Jambudvīpas, for kalpas in the future, practicing the bodhisattva conduct of Samantabhadra, in all kalpas, having blessed the training and ripening of all beings, I will be the mother of all future Tathāgatas who are bodhisattvas.

original: evamukte sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhidārako māyādevīmetadavocatkiyaccirapratilabdhastvayā ayamārye mahāpraṇidhānajñānamāyāgatavyūho bodhisattvavimokṣaḥ /
analyzed: evam ukte sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhi dārakaḥ māyādevīm etat avocat kiyat cira pratilabdhaḥ tvayā ayam ārye mahā praṇidhāna jñāna māyā gata vyūhaḥ bodhisattva vimokṣaḥ
translated: When this was said, the merchant's son Sudhana said to Māyādevī, Noble one, how long ago did you attain this bodhisattva liberation called the array of the knowledge of great vows and illusions?

original: āhabhūtapūrvaṃ kulaputra atīte'dhvani acintyānāṃ cittaviṣayasamatikrāntānāmabhijātabodhisattvacakṣuṣpathavijñaptānāṃ vijñānagaṇanāsamatikrāntānāṃ pareṇa śubhaprabho nāma kalpo'bhūt /
analyzed: āha bhūta pūrvam kula putra atīta idhvani acintyānām citta viṣaya samatikrāntānām abhijāta bodhisattva cakṣuṣpatha vijñaptānām vijñāna gaṇanā samatikrāntānām pareṇa śubhaprabhaḥ nāma kalpaḥ bhūt
translated: She said, Son of good family, in the past, beyond inconceivable, mind-defying, sublime bodhisattva eye-paths, beyond the ability of the intellect to comprehend, there was a kalpa called Śubha-prabha.

original: tasmin khalu punaḥ śubhaprabhe kalpe merūdgataśrīrnāma lokadhāturabhūdviśuddhasaṃkliṣṭānekaratnamayī sacakravālasumerusāgarā pañcagatipracārā citrā darśanīyā /
analyzed: tasmin khalu punar śubhaprabhe kalpe merūdgataśrīḥ nāma lokadhātuḥ abhūt viśuddha saṃkliṣṭa aneka ratna mayī sa cakravāla sumeru sāgarā pañca gati pracārā citrā darśanīyā
translated: In that auspicious eon, there was a world system called Merudhvaja, which was pure and defiled, made of many jewels, with its Cakravāḍa mountains, Sumeru, and oceans, and the five destinies of beings, colorful and beautiful.

original: tasyāṃ khalu merūdgataśriyāṃ lokadhātau daśa cāturdvīpikakoṭīśatānyabhūvan /
analyzed: tasyām khalu meru udgata śriyām lokadhātau daśa cāturdvīpika koṭī śatāni abhūvan
translated: In that Merudhvaja world system, there were ten trillion four-continent worlds.

original: teṣāṃ khalu daśānāṃ cāturdvīpikakoṭīśatānāṃ madhye siṃhadhvajāgratejo nāma madhyamā cāturdvīpikābhūt /
analyzed: teṣām khalu daśānām cāturdvīpika koṭī śatānām madhye siṃhadhvajāgratejaḥ nāma madhyamā cāturdvīpikā bhūt
translated: In the middle of those ten trillion four-continent worlds, there was a central four-continent world called Siṃhadhvajagaṇitejas.

analyzed: yasyām aśīti rājadhānī koṭī śatāni abhūvan
translated: In that world, there were eight trillion capital cities.

original: teṣāṃ khalu aśītīnāṃ rājadhānīkotīśatānāṃ madhye dhvajāgravatī nāma madhyamarājadhānyabhūt /
analyzed: teṣām khalu aśītīnām rājadhānīkotīśatānām madhye dhvajāgravatī nāma madhyama rājadhānī abhūt
translated: In the middle of those eight trillion capital cities, there was a central capital city called Dhvajagravatī.

original: tasyāṃ mahātejaḥparākramo nāma rājā abhūccakravartī /🔽tasyāṃ khalu punardhvajāgravatyāṃ rājadhānyāṃ citramañjariprabhāso nāma bodhimaṇḍo'bhūt /
analyzed: tasyām mahātejaḥparākramaḥ nāma rājā abhūt cakravartī  tasyām khalu punar dhvajāgravatyām rājadhānyām citramañjariprabhāsaḥ nāma bodhimaṇḍaḥ bhūt
translated: In that city, there was a universal monarch named Mahātejasprabhāsa.🔽In that capital city of Dhvajagravatī, there was a bodhimanda called Citramañjarīprabhāsa.

analyzed: tatra netraśrīḥ nāma bodhimaṇḍa devatā abhūt
translated: In that bodhimanda, there was a bodhimanda deity named Netraśrī.

original: tasmin khalu punaścitramañjariprabhāse bodhimaṇḍe vimaladhvajo nāma bodhisattvo niṣaṇṇo'bhūt sarvajñatādharmādhigamāya /
analyzed: tasmin khalu punar citramañjariprabhāse bodhimaṇḍe vimaladhvajaḥ nāma bodhisattvaḥ niṣaṇṇaḥ abhūt sarvajña tā dharma adhigamāya
translated: At that time, on that Bodhimaṇḍa of Colorful Blossoming Light, a bodhisattva named Vimaladhvaja was seated, in order to attain the qualities of omniscience.

original: tasya sarvajñatādharmādhigamāntarāyāya suvarṇaprabho nāma māro mahāsainyaparivāro'ntardhitakāya upakrānto'bhūt /
analyzed: tasya sarvajña tā dharma adhigama antarāyāya suvarṇaprabhaḥ nāma māraḥ mahā sainya parivāraḥ antardhita kāyaḥ upakrāntaḥ bhūt
translated: In order to create obstacles for him in attaining the qualities of omniscience, a māra named Suvarṇaprabha, surrounded by a great army, appeared with a hidden body.

analyzed: sa ca mahā tejaḥ parākramaḥ cakravartī bodhisattva vaśitā pratilabdhaḥ bhūt mahā ṛddhi vikurvita niryātaḥ
translated: And that Mahātejaḥpārakrama Cakravartin had attained the mastery of a bodhisattva and had emerged through great miraculous transformations.

original: sa tato mahāsainyādvipulataramugrataraṃ ca mahāntaṃ balakāyamabhinirmāya taṃ bodhimaṇḍaṃ samantādanuparivārayāmāsa mārasainyaparājayāya /
analyzed: sa tatas mahā sainyāt vipulataram ugrataram ca mahāntam balakāyam abhinirmāya tam bodhimaṇḍam samantāt anuparivārayāmāsa māra sainya parājayāya
translated: He then created a great army even larger and more fierce than that great army and surrounded that Bodhimaṇḍa on all sides in order to defeat the māra army.

analyzed: tena hi mahatī māra senā vikīrṇā
translated: Thus, that great māra army was scattered.

original: tena ca bhagavatā vimaladhvajena tathāgatena anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhirabhisaṃbuddhā /
analyzed: tena ca bhagavatā vimaladhvajena tathāgatena anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ abhisaṃbuddhā
translated: And by that Blessed One, the Tathāgata Vimaladhvaja, unsurpassed perfect enlightenment was fully awakened to.

original: atha khalu netraśrībodhimaṇḍadevatā mahātejaḥparākramasya cakravartino'ntike putrasaṃjñāmutpādya tasya tathāgatasya caraṇayoḥ praṇipatya praṇidhānamakārṣītyatra yatrāhaṃ bhagavan utpadyeyam /
analyzed: atha khalu netra śrī bodhimaṇḍa devatā mahā tejaḥparākramasya cakravartinaḥ ntike putra saṃjñām utpādya tasya tathāgatasya caraṇayoḥ praṇipatya praṇidhānam akārṣi iti atra yatra aham bhagavan utpadyeyam
translated: Then, the Bodhi-tree goddess Netraśrī, having generated the perception of a son towards the universal monarch Mahātejaḥpārakrama, bowed at the feet of that Tathāgata and made a vow: Blessed One, wherever I am reborn,

original: tatra tatraiṣa me mahātejaḥparākramaścakravartī putro bhavet /
analyzed: tatra tatra eṣa me mahā tejaḥ parākramaḥ cakravartī putraḥ bhavet
translated: may this Mahātejaḥpārakrama be my son,

analyzed: yadā ca eṣaḥ unuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeta
translated: and when he attains perfect supreme enlightenment,

analyzed: tadā api aham etasya jananī bhaveyam
translated: may I be his mother.

original: saivaṃ praṇidhānaṃ kṛtvā tasminneva citramañjariprabhāse bodhimaṇḍe tasminneva śubhaprabhe kalpe daśa nayutāni tathāgatānāmārāgayāmāsa //
analyzed: sā evam praṇidhānam kṛtvā tasmin eva citramañjariprabhāse bodhimaṇḍe tasmin eva śubhaprabhe kalpe daśa nayutāni tathāgatānām ārāgayāmāsa
translated: Having made this vow, she worshipped ten nayutas of Tathāgatas in that very Splendorous Grove of Varied Blossoms Bodhi-tree, in that very auspicious eon.

original: tatkiṃ manyase kulaputraanyā sā tena kālena tena samayena netraśrīrnāma bodhimaṇḍadevatā abhūt /
analyzed: tat kim manyase kula putra anyā sā tena kālena tena samayena netraśrīḥ nāma bodhimaṇḍa devatā abhūt
translated: What do you think, noble son? Was that Bodhi-tree goddess named Netraśrī at that time, on that occasion, someone else?

original: na khalu punaste kulaputra evaṃ draṣṭavyam /
analyzed: na khalu punar te kula putra evam draṣṭavyam
translated: No, noble son, you should not see it like that.

original: ahaṃ sā tena kālena tena samayena netraśrīrnāma bodhimaṇḍadevatā abhūvam /
analyzed: aham sā tena kālena tena samayena netraśrīḥ nāma bodhimaṇḍa devatā abhūvam
translated: I was that Bodhi-tree goddess named Netraśrī at that time, on that occasion.

original: tatkiṃ manyase kulaputraanyaḥ sa tena kālena tena samayena mahātejaḥparākramo nāma cakravartyabhūdbodhisattvavaśitāpratilabdho maharddhikavikurvitaniryāto yena sā mahatī mārasenā vikīrṇā /
analyzed: tat kim manyase kula putra anyaḥ sa tena kālena tena samayena mahātejaḥparākramaḥ nāma cakravartī abhūt bodhisattva vaśitā pratilabdhaḥ maharddhika vikurvita niryātaḥ yena sā mahatī māra senā vikīrṇā
translated: What do you think, noble sir? Was there not another who at that time, on that occasion, was the universal monarch named Great Brilliance and Courage, who had attained the mastery of a bodhisattva, who had emerged through great magical transformations, and who scattered that great army of Mara?

analyzed: na khalu evam draṣṭavyam
translated: You should not see it like that.

original: ayaṃ sa bhagavān vairocanastathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ tena kālena tena samayena mahātejaḥparākramo nāma rājā cakravartyabhūt /
analyzed: ayam sa bhagavān vairocanaḥ tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ tena kālena tena samayena mahātejaḥparākramaḥ nāma rājā cakravartī abhūt
translated: The Blessed One, the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One Vairocana was at that time, on that occasion, the universal monarch named Great Brilliance and Courage.

original: sā ahaṃ kulaputra tata upādāya yatratatropapannāḥ /
analyzed: sā aham kula putra tatas upādāya yatra tatra upapannāḥ
translated: Noble sir, from then on, wherever I was reborn,

original: sarvatra eṣa mama putratvamupāgataḥ sarvabuddhakṣetreṣu bodhisattvacaryāṃ caran sarvagatimukheṣu sarvopapattimukheṣu sarvakuśalamūlamukheṣu sarvabodhisattvacaryāvicāraparākrameṣu sarvajātakanayeṣu sarvadevendrajanmasu sarvalokendragateṣu sarveśvarabhūmiṣu sarvagatiprabhāgeṣu /
analyzed: sarvatra eṣa mama putra tvam upāgataḥ sarva buddhakṣetreṣu bodhisattva caryām caran sarva gati mukheṣu sarva upapatti mukheṣu sarva kuśala mūla mukheṣu sarva bodhisattva caryā vicāra parākrameṣu sarva jāta kanayeṣu sarva deva indra janmasu sarva loka indra gateṣu sarva īśvara bhūmiṣu sarva gati prabhāgeṣu
translated: he became my son in all the buddha-fields, practicing the conduct of a bodhisattva in all the destinies, in all the gates of rebirth, in all the roots of virtue, in all the bodhisattva practices, in all the heroic efforts, in all the birth stories, in all the births as kings of the gods, in all the ways of the kings of the world, in all the stages of sovereignty, in all the directions.

analyzed: yatra yatra upapadyate sattva paripāka hetoḥ  sarvatra aham eva asya jananī abhūvam
translated: Wherever he was reborn, for the sake of ripening beings,🔽in all those places I was his mother.

original: carame ca bhave'sya ahameva sarvatrānugatā jananyabhūvam /
analyzed: carame ca aham eva sarvatra anugatā jananī abhūvam
translated: And in his final existence, I was his mother, following him everywhere.

analyzed: sarva bodhisattva janma mukheṣu kṣaṇe kṣaṇe yāvanti bodhisattva janma vikurvitāni ādarśayāmāsa
translated: In all the entrances to the births of bodhisattvas, moment by moment, as many birth transformations of bodhisattvas as there are were displayed.

analyzed: sarvatra aham eva asya mātā abhūvam
translated: In all those places, I was his mother.

analyzed: atītānām api tathāgatānām
translated: I was also the mother of the past thus-gone ones.

analyzed: ananta madhyānām aparimāṇānām aham jananī abhūvam
translated: I was the mother of the infinite, immeasurable, and boundless ones.

original: pratyutpannānāmapi daśasu dikṣu anantamadhyānāmaparimāṇānāṃ tathāgatānāmahameva jananītvaṃ pratyanubhavāmi /
analyzed: pratyutpannānām api daśasu dikṣu ananta madhyānām aparimāṇānām tathāgatānām aham eva jananī tvam pratyanubhavāmi
translated: I also experience motherhood for the infinite, immeasurable, and boundless thus-gone ones who are present in the ten directions.

original: yāvatāṃ ca tathāgatānāmahaṃ carame bhave bodhisattvamātā abhūvam /
analyzed: yāvatām ca tathāgatānām aham carame bhave bodhisattva mātā abhūvam
translated: And for as many thus-gone ones as there are, in my final existence I was the mother of the bodhisattva.

original: sarveṣāṃ ca teṣāṃ tathāgatānāṃ nābhimaṇḍalebhyo raśmayo niścaritvā mahākāyamāsanaṃ cāvabhāsayāmāsuḥ /
analyzed: sarveṣām ca teṣām tathāgatānām nābhi maṇḍalebhyaḥ raśmayaḥ niścaritvā mahā kāyam āsanam ca avabhāsayāmāsuḥ
translated: And from the centers of the navels of all those thus-gone ones, light rays emerged and illuminated the great body and seat.

analyzed: etam aham kula putra mahā praṇidhāna jñāna māyā gata vyūham bodhisattva vimokṣam prajānāmi
translated: Noble one, I know this bodhisattva liberation called the array of the coming and going of the knowledge of great vows.

original: kiṃ mayā śakyaṃ mahākaruṇāgarbhāṇāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ sarvajñatāparipākavinayāparitṛptakukṣīṇāṃ sarvatathāgatavikurvitaromamukhaniryātanidarśanavaśavartinā caryāṃ jñātuṃ guṇān vā vaktum //
analyzed: kim mayā śakyam mahā karuṇā garbhāṇām bodhisattvānām sarvajña tā paripāka vinaya a paritṛpta kukṣīṇām sarva tathāgata vikurvita roma mukha niryāta nidarśana vaśavartinā caryām jñātum guṇān vā vaktum
translated: What can I, a human, know of the conduct or qualities of the bodhisattvas who are filled with great compassion, whose bellies are never sated by the ripening of omniscience and the discipline of all tathagatas, who manifest the emanations of all tathagatas through the pores of their skin, and who have attained mastery?

analyzed: gaccha kula putra
translated: Go, son of noble family.

original: iyamihaiva tridaśendrabhavane surendrābhā nāma devakanyā smṛtimato devaputrasya duhitā /
analyzed: iyam iha eva tridaśa indra bhavane surendrābhā nāma deva kanyā smṛtimataḥ deva putrasya duhitā
translated: Here in the palace of the lord of the thirty-three gods, there is a celestial maiden named Surendrabha, the daughter of the god Smritin.

analyzed: tām upasaṃkramya paripṛccha katham bodhisattvena bodhisattva caryāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: Approach her and ask her how a bodhisattva should train in the conduct of a bodhisattva.

analyzed: katham pratipatavyam
translated: How should one practice?

original: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhidārako māyāyā devyāḥ pādau śirasābhivandya māyādevīmanekaśatasahasrakṛtvaḥ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya punaḥ punaravalokya māyādevyā antikātprakrāntaḥ // //
analyzed: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhi dārakaḥ māyāyāḥ devyāḥ pādau śirasā abhivandya māyādevīm aneka śata sahasra kṛtvas pradakṣiṇīkṛtya punar punar avalokya māyādevyāḥ antikāt prakrāntaḥ  /
translated: Then the merchant's son Sudhana bowed his head to the feet of the goddess Maya, circumambulated the goddess Maya many hundreds of thousands of times, looked at her again and again, and left the presence of the goddess Maya.

analyzed: sura indra ābhā
translated: Surendrabha.

original: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhidārako yena tridaśendrabhavanaṃ yena ca surendrābhā devakanyā smṛtimato devaputrasya duhitā /
analyzed: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhi dārakaḥ yena tridaśa indra bhavanam yena ca surendrābhā deva kanyā smṛtimataḥ devaputrasya duhitā
translated: Then the merchant's son Sudhana went to the palace of the lord of the thirty-three gods, to the celestial maiden Surendrabha, the daughter of the god Smritin.

analyzed: tena upajagāma
translated: He approached her.

original: upetya surendrābhāyā devakanyāyāḥ pādau śirasābhivandya surendrābhāṃ devakanyāmanekaśatasahasrakṛtvaḥ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya surendrābhāyā devakanyāyāḥ purataḥ prāñjaliḥ sthitva evamāhamayā ārye anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittamutpāditam /
analyzed: upetya surendrābhāyāḥ deva kanyāyāḥ pādau śirasā abhivandya surendrābhām deva kanyām aneka śata sahasra kṛtvas pradakṣiṇīkṛtya surendrābhāyāḥ deva kanyāyāḥ puratas prāñjaliḥ sthitvā evam āham ayā ārye anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpāditam
translated: Having approached, he bowed his head to the feet of the divine maiden Surendrabha, circumambulated the divine maiden Surendrabha many hundreds of thousands of times, and stood before the divine maiden Surendrabha with palms joined, and said, Noble one, I have given rise to the mind set on unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

original: na ca jānāmikathaṃ bodhisattvena bodhisattvacaryāyāṃ śikṣitavyam /
analyzed: na ca jānāmi katham bodhisattvena bodhisattva caryāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: But I do not know how a bodhisattva should train in bodhisattva conduct.

analyzed: katham pratipattavyam
translated: How should one practice?

original: śrutaṃ ca me āryā bodhisattvānāmavavādānuśāsanīṃ dadātīti /
analyzed: śrutam ca me āryā bodhisattvānām avavāda anuśāsanīm dadāti iti
translated: And I have heard, noble one, that you give instructions and counsel to bodhisattvas.

original: tadvadasva me devate kathaṃ bodhisattvena bodhisattvacaryāyāṃ śikṣitavyam /
analyzed: tat vadasva me devate katham bodhisattvena bodhisattva caryāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: Therefore, goddess, tell me how a bodhisattva should train in bodhisattva conduct.

analyzed: katham pratipattavyam
translated: How should one practice?

original: evamukte surendrābhā nāma devakanyā sudhanaṃ śreṣṭhidārakametadavocatahaṃ kulaputra asaṅgasmṛtiviśuddhavyūhasya bodhisattvavimokṣasya lābhinī
analyzed: evam ukte surendrābhā nāma deva kanyā sudhanam śreṣṭhi dārakam etat avocata ham kula putra asaṅga smṛti viśuddha vyūhasya bodhisattva vimokṣasya lābhinī
translated: When this was said, the divine maiden Surendrabha said to the merchant's son Sudhana, Son of good family, I have attained the bodhisattva liberation called 'unobstructed recollection of the pure array.'

original: sā ahaṃ kulaputra abhijānāmiutpalako nāma kalpo'bhūt /
analyzed: sā aham kula putra abhijānāmi utpalakaḥ nāma kalpaḥ bhūt
translated: Son of good family, I know that there was an eon named Utpalaka.

original: tatra me gaṅgānadīvālukāsamāstathāgatā ārāgitāḥ /🔽abhiniṣkrāmatāṃ caiṣāmārakṣā kṛtā /🔽pūjā kṛtā /
analyzed: tatra me gaṅgā nadī vālukā samāḥ tathāgatāḥ ārāgitāḥ  abhiniṣkrāmatām ca eṣām ārakṣā kṛtā  pūjā kṛtā
translated: There I pleased tathāgatas as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River.🔽And I protected them when they were leaving home.🔽I made offerings to them.

original: ārāmāśca kṛtāḥ paribhogāya /🔽yaśca tairbuddhairbhagavadbhirbodhisattvabhūtairmātuḥ kukṣigatairjāyamānaiḥ sapta padāni prakrāmadbhirmahāsiṃhanādaṃ nadadbhiḥ kumārabhūmisthitairantaḥpuramadhyagatairvā abhiniṣkrāmadbhirvā bodhimabhisaṃbudhyamānairvā dharmacakraṃ pravartayamānaiḥ sarvabuddhavikurvitaṃ vā saṃdarśayadbhiḥ sattvaparipākavinayaḥ kṛtaḥ /
analyzed: ārāmāḥ ca kṛtāḥ paribhogāya  yaḥ ca taiḥ buddhaiḥ bhagavadbhiḥ bodhisattva bhūtaiḥ mātuḥ kukṣi gataiḥ jāyamānaiḥ sapta padāni prakrāmadbhiḥ mahāsiṃhanādam nadadbhiḥ kumāra bhūmi sthitaiḥ antaḥpura madhya gataiḥ vā abhiniṣkrāmadbhiḥ vā bodhim abhisaṃbudhyamānaiḥ vā dharmacakram pravartayamānaiḥ sarva buddha vikurvitam vā saṃdarśayadbhiḥ sattva paripāka vinayaḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: And I made gardens for their enjoyment.

original: tatsarvaṃ prathamacittotpādāya yāvatsaddharmaparyantaniṣṭhaṃ prajānāmi smarāmi anusmarāmi dhārayāmi saṃdhārayāmi upadhārayāmi anusarāmi /
analyzed: tat sarvam prathama citta utpādāya yāvat saddharma paryanta niṣṭham prajānāmi smarāmi anusmarāmi dhārayāmi saṃdhārayāmi upadhārayāmi anusarāmi
translated: And I know, remember, recollect, hold, keep, uphold, and follow all the development and training of beings that was done by those Buddha Bhagavats when they were bodhisattvas, while they were in their mothers' wombs, while they were being born, while they were taking seven steps, while they were roaring the lion's roar, while they were dwelling on the stage of a child, while they were in the midst of the harem, while they were leaving home, while they were fully awakening to enlightenment, while they were turning the wheel of the Dharma, while they were displaying all the miracles of the Buddhas, from the time of their first production of the thought of enlightenment up to the final establishment of the true Dharma.

analyzed: subhūtiḥ nāma kalpaḥ bhūt
translated: There was an eon named Subhūti.

analyzed: tatra me daśa gaṅgā nadī vālukā samāḥ tathāgatāḥ ārāgitāḥ
translated: There I pleased tathāgatas as numerous as the sands of ten Ganges Rivers.

original: subhago nāma kalpo'bhūttatra me buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamāstathāgatā ārāgitāḥ /
analyzed: subhagaḥ nāma kalpaḥ bhūt tatra me buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samāḥ tathāgatāḥ ārāgitāḥ
translated: There was an eon named Subhaga, in which I pleased as many tathāgatas as there are atoms in a buddha-field.

analyzed: anilambhaḥ nāma kalpaḥ bhūt
translated: There was an eon named Anilamba,

analyzed: tatra me caturaśītiḥ buddha koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi ārāgitāni
translated: in which I pleased eighty-four hundred thousand koṭis of niyutas of tathāgatas.

original: suprabho nāma kalpo'bhūt tatra me jambudvīpaparamāṇurajaḥsamāstathāgatā ārāgitāḥ /
analyzed: suprabhaḥ nāma kalpaḥ bhūt tatra me jambudvīpa paramāṇu rajaḥ samāḥ tathāgatāḥ ārāgitāḥ
translated: There was an eon named Suprabha, in which I pleased as many tathāgatas as there are atoms in Jambudvīpa.

analyzed: atulaprabhaḥ nāma kalpaḥ bhūt
translated: There was an eon named Atulya-prabha,

analyzed: tatra me viṃśati gaṅgā nadī vālukā samāḥ tathāgatāḥ ārāgitāḥ
translated: in which I pleased as many tathāgatas as there are sands in twenty Ganges rivers.

analyzed: uttaptaśrīḥ nāma kalpaḥ bhūt
translated: There was an eon named Uttapta-śrī,

analyzed: tatra me gaṅgā nadī vālukā samāḥ tathāgatāḥ ārāgitāḥ
translated: in which I pleased as many tathāgatas as there are sands in the Ganges river.

analyzed: sūryodayaḥ nāma kalpaḥ bhūt
translated: There was an eon named Sūrya-udaya,

analyzed: tatra mā īśīti gaṅgā nadī vālukā samāḥ tathāgatāḥ ārāgitāḥ
translated: in which I pleased as many tathāgatas as there are sands in eighty Ganges rivers.

analyzed: jayaṃgamaḥ nāma kalpaḥ bhūt
translated: There was an eon named Jayan-gama,

analyzed: tatra me ṣaṣṭi gaṅgā nadī vālukā samāḥ tathāgatāḥ ārāgitāḥ
translated: in which I pleased as many tathāgatas as there are sands in sixty Ganges rivers.

analyzed: sucandraḥ nāma kalpaḥ bhūt
translated: There was an eon named Su-candra,

analyzed: tatra me saptatiḥ gaṅgā nadī vālukā samāḥ tathāgatāḥ ārāgitāḥ
translated: in which I pleased as many tathāgatas as there are sands in seventy Ganges rivers.

original: iti hi kulaputra anenopāyena gaṅgānadīvālukāsamān kalpānanusmarāmi /
analyzed: iti hi kula putra anena upāyena gaṅgā nadī vālukā samān kalpān anusmarāmi
translated: “Thus, noble one, by this method I remember as many eons as there are grains of sand in the Ganges River.

analyzed: yat aham satata samitam avirahitā abhūvam tathāgataiḥ arhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaiḥ
translated: I have always been inseparable from the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas.

original: sarveṣāṃ ca me teṣāṃ tathāgatānāmantikādayamasaṅgasmṛtiviśuddhavyūho bodhisattvavimokṣaḥ śrutaḥ /
analyzed: sarveṣām ca me teṣām tathāgatānām antikāt ayam asaṅga smṛti viśuddha vyūhaḥ bodhisattva vimokṣaḥ śrutaḥ
translated: And from all those tathāgatas I have heard this bodhisattva liberation called the pure array of unattached memory.

original: śrutvā ca ārāgitaḥ yathoktaṃ ca pratipannaḥ /
analyzed: śrutvā ca ārāgitaḥ yathā uktam ca pratipannaḥ
translated: Having heard it, I have delighted in it and practiced it as taught.

original: evaṃ cāhaṃ vimokṣaṃ satatasamitamanupraviṣṭā yacca teṣāṃ sarvatathāgatānāṃ bodhisattvabhūmimupādāya yāvatsaddharmasthitiparyantaniṣṭhaṃ buddhavikurvitaṃ tatsarvamanena asaṅgasmṛtiviśuddhavyūhena bodhisattvavimokṣeṇānusmarāmi dhārayāmi saṃdhārayāmi upadhārayāmi anusmarāmi /
analyzed: evam ca aham vimokṣam satata samitam anupraviṣṭā yat ca teṣām sarva tathāgatānām bodhisattva bhūmim upādāya yāvat saddharma sthiti paryanta niṣṭham buddha vikurvitam tat sarvam anena asaṅga smṛti viśuddha vyūhena bodhisattva vimokṣeṇa anusmarāmi dhārayāmi saṃdhārayāmi upadhārayāmi anusmarāmi
translated: Thus, I have always entered this liberation, and I remember, hold, uphold, and keep in mind all the enlightened activities of those tathāgatas, from the time they were in the bodhisattva stage up to the end of the duration of the true Dharma, through this bodhisattva liberation called the pure array of unattached memory.

analyzed: etam aham kula putra bodhisattva vimokṣam jānāmi
translated: “Noble one, I know this bodhisattva liberation.

original: kiṃ mayā śakyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ vigatatamondhakārāṇāṃ saṃsārarātriprabhāvitānāṃ vigatanivaraṇānāmanidrāgamānāṃ vigatastyānamiddhānāṃ prasrabdhakāyasaṃskārāṇāṃ sarvadharmasvabhāvānubodhasuviśuddhānāṃ daśabalaviśuddhibodhayitṝṇāṃ caryāṃ jñātuṃ guṇān vā vaktum //
analyzed: kim mayā śakyam bodhisattvānām vigata tamaḥ ndhakārāṇām saṃsāra rātri prabhāvitānām vigata nivaraṇānām anidrā gamānām vigataḥ styānam iddhānām prasrabdha kāya saṃskārāṇām sarva dharma svabhāva anubodha su viśuddhānām daśa bala viśuddhi bodhayitṝṇām caryām jñātum guṇān vā vaktum
translated: What am I able to know the conduct or describe the qualities of bodhisattvas who are free from the darkness of ignorance, who illuminate the night of saṃsāra, who are free from obscurations, who are free from sleep, who are free from indolence and drowsiness, whose bodily processes are relaxed, who have well-purified realization of the nature of all phenomena, who cause the realization of the purification of the ten powers?

analyzed: gaccha kula putra
translated: Go, son of noble family.

original: kapilavastuni mahānagare viśvāmitro nāma dārakācāryaḥ prativasati /
analyzed: kapilavastuni mahā nagare viśvāmitraḥ nāma dāraka ācāryaḥ prativasati
translated: In the great city of Kapilavastu, there dwells a teacher of young men named Viśvāmitra.

analyzed: tam upasaṃkramya paripṛccha katham bodhisattvena bodhisattva caryāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: Approach him and ask him how a bodhisattva should train in the conduct of a bodhisattva.

analyzed: katham pratipattavyam
translated: How should one practice?

original: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhidārakaḥ tuṣṭa udagra āttamanāḥ prītisaumanasyajāto'cintyakuśalamūlavegasaṃvardhitaḥ surendrābhāyā devakanyāyāḥ pādau śirasābhivandya surendrābhāṃ devakanyāmanekaśatasahasrakṛtvaḥ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya punaḥ punaravalokya surendrābhāyā devakanyāyā antikātprakrāntaḥ viśvāmitraḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhi dārakaḥ tuṣṭaḥ udagraḥ ātta manāḥ prīti saumanasya jāta ucintya kuśala mūla vega saṃvardhitaḥ surendrābhāyāḥ deva kanyāyāḥ pādau śirasā abhivandya surendrābhām deva kanyām aneka śata sahasra kṛtvas pradakṣiṇīkṛtya punar punar avalokya surendrābhāyāḥ deva kanyāyāḥ antikāt prakrāntaḥ viśvāmitraḥ deva kanyāḥ antikāt prakrāntaḥ viśvāmitraḥ deva kanyāḥ antikāt prakrāntaḥ viśvāmitraḥ deva kan
translated: Then the merchant’s son Sudhana, satisfied, elated, and delighted, his impetus of roots of goodness inconceivable, bowed his head to the feet of the deva maiden Surendrābhā, circumambulated the deva maiden Surendrābhā many hundreds of thousands of times, keeping her to his right, and, looking back again and again, took his leave of the deva maiden Surendrābhā and departed.

original: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhidārako tridaśendrabhavanādavatīrya anupūrveṇa yena kapilavastuni mahānagare viśvāmitro dārakācāryastenopajagāma /
analyzed: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhi dārakaḥ tridaśa indra bhavanāt avatīrya anupūrveṇa yena kapilavastuni mahā nagare viśvāmitraḥ dāraka ācāryaḥ tena upajagāma
translated: Then the merchant’s son Sudhana, having descended from the palace of the lord of the Thirty-Three Gods, eventually came to the great city of Kapilavastu, to the preceptor of young men Viśvāmitra.

original: upetya viśvāmitrasya dārakācāryasya pādau śirasābhivandya viśvāmitraṃ dārakācāryamanekaśatasahasrakṛtvaḥ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya viśvāmitrasya dārakācāryasya purataḥ prāñjaliḥ sthitvā evamāhamayā ārya anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittamutpāditam /
analyzed: upetya viśvāmitrasya dāraka ācāryasya pādau śirasā abhivandya viśvāmitram dāraka ācāryam aneka śata sahasra kṛtvas pradakṣiṇīkṛtya viśvāmitrasya dāraka ācāryasya puratas prāñjaliḥ sthitvā evam āham ayā ārya anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpāditam
translated: Having approached, he bowed his head to the feet of the preceptor of young men Viśvāmitra, circumambulated the preceptor of young men Viśvāmitra many hundreds of thousands of times, keeping him to his right, and, standing in front of the preceptor of young men Viśvāmitra with palms joined, said, “Ārya, I have given rise to the mind of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: na ca jānāmikathaṃ bodhisattvena bodhisattvacaryāyāṃ śikṣitavyam /
analyzed: na ca jānāmi katham bodhisattvena bodhisattva caryāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: I do not know how a bodhisattva should train in bodhisattva conduct.

analyzed: katham pratipattavyam
translated: How should one practice?

original: śrutaṃ ca me āryo bodhisattvānāmavavādānuśāsanīṃ dadātīti /
analyzed: śrutam ca me āryaḥ bodhisattvānām avavāda anuśāsanīm dadāti iti
translated: And I have heard that the noble one gives instructions and teachings to bodhisattvas.

original: tadvadatu me āryaḥkathaṃ bodhisattvena bodhisattvacaryāyāṃ śikṣitavyam /
analyzed: tat vadatu me āryaḥ katham bodhisattvena bodhisattva caryāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: Therefore, noble one, tell me how a bodhisattva should train in bodhisattva conduct.

analyzed: katham pratipattavyam
translated: How should one practice?

original: evamukte viśvāmitro dārakācāryaḥ sudhanaṃ śreṣṭhidārakametadavocatayaṃ kulaputra śilpābhijño nāma śreṣṭhidārako bodhisattvāllipijñānaṃ śikṣitaḥ
analyzed: evam ukte viśvāmitraḥ dāraka ācāryaḥ sudhanam śreṣṭhi dārakam etat avocat ayam kula putra śilpābhijñaḥ nāma śreṣṭhi dārakaḥ bodhisattvāt lipi jñānam śikṣitaḥ
translated: When this was said, the teacher of children Viśvāmitra said to the merchant boy Sudhana, Son of good family, this merchant boy named Śilpābhijña has learned the knowledge of writing from a bodhisattva.

analyzed: etam upasaṃkramya paripṛccha
translated: Approach him and ask him.

original: eṣa te nirdekṣyati yathā bodhisattvacaryāyāṃ śikṣitavyam /
analyzed: eṣa te nirdekṣyati yathā bodhisattva caryāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: He will show you how to train in bodhisattva conduct and

analyzed: yathā pratipattavyam
translated: how to practice.

analyzed: śilpa abhijñaḥ
translated: Śilpābhijña.

original: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhidārako yena śilpābhijño śreṣṭhidārakastenopasaṃkramya śilpābhijñasya śreṣṭhidārakasya pādau śirasābhivandya śilpābhijñasya śreṣṭhidārakasya purataḥ prāñjaliḥ sthitvā evamāhamayā ārya anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittamutpāditam /
analyzed: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhi dārakaḥ yena śilpābhijñaḥ śreṣṭhi dārakaḥ tena upasaṃkramya śilpābhijñasya śreṣṭhi dārakasya pādau śirasā abhivandya śilpābhijñasya śreṣṭhi dārakasya puratas prāñjaliḥ sthitvā evam āham ayā ārya anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpāditam
translated: Then the merchant’s son Sudhana went to the merchant’s son Śilpābhijña, bowed his head at the feet of the merchant’s son Śilpābhijña, stood before the merchant’s son Śilpābhijña with palms joined, and said, “Ārya, I have given rise to the mind of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: na ca jānāmi kathaṃ bodhisattvena bodhisattvacaryāyāṃ śikṣitavyam /
analyzed: na ca jānāmi katham bodhisattvena bodhisattva caryāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: But I do not know how a bodhisattva should train in bodhisattva conduct.

analyzed: katham pratipattavyam
translated: How should one practice?

original: śrutaṃ ca me āryo bodhisattvānāmavavādānuśāsanīṃ dadātīti /
analyzed: śrutam ca me āryaḥ bodhisattvānām avavāda anuśāsanīm dadāti iti
translated: And I have heard, Ārya, that you give instructions and teachings to bodhisattvas.

original: tadvadatu me āryaḥkathaṃ bodhisattvena bodhisattvacaryāyāṃ śikṣitavyam /
analyzed: tat vadatu me āryaḥ katham bodhisattvena bodhisattva caryāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: Therefore, Ārya, tell me how a bodhisattva should train in bodhisattva conduct.

analyzed: katham pratipattavyam
translated: How should one practice?”

analyzed: sā uvocata aham kula putra śilpa abhijñāvataḥ bodhisattva vimokṣasya lābhī
translated: He said, “Noble one, I have attained the bodhisattva liberation called ‘skill in the arts.’

original: tasya me kulaputra mātṛkāṃ vācayamānasya akāramakṣaraṃ parikīrtayato bodhisattvānubhāvena asaṃbhinnaviṣayaṃ nāma prajñāpāramitāmukhamavakrāntam🔽rakāraṃ parikīrtayato'nantatalasaṃbhedaṃ nāma prajñāpāramitāmukhamavakrāntam /
analyzed: tasya me kula putra mātṛkām vācayamānasya akāram akṣaram parikīrtayataḥ bodhisattva anubhāvena asaṃbhinnaviṣayam nāma prajñāpāramitā mukham avakrāntam  rakāram parikīrtayataḥ unantatalasaṃbhedam nāma prajñāpāramitā mukham avakrāntam
translated: When I, noble sir, was reciting the alphabet, as I pronounced the letter a, through the power of the bodhisattvas I entered the door of the perfection of wisdom called the range of unimpeded objects.🔽As I pronounced the letter ra, I entered the door of the perfection of wisdom called the infinite range of the plane of reality.

analyzed: pakāram parikīrtayataḥ dharmadhātutalasaṃbhedam nāma prajñāpāramitā mukham avakrāntam
translated: As I pronounced the letter pa, I entered the door of the perfection of wisdom called the range of the plane of reality of phenomena.

original: cakāraṃ parikīrtayataḥ samantacakravibhakticchedanaṃ nāma prajñāpāramitāmukhamavakrāntam /🔽nakāraṃ parikīrtayato'nilayapratilabdhaṃ nāma prajñāpāramitāmukhamavakrāntam /
analyzed: cakāram parikīrtayataḥ samantacakra vibhakticchedanam nāma prajñāpāramitā mukham avakrāntam  nakāram parikīrtayataḥ nilayapratilabdham nāma prajñāpāramitā mukham avakrāntam
translated: As I pronounced the letter ca, I entered the door of the perfection of wisdom called the division and cutting through of the wheel in all directions.🔽As I pronounced the letter na, I entered the door of the perfection of wisdom called attaining the absence of abode.

analyzed: lakāram parikīrtayataḥ vigatānālayavimalam nāma prajñāpāramitā mukham avakrāntam
translated: As I pronounced the letter la, I entered the door of the perfection of wisdom called the stainless absence of abode and separation.

analyzed: dakāram parikīrtayataḥ vaivartyaprayogam nāma prajñāpāramitā mukham avakrāntam
translated: As I pronounced the letter da, I entered the door of the perfection of wisdom called the irreversible practice.

analyzed: bakāram parikīrtayataḥ vajramaṇḍalam nāma prajñāpārabhitā mukham avakrāntam
translated: When he uttered the syllable ba, [he realized] the gateway of the perfection of wisdom called Vajra Mandala.

original: ḍakāraṃ parikīrtayataḥ samantacakraṃ nāma prajñāpāramitāmukhamavakrāntam /🔽sakāraṃ parikīrtayataḥ sāgaragarbhaṃ nāma prajñāpāramitāmukhamavakrāntam /
analyzed: ḍakāram parikīrtayataḥ samantacakram nāma prajñāpāramitā mukham avakrāntam  sakāram parikīrtayataḥ sāgaragarbham nāma prajñāpāramitā mukham avakrāntam
translated: When he uttered the syllable ḍa, [he realized] the gateway of the perfection of wisdom called Universal Wheel.🔽When he uttered the syllable sa, [he realized] the gateway of the perfection of wisdom called Ocean's Womb.

original: vakāraṃ parikīrtayataḥ samantavirūḍhaviṭhapanaṃ nāma prajñāpāramitāmukhamavakrāntam /🔽takāraṃ parikīrtayato jyotirmaṇḍalaṃ nāma prajñāpāramitāmukhamavakrāntam /
analyzed: vakāram parikīrtayataḥ samantavirūḍhaviṭhapanam nāma prajñāpāramitā mukham avakrāntam  takāram parikīrtayataḥ jyotiḥ maṇḍalam nāma prajñāpāramitā mukham avakrāntam
translated: When he uttered the syllable va, [he realized] the gateway of the perfection of wisdom called Universal Firm Establishment.🔽When he uttered the syllable ta, [he realized] the gateway of the perfection of wisdom called Light Mandala.

analyzed: yakāram parikīrtayataḥ saṃbheda kūṭam nāma prajñāpāramitā mukham avakrāntam
translated: When he uttered the syllable ya, [he realized] the gateway of the perfection of wisdom called Inseparable Peak.

analyzed: parikīrtayataḥ samantadāhapraśamanaprabhāsam nāma prajñāpāramitā mukham avakrāntam
translated: When he uttered the syllable ṣṭa, [he realized] the gateway of the perfection of wisdom called Universal Pacification of Burning and Illumination.

analyzed: kakāram parikīrtayataḥ usaṃbhinnamegham nāma prajñāpāramitā mukham avakrāntam
translated: When he uttered the syllable ka, [he realized] the gateway of the perfection of wisdom called Inseparable Cloud.

original: ṣakāraṃ parikīrtayato abhimukhapravarṣaṇapralambaṃ nāma prajñāpāramitāmukhamavakrāntam /🔽makāraṃ parikīrtayato mahāvegavicitravegaśikharaṃ nāma prajñāpāramitāmukhamavakrāntam /
analyzed: ṣakāram parikīrtayataḥ abhimukhapravarṣaṇapralambam nāma prajñāpāramitā mukham avakrāntam  makāram parikīrtayataḥ mahāvegavicitravegaśikharam nāma prajñāpāramitā mukham avakrāntam
translated: When he uttered the syllable ṣa, he entered the gateway of the perfection of wisdom called “The Rain That Falls Directly and Is Suspended.”🔽When he uttered the syllable ma, he entered the gateway of the perfection of wisdom called “The Peak of Great Speed and Various Speeds.”

analyzed: gakāram parikīrtayataḥ samantatalaviṭhapanam nāma prajñāpāramitā mukham avakrāntam
translated: When he uttered the syllable ga, he entered the gateway of the perfection of wisdom called “The Foundation of the Entire Surface.”

analyzed: thakāram parikīrtayataḥ tathatā saṃbheda garbham nāma prajñāpāramitā mukham avakrāntam
translated: When he uttered the syllable tha, he entered the gateway of the perfection of wisdom called “The Womb of the Undifferentiated Suchness.”

analyzed: jakāram parikīrtayataḥ jagat saṃsāra viśuddhi vigāhanam nāma prajñāpāramitā mukham avakrāntam
translated: When he uttered the syllable ja, he entered the gateway of the perfection of wisdom called “The Penetration of the Purification of the World’s Saṃsāra.”

analyzed: svakāram parikīrtayataḥ sarva buddha smṛti vyūham nāma prajñāpāramitā mukham avakrāntam
translated: When he uttered the syllable sva, he entered the gateway of the perfection of wisdom called “The Array of the Recollection of All Buddhas.”

analyzed: dhakāram parikīrtayataḥ dharmamaṇḍalavicāravicayam nāma prajñāpāramitā mukham avakrāntam
translated: When he uttered the syllable dha, he entered the gateway of the perfection of wisdom called “The Investigation of the Dharma-Sphere.”

analyzed: śakāram parikīrtayataḥ sarvabuddhānuśāsanīcakrarocam nāma prajñāpāramitā mukham avakrāntam
translated: When he uttered the syllable śa, he entered the gateway of the perfection of wisdom called “The Radiance of the Wheel of Instruction of All Buddhas.”

analyzed: khakāram parikīrtayataḥ abhisaṃskāra hetu bhūmi jñānagarbham nāma prajñāpāramitā mukham avakrāntam
translated: When he uttered the letter KHA, he entered the door of the perfection of wisdom called “The Womb of Knowledge of the Grounds and Causes of Transformation.”

analyzed: kṣakāram parikīrtayataḥ karma niśānta sāgarakośavicayam nāma prajñāpāramitā mukham avakrāntam
translated: When he uttered the letter KṢA, he entered the door of the perfection of wisdom called “The Treasury of the Ocean of the End of Karma.”

analyzed: stakāram parikīrtayataḥ sarvakleśavikiraṇaviśuddhiprabham nāma prajñāpāramitā mukham avakrāntam
translated: When he uttered the letter STA, he entered the door of the perfection of wisdom called “The Purity of the Scattering of All Afflictions.”

original: ñakāraṃ parikīrtayato lokasaṃbhavavijñaptimukhaṃ nāma prajñāpāramitāmukhamavakrāntam /🔽thakāraṃ parikīrtayataḥ saṃsārapraticakrajñānamaṇḍalaṃ nāma prajñāpāramitāmuikhamavakrāntam /
analyzed: ñakāram parikīrtayataḥ lokasaṃbhavavijñaptimukham nāma prajñāpāramitā mukham avakrāntam  thakāram parikīrtayataḥ saṃsāra prati cakra jñāna maṇḍalam nāma prajñāpāramitā muikham avakrāntam
translated: When he uttered the letter ÑA, he entered the door of the perfection of wisdom called “The Door of the Manifestation of the Origin of the World.”🔽When he uttered the letter THA, he entered the door of the perfection of wisdom called “The Wheel of Knowledge that is the Antidote to Samsara.”

analyzed: bhakāram parikīrtayataḥ sarvabhavanamaṇḍalavijñaptivyūham nāma prajñāpāramitā mukham avakrāntam
translated: When he uttered the letter BHA, he entered the door of the perfection of wisdom called “The Array of the Manifestation of the Palace of All Existences.”

original: chakāraṃ parikīrtayata upacayagarbhaprayogaṃ cāritracchatramaṇḍalabhedaṃ nāma prajñāpāramitāmukhamavakrāntam /
analyzed: chakāram parikīrtayataḥ upacaya garbha prayogam cāritra chatra maṇḍala bhedam nāma prajñāpāramitā mukham avakrāntam
translated: When he uttered the letter ṢA, he entered the door of the perfection of wisdom called “The Chariot of the Womb of Accumulation, the Umbrella of Conduct that Distinguishes the Circle.”

original: smakāraṃ parikīrtayataḥ savarbuddhadaśarnadigabhimukhāvartaṃ nāma prajñāpāramitāmukhamavakrāntam /🔽hvakāraṃ parikīrtayataḥ sarvasattvābhavyāvalokanabalasaṃjātagarbhaṃ nāma prajñāpāramitāmukhamavakrāntam /
analyzed: smakāram parikīrtayataḥ  hvakāram parikīrtayataḥ sarva sattva abhavya avalokana bala saṃjāta garbham nāma prajñāpāramitā mukham avakrāntam
translated: When he recited the letter sma, he entered the gateway of the perfection of wisdom called “Facing All Directions to See All Buddhas.”🔽When he recited the letter hva, he entered the gateway of the perfection of wisdom called “The Womb Born from the Power of Contemplating the Wombs of All Beings.”

analyzed: tsakāram parikīrtayataḥ sarva guṇa sāgara pratipatti avatāra vigāhanam nāma prajñāpāramitā mukham avakrāntam
translated: When he recited the letter tsa, he entered the gateway of the perfection of wisdom called “Plunging into the Practice of the Ocean of All Virtues.”

analyzed: ghakāram parikīrtayataḥ sarva dharma megha saṃdhāraṇa dṛḍha sāgaragarbham nāma prajñāpāramitā mukham avakrāntam
translated: When he recited the letter gha, he entered the gateway of the perfection of wisdom called “The Firm Ocean Womb that Holds the Clouds of All Dharmas.”

analyzed: ṭhakāram parikīrtayataḥ sarva buddha praṇidhāna diś abhimukha gamanam nāma prajñāpāramitā mukham avakrāntam
translated: When he recited the letter ṭha, he entered the gateway of the perfection of wisdom called “Facing All Directions to Go to the Vows of All Buddhas.”

analyzed: ṇakāram parikīrtayataḥ cakra akṣara ākāra koṭi vacanam nāma prajñāpāramitā mukham avakrāntam
translated: When he recited the letter ṇa, he entered the gateway of the perfection of wisdom called “The Words of the Ten Million Forms of the Wheel Syllable.”

analyzed: phakāram parikīrtayataḥ sarva sattva paripāka koṭī gata maṇḍalam nāma prajñāpāramitā mukham avakrāntam
translated: When he recited the letter pha, he entered the gateway of the perfection of wisdom called “The Mandala that Reaches the Peak of Ripening All Beings.”

analyzed: skakāram parikīrtayataḥ bhūmi garbha āsaṅga pratisaṃvid prabhā cakra spharaṇam nāma prajñāpāramitā mukham avakrāntam
translated: When he uttered the syllable sk, I attained the gateway of the perfection of wisdom called the radiance of the wheel of unobstructed discernment emanating from the womb of the earth.

analyzed: syakāram parikīrtayataḥ sarva buddha dharma nirdeśa viṣayam nāma prajñāpāramitā mukham avakrāntam
translated: When he uttered the syllable sy, I attained the gateway of the perfection of wisdom called the domain of teaching all the Buddhadharmas.

analyzed: parikīrtayataḥ sattva gagana dharma ghana nigarjita nirnāda spharaṇam nāma prajñāpāramitā mukham avakrāntam
translated: When he uttered the syllable śc, I attained the gateway of the perfection of wisdom called the pervasion of the thunderous roar of the dense Dharma of the sky of beings.

analyzed: ṭakāram parikirtayataḥ sattva artha nairātmya kārya atyanta pariniṣṭhā pradīpam nāma prajñāpāramitā mukham avakrāntam
translated: When he uttered the syllable ṭ, I attained the gateway of the perfection of wisdom called the lamp of the absolute completion of the selfless activity for the sake of beings.

analyzed: ḍhakāram parikīrtayataḥ dharmacakrasaṃbhedagarbham nāma prajñāpāramitā mukham avakrāntam
translated: When he uttered the syllable ḍ, I attained the gateway of the perfection of wisdom called the womb of the union with the wheel of Dharma.

original: iti hi kulaputra mama mātṛkāṃ vācayata etāni dvācatvāriṃśat prajñāpāramitāmukhapramukhānyaprameyāsaṃkhyeyāni prajñāpāramitāmukhānyāvakrāntāni
analyzed: iti hi kula putra mama mātṛkām vācayataḥ etāni dvācatvāriṃśat prajñāpāramitā mukha pramukhāni aprameya asaṃkhyeyāni prajñāpāramitā mukhāni āvakrāntāni
translated: Thus, noble son, as I was reciting the alphabet, I entered immeasurable and countless gateways of the perfection of wisdom, with the first forty-two being the foremost.

original: etasya ahaṃ kulaputra śilpābhijñāvato bodhisattvavimokṣasya lābhī /
analyzed: etasya aham kula putra śilpa abhijñāvataḥ bodhisattva vimokṣasya lābhī
translated: “Noble one, I have attained this bodhisattva liberation called the knowledge of the arts.

analyzed: etam aham jānāmi
translated: I know this.

original: kiṃ mayā śakyaṃ sarvalaukikalokottaraśilpasthānapāramitāprāptānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ caryāṃ jñātuṃ guṇān va vaktum /
analyzed: kim mayā śakyam sarva laukika lokottara śilpasthāna pāramitā prāptānām bodhisattvānām caryām jñātum guṇān vaktum
translated: How could I know the conduct or describe the qualities of the bodhisattvas who have attained the perfection of all the arts of the world and beyond?

original: yathā sarvaśilpasthānapraveśeṣu sarvalipisaṃkhyāgaṇanānikṣepapraveśeṣu sarvamantrauṣadhividhijñānaprayogaprativedheṣu sarvabhūtagrahajyotiṣāpasmārakākhordavetālapratiṣṭhāneṣu sattvadhātucikitsābhaiṣajyasaṃyogajñāneṣu dhātutantrasaṃyogaprayogeṣu suvarṇamaṇimuktāvaiḍūryaśaṅkhaśilāpravālalohitakamusāragalvakeśaraśrīgarbhāśmagarbhasarvaratnasaṃbhavotpattigotrākaramūlyajñāneṣu udyānatapovanagrāmanagaranigamarāṣṭrarājadhānyabhinirhāreṣu mṛgacakrāṅkavidyāsarvalakṣaṇanimittabhūmicāladigdāholkāpātakṣemākṣemasubhikṣadurbhikṣasarvalaukikāvartanivartapraveśeṣu sarvalokottaradharmavibhaktisūcanādinirdeśapraveśatattvānugamajñāneṣu nāstyāvaraṇaṃ vā vimarśo vā vimatirvā saṃdeho vā saṃśayo vā saṃmoho vā dhaṃdhāyitatvaṃ vā vyābādhikaṃ vā avasādanaṃ vā ajñānaṃ vā anabhisamayo vā //
analyzed: yathā sarva śilpasthāna praveśeṣu sarva lipi saṃkhyā gaṇanā nikṣepa praveśeṣu sarva mantra oṣadhi vidhi jñāna prayoga prativedheṣu sarva bhūta graha jyotiṣa apasmāraka ākhorda vetāla pratiṣṭhāneṣu sattva dhātu cikitsā bhaiṣajya saṃyoga jñāneṣu dhātu tantra saṃyoga prayogeṣu suvarṇa maṇi muktā vaiḍūrya śaṅkha śilā pravāla lohitaka musāragalva kesara śrīgarbha aśmagarbha sarva ratna saṃbhava utpatti gotra ākara mūlya jñāneṣu udyāna
translated: In all the entrances to the arts and crafts, in all the entrances to writing, calculation, enumeration, and record-keeping, in the knowledge of the application and penetration of all the methods of mantras and herbs, in the establishment of all spirits, planets, epilepsy, demons, and vetālas, in the knowledge of the combination of medical treatments for the realm of beings, in the application of the combination of elements, in the knowledge of the value of all the sources, roots, and origins of gold, jewels, pearls, beryl, conch shells, crystals, corals, red gems, musāragalva, kesara, śrīgarbha, and aśmagarbha gems, in the creation of parks, hermitages, villages, towns, markets, countries, and capitals, in the knowledge of the omens of all characteristics such as the wheel and deer on the soles of the feet, in the knowledge of the entry into the teaching of the indication of the division of all supramundane dharmas such as earthquakes, the burning of the directions, the falling of meteors, and what is auspicious and inauspicious, good and bad harvests, and all worldly events, there is no obstruction, no doubt, no uncertainty, no hesitation, no perplexity, no delusion.

analyzed: gaccha kula putra
translated: Go, son of noble family!

original: iyamihaiva magadhaviṣaye kevalake janapade vartanake nagare bhadrottamā nāmopāsikā prativasati /
analyzed: iyam iha eva magadha viṣaye kevalake janapade vartanake nagare bhadrottamā nāma upāsikā prativasati
translated: Here, in the Magadha country, in the Kevalaka region, in the city of Vartanaka, there lives a laywoman named Bhadrauttama.

analyzed: tām upasaṃkramya paripṛccha katham bodhisattvena bodhisattva caryāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: Approach her and ask her how a bodhisattva should train in the bodhisattva conduct,

analyzed: katham pratipattavyam
translated: and how one should practice.

original: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhidārakaḥ śilpābhijñasya śreṣṭhidārakasya pādau śirasābhivandya śilpābhijñaṃ śreṣṭhidārakamanekaśatasahasrakṛtvaḥ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya punaḥ punaravalokya śilpābhijñasya śreṣṭhidārakasyāntikātprakrāntaḥ // //
analyzed: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhi dārakaḥ śilpa abhijñasya śreṣṭhi dārakasya pādau śirasā abhivandya śilpa abhijñam śreṣṭhi dārakam aneka śata sahasra kṛtvas pradakṣiṇīkṛtya punar punar avalokya śilpa abhijñasya śreṣṭhi dārakasya antikāt prakrāntaḥ  /
translated: Then the merchant's son Sudhana bowed his head to the feet of the merchant's son Shilpabhijna, circumambulated Shilpabhijna the merchant's son many hundreds of thousands of times, looked at him again and again, and left the presence of the merchant's son Shilpabhijna.

analyzed: bhadrā uttamā
translated: Bhadrauttama.

original: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhidārako yena kevalake janapade vartanakaṃ nagaram /
analyzed: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhi dārakaḥ yena kevalake janapade vartanakam nagaram
translated: Then the merchant's son Sudhana went to the city of Vartanaka in the Kevalaka region,

analyzed: yena ca bhadrottamā upāsikā
translated: where the laywoman Bhadrauttama was,

analyzed: tena upajagāma
translated: and approached her.

original: upetya bhadrottamāyā upāsikāyāḥ pādau śirasābhivandya bhadrottamāmupāsikāmanekaśatasahasrakṛtvaḥ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya bhadrottamāyā upāsikāyāḥ purataḥ prāñjaliḥ sthitvā evamāhamayā ārye anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittamutpāditam /
analyzed: upetya bhadrottamāyāḥ upāsikāyāḥ pādau śirasā abhivandya bhadrottamām upāsikām aneka śata sahasra kṛtvas pradakṣiṇīkṛtya bhadrottamāyāḥ upāsikāyāḥ puratas prāñjaliḥ sthitvā evam āhamayā ārye anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpāditam
translated: He approached the upāsikā Bhadrauttamā, bowed his head at her feet, circumambulated the upāsikā Bhadrauttamā many hundreds of thousands of times, and stood before the upāsikā Bhadrauttamā with palms joined in homage. He said, Noble one, I have given rise to the mind set on unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: na ca jānāmikathaṃ bodhisattvena bodhisattvacaryāyāṃ śikṣitavyam /
analyzed: na ca jānāmi katham bodhisattvena bodhisattva caryāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: But I do not know how a bodhisattva should train in bodhisattva conduct.

analyzed: katham pratipattavyam
translated: How should one practice?

original: śrutaṃ ca me āryā bodhisattvānāmavavādānuśāsanīṃ dadātīti /
analyzed: śrutam ca me āryā bodhisattvānām avavāda anuśāsanīm dadāti iti
translated: I have heard, noble one, that you give instructions and counsel to bodhisattvas.

original: tadvadatu me āryākathaṃ bodhisattvena bodhisattvacaryāyāṃ śikṣitavyam /
analyzed: tat vadatu me āryā akatham bodhisattvena bodhisattva caryāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: Please tell me, noble one, how a bodhisattva should train in bodhisattva conduct.

analyzed: katham pratipattavyam
translated: How should one practice?

original: sā avocatahaṃ kulaputra anālayamaṇḍalaṃ nāma dharmaparyāyaṃ jānāmi deśayāmi /
analyzed: sā avocata ham kula putra anālayamaṇḍalam nāma dharmaparyāyam jānāmi deśayāmi
translated: She said, Son of noble family, I know and teach a Dharma discourse called the 'Unattached Sphere.'

analyzed: adhiṣṭhānaḥ ca me samādhiḥ pratilabdhaḥ
translated: And I have attained the concentration of blessing.

analyzed: na tatra samādhau kasyacid dharmasya adhiṣṭhānam
translated: In that concentration, there is no blessing of any dharma.

analyzed: tatra sarvajña tā cakṣuḥ pravartate adhiṣṭhānam sarvajña tā śrotram
translated: There, the eye of omniscience operates, the ear of omniscience is the basis.

analyzed: adhiṣṭhānam sarvajña tā āghrāṇam  adhiṣṭhānam sarvajña tā jihvā
translated: The nose of omniscience is the basis.🔽The tongue of omniscience is the basis.

analyzed: adhiṣṭhānaḥ sarvajña tā kāyaḥ
translated: The body of omniscience is the basis.

analyzed: adhiṣṭhānam tatra sarvajña tā manaḥ pravartate  adhiṣṭhānā sarvajña tā ūrmiḥ
translated: The mind of omniscience operates there on the basis of omniscience.🔽The waves of omniscience are based on the basis of omniscience.

analyzed: adhiṣṭhānā sarvajña tā vidyut
translated: The lightning of omniscience is based on the basis of omniscience.

analyzed: adhiṣṭhānāḥ sarvajña tā vegāḥ pravartante jagat rocanā maṇḍalāḥ  etam aham kula putra
translated: The impulses of omniscience, which delight the world, operate based on the basis of omniscience.

analyzed: an ālaya maṇḍalam dharmaparyāyam jānāmi
translated: I know this Dharma discourse, O son of noble family, called The Unwavering Circle.

analyzed: kim mayā śakyam asaṅga bodhisattva caryā sakalā jñātum
translated: How can I know the entire conduct of the bodhisattvas who are free from attachment?

analyzed: gaccha kula putra dakṣiṇāpathe
translated: Go, son of noble family, to the southern region.

analyzed: tatra bharukaccham nāma nagaram
translated: There is a city called Bharukaccha.

original: tatra muktāsāro nāma hairaṇyakaḥ prativasati /🔽tamupasaṃkramya paripṛcchakathaṃ bodhisattvena bodhisattvacaryāyāṃ śikṣitavyam /
analyzed: tatra muktāsāraḥ nāma hairaṇyakaḥ prativasati  tam upasaṃkramya paripṛccha katham bodhisattvena bodhisattva caryāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: There lives a goldsmith named Muktasara.

analyzed: katham pratipattavyam
translated: Approach him and ask him how a bodhisattva should train in the conduct of a bodhisattva, and how he should practice.

original: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhidārako bhadrottamāyā upāsikāyāḥ pādau śirasābhivandya bhadrottamāmupāsikāmanekaśatasahasrakṛtvaḥ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya punaḥ punaravalokya bhadrottamāyā upāsikāyā antikātprakrāntaḥ // //
analyzed: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhi dārakaḥ bhadrottamāyāḥ upāsikāyāḥ pādau śirasā abhivandya bhadrottamām upāsikām aneka śata sahasra kṛtvas pradakṣiṇīkṛtya punar punar avalokya bhadrottamāyāḥ upāsikāyāḥ antikāt prakrāntaḥ  /
translated: Then the merchant's son Sudhana bowed his head to the feet of the laywoman Bhadrauttama, circumambulated the laywoman Bhadrauttama many hundreds of thousands of times, keeping her to his right, and, looking back again and again, departed from the presence of the laywoman Bhadrauttama.
Muktasara.

original: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhidārako'nupūrveṇa dakṣiṇāpathaṃ gatvā yena bharukacche nagare muktāsāro hairaṇyakaḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhi dārakaḥ unupūrveṇa dakṣiṇāpatham gatvā yena bharukacche nagare muktā sāraḥ hairaṇyakaḥ
translated: Then the merchant's son Sudhana, going gradually through the southern region, approached the city of Bharukaccha, where the goldsmith Muktasara was.

original: tenopasaṃkramya muktāsārahairaṇyakasya pādau śirasābhivandya purataḥ prāñjaliḥ sthitvā evamāhamayā ārya anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittamutpāditam
analyzed: tena upasaṃkramya muktā sāra hairaṇyakasya pādau śirasā abhivandya puratas prāñjaliḥ sthitvā evam āham ayā ārya anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpāditam
translated: Having approached, he bowed his head to the feet of Muktasara the goldsmith, stood before him with palms joined, and said, Noble one, I have generated the mind of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment,

original: na ca jānāmi kathaṃ bodhisattvena bodhisattvacaryāyāṃ śikṣitavyam /
analyzed: na ca jānāmi katham bodhisattvena bodhisattva caryāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: but I do not know how a bodhisattva should train in bodhisattva conduct,

analyzed: katham pratipattavyam
translated: how one should practice.

original: śrutaṃ ca me āryo bodhisattvānāmavavādānuśāsanīṃ dadātīti /
analyzed: śrutam ca me āryaḥ bodhisattvānām avavāda anuśāsanīm dadāti iti
translated: And I have heard, noble one, that you give instructions and teachings to bodhisattvas.

original: tadvadatu me āryaḥkathaṃ bodhisattvena bodhisattvacaryāyāṃ śikṣitavyam /
analyzed: tat vadatu me āryaḥ katham bodhisattvena bodhisattva caryāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: May the noble one tell me how a bodhisattva should train in bodhisattva conduct,

analyzed: katham pratipattavyam
