translated: in the same way, the great maṇi-jewel of the womb of the ocean's array of generating the mind of enlightenment displays the ocean's array of the realm of omniscient knowledge.

original: tadyathā kulaputra cintārājamaṇiratnaṃ sthāpayitvā nāsti kiṃcitprativiśiṣṭataraṃ divyena jāmbūnadasuvarṇena /
analyzed: tat yathā kula putra cintārāja maṇi ratnam sthāpayitvā na asti kiṃcid prativiśiṣṭataram divyena jāmbūnada suvarṇena
translated: Just as, noble son, the maṇi-jewel called 'the wish-fulfilling king' has nothing superior to it except for divine gold from the Jambū River,

original: evameva sarvajñajñānacintārājamahāmaṇiratnaṃ sthāpayitvā nāsti kiṃcitprativiśiṣṭataraṃ bodhicittotpādadivyajāmbūnadasuvarṇena /
analyzed: evam eva sarvajña jñānacintā rāja mahā maṇi ratnam sthāpayitvā na asti kiṃcid prativiśiṣṭataram bodhi citta utpāda divya jāmbūnada suvarṇena
translated: In the same way, except for the great jewel of the omniscient wisdom-mind, there is nothing more distinguished than the divine gold of generating the enlightenment mind.

original: tadyathā kulaputra nāgamaṇḍalasiddha āhituṇḍikaḥ sarvanāgoragān vaśe sthāpayati /
analyzed: tat yathā kula putra nāga maṇḍala siddhaḥ āhituṇḍikaḥ sarva nāga uragān vaśe sthāpayati
translated: Just as, noble sir, a magician who has mastered the circle of the nāgas can bring all the nāga-serpents under his control,

analyzed: evam eva sarvajña tā citta utpāda pratipatti nāga maṇḍala siddhaḥ bodhisattva ahituṇḍikaḥ sarva kleśa nāga uragān vaśe sthāpayati
translated: in the same way, a bodhisattva-magician who has mastered the circle of the nāga of the mind of omniscience can bring all the nāga-serpents of afflictions under his control.

original: tadyathā kulaputra praharaṇagṛhītaḥ śūro durgharṣo bhavati śatrumaṇḍalena /
analyzed: tat yathā kula putra praharaṇa gṛhītaḥ śūraḥ durgharṣaḥ bhavati śatru maṇḍalena
translated: Just as, noble sir, a hero who has taken up a weapon is unassailable by the circle of enemies,

original: evameva sarvajñatācittotpādapraharaṇagṛhīto bodhisattvo durgharṣo bhavati sarvakleśaśatrumaṇḍalena /
analyzed: evam eva sarvajña tā citta utpāda praharaṇa gṛhītaḥ bodhisattvaḥ durgharṣaḥ bhavati sarva kleśa śatru maṇḍalena
translated: in the same way, a bodhisattva who has taken up the weapon of the mind of omniscience is unassailable by the circle of enemies of all afflictions.

original: tadyathā kulaputra divyoragasāracandanasya ekacūrṇadhāraṇaṃ sāhasraṃ lokadhātuṃ gandhena spharati /
analyzed: tat yathā kula putra divya uraga sāra candanasya eka cūrṇa dhāraṇam sāhasram lokadhātum gandhena spharati
translated: Just as, noble sir, a single atom of divine dragon's sandalwood incense fills a thousand world systems with its scent,

original: karṣapramāṇaṃ sarvatrisāhasre lokadhāturatnaparipūrṇena mūlyaṃ na kṣamate /
analyzed: karṣa pramāṇam sarva tri sāhasre lokadhātu ratna paripūrṇena mūlyam na kṣamate
translated: and a measure of a kārṣa of it cannot be valued at all by the jewels that fill the entire trichiliocosm,

analyzed: evam eva sarvajña tā citta utpāda divya uraga sāra candanasya eka adhyāśaya dhātuḥ sarva dharmadhātum guṇa gandhena spharati
translated: In the same way, the single element of the intention of the divine sandalwood of the generation of the mind of omniscience pervades the entire element of dharmas with the fragrance of its qualities.

analyzed: sarva śaikṣa aśaikṣa pratyekabuddha cittāni ca abhibhavati
translated: And it surpasses the minds of all learners, adepts, and pratyekabuddhas.

original: tadyathā kulaputra himavaccandanaṃ nāma mahācandanaratnaṃ sarvadāhaṃ praśamayati /
analyzed: tat yathā kula putra himavaccandanam nāma mahā candana ratnam sarva dāham praśamayati
translated: Just as, noble sir, the great sandalwood jewel called 'snow-mountain' pacifies all burning,

analyzed: sarvam ca āśrayam śītalīkaroti
translated: and cools the entire body.

analyzed: evam eva sarvajña tā citta utpāda himavat candana ratnam sarva kleśa saṃkalpa rāga doṣa moha dāham praśamayati
translated: In the same way, the great sandalwood jewel of the generation of the mind of omniscience pacifies the burning of all afflictions, conceptual thoughts, desire, hatred, and delusion,

analyzed: jñāna āśrayam ca prahlādayati
translated: and delights the basis of knowledge.

analyzed: tat yathā kula putra ye sumerum parvata rājam upasaṃkrāmanti
translated: Just as, noble sir, all those who approach Mount Sumeru, the king of mountains,

original: sarve te ekavarṇā bhavanti yaduta suvarṇavarṇāḥ /
analyzed: sarve te eka varṇāḥ bhavanti yat uta suvarṇa varṇāḥ
translated: all become one color, namely the color of gold.

analyzed: evam eva ye sarvajña tā citta utpāda samān bodhisattvān upasaṃkrāmanti
translated: In the same way, all those who approach the bodhisattvas who have the same generation of the mind of omniscience,

original: sarve te ekavarṇā bhavanti yaduta sarvajñatāvarṇāḥ /
analyzed: sarve te eka varṇāḥ bhavanti yat uta sarvajña tā varṇāḥ
translated: all become one color, namely the color of omniscience.

original: tadyathā kulaputra yaḥ pāriyātrakasya kovidārasya cchavigandhaḥ pravāti /
analyzed: tat yathā kula putra yaḥ pāriyātrakasya kovidārasya chavi gandhaḥ pravāti
translated: For example, noble sir, the fragrance of the pāriyātra and kovidāra flowers spreads.

original: sa sarvajambudvīpe sarvavārṣikājātisumanādīnāṃ puṣpajātīnāṃ na saṃvidyate /🔽evameva yo bodhisattvasya sarvajñatācittotpādabījapraṇidhivṛkṣaguṇajñānatvaco gandhaḥ pravāti /
analyzed: sa sarva jambudvīpe sarva vārṣikā jāti sumana ādīnām puṣpa jātīnām na saṃvidyate  evam eva yaḥ bodhisattvasya sarvajña tā citta utpāda bīja praṇidhi vṛkṣa guṇa jñāna tvacaḥ gandhaḥ pravāti
translated: Just as, noble sir, the fragrance of the bark of the pāriyātraka and kovidāra trees does not exist in all the flowers of the rainy season such as the vārṣikā, jāti, and sumanā.

analyzed: sa sarva pratyavara kuśala mūlānām sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddha vārṣikā jāti sumanānām anāsrava śīla samādhi prajñā vimukti vimukti jñāna darśanānām na saṃvidyate
translated: In the same way, the fragrance of the bark of the tree of the bodhisattva's resolve, which is the seed of the mind of complete knowing, does not exist in all the flowers of the wholesome roots of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, such as the rainy season flowers of morality, concentration, wisdom, liberation, and the vision of the awareness of liberation.

original: tadyathā kulaputra pāriyātrakasya kovidārasya śuṅgībhūtasya veditavyaṃ bahūnāṃ puṣpaśatasahasrāṇāmāyadvāraṃ bhaviṣyatīti /
analyzed: tat yathā kula putra pāriyātrakasya kovidārasya śuṅgībhūtasya veditavyam bahūnām puṣpa śata sahasrāṇām āya dvāram bhaviṣyati iti
translated: Just as, noble sir, when the pāriyātraka and kovidāra trees are in full bloom, it should be known that they are the source of many hundreds of thousands of flowers.

original: evameva sarvajñatācittotpādapāriyātrakavṛkṣasya kuśalamūlaśuṅgībhūtasya veditavyamasaṃkhyeyānāṃ devamanuṣyāṇāṃ sāsravanāsravabodhikusumāyadvāraṃ bhaviṣyatīti /
analyzed: evam eva sarvajña tā citta utpāda pāriyātraka vṛkṣasya kuśala mūla śuṅgī bhūtasya veditavyam asaṃkhyeyānām deva manuṣyāṇām sa āsrava anāsrava bodhi kusuma āya dvāram bhaviṣyati iti
translated: In the same way, when the pāriyātraka tree of the mind of complete knowing of the bodhisattva is in full bloom with the buds of wholesome roots, it should be known that it is the source of innumerable gods and humans, of the flowers of the knowledge of the hearers and solitary buddhas, and of the flowers of the knowledge of the transcendence of suffering.

original: tadyathā kulaputra yaḥ ekadivasaparibhāvitasya pāriyātrakusumairvastrasya tailasya vā gandhaḥ pravāti /
analyzed: tat yathā kula putra yaḥ eka divasa paribhāvitasya pāriyātra kusumaiḥ vastrasya tailasya vā gandhaḥ pravāti
translated: For example, noble sir, the fragrance of cloth or oil that has been infused with jasmine flowers for one day spreads,

original: sa divasatasahasraparibhāvitasya campakavārṣikāsumanābhivastrasya vā tailasya vā na saṃvidyate /
analyzed: sa campaka vārṣika sumanābhi vastrasya vā tailasya vā na saṃvidyate
translated: but the fragrance of cloth or oil that has been infused with champak or varṣika flowers for a thousand days does not exist.

original: evameva ya ekajanmaparibhāvitasya sarvajñatācittasaṃtānasya bodhisattvaguṇajñānagandho daśasu dikṣu sarvabuddhapādamūleṣu pravāti /
analyzed: evam eva yaḥ eka janma paribhāvitasya sarvajña tā citta saṃtānasya bodhisattva guṇa jñāna gandhaḥ daśasu dikṣu sarva buddha pāda mūleṣu pravāti
translated: In the same way, the fragrance of the knowledge and qualities of a bodhisattva whose stream of consciousness has been infused with the aspiration for omniscience for one lifetime spreads in the ten directions at the feet of all the Buddhas,

analyzed: sa kalpa śata sahasra paribhāvitānām sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddha cittānām anāsrava kuśala dharma jñāna gandhaḥ na saṃvidyate
translated: but the fragrance of the knowledge of the good qualities of the undefiled wholesome actions of the minds of all the disciples and solitary sages, even if infused for a hundred thousand eons, does not exist.

original: tadyathā kulaputra asti nālīkerī nāma vṛkṣajātiḥ udyatake samudre saṃbhūtā /
analyzed: tat yathā kula putra asti nālīkerī nāma vṛkṣa jātiḥ udyatake samudre saṃbhūtā
translated: For example, noble sir, there is a kind of tree called nālikera that grows in the ocean.

original: sā mūlata upādāya yāvatpuṣpaphalaparyantātsarvakālaṃ sarvasattvānāṃ na kadācinnopajīvyā bhavati /
analyzed: sā mūlataḥ upādāya yāvat puṣpa phala paryantāt sarvakālam sarva sattvānām na kadācid na upajīvyā bhavati
translated: From its roots up to its flowers and fruits, it is always useful to all beings at all times, and it is never useless.

original: evameva mahākaruṇāpraṇidhimūlasaṃjāto bodhisattvasya prathamasarvajñatācittotpādo yāvatsaddharmasthitiparyavasānāt sadevakasya lokasya na kadācinnopajīvyo bhavati /
analyzed: evam eva mahā karuṇā praṇidhi mūla saṃjātaḥ bodhisattvasya prathama sarvajña tā citta utpādaḥ yāvat saddharma sthiti paryavasānāt sa devakasya lokasya na kadācid na upajīvyaḥ bhavati
translated: In the same way, the bodhisattva's first generation of the mind of omniscience, which arises from the root of great compassion and aspiration, is never without support for the world with its gods as long as the true Dharma remains.

original: tadyathā kulaputra asti hāṭakaprabhāsaṃ nāma rasajātam /
analyzed: tat yathā kula putra asti hāṭakaprabhāsam nāma rasa jātam
translated: Good son, there is a substance called 'golden radiance'.

analyzed: tasya eka palam loha pala sahasram svarṇīkaroti
translated: One pala of it turns a thousand palas of iron into gold.

original: na ca tadrasapalaṃ śakyaṃ tena lohapalasahasreṇa paryādātuṃ na lohīkartum /
analyzed: na ca tat rasa palam śakyam tena loha pala sahasreṇa paryādātum na lohīkartum
translated: And that pala of substance cannot be destroyed or made iron again by that thousand palas of iron.

original: evameva ekasarvajñatācittotpādarasadhātuḥ kuśalamūlapariṇāmanājñānasaṃgṛhītaḥ sarvakarmakleśāvaraṇalohāni paryādāya sarvadharmān sarvajñatāvarṇān karoti /
analyzed: evam eva eka sarvajña tā citta utpāda rasa dhātuḥ kuśala mūla pariṇāmanā jñāna saṃgṛhītaḥ sarva karma kleśa āvaraṇa lohāni paryādāya sarva dharmān sarvajña tā varṇān karoti
translated: In the same way, the elixir of the generation of the mind of omniscience, which is included in the knowledge of dedicating roots of goodness, destroys all the iron of the obscurations of karma and afflictions and makes all dharmas the color of omniscience.

original: na ca sarvajñatācittotpādarasadhātuḥ śakyaṃ sarvakarmakleśalohaiḥ saṃkleśayituṃ paryādātuṃ vā /
analyzed: na ca sarvajña tā citta utpāda rasa dhātuḥ śakyam sarva karma kleśa lohaiḥ saṃkleśayitum paryādātum vā
translated: And the elixir of the generation of the mind of omniscience cannot be defiled or destroyed by all the iron of karma and afflictions.

original: tadyathā kulaputra kiyatparītto'pyagniryāvadupādānaṃ labhate tāvatīṃ jvālāṃ pramuñcati /
analyzed: tat yathā kula putra kiyat parīttaḥ api agniḥ yāvat upādānam labhate tāvatīm jvālām pramuñcati
translated: Good son, no matter how small a fire is, as long as it gets fuel it emits as much flame.

analyzed: evam eva kiyat parīttaḥ api sarvajña tā citta utpāda agniḥ ārambaṇa vyavakīrṇa tayā yāvat saṃbhāra upādānam labhate
translated: In the same way, even a very small fire of the generation of the mind of omniscience, when scattered over the object, obtains the collection of provisions.

analyzed: tāvat vivardhate jñāna arciḥ pramocana tayā
translated: To that extent it increases, by releasing the flames of knowledge.

analyzed: tat yathā kula putraḥ ekasmāt pradīpāt anekāni pradīpa koṭī śata sahasrāṇi ādīpyante
translated: Just as, son of noble family, from one lamp many hundreds of thousands of millions of lamps are lit,

original: akṣaya eva pradīpo bhavatyaparyādattaḥ sarvapradīpaniryāṇaiḥ evameva ekasmātsarvajñatācittotpādapradīpādatītānāgatapratyutpannānāṃ sarvatathāgatānāṃ sarvajñatācittotpādapradīpānāṃ dīpyamānānāmakṣaya eva sa ekaḥ sarvajñatācittotpādapradīpo'vabhāti aparyādattaḥ sarvajñatācittotpādapradīpaniryāṇaiḥ tadyathā kulaputra ekaḥ pradīpo yādṛśe gṛhe vātāyane vā praveśyate /
analyzed: akṣayaḥ eva pradīpaḥ bhavati a paryādattaḥ sarva pradīpa niryāṇaiḥ evam eva ekasmāt sarvajña tā citta utpāda pradīpāt atīta anāgata pratyutpannānām sarva tathāgatānām sarvajña tā citta utpāda pradīpānām dīpyamānānām akṣayaḥ eva saḥ ekaḥ sarvajña tā citta utpāda pradīpaḥ udabhāti a paryādattaḥ sarvajña tā citta utpāda pradīpa niryāṇaiḥ tat yathā kula putraḥ ekaḥ pradīpaḥ yādṛśe gṛhe vātāyane vā praveśyate
translated: the one lamp remains inexhaustible, not exhausted by the extinction of all the lamps. In the same way, from one lamp of the generation of the mind of omniscience, the lamps of the generation of the mind of omniscience of all Tathāgatas of the past, future, and present are lit, and that one lamp of the generation of the mind of omniscience shines inexhaustible, not exhausted by the extinction of the lamps of the generation of the mind of omniscience. Just as, son of noble family, one lamp, when placed in a house or a window,

original: sahapraveśito varṣasahasrasaṃcitamapi tamondhakāraṃ vidhamati avabhāsaṃ ca karoti /
analyzed: saha praveśitaḥ varṣa sahasra saṃcitam api tamaḥ ndhakāram vidhamati avabhāsam ca karoti
translated: immediately dispels the darkness that has accumulated for a thousand years and creates illumination.

analyzed: evam eva eka sarvajña tā citta utpāda pradīpaḥ yādṛśe sattva āśaya gṛha gahane vidyā tamaḥ ndhakāra anugate praveśyate
translated: In the same way, the lamp of the generation of the mind of one who is omniscient, when it is brought into the dense house of the intentions of beings, which is accompanied by the darkness of ignorance,

analyzed: sa saha praveśita unabhilāpya kalpa śata sahasra saṃcitam api kleśa āvaraṇa tamaḥ undhakāram vidhamati
translated: it dispels the darkness of the obscurations of afflictions that have accumulated for hundreds of thousands of inexpressible kalpas, as soon as it is brought in.

analyzed: jñāna ālokam ca saṃjanayati
translated: And it produces the light of knowledge.

original: tadyathā kulaputra yādṛśī pradīpavartirbhavati tādṛśaṃ pradīpo'vabhāsaṃ karoti /
analyzed: tat yathā kula putra yādṛśī pradīpa vartiḥ bhavati tādṛśam pradīpa uvabhāsam karoti
translated: Just as, noble sir, a lamp is of such a kind that it gives light in such a way,

original: yāvāṃśca snehasaṃcayo bhavati tāvaddīpyate /🔽evameva yasya bodhisattvasya yādṛśī praṇidhānavartiviśeṣatā bhavati /
analyzed: yāvān ca sneha saṃcayaḥ bhavati tāvat dīpyate  evam eva yasya bodhisattvasya yādṛśī praṇidhāna varti viśeṣa tā bhavati
translated: and it burns for as long as there is an accumulation of oil,

original: tādṛśaṃ sarvajñatācittotpādapradīpo dharmadhātvavabhāsaṃ karoti /🔽yāvacca mahākaruṇācaryāsnehasaṃcayo bhavati /
analyzed: tādṛśam sarvajña tā citta utpāda pradīpaḥ dharmadhātu avabhāsam karoti  yāvat ca mahā karuṇā caryā sneha saṃcayaḥ bhavati
translated: in the same way, the lamp of the generation of the mind of omniscience of a bodhisattva is of such a kind that it gives the light of the realm of totality in such a way,

analyzed: tāvat sattva vinaya kṣetra viśuddhi buddha kārya prabhāvanā bhavati
translated: and it purifies the fields of training beings and manifests the activities of a buddha for as long as there is an accumulation of the oil of great compassion.

original: tadyathā kulaputra divyajāmbūnadasuvarṇālaṃkāro vaśavartino devarājasya mūrdhnāvabaddho'saṃhāryo bhavati sarvakāmāvacarairdevaputraiḥ /
analyzed: tat yathā kula putra divya jāmbūnada suvarṇa alaṃkāraḥ vaśavartinaḥ devarājasya mūrdhnā avabaddhaḥ usaṃhāryaḥ bhavati sarva kāmāvacaraiḥ devaputraiḥ
translated: Just as, noble sir, the divine gold ornament made of Jāmbū River gold, fastened on the head of the king of the gods who controls others' emanations, cannot be taken away by any of the gods of the desire realm,

analyzed: evam eva pratipatti guṇa pratiṣṭhitaḥ sarvajña tā citta utpāda divya jāmbūnada suvarṇa alaṃkāraḥ vinivartanīyānām bodhisattvānām mahā praṇidhāna mūrdhnā avabaddhaḥ usaṃhāryaḥ bhavati sarva bāla pṛthagjana śaikṣa aśaikṣa pratyekabuddhaiḥ
translated: in the same way, the divine gold ornament of the generation of the mind of complete knowing, established in the qualities of practice, fastened on the head of the irreversible bodhisattvas, cannot be taken away by any of the childish ordinary beings, learners, adepts, or solitary realizers.

original: tadyathā kulaputra siṃhasya mṛgarājasya nādena acirajātāḥ siṃhapotāḥ puṣyanti /
analyzed: tat yathā kula putra siṃhasya mṛga rājasya nādena acira jātāḥ siṃha potāḥ puṣyanti
translated: Just as, noble sir, the lion cubs, born not long ago, flourish by the roar of the lion, king of beasts,

analyzed: sarva mṛgāḥ ca vilayam gacchanti
translated: and all the deer flee,

original: evameva tathāgatapuruṣasiṃhasya bodhicittasaṃvarṇanasarvajñatānādena prayuktena sarvādikarmikabodhisattvasiṃhapotāḥ puṣyanti buddhadharmaiḥ /
analyzed: evam eva tathāgata puruṣa siṃhasya bodhi citta saṃvarṇana sarvajña tā nādena prayuktena sarva ādi karmika bodhisattva siṃha potāḥ puṣyanti buddha dharmaiḥ
translated: in the same way, the lion cubs, the bodhisattvas who have newly begun to practice, flourish in the qualities of the buddhas by the roar of the generation of the mind of complete knowing, the lion's roar of the Tathāgata, the lion among men, when it is set forth.🔽And all beings who rely on perception flee.🔽

analyzed: sarva upalambha saṃniśritāḥ ca sattvāḥ vilayam gacchanti
translated: Noble sir, it is like this: For example, the great ocean is not easily crossed over by sentient beings who have no feet.🔽In the same way, the great ocean of the wisdom of the Tathāgata is not easily crossed over by sentient beings who have no feet, who have not generated the mind of complete knowing, who have not generated the mind of the Great Way, who have not generated the mind of the bodhisattvas, who have not generated the mind of the Great Way, who have not generated the mind of the bodhisattvas, who have not generated the mind of the Great Way, who have not generated the mind of the bodhisattvas, who have not generated the mind of the Great Way, who have not generated the mind of the bodhisattvas, who have not generated the mind of the Great Way, who have not generated the mind of the bodhisattvas, who have not generated the mind of the Great Way, who have not generated the mind of the bodhisattvas, who have not generated the mind of the Great Way, who have not generated the mind of the bodhisattvas, who have not generated the mind of the Great Way, who have not generated the mind of the bodhisattvas, who have not generated the mind of the Great Way, who have not generated the mind of the bodhis

analyzed: tat yathā kula putra siṃha snāyu kṛta vīṇā tantrī śabdena sarva vīṇā tantryaḥ saṃchidyante
translated: Just as, noble sir, when the strings of a lute are made of the sinews of a lion, all the strings are broken by the sound of the lute,

analyzed: evam eva pāramitā śarīra tathāgata siṃha bodhi citta utpāda snāyu tantrī guṇa varṇa śabdena sarva kāma guṇa rati vīṇā tantryaḥ saṃchidyante
translated: in the same way, when the strings of the lute of the qualities of the perfections are made of the sinews of the Tathāgata, the lion of enlightenment, by the sound of the qualities of the praises of the production of the thought of enlightenment, all the strings of the lute of the qualities of the pleasures of desire are broken,

analyzed: sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddha caryā guṇa kathāḥ ca saṃnirūdhyante
translated: and all the stories of the qualities of the practices of the Disciples and Solitary Sages are stopped.

analyzed: tat yathā kula putra go mahiṣī ajā kṣīra pūrṇa mahā samudre eka siṃha dugdha bindu prakṣepeṇa sarva kṣīrāṇi apakrāmanti
translated: Just as, noble sir, when a great ocean full of the milk of cows, buffaloes, goats, and ewes is sprinkled with a drop of lion’s milk, all the milk curdles,

analyzed: na saṃdhayati
translated: and does not coagulate.

original: evameva kalpaśatasahasrasaṃcitaḥ karmakleśakṣīramahāsamudraḥ tathāgatamahāpuruṣasiṃhasarvajñatācittotpādadugdhaikabinduprakṣepeṇa sarvo'navaśeṣaḥ kṣayaṃ gacchanti /
analyzed: evam eva kalpa śata sahasra saṃcitaḥ karma kleśa kṣīra mahā samudraḥ tathāgata mahāpuruṣa siṃha sarvajña tā citta utpāda dugdha eka bindu prakṣepeṇa sarvaḥ ūna avaśeṣaḥ kṣayam gacchanti
translated: In the same way, when a great ocean of the milk of actions and afflictions accumulated over a hundred thousand eons is sprinkled with a drop of the milk of the production of the thought of enlightenment of the Tathāgata, the great man, the lion of humanity, all of it without exception is destroyed,

analyzed: sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddha vimuktayaḥ ca na saṃtiṣṭhante
translated: and all the liberations of the Disciples and Solitary Sages do not remain.

analyzed: na saṃvasati
translated: do not remain together.

original: tadyathā kulaputra aṇḍakośādanirgatasya kalaviṅkapotasya yo nādabalaviśeṣaḥ sarvabalavegasaṃpannānāṃ himavannivāsināṃ sarvapakṣigaṇānāṃ na saṃvidyate /
analyzed: tat yathā kula putra aṇḍakośāt a nirgatasya kalaviṅka potasya yaḥ nāda bala viśeṣaḥ sarva bala vega saṃpannānām himavat nivāsinām sarva pakṣi gaṇānām na saṃvidyate
translated: Just as, noble sir, the special power of the voice of a young sparrow that has not yet come out of the egg is not found in all the flocks of birds living in the Himalayas, who are fully endowed with strength and speed,

original: evameva yaḥ saṃsārāṇḍakośagatasyādikarmikabodhisattvakalaviṅkapotasya mahākaruṇābodhicittanādabalaviśeṣaḥ sarvaśrāvakapratyekabuddhānāṃ na saṃvidyate🔽tadyathā kulaputra yo'cirajātasya mahāgaruḍendrapotasya pakṣavātabalaparākramo nayanapariśuddhiguṇaśca /
analyzed: evam eva yaḥ saṃsāra aṇḍa kośa gatasya ādi karmika bodhisattva kalaviṅka potasya mahā karuṇā bodhi citta nāda bala viśeṣaḥ sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddhānām na saṃvidyate  tat yathā kula putra yocira jātasya mahā garuḍa indra potasya pakṣa vāta bala parākramaḥ nayana pariśuddhi guṇaḥ ca
translated: in the same way, the special power of the voice of great compassion and the thought of awakening of a young sparrow-like beginner bodhisattva who is in the egg of cyclic existence is not found in all the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: sa sarvaśarīrapravṛddhānāṃ tadanyeṣāṃ pakṣiṇāṃ na saṃvidyate /🔽evameva yaḥ prathamacittotpādikasya tathāgatamahāgaruḍendrasya kulagotrasaṃbhavasya bodhisattvamahāgaruḍendrapotasya sarvajñatācittotpādabalaparākramo
analyzed: sa sarva śarīra pravṛddhānām tad anyeṣām pakṣiṇām na saṃvidyate  evam eva yaḥ prathama cittotpādikasya tathāgata mahāgaruḍa indrasya kula gotra saṃbhavasya bodhisattva mahāgaruḍa indra potasya sarvajña tā citta utpāda bala parākramaḥ
translated: Just as, noble sir, the power, valor, and the quality of clear vision of a young garuda king of birds who has been born not long ago is not found in all the other birds whose bodies have fully grown,

analyzed: sa kalpa śata sahasra niryātānām sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddhānām na saṃvidyate
translated: in the same way, the power, valor, and the quality of clear vision of the thought of omniscience of a young garuda king of bodhisattvas who has been born in the family lineage of the Tathagata, the king of garudas, and has generated the thought of awakening for the first time is not found in all the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas who have been practicing for a hundred thousand eons.

original: tadyathā kulaputra mahāpuruṣahastagato nārācaḥ kiyaddṛḍhamapi varma nirbhinatti /
analyzed: tat yathā kula putra mahāpuruṣa hasta gataḥ nārācaḥ kiyat dṛḍham api varma nirbhinatti
translated: Just as an arrow in the hand of a great man, no matter how strong the armor, pierces through.

analyzed: evam eva dṛḍhavīrya bodhisattva hasta gataḥ sarvajña tā citta utpāda nārācaḥ sarva dṛṣṭi anuśaya varmāṇi nirbhinatti
translated: In the same way, the arrow of the generation of the mind of omniscience in the hand of a bodhisattva of firm diligence pierces through all the armors of views and latent tendencies.

original: tadyathā kulaputra krodhāviṣṭasya mahānagnasya yāvallalāṭe piṭakāstiṣṭhanti /
analyzed: tat yathā kula putra krodha āviṣṭasya mahā nagnasya yāvat lalāṭe piṭakāḥ tiṣṭhanti
translated: Just as, noble sir, as long as blisters remain on the forehead of a great man possessed by anger,

analyzed: tāvat aghṛṣyaḥ bhavati sarva jambudvīpakaiḥ manuṣyaiḥ
translated: he is unassailable by all the men of Jambudvīpa.

original: evameva mahāmaitrīmahākarūṇāviṣṭasya bodhisattvamahānagnasya yāvadadhyāśayavadane sarvajñatācittotpādapiṭakā na vigacchanti /
analyzed: evam eva mahā maitrī mahā karūṇā āviṣṭasya bodhisattva mahānagnasya yāvat adhyāśaya vadane sarvajña tā citta utpāda piṭakāḥ na vigacchanti
translated: In the same way, as long as the blisters of the generation of the mind of omniscience do not disappear from the face of the great man of the bodhisattva possessed by great loving kindness and great compassion,

analyzed: tāvat aghṛṣyaḥ bhavati sarva lokadhātu paryāpannaiḥ sarva māraiḥ sarva karmabhiḥ ca
translated: he is unassailable by all the māras and all the actions included in all the world systems.

original: tadyathā kulaputra yaḥ śikṣitasyeṣvastrāntevāsina iṣvastrajñāne kṛtābhyāsasya śilpasthānayogabalaviśeṣaḥ /
analyzed: tat yathā kula putra yaḥ śikṣitasya iṣvastra antevāsinaḥ iṣvastra jñāne kṛta abhyāsasya śilpasthāna yoga bala viśeṣaḥ
translated: Just as, noble sir, the special strength of skill in the arts of one who has trained in archery and lived with archers and has practiced the knowledge of archery,

analyzed: sa sarva śikṣitasya iṣu astra ācāryasya na saṃvidyate
translated: that does not exist for one who has trained in all archery but is not an archery master.

original: evameva yaḥ sarvādikarmikasya sarvajñatābhūmyā kṛtābhyāsasya bodhisattvājāneyasya praṇidhijñānādhimukticaryābalaviśeṣaḥ /
analyzed: evam eva yaḥ sarva ādi karmikasya sarvajña tā bhūmyā kṛta abhyāsasya bodhisattva ajāneyasya praṇidhi jñāna adhimukti caryā bala viśeṣaḥ
translated: In the same way, the difference between the bodhisattva who is a beginner and the one who has practiced for the stage of omniscience is the difference in the power of the knowledge of vows, faith, and practice.

analyzed: saḥ unutpādita bodhi cittānām sarva śaikṣa aśaikṣa pratyekabuddhānām ca na saṃvidyate
translated: In the same way, the power of the vow, knowledge, faith, and practice of the bodhisattva who is not to be known, who has practiced the stage of omniscience from the very beginning, does not exist for those who have not given rise to the mind of awakening or for all the learners and accomplished ones, including the pratyekabuddhas.

original: tadyathā kulaputra iṣvastraṃ śikṣamāṇasya prathamaḥ padabandhayogyābhyāsaḥ pūrvaṃgamo bhavati sarveṣvastrajñānasya /
analyzed: tat yathā kula putraḥ iṣu astram śikṣamāṇasya prathamaḥ padabandha yogya abhyāsaḥ pūrvaṃgamaḥ bhavati sarva iṣu astra jñānasya
translated: Just as, noble sir, for one who is learning archery, the first practice of placing the foot correctly is the forerunner of the knowledge of all archery.

original: evameva bodhisattvasya sarvajñabhūmau śikṣamāṇasya prathamaṃ sarvajñatācittādhyāśayasaṃprasthānaṃ pūrvagamaṃ bhavati sarvabuddhadharmādhigamāya
analyzed: evam eva bodhisattvasya sarvajña bhūmau śikṣamāṇasya prathamam sarvajña tā citta adhyāśaya saṃprasthānam pūrva gamam bhavati sarva buddha dharma adhigamāya
translated: In the same way, for the bodhisattva who is learning the stage of omniscience, the first setting out with the superior intention of the mind of omniscience is the forerunner of the attainment of all the qualities of the Buddha.

original: tadyathā kulaputra māyākārasya māyāgataviṣayaṃ saṃdarśayamānasya prathamamantrapadasiddhyabhinirhārameva manasikurvāṇasya sarvakriyāsiddhirbhavati /
analyzed: tat yathā kula putra māyākārasya māyā gata viṣayam saṃdarśayamānasya prathama mantra pada siddhi abhinirhāram eva manasikurvāṇasya sarva kriyā siddhiḥ bhavati
translated: Just as, noble sir, for a magician who is displaying the magical scope of his art, if he is only thinking of the accomplishment of the first magical formula, he will accomplish all his actions.

original: evameva bodhisattvasya sarvabuddhabodhisattvaviṣayavikurvāḥ saṃdarśayataḥ prathamacittotpādapraṇidhānābhinirhāra evotthāpako bhavati sarvabuddhabodhisattvaviṣayasya
analyzed: evam eva bodhisattvasya sarva buddha bodhisattva viṣaya vikurvāḥ saṃdarśayataḥ prathama citta utpāda praṇidhāna abhinirhāraḥ eva utthāpakaḥ bhavati sarva buddha bodhisattva viṣayasya
translated: In the same way, when a bodhisattva displays the miracles of the domain of all the Buddhas and bodhisattvas, the generation of the first thought of enlightenment and the fulfillment of the vow are the basis of the domain of all the Buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: tadyathā kulaputra sarvamāyāvidyāmantrāścārūpiṇo'nidarśanāḥ sarvamāyānirmāṇarūpagatāni saṃdarśayanti cittotpādena /
analyzed: tat yathā kula putra sarva māyā vidyā mantrāḥ ca arūpiṇaḥ nidarśanāḥ sarva māyā nirmāṇa rūpa gatāni saṃdarśayanti citta utpādena
translated: Just as, noble sir, all magic spells and incantations, being formless and invisible, display all the forms of magical creations by the mere thought of them,

analyzed: evam eva sarvajña tā citta utpādaḥ ca ārūpya a nidarśanaḥ sarva dharmadhātum viṭhapayati sarva guṇa alaṃkāra vyūhaiḥ citta utpāda vaśitā mātreṇa
translated: in the same way, the thought of enlightenment of all-knowledge, being formless and invisible, creates the whole realm of phenomena by the mere power of the thought of enlightenment, with all its adornments of virtues.

original: tadyathā kulaputra mārjārasya sahadṛṣṭavicāramātreṇa sarvamūṣikā vilayamāpadyante /
analyzed: tat yathā kula putra mārjārasya saha dṛṣṭa vicāra mātreṇa sarva mūṣikāḥ vilayam āpadyante
translated: Just as, noble sir, all mice are destroyed by the mere sight of the cat,

analyzed: evam eva bodhisattvasya sarvajña tā citta utpāda adhyāśaya prayoga vicāra mātreṇa sarva karma kleśāḥ vilayam āpadyante
translated: in the same way, all the actions and afflictions of the bodhisattva are destroyed by the mere sight of the thought of enlightenment, the superior attitude, and the practice of all-knowledge.

original: tadyathā kulaputra jāmbūnadasuvarṇālaṃkāra ābaddhaḥ sarvābharaṇāni jihmīkaroti /
analyzed: tat yathā kula putra jāmbūnada suvarṇa alaṃkāraḥ ābaddhaḥ sarva ābharaṇāni jihmīkaroti
translated: Just as, noble sir, the ornament of gold from the Jambunāda river outshines all ornaments,

original: evameva bodhicittajāmbūnadasuvarṇālaṃkārādhyāśayāvabaddho bodhisattvaḥ sarvaśrāvakapratyekabuddhaguṇālaṃkārānabhibhavati jihmīkaroti /🔽tadyathā kulaputra ayaskāntarājasya kiyatparītto'pi dhātuḥ sarvadṛḍhamāyasaṃ bandhanaṃ sphoṭayati /
analyzed: evam eva bodhi citta jāmbūnada suvarṇa alaṃkāra adhyāśaya avabaddhaḥ bodhisattvaḥ sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddha guṇa alaṃkārān abhibhavati jihmīkaroti  tat yathā kula putra ayaskānta rājasya kiyat parīttaḥ api dhātuḥ sarva dṛḍham āyasam bandhanam sphoṭayati
translated: In the same way, the bodhisattva, whose intention is bound with the ornament of the gold of the thought of enlightenment, surpasses and outshines all the ornaments of the qualities of the disciples and the solitary buddhas.

original: evameva kiyatparītto'pyadhyāśayotpāditaḥ sarvajñatācittotpādadhātuḥ sarvadṛṣṭikṛtāvidyātṛṣṇābandhanāni sphoṭayati /🔽tadyathā kulaputra yatra yatraiva ayaskāntadhāturvicāryate /
analyzed: evam eva kiyat parīttaḥ api adhyāśaya utpāditaḥ sarvajña tā citta utpāda dhātuḥ sarva dṛṣṭi kṛta avidyā tṛṣṇā bandhanāni sphoṭayati  tat yathā kula putra yatra yatra eva ayaskānta dhātuḥ vicāryate
translated: Just as, noble sir, no matter how small a piece of the king of magnets is, it shatters all the bonds of iron it encounters, in the same way, no matter how small the piece of the element of the thought of enlightenment that is generated by the intention, it shatters all the bonds of views, ignorance, and craving.

analyzed: tatra tatra eva sarvāṇi itarāṇi ayāṃsi palāyante
translated: Just as, noble sir, wherever the element of the magnet is applied, all the other iron is repelled,

analyzed: na tiṣṭhante na saṃdadhati
translated: it does not remain, it does not stick,

original: evameva yatra yatraiva sarvajñatācittotpādadhāturvicāryate kārmeṣu vā kleśeṣu vā śrāvakapratyekabuddhavimuktau vā /
analyzed: evam eva yatra yatra eva sarvajña tā citta utpāda dhātuḥ vicāryate kārmeṣu vā kleśeṣu vā śrāvaka pratyekabuddha vimuktau vā
translated: in the same way, wherever the element of the thought of enlightenment is applied, whether to actions or afflictions, or to the liberation of the disciples and solitary buddhas,

original: tatastata eva karmakleśāḥ sarvaśrāvakapratyekabuddhavimuktayaśca palāyante na tiṣṭhanti /
analyzed: tatas tatas eva karma kleśāḥ sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddha vimuktayaḥ ca palāyante na tiṣṭhanti
translated: from there, from there, actions and afflictions, and all the liberations of the disciples and solitary buddhas, are repelled, they do not remain.

analyzed: na saṃdadhati
translated: They do not shoot.

original: tadyathā kulaputra makaraviddhāśritaḥ kaivartaḥ sarvodakaprāṇibhayavinirvṛto bhavatyanupaghātaśarīro makaramukhagato'pi /
analyzed: tat yathā kula putra makara viddha āśritaḥ kaivartaḥ sarva udaka prāṇi bhaya vinirvṛtaḥ bhavati anupaghāta śarīraḥ makara mukha gataḥ api
translated: Just as, noble sir, a fisherman who has a hook baited with a piece of meat does not fear the loss of his hand even when he has swallowed the meat,🔽in the same way, noble sir, a bodhisattva who has swallowed the hook of the aspiration for enlightenment, baited with the piece of meat of the highest wisdom, is not afraid of losing his hand, that is, of falling into the extinction of the disciples and solitary sages.🔽Just as, noble sir, a man who has drunk the elixir of immortality is not harmed by any poison or any human or nonhuman being,

analyzed: evam eva adhyāśaya bodhi citta viddha āśritaḥ bodhisattvaḥ sarva saṃsāra karma kleśa bhaya vinivṛttaḥ bhavati sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddha abhisamaya antara prāpti anughātyaḥ bhūta koṭī sākṣātkriyā praṇāśa patha āpatana tayā
translated: in the same way, noble sir, a bodhisattva who has drunk the elixir of the aspiration for omniscience is not harmed by any poison, that is, by any reactive emotions, or by any human or nonhuman being, that is, by any Māra or any adversary.

original: tadyathā kulaputra amṛtapānapītaḥ puruṣaḥ sarvaparopakramairna mriyate /
analyzed: tat yathā kula putra amṛta pāna pītaḥ puruṣaḥ sarva para upakramaiḥ na mriyate
translated: Just as, noble sir, a man who has drunk the elixir of immortality cannot be killed by any human or nonhuman being,

original: evameva sarvajñatācittotpādāmṛtapānapīto bodhisattvaḥ sarvaśrāvakabhūmiṣu na mriyate /🔽na coparamati bodhisattvamahākaruṇāpraṇidhānāt /
analyzed: evam eva sarvajña tā citta utpāda amṛta pāna pītaḥ bodhisattvaḥ sarva śrāvaka bhūmiṣu na mriyate  na ca uparamati bodhisattva mahā karuṇā praṇidhānāt
translated: in the same way, noble sir, a bodhisattva who has drunk the elixir of the aspiration for omniscience cannot be killed by any poison, that is, by any reactive emotions, or by any human or nonhuman being, that is, by any Māra or any adversary.🔽Just as, noble sir, a man who has drunk the elixir of immortality cannot be killed by any human or nonhuman being,🔽in the same way, noble sir, a bodhisattva who has drunk the elixir of the aspiration for omniscience cannot be killed by any poison, that is, by any reactive emotions, or by any human or nonhuman being, that is, by any Māra or any adversary.🔽Just as, noble sir, a man who has drunk the elixir of immortality cannot be killed by any human or nonhuman being,🔽in the same way, noble sir, a bodhisattva who has drunk the elixir of the aspiration for omniscience cannot be killed by any poison, that is, by any reactive emotions, or by any human or nonhuman being, that is, by any Māra or any adversary.🔽Just as, noble sir, a man who has drunk the elixir of immortality cannot be killed by any human or nonhuman being,

original: tadyathā kulaputra añjanasiddhaḥ puruṣaḥ sarvamanuṣyabhavaneṣu cānuvicarati na ca sarvamanuṣyairdṛśyate /
analyzed: tat yathā kula putra añjana siddhaḥ puruṣaḥ sarva manuṣya bhavaneṣu ca anuvicarati na ca sarva manuṣyaiḥ dṛśyate
translated: in the same way, noble sir, a bodhisattva who has drunk the elixir of the aspiration for omniscience cannot be killed by any poison, that is, by any reactive emotions, or by any human or

analyzed: evam eva bodhi citta utpāda prajñā praṇidhi upastabdhaḥ bodhisattvaḥ sarva māra viṣayeṣu ca anuvicarati
translated: In the same way, the bodhisattva, supported by the wisdom and aspiration prayers of generating the mind of enlightenment, moves about in all the realms of Māra.

analyzed: sarva māraiḥ ca na dṛśyate
translated: And he is not seen by any of the Māras.

original: tadyathā kulaputra mahārājasaṃniśritaḥ puruṣaḥ sarvaprākṛtajanāt na bibheti /
analyzed: tat yathā kula putra mahā rāja saṃniśritaḥ puruṣaḥ sarva prākṛta janāt na bibheti
translated: Just as, noble sir, a man who is supported by a great king is not afraid of any ordinary people,

analyzed: evam eva sarvajña tā citta utpāda mahā dharmarāja saṃniśritaḥ bodhisattvaḥ sarva āvaraṇa nivaraṇa durgatibhyaḥ na bibheti
translated: in the same way, the bodhisattva, who is supported by the great Dharma king of generating the mind of enlightenment that aims for omniscience, is not afraid of any obscurations, hindrances, or bad rebirths.

analyzed: tat yathā kula putra parvata gṛheṣu sarva bhūmi antargata pānīya bhayāt na asti agni bhayam
translated: Just as, noble sir, in mountain caves there is no fear of fire because of the water that is contained in all the ground,

analyzed: evam eva bodhi citta kuśala mūla abhiṣyandita saṃtānasya bodhisattvasya na asti śrāvaka pratyekabuddha vimukti jñāna agni bhayam
translated: in the same way, the bodhisattva, whose mindstream is moistened by the roots of virtue of the mind of enlightenment, has no fear of the fire of the knowledge of liberation of the hearers and solitary buddhas.

original: tadyathā kulaputra śūrasaṃniśritaḥ puruṣaḥ sarvaśatrubhyo na bibheti /
analyzed: tat yathā kula putra śūra saṃniśritaḥ puruṣaḥ sarva śatrubhyaḥ na bibheti
translated: Just as, noble sir, a man who is supported by a hero is not afraid of any enemies,

original: evameva sarvajñatācittotpādaśūrasaṃniśrito bodhisattvaḥ sarvaduścaritaśatrubhyo na bibheti /
analyzed: evam eva sarvajña tā citta utpāda śūra saṃniśritaḥ bodhisattvaḥ sarva duścarita śatrubhyaḥ na bibheti
translated: in the same way, the bodhisattva, who is supported by the hero of generating the mind of enlightenment that aims for omniscience, is not afraid of any enemies of bad behavior.

original: tadyathā kulaputra vajrapraharaṇagṛhītaḥ śakro devendraḥ sarvāsuragaṇaṃ pramardayati /
analyzed: tat yathā kula putra vajra praharaṇa gṛhītaḥ śakraḥ deva indraḥ sarva asura gaṇam pramardayati
translated: Just as Shakra, the lord of the gods, holding a vajra weapon, crushes all the hordes of asuras,

analyzed: evam eva sarvajña tā citta utpāda dṛḍha adhyāśaya vajra praharaṇa gṛhītaḥ bodhisattvaḥ sarva māra para pravādya sura gaṇam pramardayati
translated: in the same way, the bodhisattva, holding the vajra weapon of the firm resolve of the mind of omniscience, crushes all the hordes of asuras, the evil ones and opponents.

original: tadyathā kulaputra rasāyanopayuktaḥ puruṣo dīrghamāyuḥ pālayati na ca durbalībhavati /
analyzed: tat yathā kula putra rasāyana upayuktaḥ puruṣaḥ dīrgham āyuḥ pālayati na ca durbalībhavati
translated: Just as a person who has taken an elixir protects his long life and does not become weak,

original: evameva sarvajñatācittotpādarasāyanasaṃbhāraprayukto bodhisattvo'saṃkhyeyān kalpān saṃsāre saṃsaranna parikhidyate /
analyzed: evam eva sarvajña tā citta utpāda rasāyana saṃbhāra prayuktaḥ bodhisattvaḥ ūsaṃkhyeyān kalpān saṃsāre saṃsaran na parikhidyate
translated: in the same way, the bodhisattva who has applied himself to the elixir of the mind of omniscience, wandering in cyclic existence for countless eons, does not become weary.

analyzed: na ca saṃsāra doṣaiḥ lipyate
translated: And he is not tainted by the faults of cyclic existence.

original: tadyathā kulaputra sarvabhaiṣajyarasasaṃprayogeṣu pānīyaṃ pūrvaṃgamaṃ na kvacidduṣyati /
analyzed: tat yathā kula putra sarva bhaiṣajya rasa saṃprayogeṣu pānīyam pūrvaṃgamam na kvacid duṣyati
translated: Just as water is the forerunner in all the applications of medicinal herbs and does not become spoiled anywhere,

analyzed: evam eva sarva bodhisattva caryā praṇidhāna saṃbhāra yogeṣu sarvajña tā citta utpādaḥ pūrvaṃgamaḥ bhavati
translated: in the same way, the mind of omniscience is the forerunner in all the practices, vows, and applications of the bodhisattva,

analyzed: na kvacid duṣyati
translated: and it is not spoiled anywhere.

original: tadyathā kulaputra puruṣasya sarvakāryeṣu jīvitendriyaṃ pūrvaṃgamam /
analyzed: tat yathā kula putra puruṣasya sarva kāryeṣu jīvita indriyam pūrvaṃgamam
translated: Just as, noble sir, the life faculty is the forerunner of all the activities of a person,

analyzed: evam eva bodhisattvasya sarva buddha dharma ādāneṣu bodhi cittam pūrvaṃgamam
translated: in the same way, noble sir, the Awakening Mind is the forerunner of all the qualities of the Buddhas.

original: tadyathā kulaputra jīvitendriyavimuktaḥ puruṣo nirupajīvyo bhavati mātāpitṛjñātivargasya sarvakarmāsamarthatvāt /
analyzed: tat yathā kula putra jīvita indriya vimuktaḥ puruṣaḥ nirupajīvyaḥ bhavati mātā pitṛ jñāti vargasya sarva karma asamartha tvāt
translated: Just as, noble sir, a person who is separated from the life faculty is incapable of being sustained by mother, father, or relatives, because all activities are impossible,

original: evameva sarvajñatācittotpādaviyukto bodhisattvaḥ sarvajñatāguṇanirupajīvyo bhavati sarvasattvānāṃ buddhajñānapratilambhāsamarthatvāt /
analyzed: evam eva sarvajña tā citta utpāda viyuktaḥ bodhisattvaḥ sarvajña tā guṇa nirupajīvyaḥ bhavati sarva sattvānām buddha jñāna pratilambha asamartha tvāt
translated: in the same way, a bodhisattva who is separated from the mind of Awakening is incapable of being sustained by all sentient beings, because he is incapable of attaining the knowledge of a Buddha.

analyzed: tat yathā kula putra mahā samudraḥ sarva viṣaiḥ a dūṣyaḥ bhavati
translated: Just as, noble sir, the great ocean is not sullied by corpses,

analyzed: evam eva sarvajña tā citta utpāda mahā samudra udūṣyaḥ bhavati sarva karma kleśa śrāvaka pratyekabuddha citta utpāda viṣaiḥ
translated: in the same way, the great ocean of the mind of Awakening is not sullied by the corpses of actions, reactive emotions, the minds of Disciples and Solitary Sages, or the minds of those who have fallen into the Lesser Vehicle.

analyzed: tat yathā kula putra sūrya maṇḍalam aparyantaḥ sarva tārā avabhāsaiḥ
translated: Just as, noble sir, the orb of the sun is not sullied by the multitude of stars,

analyzed: evam eva sarvajña tā citta utpāda sūrya maṇḍalam a paryāpannam bhavati
translated: in the same way, the orb of the mind of Awakening is not sullied by the multitude of Disciples and Solitary Sages.

analyzed: sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddha tārā anāsrava guṇān abhibhavati
translated: He surpasses all the uncontaminated qualities of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: tadyathā kulaputra acirajāto rājaputro mūrdhaprāptān sarvavṛddhāmātyānabhibhavati kulābhijātyādhipatyena /
analyzed: tat yathā kula putra acira jātaḥ rāja putraḥ mūrdha prāptān sarva vṛddha amātyān abhibhavati kula abhijāti ādhipatyena
translated: Just as, son of noble family, a prince born not long ago surpasses all the aged ministers who have attained the highest rank by the power of his noble lineage,

analyzed: evam eva acira utpādita bodhi cittaḥ tathāgata dharmarāja kula pratyājātaḥ ādi karmikaḥ bodhisattvaḥ cira carita brahmacaryān vṛddha śrāvakān abhibhavati bodhi citta mahā karuṇā ādhipatyena
translated: in the same way, a bodhisattva who has generated the mind of awakening not long ago, born in the family of the Dharma king of the Tathāgatas, a beginner, surpasses the aged śrāvakas who have long practiced celibacy by the power of the great compassion of the mind of awakening.

original: tadyathā kulaputra kiyadvṛddhenāpyamātyena kiyadbālasyāpi rājakumārasya praṇipatitavyam /
analyzed: tat yathā kula putra kiyat vṛddhena api amātyena kiyat bālasya api rāja kumārasya praṇipatitavyam
translated: Just as, son of noble family, even if a minister is very aged, he should bow to a young prince.

original: na ca rājaputreṇa vṛddhāmātyasya gauravaṃ na karaṇīyam /
analyzed: na ca rāja putreṇa vṛddha amātyasya gauravam na karaṇīyam
translated: And the prince should not fail to show respect to the aged minister.

original: evameva kiyadvṛddhairapi ciracaritabrahmacaryaiḥ śrāvakapratyekabuddhairādikarmikasya bodhisattvasya avanamitavyam /
analyzed: evam eva kiyat vṛddhaiḥ api cira carita brahmacaryaiḥ śrāvaka pratyekabuddhaiḥ ādi karmikasya bodhisattvasya avanamitavyam
translated: In the same way, even if the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas are very aged and have long practiced celibacy, they should bow to a beginner bodhisattva.

original: na ca bodhisattvena pratyekabuddheṣu gauravaṃ na karaṇīyam /
analyzed: na ca bodhisattvena pratyekabuddheṣu gauravam na karaṇīyam
translated: And the bodhisattva should not fail to show respect to the pratyekabuddhas.

original: tadyathā kulaputra sarvāparibhūto rājaputro'virahito rājalakṣaṇena sarvāgratāprāptairapi rājāmātyairna samo jātyadhyakṣatvāt /
analyzed: tat yathā kula putra sarva a paribhūtaḥ rāja putraḥ virahitaḥ rāja lakṣaṇena sarva agra tā prāptaiḥ api rāja amātyaiḥ na samaḥ jāti adhyakṣa tvāt
translated: For example, noble sir, a prince who is insulted by everyone, but who is not separated from the characteristics of a prince, is not equal to even the most eminent of the king's ministers, because of his status as the king's son.

original: evameva kiyatkarmakleśopādānaparibhūta ādikarmiko bodhisattvaḥ sarvajñatācittotpādalakṣaṇenāvirahitaḥ sarvāgraprāptairapi sarvaśrāvakapratyekabuddhairna samo buddhakulādhipatyādhyakṣatvāt /
analyzed: evam eva kiyat karma kleśa upādāna paribhūtaḥ ādikarmikaḥ bodhisattvaḥ sarvajña tā citta utpāda lakṣaṇena avirahitaḥ sarva agra prāptaiḥ api sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddhaiḥ na samaḥ buddha kula ādhipatya adhyakṣa tvāt
translated: In the same way, a beginner bodhisattva, who is insulted by taking on so much karma and reactive emotions, but who is not separated from the characteristic of generating the mind of complete knowing, is not equal to even the most eminent of all the disciples and hermit buddhas, because of his status as the heir of the Buddha.

analyzed: tat yathā kula putra pariśuddha maṇi ratnam cakṣuḥ timira doṣeṇa a pariśuddham iti ābhāsam āgacchati
translated: For example, noble sir, a pure jewel, because of a defect in the eye, appears impure.

analyzed: evam eva prakṛti pariśuddham sarvajña tā citta utpāda ratnam sattvāḥ aśraddhā nayana ajñāna timira doṣeṇa a pariśuddham iti saṃjānanti
translated: In the same way, the jewel of generating the mind of complete knowing, which is naturally pure, is thought of as impure because of the defect of the eye of lack of faith and lack of understanding in sentient beings.

original: tadyathā kulaputra sarvavidyauṣadhisaṃgrahasaṃprayukto bhaiṣajyavigraho darśanasparśanasaṃvāsanaiḥ sattvānāṃ vyādhīn śamayati /
analyzed: tat yathā kula putra sarva vidyā oṣadhi saṃgraha saṃprayuktaḥ bhaiṣajya vigrahaḥ darśana sparśana saṃvāsanaiḥ sattvānām vyādhīn śamayati
translated: For example, noble sir, a medicinal plant, which is a combination of all effective herbs, cures the sicknesses of sentient beings by being seen, touched, or ingested.

original: evameva sarvakuśalamūlopacayaprajñopāyavidyauṣadhisaṃgṛhītaṃ bodhicittasaṃprayuktaṃ bodhisattvapraṇidhijñānaśarīraṃ śravaṇadarśanasaṃvāsanānusmṛtiprayogena sattvānāṃ kleśavyādhīn praśamati /
analyzed: evam eva sarva kuśala mūla upacaya prajñā upāya vidyā oṣadhi saṃgṛhītam bodhi citta saṃprayuktam bodhisattva praṇidhi jñāna śarīram śravaṇa darśana saṃvāsana anusmṛti prayogena sattvānām kleśa vyādhīn praśamati
translated: In the same way, the body of the bodhisattva's vow-knowledge, which is endowed with the thought of enlightenment and is included in the collection of the wisdom and means of accumulating all roots of merit, alleviates the sicknesses of the afflictions of beings through the practice of hearing, seeing, associating with, and recollecting.

original: tadyathā kulaputra haṃsalakṣaṇaṃ vastraṃ sarvakardamadoṣairna kliśyate /
analyzed: tat yathā kula putra haṃsa lakṣaṇam vastram sarva kardama doṣaiḥ na kliśyate
translated: Just as, noble sir, a cloth with the characteristics of a swan is not soiled by any mud or stains,

analyzed: evam eva bodhi citta utpāda haṃsa lakṣaṇa vastram saṃsāra kleśa kardama doṣaiḥ na kliśyate
translated: in the same way, the cloth with the characteristics of a swan, the thought of enlightenment, is not soiled by the mud and stains of the afflictions of saṃsāra.

original: tadyathā kulaputra mūrdhaśalyasaṃgṛhīto dāruvigraho na vikīryate /
analyzed: tat yathā kula putra mūrdha śalya saṃgṛhītaḥ dāru vigrahaḥ na vikīryate
translated: Just as, noble sir, a wooden figure, held together by a central pole, is not scattered,

analyzed: sarva kriyāḥ ca anubhavati
translated: and is able to perform all actions,

analyzed: evam eva bodhi citta utpāda praṇidhi mūrdha śalya saṃgṛhītam sarvajña tā praṇidhi jñāna śarīram bodhisattva kriyā samartham bhavati
translated: in the same way, the body of the vow-knowledge of omniscience, held together by the central pole of the vow of the thought of enlightenment, is able to perform the actions of the bodhisattva,

analyzed: na ca vikīryate sarvajña tā praṇidhi śarīra tvāt
translated: and is not scattered, because it is the body of the vow of omniscience.

original: tadyathā kulaputra śalyavimuktaṃ yantramakāryasamarthaṃ bhavati tānyeva dārupratyaṅgāni /
analyzed: tat yathā kula putra śalya vimuktam yantram akārya samartham bhavati tāni eva dāru pratyaṅgāni
translated: Just as, noble sir, the same wooden parts, when freed from the central pole, are unable to perform any function,

analyzed: evam eva sarvajña tā citta utpāda adhyāśaya viyuktaḥ bodhisattvaḥ buddha dharma pariniṣpādanā samarthaḥ bhavati
translated: In the same way, a bodhisattva who is separated from the superior intention of the thought of enlightenment is unable to perfect the qualities of a Buddha.

analyzed: evam ca te bodhyaṅga saṃbhārāḥ
translated: And so these are the accumulations for the limbs of enlightenment.

original: tadyathā kulaputra rājñaścakravartino hastigarbhaṃ nāma kālāgaruratnam /
analyzed: tat yathā kula putra rājñaḥ cakravartinaḥ hastigarbham nāma kālāgaru ratnam
translated: Son of noble family, it is like the precious black aloes wood called elephant's womb of a universal monarch.

original: tena saha dhūpitamātraḥ sarvarājñaścaturaṅgabalakāyo vihāyase tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: tena saha dhūpita mātraḥ sarva rājñaḥ caturaṅga balakāyaḥ vihāyase tiṣṭhati
translated: As soon as it is burned, the four-division army of all kings stands in the sky.

original: evameva sarvajñatācittotpādāgarudhūpitāni bodhisattvasya kuśalamūlāni sarvatraidhātukavyativṛttāni bhavanti asaṃskṛtasarvatathāgatajñānagaganagocaraparyavasānāni
analyzed: evam eva sarvajña tā citta utpāda agaru dhūpitāni bodhisattvasya kuśala mūlāni sarva traidhātuka vyativṛttāni bhavanti a saṃskṛta sarva tathāgata jñāna gagana gocara paryavasānāni
translated: In the same way, the roots of virtue of a bodhisattva perfumed by the black aloes wood of the thought of enlightenment transcend the entire three realms, and end in the sky-like sphere of the unconditioned wisdom of all the Tathāgatas.

analyzed: tat yathā kula putra vajram na itarāt ratna ākarāt utpadyate nyatra vajra ākarāt suvarṇa ākarāt vā
translated: Son of noble family, it is like a diamond, which does not come from any other jewel mine, but only from the diamond mine or the gold mine.

analyzed: evam eva vajra upamaḥ sarvajña tā citta utpādaḥ
translated: In the same way, the thought of enlightenment, which is like a diamond,

analyzed: sa na itarāt sattva āśaya kuśala mūla ratna ākarāt utpadyate nyatra sattva paritrāṇa mahā karuṇā vajra ākarāt sarvajña jñāna adhyālambana mahā suvarṇa ākarāt vā
translated: It does not arise from any other source than the mine of the roots of virtue of the aspiration for enlightenment, except from the mine of the vajra of great compassion that saves all beings, or from the mine of the great gold of the aspiration for omniscience.

analyzed: tat yathā kula putra asti amūlā nāma vṛkṣa jātiḥ
translated: Good son, there is a kind of tree called rootless.

original: tasya mūlapratiṣṭhānaṃ nopalabhyate sarvaśākhāpatrapalāśasaṃkusumitā ca vṛkṣeṣu jālībhūtā ca saṃdṛśyate /
analyzed: tasya mūla pratiṣṭhānam na upalabhyate sarva śākhā patra palāśa saṃkusumitā ca vṛkṣeṣu jālībhūtā ca saṃdṛśyate
translated: Its root foundation is not perceived, yet it is seen as a tree with branches, leaves, flowers, and fruits, and as a network of trees.

analyzed: evam eva sarvajña tā citta utpādasya mūla pratiṣṭhānam na upalabhyate
translated: In the same way, the root foundation of the mind of aspiration for omniscience is not perceived.

analyzed: sarva puṇya jñāna abhijñā saṃkusumitaḥ ca sa sarva loka upapattiṣu mahā praṇidhāna jālībhūtaḥ saṃdṛśyate
translated: It is adorned with all merits, knowledge, and superknowledges, and is seen as a great network of vows in all the births in the world.

original: tadyathā kulaputra vajraṃ netare bhājane tiṣṭhacchobhate /
analyzed: tat yathā kula putra vajram na itare bhājane tiṣṭhat śobhate
translated: Good son, a vajra does not shine in any other vessel,

analyzed: na api chidra śuṣira bhājanena śakyam saṃdhārayitum anyatra a chidra bhājanena
translated: nor can it be held in a vessel with holes or cracks, except in an undamaged vessel.

original: evameva sarvajñatācittotpādavajraṃ na hīnādhimuktikeṣu sattvabhājaneṣu matsariṣu duḥśīleṣu vyāpannacitteṣu kusīdeṣu muṣitasmṛtiṣu duḥprajñeṣu
analyzed: evam eva sarvajña tā citta utpāda vajram na hīna adhimuktikeṣu sattva bhājaneṣu matsariṣu duḥśīleṣu vyāpanna citteṣu kusīdeṣu muṣita smṛtiṣu duḥprajñeṣu
translated: In the same way, the vajra of the generation of the mind of omniscience cannot be held in a vessel of sentient beings with inferior aspirations, in the vessel of the stingy, the immoral, those with malicious intent, the lazy, those with lost mindfulness, or those with poor wisdom.

analyzed: na adhyāśaya vipanna cala acala buddhi sarva bhājanena śakyam saṃdhārayitum anyatra bodhisattva adhyāśaya ratna bhājanena
translated: It cannot be held in any vessel other than the vessel of the jewel of the bodhisattva's superior intention, which is not ruined by the unstable and fluctuating intelligence of those with ruined superior intentions.

analyzed: tat yathā kula putra vajram sarva ratnāni nirvidhyāti
translated: Just as, noble sir, a vajra pierces all jewels,

analyzed: evam eva sarvajña tā citta utpāda vajram sarva dharma ratnāni nirvidhyati
translated: in the same way, the vajra of the generation of the mind of omniscience pierces all the jewels of the Dharma.

analyzed: tat yathā vajram sarva śailāni bhinatti
translated: Just as a vajra breaks through all mountains,

analyzed: evam eva sarvajña tā citta utpāda vajram sarva dṛṣṭi gata śailāni bhinatti
translated: in the same way, the vajra of the generation of the mind of omniscience breaks through all the mountains of views.

original: tadyathā kulaputra bhinnamapi vajraratnaṃ sarvaratnaprativiśiṣṭaṃ suvarṇālaṃkāramabhibhavati /
analyzed: tat yathā kula putra bhinnam api vajra ratnam sarva ratna prativiśiṣṭam suvarṇa alaṃkāram abhibhavati
translated: Just as, noble sir, even a broken vajra jewel surpasses all other jewels and outshines ornaments of gold,

analyzed: evam eva āśaya vipatti bhinnam api sarvajña tā citta utpāda vajra ratnam sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddha guṇa suvarṇa alaṃkārān abhibhavati
translated: in the same way, the vajra jewel of the generation of the mind of omniscience, even if broken by a ruined superior intention, surpasses all the golden ornaments of the qualities of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: tadyathā kulaputra bhinnamapi vajraratnaṃ sarvadāridryaṃ vinivartayati /
analyzed: tat yathā kula putra bhinnam api vajra ratnam sarva dāridryam vinivartayati
translated: Just as, noble sir, even a broken diamond gem removes poverty,

analyzed: evam eva pratibhinnam api sarvajña tā citta utpāda vajra ratnam sarva saṃsāra dāridryam vinivartayati
translated: in the same way, even a broken thought of enlightenment, which is a diamond gem, removes the poverty of the mundane whirl.

analyzed: tat yathā kula putra kiyat parīttaḥ api vajra dhātuḥ sarva maṇi pāṣāṇa bheda lakṣaṇaḥ
translated: Just as, noble sir, even a small piece of diamond ore surpasses all jewels and is not overcome by any gems,

analyzed: evam eva kiyat parītta ārambaṇa prasṛtaḥ api sarvajña tā citta utpāda vajra dhātuḥ sarva ajñāna bheda lakṣaṇaḥ
translated: in the same way, even a small thought of enlightenment, which is a piece of diamond ore, surpasses all the jewels of the wholesome roots of the Disciples and Solitary Sages and is not overcome by any of the actions of Mara.

original: tadyathā kulaputra vajraratnaṃ na prākṛtajanahastagataṃ bhavati /
analyzed: tat yathā kula putra vajra ratnam na prākṛta jana hasta gatam bhavati
translated: Just as, noble sir, a diamond gem does not come into the hands of an ordinary man,

original: evameva sarvajñatācittotpādavajraratnaṃ na prākṛtādhyāśayānāmitvarakuśalamūlānāṃ devamanuṣyāṇāṃ hastagataṃ bhavati /
analyzed: evam eva sarvajña tā citta utpāda vajra ratnam na prākṛta adhyāśayānām itvara kuśala mūlānām deva manuṣyāṇām hasta gatam bhavati
translated: in the same way, a thought of enlightenment, which is a diamond gem, does not come into the hands of gods or men who are not endowed with the roots of goodness necessary for supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: tadyathā kulaputra ratnaparīkṣānabhijñaḥ puruṣo vajramaṇiratnaguṇānajānan nāsya guṇaviśeṣamanubhavati /
analyzed: tat yathā kula putra ratna parīkṣā anabhijñaḥ puruṣaḥ vajra maṇi ratna guṇān a jānan na asya guṇa viśeṣam anubhavati
translated: Just as, noble sir, a man who does not know how to evaluate gems does not know the value of a diamond gem, and does not experience the special qualities of that gem,🔽in the same way, noble sir, those who are not skilled in evaluating the thought of enlightenment do not know the value of the thought of enlightenment, and do not experience the special qualities of the thought of enlightenment.🔽 Just as, noble sir, a diamond gem is not overcome by any gems,🔽in the same way, a thought of enlightenment, which is a diamond gem, is not overcome by any of the actions of Mara.🔽 Just as, noble sir, a diamond gem is not overcome by any gems,🔽in the same way, a thought of enlightenment, which is a diamond gem, is not overcome by any of the actions of Mara.🔽 Just as, noble sir, a diamond gem is not overcome by any gems,🔽in the same way, a thought of enlightenment, which is a diamond gem, is not overcome by any of the actions of Mara.🔽 Just as, noble sir, a diamond gem is not overcome by any gems,🔽in the same way, a thought of enlightenment, which is a diamond gem, is not overcome by any of the actions of Mara.🔽 Just as, noble sir, a diamond gem is not overcome by any gems,🔽in the same way, a thought of enlightenment, which is a diamond gem, is not overcome by any of the actions of Mara.🔽 Just as, noble sir, a

analyzed: evam eva duṣprajña jātīyaḥ puruṣa pudgalaḥ bodhisattva citta mahā prajñā vajra ratna guṇa anabhijñaḥ na asya guṇa viśeṣam anubhavati
translated: In the same way, a person of the type of bad wisdom, not knowing the qualities of the great wisdom-vajra-jewel of the mind of enlightenment, does not experience its special qualities.

original: tadyathā kulaputra vajraṃ na śakyaṃ jarayitum /
analyzed: tat yathā kula putra vajram na śakyam jarayitum
translated: Just as, noble sir, a vajra cannot be worn out,

original: evameva sarvajñatāhetubhūtaṃ bodhicittotpādavajraṃ na śakyaṃ jarayitum /
analyzed: evam eva sarvajña tā hetu bhūtam bodhi citta utpāda vajram na śakyam jarayitum
translated: in the same way, the vajra of generating the mind of enlightenment, which is the cause of omniscience, cannot be worn out.

original: tadyathā kulaputra vajraṃ mahāpraharaṇaṃ na śakyaṃ mahānagnenāpi saṃdhārayitumanyatra mahānārāyaṇasthāmabalavegena /
analyzed: tat yathā kula putra vajram mahā praharaṇam na śakyam mahā nagnena api saṃdhārayitum anyatra mahānārāyaṇa sthāma bala vegena
translated: Just as, noble sir, a vajra, a great weapon, cannot be held by a great fire, except by the strength, power, and force of a great Nārāyaṇa,

original: evameva sarvajñatācittotpādamahāvajrapraharaṇaṃ na śakyaṃ sarvaśrāvakapratyekabuddhamahānagnairapi saṃdhārayitumanyatra sarvajñatāhetubalopastabdhāpramāṇakuśalamūlamahānārāyaṇasthāmaprativiśiṣṭairmahāvabhāsaprāptairmahābodhisattvaiḥ
analyzed: evam eva sarvajña tā citta utpāda mahā vajra praharaṇam na śakyam sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddha mahānagnaiḥ api saṃdhārayitum anyatra sarvajña tā hetu bala upastabdha apramāṇa kuśala mūla mahānārāyaṇa sthāma prativiśiṣṭaiḥ mahā avabhāsa prāptaiḥ mahā bodhisattvaiḥ
translated: in the same way, the great vajra weapon of generating the mind of omniscience cannot be held by the great fires of all the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas, except by the great bodhisattvas who are established in the strength of the cause of omniscience, who are distinguished by the great Nārāyaṇa strength of immeasurable roots of virtue, who have attained great radiance,

original: tadyathā kulaputra yatra sarvapraharaṇāni na prasahante tatra vajraṃ prasahate /
analyzed: tat yathā kula putra yatra sarva praharaṇāni na prasahante tatra vajram prasahate
translated: Just as, noble sir, wherever all weapons do not prevail, there a vajra prevails,

analyzed: na pratihanyate
translated: and is not repulsed,

original: evameva yatra sarvaśrāvakapratyekabuddhapraṇidhijñānapraharaṇāni na prasahante sattvaparipākavinaye vā tryadhvakalpacaryāduḥkhasaṃvāse vā /
analyzed: evam eva yatra sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddha praṇidhi jñāna praharaṇāni na prasahante sattva paripāka vinaye vā tri adhva kalpa caryā duḥkha saṃvāse vā
translated: In the same way, where the knowledge-weapons of all the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, which are the result of their vows, are not effective in the ripening and taming of beings, or in enduring the hardships of conduct and dwelling in the three times,

analyzed: tatra sarvajña tā citta utpāda mahā vajra praharaṇa gṛhītaḥ bodhisattva upari khinna mānasaḥ prasahate
translated: there the bodhisattva, who has taken up the great vajra-weapon of the generation of the mind of omniscience, is not discouraged in mind.

analyzed: na pratihanyate
translated: He is not obstructed.

original: tadyathā kulaputra vajraṃ na śakyaṃ kenacitpṛthivī pradeśena saṃdhārayitumanyatra vajratalena /
analyzed: tat yathā kula putra vajram na śakyam kenacid pṛthivī pradeśena saṃdhārayitum anyatra vajra talena
translated: Just as, noble sir, a vajra cannot be held by any part of the earth except on a vajra surface,

analyzed: evam eva sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddhaiḥ bodhisattva niryāṇa praṇidhāna saṃbhāra vajram na śakyam saṃdhārayitum anyatra adhyāśaya bodhi citta utpāda vajra dṛḍha pṛthivī talena
translated: in the same way, the vajra of the bodhisattva's nirvāṇa, vows, and accumulations cannot be held by any śrāvaka or pratyekabuddha except on the firm surface of the vajra of the generation of the superior intention and the mind of awakening.

analyzed: tat yathā kula putra dṛḍha vajra tala acchidra bhājana tvāt mahā samudre pānīyam na visarati
translated: Just as, noble sir, water does not penetrate a vessel made of firm vajra because it is without cracks,

original: evameva bodhisattvavajrācchidradṛḍhatalapariṇāmanāpratiṣṭhitāni bodhisattvasya kuśalamūlāni na kṣīyante sarvabhavopapattiṣu /
analyzed: evam eva bodhisattva vajra acchidra dṛḍha tala pariṇāmanā pratiṣṭhitāni bodhisattvasya kuśala mūlāni na kṣīyante sarva bhava upapattiṣu
translated: In the same way, the roots of goodness of a bodhisattva, established in the firm ground of the vajra of the bodhisattva's irreversible resolve, are not destroyed in all births in existence.

original: tadyathā kulaputra vajratalapratiṣṭhitā mahāpṛthivī na vidīryate na saṃsīdati /
analyzed: tat yathā kula putra vajra tala pratiṣṭhitā mahā pṛthivī na vidīryate na saṃsīdati
translated: Just as, noble sir, the great earth, established on the ground of the vajra, does not break up or collapse,

original: evameva bodhicittotpādavajradṛḍhatalapratiṣṭhitāni bodhisattvapraṇidhānāni sarvatraidhātuke na vidīryante na saṃsīdanti /
analyzed: evam eva bodhi citta utpāda vajra dṛḍha tala pratiṣṭhitāni bodhisattva praṇidhānāni sarva traidhātuke na vidīryante na saṃsīdanti
translated: in the same way, the resolves of a bodhisattva, established on the ground of the vajra of the generation of the spirit of enlightenment, do not break up or collapse in the whole threefold world.

analyzed: tat yathā kula putra vajram udakena na klidyate
translated: Just as, noble sir, the vajra is not moistened by water,

original: evameva bodhicittotpādavajraṃ sarvakarmakleśodakena sarvakarmasaṃvāsairna klidyate na svidyate /
analyzed: evam eva bodhi citta utpāda vajram sarva karma kleśa udakena sarva karma saṃvāsaiḥ na klidyate na svidyate
translated: in the same way, the vajra of the generation of the spirit of enlightenment is not moistened by the water of all actions and reactive emotions, and is not burned by the fire of all actions and reactive emotions.

original: tadyathā kulaputra vajraṃ sarvāgnidāhairna dahyate na saṃtapyate /🔽evameva sarvajñatācittotpādavajraṃ sarvasaṃsāraduḥkhāgnidāhairna dahyate /
analyzed: tat yathā kula putra vajram sarva agni dāhaiḥ na dahyate na saṃtapyate  evam eva sarvajña tā citta utpāda vajram sarva saṃsāra duḥkha agni dāhaiḥ na dahyate
translated: Just as, noble sir, the vajra is not burned by all the fires, and is not heated by all the fires,

analyzed: sarva kleśa agni tāpaiḥ na saṃtapyate
translated: in the same way, the vajra of the generation of the spirit of omniscience is not burned by the fires of all the sufferings of cyclic existence, and is not heated by the fires of all reactive emotions.

original: tadyathā kulaputra tathāgatānāmarhatāṃ samyaksaṃbuddhānāṃ bodhimaṇḍe niṣīdatāṃ māraṃ yodhayatāṃ sarvajñatābhisaṃbuddhamānānāṃ nānyena pṛthivīpradeśena śakyamāsanaṃ saṃdhārayitumanyatra trisāhasramahāsāhasravajranābhidharaṇitalena /
analyzed: tat yathā kula putra tathāgatānām arhatām samyaksaṃbuddhānām bodhimaṇḍe niṣīdatām māram yodhayatām sarvajña tā abhisaṃbuddha mānānām na anyena pṛthivī pradeśena śakyam āsanam saṃdhārayitum anyatra tri sāhasra mahā sāhasra vajranābhi dharaṇi talena
translated: “Noble son, just as the earth of the diamond base of the great trichiliocosm alone is able to bear the seat of the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas when they sit on the seat of awakening, fight Māra, and attain complete buddhahood in omniscience, and not by any other part of the earth,

original: evameva bodhisattvānāmanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau praṇidadhatāṃ caryāṃ caratāṃ pāramitāḥ paripūrayatāṃ kṣāntimavakrāmatāṃ bhūmiṃ pratilabhamānānāṃ kuśalamūlāni pariṇāmayatāṃ vyākaraṇaṃ saṃpratīcchatāṃ sarvabodhisattvamārgasaṃbhāramupastambhayatāṃ sarvatathāgatānāṃ mahādharmameghān saṃdhārayatāṃ te mahākuśalamūlabalādhānavegā nānyena cittena śakyāḥ saṃdhārayitumanyatra sarvapraṇidhānajñānavajradṛḍhanābhinā sarvajñatācittotpādena /
analyzed: evam eva bodhisattvānām anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau praṇidadhatām caryām caratām pāramitāḥ paripūrayatām kṣāntim avakrāmatām bhūmim pratilabhamānānām kuśala mūlāni pariṇāmayatām vyākaraṇam saṃpratīcchatām sarva bodhisattva mārga saṃbhāram upastambhayatām sarva tathāgatānām mahā dharma meghān saṃdhārayatām te mahā kuśala mūla bala ādhāna vegāḥ na anyena cittena śakyāḥ saṃdhārayitum anyatra sarva praṇidhāna jñāna vajra dṛḍha nāma
translated: in the same way, the great power, support, and impetus of the roots of virtue of the bodhisattvas who aspire to unsurpassed and perfect awakening, practice the conduct, perfect the perfections, enter into patience, attain the levels, dedicate their roots of virtue, receive the prophecy, support the accumulation of the entire path of the bodhisattvas, and bear the great Dharma clouds of all the thus-gone ones, are able to be borne by no other mind than the diamond-like resolve of the generation of the mind of omniscience, which is firm with all aspirations and knowledge.”

original: iti hi kulaputra ebhiśca anyaiśca apramāṇairyāvadanabhilāpyānabhilāpyairguṇaviśeṣaiḥ samanvāgataḥ sarvajñatācittotpādaḥ /🔽te'pi sattvā evaṃguṇadharmasamanvāgatā bhūtāśca bhaviṣyanti ca /
analyzed: iti hi kula putraḥ ebhiḥ ca anyaiḥ ca apramāṇaiḥ yāvat anabhilāpya anabhilāpyaiḥ guṇa viśeṣaiḥ samanvāgataḥ sarvajña tā citta utpādaḥ  te api sattvāḥ evaṃguṇa dharma samanvāgatāḥ bhūtāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti ca
translated: Thus, noble sir, the thought of the knowledge of all modes is endowed with these and other immeasurable, incalculable, inconceivable, incomparable, infinite, and inexpressible special qualities.

analyzed: yaiḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittāni utpāditāni
translated: Those beings who have produced the thought of supreme enlightenment are endowed with such qualities, are, and will be.

analyzed: tasmāt tarhi kula putra su labdhāḥ te lābhāḥ
translated: Therefore, noble sir, you have gained a good gain,

original: yastvamanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittamutpādya bodhisattvacaryāṃ parimārgasi eṣāṃ guṇānāṃ pratilābhāya //
analyzed: yaḥ tvam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpādya bodhisattva caryām parimārgasi eṣām guṇānām pratilābhāya
translated: in that you have produced the thought of supreme enlightenment and are seeking the bodhisattva practice in order to attain these qualities.

original: api ca kulaputra yadvadasikathaṃ bodhisattvena bodhisattvacaryāyāṃ śikṣitavyam /
analyzed: api ca kula putra yadvat asi katham bodhisattvena bodhisattva caryāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: Moreover, noble sir, ask Ashikaprāpta how a bodhisattva should train in the bodhisattva practice,

analyzed: katham pratipattavyam iti
translated: and how he should proceed.

analyzed: gaccha kula putra
translated: Go, noble sir,

original: asya vairocanavyūhālaṃkāragarbhasya mahākūṭāgārasya abhyantaraṃ praviśya vyavalokaya /
analyzed: asya vairocana vyūha alaṃkāra garbhasya mahā kūṭāgārasya abhyantaram praviśya vyavalokaya
translated: enter the interior of this great tower Adorned with the Ornaments of Vairocana's Array, and look around.

analyzed: atra jñāsyasi yathā bodhisattva caryāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: There you will know how a bodhisattva should train in the bodhisattva practice,

analyzed: śikṣamāṇasya ca yādṛśī guṇa pariniṣpattiḥ bhavati
translated: and what kind of perfection of qualities will result from training.

original: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhidārako maitreyaṃ bodhisattvaṃ pradakṣiṇīkṛtvā evamāhavivṛṇu ārya asya kūṭāgārasya dvāram /
analyzed: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhi dārakaḥ maitreyam bodhisattvam pradakṣiṇīkṛtvā evam āha vivṛṇu ārya asya kūṭāgārasya dvāram
translated: Then the merchant's son Sudhana circumambulated the bodhisattva Maitreya and said, Noble one, open the door of this kūṭāgāra.

analyzed: pravekṣyāmi
translated: I will enter.

original: atha khalu maitreyo bodhisattvo vairocanavyūhālaṃkāragarbhasya kūṭāgārasya dvāramūlamupasaṃkramya dakṣiṇena pāṇinā acchaṭāśabdamakārṣīt /
analyzed: atha khalu maitreyaḥ bodhisattvaḥ vairocanavyūhālaṃkāragarbhasya kūṭāgārasya dvāra mūlam upasaṃkramya dakṣiṇena pāṇinā acchaṭā śabdam akārṣīt
translated: Then the bodhisattva Maitreya went to the base of the door of the kūṭāgāra adorned with the array of Vairocana and snapped his fingers with his right hand.

original: tasya dvāraṃ vivṛtamabhūt /🔽sa āhapraviśa kulaputra etatkūṭāgāram /
analyzed: tasya dvāram vivṛtam abhūt  saḥ āha praviśa kula putra etat kūṭāgāram
translated: That door opened.🔽He said, Noble one, enter this kūṭāgāra.

original: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhidārakaḥ paramāścaryaprāptastatkūṭāgāraṃ prāviśat /
analyzed: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhi dārakaḥ parama āścarya prāptaḥ tat kūṭāgāram prāviśat
translated: Then the merchant's son Sudhana, having attained the highest wonder, entered that kūṭāgāra.

analyzed: tasya samanantara praviṣṭasya tat dvāram saṃvṛtam abhūt
translated: As soon as he entered, that door closed.

original: so'drākṣīt taṃ kūṭāgāraṃ vipulavistīrṇaṃ bahuyojanaśatasahasravistīrṇaṃ gaganatalāpramāṇaṃ samantādākāśadhātuvipulam asaṃkhyeyacchatradhvajapatākālaṃkāram asaṃkhyeyaratnālaṃkāram /
analyzed: sā udrākṣīt tam kūṭāgāram vipula vistīrṇam bahu yojana śata sahasra vistīrṇam gagana tala apramāṇam samantāt ākāśa dhātu vipulam asaṃkhyeya chatra dhvaja patākā alaṃkāram asaṃkhyeya ratna alaṃkāram
translated: He saw that kūṭāgāra, vast and wide, extending over many hundreds of thousands of yojanas, immeasurable like the sky, vast like the entire realm of space, adorned with innumerable parasols, banners, and flags, adorned with innumerable jewels,

original: asaṃkhyeyamuktāhārapralambitālaṃkāram asaṃkhyeyaratnahārapralambitālaṃkāram asaṃkhyeyalohitamuktāhārapralambitālaṃkāram asaṃkhyeyasiṃhamuktāhārapralambitālaṃkāram asaṃkhyeyasiṃhadhvajālaṃkāram asaṃkhyeyacandrārdhacandrālaṃkāram asaṃkhyeyavicitrapaṭṭadāmābhipralambitālaṃkāram asaṃkhyeyavividhapaṭṭapaṭṭālaṃkāram asaṃkhyeyamaṇijālaprabhālaṃkāram asaṃkhyeyahemajālālaṃkāram asaṃkhyeyaratnapaṭṭālaṃkāram
analyzed: asaṃkhyeya muktā hāra pralambita alaṃkāram asaṃkhyeya ratna hāra pralambita alaṃkāram asaṃkhyeya lohita muktā hāra pralambita alaṃkāram asaṃkhyeya siṃha muktā hāra pralambita alaṃkāram asaṃkhyeya siṃha dhvaja alaṃkāram asaṃkhyeya candra ardhacandra alaṃkāram asaṃkhyeya vicitra paṭṭa dāma abhipralambita alaṃkāram asaṃkhyeya vividha paṭṭa paṭṭa alaṃkāram asaṃkhyeya maṇi jāla prabhā alaṃkāram asaṃkhyeya hema jāla alaṃkāram asaṃkh
translated: with ornaments hanging down of innumerable pearls, with ornaments hanging down of innumerable jewel necklaces, with ornaments hanging down of innumerable red pearls, with ornaments hanging down of innumerable lion pearls, with innumerable lion banners as ornaments, with innumerable half-moons and moons as ornaments, with ornaments hanging down of innumerable various silk streamers, with ornaments of innumerable various silk cloths, with ornaments of the light of innumerable jewel nets, with ornaments of innumerable golden nets, with ornaments of innumerable jewel cloths,

analyzed: tāni kūṭāgārāṇi vipula vistīrṇāni apramāṇa ākāśa kośa bhūtāni apaśyat samantāt su vibhaktāni
translated: He saw those kūṭāgāras as vast and spacious, like the immeasurable sky, well-arranged all around.

original: te cāsya kūṭāgāravyūhā anyonyāsaṃbhinnā anyonyāmaitrībhūtā anyonyāsaṃkīrṇāḥ pratibhāsayogena ābhāsamagaman ekasminnārambaṇe /
analyzed: te ca asya kūṭāgāra vyūhāḥ anyonya a saṃbhinnāḥ anyonya a maitrībhūtāḥ anyonya a saṃkīrṇāḥ pratibhāsa yogena ābhāsam agaman ekasmin ārambaṇe
translated: And those arrays of kūṭāgāras, not mixed with each other, not hostile to each other, not confused with each other, appeared as a manifestation on a single object.

analyzed: yathā ca ekasmin ārambaṇe
translated: And just as on a single object,

analyzed: tathā śeṣa sarva ārambaṇeṣu
translated: so also on all the remaining objects.

original: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhidārako vairocanavyūhālaṃkāragarbhasya mahākūṭāgārasya idamevaṃrūpamacintyaviṣayavikurvitaṃ dṛṣṭvā atulaprītivegavivardhitena mahāharṣaprāmodyena abhiṣyanditakāyacittaḥ sarvasaṃjñāgatavidhūtamānasaḥ sarvāvaraṇavivartitacittaḥ sarvamohavigato'saṃpramoṣadivyanayanaḥ sarvaśabdāsaṅgasmṛtivijñaptiśrotraḥ sarvamanasikāravikṣepavigato'nāvaraṇavimokṣanayanānusaraṇabuddhiḥ sarvadiksrotobhimukhena kāyapraśamena sarvārambaṇānāvaraṇasaṃpreṣitacakṣuḥ sarvatrānugatena abhinirhārabalena sarvaśarīreṇa praṇipatitaḥ //
analyzed: atha khalu sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhi dārakaḥ vairocanavyūhālaṃkāragarbhasya mahā kūṭāgārasya idam evaṃrūpam acintya viṣaya vikurvitam dṛṣṭvā atula prīti vega vivardhitena mahā harṣa prāmodyena abhiṣyandita kāya cittaḥ sarva saṃjñā gata vidhūta mānasaḥ sarva āvaraṇa vivartita cittaḥ sarva moha vigata ūsaṃpramoṣa divya nayanaḥ sarva śabda asaṅga smṛti vijñapti śrotraḥ sarva manasikāra vikṣepa vigata ūna āvaraṇa vimokṣa nayana anusaraṇa
translated: Then, the merchant's son Sudhana, having seen this kind of inconceivable manifestation of the great tower Vairocana-vyūhâlaṃkāra-garbha, with his body and mind moistened by the great joy and delight that increased the force of incomparable love, with his mind freed from all conceptual realms, with his mind turned away from all obscurations, free from all delusion, with the divine eye of non-forgetfulness, with ears that were aware of all sounds without attachment, free from all mental distractions, with a mind that followed the method of liberation without obscurations, with a body that was peaceful, facing the streams in all directions, with eyes that were unobstructed towards all objects, with the power of accomplishment that went everywhere, he prostrated with his whole body.

original: samanantarapraṇipatitamātraśca sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhidārako maitreyasya bodhisattvasya adhiṣṭhānabalena sarveṣu teṣu kūṭāgāreṣvabhyantarapraviṣṭamātmānaṃ saṃjānīte sma /
analyzed: samanantara praṇipatita mātraḥ ca sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhi dārakaḥ maitreyasya bodhisattvasya adhiṣṭhāna balena sarveṣu teṣu kūṭāgāreṣu abhyantara praviṣṭam ātmānam saṃjānīte sma
translated: As soon as the merchant's son Sudhana had prostrated, by the power of the bodhisattva Maitreya's blessing, he perceived himself to be inside all those towers.

analyzed: teṣu ca sarva kūṭāgāreṣu vividha vaimātrya gatāni acintya viṣaya vikurvitāni adrākṣīt
translated: In all those kūṭāgāras he saw inconceivable manifestations of various kinds.
