original: kvacitkūṭāgāre yatra maitreyeṇa bodhisattvena prathamaṃ praṇidhānacittamutpāditamanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: kvacid kūṭāgāre yatra maitreyeṇa bodhisattvena prathamam praṇidhāna cittam utpāditam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: In some kūṭāgāra he saw where the bodhisattva Maitreya first generated the mind of aspiration for supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: yannāmagotropapannena yena kuśalamūlena yayā samādāpanayā yena kalyāṇamitrasaṃcodanena yadāyuḥpramāṇena yannāmake kalpe yatratathāgate yadvyūhe yādṛśyāṃ parṣadi yādṛśena praṇidhānaviśeṣābhinirhāreṇa /
analyzed: yad nāma gotra upapannena yena kuśala mūlena yayā samādāpanayā yena kalyāṇa mitra saṃcodanena yad āyuḥ pramāṇena yad nāmake kalpe yatra tathāgate yad vyūhe yādṛśyām parṣadi yādṛśena praṇidhāna viśeṣa abhinirhāreṇa
translated: By what name and family he was born, by what roots of virtue, by what encouragement, by what spiritual friend's inspiration, by what life-span, in what eon, in what tathāgata, in what array, in what kind of assembly, by what kind of special aspiration-prayer,

analyzed: tat sarvam adrākṣīt
translated: all that he saw.

analyzed: saṃjānīte anusarati
translated: He recognized it, followed it.

original: yāvacca teṣāṃ sattvānāṃ tasya ca tathāgatasya tena samayenāyuḥpramāṇamabhūt /
analyzed: yāvat ca teṣām sattvānām tasya ca tathāgatasya tena samayena āyuḥ pramāṇam abhūt
translated: And for as long as the life-span of those beings and of that tathāgata was at that time,

original: tāvatkāle tasya tathāgatasya pādamulagatamātmānaṃ saṃjānīte sma /
analyzed: tāvatkāle tasya tathāgatasya pāda mula gatam ātmānam saṃjānīte sma
translated: for that long he recognized himself to be at the feet of that tathāgata.

analyzed: tām ca sarvām kriyām apaśyat
translated: And he saw all those actions.

original: kvacitkūṭāgāre yatra maitreyeṇa bodhisattvena prathamo maitrasamādhiḥ pratilabdhaḥ /
analyzed: kvacid kūṭāgāre yatra maitreyeṇa bodhisattvena prathamaḥ maitra samādhiḥ pratilabdhaḥ
translated: In some kūṭāgāra he saw where the bodhisattva Maitreya first attained the meditative absorption of loving-kindness.

original: yata upādāya asya maitreya iti saṃjñodapādi tadadrākṣīt /🔽kvacidyatra caryāḥ cīrṇāḥ /🔽kvacidyatra pāramitāḥ paripūritāḥ /🔽kvacidyatra kṣāntiravatīrṇā /
analyzed: yatas upādāya asya maitreyaḥ iti saṃjñā udapādi tat adrākṣīt  kvacid yatra caryāḥ cīrṇāḥ  kvacid yatra pāramitāḥ paripūritāḥ  kvacid yatra kṣāntiḥ avatīrṇā
translated: From that time on, Maitreya, he saw where he had practiced the perfections,

original: kvacidyatra bhūmiravakrāntā /🔽kvacidyatra buddhakṣetravyūhāḥ parigṛhītāḥ /🔽kvacidyatra tathāgataśāsanaṃ saṃdhāritam /
analyzed: kvacid yatra bhūmiḥ avakrāntā  kvacid yatra buddhakṣetra vyūhāḥ parigṛhītāḥ  kvacid yatra tathāgata śāsanam saṃdhāritam
translated: where he had entered the stages,

analyzed: kvacid yatra anutpattikeṣu dharmeṣu kṣāntiḥ pratilabdhā
translated: where he had attained acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas,

analyzed: kvacid yatra vyākṛtaḥ unuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: where he had been prophesied to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment,

original: yathā vyākṛto yena vyākṛto yāvaccireṇa ca vyākṛtastatsarvamadrākṣīt /
analyzed: yathā vyākṛtaḥ yena vyākṛtaḥ yāvat cireṇa ca vyākṛtaḥ tat sarvam adrākṣīt
translated: and by whom he had been prophesied, and for how long he had been prophesied.

original: sa kvacitkūṭāgāre maitreyaṃ bodhisattvaṃ cakravartirājabhūtaṃ sattvān daśasu kuśaleṣu karmapatheṣu pratiṣṭhāpayamānamapaśyat /
analyzed: sa kvacid kūṭāgāre maitreyam bodhisattvam cakravarti rāja bhūtam sattvān daśasu kuśaleṣu karma patheṣu pratiṣṭhāpayamānam apaśyat
translated: In some kūṭāgāras, he saw the Bodhisattva Maitreya as a wheel-turning king, establishing beings in the ten wholesome actions.

analyzed: kvacid lokapāla bhūtam sarva loka hita sukham sattvānām upasaṃharamāṇam
translated: In some, he saw him as a world protector, bringing about the welfare and happiness of all worlds for beings.

analyzed: kvacid śakra bhūtam kāma guṇa ratim sattvānām vinivartayamānam
translated: In some, he saw him as Śakra, turning beings away from the pleasures of the sense-qualities.

original: kvacidbrahmabhūtaṃ dhyānāpramāṇaratiṃ sattvānāṃ saṃvarṇayamānam /🔽kvacitsuyāmadevādhipatibhūtamapramāṇaguṇān sattvānāṃ saṃvarṇayamānam /
analyzed: kvacid brahma bhūtam dhyāna apramāṇa ratim sattvānām saṃvarṇayamānam  kvacid suyāma deva adhipati bhūtam apramāṇa guṇān sattvānām saṃvarṇayamānam
translated: In some places he saw him as Brahman, extolling the joys of meditation and the immeasurables for beings.🔽In some places he saw him as the lord of the Suyāma gods, extolling the immeasurable qualities for beings.

analyzed: kvacid saṃtuṣita deva īśvara bhūtam eka jāti pratibaddha bodhisattva guṇān udbhāvayamānam  kvacid su nirmita devarāja bhūtam sarva bodhisattva nirmāṇa vyūham deva parṣadi saṃdarśayamānam
translated: In some places he saw him as the lord of the Tuṣita gods, extolling the qualities of the bodhisattvas who are bound to one more birth.🔽In some places he saw him as the king of the Sunirmita gods, manifesting the array of all the emanations of the bodhisattvas to the assembly of gods.

analyzed: kvacid vaśavarti devarāja bhūtam sarva dharma vaśavarti tām devānām saṃprakāśayamānam
translated: In some places he saw him as the king of the Vaśavartin gods, illuminating for the gods the mastery over all phenomena.

analyzed: kvacid māra tvam kārayamāṇam
translated: In some places he saw him acting as Māra,

analyzed: sarva saṃpatti anitya tām devānām deśayamānam
translated: teaching the impermanence of all prosperity to the gods.

original: kvacidasurendrabhavanopapannaṃ sarvamānamadadarpaprahāṇāya mahājñānasāgaravigāhanāya dharmajñānasāgaravigāhanāya dharmajñānamāyāpratilambhāya asuraparṣadi dharmaṃ deśayamānamapaśyat /
analyzed: kvacid asura indra bhavana upapannam sarva māna mada darpa prahāṇāya mahā jñāna sāgara vigāhanāya dharma jñāna sāgara vigāhanāya dharma jñāna māyā pratilambhāya asura parṣadi dharmam deśayamānam apaśyat
translated: In some places he saw him born in the palace of the lord of the asuras, teaching the Dharma to the assembly of asuras in order to abandon all pride, conceit, and arrogance, in order to enter the ocean of great wisdom, in order to enter the ocean of Dharma wisdom, and in order to attain the illusion of Dharma wisdom.

analyzed: kvacid kūṭāgāre yama lokam adrākṣīt
translated: In some places in the kūṭāgāra he saw the world of Yama.

original: tatra maitreyaṃ bodhisattvaṃ prabhayā mahānarakānavabhāsya narakopapannānāṃ sattvānāṃ sarvanirayaduḥkhaṃ praśamayamānamadrākṣīt /
analyzed: tatra maitreyam bodhisattvam prabhayā mahā narakān avabhāsya naraka upapannānām sattvānām sarva niraya duḥkham praśamayamānam adrākṣīt
translated: There, in the great hells, he saw the Bodhisattva Maitreya illuminating with his radiance those beings born in the hells, and alleviating all the sufferings of the hells.

analyzed: kvacid kūṭāgāre preta bhavanam adrākṣīt
translated: In some kūṭāgāra he saw the realm of the pretas.

original: tatra maitreyaṃ bodhisattvaṃ pretabhavanopapannānāṃ sattvānāṃ vipulamannapānamupasaṃhṛtya kṣutpipāsāṃ praśamayamānamadrākṣīt /
analyzed: tatra maitreyam bodhisattvam preta bhavana upapannānām sattvānām vipulam anna pānam upasaṃhṛtya kṣudh pipāsām praśamayamānam adrākṣīt
translated: There, he saw the Bodhisattva Maitreya, having brought abundant food and drink to the beings born in the realm of the pretas, alleviating their hunger and thirst.

original: kvacitkūṭāgāre tiryagyonau vividhopapatyāyatanavimātratayā tiryagyonigatān sattvān vinayantamadrākṣīt /
analyzed: kvacid kūṭāgāre tiryagyonau vividha upapati āyatana vimātra tayā tiryagyoni gatān sattvān vinayantam adrākṣīt
translated: In some kūṭāgāra, he saw the Bodhisattva Maitreya, in the animal realm, taming the animals through the variety of their different birthplaces.

analyzed: kvacid kūṭāgāre mahārājika deva parṣadi lokapālānām dharmam deśayamānam apaśyat
translated: In some kūṭāgāra, in the assembly of the great kings of the gods, he saw the Bodhisattva Maitreya teaching the Dharma to the world guardians.

original: kacicchakradevarājaparṣadi kvacitsuyāmadevarājaparṣadi kvacitsaṃtuṣitadevarājaparṣadi kvacitsunirmitadevarājaparṣadi kvacidvaśavartidevarājaparṣadi kvacitkūṭāgāre brahmendraparṣadi maitreyaṃ bodhisattva mahābrahmabhūtaṃ dharmaṃ deśayamānapaśyat /

translated: In some he saw Maitreya, the Bodhisattva, in the assembly of the king of the gods Shakra, in some in the assembly of the king of the gods Suyama, in some in the assembly of the king of the gods Santushita, in some in the assembly of the king of the gods Sunirmita, in some in the assembly of the king of the gods Vaishravana, in some in the palace in the assembly of Brahma, teaching the Dharma as the great Brahma Bodhisattva.

original: kvacinnāgamahoragaparṣadi kvacidyakṣarākṣasaparṣadi kvacidgandharvakinnaraparṣadi kvacidasuradānavendraparṣadi kvacinmahoragendraparṣadi kvacinmanuṣyendraparṣadi kvacitkūṭāgāre devanāgayakṣagandharvāsuragaruḍakinnaramahoragamanuṣyāmanuṣyaparṣadi maitreyaṃ bodhisattvaṃ dharmaṃ deśayamānamapaśyat /
analyzed: kvacid nāga mahoraga parṣadi kvacid yakṣa rākṣasa parṣadi kvacid gandharva kinnara parṣadi kvacid asura dānava indra parṣadi kvacid mahoraga indra parṣadi kvacid manuṣya indra parṣadi kvacid kūṭāgāre deva nāga yakṣa gandharva asura garuḍa kinnara mahoraga manuṣya amanuṣya parṣadi maitreyam bodhisattvam dharmam deśayamānam apaśyat
translated: In some he saw Maitreya, the Bodhisattva, teaching the Dharma in the assembly of nagas and great serpents, in some in the assembly of yakshas and rakshasas, in some in the assembly of gandharvas and kinnaras, in some in the assembly of the lords of asuras and danavas, in some in the assembly of the lords of mahoragas, in some in the assembly of lords of humans, in some in the palace in the assembly of gods, nagas, yakshas, gandharvas, asuras, garudas, kinnaras, mahoragas, humans, and non-humans, seeing Maitreya, the Bodhisattva, teaching the Dharma.

original: kvacicchrāvakaparṣadi kvacitpratyekabuddhaparṣadi kvacidbodhisattvaparṣadi kvacitkūṭāgāre prathamacittotpādikānāmādikarmikāṇāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ maitreyaṃ bodhisattvaṃ dharmaṃ deśayamānamapaśyat /🔽kvaciccaryāpratipannānāṃ kvacitkṣāntipratilabdhānāmavinivartanīyānāṃ kvacidekajātipratibaddhānāmabhiṣekaprāptānāṃ kvacitkūṭāgāre prathamabhūmisthitānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ bhūmivaiśeṣikatāṃ saṃvarṇayamānamapaśyat /
analyzed: kvacid śrāvaka parṣadi kvacid pratyekabuddha parṣadi kvacid bodhisattva parṣadi kvacid kūṭāgāre prathama citta utpādikānām ādi karmikāṇām bodhisattvānām maitreyam bodhisattvam dharmam deśayamānam apaśyat  kvacid caryā pratipannānām kvacid kṣānti pratilabdhānām a vinivartanīyānām kvacid eka jāti pratibaddhānām abhiṣeka prāptānām kvacid kūṭāgāre prathama bhūmi sthitānām bodhisattvānām bhūmi vaiśeṣika tām saṃvarṇayamānam apaśyat
translated: In some places, in the assembly of śrāvakas, in some places in the assembly of pratyekabuddhas, in some places in the assembly of bodhisattvas, in some places in a kūṭāgāra, he saw the bodhisattva Maitreya teaching the Dharma to bodhisattvas who had first aroused the mind of awakening and were beginners.🔽In some places, to those practicing the conduct, in some places to those who had attained acceptance, to those irreversible, in some places to those bound to one birth, to those who had attained consecration, in some places in a kūṭāgāra, he saw the bodhisattva Maitreya extolling the distinctive qualities of the stages to bodhisattvas dwelling on the first stage.

original: kvacidyāvaddaśabhūmisthitairbodhisattvaiḥ saha maitreyaṃ bodhisattvaṃ sarvabhūmivaiśeṣikatāṃ saṃgāyantamapaśyat /
analyzed: kvacid yāvat daśa bhūmi sthitaiḥ bodhisattvaiḥ saha maitreyam bodhisattvam sarva bhūmi vaiśeṣika tām saṃgāyantam apaśyat
translated: In some places, up to the bodhisattvas dwelling on the tenth stage, he saw the bodhisattva Maitreya singing the distinctive qualities of all the stages together with the bodhisattva Maitreya.

original: kvacitsarvapāramitāparipūraye'pramāṇatāṃ kvacitsarvaśikṣābhimukhāvatārasamatāṃ kvacitsamādhimukhapraveśavistīrṇatāṃ kvacidvimokṣanayagambhīratāṃ kvacicchāntadhyānasamādhisamāpattyabhijñāviṣayaspharaṇatāṃ kvacidbodhisattvacaryāvinayopāyamukhapraveśatāṃ kvacitpraṇidhānābhinirhāravistīrṇatāṃ kvacitkūṭāgāre maitreyaṃ bodhisattvaṃ caṃkramābhiyuktaṃ sabhāgacaritairbodhisattvaiḥ sārdhaṃ lokahitakriyārthaṃ vividhaśilpaśānaśāstraviśeṣāṃ sarvasattvahitasukhādhānopasaṃhitatāṃ saṃgāyamānamapaśyat /🔽kvacidekajātipratibaddhairbodhisattvaiḥ sārdhaṃ sarvabuddhajñānābhiṣekamukhaṃ saṃgāyantamapaśyat /
analyzed: kvacid sarva pāramitā paripūraye pramāṇa tām kvacid sarva śikṣā abhimukha avatāra sama tām kvacid samādhi mukha praveśa vistīrṇa tām kvacid vimokṣa naya gambhīra tām kvacid śānta dhyāna samādhi samāpatti abhijñā viṣaya spharaṇa tām kvacid bodhisattva caryā vinaya upāya mukha praveśa tām kvacid praṇidhāna abhinirhāra vistīrṇa tām kvacid kūṭāgāre maitreyam bodhisattvam caṃkrama abhiyuktam sa bhāga caritaiḥ bodhisattvaiḥ sārdham loka hita kriyā arth kvacid eka jāti pratibaddhaiḥ bodhisattvaiḥ sārdham sarva buddha jñāna abhiṣeka mukham saṃgāyantam apaśyat
translated: In some places he saw the immensity of the perfection of all the perfections; in some places he saw the equality of the entrance into all the teachings; in some places he saw the vastness of the entrance into the doors of samadhis; in some places he saw the profundity of the methods of liberation; in some places he saw the pervasion of the sphere of the superknowledges of the peaceful meditations, samadhis, and samapattis; in some places he saw the entrance into the methods of training in the conduct of a bodhisattva; in some places he saw the vastness of the accomplishment of vows; in some places he saw the bodhisattva Maitreya in a pavilion, engaged in walking meditation, together with bodhisattvas of similar conduct, reciting the various special treatises on crafts and arts for the sake of benefiting the world, which are conducive to accomplishing the welfare and happiness of all beings.🔽In some places he saw him reciting with bodhisattvas bound to one more birth the various special treatises on crafts and arts for the sake of benefiting the world, which are conducive to accomplishing the welfare and happiness of all beings.

analyzed: kvacid kūṭāgāre maitreyam bodhisattvam caṃkrama abhiyuktam varṣa śata sahasraiḥ a nikṣipta dhuram apaśyat
translated: In some places he saw the bodhisattva Maitreya in a pavilion, engaged in walking meditation for hundreds of thousands of years, not slackening his efforts.

original: kvaciduddeśasvādhyāyaprayuktaṃ kvaciddharmamukhapratyavekṣaṇaprayuktaṃ kvaciddharmasaṃgāyanaprayuktaṃ kvaciddharmalekhanaprayuktaṃ kvacinmaitrīsamādhisamāpannaṃ kvacitsarvadhyānāpramāṇāni samāpannaṃ kvacisarvakṛtsnāyatanavimokṣasamāpannaṃ kvacitkūṭāgāre bodhisattvābhijñābhinirhāraprayogasamādhisamāpannaṃ maitreyaṃ bodhisattvamapaśyat //
analyzed: kvacid uddeśa svādhyāya prayuktam kvacid dharma mukha pratyavekṣaṇa prayuktam kvacid dharma saṃgāyana prayuktam kvacid dharma lekhana prayuktam kvacid maitrī samādhi samāpannam kvacid sarva dhyāna apramāṇāni samāpannam kvacid sarva kṛtsna āyatana vimokṣa samāpannam kvacid kūṭāgāre bodhisattva abhijñā abhinirhāra prayoga samādhi samāpannam maitreyam bodhisattvam apaśyat
translated: In some he saw the bodhisattva Maitreya engaged in teaching and studying, in some he saw him engaged in examining the Dharma, in some he saw him engaged in chanting the Dharma, in some he saw him engaged in writing the Dharma, in some he saw him absorbed in the meditation of loving-kindness, in some he saw him absorbed in all the meditations and immeasurables, in some he saw him absorbed in all the spheres of totality and liberations, in some he saw the bodhisattva Maitreya absorbed in the meditation of the manifestation of the superknowledges of the bodhisattvas.

analyzed: kvacid kūṭāgāre nirmāṇavatīm bodhisattva samādhim samāpannān bodhisattvān apaśyat
translated: In some pavilions he saw bodhisattvas absorbed in the bodhisattva meditation called full of emanations.

analyzed: teṣām ca sarva śarīra roma mukhebhyaḥ sarva nirmāṇa meghān niścaratā upaśyat
translated: And from all the pores of their skin he saw clouds of all emanations issuing forth.

analyzed: keṣāṃcid sarva roma mukhebhyaḥ devanikāya meghān niścaratā upaśyat
translated: From the pores of some he saw clouds of the hosts of gods issuing forth.

original: keṣāṃcinnāgayakṣagandharvāsuragaruḍakinnaramahoragaśakrabrahmalokapālacakravartimeghān keṣāṃcitkoṭṭarājameghān keṣāṃcidrājakumārameghān keṣāṃcicchreṣṭhyamātyagṛhapatimeghān keṣāṃcicchrāvakapratyekabuddhabodhisattvameghān keṣāṃcittathāgatakāyameghān keṣāṃcitsarvaśarīraromamukhebhyo'pramāṇān sarvasattvanirmāṇameghānniścarato'paśyat keṣāṃcitsarvaromamukhebhyo vividhāni dharmamukhāni niścaramāṇānyaśrauṣītyaduta bodhisattvaguṇavarṇamukhāni dānapāramitāmukhāni śīlakṣāntivīryadhyānaprajñopāyapraṇidhānabalajñānapāramitāmukhāni
analyzed: keṣāṃcid nāga yakṣa gandharva asura garuḍa kinnara mahoraga śakra brahma lokapāla cakravarti meghān keṣāṃcid koṭṭa rāja meghān keṣāṃcid rāja kumāra meghān keṣāṃcid śreṣṭhi amātya gṛhapati meghān keṣāṃcid śrāvaka pratyekabuddha bodhisattva meghān keṣāṃcid tathāgata kāya meghān keṣāṃcid sarva śarīra roma mukhebhyaḥ pramāṇān sarva sattva nirmāṇa meghān niścarataḥ upaśyat keṣāṃcid sarva roma mukhebhyaḥ vividhāni dharma m
translated: He saw clouds of nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, Śakras, Brahmās, world guardians, and universal monarchs; clouds of regional kings; clouds of princes; clouds of merchants, ministers, and householders; clouds of śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas; clouds of Tathāgata bodies; and from the pores of all their bodies and faces, he saw clouds of emanations of all beings issuing forth. From the pores of some, he heard various Dharma doors issuing forth, namely, the doors of the qualities and praises of bodhisattvas, the doors of the perfection of generosity, the doors of morality, patience, diligence, concentration, wisdom, means, vows, power, and the perfection of knowledge.

analyzed: matha vipaśyanā vimokṣa mukha pratītyasamutpāda pratiśaraṇa dharma uddāna smṛti upasthāna samyak prahāṇa ṛddhipāda indriya bala bodhyaṅga mārga śrāvaka yāna kathā pratyekabuddha yāna kathā mahāyāna kathā bhūmi kṣānti caryā praṇidhāna mukhāni evam sarva dharma mukha praveśa śabdān niścarataḥ śrauṣīt
translated: The sounds of the doors of liberation through insight and meditation, dependent origination, the refuges, the summary of the Dharma, the foundations of mindfulness, the right efforts, the bases of supernatural power, the faculties, the powers, the factors of awakening, the path, the discourses on the Śrāvakayāna, the discourses on the Pratyekabuddhayāna, the discourses on the Mahāyāna, the stages, the acceptances, the practices, the doors of vows—these and all the sounds of the doors of entry into the Dharma were heard.

analyzed: kvacid kūṭāgāre tathāgata parṣad maṇḍala saṃnipātān adrākṣīt
translated: In some kūṭāgāras he saw the assemblies of the retinues of the tathāgatas.

original: teṣāṃ ca tathāgatānāṃ nānāvimātratāṃ janmakulavimātratāṃ kāyavyūhāpramāṇavimātratāmāyurvimātratāṃ kṣetravimātratāṃ kalpavimātratāṃ dharmadeśanāvimātratāṃ nirmāṇamukhavimātratāṃ saddharmasthitivimātratāṃ yāvadaśeṣasarvākāraparṣanmaṇḍalavimātratāmadrākṣīt //
analyzed: teṣām ca tathāgatānām nānā vimātra tām janma kula vimātra tām kāya vyūha apramāṇa vimātra tām āyuḥ vimātra tām kṣetra vimātra tām kalpa vimātra tām dharma deśanā vimātra tām nirmāṇa mukha vimātra tām saddharma sthiti vimātra tām yāvat aśeṣa sarva ākāra parṣad maṇḍala vimātra tām adrākṣīt
translated: He saw the various differences among those tathāgatas, the differences in their birth families, the differences in the immeasurability of their arrays of bodies, the differences in their lifespans, the differences in their buddha-fields, the differences in their kalpas, the differences in their teachings of the Dharma, the differences in the doors of emanations, the differences in the duration of the true Dharma, and so forth, up to the differences in the assemblies of all kinds of retinues without exception.

original: madhye ca vairocanavyūhālaṃkāragarbhasya mahākūṭāgārasya ekamudārataraṃ vistīrṇataraṃ ca tadanyasarvakūṭāgārāśeṣasarvavyūhātiriktataravyūhasamalaṃkṛtaṃ kūṭāgāramadrākṣīt /
analyzed: madhye ca vairocanavyūhālaṃkāragarbhasya mahā kūṭāgārasya ekam udārataram vistīrṇataram ca tad anya sarva kūṭāgāra aśeṣa sarva vyūha atiriktatara vyūha samalaṃkṛtam kūṭāgāram adrākṣīt
translated: And in the middle of the great tower Adorned with the Array of Vairocana, he saw a tower that was more vast and spacious than all the others, adorned with an array that surpassed all the other arrays.

analyzed: sa tasya kūṭāgārasya abhyantare tri sāhasra mahā sāhasram lokadhātum adrākṣīt
translated: In that tower, he saw the universe of a billion worlds.

original: tasmiṃśca trisāhasramahāsāhasre lokadhātau koṭīśataṃ cāturdvīpikānāṃ koṭīśataṃ jambudvīpakānāṃ koṭīśataṃ tuṣitabhavanānāmadrākṣīt /
analyzed: tasmin ca tri sāhasra mahā sāhasre lokadhātau koṭī śatam cāturdvīpikānām koṭī śatam jambudvīpakānām koṭī śatam tuṣita bhavanānām adrākṣīt
translated: In that universe of a billion worlds, he saw a hundred billion four-continent worlds, a hundred billion Jambudvipa continents, and a hundred billion Tusita heavens.

original: sa tatra jambudvīpeṣu maitreyaṃ bodhisattvaṃ padmagarbhagataṃ jāyamānamapaśyat /
analyzed: sa tatra jambudvīpeṣu maitreyam bodhisattvam padma garbha gatam jāyamānam apaśyat
translated: In those Jambudvipa continents, he saw the bodhisattva Maitreya being born, seated in a lotus.

original: śakrabrahmābhyāṃ pratīkṣyamāṇaṃ saptapadāni prakrāntaṃ daśa diśo vyavalokayamānaṃ mahāsiṃhanādaṃ nadantaṃ sarvakumārabhūmiṃ saṃdarśayamānaṃ antaḥpuramadhye gatamudyānabhūmiṃ niṣkrāntaṃ sarvajñatābhimukhamabhiniṣkramya pravrajantaṃ duṣkaracaryāṃ saṃdarśayantamāhāraṃ paribhuñjānaṃ bodhimaṇḍamupasaṃkrāntaṃ māraṃ dharṣayamāṇaṃ bodhiṃ vibudhyamānaṃ bodhivṛkṣamanimiṣaṃ nirīkṣamāṇaṃ mahābrahmaṇādhyeṣyamāṇaṃ dharmacakraṃ pravartayamānaṃ devabhavaneṣu praviśantamadrākṣīt /
analyzed: śakra brahmābhyām pratīkṣyamāṇam sapta padāni prakrāntam daśa diśaḥ vyavalokayamānam mahā siṃhanādam nadantam sarva kumāra bhūmim saṃdarśayamānam antaḥpura madhye gatam udyāna bhūmim niṣkrāntam sarvajña tā abhimukham abhiniṣkramya pravrajantam duṣkara caryām saṃdarśayantam āhāram paribhuñjānam bodhimaṇḍam upasaṃkrāntam māram dharṣayamāṇam bodhim vibudhyamānam bodhivṛkṣam animiṣam nirīkṣamāṇam mahābrahmaṇādhipatim bhūta bhūta bh
translated: He saw him being attended upon by Śakra and Brahmā, taking seven steps, surveying the ten directions, roaring a great lion’s roar, demonstrating all the stages of a youth, going to the inner palace, going out to the pleasure grove, turning toward omniscience, leaving home, going forth, demonstrating the practice of austerities, eating food, going to the seat of awakening, overpowering Māra, awakening to complete buddhahood, looking at the tree of awakening without blinking, being requested by Mahābrahmā, turning the wheel of Dharma, and entering the divine abodes.

analyzed: nānā abhisaṃbodhi dharma cakra pravartana viṣaya saṃdarśana vimātra tābhiḥ nānā kalpa nāma pravartana vimātra tābhiḥ nānā āyuḥ pramāṇa vimātra tābhiḥ nānā parṣad maṇḍala vyūha vimātra tābhiḥ nānā kṣetra viśuddhi naya saṃdarśana vimātra tābhiḥ nānā caryā praṇidhāna prabhāvanā vimātra tābhiḥ nānā dharma deśanā vyavasthāna sarva paripācana upāya vimātra tābhiḥ nānā dhātu vibhaṅga śāsana sthiti adhiṣṭhāna saṃdarśana
translated: with the variety of the turning of the wheel of the Dharma of various enlightenments; with the variety of the turning of the names of various kalpas; with the variety of the lengths of lives; with the variety of the arrays of the circles of assemblies; with the variety of the manifestations of the ways of the purities of various fields; with the variety of the manifestations of various practices and vows; with the variety of the ways of teaching the Dharma and establishing all the means of ripening; with the variety of the manifestations of the bases of the continuation of the divisions of the various realms;

original: sarvatra ca tatra sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhidārakaḥ pādamūlagatamātmānaṃ saṃjānīte sma //
analyzed: sarvatra ca tatra sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhi dārakaḥ pāda mūla gatam ātmānam saṃjānīte sma
translated: and everywhere, the merchant's son Sudhana perceived himself to be at the feet of those tathagatas.

original: sa sarvaparṣanmaṇḍaleṣu sarvakriyāsaṃdarśaneṣu sarvāyuḥpramāṇavimātratāsu asaṃpramuṣitena smṛtyadhiṣṭhānajñānena sarvasaṃjñāgatavyavasitāyāṃ jñānabhūmau sthito yāvanti teṣu sarvakūṭāgāreṣu ghaṇṭākiṅkiṇījālatūryasaṃgītiprabhṛtīnyārambaṇāni sattvebhyastebhyo'cintyameghanigarjitanirghoṣaśabdaṃ niścarantamaśrauṣīt /
analyzed: sa sarva parṣad maṇḍaleṣu sarva kriyā saṃdarśaneṣu sarva āyuḥ pramāṇa vimātra tāsu asaṃpramuṣitena smṛti adhiṣṭhāna jñānena sarva saṃjñā gata vyavasitāyām jñāna bhūmau sthitaḥ yāvanti teṣu sarva kūṭāgāreṣu ghaṇṭā kiṅkiṇī jāla tūrya saṃgīti prabhṛtīni ārambaṇāni sattvebhyaḥ tebhyaḥ cintya megha nigarjita nirghoṣa śabdam niścarantam aśrauṣīt
translated: In all the assemblies, in all the displays of activity, in all the various lifespans, with undeluded mindfulness and the power of knowledge, he remained on the stage of knowledge that is determined by all conceptual states, and heard from all those bells, small bells, nets, musical instruments, and songs in those kūṭāgāras an inconceivable cloud-like thunderous sound that arose for the sake of beings.

original: kvacidbodhicittavimātratāṃ kvacitpāramitācaryāpraṇidhānavimātratāṃ kvacidbhūmyapramāṇavimātratāṃ kvacidabhijñācintyavikurvitavimātratāṃ kvacittathāgatapūjāvimātryavimātratāṃ kvacidbuddhakṣetravyūhavimātratāṃ kvacidapramāṇatathāgatadharmameghavimātratām evaṃ sarvadharmanirghoṣān yathāpūrvaparikīrtitānaśrauṣīt /
analyzed: kvacid bodhi citta vimātra tām kvacid pāramitā caryā praṇidhāna vimātra tām kvacid bhūmi apramāṇa vimātra tām kvacid abhijñā cintya vikurvita vimātra tām kvacid tathāgata pūjā vimātrya vimātra tām kvacid buddhakṣetra vyūha vimātra tām kvacid apramāṇa tathāgata dharma megha vimātra tām evam sarva dharma nirghoṣān yathāpūrva parikīrtitān aśrauṣīt
translated: In some places, the various aspects of the mind of enlightenment; in some places, the various aspects of the practice of the perfections and vows; in some places, the various aspects of the immeasurability of the stages; in some places, the various inconceivable miraculous manifestations of the superknowledges; in some places, the various aspects of the worship of the Tathāgatas; in some places, the various aspects of the adornments of the Buddha-fields; in some places, the various aspects of the immeasurable cloud-like Dharma of the Tathāgatas—in this way, he heard all the sounds of the Dharma as previously described.

original: kvacitsarvajñatāprasthānaśabdamaśrauṣītamuṣmin lokadhātāvamuko nāma bodhisattvo bodhicittamutpādayati amukaṃ dharmamukhaṃ śrutvā amukena kalyāṇamitreṇa samādāpito'mukasya tathāgatasya pādamūle evaṃnāmni kalpe īdṛśe buddhakṣetre īdṛkparṣanmadhyagate īdṛśaṃ kuśalamūlamūlamavaropya īdṛśāṃstathāgataguṇān śrutvā īdṛśenādhyāśayena īdṛśyā praṇidhānavimātratayā /
analyzed: kvacid sarvajña tā prasthāna śabdam aśrauṣīt amuṣmin lokadhātau amukaḥ nāma bodhisattvaḥ bodhi cittam utpādayati amukam dharma mukham śrutvā amukena kalyāṇamitreṇa samādāpitaḥ umukasya tathāgatasya pāda mūle evaṃnāmni kalpe īdṛśe buddhakṣetre īdṛś parṣad madhya gate īdṛśam kuśala mūla mūlam avaropya īdṛśān tathāgata guṇān śrutvā īdṛśena adhyāśayena īdṛśyā praṇidhāna vimātra tayā
translated: In some places he hears the word 'setting out for omniscience'; in that world system, a bodhisattva named so-and-so generates the mind of awakening, having heard such-and-such a Dharma door, inspired by such-and-such a spiritual friend, at the feet of such-and-such a Tathagata, in an eon named so-and-so, in a buddha field like this, in the midst of an assembly like this, having planted such-and-such roots of virtue, having heard such-and-such qualities of the Tathagata, with such-and-such an superior intention, with such-and-such a variety of vows.

original: iyataḥ kalpān bodhisattvacaryāṃ caritvā iyadbhiḥ kalpairanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbhotsyate /
analyzed: iyataḥ kalpān bodhisattva caryām caritvā iyadbhiḥ kalpaiḥ anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate
translated: Having practiced the conduct of a bodhisattva for so many eons, he will attain supreme perfect enlightenment in so many eons.

analyzed: īdṛś nāmadheyaḥ īdṛśena āyuḥ pramāṇena īdṛśyā buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūha asaṃpadā
translated: He will have such a name, such a lifespan, such an abundance of qualities in his buddha field.

analyzed: īdṛśena praṇidhāna viśeṣeṇa īdṛśena sattva vinayena īdṛśena śrāvaka pratyekabuddha bodhisattva saṃnipātena
translated: With such a specific vow, such a training of beings, such an assembly of shravakas, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas.

original: tasya parinirvṛtasya iyataḥ kalpān saddharmaḥ sthāsyati /
analyzed: tasya parinirvṛtasya iyataḥ kalpān saddharmaḥ sthāsyati
translated: After his parinirvana, the true Dharma will remain for so many eons.

analyzed: iyān samarthaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: He will be able to do this much.

original: kvacinnirghoṣamaśrauṣītamuṣmiṃllokadhātāvamuko nāma bodhisattvo dānapāramitāyāṃ carannīdṛśāni duṣkaraparityāgaśatāni karoti /
analyzed: kvacid nirghoṣam aśrauṣīt amuṣmin lokadhātau amukaḥ nāma bodhisattvaḥ dāna pāramitāyām caran īdṛśāni duṣkara parityāga śatāni karoti
translated: In some places, he hears a voice saying that in such a world system, a bodhisattva named so-and-so, practicing the perfection of generosity, is making hundreds of such difficult sacrifices.

analyzed: amukaḥ bodhisattvaḥ śīlam rakṣati
translated: Such-and-such a bodhisattva is guarding morality.

analyzed: kṣāntim bhāvayati
translated: He is cultivating patience.

analyzed: vīryam ālabhate
translated: He is undertaking vigor.

analyzed: dhyānāni samāpadyate prajñā vicaya prayuktaḥ
translated: He is attaining the meditative absorptions and is engaged in the discernment of wisdom.

analyzed: amukaḥ bodhisattvaḥ saddharma paryeṣṭi hetoḥ rāja parityāgam karoti
translated: Such-and-such a bodhisattva, for the sake of seeking the true Dharma, is making the sacrifice of kingship.

analyzed: ratna parityāgam putra parityāgam bhāryā parityāgam hasta pāda nayana uttamāṅga parityāgam karoti
translated: He is making the sacrifice of jewels, the sacrifice of sons, the sacrifice of wives, the sacrifice of hands, feet, eyes, and the head.

analyzed: agniprapatanam karoti
translated: He is throwing himself into the fire.

original: amuko nāma bodhisattvaḥ tathāgataśāsanamabhyudgato dharmabhāṇakatvaṃ karoti /
analyzed: amukaḥ nāma bodhisattvaḥ tathāgata śāsanam abhyudgataḥ dharma bhāṇaka tvam karoti
translated: Such-and-such a bodhisattva, having risen up in the teachings of the Tathāgata, is acting as a Dharma preacher.

analyzed: dharma dānam dadāti  dharmayajñam yajati  dharma dhvajam ucchrayati
translated: He is giving the gift of the Dharma.🔽He is performing the sacrifice of the Dharma.🔽He is hoisting the banner of the Dharma.

analyzed: dharma bherīm parāhanti  dharma śaṅkham āpūrayati
translated: He is beating the drum of the Dharma.🔽He is blowing the conch of the Dharma.

analyzed: dharma varṣam pravarṣati
translated: He is raining down the Dharma.

analyzed: tathāgata śāsanam dhārayati
translated: He is upholding the teachings of the Tathāgata.

analyzed: tathāgata caityāni alaṃkaroti
translated: He adorns stūpas of the Tathāgata.

analyzed: tathāgata vigrahān kārayati
translated: He makes images of the Tathāgata.

analyzed: sattva sukha upadhānam upasaṃharati
translated: He provides for the happiness of beings.

original: saddharmakośamārakṣati /🔽kvacinnirghoṣamaśrauṣītamuṣmiṃllokadhātāvamuko nāma tathāgata etarhi tiṣṭhati dhriyate yāpayati /
analyzed: saddharma kośam ārakṣati  kvacid nirghoṣam aśrauṣīt amuṣmin lokadhātau amukaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ etarhi tiṣṭhati dhriyate yāpayati
translated: He protects the treasure of the true Dharma.

original: dharmaṃ ca deśayati evaṃnāmnābhiṣekeṇa īdṛśyāṃ parṣadi īdṛśe buddhakṣetre īdṛśe kalpe īdṛśenāyuḥpramāṇena īdṛśyā dharmadeśanayā īdṛśena sattvavinayena īdṛkpraṇidhyabhisaṃbodhena /
analyzed: dharmam ca deśayati evaṃnāmnā abhiṣekeṇa īdṛśyām parṣadi īdṛśe buddhakṣetre īdṛśe kalpe īdṛśena āyuḥ pramāṇena īdṛśyā dharma deśanayā īdṛśena sattva vinayena īdṛś praṇidhi abhisaṃbodhena
translated: He hears a voice saying, ‘In such and such a world realm, the Tathāgata named so-and-so is now present, living, remaining, and continuing to teach the Dharma.’ In this way, he hears the names of the buddhas, the names of the assemblies, the names of the buddha realms, the lengths of the kalpas, the lengths of the lifespans, the teachings of the Dharma, the ways of guiding beings, and the aspirations for complete enlightenment.

analyzed: evam ekaikasmāt ghaṇṭā kiṅkiṇī jāla tūrya ādikāt ārambaṇāt apramāṇa dharma mukha vimātra tā nirghoṣān aśrauṣīt
translated: In this way, he hears from each of the bells, the nets of bells, the musical instruments, and so on, the sounds of the immeasurable Dharma gates.

original: sarveṣāṃ ca teṣāṃ nirghoṣāṇāṃ śraveṇa sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhidārako vipulaprītivegābhiṣyandita cittastāni dharmamukhāni śṛṇoti /🔽kvaciddhāraṇīmukhāni pratyalabhata /🔽kvacitpraṇidhānamukhāni /

translated: When the merchant’s son Sudhana hears all those sounds, his mind is filled with the flood of the great joy of happiness, and he hears those Dharma gates.🔽In some places he obtains the doors of retention.🔽In some places he obtains the doors of aspiration.

analyzed: kvacid kṣānti mukhāni
translated: In some places he obtains the doors of patience.

analyzed: kvacid caryā mukhāni  kvacid praṇidhāna mukhāni
translated: In some places, the doors of conduct;🔽in some places, the doors of vows;

analyzed: kvacid pāramitā mukhāni  kvacid abhijñā mukhāni
translated: in some places, the doors of the perfections;🔽in some places, the doors of the higher knowledges;

analyzed: kvacid vidyā jñāna āloka mukhāni  kvacid vimokṣa mukhāni
translated: in some places, the doors of the light of knowledge and wisdom;🔽in some places, the doors of liberation;

analyzed: kvacid samādhi praveśa mukhāni pratyalabhata
translated: in some places, the doors of entering into concentration.

analyzed: tebhyaḥ ca ādarśa maṇḍalebhyaḥ uparimāṇa pratibhāsa vyūha vijñaptim apaśyat
translated: And from those mirror surfaces, he saw the display of the appearances of immeasurable knowledge.

translated: in some places manifesting the appearance of the assembly of the retinue of the Tathāgata, in some places manifesting the appearance of the assembly of the retinue of the bodhisattvas, in some places manifesting the appearance of the assembly of the retinue of the śrāvakas, in some places manifesting the appearance of the assembly of the retinue of the pratyekabuddhas, in some places manifesting the appearance of the assembly of the retinue of the Tathāgata, in some places manifesting the appearance of a defiled realm, in some places manifesting the appearance of a pure realm, in some places manifesting the appearance of a defiled and pure realm, in some places manifesting the appearance of all the buddhas in a single world-realm, in some places manifesting the appearance of the buddhas in the world-realms, in some places manifesting the appearance of the small world-realms, in some places manifesting the appearance of the vast world-realms, in some places manifesting the appearance of the subtle world-realms, in some places manifesting the appearance of the vast world-realms, in some places manifesting the appearance of the world-realms that are like a magical display, in some places manifesting the appearance of the world-realms that are inverted,

analyzed: kāṃścid caṃkramyamāṇān kāṃścid vyāyacchataḥ kāṃścid vipaśyataḥ kāṃścid mahā karuṇayā spharamāṇān kāṃścid vividhān śāstra nayān loka artha saṃprayuktān abhinirharamāṇān kāṃścid uddiśataḥ kāṃścid su ādhyāyamānān kāṃścid likhitaḥ kāṃścid paripraśnayataḥ kān cid tri skandha deśanā pariṇamana abhiyuktān kāṃścid praṇidhānāni abhinirharamāṇān tebhyaḥ ca stambhebhyaḥ sarva maṇirāja prabhā jālāni niścaranti v
translated: He saw some of them walking, some of them making effort, some of them looking, some of them pervading with great compassion, some of them composing various treatises and methods for the benefit of the world, some of them teaching, some of them reciting to themselves, some of them writing, some of them questioning, some of them devoted to transforming the teachings of the three baskets, and some of them accomplishing aspirations. And from those pillars, all the nets of the light of the king of jewels emerged.

original: kvacinnīlavarṇāni kvacitpītavarṇāni kvacillohitavarṇāni kvacidavadātavarṇāni kvacitsphaṭikavarṇāni kvacittapanīyavarṇāni kvacidindranīlavarṇāni kvacidindrāyudhavarṇāni kvacijjāmbūnadasuvarṇavarṇāni kvacitsarvaprabhāsavarṇāni kāyacittaprītisaṃjananaparamanayanābhirāmāṇi /
analyzed: kvacid nīla varṇāni kvacid pīta varṇāni kvacid lohita varṇāni kvacid avadāta varṇāni kvacid sphaṭika varṇāni kvacid tapanīya varṇāni kvacid indranīla varṇāni kvacid indrāyudha varṇāni kvacid jāmbūnada suvarṇa varṇāni kvacid sarva prabhāsa varṇāni kāya citta prīti saṃjanana parama nayana abhirāmāṇi
translated: In some places they were blue, in some places they were yellow, in some places they were red, in some places they were white, in some places they were crystal-colored, in some places they were golden-colored, in some places they were the color of sapphire, in some places they were the color of the rainbow, in some places they were the color of gold from the Jambū River, and in some places they were the color of all lights, generating joy in body and mind, and extremely delightful to the eyes.

analyzed: tān ca jāmbūnada suvarṇa varṇa kadalī stambhān sarva ratna vigrahān ca puṣpa megha avalambita āpāṇīn adrākṣīt
translated: He saw those trunks of golden plantain trees, made of all kinds of jewels, with their hands holding clouds of flowers.

original: mālyadāmapāṇīn chatradhvajapatākāpāṇīn gandhadhūpavilepanapāṇīn vividharatnavicitrasuvarṇasūtrapāṇīn vividhamuktāhārapāṇīn nānāratnahārapāṇīn sarvavyūhaparigṛhītapāṇīn /
analyzed: mālya dāma pāṇīn chatra dhvaja patākā pāṇīn gandha dhūpa vilepana pāṇīn vividha ratna vicitra suvarṇa sūtra pāṇīn vividha muktā hāra pāṇīn nānā ratna hāra pāṇīn sarva vyūha parigṛhīta pāṇīn
translated: He saw those hands holding garlands and wreaths, those hands holding parasols, banners, and flags, those hands holding perfumes, incense, and ointments, those hands holding various jeweled ornaments and golden threads, those hands holding various pearl necklaces, those hands holding necklaces of various jewels, those hands holding all kinds of arrays.

analyzed: kāṃścid avanata cūḍāmaṇi makuṭān animiṣa nayanān kṛtāñjali puṭān namasyatā upaśyat
translated: He saw some with their jeweled crowns and diadems bowed down, their eyes unblinking, their hands folded in respect, paying homage.

analyzed: tebhyaḥ ca muktā hārebhyaḥ sarva gandha paribhāvita aṣṭāṅga upeta sūkṣma jaladharān prasravamāṇān apaśyat
translated: And from those pearl necklaces, he saw fine rain clouds perfumed with all fragrances and endowed with the eight qualities flowing.

analyzed: tebhyaḥ ca vaiḍūrya maṇi hāra jālebhyaḥ dīrghapaṅktīn kṣarantīn apaśyat
translated: And from those nets of beryl gem necklaces, he saw long lines of water flowing.

analyzed: tāni ca ratna chatrāṇi sarva alaṃkāra vyūha upaśobhitāni apaśyat
translated: And he saw those jeweled parasols adorned with all kinds of ornaments.

analyzed: tām ca ratna ghaṇṭā kiṅkiṇī jāla paṭṭa dāma kalāpa maṇi śalākā vicitra maṇi ratna kośa samalaṃkṛta garbhām apaśyat
translated: And he saw the interior adorned with nets of jeweled bells and small bells, with streamers and wreaths, with jeweled rods and various jeweled treasure chests.

analyzed: tābhyaḥ ca puṣkiriṇībhyaḥ asaṃkhyeyāni ratna padma utpala kumuda puṇḍarīkāni abhyudgatāni apaśyat
translated: And from those lotus ponds he saw countless jewels, lotuses, blue lotuses, white lotuses, and red lotuses rising up,

analyzed: kānicid vitasti pramāṇa mātrāṇi kānicid vyāma pramāṇa mātrāṇi kānicid śakaṭa cakra pramāṇa mātrāṇi
translated: some the size of a span, some the size of a fathom, some the size of a cartwheel.

analyzed: teṣu ca nānā rūpān vyūhān apaśyat
translated: And on those he saw various forms,

original: iti hi yāvanmaitreyo bodhisattvo'saṃkhyeyaiḥ kalpakoṭīniyutaśatasahasraiḥ ṣaṭsu pāramitāsu cīrṇacaritaḥ /

translated: In this way, the bodhisattva Maitreya, for countless quintillions of eons, practiced the six perfections.

analyzed: tat sarvam sudhanaḥ śreṣṭhi dārakaḥ tatas ekaikasmāt aṣṭāpadāt apara aparaiḥ ākāraiḥ adrākṣīt
translated: All of that, the merchant's son Sudhana, from each of those squares, saw in other forms.

original: sa kvacitkūṭāgāre yāvanti maitreyeṇa bodhisattvena kalyāṇamitrāṇi paryupāsitāni teṣāṃ vikurvitavyūhānadrākṣīt /
